data.v: तस्मिन्सात्यकिना वीरे द्वैरथे विरथीकृते । समपद्यत सर्वेषां सैन्यानां सुमहद्भयम् ॥
data.md: The heroic Kritavarman, having been deprived of his car by Satyaki in that single combat, all the (Kaurava) soldiers were possessed by a great fear.

data.v: पुत्रस्य तव चात्यर्थं विषादः समपद्यत । हतसूते हताश्वे च विरथे कृतवर्मणि ॥
data.md: A mighty fear overtook your sons, when Kritavarman was thus made steedless and driverless and carless.

data.v: हताश्वं च समालक्ष्य हतसूतमरिंदमम् । अभ्यधावत्कृपो राजञ्जिघांसुः शिनिपुंगवम् ॥
data.md: Beholding that chastiser of foes made steedless and driverless, Kripa, O king, rushed at that best of Shini's race, desirous of killing him.

data.v: तमारोप्य रथोपस्थे मिषतां सर्वधन्विनाम् । अपोवाह महाबाहुस्तूर्णमायोधनादपि ॥
data.md: Taking Kritavarman upon his car before all the bowmen, the mighty-armed Kripa took him away from the battlefield.

data.v: शैनेयेऽधिष्ठिते राजन्विरथे कृतवर्मणि । दुर्योधनबलं सर्वं पुनरासीत्पराङ्मुखम् ॥
data.md: The king of the Madras being slain and upon Kritavarma having been made carless, the entire arıny of Duryodhana fled away from the battle field.

data.v: तत्परे नावबुध्यन्त सैन्येन रजसावृते । तावकाः प्रद्रुता राजन्दुर्योधनमृते नृपम् ॥
data.md: The enemy, however, did not see it for the Kuru army was then covered with a cloud of dust. All your warriors fled, O king, except king Duryodhana.

data.v: दुर्योधनस्तु संप्रेक्ष्य भग्नं स्वबलमन्तिकात् । जवेनाभ्यपतत्तूर्णं सर्वांश्चैको न्यवारयत् ॥
data.md: Then seeing his army routed Duryodhana, alone, resisted all the Parthas advancing furiously.

data.v: पाण्डूंश्च सर्वान्संक्रुद्धो धृष्टद्युम्नं च पार्षतम् । शिखण्डिनं द्रौपदेयान्पाञ्चालानां च ये गणाः ॥
केकयान्सोमकांश्चैव पाञ्चालांश्चैव मारिष । असंभ्रमं दुराधर्षः शितैरस्त्रैरवारयत् ॥
अतिष्ठदाहवे यत्तः पुत्रस्तव महाबलः । यथा यज्ञे महानग्निर्मन्त्रपूतः प्रकाशयन् ॥
तं परे नाभ्यवर्तन्त मर्त्या मृत्युमिवाहवे । अथान्यं रथमास्थाय हार्दिक्यः समपद्यत ॥
data.md: His enemies could not approach him then, like creatures unable to approach the Death. Then the son of Hridika came there, on another car.

data.v: पुत्रस्तु ते महाराज रथस्थो रथिनां वरः । दुरुत्सहो बभौ युद्धे यथा रुद्रः प्रतापवान् ॥
data.md: Sanjaya said Filled with the courage of despair, that best of car-warriors, O king viz., your son, looked resplendent on his car in that battle like Rudra himself.

data.v: तस्य बाणसहस्रैस्तु प्रच्छन्ना ह्यभवन्मही । परांश्च सिषिचे बाणैर्धाराभिरिव पर्वतान् ॥
data.md: With the thousands of arrows shot by him, the Earth was completely covered. He drenched his enemies with showers of arrows like the clouds pouring rain on mountain breasts.

data.v: न च सोऽस्ति पुमान्कश्चित्पाण्डवानां महाहवे । हयो गजो रथो वापि योऽस्य बाणैरविक्षतः ॥
data.md: There was then not a man amongst the Pandavas in that great battle or a horse or an elephant or a car, who or which was not struck with Duryodhana's arrows.

data.v: यं यं हि समरे योधं प्रपश्यामि विशां पते । स स बाणैश्चितोऽभूद्वै पुत्रेण तव भारत ॥
data.md: O king, amongst the warriors every one, O Bharata, was struck by your son with his arrows.

data.v: यथा सैन्येन रजसा समुद्धूतेन वाहिनी । प्रत्यदृश्यत संछन्ना तथा बाणैर्महात्मनः ॥
data.md: The Pandava army was then covered with the arrows of that great warriors even as a army is covered with the dust it raises while marching for battle.

data.v: बाणभूतामपश्याम पृथिवीं पृथिवीपते । दुर्योधनेन प्रकृतां क्षिप्रहस्तेन धन्विना ॥
data.md: The Earth then, O king, was as if converted into one sheet of arrows by your son Duryodhana, that bowman endued with great lightness of hand.

data.v: तेषु योधसहस्रेषु तावकेषु परेषु च । एको दुर्योधनो ह्यासीत्पुमानिति मतिर्मम ॥
data.md: Amongst those thousands of warriors on the field, of your side or that of the enemy, it appeared as if Duryodhana was then the only man.

data.v: तत्राद्भुतमपश्याम तव पुत्रस्य विक्रमम् । यदेकं सहिताः पार्था नात्यवर्तन्त भारत ॥
data.md: The prowess of the king of the Madras was highly wonderful, since the Parthas, even in a body, could not approach him in that battle.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरं शतेनाजौ विव्याध भरतर्षभ । भीमसेनं च सप्तत्या सहदेवं च सप्तभिः ॥
data.md: He struck Yudhishthira, O best of Bharata's race, with a hundred arrows and Bhimasena with seventy and Sahadeva with seven.

data.v: नकुलं च चतुःषष्ट्या धृष्टद्युम्नं च पञ्चभिः । सप्तभिर्द्रौपदेयांश्च त्रिभिर्विव्याध सात्यकिम् । धनुश्चिच्छेद भल्लेन सहदेवस्य मारिष ॥
data.md: And he struck Nakula with sixty four and Dhrishtadyumna with five and the sons of Draupadi with seven and Satyaki with three arrows. With a broad-headed arrow, he then, O king, cut off the bow of Sahadeva.

data.v: तदपास्य धनुश्छिन्नं माद्रीपुत्रः प्रतापवान् । अभ्यधावत राजानं प्रगृह्यान्यन्महद्धनुः । ततो दुर्योधनं संख्ये विव्याध दशभिः शरैः ॥
data.md: Casting off that broken bow, the heroic son of Madri, took up another formidable bow and rushing against the king, viz., Duryodhana struck him with ten arrows in that battle.

data.v: नकुलश्च ततो वीरो राजानं नवभिः शरैः । घोररूपैर्महेष्वासो विव्याध च ननाद च ॥
data.md: The great and brave bowman Nakula then struck the king with nine terrible arrows and uttered a loud war cry.

data.v: सात्यकिश्चापि राजानं शरेणानतपर्वणा । द्रौपदेयास्त्रिसप्तत्या धर्मराजश्च सप्तभिः । अशीत्या भीमसेनश्च शरै राजानमार्दयत् ॥
data.md: Satyaki struck the king with a single straight shaft; the sons of Draupadi struck him with seventy three and king Yudhishthira struck him with five. And Bhimasena assailed the king with eighty arrows.

data.v: समन्तात्कीर्यमाणस्तु बाणसंघैर्महात्मभिः । न चचाल महाराज सर्वसैन्यस्य पश्यतः ॥
data.md: Though struck thus from all sides with numerous arrows by those illustrious warriors, Duryodhana still, O king, did not waver, in the presence of all the soldiers assembled there.

data.v: लाघवं सौष्ठवं चापि वीर्यं चैव महात्मनः । अति सर्वाणि भूतानि ददृशुः सर्वमानवाः ॥
data.md: The quickness, the skill and the prowess of that illustrious warrior excelled those of every man.

data.v: धार्तराष्ट्रास्तु राजेन्द्र यात्वा तु स्वल्पमन्तरम् । अपश्यमाना राजानं पर्यवर्तन्त दंशिताः ॥
data.md: Meanwhile the Dhartarashtras, O king, who had not fled far away, beholding the king, rallied and returned there, clad in mail.

data.v: तेषामापततां घोरस्तुमुलः समजायत । क्षुब्धस्य हि समुद्रस्य प्रावृट्काले यथा निशि ॥
data.md: The noise made by them when they returned was exceedingly awful, like the roar of the surging deep during the rainy season.

data.v: समासाद्य रणे ते तु राजानमपराजितम् । प्रत्युद्ययुर्महेष्वासाः पाण्डवानाततायिनः ॥
data.md: Approaching their invincible king in that battle, those great bowmen rushed against the Pandavas for fight.

data.v: भीमसेनं रणे क्रुद्धं द्रोणपुत्रो न्यवारयत् । ततो बाणैर्महाराज प्रमुक्तैः सर्वतोदिशम् । नाज्ञायन्त रणे वीरा न दिशः प्रदिशस्तथा ॥
data.md: With the arrows, O king, that were shot in that battle, all the points of the horizon were completely covered, so that the brave warriors could not distinguish the cardinal from the subsidiary points of the compass.

data.v: तावुभौ क्रूरकर्माणावुभौ भारत दुःसहौ । घोररूपमयुध्येतां कृतप्रतिकृतैषिणौ । त्रासयन्तौ जगत्सर्वं ज्याक्षेपविहतत्वचौ ॥
data.md: As regards Ashvatthaman and Bhimasena, O Bharata, both of them performed wonderful feats. Both of them were invincible in battle. The arms of both continued marks of bowstring for having repeatedly drawn the same. Opposing each other, they fought on, frightening the entire universe.

data.v: शकुनिस्तु रणे वीरो युधिष्ठिरमपीडयत् । तस्याश्वांश्चतुरो हत्वा सुबलस्य सुतो विभुः । नादं चकार बलवान्सर्वसैन्यानि कम्पयन् ॥
data.md: The heroic Shakuni struck Yudhishthira in that battle. Having killed the four horses of the king the powerful son of Subala uttered a loud roar, making all the soldiers tremble with fear.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे वीरं राजानमपराजितम् । अपोवाह रथेनाजौ सहदेवः प्रतापवान् ॥
data.md: Meanwhile the valiant Şahadeva carried away the heroic but defeated king on his car from that battle.

data.v: अथान्यं रथमास्थाय धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः । शकुनिं नवभिर्विद्ध्वा पुनर्विव्याध पञ्चभिः । ननाद च महानादं प्रवरः सर्वधन्विनाम् ॥
data.md: Then riding on another car, returned king Yudhishthira and having pierced Shakuni at first with nine arrows, once more struck him with five. And that best of all bowmen then sent up a loud roar.

data.v: तद्युद्धमभवच्चित्रं घोररूपं च मारिष । ईक्षितृप्रीतिजननं सिद्धचारणसेवितम् ॥
data.md: That battle presented a wonderful spectacle, It filled the spectators with delight and was praised by the Siddhas and the Charanas.

data.v: उलूकस्तु महेष्वासं नकुलं युद्धदुर्मदम् । अभ्यद्रवदमेयात्मा शरवर्षैः समन्ततः ॥
data.md: Heroic Uluka rushed against the mighty bowman Nakula, in that battle, discharging showers of arrows from all sides.

data.v: तथैव नकुलः शूरः सौबलस्य सुतं रणे । शरवर्षेण महता समन्तात्पर्यवारयत् ॥
data.md: The heroic Nakula, however, in that battle opposed the son of Shakuni with a dense shower of arrows from every side.

data.v: तौ तत्र समरे वीरौ कुलपुत्रौ महारथौ । योधयन्तावपश्येतां परस्परकृतागसौ ॥
data.md: Both those heroes were born in high family and both were great car-warriors. They were seen to fight with each other, each enraged with the other.

data.v: तथैव कृतवर्मा तु शैनेयं शत्रुतापनम् । योधयञ्शुशुभे राजन्बलं शक्र इवाहवे ॥
data.md: Similarly Kritavarman, O king, fighting with the grandson of Shini, that scorcher of foes, shone like Shakra fighting with the Asura Vala.

data.v: दुर्योधनो धनुश्छित्त्वा धृष्टद्युम्नस्य संयुगे । अथैनं छिन्नधन्वानं विव्याध निशितैः शरैः ॥
data.md: Having cut off Dhrishtadyumna's bow in that battle, Dhrishtadyumna struck his bowless antagonist with kcen arrows.

data.v: धृष्टद्युम्नोऽपि समरे प्रगृह्य परमायुधम् । राजानं योधयामास पश्यतां सर्वधन्विनाम् ॥
data.md: Then, in that battle, having taken up a formidable bow, Dhrishtadyumna fought with the king before all the bowmen.

data.v: तयोर्युद्धं महच्चासीत्संग्रामे भरतर्षभ । प्रभिन्नयोर्यथा सक्तं मत्तयोर्वरहस्तिनोः ॥
data.md: The encounter between those two heroes was exceedingly dreadful, O best of Bharata's race, like that between two wild and infuriate elephants with temporal juice trickling down.

data.v: गौतमस्तु रणे क्रुद्धो द्रौपदेयान्महाबलान् । विव्याध बहुभिः शूरः शरैः संनतपर्वभिः ॥
data.md: Worked up with rage in that battle, the heroic Gautama struck the mighty sons of Draupadi with many straight arrows.

data.v: तस्य तैरभवद्युद्धमिन्द्रियैरिव देहिनः । घोररूपमसंवार्यं निर्मर्यादमतीव च ॥
data.md: The encounter that took place between him and those five resembled that which takes place between a man and his five senses. It was awful and fierce and no party showed any consideration for the other.

data.v: ते च तं पीडयामासुरिन्द्रियाणीव बालिशम् । स च तान्प्रतिसंरब्धः प्रत्ययोधयदाहवे ॥
data.md: The five sons of Draupadi assailed Kripa like the senses afflicting a foolish man. He, on the other hand, fighting with thein, opposed them vigorously.

data.v: एवं चित्रमभूद्युद्धं तस्य तैः सह भारत । उत्थायोत्थाय हि यथा देहिनामिन्द्रियैर्विभो ॥
data.md: That battle between him and them was indeed wonderful because it resembled the struggles, O king, between men and their Senses.

data.v: नराश्चैव नरैः सार्धं दन्तिनो दन्तिभिस्तथा । हया हयैः समासक्ता रथिनो रथिभिस्तथा । संकुलं चाभवद्भूयो घोररूपं विशां पते ॥
data.md: Men fought with men, elephants with elephants, horses with horses and car-warriors with car-warriors. Once more O king, that encounter became general and dreadful.

data.v: इदं चित्रमिदं घोरमिदं रौद्रमिति प्रभो । युद्धान्यासन्महाराज घोराणि च बहूनि च ॥
data.md: Here an encounter was beautiful, there another was dicadful and there another was exceedingly fierce. O lord, many dreadful encounters took place in course of that battle.

data.v: ते समासाद्य समरे परस्परमरिंदमाः । विव्यधुश्चैव जघ्नुश्च समासाद्य महाहवे ॥
data.md: Belonging to both armies and encountering one another, those chastisers of foes struck and killed one another in that dreadful battle.

data.v: तेषां शस्त्रसमुद्भूतं रजस्तीव्रमदृश्यत । प्रवातेनोद्धतं राजन्धावद्भिश्चाश्वसादिभिः ॥
data.md: A thick cloud of dust was raised by the cars and the animals. Thick dust was also raised by the running of the horses, a dust that was carried from one place to another by the wind.

data.v: रथनेमिसमुद्भूतं निःश्वासैश्चापि दन्तिनाम् । रजः संध्याभ्रकपिलं दिवाकरपथं ययौ ॥
data.md: A dust, thick as an evening cloud, was caused in the sky by the wheels of cars and the breaths of the elephants.

data.v: रजसा तेन संपृक्ते भास्करे निष्प्रभीकृते । संछादिताभवद्भूमिस्ते च शूरा महारथाः ॥
data.md: On that dust being raised and the sun himself hidden therewith, the Earth became shrouded and the heroic and great car-warriors were not visible.

data.v: मुहूर्तादिव संवृत्तं नीरजस्कं समन्ततः । वीरशोणितसिक्तायां भूमौ भरतसत्तम । उपाशाम्यत्ततस्तीव्रं तद्रजो घोरदर्शनम् ॥
data.md: That dust disappeared and everything became clear when the Earth, O best of the Bharatas, was covered with the blood of heroes.

data.v: ततोऽपश्यं महाराज द्वंद्वयुद्धानि भारत । यथाप्राग्र्यं यथाज्येष्ठं मध्याह्ने वै सुदारुणे । वर्मणां तत्र राजेन्द्र व्यदृश्यन्तोज्ज्वलाः प्रभाः ॥
data.md: When that dense and awful cloud of dust was put down there were seen many single encounters, O Bharata, that the heroes fought at the noon each according to his strength and his rank. They were all exceedingly fierce. The sheen of the weapons in those encounters, O king, appeared full in view.

data.v: शब्दः सुतुमुलः संख्ये शराणां पततामभूत् । महावेणुवनस्येव दह्यमानस्य सर्वतः ॥
data.md: Loud noise, of the falling shafts in that battle, resembled that of a vast forest of bamboo's while burning on every side.

data.v: वर्तमाने तथा युद्धे घोररूपे भयानके । अभज्यत बलं तत्र तव पुत्रस्य पाण्डवैः ॥
data.md: Sanjaya said During the progress of that terrible and awful battle, the army of your son were routed by the Pandavas.

data.v: तांस्तु यत्नेन महता संनिवार्य महारथान् । पुत्रस्ते योधयामास पाण्डवानामनीकिनीम् ॥
data.md: Rallying their great car-warriors however, with vigorous exertions, your sons continued to fight with the Pandava army.

data.v: निवृत्ताः सहसा योधास्तव पुत्रप्रियैषिणः । संनिवृत्तेषु तेष्वेवं युद्धमासीत्सुदारुणम् ॥
data.md: The Kuru warriors, seeking your son's welfare, suddenly came back. Upon their return, the battle once more became fearful, between your warriors and those of the foe, resembling that between the gods and the Asuras in the days of yore. Neither amongst the enemies nor amongst your people was there a single warrior who fled away from the field.

data.v: तावकानां परेषां च देवासुररणोपमम् । परेषां तव सैन्ये च नासीत्कश्चित्पराङ्मुखः ॥
data.md: The Kuru warriors, seeking your son's welfare, suddenly came back. Upon their return, the battle once more became fearful, between your warriors and those of the foe, resembling that between the gods and the Asuras in the days of yore. Neither amongst the enemies nor amongst your people was there a single warrior who fled away from the field.

data.v: अनुमानेन युध्यन्ते संज्ञाभिश्च परस्परम् । तेषां क्षयो महानासीद्युध्यतामितरेतरम् ॥
data.md: The warriors fought, knowing one another by the names they uttered. A great onslaught took place there.

data.v: ततो युधिष्ठिरो राजा क्रोधेन महता युतः । जिगीषमाणः संग्रामे धार्तराष्ट्रान्सराजकान् ॥
data.md: Filled with great anger and desirous of defeating the Dhartarashtras and their king in that battle, king Yudhishthira struck the son of Sharadvata with three gold winged arrows whetted on stone and next killed with four others the four horses of Kritavarman.

data.v: त्रिभिः शारद्वतं विद्ध्वा रुक्मपुङ्खैः शिलाशितैः । चतुर्भिर्निजघानाश्वान्कल्याणान्कृतवर्मणः ॥
data.md: Filled with great anger and desirous of defeating the Dhartarashtras and their king in that battle, king Yudhishthira struck the son of Sharadvata with three gold winged arrows whetted on stone and next killed with four others the four horses of Kritavarman.

data.v: अश्वत्थामा तु हार्दिक्यमपोवाह यशस्विनम् । अथ शारद्वतोऽष्टाभिः प्रत्यविध्यद्युधिष्ठिरम् ॥
data.md: Then Ashvatthaman carried away the celebrated son of Hridika. Sharadvat's son struck Yudhishthira in return with eight arrows.

data.v: ततो दुर्योधनो राजा रथान्सप्तशतान्रणे । प्रेषयद्यत्र राजासौ धर्मपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: Then king Duryodhana sent seven hundred cars to the place where king Yudhishthira was fighting.

data.v: ते रथा रथिभिर्युक्ता मनोमारुतरंहसः । अभ्यद्रवन्त संग्रामे कौन्तेयस्य रथं प्रति ॥
data.md: Those cars, driven by excellent warriors and quick-coursing like the wind or thought, rushed in that battle against the car of Kunti's son.

data.v: ते समन्तान्महाराज परिवार्य युधिष्ठिरम् । अदृश्यं सायकैश्चक्रुर्मेघा इव दिवाकरम् ॥
data.md: Encircling Yudhishthira on all sides they made him invisible with their arrows like clouds hiding the sun from the view.

data.v: नामृष्यन्त सुसंरब्धाः शिखण्डिप्रमुखा रथाः । रथैरग्र्यजवैर्युक्तैः किङ्किणीजालसंवृतैः । आजग्मुरभिरक्षन्तः कुन्तीपुत्रं युधिष्ठिरम् ॥
data.md: Desirous of rescuing Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, they came there on their cars possessed of great speed and adorned with rows of bells.

data.v: ततः प्रववृते रौद्रः संग्रामः शोणितोदकः । पाण्डवानां कुरूणां च यमराष्ट्रविवर्धनः ॥
data.md: Then took place an awful battle, in which blood flowed as water, between the Pandavas and the Kurus, that increased the denizens of Yama's region.

data.v: रथान्सप्तशतान्हत्वा कुरूणामाततायिनाम् । पाण्डवाः सह पाञ्चालैः पुनरेवाभ्यवारयन् ॥
data.md: Killing those seven hundred hostile carwarriors of the Kuru army, the Pandavas and the Panchalas once more resisted (the whole Kuru ariny).

data.v: तत्र युद्धं महच्चासीत्तव पुत्रस्य पाण्डवैः । न च नस्तादृशं दृष्टं नैव चापि परिश्रुतम् ॥
data.md: There took place a fierce encounter between your son and the Pandavas. We had never before seen or heard of its like.

data.v: वर्तमाने तथा युद्धे निर्मर्यादे समन्ततः । वध्यमानेषु योधेषु तावकेष्वितरेषु च ॥
data.md: During the onset of that battle in which no consideration was shown by any party for another and while the warriors of your army and those of the foe were being killed quickly, the coinbatants were all shouting and blowing their conchs. The bowmen were roaring and uttering loud noises of diverse kinds.

data.v: निनदत्सु च योधेषु शङ्खवर्यैश्च पूरितैः । उत्कृष्टैः सिंहनादैश्च गर्जितेन च धन्विनाम् ॥
data.md: During the onset of that battle in which no consideration was shown by any party for another and while the warriors of your army and those of the foe were being killed quickly, the coinbatants were all shouting and blowing their conchs. The bowmen were roaring and uttering loud noises of diverse kinds.

data.v: अतिप्रवृद्धे युद्धे च छिद्यमानेषु मर्मसु । धावमानेषु योधेषु जयगृद्धिषु मारिष ॥
data.md: The very vitals of the combatants were being struck, during that fight and the troops, O sire, desirous of victory, were rushing with speed.

data.v: संहारे सर्वतो जाते पृथिव्यां शोकसंभवे । बह्वीनामुत्तमस्त्रीणां सीमन्तोद्धरणे तथा ॥
data.md: Everything on carth was under-going ai woeful destruction, during that battle when numberless ladies of birth and beauty were being made widows.

data.v: निर्मर्यादे तथा युद्धे वर्तमाने सुदारुणे । प्रादुरासन्विनाशाय तदोत्पाताः सुदारुणाः । चचाल शब्दं कुर्वाणा सपर्वतवना मही ॥
data.md: During the progress of that fierce encounter in which the warriors fought without any consideration for friends and foes, evil omens appeared, presaging the destruction of everything.

data.v: सदण्डाः सोल्मुका राजञ्शीर्यमाणाः समन्ततः । उल्काः पेतुर्दिवो भूमावाहत्य रविमण्डलम् ॥
data.md: The earth, with her mountains and forests, shook making a loud noise. Meteors, like burning brands equipt with handles, dropped from the sky, O king, on every side of the earth as if from the solar disc.

data.v: विष्वग्वाताः प्रादुरासन्नीचैः शर्करवर्षिणः । अश्रूणि मुमुचुर्नागा वेपथुश्चास्पृशद्भृशम् ॥
data.md: There blew a hurricane on all sides, carrying away hard pebbles along its lower course. The elephants shed profuse tears and trembled greatly.

data.v: एतान्घोराननादृत्य समुत्पातान्सुदारुणान् । पुनर्युद्धाय संमन्त्र्य क्षत्रियास्तस्थुरव्यथाः । रमणीये कुरुक्षेत्रे पुण्ये स्वर्गं यियासवः ॥
data.md: Disregarding all those fierce and awful omens, the Kshatriyas, consulting with one another, cheerfully stood on the field of Kurukshetra, desirous of going to heaven.

data.v: ततो गान्धारराजस्य पुत्रः शकुनिरब्रवीत् । युध्यध्वमग्रतो यावत्पृष्ठतो हन्मि पाण्डवान् ॥
data.md: Then Shakuni, the son of the Gandhara king, said-"Fight you all in front! I, however, will kill the Pandavas from behind!”_-Then the active Madraka warriors, amongst those on our side that were advancing, were filled with joy and uttered various cries. Others also did the same.

data.v: ततो नः संप्रयातानां मद्रयोधास्तरस्विनः । हृष्टाः किलकिलाशब्दमकुर्वन्तापरे तथा ॥
data.md: Then, whilst we were proceeding, the active Pandavas, in a body, completed the slaughter of the Madrakas and filled with delight, sent up joyous shouts.

data.v: अस्मांस्तु पुनरासाद्य लब्धलक्षा दुरासदाः । शरासनानि धुन्वन्तः शरवर्षैरवाकिरन् ॥
data.md: The invincible and sure-armed Pandavas, once more coming against us, shook their bows and enshrouded us with showers of arrows.

data.v: ततो हतं परैस्तत्र मद्रराजबलं तदा । दुर्योधनबलं दृष्ट्वा पुनरासीत्पराङ्मुखम् ॥
data.md: Seeing then that large force of the Madra king killed as also their heroic king the entire army of Duryodhana once more fled away from the field.

data.v: गान्धारराजस्तु पुनर्वाक्यमाह ततो बली । निवर्तध्वमधर्मज्ञा युध्यध्वं किं सृतेन वः ॥
data.md: The might king of the Gandharas, however, once more said these words-"Stop, you sinful wretches, fight with the foe. What use is there of fight.” At that time, O foremost of Bharata's race, the king of the Gandharas had full ten thousand horsemen capable of fighting with bright lances.

data.v: अनीकं दशसाहस्रमश्वानां भरतर्षभ । आसीद्गान्धारराजस्य विमलप्रासयोधिनाम् ॥
बलेन तेन विक्रम्य वर्तमाने जनक्षये । पृष्ठतः पाण्डवानीकमभ्यघ्नन्निशितैः शरैः ॥
data.md: During the onset of that great carnage, Shakuni, aided by the force, displayed his valor and assailed the Pandava army at the rear, killing it with his keen arrows.

data.v: तदभ्रमिव वातेन क्षिप्यमाणं समन्ततः । अभज्यत महाराज पाण्डूनां सुमहद्बलम् ॥
data.md: The huge force of the Pandus then, O king, were dispersed even as a mass of clouds of all sides by a powerful wind.

data.v: ततो युधिष्ठिरः प्रेक्ष्य भग्नं स्वबलमन्तिकात् । अभ्यचोदयदव्यग्रः सहदेवं महाबलम् ॥
data.md: Then beholding his own army rouled, Yudhishthira coolly urged the mighty Sahadeva, saying-"Yonder the son of Subala, afflicting our rear, stands clad in mail. He kills our forces. Behold that wicked man, O son of Pandu.

data.v: असौ सुबलपुत्रो नो जघनं पीड्य दंशितः । सेनां निसूदयन्त्येष पश्य पाण्डव दुर्मतिम् ॥
data.md: Then beholding his own army rouled, Yudhishthira coolly urged the mighty Sahadeva, saying-"Yonder the son of Subala, afflicting our rear, stands clad in mail. He kills our forces. Behold that wicked man, O son of Pandu.

data.v: गच्छ त्वं द्रौपदेयाश्च शकुनिं सौबलं जहि । रथानीकमहं रक्ष्ये पाञ्चालसहितोऽनघ ॥
data.md: Helped by the sons of Draupadi proceed towards him and kill Shakuni, the son of Subala. Supported by the Panchalas, O sinless one, I will meanwhile kill the car-force of the enemy.

data.v: गच्छन्तु कुञ्जराः सर्वे वाजिनश्च सह त्वया । पादाताश्च त्रिसाहस्राः शकुनिं सौबलं जहि ॥
ततो गजाः सप्तशताश्चापपाणिभिरास्थिताः । पञ्च चाश्वसहस्राणि सहदेवश्च वीर्यवान् ॥
पादाताश्च त्रिसाहस्रा द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वशः । रणे ह्यभ्यद्रवंस्ते तु शकुनिं युद्धदुर्मदम् ॥
ततस्तु सौबलो राजन्नभ्यतिक्रम्य पाण्डवान् । जघान पृष्ठतः सेनां जयगृध्रः प्रतापवान् ॥
data.md: However, O king, overpowering the Pandavas and longing for victory, Subala's son, of great valour, began to slay their forces from the back.

data.v: अश्वारोहास्तु संरब्धाः पाण्डवानां तरस्विनाम् । प्राविशन्सौबलानीकमभ्यतिक्रम्य तान्रथान् ॥
data.md: The horsemen, beside themselves with rage, of the Pandavas penetrated the division of Subala's son, overpowering the latter's carwarriors.

data.v: ते तत्र सादिनः शूराः सौबलस्य महद्बलम् । गजमध्येऽवतिष्ठन्तः शरवर्षैरवाकिरन् ॥
data.md: Those heroic horsemen, staying in the midst of their own elephants, enshrouded the large host of Subala's son with showers of arrows.

data.v: तदुद्यतगदाप्रासमकापुरुषसेवितम् । प्रावर्तत महद्युद्धं राजन्दुर्मन्त्रिते तव ॥
data.md: On account of your evil counsels, O king, a dreadful battle took place in which maces and lances were used and in which heroes only took part.

data.v: उपारमन्त ज्याशब्दाः प्रेक्षका रथिनोऽभवन् । न हि स्वेषां परेषां वा विशेषः प्रत्यदृश्यत ॥
data.md: The twang of bows was no longer heard there, for all the car-warriors stood there as spectators. At that time no difference could be seen between the opposing parties.

data.v: शूरबाहुविसृष्टानां शक्तीनां भरतर्षभ । ज्योतिषामिव संपातमपश्यन्कुरुपाण्डवाः ॥
data.md: Both the Kurus and the Pandavas, O foremost of Bharatas, saw the darts, shot off heroic arms, pass like meteors through the sky.

data.v: ऋष्टिभिर्विमलाभिश्च तत्र तत्र विशां पते । संपतन्तीभिराकाशमावृतं बह्वशोभत ॥
data.md: The entire sky, O king, covered with falling and bright sword, appeared highly beautiful.

data.v: प्रासानां पततां राजन्रूपमासीत्समन्ततः । शलभानामिवाकाशे तदा भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: The view presented, O best of the Bharatas, by the lances hurled all around, was like that of swarms of locusts in the sky.

data.v: रुधिरोक्षितसर्वाङ्गा विप्रविद्धैर्नियन्तृभिः । हयाः परिपतन्ति स्म शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: Horses, with limbs covered with blood on account of wounds inflicted by horsemen themselves struck with arrows, dropped down on all sides in hundreds and thousands.

data.v: अन्योन्यपरिपिष्टाश्च समासाद्य परस्परम् । अविक्षताः स्म दृश्यन्ते वमन्तो रुधिरं मुखैः ॥
data.md: They all remained huddled together. many of them were wounded and many vomited blood. A thick darkness set in there when the troops were covered with a cloud of dust.

data.v: ततोऽभवत्तमो घोरं सैन्येन रजसा वृते । तानपाक्रमतोऽद्राक्षं तस्माद्देशादरिंदमान् । अश्वान्राजन्मनुष्यांश्च रजसा संवृते सति ॥
data.md: When that darkness covered everything, O king, we saw those brave heroes, horses and men move away from that spot.

data.v: भूमौ निपतिताश्चान्ये वमन्तो रुधिरं बहु । केशाकेशिसमालग्ना न शेकुश्चेष्टितुं जनाः ॥
अन्योन्यमश्वपृष्ठेभ्यो विकर्षन्तो महाबलाः । मल्ला इव समासाद्य निजघ्नुरितरेतरम् । अश्वैश्च व्यपकृष्यन्त बहवोऽत्र गतासवः ॥
data.md: Many powerful heroes dragged one another from the backs of their horses and encountering one another thus, killed one another like wrestlers. Many, deprived of life, were carried away by the horses they rode.

data.v: भूमौ निपतिताश्चान्ये बहवो विजयैषिणः । तत्र तत्र व्यदृश्यन्त पुरुषाः शूरमानिनः ॥
रक्तोक्षितैश्छिन्नभुजैरपकृष्टशिरोरुहैः । व्यदृश्यत मही कीर्णा शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ॥
दूरं न शक्यं तत्रासीद्गन्तुमश्वेन केनचित् । साश्वारोहैर्हतैरश्वैरावृते वसुधातले ॥
रुधिरोक्षितसंनाहैरात्तशस्त्रैरुदायुधैः । नानाप्रहरणैर्घोरैः परस्परवधैषिभिः । सुसंनिकृष्टैः संग्रामे हतभूयिष्ठसैनिकैः ॥
स मुहूर्तं ततो युद्ध्वा सौबलोऽथ विशां पते । षट्सहस्रैर्हयैः शिष्टैरपायाच्छकुनिस्ततः ॥
तथैव पाण्डवानीकं रुधिरेण समुक्षितम् । षट्सहस्रैर्हयैः शिष्टैरपायाच्छ्रान्तवाहनम् ॥
अश्वारोहास्तु पाण्डूनामब्रुवन्रुधिरोक्षिताः । सुसंनिकृष्टाः संग्रामे भूयिष्ठं त्यक्तजीविताः ॥
नेह शक्यं रथैर्योद्धुं कुत एव महागजैः । रथानेव रथा यान्तु कुञ्जराः कुञ्जरानपि ॥
प्रतियातो हि शकुनिः स्वमनीकमवस्थितः । न पुनः सौबलो राजा युद्धमभ्यागमिष्यति ॥
data.md: Having retreated Shakuni is now staying within his own detachment. The royal son of Subala will not again come to fight.”

data.v: ततस्तु द्रौपदेयाश्च ते च मत्ता महाद्विपाः । प्रययुर्यत्र पाञ्चाल्यो धृष्टद्युम्नो महारथः ॥
data.md: Then the sons of Draupadi and those infuriate elephants went where the Panchala prince Dhrishtadyumna, that great car-warrior, was.

data.v: भीमसेनस्तु तान्दृष्ट्वा नागान्मत्तगजोपमः । करेण गृह्य महतीं गदामभ्यपतद्बली । अवप्लुत्य रथात्तूर्णं दण्डपाणिरिवान्तकः ॥
data.md: The powerful Bhimasena, himself like an infuriate elephant, seeing those elephants, took up his formidable mace and rushed at them, quickly jumping down from his car, like the Destroyer armed with his club.

data.v: तमुद्यतगदं दृष्ट्वा पाण्डवानां महारथम् । वित्रेसुस्तावकाः सैन्याः शकृन्मूत्रं प्रसुस्रुवुः । आविग्नं च बलं सर्वं गदाहस्ते वृकोदरे ॥
data.md: Seeing that great car-warrior of the Pandavas with uplifted mace, your soldiers were possessed by fear and passed urine and excreta.

data.v: गदया भीमसेनेन भिन्नकुम्भान्रजस्वलान् । धावमानानपश्याम कुञ्जरान्पर्वतोपमान् ॥
data.md: The whole army were agitated upon seeing Bhimasena armed with mace. We then saw those elephants, huge as hills, running hither and thither, with their frontal globes cut open by Bhima with his mace and all their limbs covered with blood.

data.v: प्रधाव्य कुञ्जरास्ते तु भीमसेनगदाहताः । पेतुरार्तस्वरं कृत्वा छिन्नपक्षा इवाद्रयः ॥
data.md: Struck with Bhima's mace, those elephants, running off from him, dropped down crying like mountains with their wings cut off.

data.v: तान्भिन्नकुम्भान्सुबहून्द्रवमाणानितस्ततः । पतमानांश्च संप्रेक्ष्य वित्रेसुस्तव सैनिकाः ॥
data.md: Beholding those numberless elephants, with their frontal globes cut open, running hither and thither or falling down your soidiers were possessed by fear.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरोऽपि संक्रुद्धो माद्रीपुत्रौ च पाण्डवौ । गृध्रपक्षैः शितैर्बाणैर्जघ्नुर्वै गजयोधिनः ॥
data.md: Then Yudhishthira also, worked up with anger and the two sons of Madri, began to kill those elephant-warriors with arrows having wings like those of vultures.

data.v: धृष्टद्युम्नस्तु समरे पराजित्य नराधिपम् । अपक्रान्ते तव सुते हयपृष्ठं समाश्रिते ॥
data.md: Dhrishtadyumna, after the defeat of the Kuru king in battle and after the fight of the latter from that spot of horse-back, saw that the Pandavas had all been encircled by the Kaurava elephants.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा च पाण्डवान्सर्वान्कुञ्जरैः परिवारितान् । धृष्टद्युम्नो महाराज सह सर्वैः प्रभद्रकैः । पुत्रः पाञ्चालराजस्य जिघांसुः कुञ्जरान्ययौ ॥
data.md: Beholding this, O king, Dhrishtadyumna, the son of the Panchala king proceeded towards those elephants to kill them.

data.v: अदृष्ट्वा तु रथानीके दुर्योधनमरिंदमम् । अश्वत्थामा कृपश्चैव कृतवर्मा च सात्वतः । अपृच्छन्क्षत्रियांस्तत्र क्व नु दुर्योधनो गतः ॥
data.md: In the meantime not seeing Duryodhana in the midst of the car-force, Ashvathaman and Kripa, the Kritavarman of the Satwata race, asked all the Kshatriyas, saying-"Where had Duryodhana gone.'

data.v: अपश्यमाना राजानं वर्तमाने जनक्षये । मन्वाना निहतं तत्र तव पुत्रं महारथाः । विषण्णवदना भूत्वा पर्यपृच्छन्त ते सुतम् ॥
data.md: Not seeing the king in the midst of that onslaught all those great car-warriors took him for dead and therefore with sorrowful faces, they enquired after him.

data.v: आहुः केचिद्धते सूते प्रयातो यत्र सौबलः । अपरे त्वब्रुवंस्तत्र क्षत्रिया भृशविक्षताः ॥
दुर्योधनेन किं कार्यं द्रक्ष्यध्वं यदि जीवति । युध्यध्वं सहिताः सर्वे किं वो राजा करिष्यति ॥
data.md: Others, who had been greatly wounded said-"What necessity is there with Duryodhana. See, if he is yet alive. Do you all fight in a body, what will the king do to you."

data.v: ते क्षत्रियाः क्षतैर्गात्रैर्हतभूयिष्ठवाहनाः । शरैः संपीड्यमानाश्च नातिव्यक्तमिवाब्रुवन् ॥
data.md: Other Kshatriyas, who were greatly wounded and who had lost many of their relatives and who were still being struck with the arrows of the enemy, said these words indistinctly.

data.v: इदं सर्वं बलं हन्मो येन स्म परिवारिताः । एते सर्वे गजान्हत्वा उपयान्ति स्म पाण्डवाः ॥
data.md: "Let us kill these forces by whom we are encircled. See the Pandavas are coming here after having killed the elephants.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु वचनं तेषामश्वत्थामा महाबलः । हित्वा पाञ्चालराजस्य तदनीकं दुरुत्सहम् ॥
data.md: Hearing these words, the powerful Ashvatthaman, cutting through that irresistible force of the Panchala king, went with Kripa and Kritavarman, where Subala's son was. Infect leaving the car-force, those heroes, those firm bowmen, went to find out Duryodhana.

data.v: कृपश्च कृतवर्मा च प्रययुर्यत्र सौबलः । रथानीकं परित्यज्य शूराः सुदृढधन्विनः ॥
data.md: Hearing these words, the powerful Ashvatthaman, cutting through that irresistible force of the Panchala king, went with Kripa and Kritavarman, where Subala's son was. Infect leaving the car-force, those heroes, those firm bowmen, went to find out Duryodhana.

data.v: ततस्तेषु प्रयातेषु धृष्टद्युम्नपुरोगमाः । आययुः पाण्डवा राजन्विनिघ्नन्तः स्म तावकान् ॥
data.md: After their departure, the Pandavas, headed by Dhrishtadyumna, advanced, O king and began to kill their enemies.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा तु तानापततः संप्रहृष्टान्महारथान् । पराक्रान्तांस्ततो वीरान्निराशाञ्जीविते तदा । विवर्णमुखभूयिष्ठमभवत्तावकं बलम् ॥
data.md: Beholding those brave, heroic and powerful car-warriors rushing joyously towards them, your soldiers, whose faces grew pale, became despondent of their lives.

data.v: परिक्षीणायुधान्दृष्ट्वा तानहं परिवारितान् । राजन्बलेन द्व्यङ्गेन त्यक्त्वा जीवितमात्मनः ॥
आत्मनापञ्चमोऽयुध्यं पाञ्चालस्य बलेन ह । तस्मिन्देशे व्यवस्थाप्य यत्र शारद्वतः स्थितः ॥
संप्रयुद्धा वयं पञ्च किरीटिशरपीडिताः । धृष्टद्युम्नं महानीकं तत्र नोऽभूद्रणो महान् । जितास्तेन वयं सर्वे व्यपयाम रणात्ततः ॥
data.md: We had been cut with the arrows of Arjuna and still a fierce encounter took place between us and the army of Dhrishtadyumna. At last, defeated by the latter, all of us retreated from that battle.

data.v: अथापश्यं सात्यकिं तमुपायान्तं महारथम् । रथैश्चतुःशतैर्वीरो मां चाभ्यद्रवदाहवे ॥
data.md: I then beheld the great car-warrior Satyaki rushing against us. With four hundred cars that hero pursued me in battle.

data.v: धृष्टद्युम्नादहं मुक्तः कथंचिच्छ्रान्तवाहनः । पतितो माधवानीकं दुष्कृती नरकं यथा । तत्र युद्धमभूद्घोरं मुहूर्तमतिदारुणम् ॥
data.md: Having escaped with difficulty from Dhrishtadyumna whose horses had been exhausted, I feel among the soldiers of Madhava even as a sinner falleth into hell. There a fierce and terrible encounter took place for a short time.

data.v: सात्यकिस्तु महाबाहुर्मम हत्वा परिच्छदम् । जीवग्राहमगृह्णान्मां मूर्छितं पतितं भुवि ॥
data.md: The mighty-armed Satyaki, having cut off my armour, thought of taking me alive. He caught me while I lay down on the ground insensible.

data.v: ततो मुहूर्तादिव तद्गजानीकमवध्यत । गदया भीमसेनेन नाराचैरर्जुनेन च ॥
data.md: Then within a short time that elephant force was killed by Bhimasena with his mace and Arjuna with his arrows.

data.v: प्रतिपिष्टैर्महानागैः समन्तात्पर्वतोपमैः । नातिप्रसिद्धेव गतिः पाण्डवानामजायत ॥
data.md: On account of those mighty elephants, huge as hills, falling down on every side with wounded limbs, the Pandava warriors found their way entirely blocked up.

data.v: रथमार्गांस्ततश्चक्रे भीमसेनो महाबलः । पाण्डवानां महाराज व्यपकर्षन्महागजान् ॥
data.md: Then the powerful Bhimasena, O king, dragging away those huge elephants, made a way for the Pandavas.

data.v: अश्वत्थामा कृपश्चैव कृतवर्मा च सात्वतः । अपश्यन्तो रथानीके दुर्योधनमरिंदमम् । राजानं मृगयामासुस्तव पुत्रं महारथम् ॥
data.md: Meanwhile not seeing that chastiser of foes Duryodhana amid the car-division, Ashvatthaman and Kripa and Kritavarman of the Satwata race, tried to find out your royal son.

data.v: परित्यज्य च पाञ्चालं प्रयाता यत्र सौबलः । राज्ञोऽदर्शनसंविग्ना वर्तमाने जनक्षये ॥
data.md: Leaving the prince of the Panchalas they proceeded where Subala's son was, anxious to see the king during that terrible onslaught.

data.v: गजानीके हते तस्मिन्पाण्डुपुत्रेण भारत । वध्यमाने बले चैव भीमसेनेन संयुगे ॥
चरन्तं च तथा दृष्ट्वा भीमसेनमरिंदमम् । दण्डहस्तं यथा क्रुद्धमन्तकं प्राणहारिणम् ॥
समेत्य समरे राजन्हतशेषाः सुतास्तव । अदृश्यमाने कौरव्ये पुत्रे दुर्योधने तव । सोदर्याः सहिता भूत्वा भीमसेनमुपाद्रवन् ॥
दुर्मर्षणो महाराज जैत्रो भूरिबलो रविः । इत्येते सहिता भूत्वा तव पुत्राः समन्ततः । भीमसेनमभिद्रुत्य रुरुधुः सर्वतोदिशम् ॥
ततो भीमो महाराज स्वरथं पुनरास्थितः । मुमोच निशितान्बाणान्पुत्राणां तव मर्मसु ॥
ते कीर्यमाणा भीमेन पुत्रास्तव महारणे । भीमसेनमपासेधन्प्रवणादिव कुञ्जरम् ॥
ततः क्रुद्धो रणे भीमः शिरो दुर्मर्षणस्य ह । क्षुरप्रेण प्रमथ्याशु पातयामास भूतले ॥
ततोऽपरेण भल्लेन सर्वावरणभेदिना । श्रुतान्तमवधीद्भीमस्तव पुत्रं महारथः ॥
data.md: With another broad-headed arrow capable of cutting through every armour, Bhima next killed the great car-warrior, viz., your son Shrutanta.

data.v: जयत्सेनं ततो विद्ध्वा नाराचेन हसन्निव । पातयामास कौरव्यं रथोपस्थादरिंदमः । स पपात रथाद्राजन्भूमौ तूर्णं ममार च ॥
data.md: Then striking Jayatsena easily with a clothyard shaft, that chastiser of foes, viz., the son of Pandu, struck down that action of Kuru's race from his car. The prince, O king, dropped down and immediately died.

data.v: श्रुतर्वा तु ततो भीमं क्रुद्धो विव्याध मारिष । शतेन गृध्रवाजानां शराणां नतपर्वणाम् ॥
data.md: Thereat your son Shrutarvan, worked up with rage, struck Bhima with a hundred straight arrows winged with feathers of vultures.

data.v: ततः क्रुद्धो रणे भीमो जैत्रं भूरिबलं रविम् । त्रीनेतांस्त्रिभिरानर्छद्विषाग्निप्रतिमैः शरैः ॥
data.md: Then Bhima, worked up with rage, struck Jaitra and Ravi and Bhuribala, with three arrows resembling poison or fire.

data.v: ते हता न्यपतन्भूमौ स्यन्दनेभ्यो महारथाः । वसन्ते पुष्पशबला निकृत्ता इव किंशुकाः ॥
data.md: Those great car-warrior, thus struck, dropped down from their cars like Kinshukas blossoming in the spring.

data.v: ततोऽपरेण तीक्ष्णेन नाराचेन परंतपः । दुर्विमोचनमाहत्य प्रेषयामास मृत्यवे ॥
data.md: Then that scorcher of foes, with another broad-headed and keen arrow, struck Durvimochana and killed him.

data.v: स हतः प्रापतद्भूमौ स्वरथाद्रथिनां वरः । गिरेस्तु कूटजो भग्नो मारुतेनेव पादपः ॥
data.md: Thus struck, that best of car-warriors fell down on the ground from his car, like a tree growing on the summit of a mountain uprooted by the storm.

data.v: दुष्प्रधर्षं ततश्चैव सुजातं च सुतौ तव । एकैकं न्यवधीत्संख्ये द्वाभ्यां द्वाभ्यां चमूमुखे । तौ शिलीमुखविद्धाङ्गौ पेततू रथसत्तमौ ॥
data.md: The son of Pandu next struck your other two leading their forces, viz., Dushpradharsha and Sajata, each with a couple of arrows in that battle. Those two best of carwarriors, struck with those arrows, feil down.

data.v: ततो यतन्तमपरमभिवीक्ष्य सुतं तव । भल्लेन युधि विव्याध भीमो दुर्विषहं रणे । स पपात हतो वाहात्पश्यतां सर्वधन्विनाम् ॥
data.md: Beholding another son of yours viz., Durvishaha and rushing at him, Bhima struck him with a broad-headed arrow in that battle. That prince dropped down from his car before all the bowmen.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा तु निहतान्भ्रातॄन्बहूनेकेन संयुगे । अमर्षवशमापन्नः श्रुतर्वा भीममभ्ययात् ॥
data.md: Beholding so many of his brothers killed by Bhima alone in that battle, Shrutarvan, worked up with rage, rushed at Bhima, stretching his dreadful bow docket with gold and discharging a large number of arrows resembling poison or fire. sons

data.v: विक्षिपन्सुमहच्चापं कार्तस्वरविभूषितम् । विसृजन्सायकांश्चैव विषाग्निप्रतिमान्बहून् ॥
data.md: Beholding so many of his brothers killed by Bhima alone in that battle, Shrutarvan, worked up with rage, rushed at Bhima, stretching his dreadful bow docket with gold and discharging a large number of arrows resembling poison or fire. sons

data.v: स तु राजन्धनुश्छित्त्वा पाण्डवस्य महामृधे । अथैनं छिन्नधन्वानं विंशत्या समवाकिरत् ॥
data.md: Cutting off the bow of Pandu's son in that dreadful encounter, the Kuru prince struck the bowless Bhima with twenty arrows.

data.v: ततोऽन्यद्धनुरादाय भीमसेनो महारथः । अवाकिरत्तव सुतं तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चाब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Then Bhimasena, that great car-warrior, taking up another bow, covered your son with arrows and said to him "Wait, wait."

data.v: महदासीत्तयोर्युद्धं चित्ररूपं भयानकम् । यादृशं समरे पूर्वं जम्भवासवयोरभूत् ॥
data.md: The encounter between the two was beautiful and dreadful, like that which took place in days of yore between Vasava and the Asura Jambha, O lord.

data.v: तयोस्तत्र शरैर्मुक्तैर्यमदण्डनिभैः शुभैः । समाच्छन्ना धरा सर्वा खं च सर्वा दिशस्तथा ॥
data.md: With the sharp arrows, resembling the dreadful rod of Yama, shot by those two warriors, the earth, the sky and all the points of the horizon were covered.

data.v: ततः श्रुतर्वा संक्रुद्धो धनुरायम्य सायकैः । भीमसेनं रणे राजन्बाह्वोरुरसि चार्पयत् ॥
data.md: Then excited with rage, Shrutarvan took up his bow and struck Bhimasena in that battle, O king, with many arrows on his arms and chest.

data.v: सोऽतिविद्धो महाराज तव पुत्रेण धन्विना । भीमः संचुक्षुभे क्रुद्धः पर्वणीव महोदधिः ॥
data.md: Deeply cut, О king by your son armed with the bow, Bhima grew exceedingly agitated like the ocean at the full or the new moon.

data.v: ततो भीमो रुषाविष्टः पुत्रस्य तव मारिष । सारथिं चतुरश्चाश्वान्बाणैर्निन्ये यमक्षयम् ॥
data.md: Excited with ire Bhima then, O sire, killed with his arrows the driver and the four horses of your son.

data.v: विरथं तं समालक्ष्य विशिखैर्लोमवाहिभिः । अवाकिरदमेयात्मा दर्शयन्पाणिलाघवम् ॥

data.v: भीमस्तु समरे क्रुद्धः पुत्रं तव जनाधिप । सुदर्शनमदृश्यं तं शरैश्चक्रे हसन्निव ॥
data.md: In that battle, filled with rage, O king, Bhima covered Sudarshana with his arrows.

data.v: ततोऽस्य प्रहसन्क्रुद्धः शिरः कायादपाहरत् । क्षुरप्रेण सुतीक्ष्णेन स हतः प्रापतद्भुवि ॥
data.md: Filled with rage, the son of Pandu, smiling, cut off his antagonist's head with a sharp razorheaded arrow. The prince fell down dead on the earth.

data.v: तस्मिंस्तु निहते वीरे ततस्तस्य पदानुगाः । परिवव्रू रणे भीमं किरन्तो विशिखाञ्शितान् ॥
data.md: Upon the fall of that (Kuru) hero, his followers encircled Bhima in that battle, making a downpour of whetted arrows.

data.v: ततस्तु निशितैर्बाणैस्तदनीकं वृकोदरः । इन्द्राशनिसमस्पर्शैः समन्तात्पर्यवाकिरत् । ततः क्षणेन तद्भीमो न्यहनद्भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: With keen arrows Vrikodara, however, whose touch resembled that of Indra's thunder, enshrouded the army around him. Within a very short time, Bhima killed them all, O foremost of Bharata's race.

data.v: तेषु तूत्साद्यमानेषु सेनाध्यक्षा महाबलाः । भीमसेनं समासाद्य ततोऽयुध्यन्त भारत । तांस्तु सर्वाञ्शरैर्घोरैरवाकिरत पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: Whilst they were being thus slain, many powerful Kaurava warriors, O Bharata, approached Bhima and began to fight with him.

data.v: तथैव तावका राजन्पाण्डवेयान्महारथान् । शरवर्षेण महता समन्तात्पर्यवारयन् ॥
व्याकुलं तदभूत्सर्वं पाण्डवानां परैः सह । तावकानां च समरे पाण्डवेयैर्युयुत्सताम् ॥

data.md: Struck by one another, the warriors of both armies, O king, began to drop down, lamenting for their (deceased) relatives.

data.v: तस्मिन्प्रवृत्ते संग्रामे नरवाजिगजक्षये । शकुनिः सौबलो राजन्सहदेवं समभ्ययात् ॥
data.md: Sanjaya said During the course of that battle which was so destructive of men and horses and elephants, Subala's son Shakuni, O king, proceeded against Sahadeva.

data.v: ततोऽस्यापततस्तूर्णं सहदेवः प्रतापवान् । शरौघान्प्रेषयामास पतंगानिव शीघ्रगान् । उलूकश्च रणे भीमं विव्याध दशभिः शरैः ॥
data.md: The valiant Sahadeva, as Shakuni rushed quickly towards him, discharged shower of quick-coursing arrows at that warrior like a swarm of insects. At that time Uluka also met Bhima and struck him with ten arrows.

data.v: शकुनिस्तु महाराज भीमं विद्ध्वा त्रिभिः शरैः । सायकानां नवत्या वै सहदेवमवाकिरत् ॥
data.md: O king, having struck Bhima with three arrows, Shakuni, meanwhile, covered Sahadeva with ninety.

data.v: ते शूराः समरे राजन्समासाद्य परस्परम् । विव्यधुर्निशितैर्बाणैः कङ्कबर्हिणवाजितैः । स्वर्णपुङ्खैः शिलाधौतैरा कर्णात्प्रहितैः शरैः ॥
data.md: Indeed, O king, encountering one another in that battle, those heroes, struck one another with many Kanka and peacock feathered keen arrows winged with gold, whetted on stone and shot off the bow-string drawn to their ears.

data.v: तेषां चापभुजोत्सृष्टा शरवृष्टिर्विशां पते । आच्छादयद्दिशः सर्वा धाराभिरिव तोयदः ॥
data.md: Those showers of arrows discharged from their bows and arms, O monarch, covered all the points of the horizon like a thick downpour of rain poured from the clouds.

data.v: ततः क्रुद्धो रणे भीमः सहदेवश्च भारत । चेरतुः कदनं संख्ये कुर्वन्तौ सुमहाबलौ ॥
data.md: Then Bhima, worked up with rage and the brave Sahadeva, both very powerful, moved about in that battle making a great onslaught.

data.v: ताभ्यां शरशतैश्छन्नं तद्बलं तव भारत । अन्धकारमिवाकाशमभवत्तत्र तत्र ह ॥
data.md: That army, O Bharata, was shrouded with hundreds of arrows by those two warriors and the sky, on many parts of the field, was shrouded with darkness.

data.v: अश्वैर्विपरिधावद्भिः शरच्छन्नैर्विशां पते । तत्र तत्र कृतो मार्गो विकर्षद्भिर्हतान्बहून् ॥
data.md: The horses struck with arrows, dragging after them as they ran a large number of killed warriors the passage in the battle-field was entirely blocked up.

data.v: निहतानां हयानां च सहैव हययोधिभिः । वर्मभिर्विनिकृत्तैश्च प्रासैश्छिन्नैश्च मारिष । संछन्ना पृथिवी जज्ञे कुसुमैः शबला इव ॥
data.md: Covered with horses slain with their riders, with broken shields and lances and with swords and darts and spears all around the earth appeared to have been strewn with flowers.

data.v: योधास्तत्र महाराज समासाद्य परस्परम् । व्यचरन्त रणे क्रुद्धा विनिघ्नन्तः परस्परम् ॥
data.md: Soon the field was covered with heads, beautiful as the filaments of the lotus, bedecked with ear-rings and having faces set with eyes upturned in wrath and lips bit in rage.

data.md: After the Bharata army had bcen reduced to a small number, the Pandavas, filled with delight in that dreadful battle, began to slay the Kauravas.

data.md: Meanwhile the heroic and brave son of Subala forcibly struck Sahadeva in the head with a lance.

data.v: सहदेवं तथा दृष्ट्वा भीमसेनः प्रतापवान् । सर्वसैन्यानि संक्रुद्धो वारयामास भारत ॥
data.md: Beholding Sahadeva in that condition the valiant Bhima, worked up with rage, O Bharata, obstructed the entire Kuru army.

data.v: निर्बिभेद च नाराचैः शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः । विनिर्भिद्याकरोच्चैव सिंहनादमरिंदम ॥
data.md: With his cloth-yard shafts he struck hundreds and thousands of hostilo warriors and having struck them so, that chastiser of foes sent up a leonine roar.

data.md: Terrified at that roar, all the followers of Shakuni, with their horses and elephants immediately fled away in fear.

data.v: प्रभग्नानथ तान्दृष्ट्वा राजा दुर्योधनोऽब्रवीत् । निवर्तध्वमधर्मज्ञा युध्यध्वं किं सृतेन वः ॥
data.md: Seeing them routed, king Duryodhana said to them-"Stop, you immoral Kshatriyas! fight! What is the use of fight?

data.md: That hero, who unretreatingly sacrifices his life in battle, achieves fame here and enjoyes blissful regions hereafter!"-Thus exhorted by the king, the followers of Subala's son once more proceeded against the Pandavas, determined upon ineeting with death.

data.md: O monarch, the noise made by those rushing warriors was terrible and resembled that of the agitated ocean. Thereat the field of battle was agitated all around.

data.v: तांस्तदापततो दृष्ट्वा सौबलस्य पदानुगान् । प्रत्युद्ययुर्महाराज पाण्डवा विजये वृताः ॥
data.md: Beholding those followers of Subala's son thus proceeding to battle, the victorious Pandavas, O monarch rushed against them.

data.md: Relieved a little, the invincible Sahadeva, O monarch, struck Shakuni with ten arrows and his horses with three. He, without the slightest exertion, then cut off the bow of Subala's son with a number of other arrows.

data.v: अथान्यद्धनुरादाय शकुनिर्युद्धदुर्मदः । विव्याध नकुलं षष्ट्या भीमसेनं च सप्तभिः ॥
data.md: Invincible in battle, Shakuni, however, took up another bow and struck Nakula with sixty arrows and then Bhimasena with seven.

data.md: Uluka also, O king, desirous of rescuing his father in that battle, struck Bhima with seven arrows and Sahadeva with seventy.

data.v: तं भीमसेनः समरे विव्याध निशितैः शरैः । शकुनिं च चतुःषष्ट्या पार्श्वस्थांश्च त्रिभिस्त्रिभिः ॥
data.md: Bhimasena, in that battle, struck Uluka with many keen arrows and Shakuni with four and sixty and each of the other warriors who fought around them with three arrows.

data.md: Struck by Bhimasena with arrows steeped in oil, the Kauravas, exercised with rage in that battle, covered Sahadeva with showers of arrows like clouds accompanied with lightnings pursing rain on a mountain breast.

data.v: ततोऽस्यापततः शूरः सहदेवः प्रतापवान् । उलूकस्य महाराज भल्लेनापाहरच्छिरः ॥
data.md: The heroic and brave Sahadeva then, O king, cut off, with a broad-headed arrow, the head of Uluka as the latter proceeded against him.

data.md: Killed by Sahadeva, Uluka, cheering the Pandavas in that battle, dropped down on the earth from his car, covered with blood.

data.md: Seeing his son slain, Shakuni, O Bharata, with voice suppressed in tears and sighing heavily, recollected the words of Vidura.

data.v: चिन्तयित्वा मुहूर्तं स बाष्पपूर्णेक्षणः श्वसन् । सहदेवं समासाद्य त्रिभिर्विव्याध सायकैः ॥
data.md: Having thought for a moment with tearful eyes, Shakuni, breathing heavily, approached Sahadeva and struck him with three arrows.

data.v: तानपास्य शरान्मुक्ताञ्शरसंघैः प्रतापवान् । सहदेवो महाराज धनुश्चिच्छेद संयुगे ॥
data.md: Counteracting those arrows shot by Subala's son with another downpour the brave Sahadeva, O king, sundered his antagonist's blow in that battle.

data.v: छिन्ने धनुषि राजेन्द्र शकुनिः सौबलस्तदा । प्रगृह्य विपुलं खड्गं सहदेवाय प्राहिणोत् ॥
data.md: Seeing his bow sundered, O king, Shakuni, the son of Subala, took up a formidable scimitar and discharged it at Sahadeva.

data.v: तमापतन्तं सहसा घोररूपं विशां पते । द्विधा चिच्छेद समरे सौबलस्य हसन्निव ॥
data.md: The latter, however, O king, easily cut off in twain that terrible scimitar of Subala's son as it went towards him in that skirmish.

data.v: असिं दृष्ट्वा द्विधा छिन्नं प्रगृह्य महतीं गदाम् । प्राहिणोत्सहदेवाय सा मोघा न्यपतद्भुवि ॥
data.md: Beholding his sword cut in two parts Shakuni took up a dreadful mace and discharged it at Sahadeva. That mace also dropped down on the earth unsuccessful.

data.v: ततः शक्तिं महाघोरां कालरात्रिमिवोद्यताम् । प्रेषयामास संक्रुद्धः पाण्डवं प्रति सौबलः ॥
data.md: After this, Subala's son, worked up with rage threw at the son of Pandu a dreadful dart resembling an imminent death-night.

data.md: The latter, however, O king, easily cut off in twain that terrible scimitar of Subala's son as it went towards him in that skirmish.

data.md: Seeing that dart unsuccessful and Subala's so possessed by fear, all your soldiers fled away. Subala's son also joined them.

data.md: The Pandavas then, anger for victory, sent up loud war-cries. As regards the Dhartarashtras, almost all of them fled away from the field.

data.v: तान्वै विमनसो दृष्ट्वा माद्रीपुत्रः प्रतापवान् । शरैरनेकसाहस्रैर्वारयामास संयुगे ॥
data.md: Seeing them so dispirited the brave son of Madri, with many thousand arrows, opposed them in that battle.

data.v: ततो गान्धारकैर्गुप्तं पृष्ठैरश्वैर्जये धृतम् । आससाद रणे यान्तं सहदेवोऽथ सौबलम् ॥
data.md: Then Sahadeva attacked Subala's son as the latter, who was still sanguine of success, was flying away guarded by the picked cavalry of the Gandharas.

data.v: स्वमंशमवशिष्टं स संस्मृत्य शकुनिं नृप । रथेन काञ्चनाङ्गेन सहदेवः समभ्ययात् । अधिज्यं बलवत्कृत्वा व्याक्षिपन्सुमहद्धनुः ॥
data.md: Recollecting, O king, that Shakuni, who had to be slain by him, was still alive, Sahadeva, on his car adorned with gold, pursued that warrior.

उवाच चैनं मेधावी निगृह्य स्मारयन्निव । क्षत्रधर्मे स्थितो भूत्वा युध्यस्व पुरुषो भव ॥

data.md: The energetic Sahadeva, having assailed his foes thus, addressed him, recollecting (his past misdeeds), in these words:-"Observing the duties of a Kshatriya, fight with me and show yourself to be a man! data.v: निहतास्ते दुरात्मानो येऽस्मानवहसन्पुरा । दुर्योधनः कुलाङ्गारः शिष्टस्त्वं तस्य मातुलः ॥
अद्य ते विहनिष्यामि क्षुरेणोन्मथितं शिरः । वृक्षात्फलमिवोद्धृत्य लगुडेन प्रमाथिना ॥
एवमुक्त्वा महाराज सहदेवो महाबलः । संक्रुद्धो नरशार्दूलो वेगेनाभिजगाम ह ॥
data.md: Today I shall kill you cutting off your head with a razor-headed arrow like a person plucking a fruit from a tree with a struck." Saying these words, O king, powerful Sahadeva, that foremost of men, filled with anger, rushed against Shakuni.

data.v: अभिगम्य तु दुर्धर्षः सहदेवो युधां पतिः । विकृष्य बलवच्चापं क्रोधेन प्रहसन्निव ॥
data.md: Approaching his enemy, the invincible Sahadeva, that best of warriors, forcibly drawing his bow and as if consuming his enemy with anger.

data.v: शकुनिं दशभिर्विद्ध्वा चतुर्भिश्चास्य वाजिनः । छत्रं ध्वजं धनुश्चास्य छित्त्वा सिंह इवानदत् ॥
data.md: Struck Shakuni with ten arrows and his horses with four. Then cutting off his umbrella and standard and bow, he roared like a lion.

data.v: छिन्नध्वजधनुश्छत्रः सहदेवेन सौबलः । ततो विद्धश्च बहुभिः सर्वमर्मसु सायकैः ॥
data.md: His standard and bow and umbrella being thus cut off by Sahadeva, Subala's son was struck with many arrows in all his vital parts.

data.v: ततो भूयो महाराज सहदेवः प्रतापवान् । शकुनेः प्रेषयामास शरवृष्टिं दुरासदाम् ॥
data.md: Again, O king, the brave Sahadeva discharged at Shakuni an irresistible shower of arrows.

data.v: ततस्तु क्रुद्धः सुबलस्य पुत्रो; माद्रीसुतं सहदेवं विमर्दे । प्रासेन जाम्बूनदभूषणेन; जिघांसुरेकोऽभिपपात शीघ्रम् ॥
data.md: Filled with anger the son of Subala, then single-handed, rushed, impetuously against Sahadeva in that encounter, desirous of killing the latter with lance adorned with gold.

data.v: माद्रीसुतस्तस्य समुद्यतं तं; प्रासं सुवृत्तौ च भुजौ रणाग्रे । भल्लैस्त्रिभिर्युगपत्संचकर्त; ननाद चोच्चैस्तरसाजिमध्ये ॥
data.md: However with three broad-headed arrows, the son of Madri cut off at the same time without losing a moment that uplifted lance as also the two plump arms of his enemy and then sent up a loud war-cry.

data.v: तस्याशुकारी सुसमाहितेन; सुवर्णपुङ्खेन दृढायसेन । भल्लेन सर्वावरणातिगेन; शिरः शरीरात्प्रममाथ भूयः ॥
data.md: The heroic and active Sahadeva then, with a broad-headed arrow made of hard iron, adorned with wings of gold, capable of cutting every arinour and shot with great force and care, cut off from his trunk his enemy's head.

data.v: शरेण कार्तस्वरभूषितेन; दिवाकराभेन सुसंशितेन । हृतोत्तमाङ्गो युधि पाण्डवेन; पपात भूमौ सुबलस्य पुत्रः ॥
data.md: Deprived of head by the son of Pandu with that gold-decked and sharp arrow, effulgent like the Sun, Subala's son dropped down on the earth in that battle.

data.v: स तच्छिरो वेगवता शरेण; सुवर्णपुङ्खेन शिलाशितेन । प्रावेरयत्कुपितः पाण्डुपुत्रो; यत्तत्कुरूणामनयस्य मूलम् ॥
data.md: Indeed, the son of Pandu, worked up with rage, struck off that head which was the root of the evil policy of the Kurus, with that powerful arrow winged with gold and whetted on stone.

data.v: हृतोत्तमाङ्गं शकुनिं समीक्ष्य; भूमौ शयानं रुधिरार्द्रगात्रम् । योधास्त्वदीया भयनष्टसत्त्वा; दिशः प्रजग्मुः प्रगृहीतशस्त्राः ॥
विप्रद्रुताः शुष्कमुखा विसंज्ञा; गाण्डीवघोषेण समाहताश्च । भयार्दिता भग्नरथाश्वनागाः; पदातयश्चैव सधार्तराष्ट्राः ॥
data.md: At that time your sons, with cars, elephants, horse and foot, entirely routed, heard the twang of Gandiva and fled away with dried faces, possessed by fear and senseless.

data.v: ततो रथाच्छकुनिं पातयित्वा; मुदान्विता भारत पाण्डवेयाः । शङ्खान्प्रदध्मुः समरे प्रहृष्टाः; सकेशवाः सैनिकान्हर्षयन्तः ॥
data.md: Having thrown down Shakuni from his car, the Pandavas, were filled with joy. Rejoicing with Keshava amongst them, they blew their conchs in that battle, cheering up their troops.

data.v: तं चापि सर्वे प्रतिपूजयन्तो; हृष्टा ब्रुवाणाः सहदेवमाजौ । दिष्ट्या हतो नैकृतिको दुरात्मा; सहात्मजो वीर रणे त्वयेति ॥
data.md: All of them, gladly worshipped Sahadeva and said-"By good luck, O hero, the wicked Shakuni, that one of evil policy, has, with his son, been killed by you."

data.v: ततः क्रुद्धा महाराज सौबलस्य पदानुगाः । त्यक्त्वा जीवितमाक्रन्दे पाण्डवान्पर्यवारयन् ॥
data.md: Sanjaya said After this, the followers of Subala's son, O king, were worked up with rage. Prepared to sacrifice their lives in that dreadful encounter, they began to oppose the Pandavas.

data.v: तानर्जुनः प्रत्यगृह्णात्सहदेवजये धृतः । भीमसेनश्च तेजस्वी क्रुद्धाशीविषदर्शनः ॥
data.md: Resolved to help Sahadeva in his victory, the energetic Arjuna and Bhimasena, resembling an infuriated venomous serpent, received those warriors.

data.v: शक्त्यृष्टिप्रासहस्तानां सहदेवं जिघांसताम् । संकल्पमकरोन्मोघं गाण्डीवेन धनंजयः ॥
data.md: Sanjaya said With his Gandiva, Dhananjaya baffled the purpose of those unretreating heroes struggling in battle and striking their enemies.

data.v: प्रगृहीतायुधान्बाहून्योधानामभिधावताम् । भल्लैश्चिच्छेद बीभत्सुः शिरांस्यपि हयानपि ॥
data.md: Vibhatsu, with his broad-headed arrows, cut off the horses, the heads and the arms, with weapons in grasp, of those rushing warriors.

data.v: ते हताः प्रत्यपद्यन्त वसुधां विगतासवः । त्वरिता लोकवीरेण प्रहताः सव्यसाचिना ॥
data.md: The powerful horses of those great heroes, struck by Savyasachin, dropped down on the earth, dead.

data.v: ततो दुर्योधनो राजा दृष्ट्वा स्वबलसंक्षयम् । हतशेषान्समानीय क्रुद्धो रथशतान्विभो ॥
कुञ्जरांश्च हयांश्चैव पादातांश्च परंतप । उवाच सहितान्सर्वान्धार्तराष्ट्र इदं वचः ॥
समासाद्य रणे सर्वान्पाण्डवान्ससुहृद्गणान् । पाञ्चाल्यं चापि सबलं हत्वा शीघ्रं निवर्तत ॥
तस्य ते शिरसा गृह्य वचनं युद्धदुर्मदाः । प्रत्युद्ययू रणे पार्थांस्तव पुत्रस्य शासनात् ॥
data.md: Respectfully obeying that mandate, those invincible warriors proceeded once against the Parthas in that battle.

data.v: तानभ्यापततः शीघ्रं हतशेषान्महारणे । शरैराशीविषाकारैः पाण्डवाः समवाकिरन् ॥
data.md: The Pandavas, however, enshrouded with their arrows resembling venomous snakes, all the remnant of the Kaurava army, that thus rushed quickly against them in that dreadful battle. more

data.v: तत्सैन्यं भरतश्रेष्ठ मुहूर्तेन महात्मभिः । अवध्यत रणं प्राप्य त्रातारं नाभ्यविन्दत । प्रतिष्ठमानं तु भयान्नावतिष्ठत दंशितम् ॥
data.md: That army, O Bharata chief, as it came to battle, was in no time killed by those great warriors, for it had no protector.

data.v: अश्वैर्विपरिधावद्भिः सैन्येन रजसा वृते । न प्राज्ञायन्त समरे दिशश्च प्रदिशस्तथा ॥
ततस्तु पाण्डवानीकान्निःसृत्य बहवो जनाः । अभ्यघ्नंस्तावकान्युद्धे मुहूर्तादिव भारत । ततो निःशेषमभवत्तत्सैन्यं तव भारत ॥
अक्षौहिण्यः समेतास्तु तव पुत्रस्य भारत । एकादश हता युद्धे ताः प्रभो पाण्डुसृञ्जयैः ॥
data.md: Eleven Akshauhinis, O Bharata, of troops had been collected for your son. All those O lord, were killed by the Pandus and the Srinjayas.

data.v: तेषु राजसहस्रेषु तावकेषु महात्मसु । एको दुर्योधनो राजन्नदृश्यत भृशं क्षतः ॥
data.md: Amongst those thousands and thousands of great kings belonging to your party, only Duryodhana now, O king, exceedingly mangled, survives.

data.v: ततो वीक्ष्य दिशः सर्वा दृष्ट्वा शून्यां च मेदिनीम् । विहीनः सर्वयोधैश्च पाण्डवान्वीक्ष्य संयुगे ॥
मुदितान्सर्वसिद्धार्थान्नर्दमानान्समन्ततः । बाणशब्दरवांश्चैव श्रुत्वा तेषां महात्मनाम् ॥
दुर्योधनो महाराज कश्मलेनाभिसंवृतः । अपयाने मनश्चक्रे विहीनबलवाहनः ॥
निहते मामके सैन्ये निःशेषे शिबिरे कृते । पाण्डवानां बलं सूत किं नु शेषमभूत्तदा । एतन्मे पृच्छतो ब्रूहि कुशलो ह्यसि संजय ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said When my soldiers were killed and our camp made entirely empty, what was the strength. O Suta, of the remnant the Pandavas army? 1 desire of know this. Therefore, tell me O Sanjaya, for you are a skillful narrator.

data.v: यच्च दुर्योधनो मन्दः कृतवांस्तनयो मम । बलक्षयं तथा दृष्ट्वा स एकः पृथिवीपतिः ॥
data.md: Tell me also, O Sanjaya, that which was done by my son, the wicked Duryodhana, that king of the earth, the sole survivor of so many men, when he saw his army entirely destroyed.

data.v: रथानां द्वे सहस्रे तु सप्त नागशतानि च । पञ्च चाश्वसहस्राणि पत्तीनां च शतं शताः ॥
एतच्छेषमभूद्राजन्पाण्डवानां महद्बलम् । परिगृह्य हि यद्युद्धे धृष्टद्युम्नो व्यवस्थितः ॥
data.md: Sanjaya continued Two thousand cars, hundred elephants, five thousand horse and ten thousand foot-soldiers was the remnant, O king, of the mighty army of the Pandavas. Looking after this army Dhrishtadyumna waited in that battle.

data.v: एकाकी भरतश्रेष्ठ ततो दुर्योधनो नृपः । नापश्यत्समरे कंचित्सहायं रथिनां वरः ॥
data.md: Meanwhile, O chief of the Bharatas, king Duryodhana, that best of car-warriors, did not find a single warrior on his side.

data.v: नर्दमानान्परांश्चैव स्वबलस्य च संक्षयम् । हतं स्वहयमुत्सृज्य प्राङ्मुखः प्राद्रवद्भयात् ॥
data.md: Seeing his enemies roaring aloud and the destruction of his own army, that lord of earth Duryodhana, without a comrade, left off his seven slain horse and fled from the field with face turned eastwards.

data.v: एकादशचमूभर्ता पुत्रो दुर्योधनस्तव । गदामादाय तेजस्वी पदातिः प्रस्थितो ह्रदम् ॥
data.md: That lord of eleven Akshauhinis, viz., the energetic Duryodhana, taking up his mace, fled on foot towards a lake.

data.v: नातिदूरं ततो गत्वा पद्भ्यामेव नराधिपः । सस्मार वचनं क्षत्तुर्धर्मशीलस्य धीमतः ॥
इदं नूनं महाप्राज्ञो विदुरो दृष्टवान्पुरा । महद्वैशसमस्माकं क्षत्रियाणां च संयुगे ॥
एवं विचिन्तयानस्तु प्रविविक्षुर्ह्रदं नृपः । दुःखसंतप्तहृदयो दृष्ट्वा राजन्बलक्षयम् ॥
पाण्डवाश्च महाराज धृष्टद्युम्नपुरोगमाः । अभ्यधावन्त संक्रुद्धास्तव राजन्बलं प्रति ॥
data.md: The Pandavas, O king, with Dhrishtadyumna at their head, worked up with anger, rushed against the residue of your army.

data.v: शक्त्यृष्टिप्रासहस्तानां बलानामभिगर्जताम् । संकल्पमकरोन्मोघं गाण्डीवेन धनंजयः ॥
data.md: Sanjaya said With his Gandiva, Dhananjaya baffled the purpose of those unretreating heroes struggling in battle and striking their enemies.

data.v: तान्हत्वा निशितैर्बाणैः सामात्यान्सह बन्धुभिः । रथे श्वेतहये तिष्ठन्नर्जुनो बह्वशोभत ॥
data.md: Having, with his sharp arrows, killed those troops with allies and relatives, Arjuna, as he stood on his car having white horses yoked to it, shone highly beautiful.

data.v: सुबलस्य हते पुत्रे सवाजिरथकुञ्जरे । महावनमिव छिन्नमभवत्तावकं बलम् ॥
data.md: Upon the death of Subala's on along with horse, cars and elephants, your army looked like a large forest divested by a storm.

data.v: अनेकशतसाहस्रे बले दुर्योधनस्य ह । नान्यो महारथो राजञ्जीवमानो व्यदृश्यत ॥
द्रोणपुत्रादृते वीरात्तथैव कृतवर्मणः । कृपाच्च गौतमाद्राजन्पार्थिवाच्च तवात्मजात् ॥
data.md: In Duryodhana's army then, O monarch, which had many hundred thousands of warriors, not one single car-warrior was alive, save the heroic son of Drona and Kritavarman and Kripa the son of Gotama, the lord of earth viz., your son.

data.v: धृष्टद्युम्नस्तु मां दृष्ट्वा हसन्सात्यकिमब्रवीत् । किमनेन गृहीतेन नानेनार्थोऽस्ति जीवता ॥
data.md: Seeing me, Dhrishtadyumna, laughingly addressed Satyaki, saying-What is the use of seizing the man. We will gain nothing by keeping him alive.

data.v: धृष्टद्युम्नवचः श्रुत्वा शिनेर्नप्ता महारथः । उद्यम्य निशितं खड्गं हन्तुं मामुद्यतस्तदा ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of Dhrishtadyumna, the grandson of Shini, that great car-warrior, raising up his sharp sword, was ready to kill me.

data.v: तमागम्य महाप्राज्ञः कृष्णद्वैपायनोऽब्रवीत् । मुच्यतां संजयो जीवन्न हन्तव्यः कथंचन ॥
data.md: Just at the neck of time the wise Vyasa, coming there, said-Let Sanjaya be sent away alive. On no account he should be killed.

data.v: द्वैपायनवचः श्रुत्वा शिनेर्नप्ता कृताञ्जलिः । ततो मामब्रवीन्मुक्त्वा स्वस्ति संजय साधय ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of Vyasa, the grandson of Shini joined his hands and then setting me free, said to me-Peace to you, O Sanjaya, you may go away.

data.v: अनुज्ञातस्त्वहं तेन न्यस्तवर्मा निरायुधः । प्रातिष्ठं येन नगरं सायाह्ने रुधिरोक्षितः ॥
data.md: Permitted by him, myself then putting off my armour and surrendering my weapons, started in the evening for the city, my limbs covered with blood.

data.v: क्रोशमात्रमपक्रान्तं गदापाणिमवस्थितम् । एकं दुर्योधनं राजन्नपश्यं भृशविक्षतम् ॥
data.md: After I had come about two miles O king I beheld Duryodhana, standing alone, mace in hand and greatly wounded.

data.v: स तु मामश्रुपूर्णाक्षो नाशक्नोदभिवीक्षितुम् । उपप्रैक्षत मां दृष्ट्वा तदा दीनमवस्थितम् ॥
data.md: His eyes were full of tears and, therefore, he could not see me. I stood depressed before him. He saw me but could not recognise me.

data.v: तं चाहमपि शोचन्तं दृष्ट्वैकाकिनमाहवे । मुहूर्तं नाशकं वक्तुं किंचिद्दुःखपरिप्लुतः ॥
data.md: Beholding him standing alone on the field, I also, laden with grief could not speak a single word for some time.

data.v: ततोऽस्मै तदहं सर्वमुक्तवान्ग्रहणं तदा । द्वैपायनप्रसादाच्च जीवतो मोक्षमाहवे ॥
data.md: Then I described to him everything about my own capture and my release by the favour of Vyasa.

data.md: Hearing those words of those active heroes, he answered them, saying-"Let it be so," and remained as before within the waters, having, O lord, turned them solid by his power of illusion.

data.v: ते त्वनुज्ञाप्य राजानं भृशं शोकपरायणाः । जग्मुर्दूरं महाराज कृपप्रभृतयो रथाः ॥
data.md: Those car-warriors, headed by Kripa, filled with grief, took leave of the king and went away to a remote place.

data.v: ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं न्यग्रोधं प्रेक्ष्य मारिष । न्यविशन्त भृशं श्रान्ताश्चिन्तयन्तो नृपं प्रति ॥
data.md: Having proceeded far, they beheld a banian tree under whose shade they stopped, greatly exhausted and exceedingly anxious about the king and thinking thus.

data.v: विष्टभ्य सलिलं सुप्तो धार्तराष्ट्रो महाबलः । पाण्डवाश्चापि संप्राप्तास्तं देशं युद्धमीप्सवः ॥
data.md: "Having solidified the waters of the lake, the powerful son of Dhritarashtra lives at tine bed. The Pandavas have reached there from desire of battle.

data.v: कथं नु युद्धं भविता कथं राजा भविष्यति । कथं नु पाण्डवा राजन्प्रतिपत्स्यन्ति कौरवम् ॥
data.md: How will the battle take place? What will become of the king? How will the Pandavas discover the King?"

data.v: इत्येवं चिन्तयन्तस्ते रथेभ्योऽश्वान्विमुच्य ह । तत्रासां चक्रिरे राजन्कृपप्रभृतयो रथाः ॥
data.md: Thinking of these things, O king, those heroes, viz., Kripa and others, unyoked their horses from their cars and prepared to rest there for some time.

data.v: ततस्तेष्वपयातेषु रथेषु त्रिषु पाण्डवाः । तं ह्रदं प्रत्यपद्यन्त यत्र दुर्योधनोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: Sanjaya said After those three car-warriors had left that place the Pandavas arrived at that lake within which Duryodhana was taking rest.

data.v: आसाद्य च कुरुश्रेष्ठ तदा द्वैपायनह्रदम् । स्तम्भितं धार्तराष्ट्रेण दृष्ट्वा तं सलिलाशयम् । वासुदेवमिदं वाक्यमब्रवीत्कुरुनन्दनः ॥
data.md: Having arrived at the banks of the Dvaipayana lake, O best of Kuru's race, they saw that reservoir of waters enchanted by your son. Then Yudhishthira said to Vasudeva.

data.v: पश्येमां धार्तराष्ट्रेण मायामप्सु प्रयोजिताम् । विष्टभ्य सलिलं शेते नास्य मानुषतो भयम् ॥
data.md: "Behold, the son of Dhritarashtra has enchanted these waters by his power of illusion. Having enchanted the waters, he lives within them. He entertains no fear of injury from man.

data.v: दैवीं मायामिमां कृत्वा सलिलान्तर्गतो ह्ययम् । निकृत्या निकृतिप्रज्ञो न मे जीवन्विमोक्ष्यते ॥
data.md: Having exercised his power of illusion he is now within the waters. By an act of deception, that deceiptful man has betaken to this refuge. He shall not however escape me alive.

data.v: यद्यस्य समरे साह्यं कुरुते वज्रभृत्स्वयम् । तथाप्येनं हतं युद्धे लोको द्रक्ष्यति माधव ॥
data.md: Even if the holder of the thunderbolt himself helps him in battle, people, O Mahadeva, shall yet seen him killed today.”

data.v: मायाविन इमां मायां मायया जहि भारत । मायावी मायया वध्यः सत्यमेतद्युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said With your own power of illusion, O Bharata, destroy this illusion of Duryodhana who is an expert in it. One conversant with illusion should be killed with illusion. This indeed is the truth, O Yudhishthira.

data.v: क्रियाभ्युपायैर्बहुलैर्मायामप्सु प्रयोज्य ह । जहि त्वं भरतश्रेष्ठ पापात्मानं सुयोधनम् ॥
data.md: By applying your power of illusion to these waters kill, O chief of the Bharatas, this Suyodhana who is the master of illusion.

data.v: क्रियाभ्युपायैरिन्द्रेण निहता दैत्यदानवाः । क्रियाभ्युपायैर्बहुभिर्बलिर्बद्धो महात्मना ॥
data.md: By his illusory power Indra himself killed the Daityas and the Danavas. Vali himself was bound by that great one. viz., Upendra, with the aid of his illusory power.

data.v: क्रियाभ्युपायैः पूर्वं हि हिरण्याक्षो महासुरः । हिरण्यकशिपुश्चैव क्रिययैव निषूदितौ । वृत्रश्च निहतो राजन्क्रिययैव न संशयः ॥
data.md: The great Asura Hiranyaksha, as also that one, viz., Hiranyakashipu, was killed by the same power. Forsooth, O king, Vritra also was slain by the power of illusion.

data.v: तथा पौलस्त्यतनयो रावणो नाम राक्षसः । रामेण निहतो राजन्सानुबन्धः सहानुगः । क्रियया योगमास्थाय तथा त्वमपि विक्रम ॥
data.md: Similarly was the Rakshasa Ravana of Pulastya's race, with his relatives and followers, killed by Rama. Relying upon your illusory power do you also display your prowess.

data.v: क्रियाभ्युपायैर्निहतो मया राजन्पुरातने । तारकश्च महादैत्यो विप्रचित्तिश्च वीर्यवान् ॥
data.md: Those two highly energetic and ancient Daityas, viz., Taraka and Viprachitti were, in ancient time, O king, slain by the help of illusion.

data.v: वातापिरिल्वलश्चैव त्रिशिराश्च तथा विभो । सुन्दोपसुन्दावसुरौ क्रिययैव निषूदितौ ॥
data.md: Likewise Vatapi and Ilwala and Trishiras, O lord and the Asuras Sunda and Upasunda were all killed by the aid of illusion.

data.v: क्रियाभ्युपायैरिन्द्रेण त्रिदिवं भुज्यते विभो । क्रिया बलवती राजन्नान्यत्किंचिद्युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Indra himself enjoys heaven by the power of illusion. Action is very efficacious O king and nothing else is so, O Yudhishthira.

data.v: दैत्याश्च दानवाश्चैव राक्षसाः पार्थिवास्तथा । क्रियाभ्युपायैर्निहताः क्रियां तस्मात्समाचर ॥
data.md: Daityas and Danavas and Rakshasas and king have been slain by the same. Do you, therefore, act.'

data.v: इत्युक्तो वासुदेवेन पाण्डवः संशितव्रतः । जलस्थं तं महाराज तव पुत्रं महाबलम् । अभ्यभाषत कौन्तेयः प्रहसन्निव भारत ॥
data.md: Sanjaya continued Thus addressed by Vasudeva, Pandu's son of rigid vows, smilingly addressed, O Monarch, your powerful son who, O Bharata, was then within the waters of that lake, saying.

data.v: सुयोधन किमर्थोऽयमारम्भोऽप्सु कृतस्त्वया । सर्वं क्षत्रं घातयित्वा स्वकुलं च विशां पते ॥
data.md: "Why, O Suyodhana, have you charined these waters, after having caused all the Kshatriyas to die and after having, O king, brought about the extinction of your family?

data.v: जलाशयं प्रविष्टोऽद्य वाञ्छञ्जीवितमात्मनः । उत्तिष्ठ राजन्युध्यस्व सहास्माभिः सुयोधन ॥
data.md: Why have you entered into this lake today, with a view to save your own life? Arise, O king and fight us, O Suyodhana.

data.v: स च दर्पो नरश्रेष्ठ स च मानः क्व ते गतः । यस्त्वं संस्तभ्य सलिलं भीतो राजन्व्यवस्थितः ॥
data.md: Where, O best of men, has your sense of honour now gone, since, ( king, you have exchanged these waters and are now lying within them?

data.v: सर्वे त्वां शूर इत्येव जना जल्पन्ति संसदि । व्यर्थं तद्भवतो मन्ये शौर्यं सलिलशायिनः ॥
data.md: All men describe you in assemblies as a hero. All that, however, is entirely false, I think, since you are now living concealed within these waters.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठ राजन्युध्यस्व क्षत्रियोऽसि कुलोद्भवः । कौरवेयो विशेषेण कुले जन्म च संस्मर ॥
data.md: Arise, O king and fight, for you are a Kshatriya born in a noble family. You are a Kaurava. Remember your birth.

data.v: स कथं कौरवे वंशे प्रशंसञ्जन्म चात्मनः । युद्धाद्भीतस्ततस्तोयं प्रविश्य प्रतितिष्ठसि ॥
data.md: How do you boast of your birth in Kuru's family, when you have concealed yourself within the depths of this lake, having fled away from battle in fear?

data.v: अयुद्धमव्यवस्थानं नैष धर्मः सनातनः । अनार्यजुष्टमस्वर्ग्यं रणे राजन्पलायनम् ॥
data.md: This is no the duty of a Kshatriya. Flight from battle, O king, is not the practice of honourable men, nor it leads to heaven.

data.v: कथं पारमगत्वा हि युद्धे त्वं वै जिजीविषुः । इमान्निपतितान्दृष्ट्वा पुत्रान्भ्रातॄन्पितॄंस्तथा ॥
data.md: How is it that without having terminated this war, though you were filled with the desire of victory, you live now within this lake, after having brought about the destruction of your sons and brothers and sires and relatives and friends and maternal uncles and kinsmen.

data.v: संबन्धिनो वयस्यांश्च मातुलान्बान्धवांस्तथा । घातयित्वा कथं तात ह्रदे तिष्ठसि सांप्रतम् ॥
शूरमानी न शूरस्त्वं मिथ्या वदसि भारत । शूरोऽहमिति दुर्बुद्धे सर्वलोकस्य शृण्वतः ॥
data.md: Though always vaunting of your courage, you are however, not a hero. Falsely you describe yourself, O Bharata, before all men as a hero, O wicked wight.

data.v: न हि शूराः पलायन्ते शत्रून्दृष्ट्वा कथंचन । ब्रूहि वा त्वं यया धृत्या शूर त्यजसि संगरम् ॥
data.md: They, that are heroes, never fly away from their foes. Or tell us, O hero, about the nature of that courage by which you have fled from battle.

data.v: स त्वमुत्तिष्ठ युध्यस्व विनीय भयमात्मनः । घातयित्वा सर्वसैन्यं भ्रातॄंश्चैव सुयोधन ॥
data.md: Arise, O prince and fight fearlessly. Having caused all your troops and brothers to be killed O Suyodhana, you should not, if you are an honest man, think now of saving your life. A Kshatriya, O Suyodhana, like yourself, should not act in this way.

data.v: नेदानीं जीविते बुद्धिः कार्या धर्मचिकीर्षया । क्षत्रधर्ममपाश्रित्य त्वद्विधेन सुयोधन ॥
data.md: Arise, O prince and fight fearlessly. Having caused all your troops and brothers to be killed O Suyodhana, you should not, if you are an honest man, think now of saving your life. A Kshatriya, O Suyodhana, like yourself, should not act in this way.

data.v: यत्तत्कर्णमुपाश्रित्य शकुनिं चापि सौबलम् । अमर्त्य इव संमोहात्त्वमात्मानं न बुद्धवान् ॥
data.md: Relying upon Karna as also upon Shakuni the son of Şubala, you considered yourself immortal and could not understand your own self.

data.v: तत्पापं सुमहत्कृत्वा प्रतियुध्यस्व भारत । कथं हि त्वद्विधो मोहाद्रोचयेत पलायनम् ॥
data.md: Having committed such a grievous iniquity fight now, O Bharata. How is it that you prefer flight from the field. Surely, you forget yourself.

data.v: क्व ते तत्पौरुषं यातं क्व च मानः सुयोधन । क्व च विक्रान्तता याता क्व च विस्फूर्जितं महत् ॥
data.md: Where is that manliness of yours, O sire and where, O Suyodhana, is that your pride? Where is your prowess and energy gone?

data.v: क्व ते कृतास्त्रता याता किं च शेषे जलाशये । स त्वमुत्तिष्ठ युध्यस्व क्षत्रधर्मेण भारत ॥
data.md: Where is that your mastery in weapons? Why do you live within this lake now? Arise, O Bharata and fight, following the duties of a Kshatriya.

data.v: अस्मान्वा त्वं पराजित्य प्रशाधि पृथिवीमिमाम् । अथ वा निहतोऽस्माभिर्भूमौ स्वप्स्यसि भारत ॥
data.md: Either govern the wide carth after defeating us or sleep, O Bharata, on the naked earth slain by us.

data.v: एष ते प्रथमो धर्मः सृष्टो धात्रा महात्मना । तं कुरुष्व यथातथ्यं राजा भव महारथ ॥
data.md: Even this is your highest duty, as laid down by the illustrious Creator himself. Act according to the injunctions of the scriptures and be a king, O great car-warrior.

data.v: नैतच्चित्रं महाराज यद्भीः प्राणिनमाविशेत् । न च प्राणभयाद्भीतो व्यपयातोऽस्मि भारत ॥
data.md: Duryodhana said It is not at all surprising O king, that fear should possess the hearts of living creatures. As regards myself, however, O Bharata, I have not fled from the field of battle for the fear of life.

data.v: अरथश्चानिषङ्गी च निहतः पार्ष्णिसारथिः । एकश्चाप्यगणः संख्ये प्रत्याश्वासमरोचयम् ॥
data.md: My car and quivers were destroyed and my Parshni drivers were slain. I was alone, without a single follower to help me in battle. It was for this that I wanted a little rest.

data.v: न प्राणहेतोर्न भयान्न विषादाद्विशां पते । इदमम्भः प्रविष्टोऽस्मि श्रमात्त्विदमनुष्ठितम् ॥
data.md: It was not for the sake of saving my life, it was not for fear, it was not from grief, O king, that I entered this lake. It was only out of fatigue that I did so.

data.v: त्वं चाश्वसिहि कौन्तेय ये चाप्यनुगतास्तव । अहमुत्थाय वः सर्वान्प्रतियोत्स्यामि संयुगे ॥
data.md: Do you, O son of Kunti, take a little rest with your followers. Rising from this lake I will surely fight all of you in battle.

data.v: आश्वस्ता एव सर्वे स्म चिरं त्वां मृगयामहे । तदिदानीं समुत्तिष्ठ युध्यस्वेह सुयोधन ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said All of us have taken enough of rest. We searched you for a long while. Rise then now, O Suyodhana and give us battle.

data.v: हत्वा वा समरे पार्थान्स्फीतं राज्यमवाप्नुहि । निहतो वा रणेऽस्माभिर्वीरलोकमवाप्स्यसि ॥
data.md: Either killing the Parthas in battle make this prosperous kingdom your own or killed be us in battle go to the region reserved for heroes.

data.v: यदर्थं राज्यमिच्छामि कुरूणां कुरुनन्दन । त इमे निहताः सर्वे भ्रातरो मे जनेश्वर ॥
data.md: Duryodhana said The Kurus, O son of Kuru's race, for whose sake I desired sovereignty, those brothers of mine, O king, all lie dead on the field.

data.v: क्षीणरत्नां च पृथिवीं हतक्षत्रियपुंगवाम् । नाभ्युत्सहाम्यहं भोक्तुं विधवामिव योषितम् ॥
data.md: I do not like to enjoy and longer the Earth that does not contain wealth and best of Kshatriyas and that has accordingly become like a widow.

data.v: अद्यापि त्वहमाशंसे त्वां विजेतुं युधिष्ठिर । भङ्क्त्वा पाञ्चालपाण्डूनामुत्साहं भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: I, however, still hope to defeat you, O Yudhishthira, after checking the pride, O foremost of Bharata's race, of the Panchalas and the Pandus.

data.v: न त्विदानीमहं मन्ये कार्यं युद्धेन कर्हिचित् । द्रोणे कर्णे च संशान्ते निहते च पितामहे ॥
data.md: There is, however, no longer any need for battle when Drona and Karna have been killed and when our grandfather Bhishma has been slain.

data.v: अस्त्विदानीमियं राजन्केवला पृथिवी तव । असहायो हि को राजा राज्यमिच्छेत्प्रशासितुम् ॥
data.md: This empty Earth, O king, is now intended for you. What king would like to rule a kingdom divested of friends and allies?

data.v: सुहृदस्तादृशान्हित्वा पुत्रान्भ्रातॄन्पितॄनपि । भवद्भिश्च हृते राज्ये को नु जीवेत मादृशः ॥
data.md: Shorn of friends, deprived of sons and brothers and seeing his kingdom taken by the Pandavas who is there like me that would desire to live.

data.v: अहं वनं गमिष्यामि ह्यजिनैः प्रतिवासितः । रतिर्हि नास्ति मे राज्ये हतपक्षस्य भारत ॥
data.md: Clad in deer-skins I would enter into woods. I have no desire for kingdom, shorn as I am of friends and allies, O Bharata.

data.v: हतबान्धवभूयिष्ठा हताश्वा हतकुञ्जरा । एषा ते पृथिवी राजन्भुङ्क्ष्वैनां विगतज्वरः ॥
data.md: Deprived entirely of friends and allies, of horses and elephants, this Earth exists for you, O king. Do you enjoy her now cheerfully.

data.v: वनमेव गमिष्यामि वसानो मृगचर्मणी । न हि मे निर्जितस्यास्ति जीवितेऽद्य स्पृहा विभो ॥
data.md: As for myself, clad in deer-skins, I shall go to the forest. Friendless, as I am, I have no desire, O king, for even life.

data.v: गच्छ त्वं भुङ्क्ष्व राजेन्द्र पृथिवीं निहतेश्वराम् । हतयोधां नष्टरत्नां क्षीणवप्रां यथासुखम् ॥
data.md: Go, O king and rule the Earth destitute of kings, warriors, wcalth and without citadels, as you like.
