data.v: भ्रातरस्ते हताः शूराः पुत्राश्च सहसैनिकाः । राजानश्च हताः शूराः समरेष्वनिवर्तिनः ॥
data.md: Your heroic brothers and sons, with all your troops, have been killed. Other heroic kings also, who never retreated from battle, have been killed.

data.v: एते चान्ये च निहता बहवः क्षत्रियर्षभाः । प्रातिकामी तथा पापो द्रौपद्याः क्लेशकृद्धतः ॥
data.md: These and many other leading Kshatriyas, as also Pratikamin, that wretch who had seized the locks of Draupadi, have been killed.

data.v: अवशिष्टस्त्वमेवैकः कुलघ्नोऽधमपूरुषः । त्वामप्यद्य हनिष्यामि गदया नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: You alone are still alive, O destroyer of your family, O wretch among men. I shall forsooth kill you today with my mace.

data.v: अद्य तेऽहं रणे दर्पं सर्वं नाशयिता नृप । राज्याशां विपुलां राजन्पाण्डवेषु च दुष्कृतम् ॥
data.md: Today, O king, I shall, in battle, repress all your pride. I shall destroy also your hope of sovereignty, O king and pay off all your misdeeds to the sons of Pandu.

data.v: किं कत्थितेन बहुधा युध्यस्वाद्य मया सह । अद्य तेऽहं विनेष्यामि युद्धश्रद्धां वृकोदर ॥
data.md: Duryodhana said What is the use of speaking too much? Fight now with me. Today O Vrikodara, I shall subdue you desire for battle.

data.v: किं न पश्यसि मां पाप गदायुद्धे व्यवस्थितम् । हिमवच्छिखराकारां प्रगृह्य महतीं गदाम् ॥
data.md: Why do you not see me, O wretch, standing here for an encounter with the mace? Am I not armed with a formidable mace that looks like a summit of Himavat?

data.v: गदिनं कोऽद्य मां पाप जेतुमुत्सहते रिपुः । न्यायतो युध्यमानस्य देवेष्वपि पुरंदरः ॥
data.md: What enemy is there, O wretch, that would dare defeat me armed with this weapon? If it be a fair fight, Purandara himself, amongst the celestials, is not capable of doing it.

data.v: मा वृथा गर्ज कौन्तेय शारदाभ्रमिवाजलम् । दर्शयस्व बलं युद्धे यावत्तत्तेऽद्य विद्यते ॥
data.md: Do not, O son of Kunti, roar uselessly in this way like autumnal clouds shorn of water. Display all the strength you posses in battle now.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा पाञ्चालाः सहसृञ्जयाः । सर्वे संपूजयामासुस्तद्वचो विजिगीषवः ॥
data.md: Hearing those words of his, the Pandavas with the Srinjayas, all filled with desire of victory, praised them highly.

data.v: तं मत्तमिव मातङ्गं तलशब्देन मानवाः । भूयः संहर्षयामासू राजन्दुर्योधनं नृपम् ॥
data.md: Like men exciting an infuriate elephant with the clapping of hands, all of them then pleased king Duryodhana.

data.v: बृंहन्ति कुञ्जरास्तत्र हया हेषन्ति चासकृत् । शस्त्राणि संप्रदीप्यन्ते पाण्डवानां जयैषिणाम् ॥
data.md: The elephants began to grunt and the horses to neigh repeatedly. The weapons of the Pandavas who were filled with the desire of victory shone there. The elephants began to grunt and the horses to neigh repeatedly. The weapons of the Pandavas who were filled with the desire of victory shone there.

data.v: तस्मिन्युद्धे महाराज संप्रवृत्ते सुदारुणे । उपविष्टेषु सर्वेषु पाण्डवेषु महात्मसु ॥
data.md: Sanjaya said When that fierce encounter O king, was about to take place and when all the great Pandavas had taken their seats indeed, having heard that a battle, between those two heroes, both of whom were his disciples, was about to begin, Rama, whose banner bore the emblem of the palmyra palm and who had the plough for his weapon, came there.

data.v: ततस्तालध्वजो रामस्तयोर्युद्ध उपस्थिते । श्रुत्वा तच्छिष्ययो राजन्नाजगाम हलायुधः ॥
data.md: Sanjaya said When that fierce encounter O king, was about to take place and when all the great Pandavas had taken their seats indeed, having heard that a battle, between those two heroes, both of whom were his disciples, was about to begin, Rama, whose banner bore the emblem of the palmyra palm and who had the plough for his weapon, came there.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा परमप्रीताः पूजयित्वा नराधिपाः । शिष्ययोः कौशलं युद्धे पश्य रामेति चाब्रुवन् ॥
data.md: After adoring him, they then, O king said to him these words-"Witness, O Rama, the skill in battle of your two disciples.”

data.v: अब्रवीच्च तदा रामो दृष्ट्वा कृष्णं च पाण्डवम् । दुर्योधनं च कौरव्यं गदापाणिमवस्थितम् ॥
चत्वारिंशदहान्यद्य द्वे च मे निःसृतस्य वै । पुष्येण संप्रयातोऽस्मि श्रवणे पुनरागतः । शिष्ययोर्वै गदायुद्धं द्रष्टुकामोऽस्मि माधव ॥
data.md: Looking at Krishna and the Pandavas and also at Duryodhana of Kuru's race who was standing there armed with mace, Rama then said-"Two and forty days have passed since I left home. I had set out under the constellation Pushya and have come back under Shravana. I am desirous, O Madhava, of witnessing this encounter with the mace between these two disciples of mine."

data.v: ततो युधिष्ठिरो राजा परिष्वज्य हलायुधम् । स्वागतं कुशलं चास्मै पर्यपृच्छद्यथातथम् ॥
data.md: Embracing him who had the plough for his weapon, king Yudhishthira, duly enquired about his welfare and welcomed him.

data.v: कृष्णौ चापि महेष्वासावभिवाद्य हलायुधम् । सस्वजाते परिप्रीतौ प्रियमाणौ यशस्विनौ ॥
data.md: Those great bowmen, viz., viz., the illustrious Krishnas, filled with joy, cheerfully saluted the hero who had the plough for his weapon and embraced him.

data.v: माद्रीपुत्रौ तथा शूरौ द्रौपद्याः पञ्च चात्मजाः । अभिवाद्य स्थिता राजन्रौहिणेयं महाबलम् ॥
data.md: Similarly the two sons of Madri and the five sons of Draupadi saluted Rohini's powerful son and stood at a respectful distance.

data.v: भीमसेनोऽथ बलवान्पुत्रस्तव जनाधिप । तथैव चोद्यतगदौ पूजयामासतुर्बलम् ॥
data.md: Bhimasena of great strength and your son, O monarch, both with uplifted maces in their arms, adored Baladeva.

data.v: स्वागतेन च ते तत्र प्रतिपूज्य पुनः पुनः । पश्य युद्धं महाबाहो इति ते राममब्रुवन् । एवमूचुर्महात्मानं रौहिणेयं नराधिपाः ॥
data.md: The other kings honored him by welcoming him and then all of them said to Rama "Witness this encounter, O you of mighty arms.”—Even thus those mighty car-warriors said to the high-souled son of Rohini.

data.v: परिष्वज्य तदा रामः पाण्डवान्सृञ्जयानपि । अपृच्छत्कुशलं सर्वान्पाण्डवांश्चामितौजसः । तथैव ते समासाद्य पप्रच्छुस्तमनामयम् ॥
data.md: The highly energetic Rama, having embraced the Pandavas and the Srinjayas, enquired after the welfare of all the other kings. Likewise all of them, approaching him, enquired after his welfare.

data.v: प्रत्यभ्यर्च्य हली सर्वान्क्षत्रियांश्च महामनाः । कृत्वा कुशलसंयुक्तां संविदं च यथावयः ॥
data.md: Having in return saluted all the great Kshatriyas and having made courteous inquiries about 'each according to their age, that heroe affectionately embraced Janarddana and Satyaki. Smelling their heads, he enquired after their welfare.

data.v: जनार्दनं सात्यकिं च प्रेम्णा स परिषस्वजे । मूर्ध्नि चैतावुपाघ्राय कुशलं पर्यपृच्छत ॥
data.md: Having in return saluted all the great Kshatriyas and having made courteous inquiries about 'each according to their age, that heroe affectionately embraced Janarddana and Satyaki. Smelling their heads, he enquired after their welfare.

data.v: तौ चैनं विधिवद्राजन्पूजयामासतुर्गुरुम् । ब्रह्माणमिव देवेशमिन्द्रोपेन्द्रौ मुदा युतौ ॥
data.md: Those two in return, O king, duly adored him, their superior, with great pleasure, like Indra and Upendra adoring Brahma the king of the celestials.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीद्धर्मसुतो रौहिणेयमरिंदमम् । इदं भ्रात्रोर्महायुद्धं पश्य रामेति भारत ॥
data.md: Then Dharma's son, O Bharata, said to that chastiser of foes, viz., the son of Rohini "Witness, O Rama, this dreadful encounter between the two brothers."

data.v: तेषां मध्ये महाबाहुः श्रीमान्केशवपूर्वजः । न्यविशत्परमप्रीतः पूज्यमानो महारथैः ॥
data.md: Thus adored by those great car-warriors, the mighty-armed elder brother of Keshava, of great beauty, took his seat amongst them.

data.v: स बभौ राजमध्यस्थो नीलवासाः सितप्रभः । दिवीव नक्षत्रगणैः परिकीर्णो निशाकरः ॥
data.md: Clad in blue robes and possessed of a fair complexion, Rama, as he sat midst those kings shone like the Moon in the sky encircled by a number of stars.

data.v: ततस्तयोः संनिपातस्तुमुलो रोमहर्षणः । आसीदन्तकरो राजन्वैरस्य तव पुत्रयोः ॥
data.md: Then that dreadful and hair-standing encounter took place between those two sons of yours O king, for terminating the long standing feud.

data.v: पूर्वमेव यदा रामस्तस्मिन्युद्ध उपस्थिते । आमन्त्र्य केशवं यातो वृष्णिभिः सहितः प्रभुः ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said On the eye the great battle (between the Kurus and the Pandus) Rama, with Keshava's permission, had left Dwaraka accompanied by many of the Vrishnis.

data.v: साहाय्यं धार्तराष्ट्रस्य न च कर्तास्मि केशव । न चैव पाण्डुपुत्राणां गमिष्यामि यथागतम् ॥
data.md: He had said to Keshava-"I will help neither the son of Dhritarashtra nor the sons of Pandu, but will go wherever I like."

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तदा रामो यातः शत्रुनिबर्हणः । तस्य चागमनं भूयो ब्रह्मञ्शंसितुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Having said so, Rama that subduer of enemies, had gone away. O Brahmana, tell me everything about his return.

data.v: आख्याहि मे विस्तरतः कथं राम उपस्थितः । कथं च दृष्टवान्युद्धं कुशलो ह्यसि सत्तम ॥
data.md: Tell me in full how Rama came there and how he witnessed the battle. Indeed you are a skillful narrator.

data.v: उपप्लव्ये निविष्टेषु पाण्डवेषु महात्मसु । प्रेषितो धृतराष्ट्रस्य समीपं मधुसूदनः । शमं प्रति महाबाहो हितार्थं सर्वदेहिनाम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said After the great Pandavas had taken up their post at Upaplavya, they sent Krishna to Dhritarashtra for the object of peace, O mighty-armed one and for the behoof of all creatures.

data.v: स गत्वा हास्तिनपुरं धृतराष्ट्रं समेत्य च । उक्तवान्वचनं तथ्यं हितं चैव विशेषतः । न च तत्कृतवान्राजा यथाख्यातं हि ते पुरा ॥
data.md: Having gone to Hastinapura and met Dhritarashtra, Keshava spoke whole-some and sincere words.

data.v: अनवाप्य शमं तत्र कृष्णः पुरुषसत्तमः । आगच्छत महाबाहुरुपप्लव्यं जनाधिप ॥
data.md: The king, however, as I have told you before did not pay heed to his advice. Unable to secure peace, the mighty-armed Krishna, The foremost of men, returned, O king, to Upaplavya.

data.v: ततः प्रत्यागतः कृष्णो धार्तराष्ट्रविसर्जितः । अक्रियायां नरव्याघ्र पाण्डवानिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Dismissed by Dhritarashtra's son Krishna came back and upon the failure of his mission, O foremost of kings, said to the Pandavas.

data.v: न कुर्वन्ति वचो मह्यं कुरवः कालचोदिताः । निर्गच्छध्वं पाण्डवेयाः पुष्येण सहिता मया ॥
data.md: Urged by fate, the Kauravas have disregarded my words. Come, O sons of Pandu, with me, under the constellation Pushya.

data.v: ततो विभज्यमानेषु बलेषु बलिनां वरः । प्रोवाच भ्रातरं कृष्णं रौहिणेयो महामनाः ॥
data.md: After this, while the troops of both parties were being collected and arrayed, the great son of Rohini, that foremost of all powerful persons, said to his brother Krishna.

data.v: तेषामपि महाबाहो साहाय्यं मधुसूदन । क्रियतामिति तत्कृष्णो नास्य चक्रे वचस्तदा ॥
data.md: "O mighty-armed one, O slayer of Madhu, let us help the Kurus.” Krishna, however, did not pay heed to those words of his.

data.v: ततो मन्युपरीतात्मा जगाम यदुनन्दनः । तीर्थयात्रां हलधरः सरस्वत्यां महायशाः । मैत्रे नक्षत्रयोगे स्म सहितः सर्वयादवैः ॥
data.md: Enraged at this, that illustrious son of Yadu's race, viz., the wielder of the plough, then started on a pilgrimage of the Sarasvati.

data.v: आश्रयामास भोजस्तु दुर्योधनमरिंदमः । युयुधानेन सहितो वासुदेवस्तु पाण्डवान् ॥
data.md: Accompanied by all the Yadavas, he set out under the conjunction of the asterism called Maitra. The Bhoja chief (Kritavarman), however, took the side O Duryodhana. Accompanied by Yuyudhana, Vasudeva took that of the Pandavas.

data.v: रौहिणेये गते शूरे पुष्येण मधुसूदनः । पाण्डवेयान्पुरस्कृत्य ययावभिमुखः कुरून् ॥
data.md: After the heroic son of Rohini had started under the constellation Pushya, the slayer of Madhu, placing the Pandavas in his van, went against the Kurus.

data.v: गच्छन्नेव पथिस्थस्तु रामः प्रेष्यानुवाच ह । संभारांस्तीर्थयात्रायां सर्वोपकरणानि च । आनयध्वं द्वारकाया अग्नीन्वै याजकांस्तथा ॥
data.md: While proceeding, Rama ordered his servants on the way, saying-"Bring all the necessary articles of use for a pilgrimage. Bring the sacred fire that is at Dwaraka and our priests.

data.v: सुवर्णं रजतं चैव धेनूर्वासांसि वाजिनः । कुञ्जरांश्च रथांश्चैव खरोष्ट्रं वाहनानि च । क्षिप्रमानीयतां सर्वं तीर्थहेतोः परिच्छदम् ॥
data.md: Bring gold, silver, kine, robes, horses, elephants, cars, mules, camels and other beasts of burden.

data.v: प्रतिस्रोतः सरस्वत्या गच्छध्वं शीघ्रगामिनः । ऋत्विजश्चानयध्वं वै शतशश्च द्विजर्षभान् ॥
एवं संदिश्य तु प्रेष्यान्बलदेवो महाबलः । तीर्थयात्रां ययौ राजन्कुरूणां वैशसे तदा । सरस्वतीं प्रतिस्रोतः समुद्रादभिजग्मिवान् ॥
ऋत्विग्भिश्च सुहृद्भिश्च तथान्यैर्द्विजसत्तमैः । रथैर्गजैस्तथाश्वैश्च प्रेष्यैश्च भरतर्षभ । गोखरोष्ट्रप्रयुक्तैश्च यानैश्च बहुभिर्वृतः ॥
श्रान्तानां क्लान्तवपुषां शिशूनां विपुलायुषाम् । तानि यानानि देशेषु प्रतीक्ष्यन्ते स्म भारत । बुभुक्षितानामर्थाय कॢप्तमन्नं समन्ततः ॥
यो यो यत्र द्विजो भोक्तुं कामं कामयते तदा । तस्य तस्य तु तत्रैवमुपजह्रुस्तदा नृप ॥
तत्र स्थिता नरा राजन्रौहिणेयस्य शासनात् । भक्ष्यपेयस्य कुर्वन्ति राशींस्तत्र समन्ततः ॥
data.md: Costly garments and bedsteads and coverlets were distributed amongst the Brahmanas desirous of ease and comfort. Whatever a Brahmana or Kshatriya wanted, it was given to him.

data.v: वासांसि च महार्हाणि पर्यङ्कास्तरणानि च । पूजार्थं तत्र कॢप्तानि विप्राणां सुखमिच्छताम् ॥
यत्र यः स्वपते विप्रः क्षत्रियो वापि भारत । तत्र तत्र तु तस्यैव सर्वं कॢप्तमदृश्यत ॥
यथासुखं जनः सर्वस्तिष्ठते याति वा तदा । यातुकामस्य यानानि पानानि तृषितस्य च ॥
बुभुक्षितस्य चान्नानि स्वादूनि भरतर्षभ । उपजह्रुर्नरास्तत्र वस्त्राण्याभरणानि च ॥
स पन्थाः प्रबभौ राजन्सर्वस्यैव सुखावहः । स्वर्गोपमस्तदा वीर नराणां तत्र गच्छताम् ॥
data.md: The road, O king, along which the party proceeded, looked resplendent, was comfortable for all and resembled heaven itself.

data.v: नित्यप्रमुदितोपेतः स्वादुभक्षः शुभान्वितः । विपण्यापणपण्यानां नानाजनशतैर्वृतः । नानाद्रुमलतोपेतो नानारत्नविभूषितः ॥
data.md: There were rejoicings everywhere and rich food was procurable everywhere. There were shops and stalls and various objects were kept there for sale. The entire way was thronged with human beings. And it was decorated with various kinds of trees and creatures and various kinds of gems.

data.v: ततो महात्मा नियमे स्थितात्मा; पुण्येषु तीर्थेषु वसूनि राजन् । ददौ द्विजेभ्यः क्रतुदक्षिणाश्च; यदुप्रवीरो हलभृत्प्रतीतः ॥
दोग्ध्रीश्च धेनूश्च सहस्रशो वै; सुवाससः काञ्चनबद्धशृङ्गीः । हयांश्च नानाविधदेशजाता;न्यानानि दासीश्च तथा द्विजेभ्यः ॥
data.md: That chief of Yadu's race also distributed thousands of milch kine covered with excellent cloths and having their horns coated with gold, many horses born in different countries, many vehicles and many beautiful slaves.

data.v: रत्नानि मुक्तामणिविद्रुमं च; शृङ्गीसुवर्णं रजतं च शुभ्रम् । अयस्मयं ताम्रमयं च भाण्डं; ददौ द्विजातिप्रवरेषु रामः ॥
data.md: Balarama also distributed to the foremost of the Brahmanas, the gems, garlands, diamonds, pure gold and silver and utensil made of iron copper.

data.v: एवं स वित्तं प्रददौ महात्मा; सरस्वतीतीर्थवरेषु भूरि । ययौ क्रमेणाप्रतिमप्रभाव;स्ततः कुरुक्षेत्रमुदारवृत्तः ॥
data.md: Thus did the great Rama distribute wealth in various sacred shrines on the Sarasvati. In course of his travels, that noble hero of matchless power at last came to Kurukshetra.

data.v: सारस्वतानां तीर्थानां गुणोत्पत्तिं वदस्व मे । फलं च द्विपदां श्रेष्ठ कर्मनिर्वृत्तिमेव च ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said Describe to me, O foremost of men, the characteristics, the origin and the merits of the several Tirthas on the Sarasvati and the rites to be performed while going there.

data.v: यथाक्रमं च भगवंस्तीर्थानामनुपूर्वशः । ब्रह्मन्ब्रह्मविदां श्रेष्ठ परं कौतूहलं हि मे ॥
data.md: Tell me these, in their order, O illustrious man. My curiosity is not to be satisfied, O foremost of all persons conversant with the knowledge of Brahman.

data.v: तीर्थानां विस्तरं राजन्गुणोत्पत्तिं च सर्वशः । मयोच्यमानां शृणु वै पुण्यां राजेन्द्र कृत्स्नशः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said The account of the characteristics and origin of all these Tirthas, O king, is very lengthy. I shall, however, describe them to you. Listen to that sacred account, O king.

data.v: पूर्वं महाराज यदुप्रवीर; ऋत्विक्सुहृद्विप्रगणैश्च सार्धम् । पुण्यं प्रभासं समुपाजगाम; यत्रोडुराड्यक्ष्मणा क्लिश्यमानः ॥
data.md: Accompanied by his priests and friends, Baladeva first went to the Tirthas called Prabhasa. There, the Lord of the asterism (viz., Soma), who had been suffering from phthisis, was freed from his disease. Regaining energy there, O king, be now lights up the universe. And because that foremost of Tirthas on Earth had formerly invested Soma again with effulgence, it is, therefore, called Prabhasa.

data.v: विमुक्तशापः पुनराप्य तेजः; सर्वं जगद्भासयते नरेन्द्र । एवं तु तीर्थप्रवरं पृथिव्यां; प्रभासनात्तस्य ततः प्रभासः ॥
किमर्थं भगवान्सोमो यक्ष्मणा समगृह्यत । कथं च तीर्थप्रवरे तस्मिंश्चन्द्रो न्यमज्जत ॥
कथमाप्लुत्य तस्मिंस्तु पुनराप्यायितः शशी । एतन्मे सर्वमाचक्ष्व विस्तरेण महामुने ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said "For what was the worshipful Soma afflicted with phthisis? How also did he bathe in that tirtha? How did he, having bathed in that sacred water, regain his lost power? Describe it to me fully, O great Muni.

data.v: दक्षस्य तनया यास्ताः प्रादुरासन्विशां पते । स सप्तविंशतिं कन्या दक्षः सोमाय वै ददौ ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Daksha had twenty seven daughters, O king. There he gave away (in marriage) unto Soma.

data.v: नक्षत्रयोगनिरताः संख्यानार्थं च भारत । पत्न्यो वै तस्य राजेन्द्र सोमस्य शुभलक्षणाः ॥
data.md: Connected with the several constellations, those wives, O king, of Soma of glorious deeds, served to help men in calculating time.

data.v: तास्तु सर्वा विशालाक्ष्यो रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि । अत्यरिच्यत तासां तु रोहिणी रूपसंपदा ॥
data.md: Endued with large eyes, all of them were peerless in beauty in the world. In beauty however, Rohini excelled them all.

data.v: ततस्तस्यां स भगवान्प्रीतिं चक्रे निशाकरः । सास्य हृद्या बभूवाथ तस्मात्तां बुभुजे सदा ॥
data.md: The worshipful Soma took great fancy for her. She was very much liked by him and therefore, he enjoyed the pleasures of her company alone.

data.v: पुरा हि सोमो राजेन्द्र रोहिण्यामवसच्चिरम् । ततोऽस्य कुपितान्यासन्नक्षत्राणि महात्मनः ॥
data.md: Formerly, O king, Soma lived long with Rohini exclusively. For this, those other wives of his, the constellations, became displeased with that high-souled one.

data.v: ता गत्वा पितरं प्राहुः प्रजापतिमतन्द्रिताः । सोमो वसति नास्मासु रोहिणीं भजते सदा ॥
data.md: Going to their father Daksha, that Lord of creation, they said to him-"Soma does not live with us. He always lives with Rohini only.

data.v: ता वयं सहिताः सर्वास्त्वत्सकाशे प्रजेश्वर । वत्स्यामो नियताहारास्तपश्चरणतत्पराः ॥
data.md: All of us, therefore, O Lord of creatures, shall live in your house practising austere penances."

data.v: श्रुत्वा तासां तु वचनं दक्षः सोममथाब्रवीत् । समं वर्तस्व भार्यासु मा त्वाधर्मो महान्स्पृशेत् ॥
data.md: Hearing those words of theirs, Daksha saw Soma and said to him, ""Treat all your wives equally. Do not commit a great sin."

data.v: ताश्च सर्वाब्रवीद्दक्षो गच्छध्वं सोममन्तिकात् । समं वत्स्यति सर्वासु चन्द्रमा मम शासनात् ॥
data.md: And Daksha then said to those daughters of his-"Go, all of you, to Shashin. At my command, he, surnamed Chandramas, will treat you all equally,"

data.v: विसृष्टास्तास्तदा जग्मुः शीतांशुभवनं तदा । तथापि सोमो भगवान्पुनरेव महीपते । रोहिणीं निवसत्येव प्रीयमाणो मुहुर्मुहुः ॥
data.md: Dismissed by him, they then proceeded to the house of him having cool rays. Still the worshipful Soma, O king, behaved as before, for pleased with Rohini alone, he always lived in her company.

data.v: ततस्ताः सहिताः सर्वा भूयः पितरमब्रुवन् । तव शुश्रूषणे युक्ता वत्स्यामो हि तवाश्रमे । सोमो वसति नास्मासु नाकरोद्वचनं तव ॥
data.md: His other wives then once more came to the abode of their father and said to him-"Serving you, we will live under your protection. Soma does not live with us and does not obey your commands."

data.v: तासां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा दक्षः सोममथाब्रवीत् । समं वर्तस्व भार्यासु मा त्वां शप्स्ये विरोचन ॥
data.md: Hearing those words of theirs, Daksha saw Soma and said to him, ""Treat all your wives equally. Do not commit a great sin."

data.v: अनादृत्य तु तद्वाक्यं दक्षस्य भगवाञ्शशी । रोहिण्या सार्धमवसत्ततस्ताः कुपिताः पुनः ॥
data.md: Disregarding, however, the behest of Daksha, the worshipful Soma continued to live with Rohini alone. At this, his other wives became once more angry.

data.v: गत्वा च पितरं प्राहुः प्रणम्य शिरसा तदा । सोमो वसति नास्मासु तस्मान्नः शरणं भव ॥
data.md: Going to their father Daksha, that Lord of creation, they said to him-"Soma does not live with us. He always lives with Rohini only.

data.v: रोहिण्यामेव भगवन्सदा वसति चन्द्रमाः । तस्मान्नस्त्राहि सर्वा वै यथा नः सोम आविशेत् ॥
data.md: The worshipful Chandramas always lives with Rohini exclusively. He does not value your words and does not wish to love us. Therefore, save us so that Soma may accept us all.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा भगवान्क्रुद्धो यक्ष्माणं पृथिवीपते । ससर्ज रोषात्सोमाय स चोडुपतिमाविशत् ॥
data.md: Hearing those words, the worshipful Daksha, O king, became angry and imprecated the curse of phthisis upon Some. Thus did that disease affect the king of stars.

data.v: स यक्ष्मणाभिभूतात्माक्षीयताहरहः शशी । यत्नं चाप्यकरोद्राजन्मोक्षार्थं तस्य यक्ष्मणः ॥
data.md: Afflicted with phthisis, the moon began to waste away day by day. He tried much to get rid of that disease by celebrating various sacrifices, O king. The Moon, however, could not free hiinself from that curse. On the other hand, hi daily grew lean and emaciated.

data.v: इष्ट्वेष्टिभिर्महाराज विविधाभिर्निशाकरः । न चामुच्यत शापाद्वै क्षयं चैवाभ्यगच्छत ॥
क्षीयमाणे ततः सोमे ओषध्यो न प्रजज्ञिरे । निरास्वादरसाः सर्वा हतवीर्याश्च सर्वशः ॥
data.md: On account, of the wasting of Soma the deciduous herbs failed to grow, Their juices dried up they became tasteless and all of them lost their virtues.

data.v: ओषधीनां क्षये जाते प्राणिनामपि संक्षयः । कृशाश्चासन्प्रजाः सर्वाः क्षीयमाणे निशाकरे ॥
data.md: And on account of the absence of the deciduous herbs, living creatures also began to die. Indeed, owing to the wasting of Soma, all creatures grew emaciated.

data.v: ततो देवाः समागम्य सोममूचुर्महीपते । किमिदं भवतो रूपमीदृशं न प्रकाशते ॥
data.md: Then all the celestials, approaching Soma, O king, asked him, saying-"Why is it that your form is not so beautiful and resplendent as before? Tell us whence has originated this great calamity.

data.v: कारणं ब्रूहि नः सर्वं येनेदं ते महद्भयम् । श्रुत्वा तु वचनं त्वत्तो विधास्यामस्ततो वयम् ॥
एवमुक्तः प्रत्युवाच सर्वांस्ताञ्शशलक्षणः । शापं च कारणं चैव यक्ष्माणं च तथात्मनः ॥
देवास्तस्य वचः श्रुत्वा गत्वा दक्षमथाब्रुवन् । प्रसीद भगवन्सोमे शापश्चैष निवर्त्यताम् ॥
असौ हि चन्द्रमाः क्षीणः किंचिच्छेषो हि लक्ष्यते । क्षयाच्चैवास्य देवेश प्रजाश्चापि गताः क्षयम् ॥
वीरुदोषधयश्चैव बीजानि विविधानि च । तथा वयं लोकगुरो प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि ॥
एवमुक्तस्तदा चिन्त्य प्राह वाक्यं प्रजापतिः । नैतच्छक्यं मम वचो व्यावर्तयितुमन्यथा । हेतुना तु महाभागा निवर्तिष्यति केनचित् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, Daksha, that Lord of creatures, said:-"It is impossible to make my words prove otherwise.

data.v: समं वर्ततु सर्वासु शशी भार्यासु नित्यशः । सरस्वत्या वरे तीर्थे उन्मज्जञ्शशलक्षणः । पुनर्वर्धिष्यते देवास्तद्वै सत्यं वचो मम ॥
data.md: Having bathed also in that foremost of tirthas on the Sarasvati, the hare-embalmed god shall regain his strength. These words of mine are true.

data.v: मासार्धं च क्षयं सोमो नित्यमेव गमिष्यति । मासार्धं च सदा वृद्धिं सत्यमेतद्वचो मम ॥
data.md: For half the month Soma shall decrease every day and for half the month following he will increase daily. These words of mine are true.

data.v: सरस्वतीं ततः सोमो जगाम ऋषिशासनात् । प्रभासं परमं तीर्थं सरस्वत्या जगाम ह ॥
data.md: Thus commanded by the Rishi Daksha, Soma then proceeded to the Sarasvati. He reached the greatest of tirthas called Prabhasa belonging to the Sarasvati.

data.v: अमावास्यां महातेजास्तत्रोन्मज्जन्महाद्युतिः । लोकान्प्रभासयामास शीतांशुत्वमवाप च ॥
data.md: Bathing there on the day of the new moon, that god of great energy and great effulgence women regained his cool rays and began again to lleum the universe.

data.v: देवाश्च सर्वे राजेन्द्र प्रभासं प्राप्य पुष्कलम् । सोमेन सहिता भूत्वा दक्षस्य प्रमुखेऽभवन् ॥
data.md: All the creatures also, O king, having gone to Prabhasa, returned with Soma amongst them to where Daksha was.

data.v: ततः प्रजापतिः सर्वा विससर्जाथ देवताः । सोमं च भगवान्प्रीतो भूयो वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Receiving them properly that Lord of creatures then sent them away. Plcased with Soma, the worshipful Daksha once more addressed him, saying-"Do not, O son, disregard and never disregard Brahmanas. Go and obey my commands."

data.v: मावमंस्थाः स्त्रियः पुत्र मा च विप्रान्कदाचन । गच्छ युक्तः सदा भूत्वा कुरु वै शासनं मम ॥
data.md: Receiving them properly that Lord of creatures then sent them away. Plcased with Soma, the worshipful Daksha once more addressed him, saying-"Do not, O son, disregard and never disregard Brahmanas. Go and obey my commands."

data.v: स विसृष्टो महाराज जगामाथ स्वमालयम् । प्रजाश्च मुदिता भूत्वा भोजने च यथा पुरा ॥
data.md: Dismissed by him, Soma returned to his own abode. All creatures began to live joyously as before.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथा शप्तो निशाकरः । प्रभासं च यथा तीर्थं तीर्थानां प्रवरं ह्यभूत् ॥
data.md: I have thus told you everything about how the Moon had been cursed and how also Prabhasa became the best of all tirthas.

data.v: अमावास्यां महाराज नित्यशः शशलक्षणः । स्नात्वा ह्याप्यायते श्रीमान्प्रभासे तीर्थ उत्तमे ॥
data.md: On everyday of the new moon, O king, the god, having the hare for his mark, bathes in the excellent tirtha of Prabhasa and regains his form and beauty.

data.v: अतश्चैनं प्रजानन्ति प्रभासमिति भूमिप । प्रभां हि परमां लेभे तस्मिन्नुन्मज्ज्य चन्द्रमाः ॥
data.md: O lord of Earth, that tirtha is known by the name of Prabhasa, because bathing there the moon regained his great (Prabha) effulgence.

data.v: ततस्तु चमसोद्भेदमच्युतस्त्वगमद्बली । चमसोद्भेद इत्येवं यं जनाः कथयन्त्युत ॥
data.md: After this, the mighty and illustrious Baladeva proceeded to Chamasodbheda, that is to that tirtha which is called by that name.

data.v: तत्र दत्त्वा च दानानि विशिष्टानि हलायुधः । उषित्वा रजनीमेकां स्नात्वा च विधिवत्तदा ॥
data.md: Distributing many precious presents at that place, the hero, having the plough for his weapon, passed one night there and performed his absolutions duly.

data.v: उदपानमथागच्छत्त्वरावान्केशवाग्रजः । आद्यं स्वस्त्ययनं चैव तत्रावाप्य महत्फलम् ॥
data.md: The elder brother of Keshava then speedily repaired to Udapana. Although the Sarasvati is not visible there, yet persons endued with ascetic success, no account of their obtaining great merits and sanctity of that spot and also of the coolness of the herbs and of the land there, know that the river has an invisible current, O king, underneath the earth there.

data.v: स्निग्धत्वादोषधीनां च भूमेश्च जनमेजय । जानन्ति सिद्धा राजेन्द्र नष्टामपि सरस्वतीम् ॥
data.md: The elder brother of Keshava then speedily repaired to Udapana. Although the Sarasvati is not visible there, yet persons endued with ascetic success, no account of their obtaining great merits and sanctity of that spot and also of the coolness of the herbs and of the land there, know that the river has an invisible current, O king, underneath the earth there.

data.v: तस्मान्नदीगतं चापि उदपानं यशस्विनः । त्रितस्य च महाराज जगामाथ हलायुधः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Baladeva proceeded next to the tirtha Udapana in the Sarasvati, that had formerly been the habitation, O king, of the illustrious ascetic Trita.

data.v: तत्र दत्त्वा बहु द्रव्यं पूजयित्वा तथा द्विजान् । उपस्पृश्य च तत्रैव प्रहृष्टो मुसलायुधः ॥
data.md: Having distributed profuse wealth and worshipped the Brahmanas, the hero, having the plough for his weapon, bathed there and was filled with joy.

data.v: तत्र धर्मपरो ह्यासीत्त्रितः स सुमहातपाः । कूपे च वसता तेन सोमः पीतो महात्मना ॥
data.md: The great and pious ascetic Trita had lived there. While in a hole that great man had drunk the Soma juice.

data.v: तत्र चैनं समुत्सृज्य भ्रातरौ जग्मतुर्गृहान् । ततस्तौ वै शशापाथ त्रितो ब्राह्मणसत्तमः ॥
data.md: His two brothers, dashing him down into a pit, had returned home. That foremost of Brahmanas, viz., Trita, had thereupon cursed them both."

data.v: उदपानं कथं ब्रह्मन्कथं च सुमहातपाः । पतितः किं च संत्यक्तो भ्रातृभ्यां द्विजसत्तमः ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said "What is the origin of Udapana? How did the great ascetic Trita fall into a pit there? Why was that foremost of Brahmanas thrown into that pit by his brothers?

data.v: कूपे कथं च हित्वैनं भ्रातरौ जग्मतुर्गृहान् । एतदाचक्ष्व मे ब्रह्मन्यदि श्राव्यं हि मन्यसे ॥
data.md: How did his brothers, after throwing him into that hole, come back to their home? How did Trita celebrate his sacrifice and how did he drink Soma? Describe all his O Brahmana, if you think that I am worthy of listening to it.

data.v: आसन्पूर्वयुगे राजन्मुनयो भ्रातरस्त्रयः । एकतश्च द्वितश्चैव त्रितश्चादित्यसंनिभाः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said In a former cycle, O king, there were three ascetic brothers. They were called Ekata, Dvita and Trita and all three were effulgent like the sun.

data.v: सर्वे प्रजापतिसमाः प्रजावन्तस्तथैव च । ब्रह्मलोकजितः सर्वे तपसा ब्रह्मवादिनः ॥
data.md: They were like Lords of the creation and had children. Brahmavadins as they were they had, by their ascetic penances, acquired the privilege of attaining to the regions of Brahman after death.

data.v: तेषां तु तपसा प्रीतो नियमेन दमेन च । अभवद्गौतमो नित्यं पिता धर्मरतः सदा ॥
स तु दीर्घेण कालेन तेषां प्रीतिमवाप्य च । जगाम भगवान्स्थानमनुरूपमिवात्मनः ॥
राजानस्तस्य ये पूर्वे याज्या ह्यासन्महात्मनः । ते सर्वे स्वर्गते तस्मिंस्तस्य पुत्रानपूजयन् ॥
तेषां तु कर्मणा राजंस्तथैवाध्ययनेन च । त्रितः स श्रेष्ठतां प्राप यथैवास्य पिता तथा ॥
data.md: Amongst them however, Trita, by his acts and Vedic studies, O king, became the foremost, even like his father Gautama.

data.v: तं स्म सर्वे महाभागा मुनयः पुण्यलक्षणाः । अपूजयन्महाभागं तथा विद्वत्तयैव तु ॥
data.md: Then all the great and pious ascetics began to worship Trita as they had worshipped his father Gautama before him.

data.v: कदाचिद्धि ततो राजन्भ्रातरावेकतद्वितौ । यज्ञार्थं चक्रतुश्चित्तं धनार्थं च विशेषतः ॥
data.md: Once upon a time, the two brothers Etaka and Dvita thought of celebrating a sacrifice and became anxious for wealth.

data.v: तयोश्चिन्ता समभवत्त्रितं गृह्य परंतप । याज्यान्सर्वानुपादाय प्रतिगृह्य पशूंस्ततः ॥
सोमं पास्यामहे हृष्टाः प्राप्य यज्ञं महाफलम् । चक्रुश्चैव महाराज भ्रातरस्त्रय एव ह ॥
तथा तु ते परिक्रम्य याज्यान्सर्वान्पशून्प्रति । याजयित्वा ततो याज्याँल्लब्ध्वा च सुबहून्पशून् ॥
data.md: Calling upon all their disciples for animals and helping them in their sacrifices and receiving a large number of animals from them as gifts for the priestly services rendered by them those high-souled and great Rishis came towards the east.

data.v: याज्येन कर्मणा तेन प्रतिगृह्य विधानतः । प्राचीं दिशं महात्मान आजग्मुस्ते महर्षयः ॥
त्रितस्तेषां महाराज पुरस्ताद्याति हृष्टवत् । एकतश्च द्वितश्चैव पृष्ठतः कालयन्पशून् ॥
data.md: Trita, O king, was cheerfully walking before them. Ekata and Dvita were in his rear, conducting the animals.

data.v: तयोश्चिन्ता समभवद्दृष्ट्वा पशुगणं महत् । कथं न स्युरिमा गाव आवाभ्यां वै विना त्रितम् ॥
data.md: Sceing that large herd of animals they began to think as to how they two could appropriate that property without giving a share to Trita.

data.v: तावन्योन्यं समाभाष्य एकतश्च द्वितश्च ह । यदूचतुर्मिथः पापौ तन्निबोध जनेश्वर ॥
data.md: Hear, O king, what those two sinful wretches, viz., Ekata and Dvita, said to each other.

data.v: त्रितो यज्ञेषु कुशलस्त्रितो वेदेषु निष्ठितः । अन्यास्त्रितो बहुतरा गावः समुपलप्स्यते ॥
data.md: They said-"Trita is a clever priest. Trita is well read in the Vedas. Trita is capable of earning many other kine.

data.v: तदावां सहितौ भूत्वा गाः प्रकाल्य व्रजावहे । त्रितोऽपि गच्छतां काममावाभ्यां वै विनाकृतः ॥
data.md: Let us two, therefore go away, taking the kine with us. Let Trita go wherever he likes, without being in our company."

data.v: तेषामागच्छतां रात्रौ पथिस्थाने वृकोऽभवत् । तथा कूपोऽविदूरेऽभूत्सरस्वत्यास्तटे महान् ॥
data.md: As they proceeded, they were benighted on the way. They then saw a wolf before them. Not far from that spot was a deep hole on the bank of the Sarasvati.

data.v: अथ त्रितो वृकं दृष्ट्वा पथि तिष्ठन्तमग्रतः । तद्भयादपसर्पन्वै तस्मिन्कूपे पपात ह । अगाधे सुमहाघोरे सर्वभूतभयंकरे ॥
data.md: Trita, who was going before, seeing the wolf, rain in fear and fell into that hole.

data.v: त्रितस्ततो महाभागः कूपस्थो मुनिसत्तमः । आर्तनादं ततश्चक्रे तौ तु शुश्रुवतुर्मुनी ॥
तं ज्ञात्वा पतितं कूपे भ्रातरावेकतद्वितौ । वृकत्रासाच्च लोभाच्च समुत्सृज्य प्रजग्मतुः ॥
data.md: Knowing that he had fallen into a pit, his brothers Ekata and Dvita, actuated by fear of the wolf as also by temptation, went on, leaving behind their brother.

data.v: भ्रातृभ्यां पशुलुब्धाभ्यामुत्सृष्टः स महातपाः । उदपाने महाराज निर्जले पांसुसंवृते ॥
data.md: Thus left behind by his two brothers who were tempted to appropriate those animals, the great ascetic. Trita, O king, while within that lonely pit covered with dust.

data.v: त्रित आत्मानमालक्ष्य कूपे वीरुत्तृणावृते । निमग्नं भरतश्रेष्ठ पापकृन्नरके यथा ॥
बुद्ध्या ह्यगणयत्प्राज्ञो मृत्योर्भीतो ह्यसोमपः । सोमः कथं नु पातव्य इहस्थेन मया भवेत् ॥
स एवमनुसंचिन्त्य तस्मिन्कूपे महातपाः । ददर्श वीरुधं तत्र लम्बमानां यदृच्छया ॥
data.md: While thinking thus the great ascetic, standing in that pit, beheld a creeper hanging down into it.

data.v: पांसुग्रस्ते ततः कूपे विचिन्त्य सलिलं मुनिः । अग्नीन्संकल्पयामास होत्रे चात्मानमेव च ॥
data.md: Although the pit was dry still the sage perceived the existence of water and of sacrificial fires there. Imagining himself the sacrificial priest.

data.v: ततस्तां वीरुधं सोमं संकल्प्य सुमहातपाः । ऋचो यजूंषि सामानि मनसा चिन्तयन्मुनिः । ग्रावाणः शर्कराः कृत्वा प्रचक्रेऽभिषवं नृप ॥
data.md: The great ascetic took the creeper for the Soma plant. He then mentally uttered the Rich's, the Yayushes and the Samans.

data.v: आज्यं च सलिलं चक्रे भागांश्च त्रिदिवौकसाम् । सोमस्याभिषवं कृत्वा चकार तुमुलं ध्वनिम् ॥
स चाविशद्दिवं राजन्स्वरः शैक्षस्त्रितस्य वै । समवाप च तं यज्ञं यथोक्तं ब्रह्मवादिभिः ॥
data.md: He distributed amongst the celestials their respective shares (of those sacrificial offerings). Having next mentally drunk Soma, he began to inake a great noise. Those sounds, O king, first uttered by the sacrificing Rishi, entered into heaven and Trita performed that sacrifice after the manner laid down by Brahmavadins.

data.v: वर्तमाने तथा यज्ञे त्रितस्य सुमहात्मनः । आविग्नं त्रिदिवं सर्वं कारणं च न बुध्यते ॥
data.md: During the celebration of that sacrifice of the great Trita, the entire region of the celestials was agitated. None knew, however, the cause. Brihaspati heard that loud noise.

data.v: ततः सुतुमुलं शब्दं शुश्रावाथ बृहस्पतिः । श्रुत्वा चैवाब्रवीद्देवान्सर्वान्देवपुरोहितः ॥
त्रितस्य वर्तते यज्ञस्तत्र गच्छामहे सुराः । स हि क्रुद्धः सृजेदन्यान्देवानपि महातपाः ॥
तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य सहिताः सर्वदेवताः । प्रययुस्तत्र यत्रासौ त्रितयज्ञः प्रवर्तते ॥
ते तत्र गत्वा विबुधास्तं कूपं यत्र स त्रितः । ददृशुस्तं महात्मानं दीक्षितं यज्ञकर्मसु ॥
दृष्ट्वा चैनं महात्मानं श्रिया परमया युतम् । ऊचुश्चाथ महाभागं प्राप्ता भागार्थिनो वयम् ॥
अथाब्रवीदृषिर्देवान्पश्यध्वं मां दिवौकसः । अस्मिन्प्रतिभये कूपे निमग्नं नष्टचेतसम् ॥
ततस्त्रितो महाराज भागांस्तेषां यथाविधि । मन्त्रयुक्तान्समददात्ते च प्रीतास्तदाभवन् ॥
data.md: Then Trita, O monarch, duly allotted to them their shares with proper mantras. The gods took them and were greatly delighted. Having duly received their respective shares, the denizens of heaven, pleased with him, granted him the boons he wanted.

data.v: ततो यथाविधि प्राप्तान्भागान्प्राप्य दिवौकसः । प्रीतात्मानो ददुस्तस्मै वरान्यान्मनसेच्छति ॥
data.md: The boon, however, that he prayed for was that the gods should relieve him from his painful condition.

data.v: स तु वव्रे वरं देवांस्त्रातुमर्हथ मामितः । यश्चेहोपस्पृशेत्कूपे स सोमपगतिं लभेत् ॥
data.md: He also said-"Let him that bathes in this well, achieve the end that is attained by persons that have drunk Soma.'

data.v: तत्र चोर्मिमती राजन्नुत्पपात सरस्वती । तयोत्क्षिप्तस्त्रितस्तस्थौ पूजयंस्त्रिदिवौकसः ॥
data.md: Thereat, O king, the Sarasvati. with her waves, appeared within that well. Raised above by her, Trita came up and worshipped the celestials.

data.v: तथेति चोक्त्वा विबुधा जग्मू राजन्यथागतम् । त्रितश्चाप्यगमत्प्रीतः स्वमेव निलयं तदा ॥
data.md: The gods then said to him-"By it as you wish." All of them then, O king, returned to their respective habitations and Trita, filled with joy, proceeded to his owe abode.

data.v: क्रुद्धः स तु समासाद्य तावृषी भ्रातरौ तदा । उवाच परुषं वाक्यं शशाप च महातपाः ॥
data.md: Meeting with those two Rishi, viz., his brothers, he became enraged with them. Endued with ascetic merit, he spoke harshly to them and cursed them, saying.

data.v: पशुलुब्धौ युवां यस्मान्मामुत्सृज्य प्रधावितौ । तस्माद्रूपेण तेषां वै दंष्ट्रिणामभितश्चरौ ॥
data.md: Since, actuated by covetousness, you ran away, leaving me, therefore, you shall become dreadful wolves with sharp teeth and range the forest cursed by me on account of that sinful act of yours.

data.v: भवितारौ मया शप्तौ पापेनानेन कर्मणा । प्रसवश्चैव युवयोर्गोलाङ्गूलर्क्षवानराः ॥
इत्युक्ते तु तदा तेन क्षणादेव विशां पते । तथाभूतावदृश्येतां वचनात्सत्यवादिनः ॥
data.md: Your offspring will also consist of leopards and bears and apes!' After Trita had said these words, O monarch, his two brothers were soon transformed into tigers on account of the curse of that truthful sage.

data.v: तत्राप्यमितविक्रान्तः स्पृष्ट्वा तोयं हलायुधः । दत्त्वा च विविधान्दायान्पूजयित्वा च वै द्विजान् ॥
data.md: The highly powerful Baladeva touched the waters of Udapana. And he gave away various kinds of wealth there and worshipped many Brahmanas.

data.v: उदपानं च तं दृष्ट्वा प्रशस्य च पुनः पुनः । नदीगतमदीनात्मा प्राप्तो विनशनं तदा ॥
ततो विनशनं राजन्नाजगाम हलायुधः । शूद्राभीरान्प्रति द्वेषाद्यत्र नष्टा सरस्वती ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "Then Baladeva, O king, went to Vinashana where the Sarasvati has disappeared out of view in consequence of her hatred for Shudras and Abhiras.

data.v: यस्मात्सा भरतश्रेष्ठ द्वेषान्नष्टा सरस्वती । तस्मात्तदृषयो नित्यं प्राहुर्विनशनेति ह ॥
तच्चाप्युपस्पृश्य बलः सरस्वत्यां महाबलः । सुभूमिकं ततोऽगच्छत्सरस्वत्यास्तटे वरे ॥
data.md: Having bathed in that tirtha of the Sarasvati, the powerful Baladeva then went to Subhumika situate on the excellent bank of the same river.

data.v: तत्र चाप्सरसः शुभ्रा नित्यकालमतन्द्रिताः । क्रीडाभिर्विमलाभिश्च क्रीडन्ति विमलाननाः ॥
data.md: There many fair-complexioned and beautiful-faced. Apsaras are always engaged in innocent pastimes.

data.v: तत्र देवाः सगन्धर्वा मासि मासि जनेश्वर । अभिगच्छन्ति तत्तीर्थं पुण्यं ब्राह्मणसेवितम् ॥
data.md: The celestials and the Gandharvas, every month, O king, go to that sacred shrine which is the resort of Brahman himself.

data.v: तत्रादृश्यन्त गन्धर्वास्तथैवाप्सरसां गणाः । समेत्य सहिता राजन्यथाप्राप्तं यथासुखम् ॥
data.md: The Gandharvas and various clans of Apsaras are to be seen there, O king, passing their days happily.

data.v: तत्र मोदन्ति देवाश्च पितरश्च सवीरुधः । पुण्यैः पुष्पैः सदा दिव्यैः कीर्यमाणाः पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: There the celestials and departed manes in the midst of the showers of sacred and auspicious flowers sport in joy.

data.v: आक्रीडभूमिः सा राजंस्तासामप्सरसां शुभा । सुभूमिकेति विख्याता सरस्वत्यास्तटे वरे ॥
data.md: There all the creepers are covered with flowers. And because, O king, that spot is the beautiful sporting ground of those Apsaras, therefore is that shrine on the charming bank of the Sarasvati is called Subhumika.

data.v: तत्र स्नात्वा च दत्त्वा च वसु विप्रेषु माधवः । श्रुत्वा गीतं च तद्दिव्यं वादित्राणां च निःस्वनम् ॥
data.md: Baladeva of Madhu's race, having bathed in that tirtha and distributed immense riches amongst the Brahmanas, heard the sound of those celestial songs and musical instruments.

data.v: छायाश्च विपुला दृष्ट्वा देवगन्धर्वरक्षसाम् । गन्धर्वाणां ततस्तीर्थमागच्छद्रोहिणीसुतः ॥
data.md: He also saw there many shadows of gods, Gandharvas and Rakshasas. The son of Rohini then proceeded to the tirtha of the Gandharvas.

data.v: विश्वावसुमुखास्तत्र गन्धर्वास्तपसान्विताः । नृत्तवादित्रगीतं च कुर्वन्ति सुमनोरमम् ॥
data.md: There many Gandharvas, headed by Vishvavasu and possessed of ascetic merit, pass their time in dance and singing many sweet songs.

data.v: तत्र दत्त्वा हलधरो विप्रेभ्यो विविधं वसु । अजाविकं गोखरोष्ट्रं सुवर्णं रजतं तथा ॥
data.md: Giving away various kinds of riches to the Brahmanas, as also goat and sheep and kine and mules and camels and gold and silver.

data.v: भोजयित्वा द्विजान्कामैः संतर्प्य च महाधनैः । प्रययौ सहितो विप्रैः स्तूयमानश्च माधवः ॥
data.md: And feeding many Brahmanas and satisfying them with many rich gifts as desired by them, Baladeva, of Madhu's race, left that place accompanied by many Brahmanas and praised by them.

data.v: तस्माद्गन्धर्वतीर्थाच्च महाबाहुररिंदमः । गर्गस्रोतो महातीर्थमाजगामैककुण्डली ॥
data.md: Leaving that tirtha the favourite haunt of the Gandharvas, that mighty-armed chastiser of foes, having but one ear-ring, then went to the famous tirtha called Gargashrota.

data.v: यत्र गर्गेण वृद्धेन तपसा भावितात्मना । कालज्ञानगतिश्चैव ज्योतिषां च व्यतिक्रमः ॥
data.md: There, in that sacred tirtha of the Sarasvati, the illustrious and old Garga, having a soul cleansed by ascetic penances, O Janamejaya, had mastered the knowledge of time and its course, of the deviations of luminous bodies (in the sky) and of all auspicious and inauspicious portents.

data.v: उत्पाता दारुणाश्चैव शुभाश्च जनमेजय । सरस्वत्याः शुभे तीर्थे विहिता वै महात्मना । तस्य नाम्ना च तत्तीर्थं गर्गस्रोत इति स्मृतम् ॥
तत्र गर्गं महाभागमृषयः सुव्रता नृप । उपासां चक्रिरे नित्यं कालज्ञानं प्रति प्रभो ॥
data.md: That tirtha was called after his name Gargashrota. There, ( king, highly blessed Rishis of firm vows always waited upon Garga, O lord, for acquiring a knowledge of time.

data.v: तत्र गत्वा महाराज बलः श्वेतानुलेपनः । विधिवद्धि धनं दत्त्वा मुनीनां भावितात्मनाम् ॥
data.md: Besmeared with white sandal-paste O king, Baladeva, going to that tirtha, duly distributed wealth amongst many ascetics of pure souls.

data.v: उच्चावचांस्तथा भक्ष्यान्द्विजेभ्यो विप्रदाय सः । नीलवासास्ततोऽगच्छच्छङ्खतीर्थं महायशाः ॥
data.md: Having distributed also many sorts of rich food amongst the Brahmanas, that illustrious one, clad in blue robes, then went to the tirtha called Shankha.

data.v: तत्रापश्यन्महाशङ्खं महामेरुमिवोच्छ्रितम् । श्वेतपर्वतसंकाशमृषिसंघैर्निषेवितम् । सरस्वत्यास्तटे जातं नगं तालध्वजो बली ॥
data.md: There, on the bank of the Sarasvati that powerful palmyra-emblemed hero beheld a gigantic tree called Mahashankha, tall as Meru, looking like the white-mountain and resorted to by many Rishis.

data.v: यक्षा विद्याधराश्चैव राक्षसाश्चामितौजसः । पिशाचाश्चामितबला यत्र सिद्धाः सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: There dwell Yakshas and Vidyadharas and Rakshasas of great energy and Pishachas of incomparable might and Siddhas, in thousands.

data.v: ते सर्वे ह्यशनं त्यक्त्वा फलं तस्य वनस्पतेः । व्रतैश्च नियमैश्चैव काले काले स्म भुञ्जते ॥
प्राप्तैश्च नियमैस्तैस्तैर्विचरन्तः पृथक्पृथक् । अदृश्यमाना मनुजैर्व्यचरन्पुरुषर्षभ ॥
एवं ख्यातो नरपते लोकेऽस्मिन्स वनस्पतिः । तत्र तीर्थं सरस्वत्याः पावनं लोकविश्रुतम् ॥
तस्मिंश्च यदुशार्दूलो दत्त्वा तीर्थे यशस्विनाम् । ताम्रायसानि भाण्डानि वस्त्राणि विविधानि च ॥
data.md: That tree is the cause of this tirtha. Having given away many milch cows, vessels of copper and iron and diverse sorts of other vessels, that foremost Yadu's race, viz., Baladeva, having the plough for his weapon, worshipped the Brahmanas and was adored by them in return. He then, O king, went to the Dvaita lake.

data.v: पूजयित्वा द्विजांश्चैव पूजितश्च तपोधनैः । पुण्यं द्वैतवनं राजन्नाजगाम हलायुधः ॥
तत्र गत्वा मुनीन्दृष्ट्वा नानावेषधरान्बलः । आप्लुत्य सलिले चापि पूजयामास वै द्विजान् ॥
तथैव दत्त्वा विप्रेभ्यः परिभोगान्सुपुष्कलान् । ततः प्रायाद्बलो राजन्दक्षिणेन सरस्वतीम् ॥
data.md: Having distributed profusely amongst the Brahmanas various articles of enjoyment Baladeva then, O king, went on along the southern bank of the Sarasvati.

data.v: गत्वा चैव महाबाहुर्नातिदूरं महायशाः । धर्मात्मा नागधन्वानं तीर्थमागमदच्युतः ॥
data.md: The mighty-armed and illustrious Rama, of pure soul and unmitigated glory, then proceeded to the tirtha called Nagadhanvana.

data.v: यत्र पन्नगराजस्य वासुकेः संनिवेशनम् । महाद्युतेर्महाराज बहुभिः पन्नगैर्वृतम् । यत्रासन्नृषयः सिद्धाः सहस्राणि चतुर्दश ॥
data.md: Abounding with snakes, O king, it was the abode of the highly effulgent Vasuki, the king of serpents. There four and then ten thousand Rishis also lived permanently.

data.v: यत्र देवाः समागम्य वासुकिं पन्नगोत्तमम् । सर्वपन्नगराजानमभ्यषिञ्चन्यथाविधि । पन्नगेभ्यो भयं तत्र विद्यते न स्म कौरव ॥
data.md: Having come there in days of yore the celestials had, according to due rites, installed the great snake Vasuki as king of all the snakes. There is no fear of snakes in that place Oyou of Kuru's race.

data.v: तत्रापि विधिवद्दत्त्वा विप्रेभ्यो रत्नसंचयान् । प्रायात्प्राचीं दिशं राजन्दीप्यमानः स्वतेजसा ॥
data.md: Duly distributing many valuable articles there amongst the Brahmanas Baladeva then set out with face towards the east and reached, one after another, hundreds and thousands of celebrated tirthas situated all around.

data.v: आप्लुत्य बहुशो हृष्टस्तेषु तीर्थेषु लाङ्गली । दत्त्वा वसु द्विजातिभ्यो जगामाति तपस्विनः ॥
तत्रस्थानृषिसंघांस्तानभिवाद्य हलायुधः । ततो रामोऽगमत्तीर्थमृषिभिः सेवितं महत् ॥
यत्र भूयो निववृते प्राङ्मुखा वै सरस्वती । ऋषीणां नैमिषेयाणामवेक्षार्थं महात्मनाम् ॥
निवृत्तां तां सरिच्छ्रेष्ठां तत्र दृष्ट्वा तु लाङ्गली । बभूव विस्मितो राजन्बलः श्वेतानुलेपनः ॥
data.md: Always smeared with white sandal-paste, Vala, having the plough for his weapon, seeing that great river change her course, was O king, filled with wonder.

data.v: कस्मात्सरस्वती ब्रह्मन्निवृत्ता प्राङ्मुखी ततः । व्याख्यातुमेतदिच्छामि सर्वमध्वर्युसत्तम ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said "Why O Brahmana, did the Sarasvati bend her course there towards the east. O best of Adhvaryus, you should tell me everything regarding this.

data.v: कस्मिंश्च कारणे तत्र विस्मितो यदुनन्दनः । विनिवृत्ता सरिच्छ्रेष्ठा कथमेतद्द्विजोत्तम ॥
data.md: Why was that delighter of the Yadus filled with wonder? Why, indeed did that best of rivers thus change her course."

data.v: पूर्वं कृतयुगे राजन्नैमिषेयास्तपस्विनः । वर्तमाने सुबहुले सत्रे द्वादशवार्षिके । ऋषयो बहवो राजंस्तत्र संप्रतिपेदिरे ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "Formerly, in the Satya Yuga, O king, the ascetics living in Naimisha were engaged in a great sacrifice extending for twelve years.

data.v: उषित्वा च महाभागास्तस्मिन्सत्रे यथाविधि । निवृत्ते नैमिषेये वै सत्रे द्वादशवार्षिके । आजग्मुरृषयस्तत्र बहवस्तीर्थकारणात् ॥
data.md: Many Rishis, O king, came to that sacrifice. Passing their time according to proper rites, in the celebration of that sacrifice, those great Rishis, after the termination of that twelve year's sacrifice at Naimisha, set out in large numbers for seeing the various sacred shrines.

data.v: ऋषीणां बहुलत्वात्तु सरस्वत्या विशां पते । तीर्थानि नगरायन्ते कूले वै दक्षिणे तदा ॥
data.md: On account of the number of the Rishis, O king, the tirthas on the southern banks of the Sarasvati all looked like towns and cities.

data.v: समन्तपञ्चकं यावत्तावत्ते द्विजसत्तमाः । तीर्थलोभान्नरव्याघ्र नद्यास्तीरं समाश्रिताः ॥
data.md: Those foremost of Brahmanas, O foremost of men, being anxious to enjoy the merits of tirthas, took up thcir abodes on the bank of the river up to Samantapanchaka.

data.v: जुह्वतां तत्र तेषां तु मुनीनां भावितात्मनाम् । स्वाध्यायेनापि महता बभूवुः पूरिता दिशः ॥
data.md: The whole region was as if filled with loud Vedic recitations of those Rishis of pure souls, all engaged in pouring libations of sacrificial fires.

data.v: अग्निहोत्रैस्ततस्तेषां हूयमानैर्महात्मनाम् । अशोभत सरिच्छ्रेष्ठा दीप्यमानैः समन्ततः ॥
data.md: That best of rivers shone highly beautiful with those burning homa fires all around, over which those great ascetics poured libations of clarified butter.

data.v: वालखिल्या महाराज अश्मकुट्टाश्च तापसाः । दन्तोलूखलिनश्चान्ये संप्रक्षालास्तथापरे ॥
वायुभक्षा जलाहाराः पर्णभक्षाश्च तापसाः । नानानियमयुक्ताश्च तथा स्थण्डिलशायिनः ॥
आसन्वै मुनयस्तत्र सरस्वत्याः समीपतः । शोभयन्तः सरिच्छ्रेष्ठां गङ्गामिव दिवौकसः ॥
ततः पश्चात्समापेतुरृषयः सत्रयाजिनः । तेऽवकाशं न ददृशुः कुरुक्षेत्रे महाव्रताः ॥
data.md: Hundreds of Rishis, all given to the observance of sacrifices, came there. Those observers of great vows could not find sufficient accommodation on the banks of the Sarasvati.

data.v: ततो यज्ञोपवीतैस्ते तत्तीर्थं निर्मिमाय वै । जुहुवुश्चाग्निहोत्राणि चक्रुश्च विविधाः क्रियाः ॥
data.md: Measuring small plots of land with their sacred threads, they celebrated Agnihotras and other rites.

data.v: ततस्तमृषिसंघातं निराशं चिन्तयान्वितम् । दर्शयामास राजेन्द्र तेषामर्थे सरस्वती ॥
data.md: The river Sarasvati saw, O king, those Rishis filled with despair and anxiety for want of a commodious tirtha wherein to perform their rites.

data.v: ततः कुञ्जान्बहून्कृत्वा संनिवृत्ता सरिद्वरा । ऋषीणां पुण्यतपसां कारुण्याज्जनमेजय ॥
data.md: Accordingly that best of streams came there, having made sufficient accommodation on her bank for those Rishis, out of compassion for them, O Janamejaya.

data.v: ततो निवृत्य राजेन्द्र तेषामर्थे सरस्वती । भूयः प्रतीच्यभिमुखी सुस्राव सरितां वरा ॥
data.md: Having thus, O king, changed her course for their sake, the Sarasvati, that best of rivers, once more flowed in a westerly direction, to make the arrival of the Rishis there successful. O king, the great river accomplished there this wonderful feat.

data.v: अमोघा गमनं कृत्वा तेषां भूयो व्रजाम्यहम् । इत्यद्भुतं महच्चक्रे ततो राजन्महानदी ॥
data.md: Having thus, O king, changed her course for their sake, the Sarasvati, that best of rivers, once more flowed in a westerly direction, to make the arrival of the Rishis there successful. O king, the great river accomplished there this wonderful feat.

data.v: एवं स कुञ्जो राजेन्द्र नैमिषेय इति स्मृतः । कुरुक्षेत्रे कुरुश्रेष्ठ कुरुष्व महतीः क्रियाः ॥
तत्र कुञ्जान्बहून्दृष्ट्वा संनिवृत्तां च तां नदीम् । बभूव विस्मयस्तत्र रामस्याथ महात्मनः ॥
उपस्पृश्य तु तत्रापि विधिवद्यदुनन्दनः । दत्त्वा दायान्द्विजातिभ्यो भाण्डानि विविधानि च । भक्ष्यं पेयं च विविधं ब्राह्मणान्प्रत्यपादयत् ॥
ततः प्रायाद्बलो राजन्पूज्यमानो द्विजातिभिः । सरस्वतीतीर्थवरं नानाद्विजगणायुतम् ॥
बदरेङ्गुदकाश्मर्यप्लक्षाश्वत्थविभीतकैः । पनसैश्च पलाशैश्च करीरैः पीलुभिस्तथा ॥
सरस्वतीतीररुहैर्बन्धनैः स्यन्दनैस्तथा । परूषकवनैश्चैव बिल्वैराम्रातकैस्तथा ॥
अतिमुक्तकषण्डैश्च पारिजातैश्च शोभितम् । कदलीवनभूयिष्ठमिष्टं कान्तं मनोरमम् ॥

data.md: It abounded with forests of Plantains pleasant to view and most charming. And it was haunted by various ascetics, some living on air, some water, some on fruits, some on leaves, some on raw raise again which they husked with the aid only of stones and some that were called Vaneyas. And it was filled with the chauntings of the Vedas and abounded with diverse kinds of animals.

data.v: स्वाध्यायघोषसंघुष्टं मृगयूथशताकुलम् । अहिंस्रैर्धर्मपरमैर्नृभिरत्यन्तसेवितम् ॥
सप्तसारस्वतं तीर्थमाजगाम हलायुधः । यत्र मङ्कणकः सिद्धस्तपस्तेपे महामुनिः ॥
data.md: And it was the favourite abode of men shorn of malice and devoted to righteousness. Baladeva, having the plough for his weapon, arrived at that tirtha, called the Sapta-Sarasvat, where the great ascetic Mankanaka had his penances successfully practised.

data.v: सप्तसारस्वतं कस्मात्कश्च मङ्कणको मुनिः । कथं सिद्धश्च भगवान्कश्चास्य नियमोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said "Why was that tirtha called Sapta-Sarasvat? Who was the ascetic Mankanaka? How was that worshipful one successful? What were his vows and observances?

data.v: कस्य वंशे समुत्पन्नः किं चाधीतं द्विजोत्तम । एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं विधिवद्द्विजसत्तम ॥
data.md: In whose family was he born? What books did that great Rishi study? I desire to hear all this, O foremost of Rishis.

data.v: राजन्सप्त सरस्वत्यो याभिर्व्याप्तमिदं जगत् । आहूता बलवद्भिर्हि तत्र तत्र सरस्वती ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "O king, the seven Sarasvati cover this Universe. Wherever the Sarasvati was called the energetic Rishis, there she did go.

data.v: सुप्रभा काञ्चनाक्षी च विशाला मानसह्रदा । सरस्वती ओघवती सुवेणुर्विमलोदका ॥
data.md: These are the seven forms of the Sarasvati, viz., Suprabha, Kanchanakshi, Vishala, Manorama, Oghavati, Surenu and Vimalodaka.

data.v: पितामहस्य महतो वर्तमाने महीतले । वितते यज्ञवाटे वै समेतेषु द्विजातिषु ॥
data.md: Brahma had at one time celebrated a great sacrifice. While that sacrifice was being celebrated on the site selected, many Rishis, crowned with ascetic success, came there.

data.v: पुण्याहघोषैर्विमलैर्वेदानां निनदैस्तथा । देवेषु चैव व्यग्रेषु तस्मिन्यज्ञविधौ तदा ॥
data.md: The spot was filled with the sound of the recitation and the chaunting of the Vedas. Seeing those sacrificial rites, even the very gods lost their temper.

data.v: तत्र चैव महाराज दीक्षिते प्रपितामहे । यजतस्तत्र सत्रेण सर्वकामसमृद्धिना ॥
मनसा चिन्तिता ह्यर्था धर्मार्थकुशलैस्तदा । उपतिष्ठन्ति राजेन्द्र द्विजातींस्तत्र तत्र ह ॥
data.md: There, O king, while the grandfather was initiated in the sacrifice and was performing the grand ceremony capable of granting prosperity and wished-for objects many great Rishis, conversant with virtue and profit, were present. As soon as they thought of necessary articles, they, O king, immediately came before the Rishis.

data.v: जगुश्च तत्र गन्धर्वा ननृतुश्चाप्सरोगणाः । वादित्राणि च दिव्यानि वादयामासुरञ्जसा ॥
data.md: The Gandharvas sang and the Apsaras danced. And they played upon many celestial instruments.

data.v: तस्य यज्ञस्य संपत्त्या तुतुषुर्देवता अपि । विस्मयं परमं जग्मुः किमु मानुषयोनयः ॥
data.md: The provisions collected in that sacrifice satisfied the very celestials. What shall I say then of men? The very celestials were filled with wonder.

data.v: वर्तमाने तथा यज्ञे पुष्करस्थे पितामहे । अब्रुवन्नृषयो राजन्नायं यज्ञो महाफलः । न दृश्यते सरिच्छ्रेष्ठा यस्मादिह सरस्वती ॥
data.md: During the progress of that sacrifice at Pushkara and in the presence of Brahma, the Rishis, O king, said-"This sacrifice is not successful, sine that foremost of rivers, viz., Sarasvati, is not to be seen here.” Hearing these words. the divine Brahman meditated on Sarasvati.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा भगवान्प्रीतः सस्माराथ सरस्वतीम् । पितामहेन यजता आहूता पुष्करेषु वै । सुप्रभा नाम राजेन्द्र नाम्ना तत्र सरस्वती ॥
data.md: Summoned at Pushkara by the grandfather engaged in the celebration of a sacrifice, Sarasvati, O king came there under the name of Suprava.

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा मुनयस्तुष्टा वेगयुक्तां सरस्वतीम् । पितामहं मानयन्तीं क्रतुं ते बहु मेनिरे ॥
data.md: Seeing Sarasvati pay that regard to the grandfather, the ascetics regarded that sacrifice with great esteem.

data.v: एवमेषा सरिच्छ्रेष्ठा पुष्करेषु सरस्वती । पितामहार्थं संभूता तुष्ट्यर्थं च मनीषिणाम् ॥
data.md: Thus that foremost of rivers, viz., Sarasvati, made her appearance at Pushkara for pleasing the grandfather and the ascetics.

data.v: नैमिषे मुनयो राजन्समागम्य समासते । तत्र चित्राः कथा ह्यासन्वेदं प्रति जनेश्वर ॥
data.md: On another occasion, O king many Munis assembled at Naimisha. They had many discussions amongst them, O king, on the Vedas.

data.v: तत्र ते मुनयो ह्यासन्नानास्वाध्यायवेदिनः । ते समागम्य मुनयः सस्मरुर्वै सरस्वतीम् ॥
data.md: There those ascetics, conversant with various scriptures, thought of the Sarasvati.

data.v: सा तु ध्याता महाराज ऋषिभिः सत्रयाजिभिः । समागतानां राजेन्द्र सहायार्थं महात्मनाम् । आजगाम महाभागा तत्र पुण्या सरस्वती ॥
data.md: Thus thought of, O king, by those Rishis performing a sacrifice, the highly blessed and sacred Sarasvati, for helping those great Munis, made her appearance at Naimisha and was accordingly called Kanchanakshi.

data.v: नैमिषे काञ्चनाक्षी तु मुनीनां सत्रयाजिनाम् । आगता सरितां श्रेष्ठा तत्र भारत पूजिता ॥
गयस्य यजमानस्य गयेष्वेव महाक्रतुम् । आहूता सरितां श्रेष्ठा गययज्ञे सरस्वती ॥
data.md: Worshipped of all, that best of rivers, thus came there, O Bharata. While king Gaya was engaged in the celebration of a great sacrifice at Gaya the foremost of rivers, Sarasvati, summoned at Gaya's sacrifice, came there. The Rishis of rigid vows, that were present there, named her Vishala at Gaya.

data.v: विशालां तु गयेष्वाहुरृषयः संशितव्रताः । सरित्सा हिमवत्पार्श्वात्प्रसूता शीघ्रगामिनी ॥
औद्दालकेस्तथा यज्ञे यजतस्तत्र भारत । समेते सर्वतः स्फीते मुनीनां मण्डले तदा ॥
उत्तरे कोसलाभागे पुण्ये राजन्महात्मनः । औद्दालकेन यजता पूर्वं ध्याता सरस्वती ॥
आजगाम सरिच्छ्रेष्ठा तं देशमृषिकारणात् । पूज्यमाना मुनिगणैर्वल्कलाजिनसंवृतैः । मनोह्रदेति विख्याता सा हि तैर्मनसा हृता ॥
सुवेणुरृषभद्वीपे पुण्ये राजर्षिसेविते । कुरोश्च यजमानस्य कुरुक्षेत्रे महात्मनः । आजगाम महाभागा सरिच्छ्रेष्ठा सरस्वती ॥
data.md: While, again the great Kuru was engaged in a sacrifice at Kurukshetra, that foremost of rivers, the highly sacred Sarasvati, came there.

data.v: ओघवत्यपि राजेन्द्र वसिष्ठेन महात्मना । समाहूता कुरुक्षेत्रे दिव्यतोया सरस्वती ॥
data.md: Summoned, O king, by the great Vashishtha who assisted Kuru in his sacrifice, the Sarasvati, of celestial water, came to Kurukshetra and passed by the name of Oghavati.

data.v: दक्षेण यजता चापि गङ्गाद्वारे सरस्वती । विमलोदा भगवती ब्रह्मणा यजता पुनः । समाहूता ययौ तत्र पुण्ये हैमवते गिरौ ॥
data.md: Once again, while Brahınan was engaged in a sacrifice on the sacred forest of the Himavat mountains, the worshipful Sarasvati, summoned by him, came there.

data.v: एकीभूतास्ततस्तास्तु तस्मिंस्तीर्थे समागताः । सप्तसारस्वतं तीर्थं ततस्तत्प्रथितं भुवि ॥
data.md: All these seven streams then came and joined together in that tirtha where Baladeva came. And because the seven joined together at that spot, therefore is that tirtha known on earth by the name of Sapta-Sarasvati.

data.v: इति सप्त सरस्वत्यो नामतः परिकीर्तिताः । सप्तसारस्वतं चैव तीर्थं पुण्यं तथा स्मृतम् ॥
data.md: Thus have I described to you the seven Sarasvatis, according to their names. I have also given you an account of the sacred tirtha called Satpa-Sarasvat.

data.v: शृणु मङ्कणकस्यापि कौमारब्रह्मचारिणः । आपगामवगाढस्य राजन्प्रक्रीडितं महत् ॥
दृष्ट्वा यदृच्छया तत्र स्त्रियमम्भसि भारत । स्नायन्तीं रुचिरापाङ्गीं दिग्वाससमनिन्दिताम् । सरस्वत्यां महाराज चस्कन्दे वीर्यमम्भसि ॥
data.md: Listen now to a great deed of Mankanaka, who had from his youth led the life of a Brahmacharin. While perforining his abolutions in the river, he saw one day, O Bharata, a damsel of beautiful features and fair brows, bathing in the river with her body uncovered. At this sight, O monarch, the seminal fluid of the Rishi dropped to the Sarasvati.

data.v: तद्रेतः स तु जग्राह कलशे वै महातपाः । सप्तधा प्रविभागं तु कलशस्थं जगाम ह । तत्रर्षयः सप्त जाता जज्ञिरे मरुतां गणाः ॥
data.md: The great ascetic took it up and kept it within his earthen pot. Deposited within that pot, the fluid was divided into seven parts.

data.v: वायुवेगो वायुबलो वायुहा वायुमण्डलः । वायुज्वालो वायुरेता वायुचक्रश्च वीर्यवान् । एवमेते समुत्पन्ना मरुतां जनयिष्णवः ॥
data.md: From those seven portions were born seven Rishis, from whom originated the forty nine Maruts. The Rishis named Vayuvega, Vayuhan, Vayumandala, Vayujata, Vayuretas, Vayuchakra. Thus were born those progenitors of the various Maruts.

data.v: इदमन्यच्च राजेन्द्र शृण्वाश्चर्यतरं भुवि । महर्षेश्चरितं यादृक्त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतम् ॥
data.md: Hear now of a more wonderful account O king, of a highly marvellous conduct of that great Rishi which is well known in the three worlds.

data.v: पुरा मङ्कणकः सिद्धः कुशाग्रेणेति नः श्रुतम् । क्षतः किल करे राजंस्तस्य शाकरसोऽस्रवत् । स वि शाकरसं दृष्ट्वा हर्षाविष्टः प्रनृत्तवान् ॥
data.md: Formerly, after Mankanaka had become Successful, O king, his hand became pierced seven were with a Kusha blade. Thereupon a vegetable juice came out of the wound and not blood.

data.v: ततस्तस्मिन्प्रनृत्ते वै स्थावरं जङ्गमं च यत् । प्रनृत्तमुभयं वीर तेजसा तस्य मोहितम् ॥
ब्रह्मादिभिः सुरै राजन्नृषिभिश्च तपोधनैः । विज्ञप्तो वै महादेव ऋषेरर्थे नराधिप । नायं नृत्येद्यथा देव तथा त्वं कर्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Then the celestials with Brahma at their head and the Rishis, having asceticism for their wealth, O king, all approached Mahadeva and informed him of the doings of the Rishi (Mankanaka). And they said to him-Thou shouldst, O god, do that which may prevent the Rishi from dancing."

data.v: ततो देवो मुनिं दृष्ट्वा हर्षाविष्टमतीव ह । सुराणां हितकामार्थं महादेवोऽभ्यभाषत ॥
data.md: Then Mahadeva, seeing the Rishi filled with great joy and desirous of doing good to the celestials addressed him, saying.

data.v: भो भो ब्राह्मण धर्मज्ञ किमर्थं नरिनर्त्सि वै । हर्षस्थानं किमर्थं वै तवेदं मुनिसत्तम । तपस्विनो धर्मपथे स्थितस्य द्विजसत्तम ॥
data.md: Why, O Brahmana, do you dance in this way, you who know your duties well? What must be the cause of your joy, O sage, that being an ascetic, ( best of Brahmanas and walking in the path of virtue you should behave in this way?

data.v: किं न पश्यसि मे ब्रह्मन्कराच्छाकरसं स्रुतम् । यं दृष्ट्वा वै प्रनृत्तोऽहं हर्षेण महता विभो ॥
data.md: The Rishi said Do you not see that a vegetable juice is flowing from this my wound? Seeing this, O lord, I am dancing in great glee.

data.v: तं प्रहस्याब्रवीद्देवो मुनिं रागेण मोहितम् । अहं न विस्मयं विप्र गच्छामीति प्रपश्य माम् ॥
data.md: Laughing at the Rishi who was overpowered by passion, the god said-"I do not, O Brahmana, at all wonder at this. Behold me!"

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा मुनिश्रेष्ठं महादेवेन धीमता । अङ्गुल्यग्रेण राजेन्द्र स्वाङ्गुष्ठस्ताडितोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: Having said this to that best of Rishis, the highly intelligent Mahadeva struck his thumb with the end of one of his fingers.

data.v: ततो भस्म क्षताद्राजन्निर्गतं हिमसंनिभम् । तद्दृष्ट्वा व्रीडितो राजन्स मुनिः पादयोर्गतः ॥
data.md: Thereupon, O king, ashes, white as snow, came out of that wound. Beholding this, the Rishi became ashamed, O monarch and fell at the feet of the God.

data.v: नान्यं देवादहं मन्ये रुद्रात्परतरं महत् । सुरासुरस्य जगतो गतिस्त्वमसि शूलधृक् ॥
data.md: He understood the deity to be none else than Mahadeva. Filled with wonder he said-"I do not think that thou art any one save Rudra, the great and Supreme being.

data.v: त्वया सृष्टमिदं विश्वं वदन्तीह मनीषिणः । त्वामेव सर्वं विशति पुनरेव युगक्षये ॥
data.md: O wielder of the trident, thou art the refuge of this universe consisting of gods and demons. The wise say that this universe has been created by you.

data.v: देवैरपि न शक्यस्त्वं परिज्ञातुं कुतो मया । त्वयि सर्वे स्म दृश्यन्ते सुरा ब्रह्मादयोऽनघ ॥
data.md: At the universal dissolution, everything once more enters thee. Thou art incapable of being known by the celestials, how then canst thou be known by me?

data.v: सर्वस्त्वमसि देवानां कर्ता कारयिता च ह । त्वत्प्रसादात्सुराः सर्वे मोदन्तीहाकुतोभयाः ॥
data.md: All creatures of the universe are seen in thee. The gods with Brahma at their head worship thee who dust give boons, O sinless one.

data.v: एवं स्तुत्वा महादेवं स ऋषिः प्रणतोऽब्रवीत् । भगवंस्त्वत्प्रसादाद्वै तपो मे न क्षरेदिति ॥
ततो देवः प्रीतमनास्तमृषिं पुनरब्रवीत् । तपस्ते वर्धतां विप्र मत्प्रसादात्सहस्रधा । आश्रमे चेह वत्स्यामि त्वया सार्धमहं सदा ॥
data.md: Let not my ridiculous childishness, that I displayed, O god, destroy my ascetic merit. I pray to thee for this. The god cheerfully replied-"Let your asceticism increase a thousand fold, O Brahmana, through my grace, I shall also always live with you in this hermitage."

data.v: सप्तसारस्वते चास्मिन्यो मामर्चिष्यते नरः । न तस्य दुर्लभं किंचिद्भवितेह परत्र च । सारस्वतं च लोकं ते गमिष्यन्ति न संशयः ॥
data.md: The man that will adore me in this Pritha, viz., Sapta-sarasvat, will attain everything here or hereafter. Forsooth, such a one shall go to the region called Sarasvat in heaven, after death.

data.v: एतन्मङ्कणकस्यापि चरितं भूरितेजसः । स हि पुत्रः सजन्यायामुत्पन्नो मातरिश्वना ॥
data.md: This is the history of Mankanaka. He was begotten by the god of wind upon Sukanya.

data.v: उषित्वा तत्र रामस्तु संपूज्याश्रमवासिनः । तथा मङ्कणके प्रीतिं शुभां चक्रे हलायुधः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Having passed one night there, Rama, having the plough for his weapon, adored the dwellers of that tirtha and showed great respect for Mankanaka.

data.v: दत्त्वा दानं द्विजातिभ्यो रजनीं तामुपोष्य च । पूजितो मुनिसंघैश्च प्रातरुत्थाय लाङ्गली ॥
data.md: Having distributed wealth amongst the Brahmanas and passed the night there the hero, having the plough for his weapon, was adored by the ascetics. Rising up in the morning, he took leave of all the ascetics and having touched the sacred water, O Bharata, started quickly for other tirthas.

data.v: अनुज्ञाप्य मुनीन्सर्वान्स्पृष्ट्वा तोयं च भारत । प्रययौ त्वरितो रामस्तीर्थहेतोर्महाबलः ॥
data.md: Having distributed wealth amongst the Brahmanas and passed the night there the hero, having the plough for his weapon, was adored by the ascetics. Rising up in the morning, he took leave of all the ascetics and having touched the sacred water, O Bharata, started quickly for other tirthas.

data.v: तत औशनसं तीर्थमाजगाम हलायुधः । कपालमोचनं नाम यत्र मुक्तो महामुनिः ॥
महता शिरसा राजन्ग्रस्तजङ्घो महोदरः । राक्षसस्य महाराज रामक्षिप्तस्य वै पुरा ॥
data.md: Baladeva then went to the tirtha known by the name of Ushanas. It is also called Kapalamochana. Formerly, Rama (the son of Dasharatha) slew a Rakshasa and threw his head to a great distance. That head, O king, fell upon the thigh of a great sage named Mahodara and struck to it. Bathing in this tirtha, the great Rishi was freed from that burthen. The great (Shukra) had practised his ascetic penances there.

data.v: तत्र पूर्वं तपस्तप्तं काव्येन सुमहात्मना । यत्रास्य नीतिरखिला प्रादुर्भूता महात्मनः । तत्रस्थश्चिन्तयामास दैत्यदानवविग्रहम् ॥
data.md: It was there that the science of politics and morals, .that passes by Shukra's name, was revealed to him. While living there. Shukra meditated upon the war of the Daityas and the Danavas.

data.v: तत्प्राप्य च बलो राजंस्तीर्थप्रवरमुत्तमम् । विधिवद्धि ददौ वित्तं ब्राह्मणानां महात्मनाम् ॥
data.md: Arrived at that foremost of tirthas Baladeva, O king, duly made presents of the great Brahmanas.

data.v: कपालमोचनं ब्रह्मन्कथं यत्र महामुनिः । मुक्तः कथं चास्य शिरो लग्नं केन च हेतुना ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said Why is it called Kapalamochana, where the great Muni became freed (from the Rakshasa's head)? Why and how did that head stick to his thigh?"

data.v: पुरा वै दण्डकारण्ये राघवेण महात्मना । वसता राजशार्दूल राक्षसास्तत्र हिंसिताः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "Formerly, O foremost of king, the great Rama (the son of Dasharatha) lived for sometime in the forest of Dandaka, for killing the Rakshasas.

data.v: जनस्थाने शिरश्छिन्नं राक्षसस्य दुरात्मनः । क्षुरेण शितधारेण तत्पपात महावने ॥
data.md: At Janasthana he sundered the head of a wicked Rakshasa with highly sharp razorheaded arrow. That head dropped in the deep forest.

data.v: महोदरस्य तल्लग्नं जङ्घायां वै यदृच्छया । वने विचरतो राजन्नस्थि भित्त्वास्फुरत्तदा ॥
data.md: That head, coursing at will through the sky, fell upon the thigh of Mahodara while the latter was walking in the woods. Piercing his thigh, O king, it stuck to it and remained there.

data.v: स तेन लग्नेन तदा द्विजातिर्न शशाक ह । अभिगन्तुं महाप्राज्ञस्तीर्थान्यायतनानि च ॥
स पूतिना विस्रवता वेदनार्तो महामुनिः । जगाम सर्वतीर्थानि पृथिव्यामिति नः श्रुतम् ॥
स गत्वा सरितः सर्वाः समुद्रांश्च महातपाः । कथयामास तत्सर्वमृषीणां भावितात्मनाम् ॥
data.md: Thus freed, after returning to his sacred hermitage the great ascetic, spoke of what had taken place to those Rishis of pure souls.

data.v: आप्लुतः सर्वतीर्थेषु न च मोक्षमवाप्तवान् । स तु शुश्राव विप्रेन्द्रो मुनीनां वचनं महत् ॥
सरस्वत्यास्तीर्थवरं ख्यातमौशनसं तदा । सर्वपापप्रशमनं सिद्धक्षेत्रमनुत्तमम् ॥
स तु गत्वा ततस्तत्र तीर्थमौशनसं द्विजः । तत औशनसे तीर्थे तस्योपस्पृशतस्तदा । तच्छिरश्चरणं मुक्त्वा पपातान्तर्जले तदा ॥
data.md: Then repairing to that Ushanasa tirtha, that Brahmana bathed in its waters. Thereat the Rakshasa's head, leaving the thigh, dropped into the water.

data.v: ततः स विरुजो राजन्पूतात्मा वीतकल्मषः । आजगामाश्रमं प्रीतः कृतकृत्यो महोदरः ॥
data.md: Then, O king, freed from the Rakshasa's head Mahodara gladly returned, with purified soul and all his sins cleansed, to his hermitage after attaining success.

data.v: सोऽथ गत्वाश्रमं पुण्यं विप्रमुक्तो महातपाः । कथयामास तत्सर्वमृषीणां भावितात्मनाम् ॥
data.md: Thus freed, after returning to his sacred hermitage the great ascetic, spoke of what had taken place to those Rishis of pure souls.

data.v: ते श्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य ततस्तीर्थस्य मानद । कपालमोचनमिति नाम चक्रुः समागताः ॥
data.md: Having heard his story, those Rishis conferred the name of Kapalamochana on the tirtha.

data.v: तत्र दत्त्वा बहून्दायान्विप्रान्संपूज्य माधवः । जगाम वृष्णिप्रवरो रुषङ्गोराश्रमं तदा ॥
data.md: Having distributed much wealth amongst the Brahmanas and worshipped them, Baladeva then went to the hermitage of Rushangu.

data.v: यत्र तप्तं तपो घोरमार्ष्टिषेणेन भारत । ब्राह्मण्यं लब्धवांस्तत्र विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः ॥
data.md: There, O Bharata, Arshtishena had in days of yore practised austerest of penances. There the great (Kshatriya) Muni Muni Vishvamitra became a Brahmana.

data.v: ततो हलधरः श्रीमान्ब्राह्मणैः परिवारितः । जगाम यत्र राजेन्द्र रुषङ्गुस्तनुमत्यजत् ॥
data.md: Surrounded by Brahmanas, then the beautiful Baladeva went to that spot, O king, where Rushangu had, formerly, renounced his body.

data.v: रुषङ्गुर्ब्राह्मणो वृद्धस्तपोनित्यश्च भारत । देहन्यासे कृतमना विचिन्त्य बहुधा बहु ॥
data.md: Rushangu, O Bharata, was an old Brahmana always devoted to penances. Determined to renounce his body, he thought for a long while.

data.v: ततः सर्वानुपादाय तनयान्वै महातपाः । रुषङ्गुरब्रवीत्तत्र नयध्वं मा पृथूदकम् ॥
data.md: A great ascetic as he was, he then summoned all his sons and asked them to take him to a spot where there was profuse water.

data.v: विज्ञायातीतवयसं रुषङ्गुं ते तपोधनाः । तं वै तीर्थमुपानिन्युः सरस्वत्यास्तपोधनम् ॥
data.md: Knowing their father had become very old, those ascetics took him to a tirtha on the Sarasvati.

data.v: स तैः पुत्रैस्तदा धीमानानीतो वै सरस्वतीम् । पुण्यां तीर्थशतोपेतां विप्रसंघैर्निषेविताम् ॥
स तत्र विधिना राजन्नाप्लुतः सुमहातपाः । ज्ञात्वा तीर्थगुणांश्चैव प्राहेदमृषिसत्तमः । सुप्रीतः पुरुषव्याघ्र सर्वान्पुत्रानुपासतः ॥
सरस्वत्युत्तरे तीरे यस्त्यजेदात्मनस्तनुम् । पृथूदके जप्यपरो नैनं श्वोमरणं तपेत् ॥
तत्राप्लुत्य स धर्मात्मा उपस्पृश्य हलायुधः । दत्त्वा चैव बहून्दायान्विप्राणां विप्रवत्सलः ॥
ससर्ज यत्र भगवाँल्लोकाँल्लोकपितामहः । यत्रार्ष्टिषेणः कौरव्य ब्राह्मण्यं संशितव्रतः । तपसा महता राजन्प्राप्तवानृषिसत्तमः ॥
data.md: Touching the water of that tirtha and bathing in it, the righteous Baladeva distributed wealth amongst the Brahmanas.

data.v: सिन्धुद्वीपश्च राजर्षिर्देवापिश्च महातपाः । ब्राह्मण्यं लब्धवान्यत्र विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । महातपस्वी भगवानुग्रतेजा महातपाः ॥
data.md: Possessed of great might and great prowess, Baladeva then proceeded to that tirtha where the worshipful Brahma had created the mountains called Lokaloka and where that best of Rishis, Arshtishena, of rigid vows, had by hard penances acquired the dignity of Brahmana-hood and where the royal saint Sindhudvipa and the great ascetic Devapi and the worshipful and illustrious Vishvamitra of hard penances and fierce energy, had all acquired a similar dignity.

data.v: तत्राजगाम बलवान्बलभद्रः प्रतापवान् ॥
कथमार्ष्टिषेणो भगवान्विपुलं तप्तवांस्तपः । सिन्धुद्वीपः कथं चापि ब्राह्मण्यं लब्धवांस्तदा ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said "Why did the worshipful Arshtishena practise the severest of penances? How also did Sindhudvipa acquire the dignity of a Brahmana?

data.v: देवापिश्च कथं ब्रह्मन्विश्वामित्रश्च सत्तम । तन्ममाचक्ष्व भगवन्परं कौतूहलं हि मे ॥
data.md: How also did Devapi, O Brahmana and how did Vishvamitra, O best of men, become Brahmanas. Tell me all this, O worshipful One! Great is my curiosity to hear of all this."

data.v: पुरा कृतयुगे राजन्नार्ष्टिषेणो द्विजोत्तमः । वसन्गुरुकुले नित्यं नित्यमध्ययने रतः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "Formerly, in the Krita age, O king, there was a great Rishi called Arshtishena. Living in his preceptor's house, he attended to his lessons every day.

data.v: तस्य राजन्गुरुकुले वसतो नित्यमेव ह । समाप्तिं नागमद्विद्या नापि वेदा विशां पते ॥
data.md: Although, O king, he lived long in the residence of his preceptor, he could not master any branch of learning or the Vedas, O monarch.

data.v: स निर्विण्णस्ततो राजंस्तपस्तेपे महातपाः । ततो वै तपसा तेन प्राप्य वेदाननुत्तमान् ॥
data.md: Greatly disappointed, O king, the great ascetic practised very rigid penances. By his penances he afterwards acquired the mastery of the Vedas which is best of all forms of learning.

data.v: स विद्वान्वेदयुक्तश्च सिद्धश्चाप्यृषिसत्तमः । तत्र तीर्थे वरान्प्रादात्त्रीनेव सुमहातपाः ॥
data.md: Acquiring great learning and a mastery of the Vedas, that best of Rishis became highly successful in that tirtha. He then conferred three boons on that place.

data.v: अस्मिंस्तीर्थे महानद्या अद्यप्रभृति मानवः । आप्लुतो वाजिमेधस्य फलं प्राप्नोति पुष्कलम् ॥
data.md: He said-"From this day, a person, by bathing in this tirtha of the great river Sarasvati, shall reap the great fruit of a horse sacrifice.

data.v: अद्यप्रभृति नैवात्र भयं व्यालाद्भविष्यति । अपि चाल्पेन यत्नेन फलं प्राप्स्यति पुष्कलम् ॥
data.md: From this day there will be no fear in this tirtha from serpents and wild beasts. By the slightest of endeavours, again, one shall reap great results here."

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा जगाम त्रिदिवं मुनिः । एवं सिद्धः स भगवानार्ष्टिषेणः प्रतापवान् ॥
data.md: Having said these words, that energetic Rishi proceeded to heaven. Thus the worshipful Arshtishena became successful.

data.v: तस्मिन्नेव तदा तीर्थे सिन्धुद्वीपः प्रतापवान् । देवापिश्च महाराज ब्राह्मण्यं प्रापतुर्महत् ॥
data.md: In that very tirtha, in the Krita age th greatly energetic Sindhudvipa and Devapi also, had acquired the dignity of Brahman-hood.

data.v: तथा च कौशिकस्तात तपोनित्यो जितेन्द्रियः । तपसा वै सुतप्तेन ब्राह्मणत्वमवाप्तवान् ॥
data.md: Similarly Kushika's ascetic son, having controlled his senses and practised austerities became a Brahmana.

data.v: गाधिर्नाम महानासीत्क्षत्रियः प्रथितो भुवि । तस्य पुत्रोऽभवद्राजन्विश्वामित्रः प्रतापवान् ॥
data.md: There was a great Kshatriya, celebrated over the world, by the name of Gadhi. He had a son by the name of Vishvamitra of great prowess.

data.v: स राजा कौशिकस्तात महायोग्यभवत्किल । स पुत्रमभिषिच्याथ विश्वामित्रं महातपाः ॥
देहन्यासे मनश्चक्रे तमूचुः प्रणताः प्रजाः । न गन्तव्यं महाप्राज्ञ त्राहि चास्मान्महाभयात् ॥
data.md: King Kaushika became a great ascetic. Possessed of great ascetic merit, he wished to place his son Vishvamitra on his throne, himself having made up his mind to renounce his body. His subjects, bowing unto him, said-You should not go away, O you of great wisdom and protect us from a great fear.'

data.v: एवमुक्तः प्रत्युवाच ततो गाधिः प्रजास्तदा । विश्वस्य जगतो गोप्ता भविष्यति सुतो मम ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, Gadhi replied to his subjects, saying-"My son will be the protector of the vest universe.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा तु ततो गाधिर्विश्वामित्रं निवेश्य च । जगाम त्रिदिवं राजन्विश्वामित्रोऽभवन्नृपः । न च शक्नोति पृथिवीं यत्नवानपि रक्षितुम् ॥
data.md: Having said these words and placed Vishvamitra on the throne, Gadhi, O king ascended heaven and Vishvainitra became king. He could not, however, protect the earth even trying his level best.

data.v: ततः शुश्राव राजा स राक्षसेभ्यो महाभयम् । निर्ययौ नगराच्चापि चतुरङ्गबलान्वितः ॥
data.md: The king then heard of the fear of Rakshasa in his kingdom. With his fourfold forces, he went out of his capital.

data.v: स गत्वा दूरमध्वानं वसिष्ठाश्रममभ्ययात् । तस्य ते सैनिका राजंश्चक्रुस्तत्रानयान्बहून् ॥
data.md: Having proceeded far on his way, he reached the hermitage of Vashishtha. His troops, O king, caused immense mischief there.

data.v: ततस्तु भगवान्विप्रो वसिष्ठोऽऽश्रममभ्ययात् । ददृशे च ततः सर्वं भज्यमानं महावनम् ॥
data.md: The worshipful Brahman Vashishtha, when he came to his hermitage, saw the vast forest devastated.

data.v: तस्य क्रुद्धो महाराज वसिष्ठो मुनिसत्तमः । सृजस्व शबरान्घोरानिति स्वां गामुवाच ह ॥
data.md: That best of Rishis, viz., Vashishtha O king, became angry with Vishvamitra. He commanded his own sacrificial cow, saying "Create a number of terrible Shavaras.

data.v: तथोक्ता सासृजद्धेनुः पुरुषान्घोरदर्शनान् । ते च तद्बलमासाद्य बभञ्जुः सर्वतोदिशम् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed the cow created a number of men of terrific visages. These fought with the army of Vishvamitra and made a great onslaught.

data.v: तद्दृष्ट्वा विद्रुतं सैन्यं विश्वामित्रस्तु गाधिजः । तपः परं मन्यमानस्तपस्येव मनो दधे ॥
data.md: Seeing this, the troops fled away. Regarding ascetic austerities highly efficacious, Vishvamitra, the son of Gadhi made up his mind to practise the same.

data.v: सोऽस्मिंस्तीर्थवरे राजन्सरस्वत्याः समाहितः । नियमैश्चोपवासैश्च कर्शयन्देहमात्मनः ॥
data.md: In this best of tirthas of the Sarasvati, O king, he began to emaciate his own body by Vows and fasts.

data.v: जलाहारो वायुभक्षः पर्णाहारश्च सोऽभवत् । तथा स्थण्डिलशायी च ये चान्ये नियमाः पृथक् ॥
data.md: He lived on water, air and the fallen leaves of trees. He slept on the naked earth and practised other vows of the ascetics.

data.v: असकृत्तस्य देवास्तु व्रतविघ्नं प्रचक्रिरे । न चास्य नियमाद्बुद्धिरपयाति महात्मनः ॥
data.md: The celestials repeatedly attempted for obstructing the observance of his vows. He, however, did not desist from practising his promised vow.

data.v: ततः परेण यत्नेन तप्त्वा बहुविधं तपः । तेजसा भास्कराकारो गाधिजः समपद्यत ॥
data.md: Then having practised various austerities with great devotion, the son of Gadhi became effulgent like the Sun himself.

data.v: तपसा तु तथा युक्तं विश्वामित्रं पितामहः । अमन्यत महातेजा वरदो वरमस्य तत् ॥
data.md: The boon-giving Brahmana, of great energy, resolved to grant Vishvamitra, when he had succeeded in his ascetic observances, the boon the latter wanted.

data.v: स तु वव्रे वरं राजन्स्यामहं ब्राह्मणस्त्विति । तथेति चाब्रवीद्ब्रह्मा सर्वलोकपितामहः ॥
data.md: The boon that Vishvamitra prayed for was that he should be permitted to become a Brahmana. Brahmana, the grandfather of all the worlds, said to him-"So be it.'

data.v: स लब्ध्वा तपसोग्रेण ब्राह्मणत्वं महायशाः । विचचार महीं कृत्स्नां कृतकामः सुरोपमः ॥
data.md: Having by his severe penances gained the status of Brahman-hood, the illustrious Vishvamitra, after the fulfillment of his desire, traveled over the whole earth like a god.

data.v: तस्मिंस्तीर्थवरे रामः प्रदाय विविधं वसु । पयस्विनीस्तथा धेनूर्यानानि शयनानि च ॥
तथा वस्त्राण्यलंकारं भक्ष्यं पेयं च शोभनम् । अददान्मुदितो राजन्पूजयित्वा द्विजोत्तमान् ॥
data.md: Distributing various sorts of wealth in that best of tirthas, Rama also gladly gave away milch cows, vehicles, beds, ornaments, food and drink of the best kinds, O king, to many foremost of Brahmanas, after having adored them dully.

data.v: ययौ राजंस्ततो रामो बकस्याश्रममन्तिकात् । यत्र तेपे तपस्तीव्रं दाल्भ्यो बक इति श्रुतिः ॥
data.md: Then, O king, Rama proceeded to the hermitage of Vaka which was not very far from where he was, the hermitage in which, as heard by us, Dalvya-vaka had practised the hardest of penances.”

data.v: ब्रह्मयोनिभिराकीर्णं जगाम यदुनन्दनः । यत्र दाल्भ्यो बको राजन्पश्वर्थं सुमहातपाः । जुहाव धृतराष्ट्रस्य राष्ट्रं वैचित्रवीर्यिणः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "That delighter of the Yadus then proceeded to the hermitage (of Vaka) resonant with the chaunting of the Vedas. There the great ascetic, O king, named Dalvya-vaka, poured the kingdom of Dhritarashtra, the son of Vichitravirya, as a libation (on the sacrificial fire). By practising hard penances he emaciated his own body. The greatly energetic and virtuous Rishi did it being worked up with great wrath.
