data.md: Hearing these words of that compassionate Rishi, the river began to think, O Kuru-chief, as to what she should do.

data.v: तस्याश्चिन्ता समुत्पन्ना वसिष्ठो मय्यतीव हि । कृतवान्हि दयां नित्यं तस्य कार्यं हितं मया ॥
data.md: The thought Vashishtha shows great mercy for me. It is proper for me that I should serve him.'

data.v: अथ कूले स्वके राजञ्जपन्तमृषिसत्तमम् । जुह्वानं कौशिकं प्रेक्ष्य सरस्वत्यभ्यचिन्तयत् ॥
data.md: Seeing then that best of Rishis, viz., Vashishtha engaged in silent recitation of Mantras on her bank and seeing Kushika's son Vishvamitra also engaged in homa, Sarasvati thought, this is my opportunity.' Then that foremost of rivers, by her current, washed away one of her banks.

data.v: इदमन्तरमित्येव ततः सा सरितां वरा । कूलापहारमकरोत्स्वेन वेगेन सा सरित् ॥
तेन कूलापहारेण मैत्रावरुणिरौह्यत । उह्यमानश्च तुष्टाव तदा राजन्सरस्वतीम् ॥
पितामहस्य सरसः प्रवृत्तासि सरस्वति । व्याप्तं चेदं जगत्सर्वं तवैवाम्भोभिरुत्तमैः ॥
data.md: In washing away that bank, she carried away Vashishtha. While being borne away. ) king, Vashishtha lauded the river saying: "From Brahma's Manasa-lake you have originated, O Sarasvati! The entire carth is filled with thy pure waters!

data.v: त्वमेवाकाशगा देवि मेघेषूत्सृजसे पयः । सर्वाश्चापस्त्वमेवेति त्वत्तो वयमधीमहे ॥
data.md: Passing through the sky, O Goddess, thou impartest thy waters to the clouds! All the waters are thee! Through thee we exercise our thinking faculties!

data.v: पुष्टिर्द्युतिस्तथा कीर्तिः सिद्धिर्वृद्धिरुमा तथा । त्वमेव वाणी स्वाहा त्वं त्वय्यायत्तमिदं जगत् । त्वमेव सर्वभूतेषु वससीह चतुर्विधा ॥
data.md: Thou art Pushti and Dyuti, Kiriti and Siddhi and Uma! Thou art Speech and thou art Svaha! This entire universe depends on thee. Thou dwellest in all creatures, in four forms."

data.v: एवं सरस्वती राजन्स्तूयमाना महर्षिणा । वेगेनोवाह तं विप्रं विश्वामित्राश्रमं प्रति । न्यवेदयत चाभीक्ष्णं विश्वामित्राय तं मुनिम् ॥
data.md: Thus lauded by that great Rishi, Sarasvati, O king, speedily bore that Brahmana towards the hermitage of Vishvamitra and repeatedly announced to the latter the arrival of the former.

data.v: तमानीतं सरस्वत्या दृष्ट्वा कोपसमन्वितः । अथान्वेषत्प्रहरणं वसिष्ठान्तकरं तदा ॥
data.md: Seeing Vashishtha thus brought before him by Sarasvati, Vishvamitra, worked up with ire, began to look for a weapon where with to kill that Brahmana.

data.v: तं तु क्रुद्धमभिप्रेक्ष्य ब्रह्महत्याभयान्नदी । अपोवाह वसिष्ठं तु प्राचीं दिशमतन्द्रिता । उभयोः कुर्वती वाक्यं वञ्चयित्वा तु गाधिजम् ॥
data.md: Seeing him wrathful, the river, fearing to behold a Brahmana's slaughter, quickly bore Vashishtha away to her eastern bank once more. She thus had obeyed the words of both, although she deceived Vishvamitra by her act.

data.v: ततोऽपवाहितं दृष्ट्वा वसिष्ठमृषिसत्तमम् । अब्रवीदथ संक्रुद्धो विश्वामित्रो ह्यमर्षणः ॥
data.md: Seeing that best of Rishis, viz., Vashishtha, borne away, the vindictive Vishvamitra becoming enraged addressed Sarasvati, saying

data.v: यस्मान्मा त्वं सरिच्छ्रेष्ठे वञ्चयित्वा पुनर्गता । शोणितं वह कल्याणि रक्षोग्रामणिसंमतम् ॥
data.md: Since, O best of rivers, thou hast gone away and deceived me, let thy current be changed into blood liked of Rakshasas!'

data.v: ततः सरस्वती शप्ता विश्वामित्रेण धीमता । अवहच्छोणितोन्मिश्रं तोयं संवत्सरं तदा ॥
data.md: Thus cursed by the intelligent Vishvamitra, Sarasvati flowed for a whole year, bearing blood mixed with water.

data.v: अथर्षयश्च देवाश्च गन्धर्वाप्सरसस्तथा । सरस्वतीं तथा दृष्ट्वा बभूवुर्भृशदुःखिताः ॥
data.md: Beholding the Sarasvati in that plights the gods, the Gandharvas and the Apsaras became filled with great sorrow.

data.v: एवं वसिष्ठापवाहो लोके ख्यातो जनाधिप । आगच्छच्च पुनर्मार्गं स्वमेव सरितां वरा ॥
data.md: For this reason, O king, the tirtha passed by the name of Vashishthapavaha on Earth. The best of rivers, however, once more regained her own proper condition.

data.v: सा शप्ता तेन क्रुद्धेन विश्वामित्रेण धीमता । तस्मिंस्तीर्थवरे शुभ्रे शोणितं समुपावहत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "Cursed by the intelligent Vishvamitra in anger, Sarasvati, in that sacred and best of tirthas, flowed in bloody current.

data.v: अथाजग्मुस्ततो राजन्राक्षसास्तत्र भारत । तत्र ते शोणितं सर्वे पिबन्तः सुखमासते ॥
data.md: Then, O king, many Rakshasas come and lived happily there, drinking the blood that flowed.

data.v: तृप्ताश्च सुभृशं तेन सुखिता विगतज्वराः । नृत्यन्तश्च हसन्तश्च यथा स्वर्गजितस्तथा ॥
data.md: Highly pleased with that blood, cheerfully and without anxiety of any kind, they danced and laughed there like persons that have (by virtue) attained to heaven.

data.v: कस्यचित्त्वथ कालस्य ऋषयः सतपोधनाः । तीर्थयात्रां समाजग्मुः सरस्वत्यां महीपते ॥
data.md: After some time had passed away, some Rishis, having asceticism for their wealth, came to the Sarasvati, O king, on pilgrimage.

data.v: तेषु सर्वेषु तीर्थेषु आप्लुत्य मुनिपुंगवाः । प्राप्य प्रीतिं परां चापि तपोलुब्धा विशारदाः । प्रययुर्हि ततो राजन्येन तीर्थं हि तत्तथा ॥
data.md: Those foremost of ascetics, having bathed in all the tirthas and obtained great delight, became desirous of acquiring more merit. Those learned sages at last came. O king, to that tirtha where the Sarasvati flowed in a bloody current. Those highly blessed Rishis, arriving at that frightful tirtha.

data.v: अथागम्य महाभागास्तत्तीर्थं दारुणं तदा । दृष्ट्वा तोयं सरस्वत्याः शोणितेन परिप्लुतम् । पीयमानं च रक्षोभिर्बहुभिर्नृपसत्तम ॥
data.md: Beheld the water of the Sarasvati mixed with blood and numberless Rakshasas, O king, drinking it.

data.v: तान्दृष्ट्वा राक्षसान्राजन्मुनयः संशितव्रताः । परित्राणे सरस्वत्याः परं यत्नं प्रचक्रिरे ॥
data.md: Seeing those Rakshasas, O king, those ascetics of rigid vows tried much for rescuing the Sarasvati from that condition.

data.v: ते तु सर्वे महाभागाः समागम्य महाव्रताः । आहूय सरितां श्रेष्ठामिदं वचनमब्रुवन् ॥
data.md: Arriving there, those Rishis invoked that foremost of rivers and said to her-"Tell us the reason, O auspicious lady, why this lake in you has been distressed with such a plight. Hearing it, we shall use our efforts to restore its pristine condition.

data.v: कारणं ब्रूहि कल्याणि किमर्थं ते ह्रदो ह्ययम् । एवमाकुलतां यातः श्रुत्वा पास्यामहे वयम् ॥
data.md: Arriving there, those Rishis invoked that foremost of rivers and said to her-"Tell us the reason, O auspicious lady, why this lake in you has been distressed with such a plight. Hearing it, we shall use our efforts to restore its pristine condition.

data.v: ततः सा सर्वमाचष्ट यथावृत्तं प्रवेपती । दुःखितामथ तां दृष्ट्वा त ऊचुर्वै तपोधनाः ॥
data.md: Thus accosted, Sarasvati, trembling as she spoke, informed them of everything that had taken place. Seeing her thus woe-begone, those ascetics told her-

data.v: कारणं श्रुतमस्माभिः शापश्चैव श्रुतोऽनघे । करिष्यन्ति तु यत्प्राप्तं सर्व एव तपोधनाः ॥
data.md: "We have heard of your curse, O sinless lady! All of us shall try."

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा सरिच्छ्रेष्ठामूचुस्तेऽथ परस्परम् । विमोचयामहे सर्वे शापादेतां सरस्वतीम् ॥
data.md: Having said so to that foremost of rivers, they then consulted with one another-"All of us shall release Sarasvati from her curse."

data.v: तेषां तु वचनादेव प्रकृतिस्था सरस्वती । प्रसन्नसलिला जज्ञे यथा पूर्वं तथैव हि । विमुक्ता च सरिच्छ्रेष्ठा विबभौ सा यथा पुरा ॥
दृष्ट्वा तोयं सरस्वत्या मुनिभिस्तैस्तथा कृतम् । कृताञ्जलीस्ततो राजन्राक्षसाः क्षुधयार्दिताः । ऊचुस्तान्वै मुनीन्सर्वान्कृपायुक्तान्पुनः पुनः ॥
वयं हि क्षुधिताश्चैव धर्माद्धीनाश्च शाश्वतात् । न च नः कामकारोऽयं यद्वयं पापकारिणः ॥
युष्माकं चाप्रसादेन दुष्कृतेन च कर्मणा । पक्षोऽयं वर्धतेऽस्माकं यतः स्म ब्रह्मराक्षसाः ॥
एवं हि वैश्यशूद्राणां क्षत्रियाणां तथैव च । ये ब्राह्मणान्प्रद्विषन्ति ते भवन्तीह राक्षसाः ॥
आचार्यमृत्विजं चैव गुरुं वृद्धजनं तथा । प्राणिनो येऽवमन्यन्ते ते भवन्तीह राक्षसाः । योषितां चैव पापानां योनिदोषेण वर्धते ॥
तत्कुरुध्वमिहास्माकं कारुण्यं द्विजसत्तमाः । शक्ता भवन्तः सर्वेषां लोकानामपि तारणे ॥
data.md: O best of Brahmanas, arrange then for our relief. You are capable of saving all the worlds!'

data.v: तेषां ते मुनयः श्रुत्वा तुष्टुवुस्तां महानदीम् । मोक्षार्थं रक्षसां तेषामूचुः प्रयतमानसाः ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of theirs, those ascetics lauded the great river. For the rescue of those Rakshasas, with contracted minds those ascetics said-"The food over which one will sneeze, that in which there are worms and insects, that which may be mixed with refuges of food, that which is mixed with hair, that which is trampled. That which is mixed with tears shall make up the food of these Rakshasas!'

data.v: क्षुतकीटावपन्नं च यच्चोच्छिष्टाशितं भवेत् । केशावपन्नमाधूतमारुग्णमपि यद्भवेत् । श्वभिः संस्पृष्टमन्नं च भागोऽसौ रक्षसामिह ॥
तस्माज्ज्ञात्वा सदा विद्वानेतान्यन्नानि वर्जयेत् । राक्षसान्नमसौ भुङ्क्ते यो भुङ्क्ते ह्यन्नमीदृशम् ॥
data.md: Knowing all this, the learned man shall carefully avoid these kinds of food. He that shall take such food shall be considered as partaking of the food of Rakshasas.'

data.v: शोधयित्वा ततस्तीर्थमृषयस्ते तपोधनाः । मोक्षार्थं राक्षसानां च नदीं तां प्रत्यचोदयन् ॥
data.md: Having thus purified the tirtha, those ascetics thus prayed to that river for the relief of those Rakshasas.

data.v: महर्षीणां मतं ज्ञात्वा ततः सा सरितां वरा । अरुणामानयामास स्वां तनुं पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: Understanding the wishes of those great Rishis, that best of rivers caused her body, O foremost of men, to assume a new forn called Arjuna.

data.v: तस्यां ते राक्षसाः स्नात्वा तनूस्त्यक्त्वा दिवं गताः । अरुणायां महाराज ब्रह्महत्यापहा हि सा ॥
data.md: Bathing in that new river the Rakshasas renounced their bodies and went to heaven.

data.v: एतमर्थमभिज्ञाय देवराजः शतक्रतुः । तस्मिंस्तीर्थवरे स्नात्वा विमुक्तः पाप्मना किल ॥
data.md: Ascertaining all this, the king of the celestials, viz., Indra, of a hundred sacrifices, bathed in that best of tirthas and was freed of a grievous sin."

data.v: किमर्थं भगवाञ्शक्रो ब्रह्महत्यामवाप्तवान् । कथमस्मिंश्च तीर्थे वै आप्लुत्याकल्मषोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said "Why was Indra affected with the sin of Brahmanicide! How also did he become freed by bathing in that tirtha?''

data.v: शृणुष्वैतदुपाख्यानं यथावृत्तं जनेश्वर । यथा बिभेद समयं नमुचेर्वासवः पुरा ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "Listen to that history, O king, listen to those events as they took place. Hear how Indra formerly broke his treaty with Namuchi.

data.v: नमुचिर्वासवाद्भीतः सूर्यरश्मिं समाविशत् । तेनेन्द्रः सख्यमकरोत्समयं चेदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: The Asura Namuchi, from fear of Vasava, had entered into a ray of the Sun. Indra then made friends with Namuchi and made a contract with him, saying-"O king, of Asuras, I shall not kill you, O friend, with anything that is wet or dry. I shall not kill you in the night or in the day! Forsooth I swear this to you.'

data.v: नार्द्रेण त्वा न शुष्केण न रात्रौ नापि वाहनि । वधिष्याम्यसुरश्रेष्ठ सखे सत्येन ते शपे ॥
data.md: The Asura Namuchi, from fear of Vasava, had entered into a ray of the Sun. Indra then made friends with Namuchi and made a contract with him, saying-"O king, of Asuras, I shall not kill you, O friend, with anything that is wet or dry. I shall not kill you in the night or in the day! Forsooth I swear this to you.'

data.v: एवं स कृत्वा समयं सृष्ट्वा नीहारमीश्वरः । चिच्छेदास्य शिरो राजन्नपां फेनेन वासवः ॥
data.md: Having made this understanding, the lord Indra one day behold a fog. He then, O king, sundered Namuchi's head, using the foam of water as his weapon.

data.v: तच्छिरो नमुचेश्छिन्नं पृष्ठतः शक्रमन्वयात् । हे मित्रहन्पाप इति ब्रुवाणं शक्रमन्तिकात् ॥
data.md: The severed head of Namuchi thereupon pursued Indra from behind, saying repeatedly from a near place-"O killer of a friend, O wretch!'

data.v: एवं स शिरसा तेन चोद्यमानः पुनः पुनः । पितामहाय संतप्त एवमर्थं न्यवेदयत् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed repeatedly by that head; Indra went to grandfather and informed him, sorrowfully of what had taken place.

data.v: तमब्रवील्लोकगुरुररुणायां यथाविधि । इष्ट्वोपस्पृश देवेन्द्र ब्रह्महत्यापहा हि सा ॥
data.md: The supreme lord of the universe said to him-"Performing a sacrifice, bathe duly, O king of gods, in Aruna, the tirtha which saves all from the fear of sin!

data.v: इत्युक्तः स सरस्वत्याः कुञ्जे वै जनमेजय । इष्ट्वा यथावद्बलभिदरुणायामुपास्पृशत् ॥
data.md: Thus Addressed, Indra, at these words of Brahman, O Janamejaya, performed in that abode of Sarasvati various sacrifices. Distributing many presents and bathing in that tirtha, he of a hundred sacrifices, the destroyer of Vala, duly performed certain sacrifices and then bathed in the Aruna. He became freed from the sin caused by Brahmanicide. The king of the celestial region, then returned to heaven with a joyful heart.

data.v: स मुक्तः पाप्मना तेन ब्रह्महत्याकृतेन ह । जगाम संहृष्टमनास्त्रिदिवं त्रिदशेश्वरः ॥
data.md: Thus Addressed, Indra, at these words of Brahman, O Janamejaya, performed in that abode of Sarasvati various sacrifices. Distributing many presents and bathing in that tirtha, he of a hundred sacrifices, the destroyer of Vala, duly performed certain sacrifices and then bathed in the Aruna. He became freed from the sin caused by Brahmanicide. The king of the celestial region, then returned to heaven with a joyful heart.

data.v: शिरस्तच्चापि नमुचेस्तत्रैवाप्लुत्य भारत । लोकान्कामदुघान्प्राप्तमक्षयान्राजसत्तम ॥
data.md: The head of Namuchi also dropped into that stream O Bharata and Asura gained many blessed regions, O best of kings, that granted ever wish.”

data.v: तत्राप्युपस्पृश्य बलो महात्मा; दत्त्वा च दानानि पृथग्विधानि । अवाप्य धर्मं परमार्यकर्मा; जगाम सोमस्य महत्स तीर्थम् ॥

data.md: The gods collected there all sorts of sacred articles, with due rites and mantras, that were necessary for the ceremony.

पूष्णा भगेनार्यम्णा च अंशेन च विवस्वता । रुद्रश्च सहितो धीमान्मित्रेण वरुणेन च ॥
रुद्रैर्वसुभिरादित्यैरश्विभ्यां च वृतः प्रभुः । विश्वेदेवैर्मरुद्भिश्च साध्यैश्च पितृभिः सह ॥
गन्धर्वैरप्सरोभिश्च यक्षराक्षसपन्नगैः । देवर्षिभिरसंख्येयैस्तथा ब्रह्मर्षिभिर्वरैः ॥
वैखानसैर्वालखिल्यैर्वाय्वाहारैर्मरीचिपैः । भृगुभिश्चाङ्गिरोभिश्च यतिभिश्च महात्मभिः । सर्वैर्विद्याधरैः पुण्यैर्योगसिद्धैस्तथा वृतः ॥
पितामहः पुलस्त्यश्च पुलहश्च महातपाः । अङ्गिराः कश्यपोऽत्रिश्च मरीचिर्भृगुरेव च ॥
क्रतुर्हरः प्रचेताश्च मनुर्दक्षस्तथैव च । ऋतवश्च ग्रहाश्चैव ज्योतींषि च विशां पते ॥
मूर्तिमत्यश्च सरितो वेदाश्चैव सनातनाः । समुद्राश्च ह्रदाश्चैव तीर्थानि विविधानि च । पृथिवी द्यौर्दिशश्चैव पादपाश्च जनाधिप ॥
अदितिर्देवमाता च ह्रीः श्रीः स्वाहा सरस्वती । उमा शची सिनीवाली तथा चानुमतिः कुहूः । राका च धिषणा चैव पत्न्यश्चान्या दिवौकसाम् ॥
हिमवांश्चैव विन्ध्यश्च मेरुश्चानेकशृङ्गवान् । ऐरावतः सानुचरः कलाः काष्ठास्तथैव च । मासार्धमासा ऋतवस्तथा रात्र्यहनी नृप ॥
उच्चैःश्रवा हयश्रेष्ठो नागराजश्च वामनः । अरुणो गरुडश्चैव वृक्षाश्चौषधिभिः सह ॥
धर्मश्च भगवान्देवः समाजग्मुर्हि संगताः । कालो यमश्च मृत्युश्च यमस्यानुचराश्च ये ॥
बहुलत्वाच्च नोक्ता ये विविधा देवतागणाः । ते कुमाराभिषेकार्थं समाजग्मुस्ततस्ततः ॥
data.md: I do not mention the various other gods that came there lest the list be a heavy one. All of them came to that ceremony for investing Kartikeya with the dignity of generalissimo.

data.v: जगृहुस्ते तदा राजन्सर्व एव दिवौकसः । आभिषेचनिकं भाण्डं मङ्गलानि च सर्वशः ॥
data.md: All the celestials, O king brought there every thing necessary for the ceremony and every sacred article.

data.v: दिव्यसंभारसंयुक्तैः कलशैः काञ्चनैर्नृप । सरस्वतीभिः पुण्याभिर्दिव्यतोयाभिरेव तु ॥
data.md: Gladly the celestials made that great youth, that terror of the Asuras, the generalissimo of the celestial hosts, after pouring upon his head the sacred and excellent water of the Sarasvati from golden jars that contained other sacred articles necessary for the purpose.

data.v: अभ्यषिञ्चन्कुमारं वै संप्रहृष्टा दिवौकसः । सेनापतिं महात्मानमसुराणां भयावहम् ॥
पुरा यथा महाराज वरुणं वै जलेश्वरम् । तथाभ्यषिञ्चद्भगवान्ब्रह्मा लोकपितामहः । कश्यपश्च महातेजा ये चान्ये नानुकीर्तिताः ॥
data.md: The Grandfather of the words, viz., Brahman and Kashyapa of great energy and all others, all poured water upon Skanda even as, O king, the gods had poured water on the head of Varuna, the lord of waters, when placing him in this dominion.

data.v: तस्मै ब्रह्मा ददौ प्रीतो बलिनो वातरंहसः । कामवीर्यधरान्सिद्धान्महापारिषदान्प्रभुः ॥
data.md: The lord Brahman then, with a pleased heart, gave to Skanda four powerful companions, gifted with speed of the wind, crowned with ascetic success and gifted with energy which they could increase at will.

data.v: नन्दिषेणं लोहिताक्षं घण्टाकर्णं च संमतम् । चतुर्थमस्यानुचरं ख्यातं कुमुदमालिनम् ॥
data.md: They named Nandisena and Lohitaksha and Ghantakarna and Kumudamalin.

data.v: ततः स्थाणुं महावेगं महापारिषदं क्रतुम् । मायाशतधरं कामं कामवीर्यबलान्वितम् । ददौ स्कन्दाय राजेन्द्र सुरारिविनिबर्हणम् ॥
data.md: The lord Sthanu, O king, gave to Skanda a companion possessed of great impetuosity, capable of producing a hundred illusions and gifted with might and energy that he could increase at will. And he was the great destroyer if Asuras.

data.v: स हि देवासुरे युद्धे दैत्यानां भीमकर्मणाम् । जघान दोर्भ्यां संक्रुद्धः प्रयुतानि चतुर्दश ॥
data.md: In the great battle between the gods and the Asuras, this companion that Sthanu gave, worked up with ire killed with his hands alone, fourteen millions of Daityas of terrible deeds. were

data.v: तथा देवा ददुस्तस्मै सेनां नैरृतसंकुलाम् । देवशत्रुक्षयकरीमजय्यां विश्वरूपिणीम् ॥
data.md: The god then made over to Skanda he celestial host, invincible containing many celestial troops, capable of destroying the enemies of the gods and of forms like that of Vishnu.

data.v: जयशब्दं ततश्चक्रुर्देवाः सर्वे सवासवाः । गन्धर्वयक्षरक्षांसि मुनयः पितरस्तथा ॥
data.md: The gods then, with Vasava at their head and the Gandharvas, the Yakshas, the Rakshasas, the Munis and the Pitris, all exclaimed-"Victory of Skanda.'

data.v: यमः प्रादादनुचरौ यमकालोपमावुभौ । उन्माथं च प्रमाथं च महावीर्यौ महाद्युती ॥
data.md: Then Yama gave him two companions, both of whom resembled Death, viz., Unmatha and Pramatha, endued with great energy and splendour.

data.v: सुभ्राजो भास्करश्चैव यौ तौ सूर्यानुयायिनौ । तौ सूर्यः कार्त्तिकेयाय ददौ प्रीतः प्रतापवान् ॥
data.md: Endued with great prowess, Surya, gladly gave Kartikeya two of his followers named Subhraja and Bhasvara.

data.v: कैलासशृङ्गसंकाशौ श्वेतमाल्यानुलेपनौ । सोमोऽप्यनुचरौ प्रादान्मणिं सुमणिमेव च ॥
data.md: Soma also gave him two companions, viz., Mani and Sumani, both of whom looked like summits of tea Kailasa mountain and always used white garlands and white unguents.

data.v: ज्वालाजिह्वं तथा ज्योतिरात्मजाय हुताशनः । ददावनुचरौ शूरौ परसैन्यप्रमाथिनौ ॥
data.md: Agni gave him two heroic companions, grinders of hostile armies, who were named Jvalajihva and Jyoti.

data.v: परिघं च वटं चैव भीमं च सुमहाबलम् । दहतिं दहनं चैव प्रचण्डौ वीर्यसंमतौ । अंशोऽप्यनुचरान्पञ्च ददौ स्कन्दाय धीमते ॥
data.md: Ansha gave the intelligent Skanda five companions, Parigha and Vata and Bhima of great strength and Dahati and Dahana both of whom were highly dreadful and energetic.

data.v: उत्क्रोशं पङ्कजं चैव वज्रदण्डधरावुभौ । ददावनलपुत्राय वासवः परवीरहा । तौ हि शत्रून्महेन्द्रस्य जघ्नतुः समरे बहून् ॥
चक्रं विक्रमकं चैव संक्रमं च महाबलम् । स्कन्दाय त्रीननुचरान्ददौ विष्णुर्महायशाः ॥
वर्धनं नन्दनं चैव सर्वविद्याविशारदौ । स्कन्दाय ददतुः प्रीतावश्विनौ भरतर्षभ ॥
कुन्दनं कुसुमं चैव कुमुदं च महायशाः । डम्बराडम्बरौ चैव ददौ धाता महात्मने ॥
data.md: The illustrious Dhatri gave that high-souled one five companions, viz., Kunda, Kushuma, Kumuda, Dambara and Adambara.

data.v: वक्रानुवक्रौ बलिनौ मेषवक्त्रौ बलोत्कटौ । ददौ त्वष्टा महामायौ स्कन्दायानुचरौ वरौ ॥
data.md: Tashtri give Skanda two companions named Chakra and Anuchakra both of whom were very powerful.

data.v: सुव्रतं सत्यसंधं च ददौ मित्रो महात्मने । कुमाराय महात्मानौ तपोविद्याधरौ प्रभुः ॥
data.md: The lord Mitra gave the high-souled Kumara two illustrious companions named Suvrata and Satyasandha both of whom were highly learned and endued with ascetic merit, possessed of handsome features, capable of granting boons and well known over the three worlds.

data.v: सुदर्शनीयौ वरदौ त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतौ । सुप्रभं च महात्मानं शुभकर्माणमेव च । कार्त्तिकेयाय संप्रादाद्विधाता लोकविश्रुतौ ॥
data.md: Vidhatri gave Kartikeya two companions, viz., the great Suprabha and Shubhakarman.

data.v: पालितकं कालिकं च महामायाविनावुभौ । पूषा च पार्षदौ प्रादात्कार्त्तिकेयाय भारत ॥
data.md: Pushan gave him iwo companions, viz., Panitraka and Kalika, both gifted with grcat powers of illusions,

data.v: बलं चातिबलं चैव महावक्त्रौ महाबलौ । प्रददौ कार्त्तिकेयाय वायुर्भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: Vayu gave him, O best of the Bharatas, two companions, viz., Vala and Atibala, possessed of great inight and very an large mouths.

data.v: घसं चातिघसं चैव तिमिवक्त्रौ महाबलौ । प्रददौ कार्त्तिकेयाय वरुणः सत्यसंगरः ॥
data.md: Vayu gave him, O best of the Bharatas, two companions, viz., Vala and Atibala, possessed of great inight and very an large mouths.

data.v: सुवर्चसं महात्मानं तथैवाप्यतिवर्चसम् । हिमवान्प्रददौ राजन्हुताशनसुताय वै ॥
data.md: Himavat gave Agni's son two companions, O king, viz., Suvarchas and Ativarchas.

data.v: काञ्चनं च महात्मानं मेघमालिनमेव च । ददावनुचरौ मेरुरग्निपुत्राय भारत ॥
data.md: Meru, O Bharata, gave him two companions named Kanchana and Meghamalin.

data.v: स्थिरं चातिस्थिरं चैव मेरुरेवापरौ ददौ । महात्मनेऽग्निपुत्राय महाबलपराक्रमौ ॥
data.md: Manu also gave Agni's son two others gifted with great strength and power viz., Sthira and Asthira.

data.v: उच्छ्रितं चातिशृङ्गं च महापाषाणयोधिनौ । प्रददावग्निपुत्राय विन्ध्यः पारिषदावुभौ ॥
data.md: Vindhya gave Angi's son two companions named Uchchhrita and Agnishringa both of whom fought with stones.

data.v: संग्रहं विग्रहं चैव समुद्रोऽपि गदाधरौ । प्रददावग्निपुत्राय महापारिषदावुभौ ॥
data.md: Ocean gave himn two powerful companions named Sangraha and Vigraha both armed with mace.

data.v: उन्मादं पुष्पदन्तं च शङ्कुकर्णं तथैव च । प्रददावग्निपुत्राय पार्वती शुभदर्शना ॥
data.md: The beautiful Parvati gavc Agni's son Unmada and Pushpadanta and Shankukarna.

data.v: जयं महाजयं चैव नागौ ज्वलनसूनवे । प्रददौ पुरुषव्याघ्र वासुकिः पन्नगेश्वरः ॥
data.md: Vasuki the king of the serpents, O king, gave the son of Agni two snakes named Jaya and Mahajaya.

data.v: एवं साध्याश्च रुद्राश्च वसवः पितरस्तथा । सागराः सरितश्चैव गिरयश्च महाबलाः ॥
data.md: Similarly the Saddhyas, the Rudra, the Vasus, the Pitris, the Seas, the Rivers and the Mountains, gave commanders of forces, armed with lances and battle axes and adorned with various kinds or ornaments.

data.v: ददुः सेनागणाध्यक्षाञ्शूलपट्टिशधारिणः । दिव्यप्रहरणोपेतान्नानावेषविभूषितान् ॥
data.md: Similarly the Saddhyas, the Rudra, the Vasus, the Pitris, the Seas, the Rivers and the Mountains, gave commanders of forces, armed with lances and battle axes and adorned with various kinds or ornaments.

data.v: शृणु नामानि चान्येषां येऽन्ये स्कन्दस्य सैनिकाः । विविधायुधसंपन्नाश्चित्राभरणवर्मिणः ॥
data.md: Listen now to the names of those other warriors armed with various weapons and clad in diverse kind of robes and ornaments, that Skanda got.

data.v: शङ्कुकर्णो निकुम्भश्च पद्मः कुमुद एव च । अनन्तो द्वादशभुजस्तथा कृष्णोपकृष्णकौ ॥
द्रोणश्रवाः कपिस्कन्धः काञ्चनाक्षो जलंधमः । अक्षसंतर्जनो राजन्कुनदीकस्तमोभ्रकृत् ॥
एकाक्षो द्वादशाक्षश्च तथैवैकजटः प्रभुः । सहस्रबाहुर्विकटो व्याघ्राक्षः क्षितिकम्पनः ॥
पुण्यनामा सुनामा च सुवक्त्रः प्रियदर्शनः । परिश्रुतः कोकनदः प्रियमाल्यानुलेपनः ॥
अजोदरो गजशिराः स्कन्धाक्षः शतलोचनः । ज्वालाजिह्वः करालश्च सितकेशो जटी हरिः ॥
चतुर्दंष्ट्रोऽष्टजिह्वश्च मेघनादः पृथुश्रवाः । विद्युदक्षो धनुर्वक्त्रो जठरो मारुताशनः ॥
उदराक्षो झषाक्षश्च वज्रनाभो वसुप्रभः । समुद्रवेगो राजेन्द्र शैलकम्पी तथैव च ॥
पुत्रमेषः प्रवाहश्च तथा नन्दोपनन्दकौ । धूम्रः श्वेतः कलिङ्गश्च सिद्धार्थो वरदस्तथा ॥
प्रियकश्चैव नन्दश्च गोनन्दश्च प्रतापवान् । आनन्दश्च प्रमोदश्च स्वस्तिको ध्रुवकस्तथा ॥
क्षेमवापः सुजातश्च सिद्धयात्रश्च भारत । गोव्रजः कनकापीडो महापारिषदेश्वरः ॥
गायनो हसनश्चैव बाणः खड्गश्च वीर्यवान् । वैताली चातिताली च तथा कतिकवातिकौ ॥
हंसजः पङ्कदिग्धाङ्गः समुद्रोन्मादनश्च ह । रणोत्कटः प्रहासश्च श्वेतशीर्षश्च नन्दकः ॥
कालकण्ठः प्रभासश्च तथा कुम्भाण्डकोऽपरः । कालकाक्षः सितश्चैव भूतलोन्मथनस्तथा ॥
यज्ञवाहः प्रवाहश्च देवयाजी च सोमपः । सजालश्च महातेजाः क्रथक्राथौ च भारत ॥
तुहनश्च तुहानश्च चित्रदेवश्च वीर्यवान् । मधुरः सुप्रसादश्च किरीटी च महाबलः ॥
वसनो मधुवर्णश्च कलशोदर एव च । धमन्तो मन्मथकरः सूचीवक्त्रश्च वीर्यवान् ॥
श्वेतवक्त्रः सुवक्त्रश्च चारुवक्त्रश्च पाण्डुरः । दण्डबाहुः सुबाहुश्च रजः कोकिलकस्तथा ॥

data.md: Having bathed in that Tirtha and adored Skanda, Rama gave to the Brahmans gold and clothes and ornaments and many other things.

data.v: उषित्वा रजनीं तत्र माधवः परवीरहा । पूज्य तीर्थवरं तच्च स्पृष्ट्वा तोयं च लाङ्गली । हृष्टः प्रीतमनाश्चैव ह्यभवन्माधवोत्तमः ॥
एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि । यथाभिषिक्तो भगवान्स्कन्दो देवैः समागतैः ॥
data.md: I have now told you everything about which you had enquired, viz., how the divine Skanda was installed by the celestials.

data.v: अत्यद्भुतमिदं ब्रह्मञ्श्रुतवानस्मि तत्त्वतः । अभिषेकं कुमारस्य विस्तरेण यथाविधि ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said "This history, O Rishi, that I have heard from you is highly wonderful, namely this detailed description of the installation according to due rites of Skanda.

data.v: यच्छ्रुत्वा पूतमात्मानं विजानामि तपोधन । प्रहृष्टानि च रोमाणि प्रसन्नं च मनो मम ॥
data.md: O you having asceticism for your wealth, I consider myself cleansed by having listened to this account. My hair stands on end and my mind has become cheerful.

data.md: Having heard the history of the installation of Kumara and the destruction of the Daityas, I have been greatly pleased, I feel a curiosity, however, regarding another subject.

data.v: अपां पतिः कथं ह्यस्मिन्नभिषिक्तः सुरासुरैः । तन्मे ब्रूहि महाप्राज्ञ कुशलो ह्यसि सत्तम ॥
data.md: How was the king of the waters installed by the celestials in that Tirtha formerly. O best of men, tell me all that, for you are highly wise and are skilled narrator.

data.md: Bathing in that Tirtha also and giving away various kinds of presents, Baladeva, the destroyer of Pralamba, endued with great wisdom, then proceeded to Agni Tirtha, where to the cater of the clarified butter, disappearing from the view, became concealed within the entrails of the Shami word.

data.md: When the light of the words thus disappeared, O sinless one, the gods then went to the Grandsire of the universe.

data.md: Formerly the Lord Bramhan having with all the gods bathed in that Tirtha, created all the Tirthas according to due rites, for the celestials.

data.md: The powerful Lord of the celestials then came to that hermitage, having assumed the form of the great Rishi Vashishtha.

data.v: अस्मिन्खलु महाभागे शुभे तीर्थवरे पुरा । त्यक्त्वा सप्तर्षयो जग्मुर्हिमवन्तमरुन्धतीम् ॥
data.md: In this very Tirtha, O auspicious, sinless and highly blessed one, the seven Rishis had once left Arundhati (the wife of one of them) while they went to Himavat.

data.v: ततस्ते वै महाभागा गत्वा तत्र सुसंशिताः । वृत्त्यर्थं फलमूलानि समाहर्तुं ययुः किल ॥
data.md: Those regenerate ones, of very rigid vows, had gone there for collecting fruits and roots for their sustenance.

data.v: तेषां वृत्त्यर्थिनां तत्र वसतां हिमवद्वने । अनावृष्टिरनुप्राप्ता तदा द्वादशवार्षिकी ॥
data.md: While they thus lived in a forest of Himavat for procuring their food, a drought took place extending for twelve years.

data.v: ते कृत्वा चाश्रमं तत्र न्यवसन्त तपस्विनः । अरुन्धत्यपि कल्याणी तपोनित्याभवत्तदा ॥
data.md: Those ascetics, having made a hermitage for themselves, continued to live there. Meanwhile Arundhati devoted herself to ascetic penances.

data.v: अरुन्धतीं ततो दृष्ट्वा तीव्रं नियममास्थिताम् । अथागमत्त्रिनयनः सुप्रीतो वरदस्तदा ॥
data.md: Beholding Arundhati practising the austerest of vows, the boon-giving and threecyed deity Mahadeva, highly gratified, came there.

data.v: ब्राह्मं रूपं ततः कृत्वा महादेवो महायशाः । तामभ्येत्याब्रवीद्देवो भिक्षामिच्छाम्यहं शुभे ॥
data.md: Assuming the form of a Brahmana, the illustrious Mahadeva, came to her and said-I desire almas, O auspicious one!

data.v: प्रत्युवाच ततः सा तं ब्राह्मणं चारुदर्शना । क्षीणोऽन्नसंचयो विप्र बदराणीह भक्षय । ततोऽब्रवीन्महादेवः पचस्वैतानि सुव्रते ॥
data.md: The beautiful Arundhati said to him-Our food has been exhausted, O Brahmana. Do thou eat jujubes.

data.v: इत्युक्ता सापचत्तानि ब्राह्मणप्रियकाम्यया । अधिश्रित्य समिद्धेऽग्नौ बदराणि यशस्विनी ॥
दिव्या मनोरमाः पुण्याः कथाः शुश्राव सा तदा । अतीता सा त्वनावृष्टिर्घोरा द्वादशवार्षिकी ॥
data.md: Placing those jujubes on the fire, the celebrated Arundhati listened to to various excellent and sound and sacred discourses (from the lips of Mahadeva). That twelve years, drought then passed away.

data.v: अनश्नन्त्याः पचन्त्याश्च शृण्वन्त्याश्च कथाः शुभाः । अहःसमः स तस्यास्तु कालोऽतीतः सुदारुणः ॥
data.md: Without food and employed in cooking and listening to those sacred topics, that terrible period passed away as if like a single day.

data.v: ततस्ते मुनयः प्राप्ताः फलान्यादाय पर्वतात् । ततः स भगवान्प्रीतः प्रोवाचारुन्धतीं तदा ॥
data.md: Having collected fruits from the mountain, the seven Rishis returned there. The wonderful Mahadeva, highly pleased with Arundhati, said to her-Approach, as formerly, these Rishis, O righteous one! I have been satisfied with your penances and vows.

data.v: उपसर्पस्व धर्मज्ञे यथापूर्वमिमानृषीन् । प्रीतोऽस्मि तव धर्मज्ञे तपसा नियमेन च ॥
data.md: Having collected fruits from the mountain, the seven Rishis returned there. The wonderful Mahadeva, highly pleased with Arundhati, said to her-Approach, as formerly, these Rishis, O righteous one! I have been satisfied with your penances and vows.

data.v: ततः संदर्शयामास स्वरूपं भगवान्हरः । ततोऽब्रवीत्तदा तेभ्यस्तस्यास्तच्चरितं महत् ॥
data.md: The adorable Hara appeared there in his own form. Pleased, he spoke to them about the noble conduct of Arundhati (in these words).

data.v: भवद्भिर्हिमवत्पृष्ठे यत्तपः समुपार्जितम् । अस्याश्च यत्तपो विप्रा न समं तन्मतं मम ॥
data.md: The ascetic merit, you Rishis, that this lady has acquired, is, I think, much greater than what you have earned on the breast of Himavat!

data.v: अनया हि तपस्विन्या तपस्तप्तं सुदुश्चरम् । अनश्नन्त्या पचन्त्या च समा द्वादश पारिताः ॥
data.md: The penances practised by this lady have been highly austere, for she passed twelve years in cooking, herself fasting all the time.

data.v: ततः प्रोवाच भगवांस्तामेवारुन्धतीं पुनः । वरं वृणीष्व कल्याणि यत्तेऽभिलषितं हृदि ॥
data.md: Then, addressing Arundhati, Mahadeva said, Pray for any boon, O auspicious dame, you like.

data.v: साब्रवीत्पृथुताम्राक्षी देवं सप्तर्षिसंसदि । भगवान्यदि मे प्रीतस्तीर्थं स्यादिदमुत्तमम् । सिद्धदेवर्षिदयितं नाम्ना बदरपाचनम् ॥
data.md: Then that lady of large and red eyes addressed that god in the midst of the seven Rishis, saying-If, O divine one, you are pleased with me, then let this place be an excellent Tirtha. Let it be known by the name of Vadarapachana and let it be the favorite resort of Siddhas and celestial Rishis!

data.v: तथास्मिन्देवदेवेश त्रिरात्रमुषितः शुचिः । प्राप्नुयादुपवासेन फलं द्वादशवार्षिकम् । एवमस्त्विति तां चोक्त्वा हरो यातस्तदा दिवम् ॥
data.md: May he, O god of gods, who observes a fast livre and lives for three nights after having purified himself, obtain the fruit of a twelve years fast.

data.v: ऋषयो विस्मयं जग्मुस्तां दृष्ट्वा चाप्यरुन्धतीम् । अश्रान्तां चाविवर्णां च क्षुत्पिपासासहां सतीम् ॥
एवं सिद्धिः परा प्राप्ता अरुन्धत्या विशुद्धया । यथा त्वया महाभागे मदर्थं संशितव्रते ॥
विशेषो हि त्वया भद्रे व्रते ह्यस्मिन्समर्पितः । तथा चेदं ददाम्यद्य नियमेन सुतोषितः ॥
विशेषं तव कल्याणि प्रयच्छामि वरं वरे । अरुन्धत्या वरस्तस्या यो दत्तो वै महात्मना ॥
तस्य चाहं प्रसादेन तव कल्याणि तेजसा । प्रवक्ष्याम्यपरं भूयो वरमत्र यथाविधि ॥
यस्त्वेकां रजनीं तीर्थे वत्स्यते सुसमाहितः । स स्नात्वा प्राप्स्यते लोकान्देहन्यासाच्च दुर्लभान् ॥
इत्युक्त्वा भगवान्देवः सहस्राक्षः प्रतापवान् । स्रुचावतीं ततः पुण्यां जगाम त्रिदिवं पुनः ॥
data.md: Having said these words of the pure Shrutavati, the thousand-eyed Shakra then went back to heaven.

data.v: गते वज्रधरे राजंस्तत्र वर्षं पपात ह । पुष्पाणां भरतश्रेष्ठ दिव्यानां दिव्यगन्धिनाम् ॥
data.md: After the wielder of the thunderbolt, O king, had gone, a shower of celestial flowers of sweet fragrance fell there, O Bharata's chief.

data.v: नेदुर्दुन्दुभयश्चापि समन्तात्सुमहास्वनाः । मारुतश्च ववौ युक्त्या पुण्यगन्धो विशां पते ॥
data.md: Celestial kettle-drums also, of loud sound, were beat there. Auspicious and perfumed breezes also blew there, O king.

data.v: उत्सृज्य तु शुभं देहं जगामेन्द्रस्य भार्यताम् । तपसोग्रेण सा लब्ध्वा तेन रेमे सहाच्युत ॥
data.md: The auspicious Shrutavati then renouncing her body, became the wife of Indra. Obtaining that dignity through austere penances, she began to pass her time, sporting with him."

data.v: का तस्या भगवन्माता क्व संवृद्धा च शोभना । श्रोतुमिच्छाम्यहं ब्रह्मन्परं कौतूहलं हि मे ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said "Who was the mother of Shrutavati and how was that fair damsel brought up. I desire to hear this, O Brahmana, for great is my curiosity."

data.v: भारद्वाजस्य विप्रर्षेः स्कन्नं रेतो महात्मनः । दृष्ट्वाप्सरसमायान्तीं घृताचीं पृथुलोचनाम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "The vital seed of the great Rishi Bharadvaja fell upon beholding the large eyed Apsara Ghritachi as the latter was passing by at one time.

data.v: स तु जग्राह तद्रेतः करेण जपतां वरः । तदावपत्पर्णपुटे तत्र सा संभवच्छुभा ॥
data.md: That foremost of ascetics thereupon held it in his hand. It was then kept in a cup made of the Icaves of a tree. In that cup was born the girl Shruvavati.

data.v: तस्यास्तु जातकर्मादि कृत्वा सर्वं तपोधनः । नाम चास्याः स कृतवान्भारद्वाजो महामुनिः ॥
data.md: Having performed the usual birth rites, the great ascetic Bharadvaja, gave her a name.

data.v: स्रुचावतीति धर्मात्मा तदर्षिगणसंसदि । स च तामाश्रमे न्यस्य जगाम हिमवद्वनम् ॥
data.md: The name the pious Rishi gave her on the presence of the gods and Rishis was Shruvavati. Leaving the girl in his hermitage, Bharadvaja went to the forest of Himavat.

data.v: तत्राप्युपस्पृश्य महानुभावो; वसूनि दत्त्वा च महाद्विजेभ्यः । जगाम तीर्थं सुसमाहितात्मा; शक्रस्य वृष्णिप्रवरस्तदानीम् ॥
data.md: That best of the Yadus, the heroic Baladeva, of great dignity, having bathed in that Tirtha and distributed much wealth amongst the Brahmanas, then went with a concentrated mind to the Tirtha of Shakra.'

data.v: इन्द्रतीर्थं ततो गत्वा यदूनां प्रवरो बली । विप्रेभ्यो धनरत्नानि ददौ स्नात्वा यथाविधि ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "The powerful chief of the Yadus, having gone to Indra's Tirtha, bathed there according to due rites and distributed wealth and gems amongst the Brahmanas.

data.v: तत्र ह्यमरराजोऽसावीजे क्रतुशतेन ह । बृहस्पतेश्च देवेशः प्रददौ विपुलं धनम् ॥
data.md: There the chief of the celestials had performed a hundreds horse-sacrifices and given immense wealth to Brihaspati.

data.v: निरर्गलान्सजारूथ्यान्सर्वान्विविधदक्षिणान् । आजहार क्रतूंस्तत्र यथोक्तान्वेदपारगैः ॥
data.md: Indeed, through the assistance of Brahmanas conversant with the Vedas, Shakra performed all those sacrifice there, according to rites sectioned by the scriptures. Those sacrifices were performed on a liberal scale. Horses of all breeds were brought there. The gifts to Brahmanas were immense.

data.v: तान्क्रतून्भरतश्रेष्ठ शतकृत्वो महाद्युतिः । पूरयामास विधिवत्ततः ख्यातः शतक्रतुः ॥
data.md: Having duly completed those hundred sacrifices, O chief of the Bharatas, Shakra passed by the name of Shatakratu.

data.v: तस्य नाम्ना च तत्तीर्थं शिवं पुण्यं सनातनम् । इन्द्रतीर्थमिति ख्यातं सर्वपापप्रमोचनम् ॥
data.md: That auspicious and sacred Tirtha, capable of dissipating every sin. came to be called after his name as Indra-Tirtha.

data.v: उपस्पृश्य च तत्रापि विधिवन्मुसलायुधः । ब्राह्मणान्पूजयित्वा च पानाच्छादनभोजनैः । शुभं तीर्थवरं तस्माद्रामतीर्थं जगाम ह ॥
data.md: Having duly bathed there, Baladeva worshipped the Brahmanas with excellent food and raiments. He then went to that auspicious and foremost of Tirthas called after the name of Rama.

data.v: यत्र रामो महाभागो भार्गवः सुमहातपाः । असकृत्पृथिवीं सर्वां हतक्षत्रियपुंगवाम् ॥
data.md: The highly blessed and ascetic Rama of Bhrigu's race, repeatedly conquered the Earth and killed all the foremost of Kshatriyas.

data.v: उपाध्यायं पुरस्कृत्य कश्यपं मुनिसत्तमम् । अयजद्वाजपेयेन सोऽश्वमेधशतेन च । प्रददौ दक्षिणार्थं च पृथिवीं वै ससागराम् ॥
data.md: Then Rama performed in that Tirtha a Vajapeya sacrifice and a hundred horse sacrifices through the assistance of his preceptor Kashyapa. There, as sacrificial fee, Rama gave to his preceptor the whole Earth with her oceans.

data.v: रामो दत्त्वा धनं तत्र द्विजेभ्यो जनमेजय । उपस्पृश्य यथान्यायं पूजयित्वा तथा द्विजान् ॥
पुण्ये तीर्थे शुभे देशे वसु दत्त्वा शुभाननः । मुनींश्चैवाभिवाद्याथ यमुनातीर्थमागमत् ॥
data.md: Having bathed in that sacred and foremost of Tirthas that was the resort of gods and Rishis. Baladeva duly adored the ascetics there, and then went to the Tirtha called Yamuna.

data.v: यत्रानयामास तदा राजसूयं महीपते । पुत्रोऽदितेर्महाभागो वरुणो वै सितप्रभः ॥
data.md: The highly effulgent and blessed son of Aditi, Varuna, had in days of yore performed in that Tirtha the Rajasuya sacrifice, O king.

data.v: तत्र निर्जित्य संग्रामे मानुषान्दैवतांस्तथा । वरं क्रतुं समाजह्रे वरुणः परवीरहा ॥
data.md: Having in battle subjugated both men and celestials and Gandharvas and Rakshasas, Varuna, O king, that slayer of hostile heroes, celebrated his grand sacrifice in that Tirtha. Upon the commencement of that foremost of sacrifices a baitle took place between the gods and the Danavas, terrorising the three worlds.

data.v: तस्मिन्क्रतुवरे वृत्ते संग्रामः समजायत । देवानां दानवानां च त्रैलोक्यस्य क्षयावहः ॥
data.md: Having in battle subjugated both men and celestials and Gandharvas and Rakshasas, Varuna, O king, that slayer of hostile heroes, celebrated his grand sacrifice in that Tirtha. Upon the commencement of that foremost of sacrifices a baitle took place between the gods and the Danavas, terrorising the three worlds.

data.v: राजसूये क्रतुश्रेष्ठे निवृत्ते जनमेजय । जायते सुमहाघोरः संग्रामः क्षत्रियान्प्रति ॥
data.md: After the termination of that foremost of sacrifices, viz., the Rajasuya (of Varuna), a terrible battle, O Janamejaya, ensued amongst the Kshatriyas.

data.v: सीरायुधस्तदा रामस्तस्मिंस्तीर्थवरे तदा । तत्र स्नात्वा च दत्त्वा च द्विजेभ्यो वसु माधवः ॥
वनमाली ततो हृष्टः स्तूयमानो द्विजातिभिः । तस्मादादित्यतीर्थं च जगाम कमलेक्षणः ॥
data.md: Filled with joy and lauded by the great Rishis, Baladeva, that hero ever decked with garlands of wild flower and possessed of eyes like lotus leaves, then went to the Tirtha called Aditya.

data.v: यत्रेष्ट्वा भगवाञ्ज्योतिर्भास्करो राजसत्तम । ज्योतिषामाधिपत्यं च प्रभावं चाभ्यपद्यत ॥
data.md: There, O best of kings, having performed a sacrifice, the worshipful and effulgent Sun, obtained the sovereignty of all luminous bodies (in the universe) and acquired also his great energy.

data.v: तस्या नद्यास्तु तीरे वै सर्वे देवाः सवासवाः । विश्वेदेवाः समरुतो गन्धर्वाप्सरसश्च ह ॥
द्वैपायनः शुकश्चैव कृष्णश्च मधुसूदनः । यक्षाश्च राक्षसाश्चैव पिशाचाश्च विशां पते ॥
एते चान्ये च बहवो योगसिद्धाः सहस्रशः । तस्मिंस्तीर्थे सरस्वत्याः शिवे पुण्ये परंतप ॥
तत्र हत्वा पुरा विष्णुरसुरौ मधुकैटभौ । आप्लुतो भरतश्रेष्ठ तीर्थप्रवर उत्तमे ॥
द्वैपायनश्च धर्मात्मा तत्रैवाप्लुत्य भारत । संप्राप्तः परमं योगं सिद्धिं च परमां गतः ॥
data.md: The Island-born Vyasa also, O Bharata, having bathed in that Tirtha, acquired great Yoga powers and Siddhi.

data.v: असितो देवलश्चैव तस्मिन्नेव महातपाः । परमं योगमास्थाय ऋषिर्योगमवाप्तवान् ॥
data.md: Having bathed in that very Tirtha with a concentrated mind, the Rishi Asita-Deval also obtained great Yoga powers.

data.v: तस्मिन्नेव तु धर्मात्मा वसति स्म तपोधनः । गार्हस्थ्यं धर्ममास्थाय असितो देवलः पुरा ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "In this Tirtha lived formerly a virtuous Rishi, named Asita-Devala, leading the life of a house-holder.

data.v: धर्मनित्यः शुचिर्दान्तो न्यस्तदण्डो महातपाः । कर्मणा मनसा वाचा समः सर्वेषु जन्तुषु ॥
data.md: He led life of purity and self-restraint. Possessed of great ascetic merit, he was compassionate to all creatures and never injured any one. In word, deed and thought, he behaved equally towards all creatures.

data.v: अक्रोधनो महाराज तुल्यनिन्दाप्रियाप्रियः । काञ्चने लोष्टके चैव समदर्शी महातपाः ॥
देवताः पूजयन्नित्यमतिथींश्च द्विजैः सह । ब्रह्मचर्यरतो नित्यं सदा धर्मपरायणः ॥
data.md: The great ascetic looked with an equal eye upon gold and pebbles. He daily worshipped the gods and guests and the Brahmanas. Righteous himself he always practised the vow of Brahmacharya

data.v: ततोऽभ्येत्य महाराज योगमास्थाय भिक्षुकः । जैगीषव्यो मुनिर्धीमांस्तस्मिंस्तीर्थे समाहितः ॥
data.md: Once upon a time, an intelligent ascetic, O king, of the name of Jaigishavya, devoted to Yoga and rapt in meditation and leading the life of a mendicant, came to Devala's hermitage.

data.v: देवलस्याश्रमे राजन्न्यवसत्स महाद्युतिः । योगनित्यो महाराज सिद्धिं प्राप्तो महातपाः ॥
तं तत्र वसमानं तु जैगीषव्यं महामुनिम् । देवलो दर्शयन्नेव नैवायुञ्जत धर्मतः ॥
एवं तयोर्महाराज दीर्घकालो व्यतिक्रमत् । जैगीषव्यं मुनिं चैव न ददर्शाथ देवलः ॥
आहारकाले मतिमान्परिव्राड्जनमेजय । उपातिष्ठत धर्मज्ञो भैक्षकाले स देवलम् ॥
स दृष्ट्वा भिक्षुरूपेण प्राप्तं तत्र महामुनिम् । गौरवं परमं चक्रे प्रीतिं च विपुलां तथा ॥
देवलस्तु यथाशक्ति पूजयामास भारत । ऋषिदृष्टेन विधिना समा बह्व्यः समाहितः ॥
data.md: And Devala adored his guest, О Bharata, according to his might, after the rites laid down by the Rishis and with great attention for many years.

data.v: कदाचित्तस्य नृपते देवलस्य महात्मनः । चिन्ता सुमहती जाता मुनिं दृष्ट्वा महाद्युतिम् ॥
data.md: One day, however, O king, in the sight of that great Muni, a deep anxiety distributed the mind of the high-souled Devala.

data.v: समास्तु समतिक्रान्ता बह्व्यः पूजयतो मम । न चायमलसो भिक्षुरभ्यभाषत किंचन ॥
data.md: The latter thought within himself-"Many years have I passed in adoring this ascetic. This idle mendicant, however, has not yet spoken to me a single word!"

data.v: एवं विगणयन्नेव स जगाम महोदधिम् । अन्तरिक्षचरः श्रीमान्कलशं गृह्य देवलः ॥
data.md: Having thought thus the blessed Devala proceeded to the banks of the ocean through the sky, carrying his earthen pitcher.

data.v: गच्छन्नेव स धर्मात्मा समुद्रं सरितां पतिम् । जैगीषव्यं ततोऽपश्यद्गतं प्रागेव भारत ॥
data.md: Arrived at the cost of the Ocean, that lord of rivers, O Bharata, the righteous Devala saw Jaigishavya arrived there before him.

data.v: ततः सविस्मयश्चिन्तां जगामाथासितः प्रभुः । कथं भिक्षुरयं प्राप्तः समुद्रे स्नात एव च ॥
data.md: Thereat the lord Asita, became filled with wonder and thought within himself-"How could the mendicant come to the ocean and perform his ablutions even before my arrival?'

data.v: इत्येवं चिन्तयामास महर्षिरसितस्तदा । स्नात्वा समुद्रे विधिवच्छुचिर्जप्यं जजाप ह ॥
data.md: Thus thought the great Rishi Asita. Duly performing his ablutions there and purifying himself thereby, he then began to silently recite the sacred mantras.

data.v: कृतजप्याह्निकः श्रीमानाश्रमं च जगाम ह । कलशं जलपूर्णं वै गृहीत्वा जनमेजय ॥
data.md: Having finished his ablutions and silent prayers, the blessed Devala returned to his hermitage, O Janamejaya, taking with him his carthen pitcher filled with water.

data.v: ततः स प्रविशन्नेव स्वमाश्रमपदं मुनिः । आसीनमाश्रमे तत्र जैगीषव्यमपश्यत ॥
data.md: As the ascetic, however, entered his own hermitage, he saw Jaigishavya seated there.

data.v: न व्याहरति चैवैनं जैगीषव्यः कथंचन । काष्ठभूतोऽऽश्रमपदे वसति स्म महातपाः ॥
data.md: The great ascetic Jaigishavya never spoke a word to Devala but lived in the latter's hermitage like a log of wood.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा चाप्लुतं तोये सागरे सागरोपमम् । प्रविष्टमाश्रमं चापि पूर्वमेव ददर्श सः ॥
data.md: Having seen that ascetic, who was an ocean of austerities, plunged in the waters of the ocean (before his own arrival there), Asita now saw him returned to his hermitage before his Own return.

data.v: असितो देवलो राजंश्चिन्तयामास बुद्धिमान् । दृष्टः प्रभावं तपसो जैगीषव्यस्य योगजम् ॥
data.md: Witnessing this Yoga power, of Jaigishavya, the intelligent Asita-Devala, O king, began to think over the matter.

data.v: चिन्तयामास राजेन्द्र तदा स मुनिसत्तमः । मया दृष्टः समुद्रे च आश्रमे च कथं त्वयम् ॥
data.md: Indeed, that best of ascetics, O king, wondered much, saying-"How could this one be seen in the ocean and again in my herinitage?'

data.v: एवं विगणयन्नेव स मुनिर्मन्त्रपारगः । उत्पपाताश्रमात्तस्मादन्तरिक्षं विशां पते । जिज्ञासार्थं तदा भिक्षोर्जैगीषव्यस्य देवलः ॥
सोऽन्तरिक्षचरान्सिद्धान्समपश्यत्समाहितान् । जैगीषव्यं च तैः सिद्धैः पूज्यमानमपश्यत ॥
ततोऽसितः सुसंरब्धो व्यवसायी दृढव्रतः । अपश्यद्वै दिवं यान्तं जैगीषव्यं स देवलः ॥
data.md: Devala become filled with wrath at the sight. He then saw Jaigishavya start for heaven. saw

data.v: तस्माच्च पितृलोकं तं व्रजन्तं सोऽन्वपश्यत । पितृलोकाच्च तं यान्तं याम्यं लोकमपश्यत ॥
data.md: He next saw him proceed to the region of the Pitris. Devala saw him then proceed to the region of Yama.

data.v: तस्मादपि समुत्पत्य सोमलोकमभिष्टुतम् । व्रजन्तमन्वपश्यत्स जैगीषव्यं महामुनिम् ॥
data.md: From Yama's region the great ascetic Jaigishavya was then seen to soar aloft and proceed to the region of Soma. He was then seen to proceed to the blessed regions of the perforiners of various rigid sacrifices.

data.v: लोकान्समुत्पतन्तं च शुभानेकान्तयाजिनाम् । ततोऽग्निहोत्रिणां लोकांस्तेभ्यश्चाप्युत्पपात ह ॥
दर्शं च पौर्णमासं च ये यजन्ति तपोधनाः । तेभ्यः स ददृशे धीमाँल्लोकेभ्यः पशुयाजिनाम् । व्रजन्तं लोकममलमपश्यद्देवपूजितम् ॥
data.md: The intelligent Devala then behold him go from those regions of persons performing sacrifices by killing animals to that pure region which is adored by the very gods.

data.v: चातुर्मास्यैर्बहुविधैर्यजन्ते ये तपोधनाः । तेषां स्थानं तथा यान्तं तथाग्निष्टोमयाजिनाम् ॥
data.md: Devala next saw the mendicant proceed to the place of those ascetics that perform the sacrifice called Chaturmasya and various others of the same kind. Thence he went to the region belonging to the performers of the Agnishtoma sacrifice. Devala then saw his guest go to the place of those ascetics that perforin the sacrifice called Agnishutta.

data.v: अग्निष्टुतेन च तथा ये यजन्ति तपोधनाः । तत्स्थानमनुसंप्राप्तमन्वपश्यत देवलः ॥
वाजपेयं क्रतुवरं तथा बहुसुवर्णकम् । आहरन्ति महाप्राज्ञास्तेषां लोकेष्वपश्यत ॥
यजन्ते पुण्डरीकेण राजसूयेन चैव ये । तेषां लोकेष्वपश्यच्च जैगीषव्यं स देवलः ॥
अश्वमेधं क्रतुवरं नरमेधं तथैव च । आहरन्ति नरश्रेष्ठास्तेषां लोकेष्वपश्यत ॥
सर्वमेधं च दुष्प्रापं तथा सौत्रामणिं च ये । तेषां लोकेष्वपश्यच्च जैगीषव्यं स देवलः ॥
द्वादशाहैश्च सत्रैर्ये यजन्ते विविधैर्नृप । तेषां लोकेष्वपश्यच्च जैगीषव्यं स देवलः ॥
मित्रावरुणयोर्लोकानादित्यानां तथैव च । सलोकतामनुप्राप्तमपश्यत ततोऽसितः ॥
रुद्राणां च वसूनां च स्थानं यच्च बृहस्पतेः । तानि सर्वाण्यतीतं च समपश्यत्ततोऽसितः ॥
आरुह्य च गवां लोकं प्रयान्तं ब्रह्मसत्रिणाम् । लोकानपश्यद्गच्छन्तं जैगीषव्यं ततोऽसितः ॥
data.md: Thereafter, Asita crossing all that saw him. Having soared next into the blessed region called Golaka, Jaigishavya was next scen to pass into those of the Brahmasatris.

data.v: त्रीँल्लोकानपरान्विप्रमुत्पतन्तं स्वतेजसा । पतिव्रतानां लोकांश्च व्रजन्तं सोऽन्वपश्यत ॥
data.md: Having by his energy passed through three other regions, he was seen to go to those regions that are reserved for women that are chaste and devoted to their husbands,

data.v: ततो मुनिवरं भूयो जैगीषव्यमथासितः । नान्वपश्यत योगस्थमन्तर्हितमरिंदम ॥
data.md: At this point, O chastiser of foes, Asita lost sight of Jaigishavya that foremost of ascetics, who, rapt in Yoga, disappeared from his view.

data.v: सोऽचिन्तयन्महाभागो जैगीषव्यस्य देवलः । प्रभावं सुव्रतत्वं च सिद्धिं योगस्य चातुलाम् ॥
data.md: The highly blessed Devala then reflected upon the power of Jaigishavya his vows and success in Yoga.

data.v: असितोऽपृच्छत तदा सिद्धाँल्लोकेषु सत्तमान् । प्रयतः प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा धीरस्तान्ब्रह्मसत्रिणः ॥
data.md: Then the self-restrained Asita, with joined hands and in a reverential spirit, enquired of those foremost of Siddhas in the regions of the Brahmasatris, saying "I do not see Jaigishavya! Tell me when that energetic ascetic is! I desire to hear this, for great is my curiosity!'

data.v: जैगीषव्यं न पश्यामि तं शंसत महौजसम् । एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं परं कौतूहलं हि मे ॥
शृणु देवल भूतार्थं शंसतां नो दृढव्रत । जैगीषव्यो गतो लोकं शाश्वतं ब्रह्मणोऽव्ययम् ॥
data.md: Siddhas said Listen, O Devala of rigid vows, we speak to you the truth! Jaigishavya has gone to the eternal region of Brahman!'

data.v: स श्रुत्वा वचनं तेषां सिद्धानां ब्रह्मसत्रिणाम् । असितो देवलस्तूर्णमुत्पपात पपात च ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "Hearing these words of those Siddhas, living in the regions of the Brahmasatris, Asita tried to soar aloft but he soon fell down.

data.v: ततः सिद्धास्त ऊचुर्हि देवलं पुनरेव ह । न देवल गतिस्तत्र तव गन्तुं तपोधन । ब्रह्मणः सदनं विप्र जैगीषव्यो यदाप्तवान् ॥
data.md: The Siddhas then, once more addressing Devala said to him-"You O Devala, are not competent to proceed to the region of Brahman, where Jaigishavya has gone!

data.v: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सिद्धानां देवलः पुनः । आनुपूर्व्येण लोकांस्तान्सर्वानवततार ह ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "Hcaring those words of the Siddhas, Devala came down, descending from one region to another in due succession,

data.v: स्वमाश्रमपदं पुण्यमाजगाम पतंगवत् । प्रविशन्नेव चापश्यज्जैगीषव्यं स देवलः ॥
data.md: He repaired to his own sacred hermitage very quickly, like a winged insect. As soon as he entered his abode he beheld Jaigishavya seated there.

data.v: ततो बुद्ध्या व्यगणयद्देवलो धर्मयुक्तया । दृष्ट्वा प्रभावं तपसो जैगीषव्यस्य योगजम् ॥
data.md: Witnessing this Yoga power, of Jaigishavya, the intelligent Asita-Devala, O king, began to think over the matter.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीन्महात्मानं जैगीषव्यं स देवलः । विनयावनतो राजन्नुपसर्प्य महामुनिम् । मोक्षधर्मं समास्थातुमिच्छेयं भगवन्नहम् ॥
data.md: Then beholding his Yoga power Devala, reflected upon it with his rightcous understanding and approaching that great ascetic, O king, with humility, addressed the great Jaigishavya, saying-I desire, O adorable one, to acquire Moksha (Emancipation)!'

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा उपदेशं चकार सः । विधिं च योगस्य परं कार्याकार्यं च शास्त्रतः ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of his, Jaigishavya gave him lessons. And he also initiated him in the mysteries of Yoga and taught him the all important and obligatory duties of individuals as also their reverses.

data.v: संन्यासकृतबुद्धिं तं ततो दृष्ट्वा महातपाः । सर्वाश्चास्य क्रियाश्चक्रे विधिदृष्टेन कर्मणा ॥
data.md: The holy personage of hard austerities, seeing him thus determined, performed all the sacred rites according to the injunctions laid down for that purpose.

data.v: संन्यासकृतबुद्धिं तं भूतानि पितृभिः सह । ततो दृष्ट्वा प्ररुरुदुः कोऽस्मान्संविभजिष्यति ॥
data.md: Then all creatures with the Pitris, seeing Devala determined to adopt the religion of emancipation began to weep, saying-"Alas, who will hereafter offer us food!'

data.v: देवलस्तु वचः श्रुत्वा भूतानां करुणं तथा । दिशो दश व्याहरतां मोक्षं त्यक्तुं मनो दधे ॥
data.md: Hearing these lamentations of all creatures that resounded through all the points of horizon, Devala thought of renouncing the religion of emancipation.

data.v: ततस्तु फलमूलानि पवित्राणि च भारत । पुष्पाण्योषधयश्चैव रोरूयन्ते सहस्रशः ॥
पुनर्नो देवलः क्षुद्रो नूनं छेत्स्यति दुर्मतिः । अभयं सर्वभूतेभ्यो यो दत्त्वा नावबुध्यते ॥
data.md: Then all sorts of sacred fruits and roots, O Bharata and thousands of flowers and deciduous herbs, began to weep, saying, the wicked and mean Devala will, forsooth, once more pluck and cut us! Alas, having once promised all creatures no injury, he sees not the wrong that he thinks of doing.

data.v: ततो भूयो व्यगणयत्स्वबुद्ध्या मुनिसत्तमः । मोक्षे गार्हस्थ्यधर्मे वा किं नु श्रेयस्करं भवेत् ॥
data.md: Thereat that foremost of ascetics began to think with the help of his understanding, saying "Which of the two, viz., the religion of Moksha or that of a housc-holder, will be the better for me?

data.v: इति निश्चित्य मनसा देवलो राजसत्तम । त्यक्त्वा गार्हस्थ्यधर्मं स मोक्षधर्ममरोचयत् ॥
data.md: Meditating on this, Devala, O king, relinquished the life of a house-holder and adopted that of Moksha.

data.v: एवमादीनि संचिन्त्य देवलो निश्चयात्ततः । प्राप्तवान्परमां सिद्धिं परं योगं च भारत ॥
data.md: Having thought thus, Devala, on account of this determination, acquired the highest success, O Bharata and the highest Yoga.

data.v: ततो देवाः समागम्य बृहस्पतिपुरोगमाः । जैगीषव्यं तपश्चास्य प्रशंसन्ति तपस्विनः ॥
data.md: The celestials then, led by Brihaspati, praised Jaigishavya and the penances of that ascetic.

data.v: अथाब्रवीदृषिवरो देवान्वै नारदस्तदा । जैगीषव्ये तपो नास्ति विस्मापयति योऽसितम् ॥
data.md: Then that best of ascetics, viz., Narada, said to the gods-"There is no penance in Jaigishavya since he filled Asita with wonder!'

data.v: तमेवंवादिनं धीरं प्रत्यूचुस्ते दिवौकसः । मैवमित्येव शंसन्तो जैगीषव्यं महामुनिम् ॥
data.md: The inhabitants of heaven then said to Narada who has communicated such dangerous words. Do not say about the great ascetic Jaigishavya !

data.md: Vaishampayana said "The great Baladeva, having bathed in that tirtha and given away many kinds of gifts, acquired great virtue. Of righteous deeds, he then proceeded to the great tirtha of Soma.

data.v: यत्रेजिवानुडुपती राजसूयेन भारत । तस्मिन्वृत्ते महानासीत्संग्रामस्तारकामयः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "There, in that Tirtha, O Bharata, where the Moon had formerly celebrated the Rajasuya sacrifice, a great battle was fought in which Taraka was the root.

data.md: Bathing in that Tirtha and distributing many presents, the virtuous Vala of pure soul went to the Tirtha of the Muni named Sarasvat. There, during a drought extending over twelve years, the sage Sarasvat, formerly taught the Vedas unto many best of Brahmanas.

data.md: Bathing in that Tirtha and distributing many presents, the virtuous Vala of pure soul went to the Tirtha of the Muni named Sarasvat. There, during a drought extending over twelve years, the sage Sarasvat, formerly taught the Vedas unto many best of Brahmanas.

data.v: कथं द्वादशवार्षिक्यामनावृष्ट्यां तपोधनः । वेदानध्यापयामास पुरा सारस्वतो मुनिः ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said "Why did the sage Sarasvat, O you of ascetic merit, teach the Vedas to the Rishis during a twelve years' drought?

data.v: आसीत्पूर्वं महाराज मुनिर्धीमान्महातपाः । दधीच इति विख्यातो ब्रह्मचारी जितेन्द्रियः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Formerly. O king, there was an intelligent sage of great ascetic viriuc. He was celebrated by the name of Dadhicha. Having governed his senses, he led the life of a Brahmacharin.

data.v: तस्यातितपसः शक्रो बिभेति सततं विभो । न स लोभयितुं शक्यः फलैर्बहुविधैरपि ॥
data.md: On account of his excessive ascetic austerities, Shakra was possessed by fear. The sage could not be dissuaded (from the practices of his penances) by the offer of even various kinds of rewards.

data.v: प्रलोभनार्थं तस्याथ प्राहिणोत्पाकशासनः । दिव्यामप्सरसं पुण्यां दर्शनीयामलम्बुसाम् ॥
data.md: At last, for tempting the sage, the chastiser of Paka, sent to him the highly beautiful and celestial Apsara by name Alambusha.

data.v: तस्य तर्पयतो देवान्सरस्वत्यां महात्मनः । समीपतो महाराज सोपातिष्ठत भामिनी ॥
data.md: On the banks of the Sarasvat the great sage was engaged in the worship of the gods and ! there the celestial nymphs, O king, arrived.

data.v: तां दिव्यवपुषं दृष्ट्वा तस्यर्षेर्भावितात्मनः । रेतः स्कन्नं सरस्वत्यां तत्सा जग्राह निम्नगा ॥
data.md: Seeing that beautiful damsel the seminal fluid of thar ascetic came out. Having fallen into the Sarasvati, the latter preserved it with care.

data.v: कुक्षौ चाप्यदधद्दृष्ट्वा तद्रेतः पुरुषर्षभ । सा दधार च तं गर्भं पुत्रहेतोर्महानदी ॥
data.md: Indeed, O foremost of men, the River, sceing that sced, held it in her womb. In time the secd developed into a fetus and the great river kept it so that it might have life and grow into a child.

data.v: सुषुवे चापि समये पुत्रं सा सरितां वरा । जगाम पुत्रमादाय तमृषिं प्रति च प्रभो ॥
data.md: When the time came, the best of rivers delivered that child and then went, O lord, taking it with her, to that Rishi.

data.v: ऋषिसंसदि तं दृष्ट्वा सा नदी मुनिसत्तमम् । ततः प्रोवाच राजेन्द्र ददती पुत्रमस्य तम् । ब्रह्मर्षे तव पुत्रोऽयं त्वद्भक्त्या धारितो मया ॥
data.md: Seeing that best of Rishis in a conclave, Sarasvati, O king, while handing over the child, said these words:-"O Rishi, this is your son whom I held out of respect for you! That seed of yours, which fell at seeing the nymph Alambusha, had been held by me in my womb, O Rishi, through devotion for you and knowing well that your sced would never be destroyed.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा तेऽप्सरसं रेतो यत्स्कन्नं प्रागलम्बुसाम् । तत्कुक्षिणा वै ब्रह्मर्षे त्वद्भक्त्या धृतवत्यहम् ॥

विश्वे देवाः सपितरो गन्धर्वाप्सरसां गणाः । तृप्तिं यास्यन्ति सुभगे तर्प्यमाणास्तवाम्भसा ॥
data.md: Pleased with the River, the great ascetic Dadhicha then gave a boon to her, saying "The Vishvedevas, the Rishis and all the clans of the Gandharvas and the Apsaras, will henceforth, blessed one, derive great happiness when oblations of your water are presented to them!'

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा स तु तुष्टाव वचोभिर्वै महानदीम् । प्रीतः परमहृष्टात्मा यथावच्छृणु पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Having said to that great river, the sage, pleased and filled with joy, then praised her in these words. Hear them duly, O king!

data.v: प्रसृतासि महाभागे सरसो ब्रह्मणः पुरा । जानन्ति त्वां सरिच्छ्रेष्ठे मुनयः संशितव्रताः ॥
data.md: Thou hast sprung, O highly blessed one, from the lake of Brahman in days of old. All ascetics know thee, O best of rivers.

data.v: मम प्रियकरी चापि सततं प्रियदर्शने । तस्मात्सारस्वतः पुत्रो महांस्ते वरवर्णिनि ॥
data.md: Highly beautiful, you have done me great good! This your great child, O fair river, will be known by the name of Sarasvat.

data.v: तवैव नाम्ना प्रथितः पुत्रस्ते लोकभावनः । सारस्वत इति ख्यातो भविष्यति महातपाः ॥
data.md: This your son, capable of creating new worlds, will pass after thy name! That great ascetic will be known by the name of Sarasvat!

data.v: एष द्वादशवार्षिक्यामनावृष्ट्यां द्विजर्षभान् । सारस्वतो महाभागे वेदानध्यापयिष्यति ॥
data.md: During a drought extending over iwelve years, this Sarasvat, will teach the Vedas to many best of Brahmanas.

data.v: पुण्याभ्यश्च सरिद्भ्यस्त्वं सदा पुण्यतमा शुभे । भविष्यसि महाभागे मत्प्रसादात्सरस्वति ॥
data.md: O blessed Sarasvati, through my grace, thou shalt always become the best of all sacred rivers!'

data.v: एवं सा संस्तुता तेन वरं लब्ध्वा महानदी । पुत्रमादाय मुदिता जगाम भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Thus was the great River lauded by the sage after the latter had granted her boons. The River then, overjoyed went away, O best of Bharata's race! taking with her that child.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु विरोधे देवदानवैः । शक्रः प्रहरणान्वेषी लोकांस्त्रीन्विचचार ह ॥
data.md: Meanwhile, during a war between the gods and demons Shakra travelled through the three worlds in search of weapons.

data.v: न चोपलेभे भगवाञ्शक्रः प्रहरणं तदा । यद्वै तेषां भवेद्योग्यं वधाय विबुधद्विषाम् ॥
data.md: The king of the celestials, however, failed to find such weapons as were fit to kill the enemies of the celestials.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीत्सुराञ्शक्रो न मे शक्या महासुराः । ऋतेऽस्थिभिर्दधीचस्य निहन्तुं त्रिदशद्विषः ॥
data.md: Shakra then said to the gods-"The great Asuras are incapable of being defeated by me. Save with the bones of Dadhicha, our foes cannot be killed.

data.v: तस्माद्गत्वा ऋषिश्रेष्ठो याच्यतां सुरसत्तमाः । दधीचास्थीनि देहीति तैर्वधिष्यामहे रिपून् ॥
data.md: O best of celestials, go, therefore, to that best of Rishis and beg of him, saying-"Grant us, O Dadhicha, your bones! With them we will kill our enemies.'

data.v: स देवैर्याचितोऽस्थीनि यत्नादृषिवरस्तदा । प्राणत्यागं कुरुष्वेति चकारैवाविचारयन् । स लोकानक्षयान्प्राप्तो देवप्रियकरस्तदा ॥
data.md: Begged by them for his bones, that best of Rishis, O best of Kuru's race, unhesitatingly gave up his life. Having done what was agreeable to the celestials, the sage attained to the eternally blissful region.

data.v: तस्यास्थिभिरथो शक्रः संप्रहृष्टमनास्तदा । कारयामास दिव्यानि नानाप्रहरणान्युत । वज्राणि चक्राणि गदा गुरुदण्डांश्च पुष्कलान् ॥
data.md: With his bones, Shakra gladly made many kinds of weapons, such as thunder-bolts, disci, heavy maces and many kinds of clubs and bludgeons.

data.v: स हि तीव्रेण तपसा संभृतः परमर्षिणा । प्रजापतिसुतेनाथ भृगुणा लोकभावनः ॥
अतिकायः स तेजस्वी लोकसारविनिर्मितः । जज्ञे शैलगुरुः प्रांशुर्महिम्ना प्रथितः प्रभुः । नित्यमुद्विजते चास्य तेजसा पाकशासनः ॥
data.md: Equal to the Creator himself Dadhicha, had been begotten by the penances of great Rishi Bhrigu. Strongly built and highly energetic Dadhicha had been made the strongest of men in the world. The powerful and glorious Dadhicha, became tall like the king of mountains. The chastiser of Paka had always been in dread of his power.

data.v: तेन वज्रेण भगवान्मन्त्रयुक्तेन भारत । भृशं क्रोधविसृष्टेन ब्रह्मतेजोभवेन च । दैत्यदानववीराणां जघान नवतीर्नव ॥
data.md: With the thunder-bolt created by Brahma and inspired with mantras, O Bharata, Indra made a loud noise when he hurled it and killed ninety-nine Daityas.

data.md: After a dreadful long time a drought. O king, took place that extended over twelve years.

data.v: तस्यां द्वादशवार्षिक्यामनावृष्ट्यां महर्षयः । वृत्त्यर्थं प्राद्रवन्राजन्क्षुधार्ताः सर्वतोदिशम् ॥
data.md: During that drought extending over twelve years, the great Rishis fled away, O king, on all sides to maintain themselves.

data.md: Seeing them scattered on all sides, the sage Sarasvat also set his heart on flight. The river Sarasvati then said to him. You need not, O son, go away, for I will always supply you with food even here by giving you large fishes! Remain therefore, here!'

data.md: Thus addressed (by the river), the sage continued to live there and offer oblations of food to the Rishis and the celestials, He got also his daily food and thus continued to support both himself and the gods.

data.v: अथ तस्यामतीतायामनावृष्ट्यां महर्षयः । अन्योन्यं परिपप्रच्छुः पुनः स्वाध्यायकारणात् ॥
data.md: After the termination of that twelve years' drought the great Rishis requested one another to deliver discourses on the Vedas.

data.v: तेषां क्षुधापरीतानां नष्टा वेदा विधावताम् । सर्वेषामेव राजेन्द्र न कश्चित्प्रतिभानवान् ॥
data.md: While wandering hungrily the Rishis had forgotten the Vedas. There was indeed, not even one amongst thein that could interpret the Vedas.

data.v: अथ कश्चिदृषिस्तेषां सारस्वतमुपेयिवान् । कुर्वाणं संशितात्मानं स्वाध्यायमृषिसत्तमम् ॥
data.md: It so happened that some one amongst them met Sarasvat, that foremost of Rishis, while the latter was reading the Vedas with concentrated attention.

data.md: Returning to the assemblage of Rishis, he spoke to them of Sarasvat, of his matchless effulgence and celestial appearance and of deep concentration in the Vedas in a secluded forest.

data.v: ततः सर्वे समाजग्मुस्तत्र राजन्महर्षयः । सारस्वतं मुनिश्रेष्ठमिदमूचुः समागताः ॥
data.md: Then all the great Rishis came there unitedly and spoke to Sarasvat, that best of ascetics, these words.:-"Teach us, O sage!' The ascetic replied, saying-"Become my disciples duly!'

data.md: Then all the great Rishis came there unitedly and spoke to Sarasvat, that best of ascetics, these words.:-"Teach us, O sage!' The ascetic replied, saying-"Become my disciples duly!'

data.md: The host of ascetics answered-"O son, you are too young.' Thereupon he answered the ascetics-"I must act in such a way that my religious merit may not suffer decrease'.

data.md: He that teaches improperly and he that learns improperly, are both doomed to destruction and mutual hatred.

data.md: It is not age or decrepitude, of wealth or the number of kinsmen, by which the Rishis claim their mcrit. He only is great who is capable of reading and understanding the Vedas.'

data.md: Hearing these words of his, those ascetics duly became his disciples and learning again from him the Vedas began to practise their rites.

data.v: षष्टिर्मुनिसहस्राणि शिष्यत्वं प्रतिपेदिरे । सारस्वतस्य विप्रर्षेर्वेदस्वाध्यायकारणात् ॥
data.md: Sixty thousand ascetics became disciples of the great Rishi Sarasvat for the sake of learning again the Vedas from him.

data.v: मुष्टिं मुष्टिं ततः सर्वे दर्भाणां तेऽभ्युपाहरन् । तस्यासनार्थं विप्रर्षेर्बालस्यापि वशे स्थिताः ॥
data.md: Obeying that beautiful Rishi though a boy, the ascetics each brought a handful of grass and offered it to him for his seat.

data.v: तत्रापि दत्त्वा वसु रौहिणेयो; महाबलः केशवपूर्वजोऽथ । जगाम तीर्थं मुदितः क्रमेण; ख्यातं महद्वृद्धकन्या स्म यत्र ॥
data.md: The powerful son of Rohini and elder brother of Keshava, having distributed wealth in that Tirtha, then joyfully went to another where lived formerly an old virgin lady.”

data.md: Janamejaya said "Why, O Rishi did that maiden practise ascetic penances in day of yore. Why did she practise penances and what was her vow?” Matchless and mysterious is the topic that I have already heard from you. Describe particularly how that maid practised penances."

data.md: Janamejaya said "Why, O Rishi did that maiden practise ascetic penances in day of yore. Why did she practise penances and what was her vow?” Matchless and mysterious is the topic that I have already heard from you. Describe particularly how that maid practised penances."

data.v: ऋषिरासीन्महावीर्यः कुणिर्गार्ग्यो महायशाः । स तप्त्वा विपुलं राजंस्तपो वै तपतां वरः । मानसीं स सुतां सुभ्रूं समुत्पादितवान्विभुः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "There a highly illustrious and energetic Rishi, named Kuni-Garga. Having practised the austerest of penances, O king, that best of ascetics, created a fair browed daughter by his desire. Secing her, the celebrated ascetic Kuni-Garga was filled with joy. He renounced his body, O king and then went to heaven.

data.v: तां च दृष्ट्वा भृशं प्रीतः कुणिर्गार्ग्यो महायशाः । जगाम त्रिदिवं राजन्संत्यज्येह कलेवरम् ॥
सुभ्रूः सा ह्यथ कल्याणी पुण्डरीकनिभेक्षणा । महता तपसोग्रेण कृत्वाश्रममनिन्दिता ॥
उपवासैः पूजयन्ती पितॄन्देवांश्च सा पुरा । तस्यास्तु तपसोग्रेण महान्कालोऽत्यगान्नृप ॥
सा पित्रा दीयमानापि भर्त्रे नैच्छदनिन्दिता । आत्मनः सदृशं सा तु भर्तारं नान्वपश्यत ॥
ततः सा तपसोग्रेण पीडयित्वात्मनस्तनुम् । पितृदेवार्चनरता बभूव विजने वने ॥
data.md: Emaciating her body with austere penances, she began to worship the Pitris and the gods in that solitary forest.

data.v: सात्मानं मन्यमानापि कृतकृत्यं श्रमान्विता । वार्द्धकेन च राजेन्द्र तपसा चैव कर्शिता ॥
data.md: Although engaged in such a hard task, O king and although she cmaciated herself by age and austeritics, yet she thought herself happy.

data.v: सा नाशकद्यदा गन्तुं पदात्पदमपि स्वयम् । चकार गमने बुद्धिं परलोकाय वै तदा ॥
मोक्तुकामां तु तां दृष्ट्वा शरीरं नारदोऽब्रवीत् । असंस्कृतायाः कन्यायाः कुतो लोकास्तवानघे ॥
data.md: Seeing her about to relinquish her body, Narada said to her,"O sinless one, you cannot attain any blissful region since you have not cleansed yourself by the rite of marriage.

data.v: एवं हि श्रुतमस्माभिर्देवलोके महाव्रते । तपः परमकं प्राप्तं न तु लोकास्त्वया जिताः ॥
data.md: O you of great vows, we have heard this in heaven. Great has been your ascetic merit, but you have no claim to blissful regions.

data.v: तन्नारदवचः श्रुत्वा साब्रवीदृषिसंसदि । तपसोऽर्धं प्रयच्छामि पाणिग्राहस्य सत्तमाः ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of Narada, the old lady went to an assemblage of Rishis and said, 'I shall give him half my penances who will marry ine.'

data.v: इत्युक्ते चास्या जग्राह पाणिं गालवसंभवः । ऋषिः प्राक्शृङ्गवान्नाम समयं चेदमब्रवीत् ॥
समयेन तवाद्याहं पाणिं स्प्रक्ष्यामि शोभने । यद्येकरात्रं वस्तव्यं त्वया सह मयेति ह ॥
तथेति सा प्रतिश्रुत्य तस्मै पाणिं ददौ तदा । चक्रे च पाणिग्रहणं तस्योद्वाहं च गालविः ॥
data.md: According to the rites, and having duly poured libations on the fire, Galava's son accepted her hand and married her.

data.v: सा रात्रावभवद्राजंस्तरुणी देववर्णिनी । दिव्याभरणवस्त्रा च दिव्यस्रगनुलेपना ॥
data.md: On the night, she became a handsome young lady robed in celestial dress, decked in celestial ornaments, and smeared with celestial ungucnts and perfumes.

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा गालविः प्रीतो दीपयन्तीमिवात्मना । उवास च क्षपामेकां प्रभाते साब्रवीच्च तम् ॥
यस्त्वया समयो विप्र कृतो मे तपतां वर । तेनोषितास्मि भद्रं ते स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु व्रजाम्यहम् ॥
data.md: Sceing her beauty, Galava's son became very happy and passed one night in her company. In the morning she said to him—the agreement, O Brahmana, I had made with you, has been satisfied, O best of ascetic! Blessed be you, I shall now leave you.

data.v: सानुज्ञाताब्रवीद्भूयो योऽस्मिंस्तीर्थे समाहितः । वत्स्यते रजनीमेकां तर्पयित्वा दिवौकसः ॥
चत्वारिंशतमष्टौ च द्वे चाष्टौ सम्यगाचरेत् । यो ब्रह्मचर्यं वर्षाणि फलं तस्य लभेत सः । एवमुक्त्वा ततः साध्वी देहं त्यक्त्वा दिवं गता ॥
ऋषिरप्यभवद्दीनस्तस्या रूपं विचिन्तयन् । समयेन तपोऽर्धं च कृच्छ्रात्प्रतिगृहीतवान् ॥
साधयित्वा तदात्मानं तस्याः स गतिमन्वयात् । दुःखितो भरतश्रेष्ठ तस्या रूपबलात्कृतः । एतत्ते वृद्धकन्याया व्याख्यातं चरितं महत् ॥
data.md: On account of the agreement he had made, he accepted with difficulty half her penances. Casting off his body he soon followed her, O Bharata's chief, drawn by sorrow and her beauty.

data.v: तत्रस्थश्चापि शुश्राव हतं शल्यं हलायुधः । तत्रापि दत्त्वा दानानि द्विजातिभ्यः परंतप । शुशोच शल्यं संग्रामे निहतं पाण्डवैस्तदा ॥
data.md: While there, Baladeva heard of the destruction of Shalya. Having made presents to the Brahmanas there, he bewailed, O destroyer of foes, for Shalya, who had been killed by the Pandavas in battle.

data.v: समन्तपञ्चकद्वारात्ततो निष्क्रम्य माधवः । पप्रच्छर्षिगणान्रामः कुरुक्षेत्रस्य यत्फलम् ॥
data.md: Then having come out of Samantapanchaka, Baladeva enquired at of the Rishis about the results of the battle at Kurukshetra.

data.v: ते पृष्टा यदुसिंहेन कुरुक्षेत्रफलं विभो । समाचख्युर्महात्मानस्तस्मै सर्वं यथातथम् ॥
data.md: Asked by that Yadu's chief about the results of the battle at Kurukshetra, those great ones told him everything as it had taken place.

data.v: प्रजापतेरुत्तरवेदिरुच्यते; सनातना राम समन्तपञ्चकम् । समीजिरे यत्र पुरा दिवौकसो; वरेण सत्रेण महावरप्रदाः ॥
data.md: The Rishis said "O Rama, this Samantapanchaka the eternal northern alter of Brahman the Lord of all crcatures. There the celestials, the givers of great boons, performed in days of yore a great sacrifice.

data.v: पुरा च राजर्षिवरेण धीमता; बहूनि वर्षाण्यमितेन तेजसा । प्रकृष्टमेतत्कुरुणा महात्मना; ततः कुरुक्षेत्रमितीह पप्रथे ॥
data.md: That foremost of royal sages, viz., the great, intelligent and energetic Kuru, had cultivated this field for many years. Hence it came to be called Kurukshetra (the field of Kuru)!"

data.v: किमर्थं कुरुणा कृष्टं क्षेत्रमेतन्महात्मना । एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं कथ्यमानं तपोधनाः ॥
data.md: Rama said “Why did the great Kuru cultivated this field? I desire to have this described by you, you Rishis of great penances."

data.v: पुरा किल कुरुं राम कृषन्तं सततोत्थितम् । अभ्येत्य शक्रस्त्रिदिवात्पर्यपृच्छत कारणम् ॥
किमिदं वर्तते राजन्प्रयत्नेन परेण च । राजर्षे किमभिप्रेतं येनेयं कृष्यते क्षितिः ॥
इह ये पुरुषाः क्षेत्रे मरिष्यन्ति शतक्रतो । ते गमिष्यन्ति सुकृताँल्लोकान्पापविवर्जितान् ॥
अवहस्य ततः शक्रो जगाम त्रिदिवं प्रभुः । राजर्षिरप्यनिर्विण्णः कर्षत्येव वसुंधराम् ॥
आगम्यागम्य चैवैनं भूयो भूयोऽवहस्य च । शतक्रतुरनिर्विण्णं पृष्ट्वा पृष्ट्वा जगाम ह ॥
data.md: Shakra repeatedly come to him and repeatedly receiving the same reply went away and ridiculed him. Kuru, however, was not at all depressed.

data.v: यदा तु तपसोग्रेण चकर्ष वसुधां नृपः । ततः शक्रोऽब्रवीद्देवान्राजर्षेर्यच्चिकीर्षितम् ॥
data.md: Seeing the king till the soil with great perseverance, Shakra summoned the celestials and informed them of the king's work.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा चाब्रुवन्देवाः सहस्राक्षमिदं वचः । वरेण च्छन्द्यतां शक्र राजर्षिर्यदि शक्यते ॥
यदि ह्यत्र प्रमीता वै स्वर्गं गच्छन्ति मानवाः । अस्माननिष्ट्वा क्रतुभिर्भागो नो न भविष्यति ॥
आगम्य च ततः शक्रस्तदा राजर्षिमब्रवीत् । अलं खेदेन भवतः क्रियतां वचनं मम ॥
data.md: If only by dying there men were to come to heaven, without having performed sacrifices to us, our very existence will be imperilled'Thus spoken to, Shakra returned to that royal saint and. said-Do not work any more! Act according to my words!

data.v: मानवा ये निराहारा देहं त्यक्ष्यन्त्यतन्द्रिताः । युधि वा निहताः सम्यगपि तिर्यग्गता नृप ॥
data.md: If only by dying there men were to come to heaven, without having performed sacrifices to us, our very existence will be imperilled'Thus spoken to, Shakra returned to that royal saint and. said-Do not work any more! Act according to my words!

data.v: ते स्वर्गभाजो राजेन्द्र भवन्त्विति महामते । तथास्त्विति ततो राजा कुरुः शक्रमुवाच ह ॥
data.md: Those men that will die here, having fasted with all their senses awake, and those that will die here in battle, shall, O king, come to heaven.

data.v: ततस्तमभ्यनुज्ञाप्य प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना । जगाम त्रिदिवं भूयः क्षिप्रं बलनिषूदनः ॥
data.md: They shall enjoy the blessings of heaven, O king!'-Thus addressed, king Kuru answered Shakra, saying-'So be it!'-Taking Kuru's leave, the slayer of Vala, viz., Shakra, then, with a glad heart speedily returned to heaven.

data.v: एवमेतद्यदुश्रेष्ठ कृष्टं राजर्षिणा पुरा । शक्रेण चाप्यनुज्ञातं पुण्यं प्राणान्विमुञ्चताम् ॥
data.md: Thus, O foremost of Yadu's race, that royal sage had, formerly cultivated this plain and Shakra had promised great merit to those that would give up their lives here.

data.v: अपि चात्र स्वयं शक्रो जगौ गाथां सुराधिपः । कुरुक्षेत्रे निबद्धां वै तां शृणुष्व हलायुध ॥
पांसवोऽपि कुरुक्षेत्राद्वायुना समुदीरिताः । अपि दुष्कृतकर्माणं नयन्ति परमां गतिम् ॥
सुरर्षभा ब्राह्मणसत्तमाश्च; तथा नृगाद्या नरदेवमुख्याः । इष्ट्वा महार्हैः क्रतुभिर्नृसिंह; संन्यस्य देहान्सुगतिं प्रपन्नाः ॥
तरन्तुकारन्तुकयोर्यदन्तरं; रामह्रदानां च मचक्रुकस्य । एतत्कुरुक्षेत्रसमन्तपञ्चकं; प्रजापतेरुत्तरवेदिरुच्यते ॥
data.md: The space between the Tarantuka and the Arantuka and the lakes of Rama and Chamachakra is known Kurukshetra. Samantapanchaka is called the northern (sacrificial) alter of Brahman, the Lord of all creatures.

data.v: शिवं महत्पुण्यमिदं दिवौकसां; सुसंमतं स्वर्गगुणैः समन्वितम् । अतश्च सर्वेऽपि वसुंधराधिपा; हता गमिष्यन्ति महात्मनां गतिम् ॥
data.md: This place endued with all virtues is auspicious and highly sacred, and is much respected by the celestials. It is for this that Kshatriyas slain in battle here obtain sacred and blissful regions.

data.v: कुरुक्षेत्रं ततो दृष्ट्वा दत्त्वा दायांश्च सात्वतः । आश्रमं सुमहद्दिव्यमगमज्जनमेजय ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "Having visited Kurukshetra and distributed wealth there the Satwata hero then proceeded, O Janamejaya, to a large and exceedingly beautiful hermitage.

data.v: मधूकाम्रवनोपेतं प्लक्षन्यग्रोधसंकुलम् । चिरिबिल्वयुतं पुण्यं पनसार्जुनसंकुलम् ॥
data.md: That hermitage was overgrown with Madhuka and mango trees, and abounded with Plakshas and Nyagrodhas. And it contained many Vilvas and many excellent jack and Arjuna trees.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा यादवश्रेष्ठः प्रवरं पुण्यलक्षणम् । पप्रच्छ तानृषीन्सर्वान्कस्याश्रमवरस्त्वयम् ॥
data.md: Seeing that beautiful hermitage Baladeva asked the Rishis as to whom it belonged.

data.v: ते तु सर्वे महात्मानमूचू राजन्हलायुधम् । शृणु विस्तरतो राम यस्यायं पूर्वमाश्रमः ॥
data.md: Those great ones, O king, said Baladeva 'Listen in full, O Rama, as to whose asylum this was formerly.

data.v: अत्र विष्णुः पुरा देवस्तप्तवांस्तप उत्तमम् । अत्रास्य विधिवद्यज्ञाः सर्वे वृत्ताः सनातनाः ॥
data.md: Here the god Vishnu formerly practised austere penances. Here he celebrated duly all the eternal sacrifices.

data.v: अत्रैव ब्राह्मणी सिद्धा कौमारब्रह्मचारिणी । योगयुक्ता दिवं याता तपःसिद्धा तपस्विनी ॥
data.md: Here leading from youth the vow of Brahmacharya, a Brahmani inaiden, was crowned with ascetic success. Ultimately possessed of Yoga powers that ascetic lady went to heaven.

data.v: बभूव श्रीमती राजञ्शाण्डिल्यस्य महात्मनः । सुता धृतव्रता साध्वी नियता ब्रह्मचारिणी ॥
data.md: The great Shandilya, O king, had a beautiful daughter who was chaste, observant of severe vows self-restrained, and led a life of cclibacy.

data.v: सा तु प्राप्य परं योगं गता स्वर्गमनुत्तमम् । भुक्त्वाश्रमेऽश्वमेधस्य फलं फलवतां शुभा । गता स्वर्गं महाभागा पूजिता नियतात्मभिः ॥
अभिगम्याश्रमं पुण्यं दृष्ट्वा च यदुपुंगवः । ऋषींस्तानभिवाद्याथ पार्श्वे हिमवतोऽच्युतः । स्कन्धावाराणि सर्वाणि निवर्त्यारुरुहेऽचलम् ॥
data.md: Bidding a farewell to the Rishis, Baladeva performed all the rites and ceremonies of the evening on the side of Himavat and then began to ascend mountain.

data.v: नातिदूरं ततो गत्वा नगं तालध्वजो बली । पुण्यं तीर्थवरं दृष्ट्वा विस्मयं परमं गतः ॥
data.md: The powerful Valarama having the emblem of the palmyra of his banner had not ascended far when he saw a sacred and goodly Tirtha and was stricken with wonder at the sight.

data.v: प्रभवं च सरस्वत्याः प्लक्षप्रस्रवणं बलः । संप्राप्तः कारपचनं तीर्थप्रवरमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Sceing the glory of the Sarasvati as also the Tirtha called Plakshaprasaravana, Vala next reached another excellent and foremost of Tirthas called Karavapana.

data.v: हलायुधस्तत्र चापि दत्त्वा दानं महाबलः । आप्लुतः सलिले शीते तस्माच्चापि जगाम ह । आश्रमं परमप्रीतो मित्रस्य वरुणस्य च ॥
इन्द्रोऽग्निरर्यमा चैव यत्र प्राक्प्रीतिमाप्नुवन् । तं देशं कारपचनाद्यमुनायां जगाम ह ॥
data.md: From Karavapana he proceeded to that spot on the Yamuna where formerly Indra and Agni and Aryaman had obtained great felicity.

data.v: स्नात्वा तत्रापि धर्मात्मा परां तुष्टिमवाप्य च । ऋषिभिश्चैव सिद्धैश्च सहितो वै महाबलः । उपविष्टः कथाः शुभ्राः शुश्राव यदुपुंगवः ॥
data.md: Bathing there, that Yadu's chief of pious soul, obtained great happiness. The hero then sat himself down with the Rishis and the Siddhas there for listening to their excellent discourses.

data.v: तथा तु तिष्ठतां तेषां नारदो भगवानृषिः । आजगामाथ तं देशं यत्र रामो व्यवस्थितः ॥
data.md: There where Rama sat in the midst of that assemblage the adorable Rishi Narada came while trembling.

data.md: Hearing of the death of her son in such a way, she will, in anger, with the fire of her mind, reduce us to ashes.

data.md: That highly-blessed lady is always weakening herself with the austerest of penances. Hearing of the death of her sons and grandsons, she will forsooth, reduce us to ashes. It is time, O hero, I think, for pacifying her.

data.md: Save you, O foremost of men, what other person is there that can even face that lady of red and ranging eyes and greatly overwhelmed with the misfortunes of her children.

data.md: O Madhava, I think it is better for you to go, for pacifying Gandhari, O chastiser of foes, who is blazing with wrath. You are the Creator and the Destroyer. You are the first cause of all the worlds, yourself being eternal.
