data.v: तुदन्नखैस्तु स द्रौणिं नातिव्यक्तमुदाहरत् । आचार्यपुत्र शस्त्रेण जहि मा मा चिरं कृथाः । त्वत्कृते सुकृताँल्लोकान्गच्छेयं द्विपदां वर ॥
data.md: The Panchala prince tore Ashvatthaman with his nails and at last slowly said, — 'O preceptor's son, kill me with a weapon, do not delay. O best of men, let me, through you go to the blessed regions.'

data.v: तस्याव्यक्तां तु तां वाचं संश्रुत्य द्रौणिरब्रवीत् । आचार्यघातिनां लोका न सन्ति कुलपांसन । तस्माच्छस्त्रेण निधनं न त्वमर्हसि दुर्मते ॥
data.md: Hearing those indistinct sounds of his, Drona's son said,-'O wretch of your race, there is no region for those that kill their preceptor. For this, O wicked man, you do not deserve to be killed with any weapon.'

data.v: एवं ब्रुवाणस्तं वीरं सिंहो मत्तमिव द्विपम् । मर्मस्वभ्यवधीत्क्रुद्धः पादाष्ठीलैः सुदारुणैः ॥
data.md: While saying so, Ashvatthaman, worked up with rage, began to strike the vital parts of his victim with his heels, and killed his foe like a lion killing an infuriate elephant.

data.v: तस्य वीरस्य शब्देन मार्यमाणस्य वेश्मनि । अबुध्यन्त महाराज स्त्रियो ये चास्य रक्षिणः ॥
data.md: At the cries of that hero, while he was being slain, his wives and guards that were in his tent all got up, O king.

data.v: ते दृष्ट्वा वर्ष्मवन्तं तमतिमानुषविक्रमम् । भूतमेव व्यवस्यन्तो न स्म प्रव्याहरन्भयात् ॥
data.md: Seeing some body crushing the prince with superhuman force, they took the assailant for a supernatural being, and, therefore, made no noise from fear.

data.v: तं तु तेनाभ्युपायेन गमयित्वा यमक्षयम् । अध्यतिष्ठत्स तेजस्वी रथं प्राप्य सुदर्शनम् ॥
data.md: Having sent him to Yamas abode by such means the greatly energetic, Ashvatthaman went out and getting upon his beautiful car waited there.

data.v: स तस्य भवनाद्राजन्निष्क्रम्यानादयन्दिशः । रथेन शिबिरं प्रायाज्जिघांसुर्द्विषतो बली ॥
data.md: Indeed, coming out of Dhrishtadyumna's camp, O king, Ashvatthaman made all the points of the horizon resound with his roars, and then proceeded on his car to other parts of the camp for killing his enemies.

data.v: अपक्रान्ते ततस्तस्मिन्द्रोणपुत्रे महारथे । सह तै रक्षिभिः सर्वैः प्रणेदुर्योषितस्तदा ॥
data.md: After Drona's son, that great car-warrior, had gone away, the women and all the guards began to bewail.

data.v: राजानं निहतं दृष्ट्वा भृशं शोकपरायणाः । व्याक्रोशन्क्षत्रियाः सर्वे धृष्टद्युम्नस्य भारत ॥
data.md: Secing their king killed, all the wives of Dhrishtady!mna, cried aloud sorrowfully.

data.v: तासां तु तेन शब्देन समीपे क्षत्रियर्षभाः । क्षिप्रं च समनह्यन्त किमेतदिति चाब्रुवन् ॥
data.md: Hearing their lamentations many powerful, Kshatriyas, awaking, put on their armour and came there for inquiring after the cause of their lamentations.

data.v: स्त्रियस्तु राजन्वित्रस्ता भारद्वाजं निरीक्ष्य तम् । अब्रुवन्दीनकण्ठेन क्षिप्रमाद्रवतेति वै ॥
data.md: Terrified at seeing Ashvatthaman, those ladies in piteous tones asked the man to follow him without delay.

data.v: राक्षसो वा मनुष्यो वा नैनं जानीमहे वयम् । हत्वा पाञ्चालराजं यो रथमारुह्य तिष्ठति ॥
data.md: They said, we know not whether he is a Rakshasa or a human being. Having killed the Panchala king he wait there.

data.v: ततस्ते योधमुख्यास्तं सहसा पर्यवारयन् । स तानापततः सर्वान्रुद्रास्त्रेण व्यपोथयत् ॥
data.md: Thereat those foremost of warriors suddenly surrounded Drona's son. The latter killed them ail the means of the Rudra weapon.

data.v: धृष्टद्युम्नं च हत्वा स तांश्चैवास्य पदानुगान् । अपश्यच्छयने सुप्तमुत्तमौजसमन्तिके ॥
data.md: Having killed Dhrishtadyumna and all those followers of his, he saw Uttamaujas sleeping on his bed.

data.v: तमप्याक्रम्य पादेन कण्ठे चोरसि चौजसा । तथैव मारयामास विनर्दन्तमरिंदमम् ॥
data.md: Attacking him with his foot on the throat and chest, Drona's son killed that great hero also while the latter suffered greatly.

data.v: युधामन्युस्तु संप्राप्तो मत्त्वा तं रक्षसा हतम् । गदामुद्यम्य वेगेन हृदि द्रौणिमताडयत् ॥
data.md: Coming up and taking his comrade for being slain by a Rakshasa, Yudhamanyu speedily struck Drona's son in the chest with a mace.

data.v: तमभिद्रुत्य जग्राह क्षितौ चैनमपातयत् । विस्फुरन्तं च पशुवत्तथैवैनममारयत् ॥
data.md: Rushing towards him, Ashvatthaman seized him and brought him down to the ground and killed him like an animal while the latter cried aloud.

data.v: तथा स वीरो हत्वा तं ततोऽन्यान्समुपाद्रवत् । संसुप्तानेव राजेन्द्र तत्र तत्र महारथान् । स्फुरतो वेपमानांश्च शमितेव पशून्मखे ॥
data.md: Having killed Yudhamanyu thus, that hero went against the other car-warriors of the king, who were all asleep.

data.v: ततो निस्त्रिंशमादाय जघानान्यान्पृथग्जनान् । भागशो विचरन्मार्गानसियुद्धविशारदः ॥
तथैव गुल्मे संप्रेक्ष्य शयानान्मध्यगौल्मिकान् । श्रान्तान्न्यस्तायुधान्सर्वान्क्षणेनैव व्यपोथयत् ॥
योधानश्वान्द्विपांश्चैव प्राच्छिनत्स वरासिना । रुधिरोक्षितसर्वाङ्गः कालसृष्ट इवान्तकः ॥
विस्फुरद्भिश्च तैर्द्रौणिर्निस्त्रिंशस्योद्यमेन च । आक्षेपेण तथैवासेस्त्रिधा रक्तोक्षितोऽभवत् ॥
तस्य लोहितसिक्तस्य दीप्तखड्गस्य युध्यतः । अमानुष इवाकारो बभौ परमभीषणः ॥
ये त्वजाग्रत कौरव्य तेऽपि शब्देन मोहिताः । निरीक्ष्यमाणा अन्योन्यं द्रौणिं दृष्ट्वा प्रविव्यथुः ॥
data.md: Those who got up from sleep, O Kuruhero, became stupefied with the loud noise they heard. Seeing Drona's son, they looked at each other's faces and trembled with fear.

data.v: तद्रूपं तस्य ते दृष्ट्वा क्षत्रियाः शत्रुकर्शनाः । राक्षसं मन्यमानास्तं नयनानि न्यमीलयन् ॥
data.md: Seeing the form of that crusher of foes, those Kshatriyas took him to be a Rakshasa and shut up their eyes.

data.v: स घोररूपो व्यचरत्कालवच्छिबिरे ततः । अपश्यद्द्रौपदीपुत्रानवशिष्टांश्च सोमकान् ॥
data.md: Of terrible form, he moved about in the camp like Yama himself, and at last saw the sons of Draupadi and the residue of the Somakas.

data.v: तेन शब्देन वित्रस्ता धनुर्हस्ता महारथाः । धृष्टद्युम्नं हतं श्रुत्वा द्रौपदेया विशां पते । अवाकिरञ्शरव्रातैर्भारद्वाजमभीतवत् ॥
data.md: Terrified by the noise, and learning that Dhrishtadyumna had been killed those great car-warriors, viz., the sons of Draupadi, armed with bows, shot arrows on Drona's son.

data.v: ततस्तेन निनादेन संप्रबुद्धाः प्रभद्रकाः । शिलीमुखैः शिखण्डी च द्रोणपुत्रं समार्दयन् ॥
भारद्वाजस्तु तान्दृष्ट्वा शरवर्षाणि वर्षतः । ननाद बलवन्नादं जिघांसुस्तान्सुदुर्जयान् ॥
data.md: Seeing them cast their arrows on him, Drona's son uttered a loud roar and became desirous of killing those great car-warriors.

data.v: ततः परमसंक्रुद्धः पितुर्वधमनुस्मरन् । अवरुह्य रथोपस्थात्त्वरमाणोऽभिदुद्रुवे ॥
data.md: Remembering the death of his father, Ashvatthaman became furious with rage, getting down from his car, he made a desperate rush against his enemies.

data.v: सहस्रचन्द्रं विपुलं गृहीत्वा चर्म संयुगे । खड्गं च विपुलं दिव्यं जातरूपपरिष्कृतम् । द्रौपदेयानभिद्रुत्य खड्गेन व्यचरद्बली ॥
data.md: Taking up his bright shield decked with a thousand moons and his massive and celestial sword decked with god, the great Ashvatthaman rushed against the sons of Draupadi.

data.v: ततः स नरशार्दूलः प्रतिविन्ध्यं तमाहवे । कुक्षिदेशेऽवधीद्राजन्स हतो न्यपतद्भुवि ॥
data.md: Then that foremost of men, in that dreadful battle, struck Prativindhya in the abdomen at which the latter, O king, fell down lifeless on the Earth.

data.v: प्रासेन विद्ध्वा द्रौणिं तु सुतसोमः प्रतापवान् । पुनश्चासिं समुद्यम्य द्रोणपुत्रमुपाद्रवत् ॥
data.md: Having pierced the son of Drona with a lance, the brave Sutasoma rushed at him with his uplifted sword.

data.v: सुतसोमस्य सासिं तु बाहुं छित्त्वा नरर्षभः । पुनरभ्यहनत्पार्श्वे स भिन्नहृदयोऽपतत् ॥
data.md: Ashvatthaman, however, cut off Sutasoma's hand holding the sword, and once more struck him on the back. Thereat Sutasoma dropped down dead.

data.v: नाकुलिस्तु शतानीको रथचक्रेण वीर्यवान् । दोर्भ्यामुत्क्षिप्य वेगेन वक्षस्येनमताडयत् ॥
data.md: Taking up a car-wheel with his two hands, the brave Shatanika, the son of Nakula, violently struck Ashvatthaman on the breast.

data.v: अताडयच्छतानीकं मुक्तचक्रं द्विजस्तु सः । स विह्वलो ययौ भूमिं ततोऽस्यापाहरच्छिरः ॥
data.md: The great Ashvatthaman violently assailed Shatanika after he had discharged that carwheel. Exceedingly agitated, Nakula's son dropped down upon the earth, upon which Drona's son severed his head from his body.

data.v: श्रुतकर्मा तु परिघं गृहीत्वा समताडयत् । अभिद्रुत्य ततो द्रौणिं सव्ये स फलके भृशम् ॥
data.md: Then taking up a spiked bludgeon, Shrutakarman attacked Ashvatthaman. Furiously rushing at Drona's son, he struck him violently on the left part of his forehead.

data.v: स तु तं श्रुतकर्माणमास्ये जघ्ने वरासिना । स हतो न्यपतद्भूमौ विमूढो विकृताननः ॥
data.md: Ashvatthaman struck Shrutakarman with his excellent sword on the face. Senseless and his face disfigured, he dropped down dead on the Earth.

data.v: तेन शब्देन वीरस्तु श्रुतकीर्तिर्महाधनुः । अश्वत्थामानमासाद्य शरवर्षैरवाकिरत् ॥
data.md: At this noist, the heroic Shutakirti that great car-warrior, coming up made a downpour of arrows on Ashvatthaman.

data.v: तस्यापि शरवर्षाणि चर्मणा प्रतिवार्य सः । सकुण्डलं शिरः कायाद्भ्राजमानमपाहरत् ॥
data.md: Counteracting those arrowy shower with his shield, Ashvatthaman sundered from his enemy's trunk his beautiful head bedecked with ear-rings.

data.v: ततो भीष्मनिहन्ता तं सह सर्वैः प्रभद्रकैः । अहनत्सर्वतो वीरं नानाप्रहरणैर्बली । शिलीमुखेन चाप्येनं भ्रुवोर्मध्ये समार्दयत् ॥
data.md: the destroyer of Bhishma, viz., the great Shikhandin, with all the Prabhadrakas, assailed the hero from every side with various sorts of Weapors. Shikhandin struck Ashvatthaman with an arrow in the midst of his two eyebrows.

data.v: स तु क्रोधसमाविष्टो द्रोणपुत्रो महाबलः । शिखण्डिनं समासाद्य द्विधा चिच्छेद सोऽसिना ॥
data.md: Worked up with anger at this, the powerful son of Drona, approached Shikhandin and cut him in two parts with his sword.

data.v: शिखण्डिनं ततो हत्वा क्रोधाविष्टः परंतपः । प्रभद्रकगणान्सर्वानभिदुद्राव वेगवान् । यच्च शिष्टं विराटस्य बलं तच्च समाद्रवत् ॥
data.md: Having killed Shikhandin, Ashvatthaman, filled with rage, rushed furiously against the other Prabhadrakas. He proceeded also against the residue of Virata's force.

data.v: द्रुपदस्य च पुत्राणां पौत्राणां सुहृदामपि । चकार कदनं घोरं दृष्ट्वा दृष्ट्वा महाबलः ॥
अन्यानन्यांश्च पुरुषानभिसृत्याभिसृत्य च । न्यकृन्तदसिना द्रौणिरसिमार्गविशारदः ॥
कालीं रक्तास्यनयनां रक्तमाल्यानुलेपनाम् । रक्ताम्बरधरामेकां पाशहस्तां शिखण्डिनीम् ॥
ददृशुः कालरात्रिं ते स्मयमानामवस्थिताम् । नराश्वकुञ्जरान्पाशैर्बद्ध्वा घोरैः प्रतस्थुषीम् । हरन्तीं विविधान्प्रेतान्पाशबद्धान्विमूर्धजान् ॥
स्वप्ने सुप्तान्नयन्तीं तां रात्रिष्वन्यासु मारिष । ददृशुर्योधमुख्यास्ते घ्नन्तं द्रौणिं च नित्यदा ॥
data.md: On previous days, ( sire the leading warriors, of the Pandava camp used to see in their dreams that figure carrying away the sleeping warriors and Drona's son striking them behind.

data.v: यतः प्रवृत्तः संग्रामः कुरुपाण्डवसेनयोः । ततः प्रभृति तां कृत्यामपश्यन्द्रौणिमेव च ॥
data.md: The Pandava soldiers dreamt that lady and Drona's son every night from the day when the battle between the Kurus and the Pandavas first began.

data.v: तांस्तु दैवहतान्पूर्वं पश्चाद्द्रौणिर्न्यपातयत् । त्रासयन्सर्वभूतानि विनदन्भैरवान्रवान् ॥
data.md: Assailed before by Destiny, they were now struck by Drona's son who terrified them all with the dreadful cries.

data.v: तदनुस्मृत्य ते वीरा दर्शनं पौर्वकालिकम् । इदं तदित्यमन्यन्त दैवेनोपनिपीडिताः ॥
data.md: Assailed by Destiny, and remembering the spectacle they had dreamt, the brave warriors of the Pandavas camp, identified it with what they now saw.

data.v: ततस्तेन निनादेन प्रत्यबुध्यन्त धन्विनः । शिबिरे पाण्डवेयानां शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: At the noise made, hundreds and thousands of Pandava bowmen in the camp awoke from their sleep.

data.v: सोऽच्छिनत्कस्यचित्पादौ जघनं चैव कस्यचित् । कांश्चिद्बिभेद पार्श्वेषु कालसृष्ट इवान्तकः ॥
data.md: Ashvatthaman cut of the legs of some, and the hips of others, and cut some in their back, moving about like the Destroyer himself let loose by Time.

data.v: अत्युग्रप्रतिपिष्टैश्च नदद्भिश्च भृशातुरैः । गजाश्वमथितैश्चान्यैर्मही कीर्णाभवत्प्रभो ॥
data.md: The Earth, O lord, was soon strewn with human beings that were disfigured or trampled down by elephants and horses.

data.v: क्रोशतां किमिदं कोऽयं किं शब्दः किं नु किं कृतम् । एवं तेषां तदा द्रौणिरन्तकः समपद्यत ॥
data.md: Many of them loudly cried-What is this?-Who is this one!-What is this noise?-Who is doing what?-While crying thus Drona's son killed them.

data.v: अपेतशस्त्रसंनाहान्संरब्धान्पाण्डुसृञ्जयान् । प्राहिणोन्मृत्युलोकाय द्रौणिः प्रहरतां वरः ॥
data.md: That best of strikers, viz., the son of Drona, sent to the abode of Yama all those Pandus and Srinjayas who were deprived of armour and weapons.

data.v: ततस्तच्छस्त्रवित्रस्ता उत्पतन्तो भयातुराः । निद्रान्धा नष्टसंज्ञाश्च तत्र तत्र निलिल्यिरे ॥
data.md: Terrified at that noise many got up from sleep. Stricken with fear, and beside themselves with sleep, those warriors seemed to disappear before the fury of Ashvatthaman.

data.v: ऊरुस्तम्भगृहीताश्च कश्मलाभिहतौजसः । विनदन्तो भृशं त्रस्ताः संन्यपेषन्परस्परम् ॥
data.md: The thighs of many were paralysed and some were so stupefied that they lost their। energy. Crying and stricken with fear, they : began to kill on another.

data.v: ततो रथं पुनर्द्रौणिरास्थितो भीमनिस्वनम् । धनुष्पाणिः शरैरन्यान्प्रेषयद्वै यमक्षयम् ॥
data.md: Drona's son once more mounted his car, and taking up his bow sent many with his arrows to Yama's abode.

data.v: पुनरुत्पततः कांश्चिद्दूरादपि नरोत्तमान् । शूरान्संपततश्चान्यान्कालरात्र्यै न्यवेदयत् ॥
data.md: Other brave warriors and foremost of men, that got up from sleep, as they came towards Ashvatthaman, were killed before they could approach him and were thus given as victims to that Death-night.

data.v: तथैव स्यन्दनाग्रेण प्रमथन्स विधावति । शरवर्षैश्च विविधैरवर्षच्छात्रवांस्ततः ॥
data.md: Crushing many with that best of cars, he moved through the encampment, and enshrouded his foes with repeated showers of arrows.

data.v: पुनश्च सुविचित्रेण शतचन्द्रेण चर्मणा । तेन चाकाशवर्णेन तदाचरत सोऽसिना ॥
data.md: Again with that beautiful shield of his, bedecked with a hundred moons, and with that sky-colored sword of his, he moved about amidst his enemics.

data.v: तथा स शिबिरं तेषां द्रौणिराहवदुर्मदः । व्यक्षोभयत राजेन्द्र महाह्रदमिव द्विपः ॥
data.md: Like an elephant agitating a large lake, Drona's son who cannot be checked in battle, agitated the camp of the Pandavas.

data.v: उत्पेतुस्तेन शब्देन योधा राजन्विचेतसः । निद्रार्ताश्च भयार्ताश्च व्यधावन्त ततस्ततः ॥
data.md: Awaked by the noise, O king, many warriors, still possessed by sleep and fear ran hither and thither.

data.v: विस्वरं चुक्रुशुश्चान्ये बह्वबद्धं तथावदन् । न च स्म प्रतिपद्यन्ते शस्त्राणि वसनानि च ॥
data.md: Many cried and many uttered unmeaning jargon. Many could not secure their weapons and armour.

data.v: विमुक्तकेशाश्चाप्यन्ये नाभ्यजानन्परस्परम् । उत्पतन्तः परे भीताः केचित्तत्र तथाभ्रमन् । पुरीषमसृजन्केचित्केचिन्मूत्रं प्रसुस्रुवुः ॥
data.md: The hairs of many were disheveled, and many could not recognise one another. Having got up from sleep, many fell down, fatigued; some walked purposely here and there.

data.v: बन्धनानि च राजेन्द्र संछिद्य तुरगा द्विपाः । समं पर्यपतंश्चान्ये कुर्वन्तो महदाकुलम् ॥
तत्र केचिन्नरा भीता व्यलीयन्त महीतले । तथैव तान्निपतितानपिंषन्गजवाजिनः ॥
तस्मिंस्तथा वर्तमाने रक्षांसि पुरुषर्षभ । तृप्तानि व्यनदन्नुच्चैर्मुदा भरतसत्तम ॥
स शब्दः प्रेरितो राजन्भूतसंघैर्मुदा युतैः । अपूरयद्दिशः सर्वा दिवं चापि महास्वनः ॥
तेषामार्तस्वरं श्रुत्वा वित्रस्ता गजवाजिनः । मुक्ताः पर्यपतन्राजन्मृद्नन्तः शिबिरे जनम् ॥
तैस्तत्र परिधावद्भिश्चरणोदीरितं रजः । अकरोच्छिबिरे तेषां रजन्यां द्विगुणं तमः ॥
तस्मिंस्तमसि संजाते प्रमूढाः सर्वतो जनाः । नाजानन्पितरः पुत्रान्भ्रातॄन्भ्रातर एव च ॥
data.md: When that thick darkness set in, the warriors in the camp became perfectly bewildered; fathers recognised not their sons, brothers recognised not their brothers.

data.v: गजा गजानतिक्रम्य निर्मनुष्या हया हयान् । अताडयंस्तथाभञ्जंस्तथामृद्नंश्च भारत ॥
data.md: Elephants, striking riderless elephants, and horses, striking riderless horses, assailed and broke and crushed the people that stood in their way.

data.v: ते भग्नाः प्रपतन्तश्च निघ्नन्तश्च परस्परम् । न्यपातयन्त च परान्पातयित्वा तथापिषन् ॥
data.md: Confused combatants rushed and killed one another, and felling those that stood in their way crushed them into pieces.

data.v: विचेतसः सनिद्राश्च तमसा चावृता नराः । जघ्नुः स्वानेव तत्राथ कालेनाभिप्रचोदिताः ॥
data.md: Senseless and overcome with sleep, and covered with darkness, men, urged on by fate, killed their own comrades.

data.v: त्यक्त्वा द्वाराणि च द्वाःस्थास्तथा गुल्मांश्च गौल्मिकाः । प्राद्रवन्त यथाशक्ति कांदिशीका विचेतसः ॥
data.md: The guards, living the gates in their charge, and those at duty at the outposts leaving their posts, fled away for their lives, senseless, and not knowing where they proceeded.

data.v: विप्रनष्टाश्च तेऽन्योन्यं नाजानन्त तदा विभो । क्रोशन्तस्तात पुत्रेति दैवोपहतचेतसः ॥
data.md: They killed one another, the slayers, O lord, not recognising the killed. Assailed by fate, they cried after their fathers and sons.

data.v: पलायतां दिशस्तेषां स्वानप्युत्सृज्य बान्धवान् । गोत्रनामभिरन्योन्यमाक्रन्दन्त ततो जनाः ॥
data.md: While they fled, leaving behind their friends and relatives, they called upon one another, mentioning their families and names.

data.v: हाहाकारं च कुर्वाणाः पृथिव्यां शेरते परे । तान्बुद्ध्वा रणमत्तोऽसौ द्रोणपुत्रो व्यपोथयत् ॥
data.md: Uttering cries of lamentation others dropped down on the Earth. In the thick of the battle Drona's son, recognising them, killed them all.

data.v: तत्रापरे वध्यमाना मुहुर्मुहुरचेतसः । शिबिरान्निष्पतन्ति स्म क्षत्रिया भयपीडिताः ॥
data.md: While being killed, other Kshatriyas lost their senses, and, stricken with fear, tried to fly away from the camps.

data.v: तांस्तु निष्पततस्त्रस्ताञ्शिबिराञ्जीवितैषिणः । कृतवर्मा कृपश्चैव द्वारदेशे निजघ्नतुः ॥
data.md: Those men that tried to fly away from the camp for saving their lives wee killed by Kritavarman and Kripa at the gate.

data.v: विशस्त्रयन्त्रकवचान्मुक्तकेशान्कृताञ्जलीन् । वेपमानान्क्षितौ भीतान्नैव कांश्चिदमुञ्चताम् ॥
data.md: Having no weapons, instruments and armour, and with disheveled hair, they clasped their hands. Trembling with fear, they stood on the ground, The two Kuru-warriors. however, (who were on their cars) gave none an opportunity.

data.v: नामुच्यत तयोः कश्चिन्निष्क्रान्तः शिबिराद्बहिः । कृपस्य च महाराज हार्दिक्यस्य च दुर्मतेः ॥
data.md: None amongst those that escaped from the camp was allowed to go by those two wicked persons, viz., Kripa and Kritavarman.

data.v: भूयश्चैव चिकीर्षन्तौ द्रोणपुत्रस्य तौ प्रियम् । त्रिषु देशेषु ददतुः शिबिरस्य हुताशनम् ॥
data.md: Then again for pleasing Drona's son, those two set fire to the Pandava camp in three places.

data.v: ततः प्रकाशे शिबिरे खड्गेन पितृनन्दनः । अश्वत्थामा महाराज व्यचरत्कृतहस्तवत् ॥
data.md: When the camp was lighted, Ashvatthaman, O king, moved about sword in hand, and crushing his foes with great skill.

data.v: कांश्चिदापततो वीरानपरांश्च प्रधावतः । व्ययोजयत खड्गेन प्राणैर्द्विजवरो नरान् ॥
data.md: Some of his brave enemies rushed furiously towards him and some ran here and there. That foremost of men, with his sword, deprived all of them of their lives.

data.v: कांश्चिद्योधान्स खड्गेन मध्ये संछिद्य वीर्यवान् । अपातयद्द्रोणसुतः संरब्धस्तिलकाण्डवत् ॥
data.md: Filled with rage the brave son of Drona, struck down some of the warriors, cutting them in two with his sword like sesame stalks.

data.v: विनदद्भिर्भृशायस्तैर्नराश्वद्विरदोत्तमैः । पतितैरभवत्कीर्णा मेदिनी भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: The Earth, O Chief of Bharata was covered with the bodies of foremost of men, and horses and elephants huddled together and bewailing.

data.v: मानुषाणां सहस्रेषु हतेषु पतितेषु च । उदतिष्ठन्कबन्धानि बहून्युत्थाय चापतन् ॥
data.md: When thousands of men had fallen down lifeless, numberless headless trunks stood up and fell down.

data.v: सायुधान्साङ्गदान्बाहून्निचकर्त शिरांसि च । हस्तिहस्तोपमानूरून्हस्तान्पादांश्च भारत ॥
data.md: Ashvatthaman, O Bharata, cut off arms, adorned with armlets and holding weapons, and heads, and things resembling trunks of elephants, and hands, and feet.

data.v: पृष्ठच्छिन्नाञ्शिरश्छिन्नान्पार्श्वच्छिन्नांस्तथापरान् । समासाद्याकरोद्द्रौणिः कांश्चिच्चापि पराङ्मुखान् ॥
data.md: The great son of Drona wounded the backs of some, cut off the heads of some, and caused some to retreat from the fight.

data.v: मध्यकायान्नरानन्यांश्चिच्छेदान्यांश्च कर्णतः । अंसदेशे निहत्यान्यान्काये प्रावेशयच्छिरः ॥
data.md: He cut off some at the middle, and cut off the ears of others, and struck others on the shoulders, and pressed down the heads of some into their trunks.

data.v: एवं विचरतस्तस्य निघ्नतः सुबहून्नरान् । तमसा रजनी घोरा बभौ दारुणदर्शना ॥
data.md: As Ashvatthaman moved about in this way killing thousands of men, the deep night became more dreadful for the darkness that set in.

data.v: किंचित्प्राणैश्च पुरुषैर्हतैश्चान्यैः सहस्रशः । बहुना च गजाश्वेन भूरभूद्भीमदर्शना ॥
data.md: The Earth became terrible to look at, covered with thousands of human beings, dead and dying, and numberless horses and elephants.

data.v: यक्षरक्षःसमाकीर्णे रथाश्वद्विपदारुणे । क्रुद्धेन द्रोणपुत्रेण संछिन्नाः प्रापतन्भुवि ॥
data.md: Severed by the angry son of Drona, his enemies dropped down on the Earth that was then covered with Yakshas and Rakshasas and rendered frightful with (broken) cars and killed horses and elephants.

data.v: मातॄरन्ये पितॄनन्ये भ्रातॄनन्ये विचुक्रुशुः । केचिदूचुर्न तत्क्रुद्धैर्धार्तराष्ट्रैः कृतं रणे ॥
data.md: Some called upon their brothers, and some upon their fathers and some upon their sons. And some said'The son of Dhritarastra in anger could never perform such acts in battle as these which wicked Rakshasas have done during the hour of our sleep! It is only for the absence of the Parthas that this great destruction is going on!

data.v: यत्कृतं नः प्रसुप्तानां रक्षोभिः क्रूरकर्मभिः । असांनिध्याद्धि पार्थानामिदं नः कदनं कृतम् ॥
न देवासुरगन्धर्वैर्न यक्षैर्न च राक्षसैः । शक्यो विजेतुं कौन्तेयो गोप्ता यस्य जनार्दनः ॥
ब्रह्मण्यः सत्यवाग्दान्तः सर्वभूतानुकम्पकः । न च सुप्तं प्रमत्तं वा न्यस्तशस्त्रं कृताञ्जलिम् । धावन्तं मुक्तकेशं वा हन्ति पार्थो धनंजयः ॥
data.md: Devoted to Brahma, truthful in speech, selfcontrolled, and kind to all creatures, that son of Pritha, called Dhananjaya never killed one who is asieep, or one who is careless, or one who has thrown off his weapons, or one who joins his hands for protection, or one who is retreating, or one whose hairs have been disheveled.

data.v: तदिदं नः कृतं घोरं रक्षोभिः क्रूरकर्मभिः । इति लालप्यमानाः स्म शेरते बहवो जनाः ॥
data.md: Alas, they are wicked Rakshasas, who are perpetrating such terrible acts upon ourselves!'-Saying so, many laid themselves down.

data.v: स्तनतां च मनुष्याणामपरेषां च कूजताम् । ततो मुहूर्तात्प्राशाम्यत्स शब्दस्तुमुलो महान् ॥
data.md: The loud sound caused by the cries and groans of men stopped within a short time.

data.v: शोणितव्यतिषिक्तायां वसुधायां च भूमिप । तद्रजस्तुमुलं घोरं क्षणेनान्तरधीयत ॥
data.md: The earth being drenched with blood, O king, that thick and dreadful dust soon disappeared.

data.v: संवेष्टमानानुद्विग्नान्निरुत्साहान्सहस्रशः । न्यपातयन्नरान्क्रुद्धः पशून्पशुपतिर्यथा ॥
data.md: Thousands of men who were writhing in agnoy, stricken with anxiety, and filled with despair were killed by Ashvatthaman like Rudra killing living animals.

data.v: अन्योन्यं संपरिष्वज्य शयानान्द्रवतोऽपरान् । संलीनान्युध्यमानांश्च सर्वान्द्रौणिरपोथयत् ॥
data.md: Many who laid themselves down on the ground clasping one another, and many who tried to fly away, and many who tried to hide themselves, and many who fought, were all killed by the son of Drona.

data.v: दह्यमाना हुताशेन वध्यमानाश्च तेन ते । परस्परं तदा योधा अनयन्यमसादनम् ॥
data.md: Burnt by fire and killed by Ashvatthaman, the men, beside themselves, killed one another.

data.v: तस्या रजन्यास्त्वर्धेन पाण्डवानां महद्बलम् । गमयामास राजेन्द्र द्रौणिर्यमनिवेशनम् ॥
data.md: Before half the night was over, the son of Drona, O king, killed the large army of the Pandavas.

data.v: निशाचराणां सत्त्वानां स रात्रिर्हर्षवर्धिनी । आसीन्नरगजाश्वानां रौद्री क्षयकरी भृशम् ॥
data.md: That night, so terrible and destructive of men and elephants and horses filled with joy all creatures and range in darkness.

data.v: तत्रादृश्यन्त रक्षांसि पिशाचाश्च पृथग्विधाः । खादन्तो नरमांसानि पिबन्तः शोणितानि च ॥
data.md: Many Rakshasas and Pishachas were secn there, eating human flesh and drinking the blood.

data.v: करालाः पिङ्गला रौद्राः शैलदन्ता रजस्वलाः । जटिला दीर्घसक्थाश्च पञ्चपादा महोदराः ॥
data.md: They dreadful, twany-colored, terrible, of adamantine teeth, and covered with blood. With matted locks on their heads, their thighs were long and massive; they had five fect, their stomachs were huge. were

data.v: पश्चादङ्गुलयो रूक्षा विरूपा भैरवस्वनाः । घटजानवोऽतिह्रस्वाश्च नीलकण्ठा विभीषणाः ॥
data.md: Their fingers were set backwards. They had harsh temper and ugly features, and their voice was loud and terrible. They had rows of tinkling bells tied to their persons. They had blue throats, they looked very frightful.

data.v: सपुत्रदाराः सुक्रूरा दुर्दर्शनसुनिर्घृणाः । विविधानि च रूपाणि तत्रादृश्यन्त रक्षसाम् ॥
data.md: High cruel and incapable of being looked at without fear, and hating nothing, they came there with their children and wives. Rakshasas of various forms that came there.

data.v: पीत्वा च शोणितं हृष्टाः प्रानृत्यन्गणशोऽपरे । इदं वरमिदं मेध्यमिदं स्वाद्विति चाब्रुवन् ॥
data.md: Drinking the blood that flowed in streams, they were filled with joy and began to dance in separate parties. This is excellent!-This is pure! This is very sweet!'-these were the words they gave expression to.

data.v: मेदोमज्जास्थिरक्तानां वसानां च भृशाशिताः । परमांसानि खादन्तः क्रव्यादा मांसजीविनः ॥
वसां चाप्यपरे पीत्वा पर्यधावन्विकुक्षिलाः । नानावक्त्रास्तथा रौद्राः क्रव्यादाः पिशिताशिनः ॥

data.v: विसृष्टं हि मया दिव्यमेतदस्त्रं दुरासदम् । अपाण्डवायेति मुने वह्नितेजोऽनुमन्त्र्य वै ॥
data.md: Having put into this irresistible and celestial weapon the energy of fire, I discharged it for the destruction of the Pandavas.

data.v: तदिदं पाण्डवेयानामन्तकायाभिसंहितम् । अद्य पाण्डुसुतान्सर्वाञ्जीविताद्भ्रंशयिष्यति ॥
data.md: Discharged for the destruction of the Pandavas, this weapon, therefore, will take away the lives of all the sons of Pandu.

data.v: कृतं पापमिदं ब्रह्मन्रोषाविष्टेन चेतसा । वधमाशास्य पार्थानां मयास्त्रं सृजता रणे ॥
data.md: O Rishi, I have, under the influence of anger, done this sinful deed! I invoked this weapon in battle for the destruction of the Pandavas!'

data.v: अस्त्रं ब्रह्मशिरस्तात विद्वान्पार्थो धनंजयः । उत्सृष्टवान्न रोषेण न वधाय तवाहवे ॥
data.md: Pritha's son Dhananjaya, O child, knew the use of the weapon called Brahmashira. Neither from anger, nor for your destruction in battle, did he discharge that weapon.

data.v: अस्त्रमस्त्रेण तु रणे तव संशमयिष्यता । विसृष्टमर्जुनेनेदं पुनश्च प्रतिसंहृतम् ॥
data.md: Arjuna, on the other hand, let it off for baffling your weapon. He has again withdrawn it.

data.v: ब्रह्मास्त्रमप्यवाप्यैतदुपदेशात्पितुस्तव । क्षत्रधर्मान्महाबाहुर्नाकम्पत धनंजयः ॥
data.md: Having obtained even the Brahma weapon through your fathers instructions the powerful Dhananjaya did not deviate from a Kshatriya's duties.

data.v: एवं धृतिमतः साधोः सर्वास्त्रविदुषः सतः । सभ्रातृबन्धोः कस्मात्त्वं वधमस्य चिकीर्षसि ॥
data.md: Arjuna is endued with such patience, and honesty. He is, besides, a master of every weapon. Why do you try to bring about the destruction of such a man with all his brothers.

data.v: अस्त्रं ब्रह्मशिरो यत्र परमास्त्रेण वध्यते । समा द्वादश पर्जन्यस्तद्राष्ट्रं नाभिवर्षति ॥
data.md: The region where the weapon Brahmashira is counteracted by another high weapon, suffers from a drought for twelve years, for the clouds do not pour a drop of water you.

data.v: एतदर्थं महाबाहुः शक्तिमानपि पाण्डवः । न विहन्त्येतदस्त्रं ते प्रजाहितचिकीर्षया ॥
data.md: Therefore the mighty-armed son of Pandu, although he had the power, would not still, for doing good of living creatures, baffle your weapon with his.

data.v: पाण्डवास्त्वं च राष्ट्रं च सदा संरक्ष्यमेव नः । तस्मात्संहर दिव्यं त्वमस्त्रमेतन्महाभुज ॥
data.md: The Pandavas should be protected; your self should be protected; the kingdom also should be protected. Therefore, withdraw this your celestial weapon.

data.v: अरोषस्तव चैवास्तु पार्थाः सन्तु निरामयाः । न ह्यधर्मेण राजर्षिः पाण्डवो जेतुमिच्छति ॥
data.md: Drive away from your heart, and let the Pandavas be self! The royal sage Yudhishthira never wishes to gain victory be perpetrating any sinful act.

data.v: मणिं चैतं प्रयच्छैभ्यो यस्ते शिरसि तिष्ठति । एतदादाय ते प्राणान्प्रतिदास्यन्ति पाण्डवाः ॥
data.md: Give them that gem which is on your head. Taking that, the Pandavas will grant in return your life.

data.v: पाण्डवैर्यानि रत्नानि यच्चान्यत्कौरवैर्धनम् । अवाप्तानीह तेभ्योऽयं मणिर्मम विशिष्यते ॥
data.md: Drona's son said This my gem is more valuable than all the wealth that has ever been acquired by the Pandavas and the Kauravas.

data.v: यमाबध्य भयं नास्ति शस्त्रव्याधिक्षुधाश्रयम् । देवेभ्यो दानवेभ्यो वा नागेभ्यो वा कथंचन ॥
data.md: Whenever this gem is used, the wearer entertains no fear from weapons or discase or hunger. He ceases to have any fear of celestials and Danavas and Nagas.

data.v: न च रक्षोगणभयं न तस्करभयं तथा । एवंवीर्यो मणिरयं न मे त्याज्यः कथंचन ॥
data.md: He does not fear the Rakshasas and the robbers, these are the virtues of my gem.

data.v: यत्तु मे भगवानाह तन्मे कार्यमनन्तरम् । अयं मणिरयं चाहमिषीका निपतिष्यति । गर्भेषु पाण्डवेयानाममोघं चैतदुद्यतम् ॥
एवं कुरु न चान्या ते बुद्धिः कार्या कदाचन । गर्भेषु पाण्डवेयानां विसृज्यैतदुपारम ॥
data.md: Vyasa said Do then this. Do not, however, cherish any other purpose, O sinless one. Stop throwing this weapon into the wombs of the Pandava women.

data.v: ततः परममस्त्रं तदश्वत्थामा भृशातुरः । द्वैपायनवचः श्रुत्वा गर्भेषु प्रमुमोच ह ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Having heard these words of Dvaipayana Vyasa, the son of Drona threw that uplifted weapon into the wombs of the Pandava women.

data.v: तदाज्ञाय हृषीकेशो विसृष्टं पापकर्मणा । हृष्यमाण इदं वाक्यं द्रौणिं प्रत्यब्रवीत्तदा ॥
विराटस्य सुतां पूर्वं स्नुषां गाण्डीवधन्वनः । उपप्लव्यगतां दृष्ट्वा व्रतवान्ब्राह्मणोऽब्रवीत् ॥
परिक्षीणेषु कुरुषु पुत्रस्तव जनिष्यति । एतदस्य परिक्षित्त्वं गर्भस्थस्य भविष्यति ॥
तस्य तद्वचनं साधोः सत्यमेव भविष्यति । परिक्षिद्भविता ह्येषां पुनर्वंशकरः सुतः ॥
data.md: The words of that pious man shall be fulfilled. The Pandavas shall have a son called Parikshit.'

data.v: एवं ब्रुवाणं गोविन्दं सात्वतप्रवरं तदा । द्रौणिः परमसंरब्धः प्रत्युवाचेदमुत्तरम् ॥
data.md: While Govinda, that foremost one of the Satwata race, saying these words, Drona's son, filled with anger, replied, saying,-"This, O Keshava, which you say from your partiality for the Pandavas, shall never take place. O you having eyes like lotus petals, my words cannot but be fulfilled.

data.v: नैतदेवं यथात्थ त्वं पक्षपातेन केशव । वचनं पुण्डरीकाक्ष न च मद्वाक्यमन्यथा ॥
data.md: While Govinda, that foremost one of the Satwata race, saying these words, Drona's son, filled with anger, replied, saying,-"This, O Keshava, which you say from your partiality for the Pandavas, shall never take place. O you having eyes like lotus petals, my words cannot but be fulfilled.

data.v: पतिष्यत्येतदस्त्रं हि गर्भे तस्या मयोद्यतम् । विराटदुहितुः कृष्ण यां त्वं रक्षितुमिच्छसि ॥
data.md: Taken up by me, this weapon of mine shall fall on the foetus that is in the womb of Virata's daughter,—which, O Krishna, you are so desirous of protecting.'

data.v: अमोघः परमास्त्रस्य पातस्तस्य भविष्यति । स तु गर्भो मृतो जातो दीर्घमायुरवाप्स्यति ॥
data.md: Krishna said The fall of this mighty weapon will not be useless. The foetus will die. But being dead, it will revive and have a long life.

data.v: त्वां तु कापुरुषं पापं विदुः सर्वे मनीषिणः । असकृत्पापकर्माणं बालजीवितघातकम् ॥
data.md: As regards yourself, all wise men know you as a coward and a sinful wretch. Always engaged in sinful deeds, you are the slayer of children. Therefore, you must have to bear the fruit of your sinful deeds.

data.v: तस्मात्त्वमस्य पापस्य कर्मणः फलमाप्नुहि । त्रीणि वर्षसहस्राणि चरिष्यसि महीमिमाम् । अप्राप्नुवन्क्वचित्कांचित्संविदं जातु केनचित् ॥
data.md: For three thousand years you shall have to wander over this earth, without a companion and without being able to talk with any one.

data.v: निर्जनानसहायस्त्वं देशान्प्रविचरिष्यसि । भवित्री न हि ते क्षुद्र जनमध्येषु संस्थितिः ॥
पूयशोणितगन्धी च दुर्गकान्तारसंश्रयः । विचरिष्यसि पापात्मन्सर्वव्याधिसमन्वितः ॥
data.md: Alone, and without any one with you, you shall wander through various countries, O wretch, you shall have to live out side the pale of human society. The stench of puss and blood shall come out from your body, and you shall live in dense forest and dreary moors. Thou shall wander over the earth, O sinful wight, suffering from all diseases.

data.v: वयः प्राप्य परिक्षित्तु वेदव्रतमवाप्य च । कृपाच्छारद्वताद्वीरः सर्वास्त्राण्युपलप्स्यते ॥
data.md: Coming of age and acquiring a knowledge of the Vedas, the heroic Parikshit, shall obtain all weapons from the son of Sharadvat.

data.v: विदित्वा परमास्त्राणि क्षत्रधर्मव्रते स्थितः । षष्टिं वर्षाणि धर्मात्मा वसुधां पालयिष्यति ॥
data.md: Having acquired all knowledge of all high weapons and observing all Kshatriya duties, that righteous king shall rule the earth for sixty years.

data.v: इतश्चोर्ध्वं महाबाहुः कुरुराजो भविष्यति । परिक्षिन्नाम नृपतिर्मिषतस्ते सुदुर्मते । पश्य मे तपसो वीर्यं सत्यस्य च नराधम ॥
data.md: Moreover, that boy shall become the powerful king of the Kurus, known by the name of Parikshit, before your very eyes, O wicked man.

data.v: यस्मादनादृत्य कृतं त्वयास्मान्कर्म दारुणम् । ब्राह्मणस्य सतश्चैव यस्मात्ते वृत्तमीदृशम् ॥
data.md: Vyasa said Since, obeying us, you have committed this highly cruel act, and since your conduct is such, although you are a good Brahmana by birth, therefore, those excellent words that Devaki's son had said, will, forsooth, be fulfilled regarding you, because you are living the life of a Kshatriya.'

data.v: तस्माद्यद्देवकीपुत्र उक्तवानुत्तमं वचः । असंशयं ते तद्भावि क्षुद्रकर्मन्व्रजाश्वितः ॥
सहैव भवता ब्रह्मन्स्थास्यामि पुरुषेष्वहम् । सत्यवागस्तु भगवानयं च पुरुषोत्तमः ॥
data.md: Ashvatthaman said was With yourself among all men, O Rishi, I shall reside. Let the words of this illustrious and foremost of men prove true.'

data.v: प्रदायाथ मणिं द्रौणिः पाण्डवानां महात्मनाम् । जगाम विमनास्तेषां सर्वेषां पश्यतां वनम् ॥
data.md: Having made over his gem to the great Pandavas, Drona's son cheerlessly proceeded, in their presence, to the forest.

data.v: पाण्डवाश्चापि गोविन्दं पुरस्कृत्य हतद्विषः । कृष्णद्वैपायनं चैव नारदं च महामुनिम् ॥
data.md: The Pandavas, who had killed all their foes, put Govinda and the Krishna-Dvaipayana and the great ascetic Narada at their head, and taking the gem that born with Ashvatthaman, quickly returned to the intelligent Draupadi who was observing the Praya vow."

data.v: द्रोणपुत्रस्य सहजं मणिमादाय सत्वराः । द्रौपदीमभ्यधावन्त प्रायोपेतां मनस्विनीम् ॥
data.md: The Pandavas, who had killed all their foes, put Govinda and the Krishna-Dvaipayana and the great ascetic Narada at their head, and taking the gem that born with Ashvatthaman, quickly returned to the intelligent Draupadi who was observing the Praya vow."

data.v: ततस्ते पुरुषव्याघ्राः सदश्वैरनिलोपमैः । अभ्ययुः सहदाशार्हाः शिबिरं पुनरेव ह ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said “Those foremost of men, borne by their excellent horses, quick-coursing like the wind, came back with Dasharha hero, to their encampment.

data.v: अवतीर्य रथाभ्यां तु त्वरमाणा महारथाः । ददृशुर्द्रौपदीं कृष्णामार्तामार्ततराः स्वयम् ॥
data.md: Quickly getting down from their cars, those great car-warriors, themselves much more afflicted, saw Draupada's daughter Krishna stricken with misery.

data.v: तामुपेत्य निरानन्दां दुःखशोकसमन्विताम् । परिवार्य व्यतिष्ठन्त पाण्डवाः सहकेशवाः ॥
data.md: Approaching the cheerless princess laden with sorrow and grief, the Pandavas with Keshava, sat round her.

data.v: ततो राज्ञाभ्यनुज्ञातो भीमसेनो महाबलः । प्रददौ तु मणिं दिव्यं वचनं चेदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Then the powerful Bhimasena, desired by the king, gave that celestial gem to her and said these words: 'This gem, O amiable lady, is yours. The slayer of your sons had been defeated. Rise, shake off your sorrow, and recollect the duties of a Kshatriya lady.

data.v: अयं भद्रे तव मणिः पुत्रहन्ता जितः स ते । उत्तिष्ठ शोकमुत्सृज्य क्षत्रधर्ममनुस्मर ॥
data.md: Then the powerful Bhimasena, desired by the king, gave that celestial gem to her and said these words: 'This gem, O amiable lady, is yours. The slayer of your sons had been defeated. Rise, shake off your sorrow, and recollect the duties of a Kshatriya lady.

data.v: प्रयाणे वासुदेवस्य शमार्थमसितेक्षणे । यान्युक्तानि त्वया भीरु वाक्यानि मधुघातिनः ॥
data.md: O you of black eyes, when Vasudeva was about to start (from Upaplavya.) on his mission of pace, you had said these words to the slayer of Madhu.

data.v: नैव मे पतयः सन्ति न पुत्रा भ्रातरो न च । नैव त्वमपि गोविन्द शममिच्छति राजनि ॥
data.md: I have no husbands. I have no sons, nor brothers. Nor are you alive, O Govinda, since the king seeks peace.

data.v: उक्तवत्यसि धीराणि वाक्यानि पुरुषोत्तमम् । क्षत्रधर्मानुरूपाणि तानि संस्मर्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Those bitter words were addressed by you to Krishna, that foremost of persons. You should recollect these words that were so consistent with Kshatriya usages.

data.v: हतो दुर्योधनः पापो राज्यस्य परिपन्थकः । दुःशासनस्य रुधिरं पीतं विस्फुरतो मया ॥
data.md: The wretched Duryodhana, that thorn in the way of our sovereignty, has been killed. I have quaffed the blood of the living Dusshasana.

data.v: वैरस्य गतमानृण्यं न स्म वाच्या विवक्षताम् । जित्वा मुक्तो द्रोणपुत्रो ब्राह्मण्याद्गौरवेण च ॥
data.md: We have satisfied the debt we owed to our enemy! People, will not able to blame us any longer! Having defeated Drona's son, we have released him for his being a Brahmana and for the respect that should be shown to our deceased preceptor.

data.v: यशोऽस्य पातितं देवि शरीरं त्ववशेषितम् । वियोजितश्च मणिना न्यासितश्चायुधं भुवि ॥
data.md: His faine has been spoiled, O goddess, only his body remains! He has been divested of his gem and on earth he has been deprived of his gem and on Earth he has been deprived of his weapons.

data.v: केवलानृण्यमाप्तास्मि गुरुपुत्रो गुरुर्मम । शिरस्येतं मणिं राजा प्रतिबध्नातु भारत ॥
data.md: Draupadi said I desired only to satisfy our debt for the injury we have suffered. The preceptor's son deserves my respect as the preceptor himself.

data.v: तं गृहीत्वा ततो राजा शिरस्येवाकरोत्तदा । गुरोरुच्छिष्टमित्येव द्रौपद्या वचनादपि ॥
data.md: Let the king put this gem on his head, O Bharata!'-The king then, taking that gem, placed it on his head, as desired by Draupadi and taking it as a gift from the preceptor.

data.v: ततो दिव्यं मणिवरं शिरसा धारयन्प्रभुः । शुशुभे स महाराजः सचन्द्र इव पर्वतः ॥
data.md: Holding on his head that excellent and celestial gem, the powerful king shone like a mountain with the moon above it.

data.v: उत्तस्थौ पुत्रशोकार्ता ततः कृष्णा मनस्विनी । कृष्णं चापि महाबाहुं पर्यपृच्छत धर्मराट् ॥
data.md: Though laden with grief for the death of her sons, the princess Draupadi, possessed of great mental strength, gave up her vow. Then king Yudhishthira enquired of the powerful Krishna, saying the following words.

data.v: हतेषु सर्वसैन्येषु सौप्तिके तै रथैस्त्रिभिः । शोचन्युधिष्ठिरो राजा दाशार्हमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said "After all the soldiers had been killed during the hour of sleep by those three carwarriors, king Yudhishthira sorrowfully said to Krishna:-'How, O Krishna, could my sons, all of whom were great car-warriors, be killed by the sinful and wretched Ashvatthaman who is not an expert in battle?

data.v: कथं नु कृष्ण पापेन क्षुद्रेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा । द्रौणिना निहताः सर्वे मम पुत्रा महारथाः ॥
तथा कृतास्त्रा विक्रान्ताः सहस्रशतयोधिनः । द्रुपदस्यात्मजाश्चैव द्रोणपुत्रेण पातिताः ॥
data.md: How also could Drona's son kill the children of Drupada, all of whom were masters of weapons, powerful and capable of fighting with hundreds of thousands of enemies?

data.md: Dhritarashtra said Deprived as I am of sons, counselors and all my friends, I shall, forsooth, have to rove about sorrowfully over the Earth.

data.v: किं नु बन्धुविहीनस्य जीवितेन ममाद्य वै । लूनपक्षस्य इव मे जराजीर्णस्य पक्षिणः ॥
data.md: What necessity have I now of life itself, deprived as I am of relatives and friends, I am like a bird shorn of its wings and afflicted with decrepitude?

data.v: हृतराज्यो हतसुहृद्धतचक्षुश्च वै तथा । न भ्राजिष्ये महाप्राज्ञ क्षीणरश्मिरिवांशुमान् ॥
data.md: Deprived of kingdom, deprived of relatives, and shorn of eyes, I cannot, O you of great wisdom, shine any longer on Earth like a luminary divested of its splendour.

data.v: न कृतं सुहृदां वाक्यं जामदग्न्यस्य जल्पतः । नारदस्य च देवर्षेः कृष्णद्वैपायनस्य च ॥
data.md: I did not follow the advice of friends, of Jamadagni's son, of the celestial Rishi Narada, and of Krishna-Dvaipayana.

data.v: सभामध्ये तु कृष्णेन यच्छ्रेयोऽभिहितं मम । अलं वैरेण ते राजन्पुत्रः संगृह्यतामिति ॥
data.md: In the midst of the assembly, Krishna told me what was for my good, saying,-Do away with hostilities, O king! Let your son take the entire kingdom. I did not foolishly follow that advice, and I am now obliged to repent.

data.v: तच्च वाक्यमकृत्वाहं भृशं तप्यामि दुर्मतिः । न हि श्रोतास्मि भीष्मस्य धर्मयुक्तं प्रभाषितम् ॥
दुर्योधनस्य च तथा वृषभस्येव नर्दतः । दुःशासनवधं श्रुत्वा कर्णस्य च विपर्ययम् । द्रोणसूर्योपरागं च हृदयं मे विदीर्यते ॥
data.md: I did not listen to the good counsels of Bhishma. Alas, having heard of the destruction of Duryodhana whose roars were as deep as those of a bull, of the death of Dusshasana and the extinction of Karna and the setting of the Drona-sun, my-heart is not sundered into pieces.

data.v: न स्मराम्यात्मनः किंचित्पुरा संजय दुष्कृतम् । यस्येदं फलमद्येह मया मूढेन भुज्यते ॥
data.md: I do not, O Sanjaya, remember any evil act committed by me in my pristine birth, consequences of which fool as I am, I am now suffering.

data.v: नूनं ह्यपकृतं किंचिन्मया पूर्वेषु जन्मसु । येन मां दुःखभागेषु धाता कर्मसु युक्तवान् ॥
data.md: Forsooth, I committed great sins in my previous lives, for which the great God has made me suffer such a grief.

data.v: परिणामश्च वयसः सर्वबन्धुक्षयश्च मे । सुहृन्मित्रविनाशश्च दैवयोगादुपागतः । कोऽन्योऽस्ति दुःखिततरो मया लोके पुमानिह ॥
data.md: This destruction of all my relatives, wellwishers and friends, at this old age has been brought about by Destiny. Who is there on Earth more afflicted than my wretched self.

data.v: तन्मामद्यैव पश्यन्तु पाण्डवाः संशितव्रतम् । विवृतं ब्रह्मलोकस्य दीर्घमध्वानमास्थितम् ॥
data.md: Therefore, let the Pandavas come and see me this very day determined upon following the long way that leads to the regions of Brahman."

data.v: तस्य लालप्यमानस्य बहुशोकं विचिन्वतः । शोकापहं नरेन्द्रस्य संजयो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana continued-"While king Dhritarashtra was thus bewailing, Sanjaya addressed him in the following words for driving away his grief.

data.v: शोकं राजन्व्यपनुद श्रुतास्ते वेदनिश्चयाः । शास्त्रागमाश्च विविधा वृद्धेभ्यो नृपसत्तम । सृञ्जये पुत्रशोकार्ते यदूचुर्मुनयः पुरा ॥
data.md: Cast off your grief, O king! You have heard the teachings of the Vedas and various scriptures, from the lips of the old, O king! You have heard those words which the sages said to Srinjaya while the latter was stricken with grief on account of the death of his son.

data.v: तथा यौवनजं दर्पमास्थिते ते सुते नृप । न त्वया सुहृदां वाक्यं ब्रुवतामवधारितम् । स्वार्थश्च न कृतः कश्चिल्लुब्धेन फलगृद्धिना ॥
data.md: When your son, O king, grew elated with pride, you did not accept the advice offered to you by your well-wisher. You did not, through covetousness, do what was really for your good.

data.v: तव दुःशासनो मन्त्री राधेयश्च दुरात्मवान् । शकुनिश्चैव दुष्टात्मा चित्रसेनश्च दुर्मतिः । शल्यश्च येन वै सर्वं शल्यभूतं कृतं जगत् ॥
data.md: Your son had Dusshasana, the wicked son of Radha, the equally wicked Shakuni, Chritrasena and Shalya for his counsellor. Your son made the entire world his enemy.

data.v: कुरुवृद्धस्य भीष्मस्य गान्धार्या विदुरस्य च । न कृतं वचनं तेन तव पुत्रेण भारत ॥
न धर्मः सत्कृतः कश्चिन्नित्यं युद्धमिति ब्रुवन् । क्षपिताः क्षत्रियाः सर्वे शत्रूणां वर्धितं यशः ॥
data.md: For this the Kshatriya order has been exterminated, because they did not care for virtue, and always talked of battle, and the fame of your foes enhanced.

data.v: मध्यस्थो हि त्वमप्यासीर्न क्षमं किंचिदुक्तवान् । धूर्धरेण त्वया भारस्तुलया न समं धृतः ॥
data.md: You had occupied the position of an umpire, but you did not utter a word of wholesome advice. Unfitted as you were for the work, you did not hold the scales evenly.

data.v: आदावेव मनुष्येण वर्तितव्यं यथा क्षमम् । यथा नातीतमर्थं वै पश्चात्तापेन युज्यते ॥
data.md: Every one should, at the beginning follow such a line of action that he mey not have, in the end, to repent for something already done by him.

data.v: पुत्रगृद्ध्या त्वया राजन्प्रियं तस्य चिकीर्षता । पश्चात्तापमिदं प्राप्तं न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Out of affection for your son, O king, you did what was agreeable to Duryodhana. You are obliged to repent for that now. You should not, however, grieve.

data.v: मधु यः केवलं दृष्ट्वा प्रपातं नानुपश्यति । स भ्रष्टो मधुलोभेन शोचत्येव यथा भवान् ॥
data.md: The man who always looks at the honey without seeing the fall, meets with destruction through his covetousness for honey. Such a man is obliged to repent like yourself.

data.v: अर्थान्न शोचन्प्राप्नोति न शोचन्विन्दते सुखम् । न शोचञ्श्रियमाप्नोति न शोचन्विन्दते परम् ॥
data.md: The man who indulges in grief never acquires wealth. By grieving one loses the fruits he seeks for. Grief again stands in the way of the acquisition of objects dear to us. The man who grieves loses even his salvation.

data.v: स्वयमुत्पादयित्वाग्निं वस्त्रेण परिवेष्टयेत् । दह्यमानो मनस्तापं भजते न स पण्डितः ॥
data.md: The man who keeps a burning coal within the folds of his cloth and is burnt by the fire thereof is surely called a fool if he grieves for his injuries.

data.v: त्वयैव ससुतेनायं वाक्यवायुसमीरितः । लोभाज्येन च संसिक्तो ज्वलितः पार्थपावकः ॥
data.md: with your You and your son, had with your words fanned the Partha-fire, and covetousness as clarified butter made that fire blaze forth into burning flames.

data.v: तस्मिन्समिद्धे पतिताः शलभा इव ते सुताः । तान्केशवार्चिर्निर्दग्धान्न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Yours fell into that burning fire like insects. You should not, however, grieve for them now that they have all been burnt in the fire of the enemy's arrows.

data.v: यच्चाश्रुपातकलिलं वदनं वहसे नृप । अशास्त्रदृष्टमेतद्धि न प्रशंसन्ति पण्डिताः ॥
data.md: The shedding of tears, O king, is not approved by the scriptures or praised by the wise.

data.v: विस्फुलिङ्गा इव ह्येतान्दहन्ति किल मानवान् । जहीहि मन्युं बुद्ध्या वै धारयात्मानमात्मना ॥
data.md: These tears, like sparks of fire, consume the head for whom they are shed. Drive away your grief with your intelligence, and cheer yourself up with your mental strength.

data.v: एवमाश्वासितस्तेन संजयेन महात्मना । विदुरो भूय एवाह बुद्धिपूर्वं परंतप ॥
data.md: Thus was the king consoled by the great Sanjaya. Vidura then, O scorcher of foes, once again addressed the king, showing great intelligence."

data.v: ततोऽमृतसमैर्वाक्यैर्ह्लादयन्पुरुषर्षभम् । वैचित्रवीर्यं विदुरो यदुवाच निबोध तत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Listen, O Janamejaya, to the nectar like words that Vidura said to the son of Vichitravirya and by which be pleased that foremost of men.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठ राजन्किं शेषे धारयात्मानमात्मना । स्थिरजङ्गममर्त्यानां सर्वेषामेष निर्णयः ॥
data.md: Vidura said Rise, O king! Why are you lying on the Earth. Cheer yourself up. O king, this is the final end of all living creatures.

data.v: सर्वे क्षयान्ता निचयाः पतनान्ताः समुच्छ्रयाः । संयोगा विप्रयोगान्ता मरणान्तं हि जीवितम् ॥
data.md: Everything is liable to destruction; everything that is high is sure to fall down. Union is sure to end in separation; life is sure to end in death.

data.v: यदा शूरं च भीरुं च यमः कर्षति भारत । तत्किं न योत्स्यन्ति हि ते क्षत्रियाः क्षत्रियर्षभ ॥
data.md: The Destroyer, O Bharata, takes both the hero and the coward. Why then, O foremost of Kshatriyas, should not Kshatriyas engage themselves in battle.

data.v: अयुध्यमानो म्रियते युध्यमानश्च जीवति । कालं प्राप्य महाराज न कश्चिदतिवर्तते ॥
data.md: He, who never fights has been seen to die, while he who engaged himself in battle has been seen to escape alive.

data.v: न चाप्येतान्हतान्युद्धे राजञ्शोचितुमर्हसि । प्रमाणं यदि शास्त्राणि गतास्ते परमां गतिम् ॥
data.md: O king, you should not grieve for those who have been killed in battle. If the scriptures are authoritative all of them must have obtained the highest end.

data.v: सर्वे स्वाध्यायवन्तो हि सर्वे च चरितव्रताः । सर्वे चाभिमुखाः क्षीणास्तत्र का परिदेवना ॥
data.md: All of them were well read in the Vedas; all of them had practised vows. All of them have met with death after fighting with the enemy. What is there to be sorry in this.

data.v: अदर्शनादापतिताः पुनश्चादर्शनं गताः । न ते तव न तेषां त्वं तत्र का परिदेवना ॥
data.md: They had been invisible before birth. Having come from that unknown region, they have again become invisible. They are not yours, nor are you theirs. Why should you grieve then for such disappearance?

data.v: हतोऽपि लभते स्वर्गं हत्वा च लभते यशः । उभयं नो बहुगुणं नास्ति निष्फलता रणे ॥
data.md: If killed, one acquires heaven. By killing, fame is acquired. Both of these, produce great merit. Battle, therefore, is not unproductive of good.

data.v: तेषां कामदुघाँल्लोकानिन्द्रः संकल्पयिष्यति । इन्द्रस्यातिथयो ह्येते भवन्ति पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: forsooth, Indra will give them regions capable of granting every wish. These, O foremost of men, become the guests of Indra.

data.v: न यज्ञैर्दक्षिणावद्भिर्न तपोभिर्न विद्यया । स्वर्गं यान्ति तथा मर्त्या यथा शूरा रणे हताः ॥
data.md: By celebrating sacrifice with profuse gifts, by ascetic penances and by learning, men cannot, go so quickly to heaven as heroes killed in battle.

data.v: मातापितृसहस्राणि पुत्रदारशतानि च । संसारेष्वनुभूतानि कस्य ते कस्य वा वयम् ॥
data.md: In this world a thousand sorts of relationship are made such as mother and father and son and wife. In truth, however, whose are they are whose are we?

data.v: शोकस्थानसहस्राणि भयस्थानशतानि च । दिवसे दिवसे मूढमाविशन्ति न पण्डितम् ॥
data.md: Thousands of causes spring up daily for sorrow and thousands for fear. These, however, affect the ignorant and not the wise.

data.v: न कालस्य प्रियः कश्चिन्न द्वेष्यः कुरुसत्तम । न मध्यस्थः क्वचित्कालः सर्वं कालः प्रकर्षति ॥
data.md: There is none dear of hateful to Time, O Kuru chief. Time is indifferent to none. All are equally dragged by time. give up

data.v: अनित्यं जीवितं रूपं यौवनं द्रव्यसंचयः । आरोग्यं प्रियसंवासो गृध्येदेषु न पण्डितः ॥
data.md: Youth, beauty, life, wealth, health, and friends, are all unstable. The wise will never seek any of these.

data.v: न जानपदिकं दुःखमेकः शोचितुमर्हसि । अप्यभावेन युज्येत तच्चास्य न निवर्तते ॥
data.md: You should not grieve for what is universal. By indulging in grief a person may himself die, but grief itself by being indulged in, never becomes light.

data.v: अशोचन्प्रतिकुर्वीत यदि पश्येत्पराक्रमम् । भैषज्यमेतद्दुःखस्य यदेतन्नानुचिन्तयेत् । चिन्त्यमानं हि न व्येति भूयश्चापि विवर्धते ॥
data.md: If you feel any grief heavily, it should be overcome by not indulging in it. This is the only remedy for grief, viz., that one should not indulge in it.

data.v: अनिष्टसंप्रयोगाच्च विप्रयोगात्प्रियस्य च । मनुष्या मानसैर्दुःखैर्युज्यन्ते येऽल्पबुद्धयः ॥
data.md: By indulging in it, one cannot lesson it. On the other hand, it increases when being indulged in. When any evil or when bereavement of some dear one, comes on, only they that are of little intelligence allow their minds to be laden with grief.

data.v: नार्थो न धर्मो न सुखं यदेतदनुशोचसि । न च नापैति कार्यार्थात्त्रिवर्गाच्चैव भ्रश्यते ॥
data.md: This is neither Profit, nor Religion, nor Happiness, of which you are thinking.

data.v: अन्यामन्यां धनावस्थां प्राप्य वैशेषिकीं नराः । असंतुष्टाः प्रमुह्यन्ति संतोषं यान्ति पण्डिताः ॥
data.md: The indulgence of grief in the sure means of one's losing one's objects. Through it, one deviates from the three great ends of life. They, who are not contented are stupefied by the vicissitudes of fortune. The wise, are, on the other hand, unaffected by such changes. One should destroy mental grief by wisdom, as physical grief should be destroyed by medicine. Wisdom has this power. They, however, that are foolish, can never acquire equanimity of mind.

data.v: प्रज्ञया मानसं दुःखं हन्याच्छारीरमौषधैः । एतज्ज्ञानस्य सामर्थ्यं न बालैः समतामियात् ॥
शयानं चानुशयति तिष्ठन्तं चानुतिष्ठति । अनुधावति धावन्तं कर्म पूर्वकृतं नरम् ॥
data.md: Pristine actions closely follow a man, so much so that they lie by him when he lies down, stand by him when he stands, and run with him when he runs.

data.v: यस्यां यस्यामवस्थायां यत्करोति शुभाशुभम् । तस्यां तस्यामवस्थायां तत्तत्फलमुपाश्नुते ॥
data.md: As a man acts well or ill, so he enjoys or suffers the fruit thereof.

data.v: सुभाषितैर्महाप्राज्ञ शोकोऽयं विगतो मम । भुय एव तु वाक्यानि श्रोतुमिच्छामि तत्त्वतः ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said "O you of great wisdom, by grief has been removed by your excellent words. I wish you, however, to speak again.

data.v: अनिष्टानां च संसर्गादिष्टानां च विवर्जनात् । कथं हि मानसैर्दुःखैः प्रमुच्यन्तेऽत्र पण्डिताः ॥
data.md: How, indeed, do the wise free themselves from mental grief begotten by evil deeds and the bereavement of dear objects."

data.v: यतो यतो मनो दुःखात्सुखाद्वापि प्रमुच्यते । ततस्ततः शमं लब्ध्वा सुगतिं विन्दते बुधः ॥
अशाश्वतमिदं सर्वं चिन्त्यमानं नरर्षभ । कदलीसंनिभो लोकः सारो ह्यस्य न विद्यते ॥
गृहाण्येव हि मर्त्यानामाहुर्देहानि पण्डिताः । कालेन विनियुज्यन्ते सत्त्वमेकं तु शोभनम् ॥
