data.v: ध्रुवं दुर्योधनो वीरो गतिं नसुलभां गतः । तथा ह्यभिमुखः शेते शयने वीरसेविते ॥
data.md: Forsooth, the heroic Duryodhana, when he sleeps on that bed of the heroes, has attain to the best end.

data.v: यं पुरा पर्युपासीना रमयन्ति महीक्षितः । महीतलस्थं निहतं गृध्रास्तं पर्युपासते ॥
data.md: He who was formerly encircled by kings who competed with one another to give him pleasure, alas, is now slain and lying on the ground, encircled by vultures.

data.v: यं पुरा व्यजनैरग्र्यैरुपवीजन्ति योषितः । तमद्य पक्षव्यजनैरुपवीजन्ति पक्षिणः ॥
data.md: He who was formerly fanned with beautiful fans by fair damsels, is now fanned by (carnivorous) birds with flaps of their wings.

data.v: एष शेते महाबाहुर्बलवान्सत्यविक्रमः । सिंहेनेव द्विपः संख्ये भीमसेनेन पातितः ॥
data.md: Endued with great strength and true prowess, this mighty-armed prince, killed by Bhimasena in battle, sleeps like in elephant killed by a lion.

data.v: पश्य दुर्योधनं कृष्ण शयानं रुधिरोक्षितम् । निहतं भीमसेनेन गदामुद्यम्य भारत ॥
data.md: Look at Duryodhana, O Krishna, lying on the naked Earth, bathed in blood, killed by Bhimasena with his mace.

data.v: अक्षौहिणीर्महाबाहुर्दश चैकां च केशव । अनयद्यः पुरा संख्ये सोऽनयान्निधनं गतः ॥
data.md: That mighty-armed one who had in battle collected together eleven Akshauhinis of soldiers, O Keshava, has on account of his own evil policy, been now killed.

data.v: एष दुर्योधनः शेते महेष्वासो महारथः । शार्दूल इव सिंहेन भीमसेनेन पातितः ॥
data.md: Alas, there that great bowman and powerful car-warrior sleeps, killed by Bhimasena, like a tiger killed by a lion,

data.v: विदुरं ह्यवमन्यैष पितरं चैव मन्दभाक् । बालो वृद्धावमानेन मन्दो मृत्युवशं गतः ॥
data.md: Having disobeyed Vidura, and his own father, this reckless, foolish, and wicked prince has met with death, on account of his disregard of the old.

data.v: निःसपत्ना मही यस्य त्रयोदश समाः स्थिता । स शेते निहतो भूमौ पुत्रो मे पृथिवीपतिः ॥
data.md: He who had unrivaled away over the Earth, for thirteen years, alas, that prince, that son of mine, sleeps to-day on the naked Earth, killed by his foes.

data.v: अपश्यं कृष्ण पृथिवीं धार्तराष्ट्रानुशासनात् । पूर्णां हस्तिगवाश्वस्य वार्ष्णेय न तु तच्चिरम् ॥
data.md: Not long before, O Krishna, I saw the Earth, full of elephants and kine and horses, ruled by Duryodhana.

data.v: तामेवाद्य महाबाहो पश्याम्यन्यानुशासनात् । हीनां हस्तिगवाश्वेन किं नु जीवामि माधव ॥
data.md: To-day, O you of mighty-arms, I see her governed by another, and destitute of elephants and kine and horses. What need have I, O Madhava, of lie?

data.v: इदं कृच्छ्रतरं पश्य पुत्रस्यापि वधान्मम । यदिमाः पर्युपासन्ते हताञ्शूरान्रणे स्त्रियः ॥
data.md: Again, look at this sight, of these fair ladies weeping by the side of the killed heroes, that is more painful than the death of my son.

data.v: प्रकीर्णकेशां सुश्रोणीं दुर्योधनभुजाङ्कगाम् । रुक्मवेदीनिभां पश्य कृष्ण लक्ष्मणमातरम् ॥
data.md: Behold, O Krishna, the mother of Lakshmana, that lady having large hips, with her hairs disheveled, that dear wife of Duryodhana, resembling a golden sacrificial altar.

data.v: नूनमेषा पुरा बाला जीवमाने महाभुजे । भुजावाश्रित्य रमते सुभुजस्य मनस्विनी ॥
data.md: While her mighty-armed husband was formerly alive, this highly intelligent damsel used to sport within the embrace of her lords' beautiful arms.

data.v: कथं तु शतधा नेदं हृदयं मम दीर्यते । पश्यन्त्या निहतं पुत्रं पुत्रेण सहितं रणे ॥
data.md: Why, indeed, does not my heart break into a hundred pieces seeing my son and grandson killed in battle.

data.v: पुत्रं रुधिरसंसिक्तमुपजिघ्रत्यनिन्दिता । दुर्योधनं तु वामोरूः पाणिना परिमार्जति ॥
data.md: Alas, that innocent lady now smells her son covered with blood. Again, that lady having beautiful thighs is gently rubbing Duryodhana's body with her fair hand.

data.v: किं नु शोचति भर्तारं पुत्रं चैषा मनस्विनी । तथा ह्यवस्थिता भाति पुत्रं चाप्यभिवीक्ष्य सा ॥
data.md: At one time she is grieving for her husband, and again for her son. At one time she looks on her lord, and again on her son.

data.v: स्वशिरः पञ्चशाखाभ्यामभिहत्यायतेक्षणा । पतत्युरसि वीरस्य कुरुराजस्य माधव ॥
data.md: See, O Madhava, striking her head with her hands, she falls upon the breast of her heroic husband, the king of the Kurus.

data.v: पुण्डरीकनिभा भाति पुण्डरीकान्तरप्रभा । मुखं विमृज्य पुत्रस्य भर्तुश्चैव तपस्विनी ॥
data.md: Having a complexion like that of the filaments of the lotus, she looks beautiful like a lotus. The hapless princess, now rubs the face of her son, and again that of her husband.

data.v: यदि चाप्यागमाः सन्ति यदि वा श्रुतयस्तथा । ध्रुवं लोकानवाप्तोऽयं नृपो बाहुबलार्जितान् ॥
data.md: If the scriptures and the Shrutis be true, forsooth, this king has obtained the blessed region that one may acquire by the use of weapons.'

data.v: पश्य माधव पुत्रान्मे शतसंख्याञ्जितक्लमान् । गदया भीमसेनेन भूयिष्ठं निहतान्रणे ॥
data.md: Gandhari said See, O Madhava, my hundred sons. who never knew fatigue in battle, have all been killed by Bhimasena with his mace in battle.

data.v: इदं दुःखतरं मेऽद्य यदिमा मुक्तमूर्धजाः । हतपुत्रा रणे बालाः परिधावन्ति मे स्नुषाः ॥
data.md: That which pains me more to-day is that these my young daughter-in-law, deprived of sons and with disheveled hairs, are wandering on the field today.

data.v: प्रासादतलचारिण्यश्चरणैर्भूषणान्वितैः । आपन्ना यत्स्पृशन्तीमा रुधिरार्द्रां वसुंधराम् ॥
data.md: Alas, they who formerly walked only on the terraces of magnificent edifices with feet decorated with many ornaments, are now, in great misery, obliged to touch with those feet of theirs this hard Earth, covered with blood.

data.v: गृध्रानुत्सारयन्त्यश्च गोमायून्वायसांस्तथा । शोकेनार्ता विघूर्णन्त्यो मत्ता इव चरन्त्युत ॥
data.md: Reeling in sorrow, they are moving about like drunk persons, driving away with difficulty vulture and jackals and crows.

data.v: एषान्या त्वनवद्याङ्गी करसंमितमध्यमा । घोरं तद्वैशसं दृष्ट्वा निपतत्यतिदुःखिता ॥
data.md: Behold, seeing this terrible destruction, that lady of beautiful limbs, and slender waist, falls down, laden with grief.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा मे पार्थिवसुतामेतां लक्ष्मणमातरम् । राजपुत्रीं महाबाहो मनो न व्युपशाम्यति ॥
data.md: Beholding this princess, this mother of Lakshmana, O you of mighty-arms, my heart is torn with sorrow.

data.v: भ्रातॄंश्चान्याः पतींश्चान्याः पुत्रांश्च निहतान्भुवि । दृष्ट्वा परिपतन्त्येताः प्रगृह्य सुभुजा भुजान् ॥
data.md: Some seeing their brothers, some their husbands, and some their sons, lying down dead on the naked earth, these beautiful ladies of fair arms, and themselves falling down, catching the arms of the killed.

data.v: मध्यमानां तु नारीणां वृद्धानां चापराजित । आक्रन्दं हतबन्धूनां दारुणे वैशसे शृणु ॥
data.md: Hear, O unvanquished one, the loud lamentations of those elderly ladies and those others of middle age on witnessing this terrible destruction.

data.v: रथनीडानि देहांश्च हतानां गजवाजिनाम् । आश्रिताः श्रममोहार्ताः स्थिताः पश्य महाबल ॥
data.md: See, O you of great might, those dames, exhausted with fatigue, are taking rest, supporting themselves against broken boxes of cars and the bodies of slain elephants and steeds.

data.v: अन्या चापहृतं कायाच्चारुकुण्डलमुन्नसम् । स्वस्य बन्धोः शिरः कृष्ण गृहीत्वा पश्य तिष्ठति ॥
data.md: See, O Krishna, taking up some relative's severed head adorned with beautiful nose and ear-rings, some one amongst them, is standing sorrowfully.

data.v: पूर्वजातिकृतं पापं मन्ये नाल्पमिवानघ । एताभिरनवद्याभिर्मया चैवाल्पमेधया ॥
data.md: I think, O sinless one, they and myself of little understanding must have perpetrated great iniquities in our previous lives, since, O Janarddana, all our relatives and kinsmen have thus been killed by king Yudhishthira. Our acts, fair or unfair, must bear fruits, O you of Vrishni's race.

data.v: तदिदं धर्मराजेन यातितं नो जनार्दन । न हि नाशोऽस्ति वार्ष्णेय कर्मणोः शुभपापयोः ॥
data.md: I think, O sinless one, they and myself of little understanding must have perpetrated great iniquities in our previous lives, since, O Janarddana, all our relatives and kinsmen have thus been killed by king Yudhishthira. Our acts, fair or unfair, must bear fruits, O you of Vrishni's race.

data.v: प्रत्यग्रवयसः पश्य दर्शनीयकुचोदराः । कुलेषु जाता ह्रीमत्यः कृष्णपक्षाक्षिमूर्धजाः ॥
data.md: See, O Madhava, those young ladies having beautiful breasts and abdomen, born in respectable families, of great modesty, having black eye-lashes and tresses of the same color on their heads, having voice sweet and dear like that of swans, are falling down, unconscious from great grief and crying piteously like fights of cranes.

data.v: हंसगद्गदभाषिण्यो दुःखशोकप्रमोहिताः । सारस्य इव वाशन्त्यः पतिताः पश्य माधव ॥
data.md: See, O Madhava, those young ladies having beautiful breasts and abdomen, born in respectable families, of great modesty, having black eye-lashes and tresses of the same color on their heads, having voice sweet and dear like that of swans, are falling down, unconscious from great grief and crying piteously like fights of cranes.

data.v: फुल्लपद्मप्रकाशानि पुण्डरीकाक्ष योषिताम् । अनवद्यानि वक्त्राणि तपत्यसुखरश्मिवान् ॥
data.md: See, O lotus-eyed, hero, there beautiful faces resembling full-blown lotuses, scorched by the sun.

data.v: ईर्षूणां मम पुत्राणां वासुदेवावरोधनम् । मत्तमातङ्गदर्पाणां पश्यन्त्यद्य पृथग्जनाः ॥
data.md: Alas, O Vasudeva, the wives of my proud children who were powerful like infuriate are elephants, are now being looked at by common people.

data.v: शतचन्द्राणि चर्माणि ध्वजांश्चादित्यसंनिभान् । रौक्माणि चैव वर्माणि निष्कानपि च काञ्चनान् ॥
data.md: See, O Govinda, the shields decked with hundred moons, the sunny standards, the golden coats of mail, and the golden collars and cuirasses, and the head-gears, of my sons, scattered on the Earth, are shining like sacrificial fires over which have been poured libation of clarified butter.

data.v: शीर्षत्राणानि चैतानि पुत्राणां मे महीतले । पश्य दीप्तानि गोविन्द पावकान्सुहुतानिव ॥
data.md: See, O Govinda, the shields decked with hundred moons, the sunny standards, the golden coats of mail, and the golden collars and cuirasses, and the head-gears, of my sons, scattered on the Earth, are shining like sacrificial fires over which have been poured libation of clarified butter.

data.v: एष दुःशासनः शेते शूरेणामित्रघातिना । पीतशोणितसर्वाङ्गो भीमसेनेन पातितः ॥
data.md: There, Dusshasana sleep, killed by Bhima, having the blood of all his limbs drunk by that heroic slayer of foes.

data.v: गदया वीरघातिन्या पश्य माधव मे सुतम् । द्यूतक्लेशाननुस्मृत्य द्रौपद्या चोदितेन च ॥
data.md: Look at that other son of mine, O Madhava, killed by Bhima with his mace, actuated by Draupadi and the memory of his woes at the time of the match at dice.

data.v: उक्ता ह्यनेन पाञ्चाली सभायां द्यूतनिर्जिता । प्रियं चिकीर्षता भ्रातुः कर्णस्य च जनार्दन ॥
data.md: Addressing the princess of Panchala, in the midst of the assembly, who had been won by dice, this Dusshasana, desirous of pleasing his (elder) brother and Karna, O Janarddana, had said,-You are now the wife of a slave! With Sahadeva and Nakula and Arjuna, O lady, enter our household now.

data.v: सहैव सहदेवेन नकुलेनार्जुनेन च । दासभार्यासि पाञ्चालि क्षिप्रं प्रविश नो गृहान् ॥
ततोऽहमब्रुवं कृष्ण तदा दुर्योधनं नृपम् । मृत्युपाशपरिक्षिप्तं शकुनिं पुत्र वर्जय ॥
data.md: At that time, O Krishna, I sad to king Duryodhana,-O son, discard the wrathful Shakuni.

data.v: निबोधैनं सुदुर्बुद्धिं मातुलं कलहप्रियम् । क्षिप्रमेनं परित्यज्य पुत्र शाम्यस्व पाण्डवैः ॥
data.md: Know your maternal uncle to be very wicked and greatly fond of quarrel. Discard him forthwith and make peace with the Pandavas, O son.

data.v: न बुध्यसे त्वं दुर्बुद्धे भीमसेनममर्षणम् । वाङ्नाराचैस्तुदंस्तीक्ष्णैरुल्काभिरिव कुञ्जरम् ॥
data.md: O fool, do you not think of Bhimasena filled with anger. You are cutting him with your words arrows like a person striking an elephant with burning brands.

data.v: तानेष रभसः क्रूरो वाक्शल्यानवधारयन् । उत्ससर्ज विषं तेषु सर्पो गोवृषभेष्विव ॥
data.md: Alas, neglecting my wordy, he vomited his poison of words at them, who had already been cut with wordy arrows, like a snake vomiting his poison at a bull.

data.v: एष दुःशासनः शेते विक्षिप्य विपुलौ भुजौ । निहतो भीमसेनेन सिंहेनेव महर्षभः ॥
data.md: there that Dusshasana sleeps stretching his tow massive arms, killed by Bhimasena like a powerful elephant by a lion.

data.v: अत्यर्थमकरोद्रौद्रं भीमसेनोऽत्यमर्षणः । दुःशासनस्य यत्क्रुद्धोऽपिबच्छोणितमाहवे ॥
data.md: The very angry Bhimasena perpetrated a most dreadful deed by drinking in battle the blood of his foes.

data.v: एष माधव पुत्रो मे विकर्णः प्राज्ञसंमतः । भूमौ विनिहतः शेते भीमेन शतधा कृतः ॥
data.md: Gandhari said There, O Madhava, my. son Vikarma, praised by the wise, lies on the naked earth, killed by Bhima and wounded horribly.

data.v: गजमध्यगतः शेते विकर्णो मधुसूदन । नीलमेघपरिक्षिप्तः शरदीव दिवाकरः ॥
data.md: O destroyer of Madhu, Vikarna lies there dead in the midst of (slain) elephants like the moon in the autumnal sky surrounded by blue clouds.

data.v: अस्य चापग्रहेणैष पाणिः कृतकिणो महान् । कथंचिच्छिद्यते गृध्रैरत्तुकामैस्तलत्रवान् ॥
data.md: His broad palm, covered with leathern fence, and scarred by constant holding of the bow, is pierced with difficulty by vultures desirous of eating it up.

data.v: अस्य भार्यामिषप्रेप्सून्गृध्रानेतांस्तपस्विनी । वारयत्यनिशं बाला न च शक्नोति माधव ॥
data.md: His helpless young wife, O Madhava, is continually but unsuccessfully trying to drive away those vultures desirous of feeding on carrion.

data.v: युवा वृन्दारकः शूरो विकर्णः पुरुषर्षभ । सुखोचितः सुखार्हश्च शेते पांसुषु माधव ॥
data.md: The youthful, brave and beautiful Vikarna, O foremost of men, reared in luxury and worthy of every king of happiness, now sleeps on dust, O Madhava.

data.v: कर्णिनालीकनाराचैर्भिन्नमर्माणमाहवे । अद्यापि न जहात्येनं लक्ष्मीर्भरतसत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Thought all his vital parts have been cut with cloth-yard and bearded arrows and Nalikas, yet the natural beauty of his body has not left this best of the Bharatas.

data.v: एष संग्रामशूरेण प्रतिज्ञां पालयिष्यता । दुर्मुखोऽभिमुखः शेते हतोऽरिगणहा रणे ॥
data.md: There, my son Durmuksha, that destroyer of a great number of enemies, sleeps facing the enemy, slain by the heroic Bhiinasena in satisfaction of his promisc.

data.v: तस्यैतद्वदनं कृष्ण श्वापदैरर्धभक्षितम् । विभात्यभ्यधिकं तात सप्तम्यामिव चन्द्रमाः ॥
data.md: His face, O Krishna, half eaten away by beasts of prey, looks more beautiful like the moon on the seventh day of the light fortnight.

data.v: शूरस्य हि रणे कृष्ण यस्याननमथेदृशम् । स कथं निहतोऽमित्रैः पांसून्ग्रसति मे सुतः ॥
data.md: Look, O Krishna at the face of that heroic son of mine. How could that son of mine be killed by enemies and thus made to eat the dust.

data.v: यस्याहवमुखे सौम्य स्थाता नैवोपपद्यते । स कथं दुर्मुखोऽमित्रैर्हतो विबुधलोकजित् ॥
data.md: O amiable one, how could that Durmukha, before whom no enemy could stand be killed by foes.

data.v: चित्रसेनं हतं भूमौ शयानं मधुसूदन । धार्तराष्ट्रमिमं पश्य प्रतिमानं दनुष्मताम् ॥
data.md: Look, O slayer of Madhu, at that other son of Dhritarashtra, viz., Chitrasena, the best of all bowmen, slain and lying on the ground.

data.v: तं चित्रमाल्याभरणं युवत्यः शोककर्शिताः । क्रव्यादसंघैः सहिता रुदन्त्यः पर्युपासते ॥
data.md: Those young ladies, stricken with grief and crying piteously and now sitting, with beasts of prey, around his beautiful body bedecked with wreaths and garlands.

data.v: स्त्रीणां रुदितनिर्घोषः श्वापदानां च गर्जितम् । चित्ररूपमिदं कृष्ण विचित्रं प्रतिभाति मे ॥
data.md: The piteous lamentations of women, and these cries and roars of beasts of prey, appear highly wonderful to me, OKrishna.

data.v: युवा वृन्दारको नित्यं प्रवरस्त्रीनिषेवितः । विविंशतिरसौ शेते ध्वस्तः पांसुषु माधव ॥
data.md: Young and beautiful, and always waited upon and served by the most handsome ladies, my son Vivinshati, O Madhava, sleeps there, covered with dust.

data.v: शरसंकृत्तवर्माणं वीरं विशसने हतम् । परिवार्यासते गृध्राः परिविंशा विविंशतिम् ॥
data.md: His armour has been cut with arrows. Killed in the general destruction, the heroic Vivingshati is now encircled and waited upon by vultures.

data.v: प्रविश्य समरे वीरः पाण्डवानामनीकिनीम् । आविश्य शयने शेते पुनः सत्पुरुषोचितम् ॥
data.md: Having in battle penetrated the ranks of the Pandavas army, that hero now sleeps on the bed of a most exalted and heroic Kshatriya.

data.v: स्मितोपपन्नं सुनसं सुभ्रु ताराधिपोपमम् । अतीव शुभ्रं वदनं पश्य कृष्ण विविंशतेः ॥
data.md: Look, O Krishna, at his very beautiful and smiling face, having excellent nose and beautiful eyebrows, and resembling the shining Moon himself.

data.v: यं स्म तं पर्युपासन्ते वसुं वासवयोषितः । क्रीडन्तमिव गन्धर्वं देवकन्याः सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: Formerly a body of the most beautiful ladies used to wait upon him, like thousands of celestial girls upon a sporting Gandharva.

data.v: हन्तारं वीरसेनानां शूरं समितिशोभनम् । निबर्हणममित्राणां दुःसहं विषहेत कः ॥
data.md: Who again could stand before my son Dussaha, that destroyer of heroic enemies, that hero, that ornament of assemblies, that irresistible warrior, that resister of foes.

data.v: दुःसहस्यैतदाभाति शरीरं संवृतं शरैः । गिरिरात्मरुहैः फुल्लैः कर्णिकारैरिवावृतः ॥
data.md: The body of Dussaha, covered with shafts, shines like a mountain overgrown with blossoming Karnikaras.

data.v: शातकौम्भ्या स्रजा भाति कवचेन च भास्वता । अग्निनेव गिरिः श्वेतो गतासुरपि दुःसहः ॥
data.md: With his golden garland and his bright armour, Dussaha, though dead, shines yet, like a white mountain of fire.

data.v: अध्यर्धगुणमाहुर्यं बले शौर्ये च माधव । पित्रा त्वया च दाशार्ह दृप्तं सिंहमिवोत्कटम् ॥
यो बिभेद चमूमेको मम पुत्रस्य दुर्भिदाम् । स भूत्वा मृत्युरन्येषां स्वयं मृत्युवशं गतः ॥
तस्योपलक्षये कृष्ण कार्ष्णेरमिततेजसः । अभिमन्योर्हतस्यापि प्रभा नैवोपशाम्यति ॥
data.md: I see, O Krishna, the splendour of that son of Arjuna, of that great hero, viz., Abhimanyu, has not diminished even in death.

data.v: एषा विराटदुहिता स्नुषा गाण्डीवधन्वनः । आर्ता बाला पतिं वीरं शोच्या शोचत्यनिन्दिता ॥
data.md: There, the daughter of Virata, the daughterin-law of Arjuna, that girl of faultless beauty, stricken with grief on seeing her heroic husband, is bewailing.

data.v: तमेषा हि समासाद्य भार्या भर्तारमन्तिके । विराटदुहिता कृष्ण पाणिना परिमार्जति ॥
data.md: Approaching her husband, that young wife, viz., the daughter of Virata, is gently rubbing him, O Krishna, with her hand.

data.v: तस्य वक्त्रमुपाघ्राय सौभद्रस्य यशस्विनी । विबुद्धकमलाकारं कम्बुवृत्तशिरोधरम् ॥
data.md: Formerly, that highly intelligent and beautiful girl, inebriate with honied wines, used bashfully to embrace her lord, and kiss and face of Subhadra's son, resembling a fullblown lotus and supported on a neck bearing three lines like those of a conch-shell.

data.v: काम्यरूपवती चैषा परिष्वजति भामिनी । लज्जमाना पुरेवैनं माध्वीकमदमूर्छिता ॥
तस्य क्षतजसंदिग्धं जातरूपपरिष्कृतम् । विमुच्य कवचं कृष्ण शरीरमभिवीक्षते ॥
data.md: Taking of her husband's golden armour, O hero, that damsel is now looking on the body of her husband covered with blood.

data.v: अवेक्षमाणा तं बाला कृष्ण त्वामभिभाषते । अयं ते पुण्डरीकाक्ष सदृशाक्षो निपातितः ॥
data.md: Beholding her lord, O Krishna, that girl addresses you saying:-'O lotus-eyed one, this hero whose eyes resembled yours, has been killed.

data.v: बले वीर्ये च सदृशस्तेजसा चैव तेऽनघ । रूपेण च तवात्यर्थं शेते भुवि निपातितः ॥
data.md: In power, energy, and prowess, he has your equal, O sinless one! He resembled you very much in beauty. Yet he sleeps on the ground, killed by the enemy.

data.v: अत्यन्तसुकुमारस्य राङ्कवाजिनशायिनः । कच्चिदद्य शरीरं ते भूमौ न परितप्यते ॥
data.md: Addressing her own husband, she says again,-'You were reared up in every luxury. You used to sleep on soft skins of the Ranku deer. Alas, does not your body feet pain to-day by lying thus on this naked Earth.

data.v: मातङ्गभुजवर्ष्माणौ ज्याक्षेपकठिनत्वचौ । काञ्चनाङ्गदिनौ शेषे निक्षिप्य विपुलौ भुजौ ॥
data.md: Stretching your massive arms decorated with golden Angadas, resembling a couple of elephants trunks, and trunks, and coated with skin hardened by constant use of the bow, sleep, you, O lord, peacefully as if worn out with the fatigue of too much exercise. Alas, why do you not speak to me that am weeping so?

data.v: व्यायम्य बहुधा नूनं सुखसुप्तः श्रमादिव । एवं विलपतीमार्तां न हि मामभिभाषसे ॥
data.md: Stretching your massive arms decorated with golden Angadas, resembling a couple of elephants trunks, and trunks, and coated with skin hardened by constant use of the bow, sleep, you, O lord, peacefully as if worn out with the fatigue of too much exercise. Alas, why do you not speak to me that am weeping so?

data.v: आर्यामार्य सुभद्रां त्वमिमांश्च त्रिदशोपमान् । पितॄन्मां चैव दुःखार्तां विहाय क्व गमिष्यसि ॥
data.md: Where will you go, leaving behind you the much-respected Subhadra, these your sires who take after the very celestials, and my own wretched self distracted with grief.

data.v: तस्य शोणितसंदिग्धान्केशानुन्नाम्य पाणिना । उत्सङ्गे वक्त्रमाधाय जीवन्तमिव पृच्छति । स्वस्रीयं वासुदेवस्य पुत्रं गाण्डीवधन्वनः ॥
data.md: See, O Krishna, collecting with her hands the blood-dyed hair of her husband and placing his head on her lap, beautiful lady is addressing him as if he were alive,-How could those great car-warriors kill you in the midst of battle,-you who are the sister's son of Vasudeva and the son of the bolder of Gandiva?

data.v: कथं त्वां रणमध्यस्थं जघ्नुरेते महारथाः । धिगस्तु क्रूरकर्तॄंस्तान्कृपकर्णजयद्रथान् ॥
द्रोणद्रौणायनी चोभौ यैरसि व्यसनीकृतः । रथर्षभाणां सर्वेषां कथमासीत्तदा मनः ॥
बालं त्वां परिवार्यैकं मम दुःखाय जघ्नुषाम् । कथं नु पाण्डवानां च पाञ्चालानां च पश्यताम् । त्वं वीर निधनं प्राप्तो नाथवान्सन्ननाथवत् ॥
data.md: How could you, O hero, who had so many protectors, be killed so helplessly before the very eyes of the Pandavas and the Panchalas?

data.v: दृष्ट्वा बहुभिराक्रन्दे निहतं त्वामनाथवत् । वीरः पुरुषशार्दूलः कथं जीवति पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: Seeing you, O hero, killed in battle by many warriors in a body, how is that foremost of men, that son of Pandu, viz., your father, able to bear the burden of life?

data.v: न राज्यलाभो विपुलः शत्रूणां वा पराभवः । प्रीतिं दास्यति पार्थानां त्वामृते पुष्करेक्षण ॥
data.md: Neither the acquisition of a vast territory, nor the discomfitures of their foes, gives joy to the Parthas bereft of you, O lotus-eyed one.

data.v: तव शस्त्रजिताँल्लोकान्धर्मेण च दमेन च । क्षिप्रमन्वागमिष्यामि तत्र मां प्रतिपालय ॥
data.md: By the practice of virtue and self-restraint, I shall very soon go to those blissful regions which you have acquired by the use of weapons. Protect me, O hero, when I go there.

data.v: दुर्मरं पुनरप्राप्ते काले भवति केनचित् । यदहं त्वां रणे दृष्ट्वा हतं जीवामि दुर्भगा ॥
data.md: Until the appointed time comes, one cannot die, since, wretched that I am, I am still alive after seeing you killed in battle.

data.v: कामिदानीं नरव्याघ्र श्लक्ष्णया स्मितया गिरा । पितृलोके समेत्यान्यां मामिवामन्त्रयिष्यसि ॥
data.md: Having gone to the region of the departed manes, whom else, like me, do you address now, O foremost of men, in sweet and smiling words.

data.v: नूनमप्सरसां स्वर्गे मनांसि प्रमथिष्यसि । परमेण च रूपेण गिरा च स्मितपूर्वया ॥
data.md: Forsooth, you will agitated the hearts of the Apsaras in heaven, with your great beauty and soft and smiling words.

data.v: प्राप्य पुण्यकृताँल्लोकानप्सरोभिः समेयिवान् । सौभद्र विहरन्काले स्मरेथाः सुकृतानि मे ॥
data.md: Having attained the regions reserved for pious persons, you are now united, O son of Subhadra, with the Apsaras. While playing with them, recollect now and then my good acts towards you.

data.v: एतावानिह संवासो विहितस्ते मया सह । षण्मासान्सप्तमे मासि त्वं वीर निधनं गतः ॥
data.md: Your union with me in this world had, it seems, been ordained for only six months, for on the seventh, O hero, you lost your life.

data.v: इत्युक्तवचनामेतामपकर्षन्ति दुःखिताम् । उत्तरां मोघसंकल्पां मत्स्यराजकुलस्त्रियः ॥
data.md: O Krishna, the ladies of the royal house of Matsya are dragging away the sorrowful Uttara, disappointed, and even lamenting in this way.

data.v: उत्तरामपकृष्यैनामार्तामार्ततराः स्वयम् । विराटं निहतं दृष्ट्वा क्रोशन्ति विलपन्ति च ॥
data.md: Dragging away the sorrow-stricken Uttara, those ladies, themselves still more aggrieved then that girl, are weeping and bewailing aloud at sight of the slain Virata.

data.v: द्रोणास्त्रशरसंकृत्तं शयानं रुधिरोक्षितम् । विराटं वितुदन्त्येते गृध्रगोमायुवायसाः ॥
data.md: Wounded with the weapons and arrows of Drona, lying down oi. earth, and bathed in blood, Virata is encompassed by the screaming vultures and yelling jackals and crows ravens.

data.v: वितुद्यमानं विहगैर्विराटमसितेक्षणाः । न शक्नुवन्ति विवशा निवर्तयितुमातुराः ॥
data.md: Those black-eyed ladies, approaching the dead body of Matsya king over which carnivorous birds are uttering cries of joy, are trying to turn the body. Weakened by grief, they are unable to do what they wish.

data.v: आसामातपतप्तानामायासेन च योषिताम् । श्रमेण च विवर्णानां रूपाणां विगतं वपुः ॥
data.md: Scorched by the Sun, and exhausted with fatigue and toil, their faces have become colourless and pale.

data.v: उत्तरं चाभिमन्युं च काम्बोजं च सुदक्षिणम् । शिशूनेतान्हतान्पश्य लक्ष्मणं च सुदर्शनम् । आयोधनशिरोमध्ये शयानं पश्य माधव ॥
data.md: See also, O Madhava, those other children besides Abhimanyu, viz., Uttara, Sudakshina the prince of the Kamvojas, and the beautiful Lakshmana, all lying on the field of battle.'

data.v: एष वैकर्तनः शेते महेष्वासो महारथः । ज्वलितानलवत्संख्ये संशान्तः पार्थतेजसा ॥
data.md: Gandhari said There the powerful Karna, that great bowman, lies prostrate on the earth. In battle he was like a burning fire. That fire, however, has now been put out by the power of Partha.

data.v: पश्य वैकर्तनं कर्णं निहत्यातिरथान्बहून् । शोणितौघपरीताङ्गं शयानं पतितं भुवि ॥
data.md: See, Vikartana's son Karna, after having killed many Atirathas, has been prostrated on the naked Earth and is covered with blood.

data.v: अमर्षी दीर्घरोषश्च महेष्वासो महारथः । रणे विनिहतः शेते शूरो गाण्डीवधन्वना ॥
data.md: Wrathful and energetic, he was a great bowman and a powerful car-warrior. Killed in battle by holder of Gandiva, that hero now sleeps on the ground.

data.v: यं स्म पाण्डवसंत्रासान्मम पुत्रा महारथाः । प्रायुध्यन्त पुरस्कृत्य मातङ्गा इव यूथपम् ॥
data.md: My sons, those powerful car-warriors, from fear of the Pandavas, fought, fled by Karna, like a heart of elephants with its leader standing first.

data.v: शार्दूलमिव सिंहेन समरे सव्यसाचिना । मातङ्गमिव मत्तेन मातङ्गेन निपातितम् ॥
data.md: Alas, like a tiger killed by a lion, or an elephant by an infuriate elephant, that warrior has been killed in battle by Savyasachin.

data.v: समेताः पुरुषव्याघ्र निहतं शूरमाहवे । प्रकीर्णमूर्धजाः पत्न्यो रुदत्यः पर्युपासते ॥
data.md: collected together, O foremost of men, the wives of that warrior, with disheveled hairs and loud cried of grief, and sitting around that fallen hero.

data.v: उद्विग्नः सततं यस्माद्धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः । त्रयोदश समा निद्रां चिन्तयन्नाध्यगच्छत ॥
data.md: Anxious about that warrior, king Yudhishthira the just could not sleep for thirteen years.

data.v: अनाधृष्यः परैर्युद्धे शत्रुभिर्मघवानिव । युगान्ताग्निरिवार्चिष्मान्हिमवानिव च स्थिरः ॥
data.md: Incapable of being restrained by foes in battle like Indra himself who is invincible by enemies, Karna was like the all-destroying fire of dreadful flames at the end of a cycle, and immovable like Himavat himself.

data.v: स भूत्वा शरणं वीरो धार्तराष्ट्रस्य माधव । भूमौ विनिहतः शेते वातरुग्ण इव द्रुमः ॥
data.md: That hero became the protector of Dhritarashtra's son, O Madhava! Alas killed, he now lies on the bare ground, like a tree struck down by the wind.

data.v: पश्य कर्णस्य पत्नीं त्वं वृषसेनस्य मातरम् । लालप्यमानाः करुणं रुदतीं पतितां भुवि ॥
data.md: Behold, the wife of Karna and mother of Vrishasena, is bewailing piteously and crying and weeping and falling upon the ground.

data.v: आचार्यशापोऽनुगतो ध्रुवं त्वां; यदग्रसच्चक्रमियं धरा ते । ततः शरेणापहृतं शिरस्ते; धनंजयेनाहवे शत्रुमध्ये ॥
data.md: Even now she exclaims-Forsooth your preceptors' curse has followed you. When the wheel of your car was sunk in the Earth, the cruel Dhananjaya cut off your head with a shaft.

data.v: अहो धिगेषा पतिता विसंज्ञा; समीक्ष्य जाम्बूनदबद्धनिष्कम् । कर्णं महाबाहुमदीनसत्त्वं; सुषेणमाता रुदती भृशार्ता ॥
data.md: That lady, the mother of Sushena, greatly stricken with woe and uttering cries of woe, is falling down, unconscious at the sight of the mighty-armed and brave Karna prostrated on the Earth, with his waist still encircled with a golden belt.

data.v: अल्पावशेषो हि कृतो महात्मा; शरीरभक्षैः परिभक्षयद्भिः । द्रष्टुं न संप्रीतिकरः शशीव; कृष्णश्य पक्षस्य चतुर्दशाहे ॥
data.md: Feasting on the body of that illustrious hero, carnivorous animals, have reduced it greatly. This spectacle is indeed pitiable, like that of the moon on the fourteenth night of the darkfortnight.

data.v: सावर्तमाना पतिता पृथिव्या;मुत्थाय दीना पुनरेव चैषा । कर्णस्य वक्त्रं परिजिघ्रमाणा; रोरूयते पुत्रवधाभितप्ता ॥
data.md: Falling down on the ground the cheerless lady is rising up again. Filled with grief for the death of her son also, she comes and smelleth the face of her husband.

data.v: आवन्त्यं भीमसेनेन भक्षयन्ति निपातितम् । गृध्रगोमायवः शूरं बहुबन्धुमबन्धुवत् ॥
data.md: Gandhari said "See, killed by Bhimasena, the king of Avanti lies there. Vultures and jackals and crows are feasting upon that hero. Through possessed of many friends, he lies now perfectly helpless.

data.v: तं पश्य कदनं कृत्वा शत्रूणां मधुसूदन । शयानं वीरशयने रुधिरेण समुक्षितम् ॥
data.md: See, O slayer of Madhu, having made a great onslaught of enemies, that warrior is now lying on the bed of a hero, bathed in blood.

data.v: तं सृगालाश्च कङ्काश्च क्रव्यादाश्च पृथग्विधाः । तेन तेन विकर्षन्ति पश्य कालस्य पर्ययम् ॥
data.md: Jackals, and Kankas, and other carnivorous animals of various kinds, are dragging him now. Mark the reverses caused by Time.

data.v: शयानं वीरशयने वीरमाक्रन्दसारिणम् । आवन्त्यमभितो नार्यो रुदत्यः पर्युपासते ॥
data.md: His wives, all are crying in grief, and sitting around that hero who while alive was a terrible slayer of enemies but who now lies on the bed of a hero.

data.v: प्रातिपीयं महेष्वासं हतं भल्लेन बाह्लिकम् । प्रसुप्तमिव शार्दूलं पश्य कृष्ण मनस्विनम् ॥
data.md: See, Pratipa's son Valhika, that powerful and highly energetic bowman, slain with a broad-headed shaft, is now lying on the ground like a sleeping tiger.

data.v: अतीव मुखवर्णोऽस्य निहतस्यापि शोभते । सोमस्येवाभिपूर्णस्य पौर्णमास्यां समुद्यतः ॥
data.md: Though dead, the color of his face is still highly bright, like that of the full moon, risen on the fifteenth day of the light fortnight.

data.v: पुत्रशोकाभितप्तेन प्रतिज्ञां परिरक्षता । पाकशासनिना संख्ये वार्द्धक्षत्रिर्निपातितः ॥
data.md: Burning with grief on account of the death of his son, and desirous of fulfilling his vow, Indra's son Arjuna has killed there that son of Vriddhakshatra.

data.v: एकादश चमूर्जित्वा रक्ष्यमाणं महात्मना । सत्यं चिकीर्षता पश्य हतमेनं जयद्रथम् ॥
data.md: Behold that Jayadratha, who was protected by the illustrious Drona, killed by Partha bent on making good his promise, after penetrating through eleven Akshauhinis of soldiers.

data.v: सिन्धुसौवीरभर्तारं दर्पपूर्णं मनस्विनम् । भक्षयन्ति शिवा गृध्रा जनार्दन जयद्रथम् ॥
data.md: Inauspicious vultures, O Janarddana, are feasting upon Jayadratha, the proud and energetic lord of the Sindhu-Sauviras.

data.v: संरक्ष्यमाणं भार्याभिरनुरक्ताभिरच्युत । भषन्तो व्यपकर्षन्ति गहनं निम्नमन्तिकात् ॥
data.md: See, O Achyuta, carnivorous creatures are dragging his body away to a neighbouring jungle, though his devoted wives are trying to protect it.

data.v: तमेताः पर्युपासन्ते रक्षमाणा महाभुजम् । सिन्धुसौवीरगान्धारकाम्बोजयवनस्त्रियः ॥
data.md: The Kamvoja and Yavana wives of that powerful king of the Sindhus and the Sauviras are waiting upon him for protecting his body.

data.v: यदा कृष्णामुपादाय प्राद्रवत्केकयैः सह । तदैव वध्यः पाण्डूनां जनार्दन जयद्रथः ॥
data.md: At that time, O Janarddana, when Jayadratha, assisted by the Kekayas, tried to ravish Draupadi, he should have been killed by the Pandavas.

data.v: दुःशलां मानयद्भिस्तु यदा मुक्तो जयद्रथः । कथमद्य न तां कृष्ण मानयन्ति स्म ते पुनः ॥
data.md: Out of respect, for Dusshala, they liberated him on that occasion. Why, O Krishna, did they not show some respect for that Dusshala once more.

data.v: सैषा मम सुता बाला विलपन्ती सुदुःखिता । प्रमापयति चात्मानमाक्रोशति च पाण्डवान् ॥
data.md: That young daughter of mine, is now crying sorrowfully. She is striking her body with her own hands and blaming the Pandavas.

data.v: किं नु दुःखतरं कृष्ण परं मम भविष्यति । यत्सुता विधवा बाला स्नुषाश्च निहतेश्वराः ॥
data.md: What, O Krishna, can be a greater grief to me than that my young daughter should be a widow and all my daughters-in-law should equally be so.

data.v: अहो धिग्दुःशलां पश्य वीतशोकभयामिव । शिरो भर्तुरनासाद्य धावमानामितस्ततः ॥
data.md: Alas, alas, see, my daughter Dusshala having cast off her grief and fears, is running about in search of the head of her husband.

data.v: वारयामास यः सर्वान्पाण्डवान्पुत्रगृद्धिनः । स हत्वा विपुलाः सेनाः स्वयं मृत्युवशं गतः ॥
data.md: After killing a vast army, he who had restrained all the Pandavas desirous of rescuing their son, at last himself yielded to death.

data.v: तं मत्तमिव मातङ्गं वीरं परमदुर्जयम् । परिवार्य रुदन्त्येताः स्त्रियश्चन्द्रोपमाननाः ॥
data.md: Alas, those wives of his, with faces as beautiful as the moon, are crying, sitting around that irresistible hero who took after an infuriate elephant.

data.v: एष शल्यो हतः शेते साक्षान्नकुलमातुलः । धर्मज्ञेन सता तात धर्मराजेन संयुगे ॥
data.md: Gandhari said There lies Shalya, the maternal uncle himself of Nakula, killed in battle, by the pious and virtuous Yudhishthira.

data.v: यस्त्वया स्पर्धते नित्यं सर्वत्र पुरुषर्षभ । स एष निहतः शेते मद्रराजो महारथः ॥
data.md: He used everywhere, O foremost of men, to boast of his equality with you. That powerful car-warrior, viz., the king of the Madras, now lies dead.

data.v: येन संगृह्णता तात रथमाधिरथेर्युधि । जयार्थं पाण्डुपुत्राणां तथा तेजोवधः कृतः ॥
data.md: When he accepted the drivership of Karna's car in battle, he tried to depress Karna for securing victory for the sons of Pandu.

data.v: अहो धिक्पश्य शल्यस्य पूर्णचन्द्रसुदर्शनम् । मुखं पद्मपलाशाक्षं वडैरादष्टमव्रणम् ॥
data.md: Alas, alas, look at the smooth face of Shalya, beautiful as the moon, and having eyes resembling lotus petals, eaten away by crows.

data.v: एषा चामीकराभस्य तप्तकाञ्चनसप्रभा । आस्याद्विनिःसृता जिह्वा भक्ष्यते कृष्ण पक्षिभिः ॥
data.md: There, the tongue of that king, beautiful like molten gold, looting out of his mouth, is, O। Krishna, being devoured by carnivorous birds.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरेण निहतं शल्यं समितिशोभनम् । रुदन्त्यः पर्युपासन्ते मद्रराजकुलस्त्रियः ॥
data.md: the ladies of the royal house of Madra, crying aloud, are sitting around the body of that king, that ornament of assemblies, killed by Yudhishthira.

data.v: एताः सुसूक्ष्मवसना मद्रराजं नरर्षभम् । क्रोशन्त्यभिसमासाद्य क्षत्रियाः क्षत्रियर्षभम् ॥
data.md: Those ladies are sitting around that fallen hero like a herd of she-elephants in their season around their leader sunk in mud.

data.v: शल्यं निपतितं नार्यः परिवार्याभितः स्थिताः । वाशिता गृष्टयः पङ्के परिमग्नमिवर्षभम् ॥
शल्यं शरणदं शूरं पश्यैनं रथसत्तमम् । शयानं वीरशयने शरैर्विशकलीकृतम् ॥
data.md: Look at the brave Shalya, the great protector and the foremost of car-warriors, stretched on the bed of heroes, his body wounded with arrows.

data.v: एष शैलालयो राजा भगदत्तः प्रतापवान् । गजाङ्कुशधरः श्रेष्ठः शेते भुवि निपातितः ॥
data.md: There the highly powerful king Bhagadatta, the king of a mountainous kingdom, the foremost of all holders of good, lies dead on the Earth.

data.v: यस्य रुक्ममयी माला शिरस्येषा विराजते । श्वापदैर्भक्ष्यमाणस्य शोभयन्तीव मूर्धजान् ॥
data.md: Look at the golden and shining garland that he still wears on his head. Though the body is being devoroured by beasts of prey, that garland still adorns the beautiful hairs on his head.

data.v: एतेन किल पार्थस्य युद्धमासीत्सुदारुणम् । लोमहर्षणमत्युग्रं शक्रस्य बलिना यथा ॥
data.md: Dreadful was the battle that took place between this king and Partha, making the hairs stand erect, like that between Shakra and the Asura Vritra.

data.v: योधयित्वा महाबाहुरेष पार्थं धनंजयम् । संशयं गमयित्वा च कुन्तीपुत्रेण पातितः ॥
data.md: Having fought Dhananjaya ine son of Pritha, and brought him to a perilous condition,। this mighty-armed one, was at last killed by his antagonist.

data.v: यस्य नास्ति समो लोके शौर्ये वीर्ये च कश्चन । स एष निहतः शेते भीष्मो भीष्मकृदाहवे ॥
data.md: He who had no equal on Earth in heroism and energy, that achiever of dreadful feasts in battle, viz., Bhishma, lies there dead.

data.v: पश्य शांतनवं कृष्ण शयानं सूर्यवर्चसम् । युगान्त इव कालेन पातितं सूर्यमम्बरात् ॥
data.md: Behold the son of Shantanu, O Krishna, that hero effulgent like the sun, stretched on the Earth, like the Sun himself dropped off the sky at the end of the Yuga.

data.v: एष तप्त्वा रणे शत्रूञ्शस्त्रतापेन वीर्यवान् । नरसूर्योऽस्तमभ्येति सूर्योऽस्तमिव केशव ॥
data.md: Having scorched his enemies with the fire of his weapons in battle, that brave warrior, that Sun among men, O Keshava, has set like the real Sun at evening.

data.v: शरतल्पगतं वीरं धर्मे देवापिना समम् । शयानं वीरशयने पश्य शूरनिषेविते ॥
data.md: Look at that hero, O Krishna, who in knowledge of duty was equal to Devapi himself, now lying on a bed of arrows, worthy of heroes.

data.v: कर्णिनालीकनाराचैरास्तीर्य शयनोत्तमम् । आविश्य शेते भगवान्स्कन्दः शरवणं यथा ॥
data.md: Having spread his bed of barbed and unbarbed arrows, that hero lieth on it like Skanda on a clump of reeds.

data.v: अतूलपूर्णं गाङ्गेयस्त्रिभिर्बाणैः समन्वितम् । उपधायोपधानाग्र्यं दत्तं गाण्डीवधन्वना ॥
data.md: Indeed, the son of Ganga lies there, resting his head on that excellent pillow, consisting of three arrows,-given him by Arjuna.

data.v: पालयानः पितुः शास्त्रमूर्ध्वरेता महायशाः । एष शांतनवः शेते माधवाप्रतिमो युधि ॥
data.md: For obeying the mandate of his father, this illustrious one drew up his vital seed. Peerless in battle, that son of Shantanu lies there, O Madhava.

data.v: धर्मात्मा तात धर्मज्ञः पारंपर्येण निर्णये । अमर्त्य इव मर्त्यः सन्नेष प्राणानधारयत् ॥
data.md: Pious and acquainted with all forms of duty, by the help of his knowledge of both the worlds, that hero, though mortal, is still alive like an immortal.

data.v: नास्ति युद्धे कृती कश्चिन्न विद्वान्न पराक्रमी । यत्र शांतनवो भीष्मः शेतेऽद्य निहतः परैः ॥
data.md: When Shantanu's son lies to-day, struck down with arrows, it seems that no other person alive on Earth who is learned and powerful and who is competent to perform great feats in battle.

data.v: स्वयमेतेन शूरेण पृच्छ्यमानेन पाण्डवैः । धर्मज्ञेनाहवे मृत्युराख्यातः सत्यवादिना ॥
data.md: Solicited by the Pandavas, this truthful, righteous, and virtuous hero, communicate to them the means of his own death.

data.v: प्रनष्टः कुरुवंशश्च पुनर्येन समुद्धृतः । स गतः कुरुभिः सार्धं महाबुद्धिः पराभवम् ॥
data.md: Alas, he who had revived the extinct line of Kuru, that illustrious and highly intelligent person, has left the world with all the Kurus in his company.

data.v: धर्मेषु कुरवः कं नु परिप्रक्ष्यन्ति माधव । गते देवव्रते स्वर्गं देवकल्पे नरर्षभे ॥
data.md: From whom, O Madhava, will the Kurus, receive instructions of religion and duty after that foremost of men, viz., Devavrata, who resembles a god, shall have gone to heaven?

data.v: अर्जुनस्य विनेतारमाचार्यं सात्यकेस्तथा । तं पश्य पतितं द्रोणं कुरूणां गुरुसत्तमम् ॥
data.md: See Drona, that best of Brahmanas, that preceptor of Arjuna, of Satyaki, and of the Kurus, is lying on the ground.

data.v: अस्त्रं चतुर्विधं वेद यथैव त्रिदशेश्वरः । भार्गवो वा महावीर्यस्तथा द्रोणोऽपि माधव ॥
data.md: The highly energetic Drona, O Madhava, was as a master of the four kinds of arms like Shukra of Vrigu's race.

data.v: यस्य प्रसादाद्बीभत्सुः पाण्डवः कर्म दुष्करम् । चकार स हतः शेते नैनमस्त्राण्यपालयन् ॥
data.md: Through his favour, Vibhatsu the son of Pandu has achieved the most of difficult feats. He now lies dead on the ground. Weapons refused to come at last at his command.

data.v: यं पुरोधाय कुरव आह्वयन्ति स्म पाण्डवान् । सोऽयं शस्त्रभृतां श्रेष्ठो द्रोणः शस्त्रैः पृथक्कृतः ॥
data.md: Placing him at their head, the Kauravas had challenged the Pandavas. That foremost of all warriors was in the end wounded with weapons.

data.v: यस्य निर्दहतः सेनां गतिरग्नेरिवाभवत् । स भूमौ निहतः शेते शान्तार्चिरिव पावकः ॥
data.md: As he moved about in battle, scorching his enemies in every direction, his movement resembled that of a blazing fire. Alas, he now lies dead on the ground, like an extinguished fire.

data.v: धनुर्मुष्टिरशीर्णश्च हस्तावापश्च माधव । द्रोणस्य निहतस्यापि दृश्यते जीवतो यथा ॥
data.md: The handle of the bow is yet in his grasp, The leathern fences, O Madhava, pre still on his fingers. Though killed, he still looks as if alive.

data.v: वेदा यस्माच्च चत्वारः सर्वास्त्राणि च केशव । अनपेतानि वै शूराद्यथैवादौ प्रजापतेः ॥
data.md: The four Vedas, and all kinds, of weapons, O Keshava, did not leave that hero even as they do not the Lord Prajapati.

data.v: वन्दनार्हाविमौ तस्य बन्दिभिर्वन्दितौ शुभौ । गोमायवो विकर्षन्ति पादौ शिष्यशतार्चितौ ॥
data.md: His auspicious feet, worthy of adoration and adored before by bards and eulogists, and worshipped by disciples, are now being dragged by jackals.

data.v: द्रोणं द्रुपदपुत्रेण निहतं मधुसूदन । कृपी कृपणमन्वास्ते दुःखोपहतचेतना ॥
data.md: Senseless with sorrow, Kripi sorrowfully attends, O destroyer of Madhu, on that Drona who has been killed by Draupada's son.

data.v: तां पश्य रुदतीमार्तां मुक्तकेशीमधोमुखीम् । हतं पतिमुपासन्तीं द्रोणं शस्त्रभृतां वरम् ॥
data.md: Look at that sorrow-stricken lady, fallen upon the Earth, with disheveled hair and face Juser hanging down. Alas, she serves sorrowfully her lifeless husband, that best of all holders of weapons, lying on the ground.

data.v: बाणैर्भिन्नतनुत्राणं धृष्टद्युम्नेन केशव । उपास्ते वै मृधे द्रोणं जटिला ब्रह्मचारिणी ॥
data.md: Many Brahmana saints, with matted locks on their head, are serving the body of Drona that is cased in armour cut asunder, O Keshava, with the arrows of Dhrishtadyumna.

data.v: प्रेतकृत्ये च यतते कृपी कृपणमातुरा । हतस्य समरे भर्तुः सुकुमारी यशस्विनी ॥
data.md: The illustrious and delicate Kripi, depressed and Sorrow-stricken, is trying to perform the last rites on the body of her husband killed in battle.

data.v: अग्नीनाहृत्य विधिवच्चितां प्रज्वाल्य सर्वशः । द्रोणमाधाय गायन्ति त्रीणि सामानि सामगाः ॥
data.md: There, having placed the body of Drona on the funeral pyre and having put fire with due rites, those reciters of Samans are singing the three verses.

data.v: किरन्ति च चितामेते जटिला ब्रह्मचारिणः । धनुर्भिः शक्तिभिश्चैव रथनीडैश्च माधव ॥
data.md: Those Brahmana saints, with matted locks on their head, have made the funeral pyre of that Brahmana with bows and arrows and carboxes, O Madhava.

data.v: शस्त्रैश्च विविधैरन्यैर्धक्ष्यन्ते भूरितेजसम् । त एते द्रोणमाधाय शंसन्ति च रुदन्ति च ॥
data.md: Having collected various other sorts of arrows, that highly energetic hero is being consumed by them. Having placed his body on the pyre, they are singing and weeping.

data.v: सोमदत्तसुतं पश्य युयुधानेन पातितम् । वितुद्यमानं विहगैर्बहुभिर्माधवान्तिके ॥
data.md: Gandhari said See the son of Somadatta, who was killed by Yuyudhana, is being cut by a large number of birds.

data.v: पुत्रशोकाभिसंतप्तः सोमदत्तो जनार्दन । युयुधानं महेष्वासं गर्हयन्निव दृश्यते ॥
data.md: Burning with sorrow at the death of his son, Somadatta, O Janarddana, seems to blame the great bowman Yuyudhana.

data.v: असौ तु भूरिश्रवसो माता शोकपरिप्लुता । आश्वासयति भर्तारं सोमदत्तमनिन्दिता ॥
data.md: There the mother of Bhurishravas that faultless lady, beside herself with grief, is addressing her lord Somadatta, saying,-By good luck, O king, you do not witness this terrible destruction of the Bharatas, this extermination of the Kurus, this sight resembling the spectacles occurring at the end of a cycle.

data.v: दिष्ट्या नेदं महाराज दारुणं भरतक्षयम् । कुरुसंक्रन्दनं घोरं युगान्तमनुपश्यसि ॥
data.md: There the mother of Bhurishravas that faultless lady, beside herself with grief, is addressing her lord Somadatta, saying,-By good luck, O king, you do not witness this terrible destruction of the Bharatas, this extermination of the Kurus, this sight resembling the spectacles occurring at the end of a cycle.

data.v: दिष्ट्या यूपध्वजं वीरं पुत्रं भूरिसहस्रदम् । अनेकक्रतुयज्वानं निहतं नाद्य पश्यसि ॥
data.md: By good luck, you do not see your heroic, son, who bore the device of the sacrificial stake on his banner and who celebrated numberless sacrifices with profuse presents to all, killed on the field of battle.

data.v: दिष्ट्या स्नुषाणामाक्रन्दे घोरं विलपितं बहु । न शृणोषि महाराज सारसीनामिवार्णवे ॥
data.md: By good luck, you do not hear those dreadful wails of woe uttered amidst this destruction by your daughter-in-law like the screams of a fight of cranes of the sea.

data.v: एकवस्त्रानुसंवीताः प्रकीर्णासितमूर्धजाः । स्नुषास्ते परिधावन्ति हतापत्या हतेश्वराः ॥
data.md: Your daughters-in-law, deprived of both husbands and sons, are running about, each clad in a single piece of cloth and each with her clad in a single piece of cloth and each with her black hairs all disheveled.

data.v: श्वापदैर्भक्ष्यमाणं त्वमहो दिष्ट्या न पश्यसि । छिन्नबाहुं नरव्याघ्रमर्जुनेन निपातितम् ॥
data.md: By good luck, you do not see to-day your son, that foremost of men, deprived of one of his arms, killed by Arjuna, and now being devoured by beasts of prey.

data.v: शलं विनिहतं संख्ये भूरिश्रवसमेव च । स्नुषाश्च विधवाः सर्वा दिष्ट्या नाद्येह पश्यसि ॥
data.md: By good luck, you do not see to-day your son Shala killed in battle, and Bhurishravas deprived of life, and your widowed daughterin-law plunged into grief.

data.v: दिष्ट्या तत्काञ्चनं छत्रं यूपकेतोर्महात्मनः । विनिकीर्णं रथोपस्थे सौमदत्तेर्न पश्यसि ॥
data.md: By good luck, you do not see the golden umbrella of that illustrious hero who had the sacrificial stake as his emblem on his banner, torn and broken on the terrace of his car.

data.v: अमूस्तु भूरिश्रवसो भार्याः सात्यकिना हतम् । परिवार्यानुशोचन्ति भर्तारमसितेक्षणाः ॥
data.md: There the black-eyed wives of Bhurishravas are bewailing piteously surrounding their lord killed by Satyaki.

data.v: एता विलप्य बहुलं भर्तृशोकेन कर्शिताः । पतन्त्यभिमुखा भूमौ कृपणं बत केशव ॥
data.md: Stricken with sorrow on account of the slaughter of their husband, those ladies bewailing piteously, are falling down on the Earth with their faces toward the ground, and slowly approaching you, O Keshava!

data.v: बीभत्सुरतिबीभत्सं कर्मेदमकरोत्कथम् । प्रमत्तस्य यदच्छैत्सीद्बाहुं शूरस्य यज्वनः ॥
data.md: Alas, why did Arjuna of pure deeds commit such a heinous crime, since he cut off the arm of a heedless warrior who was brave and used to perform sacrifices.

data.v: ततः पापतरं कर्म कृतवानपि सात्यकिः । यस्मात्प्रायोपविष्टस्य प्राहार्षीत्संशितात्मनः ॥
data.md: Alas, Satyaki perpetrated a still more sinful act, for he killed a person of restrained soul while sitting in the observance of the praya VOW.

भार्या यूपध्वजस्यैषा करसंमितमध्यमा । कृत्वोत्सङ्गे भुजं भर्तुः कृपणं पर्यदेवयत् ॥
अयं स रशनोत्कर्षी पीनस्तनविमर्दनः । नाभ्यूरुजघनस्पर्शी नीवीविस्रंसनः करः ॥
वासुदेवस्य सांनिध्ये पार्थेनाक्लिष्टकर्मणा । युध्यतः समरेऽन्येन प्रमत्तस्य निपातितः ॥
data.md: In the presence of Vasudeva himself, Arjuna of pure deeds cut it off while you were heedless and engaged with another in battle.

data.v: गान्धारराजः शकुनिर्बलवान्सत्यविक्रमः । निहतः सहदेवेन भागिनेयेन मातुलः ॥
data.md: There the powerful Shakuni, the king of the Gandharas, having irresistible prowess, has been killed by Sahadeva, the maternal uncle by the sister's son.

data.v: यः पुरा हेमदण्डाभ्यां व्यजनाभ्यां स्म वीज्यते । स एष पक्षिभिः पक्षैः शयान उपवीज्यते ॥
data.md: Formerly, he used to be fanned with a two gold-handed fans. Alas, now, his boy lunging on the ground is being fanned by birds with their wings.

data.v: यः स्म रूपाणि कुरुते शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः । तस्य मायाविनो माया दग्धाः पाण्डवतेजसा ॥
data.md: He used to assume hundreds and thousands of forms. All the illusions, however, of that man possessed of great illusory powers, have been burnt by the energy of the son of Pandu.

data.v: मायया निकृतिप्रज्ञो जितवान्यो युधिष्ठिरम् । सभायां विपुलं राज्यं स पुनर्जीवितं जितः ॥
data.md: Highly wily, he had defeated Yudhishthira in the assembly by his power of deception and won from him his vast kingdom. The son of Pandu, however, has now conquered Shakuni's life-breaths.

data.v: शकुन्ताः शकुनिं कृष्ण समन्तात्पर्युपासते । कितवं मम पुत्राणां विनाशायोपशिक्षितम् ॥
data.md: Look, O Krishna, a number of birds is not sitting around Shakuni. An expert in dice, alas, he had also mastered the means for the destruction of my sons.

data.md: Like those gained by my sons, O powerful one, by the use of arms, this man too, however wicked-souled, has obtained many blissful regions by the use of weapons.

data.md: Stricken with great sorrow, his wife is weeping bitterly at sight of his arms covered with blood, which, however, formerly used to be smeared with sandal-paste.

data.md: Indeed, the beautiful lady exclaims,-Even now adorned with beautiful palms and fingers, these two arins of yours resemble a couple of spiked maces, entering into whose clasp joy never felt me for a moment.

data.md: How shall I fare, O king, when I am deprived of you.-Possessing a sweet voice, the Kamvoja queen is weeping helplessly and trembling with emotion.

data.md: Look at that bevy of fair ladies there. Although tired with toil and worn out with heat, yet beauty does not leave them like the beauty of the garlands worn by the celestials although exposed to the Sun.

data.md: Behold, O destroyer of Madhu, the heroic king of the Kalingas lying there on the ground, with his mighty arms bedecked with a couple of Angadas.

data.v: मागधानामधिपतिं जयत्सेनं जनार्दन । परिवार्य प्ररुदिता मागध्यः पश्य योषितः ॥
data.md: Behold, O Janarddana, those Magadha ladies crying and standing around Jayastsena the king of the Magadhas.

data.md: The charming and sweet cries of those large-eyed and sweet-voiced damsels, O Krishna, are stupefying my heart greatly.

data.md: Having all their ornaments displaced, crying, and stricken with sorrow, alas, those ladies of Magadha, worthy of sleeping on costly beds, are now lying down on the naked earth.

data.v: कोसलानामधिपतिं राजपुत्रं बृहद्बलम् । भर्तारं परिवार्यैताः पृथक्प्ररुदिताः स्त्रियः ॥
data.md: Surrounding their lord, the king of the Kosalas, viz., prince Vrihadvala, those other ladies are crying aloud.

data.v: अस्य गात्रगतान्बाणान्कार्ष्णिबाहुबलार्पितान् । उद्धरन्त्यसुखाविष्टा मूर्छमानाः पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: Engaged in taking out from his person the with which it was pierced by Abhimanyu with the full force of his arms, those ladies are again and again losing their consciousness.

data.md: The faces of those beautiful damsels, O Madhava, exhausted with toil and scorched by thc rays of the Sun, are appearing like faded lotuses.

data.md: arrows There, the brave sons of Dhrishtadyurnna, young in age, and bedecked with garlands of gold and beautiful Angadas, are lying, killed by Drona.

data.v: तप्तकाञ्चनवर्माणस्ताम्रध्वजरथस्रजः । भासयन्ति महीं भासा ज्वलिता इव पावकाः ॥
data.md: Their coats of mail, stinging like molten gold, and their tall standards and cars and garlands all made of gold, are shedding a bright lustre on the Earth like so many burning fires.

data.v: द्रोणेन द्रुपदं संख्ये पश्य माधव पातितम् । महाद्विपमिवारण्ये सिंहेन महता हतम् ॥
data.md: Look, O Madhava, at king Drupada overthrown in battle by Drona, like mighty elephant in the forest killed by a huge lion.

data.v: पाञ्चालराज्ञो विपुलं पुण्डरीकाक्ष पाण्डुरम् । आतपत्रं समाभाति शरदीव दिवाकरः ॥
data.md: The bright and white umbrella, of the king of the Panchalas, shines, O lotus-eyed one, like the moon in the autumnal sky.

data.v: एतास्तु द्रुपदं वृद्धं स्नुषा भार्याश्च दुःखिताः । दग्ध्वा गच्छन्ति पाञ्चाल्यं राजानमपसव्यतः ॥
data.md: Having burnt his body on the funeral pyre, the daughter-in-law and the wives of the old king, stricken with sorrow, are proceeding, keeping the pyre to their right.

data.v: धृष्टकेतुं महेष्वासं चेदिपुंगवमङ्गनाः । द्रोणेन निहतं शूरं हरन्ति हृतचेतसः ॥
data.md: There, those ladies, beside themselves with sorrow, are removing the brave and great bowman, viz., Dhrishtaketu, that foremost of the Chedis, killed by Drona.

data.v: द्रोणास्त्रमभिहत्यैष विमर्दे मधुसूदन । महेष्वासो हतः शेते नद्या हृत इव द्रुमः ॥
data.md: Having counteracted many weapons of Drona, this destroyer of foes, O slayer of Madhu, this great bowman lies there, dead, like a tree uprooted by the wind.

data.v: एष चेदिपतिः शूरो धृष्टकेतुर्महारथः । शेते विनिहतः संख्ये हत्वा शत्रून्सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: After having slain thousands of enemies, that brave king of the Chedis, that mighty carwarrior, viz., Dhrishtaketu lies, himself deprived of life.

data.v: वितुद्यमानं विहगैस्तं भार्याः प्रत्युपस्थिताः । चेदिराजं हृषीकेश हतं सबलबान्धवम् ॥
data.md: There, O Hrishikesha, the wives of the king of the Chedis are sitting around his body still decked with beautiful hairs and ear-rings, though torn by carnivorous birds.

data.v: दाशार्हीपुत्रजं वीरं शयानं सत्यविक्रमम् । आरोप्याङ्के रुदन्त्येताश्चेदिराजवराङ्गनाः ॥
data.md: Placing upon their laps and prostrate form of the heroic Dhrishtaketu of Dasharha race, those foremost of ladies, are crying in sorrow.

data.v: अस्य पुत्रं हृषीकेश सुवक्त्रं चारुकुण्डलम् । द्रोणेन समरे पश्य निकृत्तं बहुधा शरैः ॥
data.md: Behold, O Hrishikesha, the son of that Dhrishtaketu, having fair locks and excellent car-rings, cut in battle by Drona with his arrows.

data.v: पितरं नूनमाजिस्थं युध्यमानं परैः सह । नाजहात्पृष्ठतो वीरमद्यापि मधुसूदन ॥
data.md: He never deserted his father while the latter fought with his enemies. Mark, O destroyer of Madhu, he does not, even in death, leave the side of that heroic father.

data.v: एवं ममापि पुत्रस्य पुत्रः पितरमन्वगात् । दुर्योधनं महाबाहो लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा ॥
data.md: Thus. also, my grandson, that slayer of hostile heroes, viz., the mighty-armed Lakshmana, has followed his father Duryodhana.

data.v: विन्दानुविन्दावावन्त्यौ पतितौ पश्य माधव । हिमान्ते पुष्पितौ शालौ मरुता गलिताविव ॥

data.md: I ravished the dearly-loved wife that sage. Cursed by him I fell down on the Earth in the form of a worm.

data.v: अब्रवीत्तु स मां क्रोधात्तव पूर्वपितामहः । मूत्रश्लेष्माशनः पाप निरयं प्रतिपत्स्यसे ॥
data.md: In anger your ancestor said to me, living on urine and phlegm, O wretch, you will live in hell.

data.v: शापस्यान्तो भवेद्ब्रह्मन्नित्येवं तमथाब्रुवम् । भविता भार्गवे राम इति मामब्रवीद्भृगुः ॥
data.md: I then begged him, saying-When, O Brahmana, will this curse end?-Bhrigu replied, saying-This curse shall end through Rama of my family.

data.v: सोऽहमेतां गतिं प्राप्तो यथा नकुशलं तथा । त्वया साधो समागम्य विमुक्तः पापयोनितः ॥
data.md: It was for this I had led a life like one of uncleaned soul! O righteous one, by you, however, I have been rescued from that sinful life.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा नमस्कृत्य ययौ रामं महासुरः । रामः कर्णं तु सक्रोधमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Having said so, the great Asura, bowing to Rama, went away. Then Rama wrathfully addressed Karna, saying.

data.v: अतिदुःखमिदं मूढ न जातु ब्राह्मणः सहेत् । क्षत्रियस्यैव ते धैर्यं कामया सत्यमुच्यताम् ॥
data.md: O fool, no Brahmana could bear such a pain! Your patience is like that of a Kshatriya! Tell me the truth, without fear.

data.v: तमुवाच ततः कर्णः शापभीतः प्रसादयन् । ब्रह्मक्षत्रान्तरे सूतं जातं मां विद्धि भार्गव ॥
data.md: Thus asked, Karna, fearing to be cursed, and trying to please him, said, O you of Bhrigu's race know me for a Suta, a race originating from the intermixture of Brahmanas with Kshatriyas.

data.v: राधेयः कर्ण इति मां प्रवदन्ति जना भुवि । प्रसादं कुरु मे ब्रह्मन्नस्त्रलुब्धस्य भार्गव ॥
data.md: People call me Karna the son of Radha! O you of Bhrigu's race, be propitiated with my poor self who have thus behaved for mastering the weapons.

data.v: पिता गुरुर्न संदेहो वेदविद्याप्रदः प्रभुः । अतो भार्गव इत्युक्तं मया गोत्रं तवान्तिके ॥
data.md: Forsooth, a reverend preceptor in the Vedas and other branches of learning is one's father! It was for this that I introduced myself to you as a person of your family.

data.v: तमुवाच भृगुश्रेष्ठः सरोषः प्रहसन्निव । भूमौ निपतितं दीनं वेपमानं कृताञ्जलिम् ॥
data.md: Unto the cheerless and trembling Karna, that foremost one of Bhrigu's race, smiling though angry, said to the cheerless and trembling Karna who was lying on Earth with joined hands, since you have from avarice of weapons, behaved here falsely, therefore, O wretch, this Brahma weapon shall not remain in your remembrance.

data.v: यस्मान्मिथ्योपचरितो अस्त्रलोभादिह त्वया । तस्मादेतद्धि ते मूढ ब्रह्मास्त्रं प्रतिभास्यति ॥
data.md: Unto the cheerless and trembling Karna, that foremost one of Bhrigu's race, smiling though angry, said to the cheerless and trembling Karna who was lying on Earth with joined hands, since you have from avarice of weapons, behaved here falsely, therefore, O wretch, this Brahma weapon shall not remain in your remembrance.

data.v: अन्यत्र वधकालात्ते सदृशेन समेयुषः । अब्राह्मणे न हि ब्रह्म ध्रुवं तिष्ठेत्कदाचन ॥
data.md: Since you are not a Brahmana, this Brahma weapon shall not, up to the time of your death, live in you when you will be engaged with a warrior equal to yourself.

data.v: गच्छेदानीं न ते स्थानमनृतस्येह विद्यते । न त्वया सदृशो युद्धे भविता क्षत्रियो भुवि ॥
data.md: Go hence, this is not the place for a person who behaves falsely. On Earth, no Kshatriya will be your equal in battle.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण न्यायेनोपजगाम सः । दुर्योधनमुपागम्य कृतास्त्रोऽस्मीति चाब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by Rama, Karna came away, having duly taken his permission. Arriving then before Duryodhana, he informed him, saying-I have learnt all weapons.

data.v: कर्णस्तु समवाप्यैतदस्त्रं भार्गवनन्दनात् । दुर्योधनेन सहितो मुमुदे भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Narada Said Having thus learnt the use of weapons from Rama of Bhrigu's race, Karna began to live happily in the company of Duryodhana, O foremost of Bharata's race.

data.v: ततः कदाचिद्राजानः समाजग्मुः स्वयंवरे । कलिङ्गविषये राजन्राज्ञश्चित्राङ्गदस्य च ॥
data.md: Once on a time, O monarch, many kings went to a Svayamvara at the capital of Chitrangada, the king of the Kalingas.

data.v: श्रीमद्राजपुरं नाम नगरं तत्र भारत । राजानः शतशस्तत्र कन्यार्थं समुपागमन् ॥
data.md: That prosperous city, O Bharata, was known by the name of Rajapura. Hundreds of kings went there for securing the hand of the maiden.

data.v: श्रुत्वा दुर्योधनस्तत्र समेतान्सर्वपार्थिवान् । रथेन काञ्चनाङ्गेन कर्णेन सहितो ययौ ॥
data.md: Hearing that various kings had come there, : Duryodhana also, on his golden car, proceeded there, accompanied by Karna.

data.v: ततः स्वयंवरे तस्मिन्संप्रवृत्ते महोत्सवे । समापेतुर्नृपतयः कन्यार्थे नृपसत्तम ॥
data.md: When the festivities commenced in that Svayamvara various kings, O best of kings, came there for the hand of the maiden.

data.v: शिशुपालो जरासंधो भीष्मको वक्र एव च । कपोतरोमा नीलश्च रुक्मी च दृढविक्रमः ॥
data.md: There were amongst them Shisupala, Jarasandha, Bhishmaka, Vakra, Kaportroman, Nila, Rukmi of steady prowess, Shrigala who was ruler of the kingdom of females, Ashoka, Satadhanvan and the heroic king of the Bhojas.

data.v: सृगालश्च महाराज स्त्रीराज्याधिपतिश्च यः । अशोकः शतधन्वा च भोजो वीरश्च नामतः ॥
data.md: There were amongst them Shisupala, Jarasandha, Bhishmaka, Vakra, Kaportroman, Nila, Rukmi of steady prowess, Shrigala who was ruler of the kingdom of females, Ashoka, Satadhanvan and the heroic king of the Bhojas.

data.v: एते चान्ये च बहवो दक्षिणां दिशमाश्रिताः । म्लेच्छाचार्याश्च राजानः प्राच्योदीच्याश्च भारत ॥
data.md: Besides these, many others who lived in the Deccan and many preceptors of the Mlechchha tribes, and many kings from the East and the North, O Bharata, came there.

data.v: काञ्चनाङ्गदिनः सर्वे बद्धजाम्बूनदस्रजः । सर्वे भास्वरदेहाश्च व्याघ्रा इव मदोत्कटाः ॥
data.md: All of them were bedecked with golden Angadas and shone resplendent like pure gold. Of shining persons they were like tigers of fierce might.

data.v: ततः समुपविष्टेषु तेषु राजसु भारत । विवेश रङ्गं सा कन्या धात्रीवर्षधरान्विता ॥
data.md: After all those kings had taken their seats, O Bharata, the maiden entered the arena, accompanied by her nurse and a guard of eunuchs.

data.v: ततः संश्राव्यमाणेषु राज्ञां नामसु भारत । अत्यक्रामद्धार्तराष्ट्रं सा कन्या वरवर्णिनी ॥
data.md: The names of the kings being mentioned to her that fair maiden passed by the son of Dhritarashtra as she had passed others before him.

data.v: दुर्योधनस्तु कौरव्यो नामर्षयत लङ्घनम् । प्रत्यषेधच्च तां कन्यामसत्कृत्य नराधिपान् ॥
data.md: Duryodhana, however, of Kuru's race could not bear that insult of self. Disregarding all the kings, he ordered the maiden to stop.

data.v: स वीर्यमदमत्तत्वाद्भीष्मद्रोणावुपाश्रितः । रथमारोप्य तां कन्यामाजुहाव नराधिपान् ॥
data.md: Elated with the pride of power and relying upon Bhishma and Drona, king Duryodhana taking up that maiden on his car, carried her away forcibly.

data.v: तमन्वयाद्रथी खड्गी भद्धगोधाङ्गुलित्रवान् । कर्णः शस्त्रभृतां श्रेष्ठः पृष्ठतः पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: Armed with sword, clad in mail, and his fingers cased in leathern fences, Karna, that foremost of all holders of weapons, riding on his car, followed Duryodhana.

data.v: ततो विमर्दः सुमहान्राज्ञामासीद्युधिष्ठिर । संनह्यतां तनुत्राणि रथान्योजयतामपि ॥
data.md: A great tumult then took place among the kings, all the whom were bent upon fighting.-Put on your coats of mail. Get the cars ready!-(These were the words that were heard).

data.v: तेऽभ्यधावन्त संक्रुद्धाः कर्णदुर्योधनावुभौ । शरवर्षाणि मुञ्चन्तो मेघाः पर्वतयोरिव ॥
data.md: Filled with ire, they pursued Karna and Duryodhana, pouring their shafts upon them like masses of clouds pouring rain upon a couple of hills.

data.v: कर्णस्तेषामापततामेकैकेन क्षुरेण ह । धनूंषि सशरावापान्यपातयत भूतले ॥
data.md: As they thus pursued them, Karna struck down their bows and arrows on the ground, each with a single arrow.

data.v: ततो विधनुषः कांश्चित्कांश्चिदुद्यतकार्मुकान् । कांश्चिदुद्वहतो बाणान्रथशक्तिगदास्तथा ॥
data.md: Amongst them some were deprived of bow, some rushed bow in hand, some were on the point of discharging their arrows, and some pursued them, armed with darts and maces.

data.v: लाघवादाकुलीकृत्य कर्णः प्रहरतां वरः । हतसूतांश्च भूयिष्ठानवजिग्ये नराधिपान् ॥
data.md: Endued with great lightness of hands, Karna, that foremost of all strikers, assailed them all. He deprived many kings of their drivers, and thus defeated them.

data.v: ते स्वयं त्वरयन्तोऽश्वान्याहि याहीति वादिनः । व्यपेयुस्ते रणं हित्वा राजानो भग्नमानसाः ॥
data.md: They then themselves took up the reins of their horses, and saying.-Go away, go away-turned away from the battle with depressed hearts.

data.v: दुर्योधनस्तु कर्णेन पाल्यमानोऽभ्ययात्तदा । हृष्टः कन्यामुपादाय नगरं नागसाह्वयम् ॥
data.md: Protected by Karna, Duryodhana also came away, with a gladdened heart, bringing with him the maiden to Hastinapura.

data.v: आविष्कृतबलं कर्णं ज्ञात्वा राजा तु मागधः । आह्वयद्द्वैरथेनाजौ जरासंधो महीपतिः ॥
तयोः समभवद्युद्धं दिव्यास्त्रविदुषोर्द्वयोः । युधि नानाप्रहरणैरन्योन्यमभिवर्षतोः ॥
क्षीणबाणौ विधनुषौ भग्नखड्गौ महीं गतौ । बाहुभिः समसज्जेतामुभावपि बलान्वितौ ॥
data.md: At last when their arrows were run out, and bows and swords were broken, and they both lost their cars, they began, powerful as they were, to fight with bare arms.

data.v: बाहुकण्टकयुद्धेन तस्य कर्णोऽथ युध्यतः । बिभेद संधिं देहस्य जरया श्लेषितस्य ह ॥
data.md: While engaged with him a dreadful encounter with bare arms, Karna was about to cut the two portions of his antagonist's body that had been joined by Jara.

data.v: स विकारं शरीरस्य दृष्ट्वा नृपतिरात्मनः । प्रीतोऽस्मीत्यब्रवीत्कर्णं वैरमुत्सृज्य भारत ॥
data.md: Feeling himself very much pained, and giving up desire of hostility, the king of Magadha addressed Karma, saying,-I am pleased.

data.v: प्रीत्या ददौ स कर्णाय मालिनीं नगरीमथ । अङ्गेषु नरशार्दूल स राजासीत्सपत्नजित् ॥
data.md: Out of friendship he then gave to Karna the town Malini. Before this, that foremost of men and subjugator of all enemies (Karna), had been king of the Angas only, but from that time that grinder of hostile forces, began to rule over Champa also, as desired by Duryodhana, as you know.

data.v: पालयामास चम्पां तु कर्णः परबलार्दनः । दुर्योधनस्यानुमते तवापि विदितं तथा ॥
data.md: Out of friendship he then gave to Karna the town Malini. Before this, that foremost of men and subjugator of all enemies (Karna), had been king of the Angas only, but from that time that grinder of hostile forces, began to rule over Champa also, as desired by Duryodhana, as you know.

data.v: एवं शस्त्रप्रतापेन प्रथितः सोऽभवत्क्षितौ । त्वद्धितार्थं सुरेन्द्रेण भिक्षितो वर्मकुण्डले ॥
data.md: Thus Karna became known on Earth for the strength of his arms. When, for your well-being the king of gods begged of him his (natural) coat-of-mail and ear-rings, stupefied by celestial illusion, he gave away those precious things.

data.v: स दिव्ये सहजे प्रादात्कुण्डले परमार्चिते । सहजं कवचं चैव मोहितो देवमायया ॥
विमुक्तः कुण्डलाभ्यां च सहजेन च वर्मणा । निहतो विजयेनाजौ वासुदेवस्य पश्यतः ॥
data.md: Deprived of his ear-rings and his natural armour, he was killed by Arjuna before Vasudeva.

data.v: ब्राह्मणस्याभिशापेन रामस्य च महात्मनः । कुन्त्याश्च वरदानेन मायया च शतक्रतोः ॥
भीष्मावमानात्संख्यायां रथानामर्धकीर्तनात् । शल्यात्तेजोवधाच्चापि वासुदेवनयेन च ॥
रुद्रस्य देवराजस्य यमस्य वरुणस्य च । कुबेरद्रोणयोश्चैव कृपस्य च महात्मनः ॥
अस्त्राणि दिव्यान्यादाय युधि गाण्डीवधन्वना । हतो वैकर्तनः कर्णो दिवाकरसमद्युतिः ॥
एवं शप्तस्तव भ्राता बहुभिश्चापि वञ्चितः । न शोच्यः स नरव्याघ्रो युद्धे हि निधनं गतः ॥
data.md: Thus had your brother been cursed and beguiled by many! As, however, he has fallen in battle, you should not grieve for that foremost of man.

data.v: एतावदुक्त्वा देवर्षिर्विरराम स नारदः । युधिष्ठिरस्तु राजर्षिर्दध्यौ शोकपरिप्लुतः ॥
data.md: Saying so the celestial Rishi Narada became silent. the royal sage Yudhishthira, filled with sorrow began to meditate.

data.v: तं दीनमनसं वीरमधोवदनमातुरम् । निःश्वसन्तं यथा नागं पर्यश्रुनयनं तथा ॥
कुन्ती शोकपरीताङ्गी दुःखोपहतचेतना । अब्रवीन्मधुराभाषा काले वचनमर्थवत् ॥
data.md: Seeing that hero cheerless and unnerved by grief, sighing like a snake and shedding profuse tears, Kunti, herself filled with grief and almost beside herself with sorrow, addressed him in these sweet but weighty

data.v: युधिष्ठिर महाबाहो नैनं शोचितुमर्हसि । जहि शोकं महाप्राज्ञ शृणु चेदं वचो मम ॥
data.md: O mighty-armed Yudhishthira, you should not give way to sorrow thus! O you of at wisdom, destroy this grief and listen to what I say.

data.v: यतितः स मया पूर्वं भ्रात्र्यं ज्ञापयितुं तव । भास्करेण च देवेन पित्रा धर्मभृतां वर ॥
data.md: I tried formerly to inform Karna of his being your brother. The god Surya also, O best of all righteous men, did the same.

data.v: यद्वाच्यं हितकामेन सुहृदा भूतिमिच्छता । तथा दिवाकरेणोक्तः स्वप्नान्ते मम चाग्रतः ॥
data.md: That god said to Karna in a dream and once more in my presence, all that a well-wishing friend, from desire of good, should say.

data.v: न चैनमशकद्भानुरहं वा स्नेहकारणैः । पुरा प्रत्यनुनेतुं वा नेतुं वाप्येकतां त्वया ॥
data.md: Neither by affliction nor by reasons could Surya or myself succeed in pacifying him or inducing him to join you.

data.v: ततः कालपरीतः स वैरस्योद्धुक्षणे रतः । प्रतीपकारी युष्माकमिति चोपेक्षितो मया ॥
data.md: Yielding to the influence of Time, he was determined on creating enmity with you. As he was determined upon doing injuries to you all, I myself gave up the attempt.'

data.v: इत्युक्तो धर्मराजस्तु मात्रा बाष्पाकुलेक्षणः । उवाच वाक्यं धर्मात्मा शोकव्याकुलचेतनः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by his mother, king Yudhishthira, with tearful eyes and heart shaken by grief, said:-

data.v: भवत्या गूढमन्त्रत्वात्पीडितोऽस्मीत्युवाच ताम् । शशाप च महातेजाः सर्वलोकेषु च स्त्रियः । न गुह्यं धारयिष्यन्तीत्यतिदुःखसमन्वितः ॥
