data.md: Having performed various acts according to the diverse means of royal policy, insignificant kings, often destroy a great king through some contrivance.

data.v: तस्मात्प्रज्ञामृतमिदं चिरान्मां प्रत्युपस्थितम् । तत्प्राप्य प्रार्थये स्थानमव्ययं शाश्वतं ध्रुवम् ॥
data.md: Meditating on these circumstances, this nectar of wisdom has come to me. Having attained it, I desire to get a permanent, eternal, and ever-abiding place (for myself).

data.v: एतया सततं वृत्त्या चरन्नेवंप्रकारया । देहं संस्थापयिष्यामि निर्भयं मार्गमास्थितः ॥
data.md: Always (behaving) with such wisdom and acting in this wise, I shall, by following that fearless path of life, and this body that is subject to birth, death, decrepitude, disease, and pain.

data.v: श्रोत्रियस्येव ते राजन्मन्दकस्याविपश्चितः । अनुवाकहताबुद्धिर्नैषा तत्त्वार्थदर्शिनी ॥
data.md: Bhimasena said-Your understanding, O king, cannot perceive the truth, like that of a foolish and unintelligent reciter of the Veda for his recitation of those scriptures.

data.v: आलस्ये कृतचित्तस्य राजधर्मानसूयतः । विनाशे धार्तराष्ट्राणां किं फलं भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: If censuring the duties of kings you would lead an idle life, then, O foremost of Bharata's race, this destruction of the Dhartarashtras was perfectly useless.

data.v: क्षमानुकम्पा कारुण्यमानृशंस्यं न विद्यते । क्षात्रमाचरतो मार्गमपि बन्धोस्त्वदन्तरे ॥
data.md: Does not a Kshatriya possess forgiveness and compassion and pity and abstention from injury?

data.v: यदीमां भवतो बुद्धिं विद्याम वयमीदृशीम् । शस्त्रं नैव ग्रहीष्यामो न वधिष्याम कंचन ॥
data.md: If we knew that this was your intention, we would then have never taken up arms and killed a single creature.

data.v: भैक्ष्यमेवाचरिष्याम शरीरस्या विमोक्षणात् । न चेदं दारुणं युद्धमभविष्यन्महीक्षिताम् ॥
data.md: We would then have lived by begging till the destruction of this body! This dreadful battle between the kings would also have never taken place!

data.v: प्राणस्यान्नमिदं सर्वमिति वै कवयो विदुः । स्थावरं जङ्गमं चैव सर्वं प्राणस्य भोजनम् ॥
data.md: The learned have declared that what we see is food for the strong. This mobile and immobile world is worthy of being enjoyed by the strong.

data.v: आददानस्य चेद्राज्यं ये केचित्परिपन्थिनः । हन्तव्यास्त इति प्राज्ञाः क्षत्रधर्मविदो विदुः ॥
data.md: Wise men conversant with Kshatriya duties have said that they who stand in the way of the person taking the sovereignty of the Earth, should be killed.

data.v: ते सदोषा हतास्माभी राज्यस्य परिपन्थिनः । तान्हत्वा भुङ्क्ष्व धर्मेण युधिष्ठिर महीमिमाम् ॥
data.md: Committing the same fault, those that stood as enemies of our kingdom have all been killed by us. Having killed then, O Yudhishthira, righteously govern this Earth!

data.v: यथा हि पुरुषः खात्वा कूपमप्राप्य चोदकम् । पङ्कदिग्धो निवर्तेत कर्मेदं नस्तथोपमम् ॥
data.md: This act of our refusing the kingdom is like that of a person who having dug a well stops in his work before obtaining water and comes up covered with mire.

data.v: यथारुह्य महावृक्षमपहृत्य ततो मधु । अप्राश्य निधनं गच्छेत्कर्मेदं नस्तथोपमम् ॥
data.md: Or, this our act is like that of a person who having climbed up a tall tree and collected honey therefrom dies before tasting it.

data.v: यथा महान्तमध्वानमाशया पुरुषः पतन् । स निराशो निवर्तेत कर्मेदं नस्तथोपमम् ॥
data.md: Or, it is like that of a person who having set out on a long journey comes back in despair without having reached his goal.

data.v: यथा शत्रून्घातयित्वा पुरुषः कुरुसत्तम । आत्मानं घातयेत्पश्चात्कर्मेदं नस्तथाविधम् ॥
data.md: Or, it is like that of a person who having killed all his enemies, O you of Kuru's race, at last dies at his own hand.

data.v: यथान्नं क्षुधितो लब्ध्वा न भुञ्जीत यदृच्छया । कामी च कामिनीं लब्ध्वा कर्मेदं नस्तथाविधम् ॥
data.md: Or, it is like that of a person with hunger, who having obtained food, refuses to take it, or of a person under the influence of passion, who having obtained a woman reciprocating his desire refuses to know her.

data.v: वयमेवात्र गर्ह्या हि ये वयं मन्दचेतसः । त्वां राजन्ननुगच्छामो ज्येष्ठोऽयमिति भारत ॥
data.md: We have become butts of censure, O Bharata, because, O king, we follow you who are of weak understanding, in consequence of yourself being our eldest brother!

data.v: वयं हि बाहुबलिनः कृतविद्या मनस्विनः । क्लीबस्य वाक्ये तिष्ठामो यथैवाशक्तयस्तथा ॥
data.md: We are endued with the might of arms; we are accomplished in knowledge and gifted with great energy. Yet we follow the words of a eunuch as if we were entirely helpless!

data.v: अगतीन्कागतीनस्मान्नष्टार्थानर्थसिद्धये । कथं वै नानुपश्येयुर्जनाः पश्यन्ति यादृशम् ॥
data.md: We are the refuge of all helpless persons. Yet, when people see us so, why would they not say that we are entirely powerless to acquire our objects? Think of what I say!

data.v: आपत्काले हि संन्यासः कर्तव्य इति शिष्यते । जरयाभिपरीतेन शत्रुभिर्व्यंसितेन च ॥
data.md: It has been laid down that (a life of) Renunciation should be adopted, only in times of difficulty, by kings attacked with decrepitude or defeated by, enemies!

data.v: तस्मादिह कृतप्रज्ञास्त्यागं न परिचक्षते । धर्मव्यतिक्रमं चेदं मन्यन्ते सूक्ष्मदर्शिनः ॥
data.md: Wise men, therefore, do not praise Renunciation as the duty of a Kshatriya. On the other hand, the clear-sighted think that the adoption of such a life (by a Kshatriya) involves even the loss of virtue.

data.v: कथं तस्मात्समुत्पन्नस्तन्निष्ठस्तदुपाश्रयः । तदेव निन्दन्नासीत श्रद्धा वान्यत्र गृह्यते ॥
data.md: How can those who are born in that order, who follow the practices of that order, and that have their refuse in them, censure those duties? If indeed those duties be censurable, then why should not the Supreme Ordainer be blamed?

data.v: श्रिया विहीनैरधनैर्नास्तिकैः संप्रवर्तितम् । वेदवादस्य विज्ञानं सत्याभासमिवानृतम् ॥
data.md: The persons who are shorn of prosperity and wealth and who are unbelievers, have laid down this precept of the Vedas as the truth. In reality, however, it is never, proper for a Kshatriya to do so.

data.v: शक्यं तु मौण्ड्यमास्थाय बिभ्रतात्मानमात्मना । धर्मच्छद्म समास्थाय आसितुं न तु जीवितुम् ॥
data.md: He who can support life by prowess, he who can support himself by his own exertions, does note live, but really deviates from his duty, by following the life of Renunciation.

data.v: शक्यं पुनररण्येषु सुखमेकेन जीवितुम् । अबिभ्रता पुत्रपौत्रान्देवर्षीनतिथीन्पितॄन् ॥
data.md: That man only is capable of leading a solitary life of happiness in the forest who cannot support sons and grandsons and the deities and Rishis and guests and Pitris.

data.v: नेमे मृगाः स्वर्गजितो न वराहा न पक्षिणः । अथैतेन प्रकारेण पुण्यमाहुर्न ताञ्जनाः ॥
data.md: As the deer and boars and birds cannot attain to heaven, even so those Kshatriyas who are not shorn of prowess cannot attain to heaven by leading only a forest life. They should acquire religious merit by other means.

data.v: यदि संन्यासतः सिद्धिं राजन्कश्चिदवाप्नुयात् । पर्वताश्च द्रुमाश्चैव क्षिप्रं सिद्धिमवाप्नुयुः ॥
data.md: If, O king, anybody could secure success from Renunciation, then mountains and trees would surely obtain it.

data.v: एते हि नित्यसंन्यासा दृश्यन्ते निरुपद्रवाः । अपरिग्रहवन्तश्च सततं चात्मचारिणः ॥
data.md: These latter always lead lives of Renunciation. They do not harın any one. They do not lead a life of worldliness and are all Brahmacharins.

data.v: अथ चेदात्मभाग्येषु नान्येषां सिद्धिमश्नुते । तस्मात्कर्मैव कर्तव्यं नास्ति सिद्धिरकर्मणः ॥
data.md: If it be the truth that a person's success depends upon his own torture in life and not upon that of others, then you should take to action. He that is shorn of action can never attain success.

data.v: औदकाः सृष्टयश्चैव जन्तवः सिद्धिमाप्नुयुः । येषामात्मैव भर्तव्यो नान्यः कश्चन विद्यते ॥
data.md: If they who fill only their own stomachs could achieve success, then all aquatic creatures would get it, for these have none else to support save their own selves.

data.v: अवेक्षस्व यथा स्वैः स्वैः कर्मभिर्व्यापृतं जगत् । तस्मात्कर्मैव कर्तव्यं नास्ति सिद्धिरकर्मणः ॥
data.md: Behold, the world moves on, with every creature on it acting according to its nature, therefore, one should act. The man shorn of action can never attain success.

data.v: अत्रैवोदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । तापसैः सह संवादं शक्रस्य भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Arjuna said The old history of the discourse between certain ascetics and Shakra, is cited in this connection, O foremost of Bharata's race!

data.v: केचिद्गृहान्परित्यज्य वनमभ्यगमन्द्विजाः । अजातश्मश्रवो मन्दाः कुले जाताः प्रवव्रजुः ॥
data.md: Certain little-witted well-born Brahmana youths, without attaining manhood, forsaking their homes, came to the woods for leading a forest life.

data.v: धर्मोऽयमिति मन्वाना ब्रह्मचर्ये व्यवस्थिताः । त्यक्त्वा गृहान्पितॄंश्चैव तानिन्द्रोऽन्वकृपायत ॥
data.md: Considering that to be virtue, those youths possessing sufficient resources desired to live as Brahmacharins, having abandoned their brothers and fathers. It so happened that Indra felt pity for them.

data.v: तानाबभाषे भगवान्पक्षी भूत्वा हिरण्मयः । सुदुष्करं मनुष्यैश्च यत्कृतं विघसाशिभिः ॥
data.md: Assuming the form of a golden bird, Indra addressed them, saying,-What is done by persons who eat the residue of a Sacrifice is the most difficult of acts that men can perform.

data.v: पुण्यं च बत कर्मैषां प्रशस्तं चैव जीवितम् । संसिद्धास्ते गतिं मुख्यां प्राप्ता धर्मपरायणाः ॥
data.md: Such an act is productive of great merit. The lives of such men are worthy of every praise. Having attained the object of life, those virtuous men, obtained the highest end!

data.v: अहो बतायं शकुनिर्विघसाशान्प्रशंसति । अस्मान्नूनमयं शास्ति वयं च विघसाशिनः ॥
data.md: Hearing these words, the Rishis said,-Lo, this bird praises those who live upon the remnants of Sacrifices! He mentions this to us, for we live upon such remnants!

data.v: नाहं युष्मान्प्रशंसामि पङ्कदिग्धान्रजस्वलान् । उच्छिष्टभोजिनो मन्दानन्ये वै विघसाशिनः ॥
data.md: The bird then said The bird then said.-I do not praise you! You are covered with mire and very impure! Living upon offals, you are wicked! Ye you not persons living upon the remnants of Sacrifice!-

data.v: इदं श्रेयः परमिति वयमेवाभ्युपास्महे । शकुने ब्रूहि यच्छ्रेयो भृशं वै श्रद्दधाम ते ॥
data.md: The Rishis said We consider this course of life to be highly : blessed! Tell us, O bird, what is for our wellbeing! Your words fill us with great faith!

data.v: यदि मां नाभिशङ्कध्वं विभज्यात्मानमात्मना । ततोऽहं वः प्रवक्ष्यामि याथातथ्यं हितं वचः ॥
data.md: The bird said If by acting against your better selves, you do not refuse me your faith, then I shall tell you true and beneficial words.

data.v: शृणुमस्ते वचस्तात पन्थानो विदितास्तव । नियोगे चैव धर्मात्मन्स्थातुमिच्छाम शाधि नः ॥
data.md: The Rishis said We shall hear words, O sire, for you know the different paths! O you of righteous soul, we desire also to obey your behests. Instruct us now!

data.v: चतुष्पदां गौः प्रवरा लोहानां काञ्चनं वरम् । शब्दानां प्रवरो मन्त्रो ब्राह्मणो द्विपदां वरः ॥
data.md: among quadrupeds the cow is the foremost. Of metals, goid is the foremost. Of words, Mantras, and of human beings, Brahmanas, are the foremost.

data.v: मन्त्रोऽयं जातकर्मादि ब्राह्मणस्य विधीयते । जीवतो यो यथाकालं श्मशाननिधनादिति ॥
data.md: These Mantras regulate all the rites of a Brahmana's life, beginning with those consequent upon birth and the period after it, and ending with those consequent on death and the obsequial rites.

data.v: कर्माणि वैदिकान्यस्य स्वर्ग्यः पन्थास्त्वनुत्तमः । अथ सर्वाणि कर्माणि मन्त्रसिद्धानि चक्षते ॥
data.md: These Vedic rites constitute his heaven, path, and best of sacrifices, If it were Otherwise, how could the acts of persons seeking of heaven become successful through Mantras?

data.v: आम्नायदृढवादीनि तथा सिद्धिरिहेष्यते । मासार्धमासा ऋतव आदित्यशशितारकम् ॥
data.md: He who, in this world, worships his self, knowing it to be a deity of a particular kind, attains to success consistent with a nature of that particular deity. Persons dying in two fortnights go to the Sun, the Moon, or the Stars.

data.v: ईहन्ते सर्वभूतानि तदृतं कर्मसङ्गिनाम् । सिद्धिक्षेत्रमिदं पुण्यमयमेवाश्रमो महान् ॥
data.md: These three kinds of success, dependent upon action, are sought by every creature. The life of a householder is very superior and sacred and is called the field of success.

data.v: अथ ये कर्म निन्दन्तो मनुष्याः कापथं गताः । मूढानामर्थहीनानां तेषामेनस्तु विद्यते ॥
data.md: What path do those men follow that censure action? Foolish and poor as they are they incur sin.

data.v: देववंशान्पितृवंशान्ब्रह्मवंशांश्च शाश्वतान् । संत्यज्य मूढा वर्तन्ते ततो यान्त्यश्रुतीपथम् ॥
data.md: And since those little-witted men live by abandoning the eternal paths of the gods, of the Rishis, and of Brahma, therefore, they attain to paths disapproved of by the Shrutis.

data.v: एतद्वोऽस्तु तपो युक्तं ददानीत्यृषिचोदितम् । तस्मात्तदध्यवसतस्तपस्वि तप उच्यते ॥
data.md: There is a verse in the Maniras which says,-(Ye sacrificer, perform the sacrifice with gifts of costly things. I will give you the happiness represented by sons, animals, and heaven.) To live, therefore, in accordance with the ordinance is said to be the highest form of asceticism. Therefore, you should perform sacrifice and penances in the shape of gifts.

data.v: देववंशान्पितृवंशान्ब्रह्मवंशांश्च शाश्वतान् । संविभज्य गुरोश्चर्यां तद्वै दुष्करमुच्यते ॥
data.md: And since those little-witted men live by abandoning the eternal paths of the gods, of the Rishis, and of Brahma, therefore, they attain to paths disapproved of by the Shrutis.

data.v: देवा वै दुष्करं कृत्वा विभूतिं परमां गताः । तस्माद्गार्हस्थ्यमुद्वोढुं दुष्करं प्रब्रवीमि वः ॥
data.md: By practising such highly difficult penances, the gods have obtained the highest glory and power. I, therefore, ask you to satisfy the heavy duties of a householder.

data.v: तपः श्रेष्ठं प्रजानां हि मूलमेतन्न संशयः । कुटुम्बविधिनानेन यस्मिन्सर्वं प्रतिष्ठितम् ॥
data.md: Forsooth, penances are the foremost of all things and are the root of all creatures, Asceticism, is attainable by leading the life a householder, upon which depends everything. The learned Brahmins having chack on malice, beyond the sphere of duality know that penance. The penance so observed by them is addressed as penance on the earth.

data.v: एतद्विदुस्तपो विप्रा द्वंद्वातीता विमत्सराः । तस्माद्वनं मध्यमं च लोकेषु तप उच्यते ॥
दुराधर्षं पदं चैव गच्छन्ति विघसाशिनः । सायंप्रातर्विभज्यान्नं स्वकुटुम्बे यथाविधि ॥
data.md: After duly distributing the food morning and evening among kinsmen, they who eat the residuc attain to the ends that are highly difficult of attainment.

data.v: दत्त्वातिथिभ्यो देवेभ्यः पितृभ्यः स्वजनस्य च । अवशिष्टानि येऽश्नन्ति तानाहुर्विघसाशिनः ॥
data.md: They are called eaters of the residue of feasts who cat after having fed guests and gods and Rishis and kinsmen.

data.v: तस्मात्स्वधर्ममास्थाय सुव्रताः सत्यवादिनः । लोकस्य गुरवो भूत्वा ते भवन्त्यनुपस्कृताः ॥
data.md: Therefore, those persons who observe their own duties, who practise excellent vows and are truthful in speech, are greatly respected in the world, with their own faith greatly strengthened.

data.v: त्रिदिवं प्राप्य शक्रस्य स्वर्गलोके विमत्सराः । वसन्ति शाश्वतीर्वर्षा जना दुष्करकारिणः ॥
data.md: Shorn pride, those achievers of the most difficult feats attain to heaven and live for ever in the regions of Shakra!

data.v: ततस्ते तद्वचः श्रुत्वा तस्य धर्मार्थसंहितम् । उत्सृज्य नास्तिकगतिं गार्हस्थ्यं धर्ममाश्रिताः ॥
data.md: Arjuna continued Hearing these beneficial and righteous words, those ascetics abandoned the religion of Renunciation, saying, There is nothing in it,-and begin to live like householders.

data.v: तस्मात्त्वमपि दुर्धर्ष धैर्यमालम्ब्य शाश्वतम् । प्रशाधि पृथिवीं कृत्स्नां हतामित्रां नरोत्तम ॥
data.md: Therefore, O you, who are conversant with righteousness, availing of that eternal wisdom, rule the wide world, O monarch, that is now shorn of foes."

data.v: अर्जुनस्य वचः श्रुत्वा नकुलो वाक्यमब्रवीत् । राजानमभिसंप्रेक्ष्य सर्वधर्मभृतां वरम् ॥
अनुरुध्य महाप्राज्ञो भ्रातुश्चित्तमरिंदमः । व्यूढोरस्को महाबाहुस्ताम्रास्यो मितभाषिता ॥
विशाखयूपे देवानां सर्वेषामग्नयश्चिताः । तस्माद्विद्धि महाराज देवान्कर्मपथि स्थितान् ॥
data.md: Nakula said Even the gods had placed their fires in the reign called Vishakha-yupa, Know, therefore, O king, that the gods themselves depend upon the fruits of action!

data.v: अनास्तिकानास्तिकानां प्राणदाः पितरश्च ये । तेऽपि कर्मैव कुर्वन्ति विधिं पश्यस्व पार्थिव । वेदवादापविद्धांस्तु तान्विद्धि भृशनास्तिकान् ॥
data.md: Observing the Vedic ordinances (of the Creator as declared in the Vedas), the Pitris, who support (by rain) the lives of even all disbelievers, are, O king, engaged in action.

data.v: न हि वेदोक्तमुत्सृज्य विप्रः सर्वेषु कर्मसु । देवयानेन नाकस्य पृष्ठमाप्नोति भारत ॥
data.md: They are, indeed, consummate atheists who do not accept the injunction of the Vedas (which inculcate action). By following Vedic injunctions in all his acts, the person that is learned in the Vedas, attains, O Bharata, to the highest region of heaven by the way of the deities. All persons acquainted with Vedas have declared the life of a householder to be superior to all the (other) modes of life.

data.v: अत्याश्रमानयं सर्वानित्याहुर्वेदनिश्चयाः । ब्राह्मणाः श्रुतिसंपन्नास्तान्निबोध जनाधिप ॥
वित्तानि धर्मलब्धानि क्रतुमुख्येष्ववासृजन् । कृतात्मसु महाराज स वै त्यागी स्मृतो नरः ॥
data.md: O king, the person who in sacrifices give away his fairly acquired wealth to these Brahmanas who are well conversant with the Vedas, and contracts his soul, is, O monarch, regarded as the true Renouncer.

data.v: अनवेक्ष्य सुखादानं तथैवोर्ध्वं प्रतिष्ठितः । आत्मत्यागी महाराज स त्यागी तामसः प्रभो ॥
data.md: He, however, who, disregarding the life of a householder, the source of much happiness, adopts the next mode of life,-Renunciation, O monarch, is Renouncer possessed by the quality of darkness.

data.v: अनिकेतः परिपतन्वृक्षमूलाश्रयो मुनिः । अपाचकः सदा योगी स त्यागी पार्थ भिक्षुकः ॥
data.md: That man who is houseless, who roves over the world like a mendicant who has the foot of a tree for his refuge, who observes the vow of silence, never cooks for himself, and tries to control his senses, is, O Partha, a Renouncer observing the vow of mendicancy.

data.v: क्रोधहर्षावनादृत्य पैशुन्यं च विशां पते । विप्रो वेदानधीते यः स त्यागी गुरुपूजकः ॥
data.md: That Brahmana who, disregarding anger and joy, and especially deceitfulness, always devotes his time to the study of the Vedas, is a Renouncer observing the vow of mendicancy.

data.v: आश्रमांस्तुलया सर्वान्धृतानाहुर्मनीषिणः । एकतस्ते त्रयो राजन्गृहस्थाश्रम एकतः ॥
data.md: The four different modes of life were at one time weighed in the balance. The wise have said, O king, that when the life of a householder was placed on one scale, it required the three others to balance it.

data.v: समीक्षते तु योऽर्थं वै कामं स्वर्गं च भारत । अयं पन्था महर्षीणामियं लोकविदां गतिः ॥
data.md: Marking the result of this examination by scales, O Partha, and seeing further, O Bharata, that the life of a householder alone contained both heaven and pleasure, the great Rishis and the persons conversant with the ways of the world followed it.

data.v: इति यः कुरुते भावं स त्यागी भरतर्षभ । न यः परित्यज्य गृहान्वनमेति विमूढवत् ॥
data.md: He, therefore,O foremost of Bharata's race, who follows this mode of life, thinking it to be his duty and abandoning all desire for fruit, is a true Renouncer, and not that man who having clouded understanding goes to the forest abandoning home.

data.v: यदा कामान्समीक्षेत धर्मवैतंसिकोऽनृजुः । अथैनं मृत्युपाशेन कण्ठे बध्नाति मृत्युराट् ॥
data.md: A person, again, who, putting on the external marks of righteousness, fails to conquer his desires even while living in the forest, is bound by Death with his deadly fetters round the neck.

data.v: अभिमानकृतं कर्म नैतत्फलवदुच्यते । त्यागयुक्तं महाराज सर्वमेव महाफलम् ॥
data.md: Acts which are the outcome of vanity product no fruit. Those acts however, O monarch, which are the outcome of the spirit of Renunciation, always bear abundant fruits.

data.v: शमो दमस्तपो दानं सत्यं शौचमथार्जवम् । यज्ञो धृतिश्च धर्मश्च नित्यमार्षो विधिः स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Tranquillity, self-restraint, fortitude, truth, purity, simplicity, sacrifices, perseverance, and righteousness,-these are always the virtues recommended by the Rishis.

data.v: पितृदेवातिथिकृते समारम्भोऽत्र शस्यते । अत्रैव हि महाराज त्रिवर्गः केवलं फलम् ॥
data.md: The householder performs acts intended for Pitris, gods, and guests, this mode of life alone, O monarch, contains the threefold objects.

data.v: एतस्मिन्वर्तमानस्य विधौ विप्रनिषेविते । त्यागिनः प्रसृतस्येह नोच्छित्तिर्विद्यते क्वचित् ॥
data.md: The Renouncer that rigidly follows this mode of life, in which one is free to do all acts, has not to meet ruin either here or hereafter.

data.v: असृजद्धि प्रजा राजन्प्रजापतिरकल्मषः । मां यक्ष्यन्तीति शान्तात्मा यज्ञैर्विविधदक्षिणैः ॥
data.md: The holy Lord of all creatures, of righteous soul, created creatures with the purpose that they would worship him by sacrifices with profuse presents.

data.v: वीरुधश्चैव वृक्षांश्च यज्ञार्थं च तथौषधीः । पशूंश्चैव तथा मेध्यान्यज्ञार्थानि हवींषि च ॥
data.md: Creepers, trees, deciduous herbs, and clean animals, and clarified butter, were created as materials of sacrifice.

data.v: गृहस्थाश्रमिणस्तच्च यज्ञकर्म विरोधकम् । तस्माद्गार्हस्थ्यमेवेह दुष्करं दुर्लभं तथा ॥
data.md: To a householder the performance of sacrifice is fraught with impediments. For this, that mode of life is described as exceedingly difficult and unattainable.

data.v: तत्संप्राप्य गृहस्था ये पशुधान्यसमन्विताः । न यजन्ते महाराज शाश्वतं तेषु किल्बिषम् ॥
data.md: The householders, who, possessed of wealth and corn and animals, do not perform sacrifices commit, o king, eternal sin.

data.v: स्वाध्याययज्ञा ऋषयो ज्ञानयज्ञास्तथापरे । अथापरे महायज्ञान्मनसैव वितन्वते ॥
data.md: Amongst Rishis, there are some who consider the study of the Vedas to be a some sacrifice; and who consider contemplation to be a great sacrifice which they perform in their minds.

data.v: एवं दानसमाधानं मार्गमातिष्ठतो नृप । द्विजातेर्ब्रह्मभूतस्य स्पृहयन्ति दिवौकसः ॥
data.md: The very gods, O king, seek the companionship of such a holy person, who on account of his following such a way which consists in the concentration of the mind, has become equal to Brahma.

data.v: स रत्नानि विचित्राणि संभृतानि ततस्ततः । मखेष्वनभिसंत्यज्य नास्तिक्यमभिजल्पसि । कुटुम्बमास्थिते त्यागं न पश्यामि नराधिप ॥
data.md: By refusing to spend in Sacrifice the various kinds of wealth which you have collected from your enemies, you are only displaying your want of faith!

data.v: राजसूयाश्वमेधेषु सर्वमेधेषु वा पुनः । य चान्ये क्रतवस्तात ब्राह्मणैरभिपूजिताः । तैर्यजस्व महाराज शक्रो देवपतिर्यथा ॥
data.md: Like Shakra, the king of gods, O sire, perform those other sacrifices that are lauded by the Brahmanas!

data.v: राज्ञः प्रमाददोषेण दस्युभिः परिमुष्यताम् । अशरण्यः प्रजानां यः स राजा कलिरुच्यते ॥
data.md: The king, through whose negligence the subjects are plundered by robbers, and who does not offer protection to those whom he is called upon to rule is said to be the personated Kali.

data.v: अश्वान्गाश्चैव दासीश्च करेणूश्च स्वलंकृताः । ग्रामाञ्जनपदांश्चैव क्षेत्राणि च गृहाणि च ॥
data.md: If, without giving away horses and kine, and female slaves and elephants adorned with trappings, and villages, and populous countries, and fields, and houses, to Brahmanas, we retire into the forest with hearts not overflowing with friendly feelings towards kinsmen, even we shall be, O king, like so many Kali Kshatriyas.

data.v: अप्रदाय द्विजातिभ्यो मात्सर्याविष्टचेतसः । वयं ते राजकलयो भविष्यामो विशां पते ॥
data.md: If, without giving away horses and kine, and female slaves and elephants adorned with trappings, and villages, and populous countries, and fields, and houses, to Brahmanas, we retire into the forest with hearts not overflowing with friendly feelings towards kinsmen, even we shall be, O king, like so many Kali Kshatriyas.

data.v: अदातारोऽशरण्याश्च राजकिल्बिषभागिनः । दुःखानामेव भोक्तारो न सुखानां कदाचन ॥
data.md: Kshatriyas who do not practise charity and give protection (to others), commit sin. Woe to thein hereafter and not bliss.

data.v: अनिष्ट्वा च महायज्ञैरकृत्वा च पितृस्वधाम् । तीर्थेष्वनभिसंत्यज्य प्रव्रजिष्यसि चेदथ ॥
data.md: If, O lord, without celebrating great sacrifices and the rites in honour of your deceased manes, and if, without bathing in sacred waters, you lead the life of a mendicant, you will then meet with destruction like a sinall cloud, separated from a mass and driven by the winds. You will then fall off from both worlds and will be born in the Pishacha order.

data.v: छिन्नाभ्रमिव गन्तासि विलयं मारुतेरितम् । लोकयोरुभयोर्भ्रष्टो ह्यन्तराले व्यवस्थितः ॥
data.md: If, O lord, without celebrating great sacrifices and the rites in honour of your deceased manes, and if, without bathing in sacred waters, you lead the life of a mendicant, you will then meet with destruction like a sinall cloud, separated from a mass and driven by the winds. You will then fall off from both worlds and will be born in the Pishacha order.

data.v: अन्तर्बहिश्च यत्किंचिन्मनोव्यासङ्गकारकम् । परित्यज्य भवेत्त्यागी न यो हित्वा प्रतिष्ठते ॥
data.md: A person becomes a true Renouncer by casting off internal and external attachments, and not simply by leaving home for dwelling in the forest,

data.v: एतस्मिन्वर्तमानस्य विधौ विप्रनिषेविते । ब्राह्मणस्य महाराज नोच्छित्तिर्विद्यते क्वचित् ॥
data.md: The Renouncer that rigidly follows this mode of life, in which one is free to do all acts, has not to meet ruin either here or hereafter.

data.v: निहत्य शत्रूंस्तरसा समृद्धा;न्शक्रो यथा दैत्यबलानि संख्ये । कः पार्थ शोचेन्निरतः स्वधर्मे; पूर्वैः स्मृते पार्थिव शिष्टजुष्टे ॥
data.md: Observing the duties of one's own order, respected by the ancients and practised by the best of men,-who is there, ( Partha, that would grieve, o king, for having killed in battle his enemies elated with prosperity, like Shakra killing the forces of the Daityas?

data.v: क्षात्रेण धर्मेण पराक्रमेण; जित्वा महीं मन्त्रविद्भ्यः प्रदाय । नाकस्य पृष्ठेऽसि नरेन्द्र गन्ता; न शोचितव्यं भवताद्य पार्थ ॥
data.md: Having, while observing Kshatriya duties, subjugated the world by the help of your prowess, and having made presents unto persons conversant with the Vedas, you can, O king, go to regions higher than heaven itself. You should not, O Partha, indulge in grief.'

data.v: न बाह्यं द्रव्यमुत्सृज्य सिद्धिर्भवति भारत । शारीरं द्रव्यमुत्सृज्य सिद्धिर्भवति वा न वा ॥
data.md: Sahadeva said By renouncing all external objects only, O Bharata, one does not obtain success. Even in the casting off of mental attachments, the attainment of, success is doubtful.

data.v: बाह्यद्रव्यविमुक्तस्य शारीरेषु च गृध्यतः । यो धर्मो यत्सुखं वा स्याद्द्विषतां तत्तथास्तु नः ॥
data.md: May our enemies have that religious merit and that happiness which fall to the share of him, who has relinquished external objects, but whose mind still internally covets them.

data.v: शारीरं द्रव्यमुत्सृज्य पृथिवीमनुशासतः । यो धर्मो यत्सुखं वा स्यात्सुहृदां तत्तथास्तु नः ॥
data.md: May our enemies have that religious merit and that happiness which fall to the share of him, who has relinquished external objects, but whose mind still internally covets them.

data.v: द्व्यक्षरस्तु भवेन्मृत्युस्त्र्यक्षरं ब्रह्म शाश्वतम् । ममेति च भवेन्मृत्युर्न ममेति च शाश्वतम् ॥
data.md: The word with two letters is Mrityu (death,) and the word with three letters is Shashvata Brahman, the eternal spirit. The consciousness of ego, or the state of being addicted to worldly objects is Death, and the absence of that feeling is immortality.

data.v: ब्रह्ममृत्यू च तौ राजन्नात्मन्येव समाश्रितौ । अदृश्यमानौ भूतानि योधयेतामसंशयम् ॥
data.md: O king, entering invisibly into every soul, Brahma and Death, forsooth, all creatures to act.

data.v: अविनाशोऽस्य सत्त्वस्य नियतो यदि भारत । भित्त्वा शरीरं भूतानां न हिंसा प्रतिपत्स्यते ॥
data.md: If this being, O Bharata, which is called soul, is not subject to destruction, then by destroying the bodies of creatures one cannot be guilty of murder.

data.v: अथापि च सहोत्पत्तिः सत्त्वस्य प्रलयस्तथा । नष्टे शरीरे नष्टं स्याद्वृथा च स्यात्क्रियापथः ॥
data.md: If, on the other hand, the soul and the body are born or killed together, so that when the body is destroyed the soul also is destroyed, ten the religious rites and acts would be useless.

data.v: तस्मादेकान्तमुत्सृज्य पूर्वैः पूर्वतरैश्च यः । पन्था निषेवितः सद्भिः स निषेव्यो विजानता ॥
data.md: Therefore, driving away all misgivings regarding the immortality of the soul, the intelligent nian should adopt the path of the righteous of old and older times.

data.v: लब्ध्वापि पृथिवीं कृत्स्नां सहस्थावरजङ्गमाम् । न भुङ्क्ते यो नृपः सम्यङ्निष्फलं तस्य जीवितम् ॥
data.md: The life of that king is certainly useless who having acquired the entire Earth with her mobile and immobile creatures, does not enjoy her.

data.v: अथ वा वसतो राजन्वने वन्येन जीवतः । द्रव्येषु यस्य ममता मृत्योरास्ये स वर्तते ॥
data.md: Regarding the man again who dwells in the forest upon wild fruits and roots, but whose attachment to earthly objects has not ceased, such a one, O king, lives within the jaws of Death.

data.v: बाह्याभ्यन्तरभूतानां स्वभावं पश्य भारत । ये तु पश्यन्ति तद्भावं मुच्यन्ते महतो भयात् ॥
data.md: Know, O Bharata, the hearts and the bodies of all creatures to be but manifestations of your own. They who regard all creatures as their own selves escape from the great fear of Death.

data.v: भवान्पिता भवान्माता भवान्भ्राता भवान्गुरुः । दुःखप्रलापानार्तस्य तस्मान्मे क्षन्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: You are my father, you are my protector, you are my brother, and you my senior and preceptor. You should, therefore, forgive these incoherent utterances in sorrow of a woestricken person.

data.v: तथ्यं वा यदि वातथ्यं यन्मयैतत्प्रभाषितम् । तद्विद्धि पृथिवीपाल भक्त्या भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: True or false, what I have said, O king, has been said from a due respect for you, O best of Bharatas!

data.v: अव्याहरति कौन्तेये धर्मराजे युधिष्ठिरे । भ्रातॄणां ब्रुवतां तांस्तान्विविधान्वेदनिश्चयान् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said When after listening to his brothers who were telling these truths of the Vedas, Kunti's son king Yudhishthira just remained silent.

data.v: महाभिजनसंपन्ना श्रीमत्यायतलोचना । अभ्यभाषत राजेन्द्रं द्रौपदी योषितां वरा ॥
data.md: That foremost of nobly born women, viz., Draupadi, of large eyes and great beauty, O king, said these words unto that foremost of kings seated in the midst of his brothers who were like many lions and tigers, and like the leader of an elephantine herd in the midst of a herd of elephants.

data.v: आसीनमृषभं राज्ञां भ्रातृभिः परिवारितम् । सिंहशार्दूलसदृशैर्वारणैरिव यूथपम् ॥
data.md: That foremost of nobly born women, viz., Draupadi, of large eyes and great beauty, O king, said these words unto that foremost of kings seated in the midst of his brothers who were like many lions and tigers, and like the leader of an elephantine herd in the midst of a herd of elephants.

data.v: अभिमानवती नित्यं विशेषेण युधिष्ठिरे । लालिता सततं राज्ञा धर्मज्ञा धर्मदर्शिनी ॥
data.md: Always expecting respectful love from all her husbands but especially from Yudhishthira, she was always treated with love and indulgence by the king. Conversant with duties and always satisfying them, that lady of large hips, eyeing her husband, drew his attention in soothing and sweet words, and said as follows:

data.v: इमे ते भ्रातरः पार्थ शुष्यन्त स्तोकका इव । वावाश्यमानास्तिष्ठन्ति न चैनानभिनन्दसे ॥
data.md: These your brothers, O Partha, are crying and drying their tongues like Chatakas, but you do not please them.

data.v: नन्दयैतान्महाराज मत्तानिव महाद्विपान् । उपपन्नेन वाक्येन सततं दुःखभागिनः ॥
data.md: O king, cheer up these your brothers, who are like infuriate elephants (in prowess) with proper words,-these heroes who have always suffered miseries!

data.v: कथं द्वैतवने राजन्पूर्वमुक्त्वा तथा वचः । भ्रातॄनेतान्स्म सहिताञ्शीतवातातपार्दितान् ॥
data.md: Why, O king, while living on the bank of the Dvaita lake, did you say to these your brothers then living with you, and suffering from cold and wind and sun, these words, viz.,-engaging in battle to win victory, we will kill Duryodhana and enjoy the Earth that is capable of granting every desire.

data.v: वयं दुर्योधनं हत्वा मृधे भोक्ष्याम मेदिनीम् । संपूर्णां सर्वकामानामाहवे विजयैषिणः ॥
data.md: Why, O king, while living on the bank of the Dvaita lake, did you say to these your brothers then living with you, and suffering from cold and wind and sun, these words, viz.,-engaging in battle to win victory, we will kill Duryodhana and enjoy the Earth that is capable of granting every desire.

data.v: विरथांश्च रथान्कृत्वा निहत्य च महागजान् । संस्तीर्य च रथैर्भूमिं ससादिभिररिंदमाः ॥
data.md: Depriving great car-warriors of their cars and killing huge elephants, and covering the battle-field with the bodies of car-warriors and horsemen and horses, O chastiser of foes, you will celebrate great sacrifices of various kinds with profuse presents! All these sufferings of a life of exile in the forest will then end in happiness!

data.v: यजतां विविधैर्यज्ञैः समृद्धैराप्तदक्षिणैः । वनवासकृतं दुःखं भविष्यति सुखाय नः ॥
data.md: Depriving great car-warriors of their cars and killing huge elephants, and covering the battle-field with the bodies of car-warriors and horsemen and horses, O chastiser of foes, you will celebrate great sacrifices of various kinds with profuse presents! All these sufferings of a life of exile in the forest will then end in happiness!

data.v: इत्येतानेवमुक्त्वा त्वं स्वयं धर्मभृतां वर । कथमद्य पुनर्वीर विनिहंसि मनांस्युत ॥
data.md: O foremost of the virtuous, having yourself said these words to your brothers then, why, O hero, do you depress our hearts now?

data.v: न क्लीबो वसुधां भुङ्क्ते न क्लीबो धनमश्नुते । न क्लीबस्य गृहे पुत्रा मत्स्याः पङ्क इवासते ॥
data.md: A eunuch can never enjoy wealth. A eunuch can never have children, as there can be no fish in a mud (destitute of water).

data.v: नादण्डः क्षत्रियो भाति नादण्डो भूतिमश्नुते । नादण्डस्य प्रजा राज्ञः सुखमेधन्ति भारत ॥
data.md: A Kshatriya without the rod of chastisement never prosper. Without the rod of chastisement a Kshatriya can never enjoy the Earth. The subjects of a king who has no rod of chastisement can never enjoy happiness!

data.v: मित्रता सर्वभूतेषु दानमध्ययनं तपः । ब्राह्मणस्यैष धर्मः स्यान्न राज्ञो राजसत्तम ॥
data.md: Love for all creatures, charity, study of the Vedas, penances, are are the duties of a Brahniana and not of a king, O best of kings!

data.v: असतां प्रतिषेधश्च सतां च परिपालनम् । एष राज्ञां परो धर्मः समरे चापलायनम् ॥
data.md: Suppressing the wicked, maintaining the honest, and never retreating from battle are the highest duties of kings! can

data.v: यस्मिन्क्षमा च क्रोधश्च दानादाने भयाभये । निग्रहानुग्रहौ चोभौ स वै धर्मविदुच्यते ॥
data.md: He is the master of duties in whom reside forgiveness and anger, giving and taking, terror and fearlessness, and chastisement and reward!

data.v: न श्रुतेन न दानेन न सान्त्वेन न चेज्यया । त्वयेयं पृथिवी लब्धा नोत्कोचेन तथाप्युत ॥
data.md: It was not by study, or gift, or mendicancy, that you have acquired the Earth?

data.v: यत्तद्बलममित्राणां तथा वीरसमुद्यतम् । हस्त्यश्वरथसंपन्नं त्रिभिरङ्गैर्महत्तरम् ॥
रक्षितं द्रोणकर्णाभ्यामश्वत्थाम्ना कृपेण च । तत्त्वया निहतं वीर तस्माद्भुङ्क्ष्व वसुंधराम् ॥
data.md: That army of the enemy, O hero, ready to attack you with all its might, consisting of elephants and horses and cars, protected by Drona and Karna and Ashvatthaman and Kripa, has been defeated and killed by you, O hero. It is for this that I request you to enjoy the Earth.

data.v: जम्बूद्वीपो महाराज नानाजनपदायुतः । त्वया पुरुषशार्दूल दण्डेन मृदितः प्रभो ॥
data.md: (Formerly), O powerful one, you had, O king, governed with might, the region called Jaimbu, O foremost of men, abounding with populous districts!

data.v: जम्बूद्वीपेन सदृशः क्रौञ्चद्वीपो नराधिप । अपरेण महामेरोर्दण्डेन मृदितस्त्वया ॥
data.md: You had also, O king, governed with might, that other region called Kraunchadvipa situated on the west of the great Meru and equal to Jambudvipa itself!

data.v: क्रौञ्चद्वीपेन सदृशः शाकद्वीपो नराधिप । पूर्वेण तु महामेरोर्दण्डेन मृदितस्त्वया ॥
data.md: You had also, O king, governed with might, that other region called Kraunchadvipa situated on the west of the great Meru and equal to Jambudvipa itself!

data.v: उत्तरेण महामेरोः शाकद्वीपेन संमितः । भद्राश्वः पुरुषव्याघ्र दण्डेन मृदितस्त्वया ॥
data.md: The region called Bhadrashva, on the north of the great Meru and equal to Shakadvipa was also governed by you, O foremost of Men!

data.v: द्वीपाश्च सान्तरद्वीपा नानाजनपदालयाः । विगाह्य सागरं वीर दण्डेन मृदितास्त्वया ॥
data.md: You had even entered the ocean and governed with inight other regions, too, O hero, and the very islands encircled by the sea and containing many populous districts.

data.v: एतान्यप्रतिमानि त्वं कृत्वा कर्माणि भारत । न प्रीयसे महाराज पूज्यमानो द्विजातिभिः ॥
data.md: Having, O Bharata, made such wonderful conquests, and having obtained (through them) the worship of the Brahmanas, how is it that your mind is not satisfied.

data.v: स त्वं भ्रातॄनिमान्दृष्ट्वा प्रतिनन्दस्व भारत । ऋषभानिव संमत्तान्गजेन्द्रानूर्जितानिव ॥
data.md: Seeing these brothers of your before you, O Bharata,these heroes endued with might and resembling bulls or infuriate clephants-why do you not speak to them sweet words.

data.v: अमरप्रतिमाः सर्वे शत्रुसाहाः परंतपाः । एकोऽपि हि सुखायैषां क्षमः स्यादिति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: All of you are like celestials. All of you are capable of withstanding enemies. All of you are capable of scorching your enemies. If only one of you had become my husband. my happiness would even then have been very considerable.

data.v: किं पुनः पुरुषव्याघ्राः पतयो मे नरर्षभाः । समस्तानीन्द्रियाणीव शरीरस्य विचेष्टने ॥
data.md: What need I say then, O foremost of men, when all of you, five in number, are my husbands (and take care of me) like the five senses working up the body.

data.v: अनृतं माब्रवीच्छ्वश्रूः सर्वज्ञा सर्वदर्शिनी । युधिष्ठिरस्त्वां पाञ्चालि सुखे धास्यत्यनुत्तमे ॥
data.md: The words of my mother-in-law who is endued with great knowledge and foresight, cannot be untrue. She said,-O princess of Panchala, Yudhishthira will always keep you in happiness, O excellent lady.

data.v: हत्वा राजसहस्राणि बहून्याशुपराक्रमः । तद्व्यर्थं संप्रपश्यामि मोहात्तव जनाधिप ॥
data.md: Having killed many thousands of powerful kings, I see, O monarch, that through your folly you are about to make such an attachment futile.

data.v: येषामुन्मत्तको ज्येष्ठः सर्वे तस्योपचारिणः । तवोन्मादेन राजेन्द्र सोन्मादाः सर्वपाण्डवाः ॥
data.md: They whose eldest brother runs mad, have all to follow him like mad men. For your madness, O king, all the Pandavas, are about to become mad.

data.v: यदि हि स्युरनुन्मत्ता भ्रातरस्ते जनाधिप । बद्ध्वा त्वां नास्तिकैः सार्धं प्रशासेयुर्वसुंधराम् ॥
data.md: If, O King, these your brothers had been sane, they would then have locked you up with all unbelievers (in a prison) and taken charge of the government of the Earth. The man who for feeble intellect acts thus never succeeds in winning prosperity.

data.v: कुरुते मूढमेवं हि यः श्रेयो नाधिगच्छति । धूपैरञ्जनयोगैश्च नस्यकर्मभिरेव च । भेषजैः स चिकित्स्यः स्याद्य उन्मार्गेण गच्छति ॥
data.md: The man who behaves like a mad, man should be subjected to medical treatment by the aid of incense and collyrium, of drugs applied through the nose, and of other medicaments.

data.v: साहं सर्वाधमा लोके स्त्रीणां भरतसत्तम । तथा विनिकृतामित्रैर्याहमिच्छामि जीवितुम् ॥
data.md: O best of the Bharatas, I am the worst of all females, since I wish to live on even though I am deprived of my children.

data.v: एतेषां यतमानानामुत्पद्यन्ते तु संपदः । त्वं तु सर्वां महीं लब्ध्वा कुरुषे स्वयमापदम् ॥
data.md: You should not disregard the words spoken by me and by these brothers of yours who are trying thus to dissuade you. Indeed, abandoning the whole Earth, you are inviting adversity and danger to assail you.

data.v: यथास्तां संमतौ राज्ञां पृथिव्यां राजसत्तमौ । मान्धाता चाम्बरीषश्च तथा राजन्विराजसे ॥
data.md: You appear in splendour now, O monarch, even as those two foremost of kings, viz., Mandhatri and Ambarisha, respected by all the kings, did in former days.

data.v: प्रशाधि पृथिवीं देवीं प्रजा धर्मेण पालयन् । सपर्वतवनद्वीपां मा राजन्विमना भव ॥
data.md: Protecting your subjects righteously, rule over the goddess Earth with her mountains and forests and islands. Do not, O king, become disspirited.

data.v: यजस्व विविधैर्यज्ञैर्जुह्वन्नग्नीन्प्रयच्छ च । पुराणि भोगान्वासांसि द्विजातिभ्यो नृपोत्तम ॥
data.md: Worship the gods with various sacrifices. Fight your foes! Present wealth, clothes and other objects of enjoyment to the Brahmanas, O foremost of kings!

data.v: याज्ञसेन्या वचः श्रुत्वा पुनरेवार्जुनोऽब्रवीत् । अनुमान्य महाबाहुं ज्येष्ठं भ्रातरमीश्वरम् ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of Yajnasena's daughter, Arjuna once more spoke, showing every respect for his mighty-armed and ever illustrious eldest brother.

data.v: दण्डः शास्ति प्रजाः सर्वा दण्ड एवाभिरक्षति । दण्डः सुप्तेषु जागर्ति दण्डं धर्मं विदुर्बुधाः ॥
data.md: Arjuna said (A king with) the rod of chastisement sways all subjects and protects them. The rod of chastisement is awake when all else is under sleep. For this, the wise have designated the rod of chastisement as Righteousness itself.

data.v: धर्मं संरक्षते दण्डस्तथैवार्थं नराधिप । कामं संरक्षते दण्डस्त्रिवर्गो दण्ड उच्यते ॥
data.md: The rod of chastisement protects. Religion and Profit. It protects Pleasure also, O king! For this, the rod of chastisement is identified with the three-fold objects of life.

data.v: दण्डेन रक्ष्यते धान्यं धनं दण्डेन रक्ष्यते । एतद्विद्वन्नुपादत्स्व स्वभावं पश्य लौकिकम् ॥
data.md: Corn and riches are both protected by the rod of chastisement. Knowing this, O learned king, take up the rod of chastisement and follow the ways of the world!

data.v: राजदण्डभयादेके पापाः पापं न कुर्वते । यमदण्डभयादेके परलोकभयादपि ॥
data.md: One class of wicked men refrain from committing sins through fear of the rod of chastisement in the king's hands. Another section desist from similar acts out of fear of Yama's rod, and another from fear of the next world.

data.v: परस्परभयादेके पापाः पापं न कुर्वते । एवं सांसिद्धिके लोके सर्वं दण्डे प्रतिष्ठितम् ॥
data.md: Another class of persons refrain from committing sinful acts through fear of society. Thus, O king, in this world, everything depends on the rod of chastisement.

data.v: दण्डस्यैव भयादेके न खादन्ति परस्परम् । अन्धे तमसि मज्जेयुर्यदि दण्डो न पालयेत् ॥
data.md: There are persons who are checked by only the rod of chastisement from devouring one another. If the rod of chastisement did not protect people, they would have been immersed in the darkness of hell.

data.v: यस्माददान्तान्दमयत्यशिष्टान्दण्डयत्यपि । दमनाद्दण्डनाच्चैव तस्माद्दण्डं विदुर्बुधाः ॥
data.md: The rod of chastisement (Danda) has been so designated by the wise, because it governs the ungovernable and punishes the wicked.

data.v: वाचि दण्डो ब्राह्मणानां क्षत्रियाणां भुजार्पणम् । दानदण्डः स्मृतो वैश्यो निर्दण्डः शूद्र उच्यते ॥
data.md: The chastisement should be meted to the Brahmanas by words only; to the Kshatriyas, by giving them only that much of food as would suffice for the up-keep of life; to the Vaishyas, by the imposition of fines and forfeitures of property, while for the Sudras there is no punishment.

data.v: असंमोहाय मर्त्यानामर्थसंरक्षणाय च । मर्यादा स्थापिता लोके दण्डसंज्ञा विशां पते ॥
data.md: For compelling men to stick to their duties) and for the protection of property, punitive laws, O king, have been established in the world.

data.v: यत्र श्यामो लोहिताक्षो दण्डश्चरति सूनृतः । प्रजास्तत्र न मुह्यन्ति नेता चेत्साधु पश्यति ॥
data.md: The subjects never forget their duties, where Chastisement, of dark complexion and red eyes, stand ready (to grapple with every offender) and the king is of righteous vision.

data.v: ब्रह्मचारी गृहस्थश्च वानप्रस्थोऽथ भिक्षुकः । दण्डस्यैव भयादेते मनुष्या वर्त्मनि स्थिताः ॥
data.md: The Brahmacharin and the householder, the hermit and the religious mendicant, all follow their respective duties through fear of chastisement only.

data.v: नाभीतो यजते राजन्नाभीतो दातुमिच्छति । नाभीतः पुरुषः कश्चित्समये स्थातुमिच्छति ॥
data.md: He that is without any fear, O king, never celebrates a sacrifice. He that is without fear never gives away. The man that is without any fear never desires to satisfy and engagement or contract.

data.v: नाच्छित्त्वा परमर्माणि नाकृत्वा कर्म दारुणम् । नाहत्वा मत्स्यघातीव प्राप्नोति महतीं श्रियम् ॥
data.md: Without cutting the vital parts of others, without performing the most difficult deeds, and without killing creatures like a fisherman (slaying fish), no person can acquire great prosperity.

data.v: नाघ्नतः कीर्तिरस्तीह न वित्तं न पुनः प्रजाः । इन्द्रो वृत्रवधेनैव महेन्द्रः समपद्यत ॥
data.md: Without slaughter no man has been able to acquire fame in this world or wealth or subjects. Indra himself, by killing Vritra, became the great Indra.

data.v: य एव देवा हन्तारस्ताँल्लोकोऽर्चयते भृशम् । हन्ता रुद्रस्तथा स्कन्दः शक्रोऽग्निर्वरुणो यमः ॥
data.md: Those amongst the gods that are giving to killing others are worshipped much more by inen. Rudra, Skanda, Shakra, Agni, Varuna, are all destroyers.

data.v: हन्ता कालस्तथा वायुर्मृत्युर्वैश्रवणो रविः । वसवो मरुतः साध्या विश्वेदेवाश्च भारत ॥
data.md: Kala and Mrityu and Vayu and Kubera and Surya, the Vasus, the Maruts, the Saddhyas and the Vishvedevas, O Bharata, are all destroyers.

data.v: एतान्देवान्नमस्यन्ति प्रतापप्रणता जनाः । न ब्रह्माणं न धातारं न पूषाणं कथंचन ॥
data.md: Humiliated by their power, all people bow to these gods, but not to Brahmana or Dhatri or Pushan at any time.

data.v: मध्यस्थान्सर्वभूतेषु दान्ताञ्शमपरायणान् । यजन्ते मानवाः केचित्प्रशान्ताः सर्वकर्मसु ॥
data.md: Only a few noble-ininded men worship in all their acts those among the gods who treat all creatures equally and who are self-restrained and peaceful.

data.v: न हि पश्यामि जीवन्तं लोके कंचिदहिंसया । सत्त्वैः सत्त्वानि जीवन्ति दुर्बलैर्बलवत्तराः ॥
data.md: I do not see any such creature in this world that supports life without doing any act of injury to others. Animals live upon animals, the stronger upon the weaker.

data.v: नकुलो मूषकानत्ति बिडालो नकुलं तथा । बिडालमत्ति श्वा राजञ्श्वानं व्यालमृगस्तथा ॥
data.md: The mungoose eats up mice; the cat eats up inungoose; the dog eats up the cat; the dog again is devoured by the spotted leopard.

data.v: तानत्ति पुरुषः सर्वान्पश्य धर्मो यथागतः । प्राणस्यान्नमिदं सर्वं जङ्गमं स्थावरं च यत् ॥
data.md: Behold, all things again are eaten up by the Destroyer when he comes! This mobile and immobile universe is food for living creatures.

data.v: विधानं देवविहितं तत्र विद्वान्न मुह्यति । यथा सृष्टोऽसि राजेन्द्र तथा भवितुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: This has been ordained by the celestials. The learned man, therefore, is never stupefied at it. You should, O great king, become what you are by birth!

data.v: विनीतक्रोधहर्षा हि मन्दा वनमुपाश्रिताः । विना वधं न कुर्वन्ति तापसाः प्राणयापनम् ॥
data.md: Only the foolish (Kshatriyas) controlling anger and joy, dwell in the woods. The very ascetics cannot maintain their lives without killing creatures.

data.v: उदके बहवः प्राणाः पृथिव्यां च फलेषु च । न च कश्चिन्न तान्हन्ति किमन्यत्प्राणयापनात् ॥
data.md: Innumerable creature live in water, on earth and in fruits. It is not true that one does not kill them. What greater duty is there than supporting one's life?

data.v: सूक्ष्मयोनीनि भूतानि तर्कगम्यानि कानिचित् । पक्ष्मणोऽपि निपातेन येषां स्यात्स्कन्धपर्ययः ॥
data.md: There are many creatures that are so ininute that their existence is not perceptible. The falling of the eyelids even kills them.

data.v: ग्रामान्निष्क्रम्य मुनयो विगतक्रोधमत्सराः । वने कुटुम्बधर्माणो दृश्यन्ते परिमोहिताः ॥
data.md: There are men who controlling anger and pride love like ascetics and abandoning villages and towns repair to the forests. Coming there, those men become so stupefied that they live like householder again.

data.v: भूमिं भित्त्वौषधीश्छित्त्वा वृक्षादीनण्डजान्पशून् । मनुष्यास्तन्वते यज्ञांस्ते स्वर्गं प्राप्नुवन्ति च ॥
data.md: Others living like householders and tilling the soil, uprooting herbs, cutting off trees and killing birds and animals celebrate sacrifices and at last attain to heaven.

data.v: दण्डनीत्यां प्रणीतायां सर्वे सिध्यन्त्युपक्रमाः । कौन्तेय सर्वभूतानां तत्र मे नास्ति संशयः ॥
data.md: O son of Kunti, I am sure that the acts of all creatures become successful only when the policy of chastisement is properly applied.

data.v: दण्डश्चेन्न भवेल्लोके व्यनशिष्यन्निमाः प्रजाः । शूले मत्स्यानिवापक्ष्यन्दुर्बलान्बलवत्तराः ॥
data.md: If chastisement were done away with in this word, creatures would soon be destroyed. Like fishes in the water, stronger animals devour the weaker.

data.v: सत्यं चेदं ब्रह्मणा पूर्वमुक्तं; दण्डः प्रजा रक्षति साधु नीतः । पश्याग्नयश्च प्रतिशाम्यन्त्यभीताः; संतर्जिता दण्डभयाज्ज्वलन्ति ॥
data.md: Formerly Brahman himself, said that chastisement, properly applied, maintains creatures. Behold, the very fires, when put out, blaze up again, in fright, when blown! This is owing to the fear of force.

data.v: अन्धं तम इवेदं स्यान्न प्रज्ञायेत किंचन । दण्डश्चेन्न भवेल्लोके विभजन्साध्वसाधुनी ॥
data.md: If there were no chastisement in the world differentiating the good from the evil, the whole world would have been covered with sheer darkness and all things would have been unsettled.

data.v: येऽपि संभिन्नमर्यादा नास्तिका वेदनिन्दकाः । तेऽपि भोगाय कल्पन्ते दण्डेनोपनिपीडिताः ॥
data.md: By chastisement the violators of laws, the atheists and scoffers of the Vedas, soon become disposed to observe rules and regulations.

data.v: सर्वो दण्डजितो लोको दुर्लभो हि शुचिर्नरः । दण्डस्य हि भयाद्भीतो भोगायेह प्रकल्पते ॥
data.md: Every one in this world is kept all right by chastisement. A person by nature pure and pious is rare. In fear of chastisement, man becomes disposed to observe rules and restrictions.

data.v: चातुर्वर्ण्याप्रमोहाय सुनीतनयनाय च । दण्डो विधात्रा विहितो धर्मार्थावभिरक्षितुम् ॥
data.md: Chastisement was introduced by the Creator himself for protecting Religion and Profit, for the happiness of all the four orders, and for making thein pious and humble.

data.v: यदि दण्डान्न बिभ्येयुर्वयांसि श्वापदानि च । अद्युः पशून्मनुष्यांश्च यज्ञार्थानि हवींषि च ॥
data.md: If there had been no fear of chastisement, then ravens and beasts of prey would have devoured all other animals and men and the clarified butter intended for sacrifices.

data.v: न ब्रह्मचार्यधीयीत कल्याणी गौर्न दुह्यते । न कन्योद्वहनं गच्छेद्यदि दण्डो न पालयेत् ॥
data.md: If chastisement did not keep up and protect (the world), then no body would have read the Vedas, nobody would have milked a milch cow, and no maiden would have married.

data.v: विश्वलोपः प्रवर्तेत भिद्येरन्सर्वसेतवः । ममत्वं न प्रजानीयुर्यदि दण्डो न पालयेत् ॥
data.md: If chastisement did not uphold and protect, then destruction and confusion would have prevailed everywhere and all restrictions would have disappeared, and the idea of property would have gone away.

data.v: न संवत्सरसत्राणि तिष्ठेयुरकुतोभयाः । विधिवद्दक्षिणावन्ति यदि दण्डो न पालयेत् ॥
data.md: If chastisement did not uphold and protect, people could never duly celebrate annual sacrifices with profuse presents.

data.v: चरेयुर्नाश्रमे धर्मं यथोक्तं विधिमाश्रिताः । न विद्यां प्राप्नुयात्कश्चिद्यदि दण्डो न पालयेत् ॥
data.md: If chastisement did not uphold and protect, no one would observe the duties of his own order as sanctioned (in the scriptures), and no one would have succeeded in gaining knowledge.

data.v: न चोष्ट्रा न बलीवर्दा नाश्वाश्वतरगर्दभाः । युक्ता वहेयुर्यानानि यदि दण्डो न पालयेत् ॥
data.md: If chastisement did not reign supreme, neither, nor asses, would, even if yoked thereto, would carry cars and carriages.

data.v: न प्रेष्या वचनं कुर्युर्न बालो जातु कर्हिचित् । तिष्ठेत्पितृमते धर्मे यदि दण्डो न पालयेत् ॥
दण्डे स्थिताः प्रजाः सर्वा भयं दण्डं विदुर्बुधाः । दण्डे स्वर्गो मनुष्याणां लोकोऽयं च प्रतिष्ठितः ॥
data.md: All creatures depend upon chastisement. The learned, therefore, declare that chastisement is the root of all things. Upon chastisement rests the heaven that people seek, and upon il rests this world also.

data.v: न तत्र कूटं पापं वा वञ्चना वापि दृश्यते । यत्र दण्डः सुविहितश्चरत्यरिविनाशनः ॥
data.md: No sin, no falsehood, and no wickedness, is to be seen there where foe-destroying chastisement is properly used.

data.v: हविः श्वा प्रपिबेद्धृष्टो दण्डश्चेन्नोद्यतो भवेत् । हरेत्काकः पुरोडाशं यदि दण्डो न पालयेत् ॥
data.md: If the rod of chastisement be not taken up, the dog will lick the sacrificial butter. If that rod were not raised up, the crow also would take away the first (sacrificial) offering.

data.v: यदिदं धर्मतो राज्यं विहितं यद्यधर्मतः । कार्यस्तत्र न शोको वै भुङ्क्ष्व भोगान्यजस्व च ॥
data.md: Fairly or unfairly, this kingdom has not been gained by us. Our duty now is to give up grief. Do you, therefore, enjoy it and celebrate sacrifices!

data.md: Living with their dear wives the lucky men, cat good food, wear good clothes, and cheerfully acquire virtue by fruits and gifts.

data.md: Forsooth, all our acts, depend on wealth : that wealth again depends on chastisement. Mark, therefore, the utility of chastisement!

data.md: Duties have been laid down for maintaining the various relations of the world. There are two things here, viz., abstention from injury and injury done with righteous motives, Of these two, that which brings in righteousness is preferable.

data.md: There is no act that is entirely pure, nor any that is entirely simple. In all acts, right or wrong, something of both prevails.

data.md: Animals are castrated, and their horns are cut off. They are then compelled to carry weights are tethered, and beaten.

data.v: एवं पर्याकुले लोके विपथे जर्जरीकृते । तैस्तैर्न्यायैर्महाराज पुराणं धर्ममाचर ॥
data.md: In this world that is unsubstantial full of abuses and painful, O king, do you practise the old customs of men, following rules and examples quoted above.

data.v: यज देहि प्रजा रक्ष धर्मं समनुपालय । अमित्राञ्जहि कौन्तेय मित्राणि परिपालय ॥
data.md: Celebrate sacrifices, distribute alms, protect your subjects, and practise righteousness. Kill your enemies, O son of Kunti, and protect your friends.

data.v: मा च ते निघ्नतः शत्रून्मन्युर्भवतु भारत । न तत्र किल्बिषं किंचित्कर्तुर्भवति भारत ॥
data.md: Be not dispirited. O king, while killing enemies! He that does it, О Bharata, does not commit the slightest sin!

data.v: आततायी हि यो हन्यादाततायिनमागतम् । न तेन भ्रूणहा स स्यान्मन्युस्तं मन्युमृच्छति ॥
data.md: He who takes up a weapon and kills an arined enemy advancing against him, does not incur the sin of killing a man, for it is the anger of the advancing enemy that excites the anger of the destroyer.

data.v: अवध्यः सर्वभूतानामन्तरात्मा न संशयः । अवध्ये चात्मनि कथं वध्यो भवति केनचित् ॥
data.md: The soul of every creature cannot be killed. When the soul cannot be killed how then can one be killed by another?

data.v: यथा हि पुरुषः शालां पुनः संप्रविशेन्नवाम् । एवं जीवः शरीराणि तानि तानि प्रपद्यते ॥
data.md: As a person enters a new house, so does a creature put on successive bodies.

data.md: Leaving behind decrepit bodies, a creature acquires new forms. People gifted with true insight consider this change as death.

data.v: अर्जुनस्य वचः श्रुत्वा भीमसेनोऽत्यमर्षणः । धैर्यमास्थाय तेजस्वी ज्येष्ठं भ्रातरमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said After Arjuna had done the highly wrathful and energetic Bhimasena, collecting all his patience, said these words to his eldest brother:राजन् विदितधर्मोऽसि न तेऽस्त्यविदितं क्वचित्।

data.v: राजन्विदितधर्मोऽसि न तेऽस्त्यविदितं भुवि । उपशिक्षाम ते वृत्तं सदैव न च शक्नुमः ॥
data.md: 'You are, O king, conversant with all duties. There is nothing unknown to you. We always wish to imitate your conduct, but, alas, we cannot do it.

data.v: न वक्ष्यामि न वक्ष्यामीत्येवं मे मनसि स्थितम् । अतिदुःखात्तु वक्ष्यामि तन्निबोध जनाधिप ॥
data.md: I had wished not to say anything. Excited, however, by great grief I am compelled to say something. Listen to these words of mine, O king.

data.md: Everything has been imperilled by the bewilderment of your faculties, and ourselves are being made disspirited and weak.

data.md: How is it that you who are the king of the world, you who are the master of all branches of knowledge, allow your understanding to be clouded, with depression like a coward?

data.v: आगतिश्च गतिश्चैव लोकस्य विदिता तव । आयत्यां च तदात्वे च न तेऽस्त्यविदितं प्रभो ॥
data.md: The fair and unfair paths of the world are known to you. Everything belonging either to the future or the present is known to you, O powerfiil one.

data.v: एवं गते महाराज राज्यं प्रति जनाधिप । हेतुमत्र प्रवक्ष्यामि तदिहैकमनाः शृणु ॥
data.md: When such in the case, O king, I will point out, O king, the reasons in favour of your assuming sovereignty. Listen to me with rapt attention.

data.v: द्विविधो जायते व्याधिः शारीरो मानसस्तथा । परस्परं तयोर्जन्म निर्द्वंद्वं नोपलभ्यते ॥
data.md: There are two sorts of diseases, viz., physical and mental. Each originates from the other. None of them exists independently.

data.v: शारीराज्जायते व्याधिर्मानसो नात्र संशयः । मानसाज्जायते व्याधिः शारीर इति निश्चयः ॥
data.md: Forsooth, mental diseases originate form physical ones. Likewise physical diseases originate from mental ones. This is the truth.

data.v: शारीरमानसे दुःखे योऽतीते अनुशोचति । दुःखेन लभते दुःखं द्वावनर्थौ प्रपद्यते ॥
data.md: Dead or lost, the person who grieves for what has already taken place, and suffers great grief. By grieving one increases it twofold.

data.v: शीतोष्णे चैव वायुश्च त्रयः शारीरजा गुणाः । तेषां गुणानां साम्यं च तदाहुः स्वस्थलक्षणम् ॥
data.md: Cold, heat, and winds,-are the three essentials of the body. Their harmonious existence indicates good heath.

data.v: तेषामन्यतमोत्सेके विधानमुपदिष्यते । उष्णेन बाध्यते शीतं शीतेनोष्णं प्रबाध्यते ॥
data.md: In case of one of the three prevailing over the rest, remedies have been prescribed. Cold is checked by heat, and heat is checked by cold.

data.v: सत्त्वं रजस्तमश्चैव मानसाः स्युस्त्रयो गुणाः । हर्षेण बाध्यते शोको हर्षः शोकेन बाध्यते ॥
कश्चित्सुखे वर्तमानो दुःखस्य स्मर्तुमिच्छति । कश्चिद्दुःखे वर्तमानः सुखस्य स्मर्तुमिच्छति ॥
स त्वं न दुःखी दुःखस्य न सुखी च सुखस्य च । न दुःखी सुखजातस्य न सुखी दुःखजस्य वा ॥
