data.md: But he who imitates those men by leaving off palatial edifices and beds and vehicles and dresses and ornaments, acts improperly, indeed.

data.v: योऽत्यन्तं प्रतिगृह्णीयाद्यश्च दद्यात्सदैव हि । तयोस्त्वमन्तरं विद्धि श्रेयांस्ताभ्यां क उच्यते ॥
data.md: One always accepts gifts from others, while another always makes gifts. You know the difference between the two, Who, indeed, of these two should be considered superior?

data.v: सदैव याचमानेषु सत्सु दम्भविवर्जिषु । एतेषु दक्षिणा दत्ता दावाग्नाविव दुर्हुतम् ॥
data.md: If a gift is made to one who always accepts gifts, or to one who is proud, that gift, becomes useless like the clarified butter that is poured upon a forest-fire.

data.v: जातवेदा यथा राजन्नादग्ध्वैवोपशाम्यति । सदैव याचमानो वै तथा शाम्यति न द्विजः ॥
data.md: As a fire, o king, never dies till it has consumed all that has been thrown into it, even so a beggar is silenced till he receives something.

data.v: सतां च वेदा अन्नं च लोकेऽस्मिन्प्रकृतिर्ध्रुवा । न चेद्दाता भवेद्दाता कुतः स्युर्मोक्षकाङ्क्षिणः ॥
data.md: In this world, the food given by a charitable person, is the support of the pious. If, therefore, the king does not give (food), where will the pious go to, who aspire for salvation.

data.v: अन्नाद्गृहस्था लोकेऽस्मिन्भिक्षवस्तत एव च । अन्नात्प्राणः प्रभवति अन्नदः प्राणदो भवेत् ॥
data.md: They that have food (in their houses) are householders. Mendicants are supported by them. Life is kept up by food. Therefore, the giver of food is the giver of life.

data.v: गृहस्थेभ्योऽभिनिर्वृत्ता गृहस्थानेव संश्रिताः । प्रभवं च प्रतिष्ठां च दान्ता निन्दन्त आसते ॥
data.md: Coming out from among those who live as householders, mendicants depend upon those very persons from whom they come. By doing this, those self-controlled men acquire and enjoy fame and power.

data.v: त्यागान्न भिक्षुकं विद्यान्न मौण्ड्यान्न च याचनात् । ऋजुस्तु योऽर्थं त्यजति तं सुखं विद्धि भिक्षुकम् ॥
data.md: One cannot be called a mendicant for his having only renounced his worldly possessions, or for his having only led a life of dependence on charity. He who forsakes sincerely the possessions and pleasures of the world to be regarded a true mendicant.

data.v: असक्तः सक्तवद्गच्छन्निःसङ्गो मुक्तबन्धनः । समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च स वै मुक्तो महीपते ॥
data.md: Unattachment at heart though showing attachment outwardly, standing aloof from the world, having broken all his fetters, regarding friend and foe in the same light, such a man, O king, is regarded to be liberated.

data.v: परिव्रजन्ति दानार्थं मुण्डाः काषायवाससः । सिता बहुविधैः पाशैः संचिन्वन्तो वृथामिषम् ॥
data.md: Having shaved their heads clean and put on the brown robe, people rove like mendicants, though fettered by various ties and though always seeking useless wealth.

data.v: त्रयीं च नाम वार्तां च त्यक्त्वा पुत्रांस्त्यजन्ति ये । त्रिविष्टब्धं च वासश्च प्रतिगृह्णन्त्यबुद्धयः ॥
data.md: They who, casting off the three Vedas, their usual avocations and children, live like mendicants by taking up the triple-headed rod and the brown robe, are really persons of weak understanding.

data.v: अनिष्कषाये काषायमीहार्थमिति विद्धि तत् । धर्मध्वजानां मुण्डानां वृत्त्यर्थमिति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: Without having cast off anger and other passions, wearing only the brown robe, O king, is due to the desire of earning the means of livelihood. Those persons of clean-shaved heads who hold up the banner of virtue, have the acquisition of sustenance for their only object in life.

data.v: काषायैरजिनैश्चीरैर्नग्नान्मुण्डाञ्जटाधरान् । बिभ्रत्साधून्महाराज जय लोकाञ्जितेन्द्रियः ॥
data.md: Therefore, O king, controlling your passions do you secure blissful regions for yourself hereafter by maintaining them that are truly pious amongst those having matted locks or clean-shaved heads, naked or clad in rags, or skins or brown clothes.

data.v: अग्न्याधेयानि गुर्वर्थान्क्रतून्सपशुदक्षिणान् । ददात्यहरहः पूर्वं को नु धर्मतरस्ततः ॥
data.md: Who is there that is more virtuous then he who maintains his sacred fire, who celebrates sacrifices with presents of animals and money, and who administers charity day and night?

data.v: तत्त्वज्ञो जनको राजा लोकेऽस्मिन्निति गीयते । सोऽप्यासीन्मोहसंपन्नो मा मोहवशमन्वगाः ॥
data.md: Arjuna said King Janaka was known as a truth-knowing person in the world. Even he, was bewildered in the ascertainment of duty. Do not yield to stupefaction.

data.v: एवं धर्ममनुक्रान्तं सदा दानपरैर्नरैः । आनृशंस्यगुणोपेतैः कामक्रोधविवर्जिताः ॥
पालयन्तः प्रजाश्चैव दानमुत्तममास्थिताः । इष्टाँल्लोकानवाप्स्यामो ब्रह्मण्याः सत्यवादिनः ॥
वेदाहं तात शास्त्राणि अपराणि पराणि च । उभयं वेदवचनं कुरु कर्म त्यजेति च ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said I know both the Vedas and the scriptures that lead to the attainment of Brahma. In the Vedas there are both kinds of precepts, viz., those that preach action and those that preach the renouncement of action,

data.v: आकुलानि च शास्त्राणि हेतुभिश्चित्रितानि च । निश्चयश्चैव यन्मात्रो वेदाहं तं यथाविधि ॥
data.md: The scriptures are conflicting and their conclusions are based upon reasons. The truth of the mantras is duly known to me.

data.v: त्वं तु केवलमस्त्रज्ञो वीरव्रतमनुष्ठितः । शास्त्रार्थं तत्त्वतो गन्तुं न समर्थः कथंचन ॥
data.md: You are conversant only with weapons and the practices of heroes. You are unable to understand correctly the meaning of the scriptures.

data.v: शास्त्रार्थसूक्ष्मदर्शी यो धर्मनिश्चयकोविदः । तेनाप्येवं न वाच्योऽहं यदि धर्मं प्रपश्यसि ॥
data.md: If you were really acquainted with duty, then you could have understood that words like these ought not to have been addressed to me by one possessing the true knowledge of the scriptures and acquainted with the truths of religion.

data.v: भ्रातृसौहृदमास्थाय यदुक्तं वचनं त्वया । न्याय्यं युक्तं च कौन्तेय प्रीतोऽहं तेन तेऽर्जुन ॥
data.md: What, however, you have said to me out of fraternal affection, has been fit and proper, O son of Kunti. I am, therefore, gratified with thee, O Arjuna.

data.v: युद्धधर्मेषु सर्वेषु क्रियाणां नैपुणेषु च । न त्वया सदृशः कश्चित्त्रिषु लोकेषु विद्यते ॥
data.md: There is no one equal to you in the three worlds in all duties connected with battle and in skill in various kinds of acts,

data.v: धर्मसूक्ष्मं तु यद्वाक्यं तत्र दुष्प्रतरं त्वया । धनंजय न मे बुद्धिमभिशङ्कितुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: You are, therefore, competent to speak of the niceties of those subjects, that are not understood by others. You should not, however, O Dhananjaya, doubt my intelligence.

data.v: युद्धशास्त्रविदेव त्वं न वृद्धाः सेवितास्त्वया । समासविस्तरविदां न तेषां वेत्सि निश्चयम् ॥
data.md: You are, a master of the science of battle, but you have never waited upon the aged. You know not the conclusions arrived at by those that have studied the subject briefly and fully. The conclusion of intelligent men who want salvation, is that of ascetic penances, renunciation, and knowledge of Brahma, the second is superior to the first, and the third is superior to the second.

data.v: तपस्त्यागो विधिरिति निश्चयस्तात धीमताम् । परं परं ज्याय एषां सैषा नैःश्रेयसी गतिः ॥
न त्वेतन्मन्यसे पार्थ न ज्यायोऽस्ति धनादिति । अत्र ते वर्तयिष्यामि यथा नैतत्प्रधानतः ॥
data.md: Your conclusion, that there is nothing superior to wealth, is a mistake. I will convince you of it, so that you may not again regard wealth in that light.

data.v: तपःस्वाध्यायशीला हि दृश्यन्ते धार्मिका जनाः । ऋषयस्तपसा युक्ता येषां लोकाः सनातनाः ॥
data.md: All righteous men are seen to be devoted to ascetic penances and the study of the Vedas, The Rishis also, that have many eternal regions for them, enjoy the merit of penances.

data.v: अजातश्मश्रवो धीरास्तथान्ये वनवासिनः । अनन्ता अधना एव स्वाध्यायेन दिवं गताः ॥
data.md: Others possessed equanimity of soul, having no enemies, and dwelling in the forest have, through penances and study of the Vedas, proceeded to heaven.

data.v: उत्तरेण तु पन्थानमार्या विषयनिग्रहात् । अबुद्धिजं तमस्त्यक्त्वा लोकांस्त्यागवतां गताः ॥
data.md: By controlling desire for worldly objects and casting off the darkness of sin, pious men proceed northward to the regions reserved for those who practise Renunciation.

data.v: दक्षिणेन तु पन्थानं यं भास्वन्तं प्रपश्यसि । एते क्रियावतां लोका ये श्मशानानि भेजिरे ॥
data.md: The path that lies to the south and leads to regions of light is reserved for men devoted to action. These are acquired by persons subject to birth and death.

data.v: अनिर्देश्या गतिः सा तु यां प्रपश्यन्ति मोक्षिणः । तस्मात्त्यागः प्रधानेष्टः स तु दुःखः प्रवेदितुम् ॥
data.md: That end, however, which persons who wishing to have salvation cannot be described. Yoga is the best means for attaining to it. It is not easy to explain it.

data.v: अनुसृत्य तु शास्त्राणि कवयः समवस्थिताः । अपीह स्यादपीह स्यात्सारासारदिदृक्षया ॥
data.md: Those that are learned live, meditating on the scriptures for finding out what is unreal. They, however, jump at this and that in the belief that the object of their search exists in this and that.

data.v: वेदवादानतिक्रम्य शास्त्राण्यारण्यकानि च । विपाट्य कदलीस्कन्धं सारं ददृशिरे न ते ॥
data.md: Having studied, however, the Vedas the Aranyakas, and the other scriptures, they miss the real like men failing to find solid timber in an uprooted Banana plant.

data.v: अथैकान्तव्युदासेन शरीरे पञ्चभौतिके । इच्छाद्वेषसमायुक्तमात्मानं प्राहुरिङ्गितैः ॥
data.md: There are some who, disbelieving in its oneness, consider the Soul, dwelling in the physical body consisting of the five elements, possessing the attributes of desire and hatred.

data.v: अग्राह्यश्चक्षुषा सोऽपि अनिर्देश्यं च तद्गिरा । कर्महेतुपुरस्कारं भूतेषु परिवर्तते ॥
data.md: Unseen by the eye, highly subtile, and indescribable by words, it goes on in a round (of rebirths) among the creatures of the Earth, keeping before it that which is the root of action.

data.v: कल्याणगोचरं कृत्वा मनस्तृष्णां निगृह्य च । कर्मसंततिमुत्सृज्य स्यान्निरालम्बनः सुखी ॥
data.md: Having made the Soul gradually come towards itself which is the root of all bliss, having controlled all mental desires, and having cast off all kinds of action, one may become perfectly independent and happy.

data.v: अस्मिन्नेवं सूक्ष्मगम्ये मार्गे सद्भिर्निषेविते । कथमर्थमनर्थाढ्यमर्जुन त्वं प्रशंससि ॥
data.md: When there is such a path that is followed by the righteous and that is attainable by Knowledge, why, O Arjuna, do you speak highly of wealth which is full of all sorts of dangers?

data.v: पूर्वशास्त्रविदो ह्येवं जनाः पश्यन्ति भारत । क्रियासु निरता नित्यं दाने यज्ञे च कर्मणि ॥
data.md: Men of olden times who were conversant with the scriptures, O Bharata,-men who were always engaged in gifts and sacrifices and action, held this view, O Bharata.

data.v: भवन्ति सुदुरावर्ता हेतुमन्तोऽपि पण्डिताः । दृढपूर्वश्रुता मूढा नैतदस्तीति वादिनः ॥
data.md: There are some fools who, accomplished in the science of logic, deny the existence of the Soul, for the strength of their convictions of a pristine life. It is very difficult to make them accept this truth about final liberation.

data.v: अमृतस्यावमन्तारो वक्तारो जनसंसदि । चरन्ति वसुधां कृत्स्नां वावदूका बहुश्रुताः ॥
data.md: Those wicked men, though highly learned, travel all over the Earth, delivering lectures in assemblies, and deprecating the true doctrine about liberation.

data.v: यान्वयं नाभिजानीमः कस्ताञ्ज्ञातुमिहार्हति । एवं प्राज्ञान्सतश्चापि महतः शास्त्रवित्तमान् ॥
data.md: O Partha, who else can understand what we do not understand? Similarly they do not succeed in knowing those wise and pious persons who are truly great and who are wellread in the scriptures.

data.v: तपसा महदाप्नोति बुद्ध्या वै विन्दते महत् । त्यागेन सुखमाप्नोति सदा कौन्तेय धर्मवित् ॥
data.md: O son of Kunti, men acquainted with truth attain to Brahma by asceticism and intelligence, and great happiness by Renunciation.

data.v: तस्मिन्वाक्यान्तरे वक्ता देवस्थानो महातपाः । अभिनीततरं वाक्यमित्युवाच युधिष्ठिरम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said After Yudhishthira had stopped, the great and eloquent ascetic Devasthana, said these words pregnant with reason to the king.

data.v: यद्वचः फल्गुनेनोक्तं न ज्यायोऽस्ति धनादिति । अत्र ते वर्तयिष्यामि तदेकाग्रमनाः शृणु ॥
data.md: Your conclusion, that there is nothing superior to wealth, is a mistake. I will convince you of it, so that you may not again regard wealth in that light.

data.v: अजातशत्रो धर्मेण कृत्स्ना ते वसुधा जिता । तां जित्वा न वृथा राजंस्त्वं परित्यक्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: O you, having no enemy you have righteously conquered the Earth. Having won her, you should not, () king, abandon her without cause.

data.v: चतुष्पदी हि निःश्रेणी कर्मण्येषा प्रतिष्ठिता । तां क्रमेण महाबाहो यथावज्जय पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Four modes of life and laid down in the Vedas. Do you, O king, duly pass through them one after another.

data.v: तस्मात्पार्थ महायज्ञैर्यजस्व बहुदक्षिणैः । स्वाध्याययज्ञा ऋषयो ज्ञानयज्ञास्तथापरे ॥
data.md: At present you should, therefore, celebrate great sacrifices with profuse presents. Amongst the very Rishis, some celebrate the sacrifice represented by Vedic study, and some that represented by knowledge.

data.v: कर्मनिष्ठांस्तु बुध्येथास्तपोनिष्ठांश्च भारत । वैखानसानां राजेन्द्र वचनं श्रूयते यथा ॥
ईहते धनहेतोर्यस्तस्यानीहा गरीयसी । भूयान्दोषः प्रवर्धेत यस्तं धनमपाश्रयेत् ॥
data.md: One may desire wealth. The abandonment, however, of such desire is better for himn. There are many shortcomings attached to wealth and, therefore, to those religious acts that are performed with wealth.

data.v: कृच्छ्राच्च द्रव्यसंहारं कुर्वन्ति धनकारणात् । धनेन तृषितोऽबुद्ध्या भ्रूणहत्यां न बुध्यते ॥
data.md: Men collect together various articles (for the celebration of sacrifices) according to the Vedic prescription. He who, impelled by his own foolish understanding, gives away wealth to an undeserving person without giving it to the deserving, does not know that he incurs the sin of killing a foetus.

data.v: अनर्हते यद्ददाति न ददाति यदर्हते । अनर्हार्हापरिज्ञानाद्दानधर्मोऽपि दुष्करः ॥
data.md: Being unable to the discriminate between the deserving and the undeserving, men give to the undeserving and refrain from giving to the deserving. For this reason the administration of charity is difficult.

data.v: यज्ञाय सृष्टानि धनानि धात्रा; यष्टादिष्टः पुरुषो रक्षिता च । तस्मात्सर्वं यज्ञ एवोपयोज्यं; धनं ततोऽनन्तर एव कामः ॥
data.md: The Supreme Creator created wealth for Sacrifice, and He created man also for taking care of that wealth and for celebrating Sacrifice. For this reason, the entire wealth of a man should be devoted to the celebration of a sacrifice. This would beget pleasure as a matter of course.

data.v: यज्ञैरिन्द्रो विविधैरन्नवद्भि;र्देवान्सर्वानभ्ययान्महौजाः । तेनेन्द्रत्वं प्राप्य विभ्राजतेऽसौ; तस्माद्यज्ञे सर्वमेवोपयोज्यम् ॥
data.md: By the performance of various sacrifices with profuse gifts of valuables, the highly energetic Indra excelled all the gods. Having thus become their king, he shines in heaven. Therefore, everything should be given to Sacrifices.

data.v: महादेवः सर्वमेधे महात्मा; हुत्वात्मानं देवदेवो विभूतः । विश्वाँल्लोकान्व्याप्य विष्टभ्य कीर्त्या; विरोचते द्युतिमान्कृत्तिवासाः ॥
data.md: Clad in deer-skin the great Mahadeva, having poured his own self as a libation in the sacrifice called Sarva, become the first of gods, and excelling all creatures in the universe and reigning Supreme over them thereby, shines in resplendence.

data.v: आविक्षितः पार्थिवो वै मरुत्तः; स्वृद्ध्या मर्त्यो योऽजयद्देवराजम् । यज्ञे यस्य श्रीः स्वयं संनिविष्टा; यस्मिन्भाण्डं काञ्चनं सर्वमासीत् ॥
data.md: King Marutta, the son of a Avikshit by the profusion of his wealth, defeated Shakra ! himself, the king of the gods. In great sacrifice he performed, all the vessels were made of gold, and the Goddess of Prosperity herself came in person.

data.v: हरिश्चन्द्रः पार्थिवेन्द्रः श्रुतस्ते; यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा पुण्यकृद्वीतशोकः । ऋद्ध्या शक्रं योऽजयन्मानुषः सं;स्तस्माद्यज्ञे सर्वमेवोपयोज्यम् ॥
data.md: You have heard that the great king Harishchandra, having celebrated sacrifices, earned great merit and great happiness. Though a man, he nevertheless defeated Shakra by wealth. For this reason everything should be given to Sacrifice.

data.v: अत्रैवोदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । इन्द्रेण समये पृष्टो यदुवाच बृहस्पतिः ॥
data.md: Regarding this subject is cited an old history, viz., the discourse that Brihaspati, asked by Indra, delivered to him.

data.v: संतोषो वै स्वर्गतमः संतोषः परमं सुखम् । तुष्टेर्न किंचित्परतः सुसम्यक्परितिष्ठति ॥
data.md: Brihaspati said 'Contentment is the highest heaven, and the greatest bliss. There is nothing superior to Contentment. Contentment heads all.

data.v: यदा संहरते कामान्कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वशः । तदात्मज्योतिरात्मैव स्वात्मनैव प्रसीदति ॥
data.md: When one contracts all his desires like a tortoise drawing in all his limbs, then the native cffulgence of his soul soon manifests itself.

data.v: न बिभेति यदा चायं यदा चास्मान्न बिभ्यति । कामद्वेषौ च जयति तदात्मानं प्रपश्यति ॥
data.md: When one does not fear any creature, nor any creature is frightened at one, when one contracts onc's desire and hatred, then is one said to see one's soul.

data.v: यदासौ सर्वभूतानां न क्रुध्यति न दुष्यति । कर्मणा मनसा वाचा ब्रह्म संपद्यते तदा ॥
data.md: When one, seeks to injure nobody in deed, word, and thought, and cherishes no desire, he is said to attain to Brahma.

data.v: एवं कौन्तेय भूतानि तं तं धर्मं तथा तथा । तदा तदा प्रपश्यन्ति तस्माद्बुध्यस्व भारत ॥
data.md: Thus, O son of Kunti, creatures reap fruits according to the religion they follow-Awaken yourself by this thought, O Bharata.

data.v: अन्ये शमं प्रशंसन्ति व्यायाममपरे तथा । नैकं न चापरं केचिदुभयं च तथापरे ॥
यज्ञमेके प्रशंसन्ति संन्यासमपरे जनाः । दानमेके प्रशंसन्ति केचिदेव प्रतिग्रहम् । केचित्सर्वं परित्यज्य तूष्णीं ध्यायन्त आसते ॥
राज्यमेके प्रशंसन्ति सर्वेषां परिपालनम् । हत्वा भित्त्वा च छित्त्वा च केचिदेकान्तशीलिनः ॥
एतत्सर्वं समालोक्य बुधानामेष निश्चयः । अद्रोहेणैव भूतानां यो धर्मः स सतां मतः ॥
अद्रोहः सत्यवचनं संविभागो धृतिः क्षमा । प्रजनः स्वेषु दारेषु मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् ॥
धनं धर्मप्रधानेष्टं मनुः स्वायंभुवोऽब्रवीत् । तस्मादेवं प्रयत्नेन कौन्तेय परिपालय ॥
यो हि राज्ये स्थितः शश्वद्वशी तुल्यप्रियाप्रियः । क्षत्रियो यज्ञशिष्टाशी राजशास्त्रार्थतत्त्ववित् ॥
असाधुनिग्रहरतः साधूनां प्रग्रहे रतः । धर्मे वर्त्मनि संस्थाप्य प्रजा वर्तेत धर्मवित् ॥
पुत्रसंक्रामितश्रीस्तु वने वन्येन वर्तयन् । विधिना श्रामणेनैव कुर्यात्कालमतन्द्रितः ॥
य एवं वर्तते राजा राजधर्मविनिश्चितः । तस्यायं च परश्चैव लोकः स्यात्सफलो नृप । निर्वाणं तु सुदुष्पारं बहुविघ्नं च मे मतम् ॥
एवं धर्ममनुक्रान्ताः सत्यदानतपःपराः । आनृशंस्यगुणैर्युक्ताः कामक्रोधविवर्जिताः ॥
data.md: They who follow such duties and practise charity and ascetic penances, penances, who are compassionate and are freed from desire and anger, who are engaged in ruling their subjects with righteousness and fighting for the sake of kine and Brahmanas, attain hereafter to a high end.

data.v: प्रजानां पालने युक्ता दममुत्तममास्थिताः । गोब्राह्मणार्थं युद्धेन संप्राप्ता गतिमुत्तमाम् ॥
data.md: They who follow such duties and practise charity and ascetic penances, penances, who are compassionate and are freed from desire and anger, who are engaged in ruling their subjects with righteousness and fighting for the sake of kine and Brahmanas, attain hereafter to a high end.

data.v: एवं रुद्राः सवसवस्तथादित्याः परंतप । साध्या राजर्षिसंघाश्च धर्ममेतं समाश्रिताः । अप्रमत्तास्ततः स्वर्गं प्राप्ताः पुण्यैः स्वकर्मभिः ॥
data.md: For this the Rudras, with the Vasus and the Adityas, O destroyer of foes, and the Sadhyas and innumerable other kings adopt this religion. practising carefully the duties laid down by that religion, they attain to heaven through those acts of theirs.

data.v: तस्मिन्वाक्यान्तरे वाक्यं पुनरेवार्जुनोऽब्रवीत् । विषण्णमनसं ज्येष्ठमिदं भ्रातरमीश्वरम् ॥
data.md: After this, Arjuna again said to his eldest brother of unfading glory, king Yudhishthira of cheerless heart :

data.v: क्षत्रधर्मेण धर्मज्ञ प्राप्य राज्यमनुत्तमम् । जित्वा चारीन्नरश्रेष्ठ तप्यते किं भवान्भृशम् ॥
data.md: 'O you who are conversant with every kind of duty, having by the practise of Kshatriya duties acquired sovereignty that is so very difficult of acquisition, and having defeated all your foes, why do you grieve.

data.v: क्षत्रियाणां महाराज संग्रामे निधनं स्मृतम् । विशिष्टं बहुभिर्यज्ञैः क्षत्रधर्ममनुस्मर ॥
data.md: O king, as regards Kshatriyas, death in battle is regarded more meritorious for them than the celebration of various sacrifices. it is so laid down in the ordinance that describes the duties of Kshatriyas.

data.v: ब्राह्मणानां तपस्त्यागः प्रेत्यधर्मविधिः स्मृतः । क्षत्रियाणां च विहितं संग्रामे निधनं विभो ॥
data.md: Penances and Renunciation constitute the duties of Brahmanas. Such is also the ordinance about the next world, Indeed, O powerful one, death in battle is laid down for Kshatriyas.

data.v: क्षत्रधर्मो महारौद्रः शस्त्रनित्य इति स्मृतः । वधश्च भरतश्रेष्ठ काले शस्त्रेण संयुगे ॥
data.md: The duties of Kshatriyas are highly dreadful and are always connected with the use of weapons, and it has been ordained, O chief of the Bharatas, that they should, when the time comes, die by weapons on the field of battle.

data.v: ब्राह्मणस्यापि चेद्राजन्क्षत्रधर्मेण तिष्ठतः । प्रशस्तं जीवितं लोके क्षत्रं हि ब्रह्मसंस्थितम् ॥
data.md: The life of even a Brahmana, O king, who follows the observances of a Kshatriya, is not blameable, for Kshatriyas also have originated from Brahman.

data.v: न त्यागो न पुनर्याच्ञा न तपो मनुजेश्वर । क्षत्रियस्य विधीयन्ते न परस्वोपजीवनम् ॥
data.md: Neither Renunciation, nor Sacrifice, nor Penances, nor dependence on the wealth of others, O king, has been laid down for Kshatriyas.

data.v: स भवान्सर्वधर्मज्ञः सर्वात्मा भरतर्षभ । राजा मनीषी निपुणो लोके दृष्टपरावरः ॥
त्यक्त्वा संतापजं शोकं दंशितो भव कर्मणि । क्षत्रियस्य विशेषेण हृदयं वज्रसंहतम् ॥
data.md: You know full well all duties, and you are of righteous soul, O foremost of Bharata's race. You are a wise king, of skilful deeds, You can discriminate what is right in this world from what is wrong. Shaking off this cheerlessness begotten by repentance engage in action vigorously. The heart of a Kshatriya is hard as adamant.

data.v: जित्वारीन्क्षत्रधर्मेण प्राप्य राज्यमकण्टकम् । विजितात्मा मनुष्येन्द्र यज्ञदानपरो भव ॥
data.md: Having by the performance of Kshatriya duties defeated your foes and acquired empire without a throne in its side, control your soul, O king, and be engaged in the performance of sacrifices and the practice of charity.

data.v: इन्द्रो वै ब्रह्मणः पुत्रः कर्मणा क्षत्रियोऽभवत् । ज्ञातीनां पापवृत्तीनां जघान नवतीर्नव ॥
data.md: Indra himself, though a Brahmana, become a Kshatriya in his deeds, and fought with his sinful kinsmen for eight hundred and ten times.

data.v: तच्चास्य कर्म पूज्यं हि प्रशस्यं च विशां पते । तेन चेन्द्रत्वमापेदे देवानामिति नः श्रुतम् ॥
data.md: Those acts of his, o king, deserve every commendation. Through them, as we have heard, he became the king of the gods.

data.v: स त्वं यज्ञैर्महाराज यजस्व बहुदक्षिणैः । यथैवेन्द्रो मनुष्येन्द्र चिराय विगतज्वरः ॥
data.md: Do you, therefore, O monarch, celebrate sacrifices with profuse presents even as Indra did, Cking, and thereby free yourself from your fever.

data.v: मा त्वमेवंगते किंचित्क्षत्रियर्षभ शोचिथाः । गतास्ते क्षत्रधर्मेण शस्त्रपूताः परां गतिम् ॥
data.md: Do not, O foremost of Kshatriyas grieve th... for what is gone. They that have been killed have attained to the highest end, purified by weapons and agreeably to the ordinances of the Kshatriyas religion.

data.v: भवितव्यं तथा तच्च यद्वृत्तं भरतर्षभ । दिष्टं हि राजशार्दूल न शक्यमतिवर्तितुम् ॥
data.md: That which has taken place was ordained to take place. Destiny, O foremost of kings, is incapable of being resisted.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु कौन्तेयो गुडाकेशेन भारत । नोवाच किंचित्कौरव्यस्ततो द्वैपायनोऽब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Thus addressed by Arjuna of curly hair, the Kuru king, son of Kunti, remained silent. Then Dvaipayana (Vyasa) said.

data.v: बीभत्सोर्वचनं सम्यक्सत्यमेतद्युधिष्ठिर । शास्त्रदृष्टः परो धर्मः स्मृतो गार्हस्थ्य आश्रमः ॥
data.md: Vyasa said The words of Arjuna, O amiable Yudhishthira, are true. The highest religion as sanctioned by the scriptures, consists in the duties of a householder.

data.v: स्वधर्मं चर धर्मज्ञ यथाशास्त्रं यथाविधि । न हि गार्हस्थ्यमुत्सृज्य तवारण्यं विधीयते ॥
data.md: You are acquainted with all duties. Do you then duly practise the duties prescribed for you (viz., the duties of a householder.) A life of retirement in the forest forgetting the duties of a householder, has not been laid down for you.

data.v: गृहस्थं हि सदा देवाः पितर ऋषयस्तथा । भृत्याश्चैवोपजीवन्ति तान्भजस्व महीपते ॥
data.md: The gods, Pitris, guests, and servants all depend (for their maintenance) upon householder. Do you then support all these, O king.

data.v: वयांसि पशवश्चैव भूतानि च महीपते । गृहस्थैरेव धार्यन्ते तस्माज्ज्येष्ठाश्रमो गृही ॥
data.md: Birds and animals and various other creatures, O king, supported by a are householders. He, therefore, who belongs to that mode of life, is superior to all.

data.v: सोऽयं चतुर्णामेतेषामाश्रमाणां दुराचरः । तं चराविमनाः पार्थ दुश्चरं दुर्बलेन्द्रियैः ॥
data.md: The life of a householder is the inost difficult of all the four modes of life. Do you practise that mode of life then, O Partha, which is difficult of being practised by persons of uncontrolled senses.

data.v: वेदज्ञानं च ते कृत्स्नं तपश्च चरितं महत् । पितृपैतामहे राज्ये धुरमुद्वोढुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: You have mastered all the Vedas. You have earned great ascetic merit. You should, therefore, bear like an ox the burden of your ancestral kingdom.

data.v: तपो यज्ञस्तथा विद्या भैक्षमिन्द्रियनिग्रहः । ध्यानमेकान्तशीलत्वं तुष्टिर्दानं च शक्तितः ॥
data.md: Penances, sacrifices, forgiveness, learning, mendicancy, restraint of senses, contemplation, living in solitude, contentment, and knowledge (of Brahma), should, O king, be practised by Brahmanas to the best of their ability for the attainment of success.

data.v: ब्राह्मणानां महाराज चेष्टाः संसिद्धिकारिकाः । क्षत्रियाणां च वक्ष्यामि तवापि विदितं पुनः ॥
यज्ञो विद्या समुत्थानमसंतोषः श्रियं प्रति । दण्डधारणमत्युग्रं प्रजानां परिपालनम् ॥
वेदज्ञानं तथा कृत्स्नं तपः सुचरितं तथा । द्रविणोपार्जनं भूरि पात्रेषु प्रतिपादनम् ॥
एतानि राज्ञां कर्माणि सुकृतानि विशां पते । इमं लोकममुं लोकं साधयन्तीति नः श्रुतम् ॥
तेषां ज्यायस्तु कौन्तेय दण्डधारणमुच्यते । बलं हि क्षत्रिये नित्यं बले दण्डः समाहितः ॥
data.md: Of them, O son of Kunti, wielding the rod of chastisement has been declared to be the foremost. A Kshatriya must always have strength, and upon strength depends chastisement.

data.v: एताश्चेष्टाः क्षत्रियाणां राजन्संसिद्धिकारिकाः । अपि गाथामिमां चापि बृहस्पतिरभाषत ॥
data.md: Those I have mentioned are, O king, the principle duties for Kshatriyas and lead greatly to their success. Brihaspati, in this matter, sang this verse :

data.v: भूमिरेतौ निगिरति सर्पो बिलशयानिव । राजानं चाविरोद्धारं ब्राह्मणं चाप्रवासिनम् ॥
data.md: Like a snake devouring a mouse, the Earth devours a king who is inclined to peace and a Brahmana who is greatly addicted to a life of domesticity!

data.v: सुद्युम्नश्चापि राजर्षिः श्रूयते दण्डधारणात् । प्राप्तवान्परमां सिद्धिं दक्षः प्राचेतसो यथा ॥
data.md: It is heard again that the royal sage Sudyumna, only by wielding the rod of chastisement, gained the highest success, like Daksha himself, the son of Prachetas.

data.v: भगवन्कर्मणा केन सुद्युम्नो वसुधाधिपः । संसिद्धिं परमां प्राप्तः श्रोतुमिच्छामि तं नृपम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O holy sage, by what acts did king Sudyumna gain the highest success? (I wish to hear the king.)

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । शङ्खश्च लिखितश्चास्तां भ्रातरौ संयतव्रतौ ॥
data.md: Vyasa said 'In this matter is also cited this old history. There were two brothers, viz., Shankha and Likhita of rigid vows.

data.v: तयोरावसथावास्तां रमणीयौ पृथक्पृथक् । नित्यपुष्पफलैर्वृक्षैरुपेतौ बाहुदामनु ॥
data.md: The two brothers had two separate beautiful houses. Situate by the bank of the river called Vahuda, both of those houses were decorated with trees always bearing flowers and fruits.

data.v: ततः कदाचिल्लिखितः शङ्खस्याश्रममागमत् । यदृच्छयापि शङ्खोऽथ निष्क्रान्तोऽभवदाश्रमात् ॥
data.md: Once on a time Likhita come to the house of his brother Shankha. At that time, however, Shankha had left his asylum with no fixed purpose.

data.v: सोऽभिगम्याश्रमं भ्रातुः शङ्खस्य लिखितस्तदा । फलानि शातयामास सम्यक्परिणतान्युत ॥
data.md: Arrived at the asylum of his brother, Shankha, Likhita plucked many ripe fruits.

data.v: तान्युपादाय विस्रब्धो भक्षयामास स द्विजः । तस्मिंश्च भक्षयत्येव शङ्खोऽप्याश्रममागमत् ॥
data.md: Getting them the Rishi Likhita began to eat them without feeling any pinch of conscience. While thus eating Shankha returned to his hermitage.

data.v: भक्षयन्तं तु तं दृष्ट्वा शङ्खो भ्रातरमब्रवीत् । कुतः फलान्यवाप्तानि हेतुना केन खादसि ॥
data.md: Seeing him eating, Shankha addressed his brother, saying,-Whence have these fruits been got and for why are you eating them?

data.v: सोऽब्रवीद्भ्रातरं ज्येष्ठमुपस्पृश्याभिवाद्य च । इत एव गृहीतानि मयेति प्रहसन्निव ॥
data.md: Approaching his elder brother and saluting him, Likhita smilingly replied, saying,—I have taken them even from this hermitage.

data.v: तमब्रवीत्तदा शङ्खस्तीव्रकोपसमन्वितः । स्तेयं त्वया कृतमिदं फलान्याददता स्वयम् । गच्छ राजानमासाद्य स्वकर्म प्रथयस्व वै ॥
data.md: Filled with great anger, Shankha said to him,—You have committed theft by taking yourself these fruits.

data.v: अदत्तादानमेवेदं कृतं पार्थिवसत्तम । स्तेनं मां त्वं विदित्वा च स्वधर्ममनुपालय । शीघ्रं धारय चौरस्य मम दण्डं नराधिप ॥
data.md: Knowing me for a thief and following your duty of order, do you punish me O king, like a thief.

data.v: इत्युक्तस्तस्य वचनात्सुद्युम्नं वसुधाधिपम् । अभ्यगच्छन्महाबाहो लिखितः संशितव्रतः ॥
data.md: Thus commanded by his brother, the highly blessed Likhita of rigid vows proceeded to king Sudyumna.

data.v: सुद्युम्नस्त्वन्तपालेभ्यः श्रुत्वा लिखितमागतम् । अभ्यगच्छत्सहामात्यः पद्भ्यामेव नरेश्वरः ॥
data.md: Hearing from his gate-keepers that Likhita had come, king Sudyumna, with his counsellors, went out (for receiving him.)

data.v: तमब्रवीत्समागत्य स राजा ब्रह्मवित्तमम् । किमागमनमाचक्ष्व भगवन्कृतमेव तत् ॥
एवमुक्तः स विप्रर्षिः सुद्युम्नमिदमब्रवीत् । प्रतिश्रौषि करिष्येति श्रुत्वा तत्कर्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Meeting with him, the king addressed that best of all persons conversant with duties, saying,-Tell me, O reverend sir, why you have Know it is already accomplished.-Thus accosted, that Rishi said to Sudyumna,-Do you promise first that you will do it. You should then, after hearing me, fulfil that promise.

data.v: अनिसृष्टानि गुरुणा फलानि पुरुषर्षभ । भक्षितानि मया राजंस्तत्र मां शाधि माचिरम् ॥
प्रमाणं चेन्मतो राजा भवतो दण्डधारणे । अनुज्ञायामपि तथा हेतुः स्याद्ब्राह्मणर्षभ ॥
data.md: O foremost of men, I ate some fruits that had not given me by my elder brother. Do you, o king, punish me for it forthwith, Sudyumna answered,-If the king be considered to wield the rod of chastisement, he come. should be regarded, O foremost of Brahmanas, as equally competent to pardon.

data.v: स भवानभ्यनुज्ञातः शुचिकर्मा महाव्रतः । ब्रूहि कामानतोऽन्यांस्त्वं करिष्यामि हि ते वचः ॥
data.md: Purged in sin, you of high vows, consider yourself as pardoned. Tell me now what else do you wish. I shall certainly accomplish those your commands.'

data.v: छन्द्यमानोऽपि ब्रह्मर्षिः पार्थिवेन महात्मना । नान्यं वै वरयामास तस्माद्दण्डादृते वरम् ॥
data.md: “Thus honoured by the great king, the Rishi Likhita, however, did not ask for any other favour.

data.v: ततः स पृथिवीपालो लिखितस्य महात्मनः । करौ प्रच्छेदयामास धृतदण्डो जगाम सः ॥
data.md: Then that king caused the two hands of the high-souled Likhita to be cut off, whereupon the latter, bearing the punishment, went away.

data.v: स गत्वा भ्रातरं शङ्खमार्तरूपोऽब्रवीदिदम् । धृतदण्डस्य दुर्भुद्धेर्भगवन्क्षन्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Returning to his brother Shankha, Likhita, in great agony said,-'You should now pardon this wretched man who has been duly punished (for what he did)'.

data.v: न कुप्ये तव धर्मज्ञ न च दूषयसे मम । धर्मस्तु ते व्यतिक्रान्तस्ततस्ते निष्कृतिः कृता ॥
data.md: Shankha said "I am not angry with you nor have you injured me, O foremost of all persons conversant with duties. Your virtue, however, had deteriorated. I have saved you from that plight.

data.v: स गत्वा बाहुदां शीघ्रं तर्पयस्व यथाविधि । देवान्पितॄनृषींश्चैव मा चाधर्मे मनः कृथाः ॥
data.md: Proceed forthwith to the river Vahuda and please duly, with oblations of water, the gods, Rishis, and the Pitris, and never again think of sin.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा शङ्खस्य लिखितस्तदा । अवगाह्यापगां पुण्यामुदकार्थं प्रचक्रमे ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of Shankha, Likhita performed his ablutions in the sacred river and began to perform the water-rite.

data.v: प्रादुरास्तां ततस्तस्य करौ जलजसंनिभौ । ततः स विस्मितो भ्रातुर्दर्शयामास तौ करौ ॥
data.md: Thereat, two hands, like two lotuses, appeared at the extremities of his stumps. Stricken with wonder he returned to his brother and showed him the two hands.

data.v: ततस्तमब्रवीच्छङ्खस्तपसेदं कृतं मया । मा च तेऽत्र विशङ्का भूद्दैवमेव विधीयते ॥
data.md: Shankha said All this has been done by me through my penances! Do not be surprised at it. Providence is the instrument here.

data.v: किं नु नाहं त्वया पूतः पूर्वमेव महाद्युते । यस्य ते तपसो वीर्यमीदृशं द्विजसत्तम ॥
data.md: Likhita answered: O you of great splendour, why did you not purify me at first, when, O best of Rishis, such was the power of your penances?

data.v: एवमेतन्मया कार्यं नाहं दण्डधरस्तव । स च पूतो नरपतिस्त्वं चापि पितृभिः सह ॥
data.md: Shankha said I should not have acted otherwise. I am not your punisher. The king has been himself purified as also yourself, along with the Pitris.

data.v: स राजा पाण्डवश्रेष्ठ श्रेष्ठो वै तेन कर्मणा । प्राप्तवान्परमां सिद्धिं दक्षः प्राचेतसो यथा ॥
data.md: It is heard again that the royal sage Sudyumna, only by wielding the rod of chastisement, gained the highest success, like Daksha himself, the son of Prachetas.

data.v: एष धर्मः क्षत्रियाणां प्रजानां परिपालनम् । उत्पथेऽस्मिन्महाराज मा च शोके मनः कृथाः ॥
data.md: Such is the duty of Kshatriyas, viz., the ruling of subjects. Any other, O king, would be considered as a wrong path for them. Do not grieve.

data.v: भ्रातुरस्य हितं वाक्यं शृणु धर्मज्ञसत्तम । दण्ड एव हि राजेन्द्र क्षत्रधर्मो न मुण्डनम् ॥
data.md: O best of all persons conversant with duty, listen to the wholesome words of this your brother. Holding the rod of chastisement, O king, is the duty of kings and not the shaving of the head. more

data.v: पुनरेव महर्षिस्तं कृष्णद्वैपायनोऽब्रवीत् । अजातशत्रुं कौन्तेयमिदं वचनमर्थवत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Once the great sage KrishnaDvaipayana said these words to the son of Kunti, who had no enemies.

data.v: अरण्ये वसतां तात भ्रातॄणां ते तपस्विनाम् । मनोरथा महाराज ये तत्रासन्युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Let these great car-warriors, possessing sufficient mental strength, O king, let these your brothers, O Yudhishthira the chief of the Bharatas, satisfying those wishes of theirs which they entertained while living in the woods. Rule you the Earth, O son of Pritha, like (another) Yayati the son of Nahusha.

data.v: तानिमे भरतश्रेष्ठ प्राप्नुवन्तु महारथाः । प्रशाधि पृथिवीं पार्थ ययातिरिव नाहुषः ॥
data.md: Let these great car-warriors, possessing sufficient mental strength, O king, let these your brothers, O Yudhishthira the chief of the Bharatas, satisfying those wishes of theirs which they entertained while living in the woods. Rule you the Earth, O son of Pritha, like (another) Yayati the son of Nahusha.

data.v: अरण्ये दुःखवसतिरनुभूता तपस्विभिः । दुःखस्यान्ते नरव्याघ्राः सुखं त्वनुभवन्त्विमे ॥
data.md: Before this you suffered misery while living in the woods in the observance of ascetic penances. That misery has ended, O foremost of men. Enjoy happiness, therefore, for some time.

data.v: धर्ममर्थं च कामं च भ्रातृभिः सह भारत । अनुभूय ततः पश्चात्प्रस्थातासि विशां पते ॥
data.md: Having, O Bharata, acquired and enjoyed religious merit and wealth and pleasure for some time with your brothers, you may then, O king, retire into the forest.

data.v: अतिथीनां च पितॄणां देवतानां च भारत । आनृण्यं गच्छ कौन्तेय ततः स्वर्गं गमिष्यसि ॥
data.md: Be freed first, О Bharata, from the debt you owe to persons who may beg of you to the Pitris, and to the gods. You may then, O son of Kunti, follow all the other modes of life.

data.v: सर्वमेधाश्वमेधाभ्यां यजस्व कुरुनन्दन । ततः पश्चान्महाराज गमिष्यसि परां गतिम् ॥
data.md: Do you, O son of Kuru's race, celebrate the sacrifices of Sarvamedha and Ashvainedha. You will then attain, O king, to the highest end hereafter.

data.v: भ्रातॄंश्च सर्वान्क्रतुभिः संयोज्य बहुदक्षिणैः । संप्राप्तः कीर्तिमतुलां पाण्डवेय भविष्यसि ॥
data.md: Making your brothers also perform great sacrifices with profuse presents, you will, O son of Pandu, acquire great fame.

data.v: विद्म ते पुरुषव्याघ्र वचनं कुरुनन्दन । शृणु मच्च यथा कुर्वन्धर्मान्न च्यवते नृपः ॥
data.md: There is a saying, O foremost of men and best of the Kurus! Listen to it, for by acting according to it, O king, you will not deviate from the path of virtue.

data.v: आददानस्य च धनं निग्रहं च युधिष्ठिर । समानं धर्मकुशलाः स्थापयन्ति नरेश्वर ॥
data.md: Those men only O Yudhishthira, who behave like robbers, advise a king to undertake wars and acquire victory.

data.v: देशकालप्रतीक्षे यो दस्योर्दर्शयते नृपः । शास्त्रजां बुद्धिमास्थाय नैनसा स हि युज्यते ॥
data.md: That king who, knowing proper place and time and following the injunctions of the scriptures, pardons even a nuinber of robbers, incurs no sin.

data.v: आदाय बलिषड्भागं यो राष्ट्रं नाभिरक्षति । प्रतिगृह्णाति तत्पापं चतुर्थांशेन पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: That king, who, realising his tribute of a sixth, does not protect his kingdom, shares a fourth part of the sins of his kingdom.

data.v: निबोध च यथातिष्ठन्धर्मान्न च्यवते नृपः । निग्रहाद्धर्मशास्त्राणामनुरुध्यन्नपेतभीः । कामक्रोधावनादृत्य पितेव समदर्शनः ॥
data.md: Listen also to that by which a king may not deviate from the path of virtue. By disregarding the scriptures one incurs sin, while by obeying them one may live fearlessly.

data.v: दैवेनोपहते राजा कर्मकाले महाद्युते । प्रमादयति तत्कर्म न तत्राहुरतिक्रमम् ॥
data.md: O you of great splendour, if a king, possessed by destiny, fails to accomplish an act in proper time, such failure would not be called a trespass.

data.v: तरसा बुद्धिपूर्वं वा निग्राह्या एव शत्रवः । पापैः सह न संदध्याद्राष्ट्रं पण्यं न कारयेत् ॥
data.md: By power and policy should the king subjugate his foes. He must not allow sin to be committed in his kingdom, but should cause virtue to be practised.

data.v: शूराश्चार्याश्च सत्कार्या विद्वांसश्च युधिष्ठिर । गोमतो धनिनश्चैव परिपाल्या विशेषतः ॥
data.md: Brave men, the respectable, the virtuous, the learned, O Yudhishthira, Brahmanas conversant with Vedic texts and rites, and men of wcalth, should especially be protected.

data.v: व्यवहारेषु धर्म्येषु नियोज्याश्च बहुश्रुताः । गुणयुक्तेऽपि नैकस्मिन्विश्वस्याच्च विचक्षणः ॥
data.md: In trying cases and performing religious acts, they who are possessed of great learning should alone be employed. A prudent king should never place his confidence in one individual however accomplished.

data.v: अरक्षिता दुर्विनीतो मानी स्तब्धोऽभ्यसूयकः । एनसा युज्यते राजा दुर्दान्त इति चोच्यते ॥
data.md: That king who does not protect his subjects, whose passions are not under-control, who is full of vanity, who is haughty and malicious, incurs sin and becomes notorious as a tyrant.

data.v: येऽरक्ष्यमाणा हीयन्ते दैवेनोपहते नृपे । तस्करैश्चापि हन्यन्ते सर्वं तद्राजकिल्बिषम् ॥
data.md: If the subjects of a king, O monarch, die from want of protection and are afflicted by the gods and oppressed by robbers, the sin of all this affects the king himself.

data.v: सुमन्त्रिते सुनीते च विधिवच्चोपपादिते । पौरुषे कर्मणि कृते नास्त्यधर्मो युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: There is no sin, O Yudhishthira, in doing an act with full heart, after mature consideration and consultation with men capable of giving good advice.

data.v: विपद्यन्ते समारम्भाः सिध्यन्त्यपि च दैवतः । कृते पुरुषकारे तु नैनः स्पृशति पार्थिवम् ॥
data.md: Our works fail or succeed through destiny. If activity, however, be applied, sin would not affect the king.

data.v: अत्र ते राजशार्दूल वर्तयिष्ये कथामिमाम् । यद्वृत्तं पूर्वराजर्षेर्हयग्रीवस्य पार्थिव ॥
data.md: I shall recite to you, O foremost of kings, the story of what happened to an ancient king of the name of Hayagriva, O son of Pandu,the story of the heroic Hayagriva of unsullied deeds, who after having killed a host of enemies in battle, was himself defeated and killed while without a follower by his side.

data.v: शत्रून्हत्वा हतस्याजौ शूरस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः । असहायस्य धीरस्य निर्जितस्य युधिष्ठिर ॥
यत्कर्म वै निग्रहे शात्रवाणां; योगश्चाग्र्यः पालने मानवानाम् । कृत्वा कर्म प्राप्य कीर्तिं सुयुद्धे; वाजिग्रीवो मोदते देवलोके ॥
data.md: Having done all for restraining his foes and adopted all those foremost of means by which men may be protected, Hayagriva won great fame from the battles he fought and is now enjoying great bliss in heaven.

data.v: संत्यक्तात्मा समरेष्वाततायी; शस्त्रैश्छिन्नो दस्युभिरर्द्यमानः । अश्वग्रीवः कर्मशीलो महात्मा; संसिद्धात्मा मोदते देवलोके ॥
data.md: Wounded by robbers with weapons, bravely fighting with them, and giving up his life in battle, the great Hayagriva, ever devoted to his royal duties, achieved the object of his life and is now enjoying great bliss in heaven.

data.v: धनुर्यूपो रशना ज्या शरः स्रु;क्स्रुवः खड्गो रुधिरं यत्र चाज्यम् । रथो वेदी कामगो युद्धमग्नि;श्चातुर्होत्रं चतुरो वाजिमुख्याः ॥
data.md: The bow was his (sacrificial) stake and the bow-string was the cord for trying the animals. Arrows were the smaller ladle and the sword the larger one, and blood formed the clarified butter that he poured. The car constituted the altar and the anger he left in battle was the fire, and the four best of horses yoked to his vehicle were the four Hotris.

data.v: हुत्वा तस्मिन्यज्ञवह्नावथारी;न्पापान्मुक्तो राजसिंहस्तरस्वी । प्राणान्हुत्वा चावभृथे रणे स; वाजिग्रीवो मोदते देवलोके ॥
data.md: Having poured upon that sacrificial fire his enemies as libations and then his own life at the termination of the sacrifice, that foremost of kings, Hayagriva, became freed from sin and is now playing in the regions of the celestials.

data.v: राष्ट्रं रक्षन्बुद्धिपूर्वं नयेन; संत्यक्तात्मा यज्ञशीलो महात्मा । सर्वाँल्लोकान्व्याप्य कीर्त्या मनस्वी; वाजिग्रीवो मोदते देवलोके ॥
data.md: Having protected his kingdom with policy and intelligence, the great and self-controlled Hayagriva of great strength of mind and given to the performance of sacrifices filled all the worlds with his glory and is now sporting in the region of the celestials.

data.v: दैवीं सिद्धिं मानुषीं दण्डनीतिं; योगन्यायैः पालयित्वा महीं च । तस्माद्राजा धर्मशीलो महात्मा; हयग्रीवो मोदते स्वर्गलोके ॥
data.md: Having acquired the merit of celebrating sacrifices as also every kind of merit of human worlds, he held the rod of chastisement and ruled the Earth with vigour and without pride. For this the virtuous and great Hayagriva is sporting in the region of the celestials.

data.v: विद्वांस्त्यागी श्रद्दधानः कृतज्ञ;स्त्यक्त्वा लोकं मानुषं कर्म कृत्वा । मेधाविनां विदुषां संमतानां; तनुत्यजां लोकमाक्रम्य राजा ॥
data.md: Learned men practising renunciation, cherishing faith, and grateful, that king, having performed various acts, left this world of men and attained the regions that are reserved for the intelligent and the wise and those who are of approved conduct and behaviour and prepared to kill themselves in battle.

data.v: सम्यग्वेदान्प्राप्य शास्त्राण्यधीत्य; सम्यग्राष्ट्रं पालयित्वा महात्मा । चातुर्वर्ण्यं स्थापयित्वा स्वधर्मे; वाजिग्रीवो मोदते देवलोके ॥
data.md: Having studied all the Vedas and the other scriptures duly, having protected the kingdom duly, and having made all the four orders follow their respective duties, a king become purified and finally sports in heaven.

data.v: जित्वा संग्रामान्पालयित्वा प्रजाश्च; सोमं पीत्वा तर्पयित्वा द्विजाग्र्यान् । युक्त्या दण्डं धारयित्वा प्रजानां; युद्धे क्षीणो मोदते देवलोके ॥
data.md: By gaining battles, protecting his kingdom, drinking the Soma juice, making his subjects prosper, holding judiciously the rod of chastisement, and renouncing his body at last in fight, a king enjoy happiness in heaven.

data.v: वृत्तं यस्य श्लाघनीयं मनुष्याः; सन्तो विद्वांसश्चार्हयन्त्यर्हणीयाः । स्वर्गं जित्वा वीरलोकांश्च गत्वा; सिद्धिं प्राप्तः पुण्यकीर्तिर्महात्मा ॥
data.md: His life was worthy of every complement. Learned and honest, men speak high of it, for it deserves every praise. Having acquired heaven and won the regions reserved for heroes, that great king of virtuous deeds became drowned with success.

data.v: द्वैपायनवचः श्रुत्वा कुपिते च धनंजये । व्यासमामन्त्र्य कौन्तेयः प्रत्युवाच युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: Hearing the words of Dvaipayana Vyasa and seeing Dhananjaya angry, Yudhishthira the son of Kunti saluted Vyasa and said.

data.v: न पार्थिवमिदं राज्यं न च भोगाः पृथग्विधाः । प्रीणयन्ति मनो मेऽद्य शोको मां नर्दयत्ययम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said This earthly sovereignty and the various objects of enjoyments cannot give me any joy. On the other hand, this painful grief is cutting me to the quick.

data.v: श्रुत्वा च वीरहीनानामपुत्राणां च योषिताम् । परिदेवयमानानां शान्तिं नोपलभे मुने ॥
data.md: Hearing the lamentations of these women who have lost their heroic husbands and children, I cannot enjoy peace, O sage.

data.v: इत्युक्तः प्रत्युवाचेदं व्यासो योगविदां वरः । युधिष्ठिरं महाप्राज्ञं धर्मज्ञो वेदपारगः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Thus addressed, the virtuous Vyasa, the best of all persons conversant with Yoga, endued with great wisdom and a master of the Vedas, said to Yudhishthira.

data.v: न कर्मणा लभ्यते चिन्तया वा; नाप्यस्य दाता पुरुषस्य कश्चित् । पर्याययोगाद्विहितं विधात्रा; कालेन सर्वं लभते मनुष्यः ॥
data.md: Vyasa said, No one can acquire anything by his own deeds or by sacrifices and adoration. No man can give anything to another. Man gets everything through Time. The Great Ordainer has made the course of Time the instrument of acquisition.

data.v: न बुद्धिशास्त्राध्ययनेन शक्यं; प्राप्तुं विशेषैर्मनुजैरकाले । मूर्खोऽपि प्राप्नोति कदाचिदर्था;न्कालो हि कार्यं प्रति निर्विशेषः ॥
data.md: By mere intelligence of study of the scriptures, men, if Time be not propitious, cannot acquire any earthly object. Sometimes an ignorant fool may acquire wealth. Time is the the powerful instrument for the accomplishment of all acts.

data.v: नाभूतिकाले च फलं ददाति; शिल्पं न मन्त्राश्च तथौषधानि । तान्येव कालेन समाहितानि; सिध्यन्ति चेध्यन्ति च भूतिकाले ॥
data.md: During the hour of adversity, neither science, nor incantations, nor drugs, produce any fruits. In prosperity, however, those very things, applied, yield abundant fruits.

data.v: कालेन शीघ्राः प्रविवान्ति वाताः; कालेन वृष्टिर्जलदानुपैति । कालेन पद्मोत्पलवज्जलं च; कालेन पुष्यन्ति नगा वनेषु ॥
data.md: By time the winds blow violently; by Time the clouds become surcharged with rain; by Time tanks become adorned with lotuses of various sorts; by Time trees in the forest are covered with flowers.

data.v: कालेन कृष्णाश्च सिताश्च रात्र्यः; कालेन चन्द्रः परिपूर्णबिम्बः । नाकालतः पुष्पफलं नगानां; नाकालवेगाः सरितो वहन्ति ॥
data.md: By Time nights become dark or lighted. By Time the Moon becomes full. If the proper Time does not come, trees do not bear flowers and fruits. If the proper Time does not come, the currents of rivers do not become powerful.

data.v: नाकालमत्ताः खगपन्नगाश्च; मृगद्विपाः शैलमहाग्रहाश्च । नाकालतः स्त्रीषु भवन्ति गर्भा; नायान्त्यकाले शिशिरोष्णवर्षाः ॥
data.md: Birds, snakes, deer, elephants and other animals never become excited when the proper Time does not come. If the proper Time does not come, women do not conceive. It is with Time that winter, summer, and the rainy seasons come.

data.v: नाकालतो म्रियते जायते वा; नाकालतो व्याहरते च बालः । नाकालतो यौवनमभ्युपैति; नाकालतो रोहति बीजमुप्तम् ॥
data.md: If the proper Time does not come, no one is born and no one dies. If the Time does not come, the infant does not gain power of speech. If the Time does not come one does not come by youth. It is with Time that the seed sown sprouts up.

data.v: नाकालतो भानुरुपैति योगं; नाकालतोऽस्तं गिरिमभ्युपैति । नाकालतो वर्धते हीयते च; चन्द्रः समुद्रश्च महोर्मिमाली ॥
data.md: If the Time does not come, the Sun does not appear in the horizon, nor, when the Time for it does not come, does he set. If the Time for it does not come, the Moon does not increase nor wane, nor the ocean with its waves rise and ebb.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । गीतं राज्ञा सेनजिता दुःखार्तेन युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: In this connection is related the old story, O Yudhishthira, by king Senajit in sorrow.

data.v: सर्वानेवैष पर्यायो मर्त्यान्स्पृशति दुस्तरः । कालेन परिपक्वा हि म्रियन्ते सर्वमानवाः ॥
data.md: The powerful course of Time affects all mortals. All earthly objects, ripened by Time, meet with destruction.

data.v: घ्नन्ति चान्यान्नरा राजंस्तानप्यन्ये नरास्तथा । संज्ञैषा लौकिकी राजन्न हिनस्ति न हन्यते ॥
data.md: Some, O king, kill some men. The killers, again, are slain by others. This is what the world says. In reality, however, no one kills and no one is killed.

data.v: हन्तीति मन्यते कश्चिन्न हन्तीत्यपि चापरे । स्वभावतस्तु नियतौ भूतानां प्रभवाप्ययौ ॥
data.md: Some body thinks men kill (their fellow men). Another thinks men do not kill. The truth is that the birth and death of all creatures have been ordained to happen by their very nature.

data.v: नष्टे धने वा दारे वा पुत्रे पितरि वा मृते । अहो कष्टमिति ध्यायञ्शोकस्यापचितिं चरेत् ॥
data.md: At the loss of one's riches or the death of one's wife or son or father, one cries out saying-Alas what grief!-and the continued thought of that sorrow always increases it.

data.v: स किं शोचसि मूढः सञ्शोच्यः किमनुशोचसि । पश्य दुःखेषु दुःखानि भयेषु च भयान्यपि ॥
data.md: Why do you, like a foolish man, grieve? Why do you grieve for them who are subject to grief? Mark, grief is enhanced by indulgence as fear is by fearing.

data.v: आत्मापि चायं न मम सर्वापि पृथिवी मम । यथा मम तथान्येषामिति पश्यन्न मुह्यति ॥
data.md: This body even is not mine. Nothing in this Earth is mine. The things of this Earth belong as much to others as to me. Seeing this, the wise do not allow themselves to be beguiled.

data.v: शोकस्थानसहस्राणि हर्षस्थानशतानि च । दिवसे दिवसे मूढमाविशन्ति न पण्डितम् ॥
data.md: There are thousands of causes for sorrow and hundreds of causes for joy. These affect daily the ignorant only, but not the wise.

data.v: एवमेतानि कालेन प्रियद्वेष्याणि भागशः । जीवेषु परिवर्तन्ते दुःखानि च सुखानि च ॥
data.md: These in course of Time. become objects of love or hatred, and appearing as happiness or misery revolve for affecting living creatures.

data.v: दुःखमेवास्ति न सुखं तस्मात्तदुपलभ्यते । तृष्णार्तिप्रभवं दुःखं दुःखार्तिप्रभवं सुखम् ॥
data.md: There is only sorrow in this world and not happiness. Therefore sorrow only is felt. Desire begets sorrow and sorrow happiness.

data.v: सुखस्यानन्तरं दुःखं दुःखस्यानन्तरं सुखम् । न नित्यं लभते दुःखं न नित्यं लभते सुखम् ॥
data.md: Sorrow comes after happiness. and happiness after sorrow. One does not always suffer sorrow or always enjoy happiness.

data.v: सुखमन्ते हि दुःखानां दुःखमन्ते सुखस्य च । तस्मादेतद्द्वयं जह्याद्य इच्छेच्छाश्वतं सुखम् ॥
data.md: Happiness always ends in sorrow and sometimes originates from sorrow itself. He, therefore, who desires perpetual happiness must give up both.

data.v: यन्निमित्तं भवेच्छोकस्तापो वा दुःखमूर्छितः । आयासो वापि यन्मूलस्तदेकाङ्गमपि त्यजेत् ॥
data.md: When sorrow must arise upon termination of happiness, and happiness upon the termination of sorrow, and should, therefore, shake off, like a (snake-bit) limb, that which begets sorrow or that heart-burning which is reared by sorrow or that which is the root of his anxiety.

data.v: सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं प्रियं वा यदि वाप्रियम् । प्राप्तं प्राप्तमुपासीत हृदयेनापराजितः ॥
data.md: Be it happiness or be it misery, be it pleasant or be it otherwise, what comes to one should be enjoyed or put up with an unconquered heart.

data.v: ईषदप्यङ्ग दाराणां पुत्राणां वा चराप्रियम् । ततो ज्ञास्यसि कः कस्य केन वा कथमेव वा ॥
data.md: O amiable king, if you do not in the least, do what is agreeable to your wives and children, you shall then know who is whose, and why so, and for what.

data.v: ये च मूढतमा लोके ये च बुद्धेः परं गताः । त एव सुखमेधन्ते मध्यः क्लेशेन युज्यते ॥
data.md: Only those who stolid fools and those who are masters of their souls enjoy happiness here. They, however, who occupy an intermediate position suffering misery.

data.v: इत्यब्रवीन्महाप्राज्ञो युधिष्ठिर स सेनजित् । परावरज्ञो लोकस्य धर्मवित्सुखदुःखवित् ॥
data.md: This, O Yudhishthira, is what the highly wise the Senajit who was conversant with what is good or bad in this world, with duties, and with happiness and misery said.

data.v: सुखी परस्य यो दुःखे न जातु स सुखी भवेत् । दुःखानां हि क्षयो नास्ति जायते ह्यपरात्परम् ॥
data.md: He who is grieved at other people's griefs can never enjoy happiness. There is no end of grief, and grief originates from happiness itself.

data.v: सुखं च दुःखं च भवाभवौ च; लाभालाभौ मरणं जीवितं च । पर्यायशः सर्वमिह स्पृशन्ति; तस्माद्धीरो नैव हृष्येन्न कुप्येत् ॥
data.md: Happiness and misery, prosperity and adversity, gain and loss, death and life, in their turn, visit all creatures. There the wise man, endued with equanimity soul would neither be puffed up with joy nor be depressed with sorrow.

data.v: दीक्षां यज्ञे पालनं युद्धमाहु;र्योगं राष्ट्रे दण्डनीत्या च सम्यक् । वित्तत्यागं दक्षिणानां च यज्ञे; सम्यग्ज्ञानं पावनानीति विद्यात् ॥
data.md: Battle has been described as the Sacrifice for a king; observance of chastisement is his Yoga; and the gift of riches in sacrifices in the form of presents his Renunciation. All these should be regarded as acts which purify him.

data.v: रक्षन्राष्ट्रं बुद्धिपूर्वं नयेन; संत्यक्तात्मा यज्ञशीलो महात्मा । सर्वाँल्लोकान्धर्ममूर्त्या चरंश्चा;प्यूर्ध्वं देहान्मोदते देवलोके ॥
data.md: Having protected his kingdom with policy and intelligence, the great and self-controlled Hayagriva of great strength of mind and given to the performance of sacrifices filled all the worlds with his glory and is now sporting in the region of the celestials.

data.v: जित्वा संग्रामान्पालयित्वा च राष्ट्रं; सोमं पीत्वा वर्धयित्वा प्रजाश्च । युक्त्या दण्डं धारयित्वा प्रजानां; युद्धे क्षीणो मोदते देवलोके ॥
data.md: By gaining battles, protecting his kingdom, drinking the Soma juice, making his subjects prosper, holding judiciously the rod of chastisement, and renouncing his body at last in fight, a king enjoy happiness in heaven.

data.v: सम्यग्वेदान्प्राप्य शास्त्राण्यधीत्य; सम्यग्राष्ट्रं पालयित्वा च राजा । चातुर्वर्ण्यं स्थापयित्वा स्वधर्मे; पूतात्मा वै मोदते देवलोके ॥
data.md: Having studied all the Vedas and the other scriptures duly, having protected the kingdom duly, and having made all the four orders follow their respective duties, a king become purified and finally sports in heaven.

data.v: यस्य वृत्तं नमस्यन्ति स्वर्गस्थस्यापि मानवाः । पौरजानपदामात्याः स राजा राजसत्तमः ॥
data.md: He is the best of kings whose conduct, even after his death, is praised by the denizens of the city and the country and by his counsellors and friends.

data.v: अभिमन्यौ हते बाले द्रौपद्यास्तनयेषु च । धृष्टद्युम्ने विराटे च द्रुपदे च महीपतौ ॥
वसुषेणे च धर्मज्ञे धृष्टकेतौ च पार्थिवे । तथान्येषु नरेन्द्रेषु नानादेश्येषु संयुगे ॥
न विमुञ्चति मां शोको ज्ञातिघातिनमातुरम् । राज्यकामुकमत्युग्रं स्ववंशोच्छेदकारकम् ॥
यस्याङ्के क्रीडमानेन मया वै परिवर्तितम् । स मया राज्यलुब्धेन गाङ्गेयो विनिपातितः ॥
data.md: He upon whose breast and limbs I used to play, alas, that Ganga's son has been killed by me in battle out of desire for sovereignty.

data.v: यदा ह्येनं विघूर्णन्तमपश्यं पार्थसायकैः । कम्पमानं यथा वज्रैः प्रेक्षमाणं शिखण्डिनम् ॥
data.md: When I saw that foremost of men, viz., our grandfather, assailed by Shikhandin and trembling and reeling in consequence of Partha's arrows that resembled thunder-bolts in power, when I saw his tall form cut all over with blazing arrows and himself become weak like an aged lion, my heart was greatly pained.

data.v: जीर्णं सिंहमिव प्रांशुं नरसिंहं पितामहम् । कीर्यमाणं शरैस्तीक्ष्णैर्दृष्ट्वा मे व्यथितं मनः ॥
प्राङ्मुखं सीदमानं च रथादपच्युतं शरैः । घूर्णमानं यथा शैलं तदा मे कश्मलोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: When I saw that destroyer of hostile cars reel like a mountain summit and drop down on the terrace of his own car with his face turned towards the east, my senses were bewildered.

data.v: यः स बाणधनुष्पाणिर्योधयामास भार्गवम् । बहून्यहानि कौरव्यः कुरुक्षेत्रे महामृधे ॥
समेतं पार्थिवं क्षत्रं वाराणस्यां नदीसुतः । कन्यार्थमाह्वयद्वीरो रथेनैकेन संयुगे ॥
येन चोग्रायुधो राजा चक्रवर्ती दुरासदः । दग्धः शस्त्रप्रतापेन स मया युधि घातितः ॥
स्वयं मृत्युं रक्षमाणः पाञ्चाल्यं यः शिखण्डिनम् । न बाणैः पातयामास सोऽर्जुनेन निपातितः ॥
data.md: Knowing full well that Shikhandin the prince of Panchala was his slayer, that hero still refrained from killing the prince with his arrow. Alas, such a magnanimous warrior was killed by Arjuna.

data.v: यदैनं पतितं भूमावपश्यं रुधिरोक्षितम् । तदैवाविशदत्युग्रो ज्वरो मे मुनिसत्तम । येन संवर्धिता बाला येन स्म परिरक्षिताः ॥
data.md: O best of sages, when I saw the grandfather stretched on the Earth and bathed in blood, a violent fever afflicted my heart.

data.v: स मया राज्यलुब्धेन पापेन गुरुघातिना । अल्पकालस्य राज्यस्य कृते मूढेन घातितः ॥

data.md: The immense wealth, O King, Sashavindu distributed in a Horse-sacrifice amongst the Brahmanas.

data.md: Rising (at the termination of every sacrifice) he distributed a hundred thousand kine and hundreds of mules during this time.

data.md: King Rantideva used to make presents to the. When the king said,-To you I give a hundred Nishkas! To you I give a hundred Nishkas! To you I give a hundred-the Brahinanas raised a hue and cry of refusal.

data.md: When, however, the king said-I give a thousand Nishkas--the gifts were all accepted. All the vessels and plates in Rantideva's inansion for carrying food and other articles, all the jugs and pots, the pans and plates and cups were made of gold.

data.md: Out of wrath that king made the Earth to be excavated, whereupon she came to have the ocean on her bosom, and, therefore, the ocean is called Sagara after his name.

data.md: Seeing Prithu the son of Vena, all the creatures of the Earth, exclaimed,-We love him affectionately!-And for the loving attachment (to him of all creatures), he was called a Raja (one who gratifies all).

data.v: अकृष्टपच्या पृथिवी पुटके पुटके मधु । सर्वा द्रोणदुघा गावो वैन्यस्यासन्प्रशासतः ॥
data.md: The Earth, during his regime produced crops without being tilled, every leaf of the trees bore honey, and every cow gave a jugful of milk.

data.md: All men enjoyed health and all their wishes were fructified. They had no fear of any kind. They used to live, as they pleased, in fields or houses.

data.md: What are you, O Srinjaya, thinking of silently? It seems, O king, that you do not pay heed to these words of mine. If you have not heard them, then this discourse of mine has been fruitless like medicine or diet to a person on the point of death.'

data.v: शृणोमि ते नारद वाचमेतां; विचित्रार्थां स्रजमिव पुण्यगन्धाम् । राजर्षीणां पुण्यकृतां महात्मनां; कीर्त्या युक्तां शोकनिर्णाशनार्थम् ॥
data.md: I am all attention, ONarada, to this discourse of yours, of excellent sense and perfumed like a garland of flowers,-this discourse regarding the conduct of great royal sages of meritorious deeds and great fame, that can surely remove grief.

data.md: Your discourse, O great sage, has not been fruitless. I have been freed from sorrow at your very sight! Like one never satiated with drinking nectar, I am not satiated with your words.

data.md: O you of true vision, If you, O lord, be inclined to show your grace towards this man burning for the death of his son, then that son, through your favour, is sure to be revived and to mix once more with me (in this life).

data.md: Narada said: I will give back to you that son of yours named Suvarnashthivin, whom Parvata gave you and who has been deprived of life! Effulgent like gold, that child shall live a thousand years.

data.md: Krishna said 'I will recount, О king, the incidents as they took place. There are two Rishis foremost in the world, named Narada and Parvata.
