data.md: Narada is the maternal uncle and Parvata is his sister's son. With cheerful hearts, the uncle Narada and the nephew Parvata had in days of yore, O king, left the celestial region for a journey on Earth for eating clarified butter and rice.

data.v: हविःपवित्रभोज्येन देवभोज्येन चैव ह । नारदो मातुलश्चैव भागिनेयश्च पर्वतः ॥
data.md: Narada is the maternal uncle and Parvata is his sister's son. With cheerful hearts, the uncle Narada and the nephew Parvata had in days of yore, O king, left the celestial region for a journey on Earth for eating clarified butter and rice.

data.v: तावुभौ तपसोपेताववनीतलचारिणौ । भुञ्जानौ मानुषान्भोगान्यथावत्पर्यधावताम् ॥
data.md: Both of them endued with great ascetic merit, they wandered over the Earth living on food taken by human beings.

data.v: प्रीतिमन्तौ मुदा युक्तौ समयं तत्र चक्रतुः । यो भवेद्धृदि संकल्पः शुभो वा यदि वाशुभः । अन्योन्यस्य स आख्येयो मृषा शापोऽन्यथा भवेत् ॥
data.md: Filled with joy and cherishing great affection for each other, they entered into an agreement that whatever wish, good or bad, would be entertained by one, should be disclosed to the other, but if one happens to act otherwise, he should be visited by the other's curse.

data.v: तौ तथेति प्रतिज्ञाय महर्षी लोकपूजितौ । सृञ्जयं श्वैत्यमभ्येत्य राजानमिदमूचतुः ॥
data.md: Coming at that understanding, those two great Rishis, worshipped of all the worlds, repaired to King Srinjaya the son of Shitya and said to him?

data.v: आवां भवति वत्स्यावः कंचित्कालं हिताय ते । यथावत्पृथिवीपाल आवयोः प्रगुणीभव । तथेति कृत्वा तौ राजा सत्कृत्योपचचार ह ॥
data.md: We two, for your well-being shall live with you for a few days. O lord of Earth, do you satisfy all our wants duly! The king, saying,-So be it, began to treat them hospitably.

data.v: ततः कदाचित्तौ राजा महात्मानौ तथागतौ । अब्रवीत्परमप्रीतः सुतेयं वरवर्णिनी ॥
एकैव मम कन्यैषा युवां परिचरिष्यति । दर्शनीयानवद्याङ्गी शीलवृत्तसमन्विता । सुकुमारी कुमारी च पद्मकिञ्जल्कसंनिभा ॥
परमं सौम्य इत्युक्तस्ताभ्यां राजा शशास ताम् । कन्ये विप्रावुपचर देववत्पितृवच्च ह ॥
सा तु कन्या तथेत्युक्त्वा पितरं धर्मचारिणी । यथानिदेशं राज्ञस्तौ सत्कृत्योपचचार ह ॥
data.md: The pious princess, saying,-So be it-began to serve them in obedience to her father's command.

data.v: तस्यास्तथोपचारेण रूपेणाप्रतिमेन च । नारदं हृच्छयस्तूर्णं सहसैवान्वपद्यत ॥
data.md: Her dutiful services and her peerless beauty very soon created love in Narada's heart.

data.v: ववृधे च ततस्तस्य हृदि कामो महात्मनः । यथा शुक्लस्य पक्षस्य प्रवृत्तावुडुराट्छनैः ॥
data.md: That tender feeling began to grow in the heart of the great saint, like the moon gradually increasing in the light fortnight.

data.v: न च तं भागिनेयाय पर्वताय महात्मने । शशंस मन्मथं तीव्रं व्रीडमानः स धर्मवित् ॥
data.md: The virtuous Narada, however, out of shame, could not give out that burning love to his sister's son the high-souled Parvata.

data.v: तपसा चेङ्गितेनाथ पर्वतोऽथ बुबोध तत् । कामार्तं नारदं क्रुद्धः शशापैनं ततो भृशम् ॥
data.md: By his ascetic power, as also by signs, Parvata understood all. Excited with rage, the latter thereupon made up his mind to curse the love-stricken Narada.

data.v: कृत्वा समयमव्यग्रो भवान्वै सहितो मया । यो भवेद्धृदि संकल्पः शुभो वा यदि वाशुभः ॥
data.md: And he said, ‘Having of your own accord made an agreement with me that, whatever wish, good or bad, would be entertained by either of us should be disclosed to the other you have violated it! These were your own words. O Brahman! It is for this that I shall curse you.

data.v: अन्योन्यस्य स आख्येय इति तद्वै मृषा कृतम् । भवता वचनं ब्रह्मंस्तस्मादेतद्वदाम्यहम् ॥
data.md: And he said, ‘Having of your own accord made an agreement with me that, whatever wish, good or bad, would be entertained by either of us should be disclosed to the other you have violated it! These were your own words. O Brahman! It is for this that I shall curse you.

data.v: न हि कामं प्रवर्तन्तं भवानाचष्ट मे पुरा । सुकुमार्यां कुमार्यां ते तस्मादेष शपाम्यहम् ॥
data.md: You did not tell me before that your heart has been stricken with the beauty of the maiden Sukumari, I shall, therefore, curse you.

data.v: ब्रह्मवादी गुरुर्यस्मात्तपस्वी ब्राह्मणश्च सन् । अकार्षीः समयभ्रंशमावाभ्यां यः कृतो मिथः ॥
data.md: You are a Brahmacharin. You are my preceptor. You are an ascetic and a Brahmana. Yet you have broken the agreement you had made with me.

data.v: शप्स्ये तस्मात्सुसंक्रुद्धो भवन्तं तं निबोध मे । सुकुमारी च ते भार्या भविष्यति न संशयः ॥
data.md: Filled with anger I shall, for this, curse even you. Listen to me. This Sukumari shall, forsooth, become your wife.

data.v: वानरं चैव कन्या त्वां विवाहात्प्रभृति प्रभो । संद्रक्ष्यन्ति नराश्चान्ये स्वरूपेण विनाकृतम् ॥
data.md: From the time of your marriage, however, O powerful one, both she and all men shall see you a monkey, for your real features having disappeared, you will appear like a monkey to all.

data.v: स तद्वाक्यं तु विज्ञाय नारदः पर्वतात्तदा । अशपत्तमपि क्रोधाद्भागिनेयं स मातुलः ॥
तपसा ब्रह्मचर्येण सत्येन च दमेन च । युक्तोऽपि धर्मनित्यश्च न स्वर्गवासमाप्स्यसि ॥
तौ तु शप्त्वा भृशं क्रुद्धौ परस्परममर्षणौ । प्रतिजग्मतुरन्योन्यं क्रुद्धाविव गजोत्तमौ ॥
data.md: Filled with anger and feelings of vengeance, they thus cursed each other like a pair of infuriate elephants.

data.v: पर्वतः पृथिवीं कृत्स्नां विचचार महामुनिः । पूज्यमानो यथान्यायं तेजसा स्वेन भारत ॥
data.md: From that time the great Parvata began to wander over the Earth, respected as he deserved, O Bharata, for his own power.

data.v: अथ तामलभत्कन्यां नारदः सृञ्जयात्मजाम् । धर्मेण धर्मप्रवरः सुकुमारीमनिन्दिताम् ॥
data.md: Narada then, that best of Brahmanas, duly married Srinjaya's daughter, the faultless Sukumari.

data.v: सा तु कन्या यथाशापं नारदं तं ददर्श ह । पाणिग्रहणमन्त्राणां प्रयोगादेव वानरम् ॥
सुकुमारी च देवर्षिं वानरप्रतिमाननम् । नैवावमन्यत तदा प्रीतिमत्येव चाभवत् ॥
data.md: The princess, however, saw Narada exactly as he had been. Indeed, just after the last of the wedding Mantras had been recited, Sukumari saw the celestial Rishi to have a face like that of a monkey. She, however, did not for that disregard her husband. On the other hand, she bestowed her love on him.

data.v: उपतस्थे च भर्तारं न चान्यं मनसाप्यगात् । देवं मुनिं वा यक्षं वा पतित्वे पतिवत्सला ॥
data.md: Indeed, that chaste princess, devoted herself entirely to her husband and did not in her heart even desire any one else among the gods, Munis and Yakshas for a husband.

data.v: ततः कदाचिद्भगवान्पर्वतोऽनुससार ह । वनं विरहितं किंचित्तत्रापश्यत्स नारदम् ॥
data.md: One day, as the illustrious Parvata, while wandering about entered a solitary forest, he saw Narada there.

data.v: ततोऽभिवाद्य प्रोवाच नारदं पर्वतस्तदा । भवान्प्रसादं कुरुतां स्वर्गादेशाय मे प्रभो ॥
data.md: Bowing to him, Parvata said,-Favour me by permitting me, O powerful one, to go to heaven.

data.v: तमुवाच ततो दृष्ट्वा पर्वतं नारदस्तदा । कृताञ्जलिमुपासीनं दीनं दीनतरः स्वयम् ॥
त्वयाहं प्रथमं शप्तो वानरस्त्वं भविष्यसि । इत्युक्तेन मया पश्चाच्छप्तस्त्वमपि मत्सरात् । अद्यप्रभृति वै वासं स्वर्गे नावाप्स्यसीति ह ॥
तव नैतद्धि सदृशं पुत्रस्थाने हि मे भवान् । निवर्तयेतां तौ शापमन्योऽन्येन तदा मुनी ॥
श्रीसमृद्धं तदा दृष्ट्वा नारदं देवरूपिणम् । सुकुमारी प्रदुद्राव परपत्यभिशङ्कया ॥
data.md: Seeing her husband possessed of celestial forin shining with beauty, Sukumari fled from him taking him, to be somebody other than her husband.

data.v: तां पर्वतस्ततो दृष्ट्वा प्रद्रवन्तीमनिन्दिताम् । अब्रवीत्तव भर्तैष नात्र कार्या विचारणा ॥
data.md: Seeing the beautiful princess flying away from her husband, Parvata addressed her, saying,-He is your husband. Do not entertain any scruple.

data.v: ऋषिः परमधर्मात्मा नारदो भगवान्प्रभुः । तवैवाभेद्यहृदयो मा ते भूदत्र संशयः ॥
data.md: He is the illustrious and powerful Rishi Narada, that foremost of virtuous persons. He is your husband entirely devoted to you. Do not cherish any doubt.

data.v: सानुनीता बहुविधं पर्वतेन महात्मना । शापदोषं च तं भर्तुः श्रुत्वा स्वां प्रकृतिं गता । पर्वतोऽथ ययौ स्वर्गं नारदोऽथ ययौ गृहान् ॥
data.md: Assured in various ways be the great Parvata and informed also of the curse on her husband the princess regained the calmness of men. Then Parvata proceeded to heaven and Narada to his home.'

data.v: प्रत्यक्षकर्मा सर्वस्य नारदोऽयं महानृषिः । एष वक्ष्यति वै पृष्टो यथा वृत्तं नरोत्तम ॥
data.md: The illustrious Rishi Narada, who himself did so, is here, O best of men, asked by you, he will tell you everything that took place."

data.v: ततो राजा पाण्डुसुतो नारदं प्रत्यभाषत । भगवञ्श्रोतुमिच्छामि सुवर्णष्ठीविसंभवम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said: The royal son of Pandu then addressed Narada, saying,-'O holy one, I wish to hear of the birth of the child whose excreta were gold.

data.v: एवमुक्तः स च मुनिर्धर्मराजेन नारदः । आचचक्षे यथा वृत्तं सुवर्णष्ठीविनं प्रति ॥
data.md: Thus accosted by king Yudhishthira the sage Narada began to describe to him all that had taken place about that child who passed golden excreta.

data.v: एवमेतन्महाराज यथायं केशवोऽब्रवीत् । कार्यस्यास्य तु यच्छेषं तत्ते वक्ष्यामि पृच्छतः ॥
data.md: Narada said 'It is so, O you of mighty arms, as Keshava here has said, asked by you I shall now recite the remaining portion of this story.

data.v: अहं च पर्वतश्चैव स्वस्रीयो मे महामुनिः । वस्तुकामावभिगतौ सृञ्जयं जयतां वरम् ॥
data.md: Myself, and my sister's son, the great ascetic Parvata, once came to Srinjaya, that foremost of all victorious kings, for living with him.

data.v: तत्र संपूजितौ तेन विधिदृष्टेन कर्मणा । सर्वकामैः सुविहितौ निवसावोऽस्य वेश्मनि ॥
data.md: Honoured duly by him who gratified every wish of ours, we lived in his palace.

data.v: व्यतिक्रान्तासु वर्षासु समये गमनस्य च । पर्वतो मामुवाचेदं काले वचनमर्थवत् ॥
data.md: After the rains had gone, and when the time for our own departure arrived, Parvata said to me these weighty words suitable to the hour.

data.v: आवामस्य नरेन्द्रस्य गृहे परमपूजितौ । उषितौ समये ब्रह्मंश्चिन्त्यतामत्र सांप्रतम् ॥
data.md: We have, O Brahmana, lived in the house of this king for some time, highly respected by him. Think of what return we should make.

data.v: ततोऽहमब्रुवं राजन्पर्वतं शुभदर्शनम् । सर्वमेतत्त्वयि विभो भागिनेयोपपद्यते ॥
data.md: I then, O king, said to Parvata,-O nephew, it is really like you, and, O ye of great power, all this depends upon yourself.

data.v: वरेण छन्द्यतां राजा लभतां यद्यदिच्छति । आवयोस्तपसा सिद्धिं प्राप्नोतु यदि मन्यसे ॥
data.md: By your boons let the king be made happy and let him obtain his wishes. Or, if you wish, let hiin be crowned with success by the power of ascetic merits of both of us.

data.v: तत आहूय राजानं सृञ्जयं शुभदर्शनम् । पर्वतोऽनुमतं वाक्यमुवाच मुनिपुंगवः ॥
data.md: After this, Parvata having summoned king Srinjaya, that foremost of victorious persons, said to him these words, O foremost of Kurus:प्रीतौ स्वो नृप सत्कारैर्भवदार्जवसम्भृतैः।

data.v: प्रीतौ स्वो नृप सत्कारैस्तव ह्यार्जवसंभृतैः । आवाभ्यामभ्यनुज्ञातो वरं नृवर चिन्तय ॥
देवानामविहिंसायां यद्भवेन्मानुषक्षमम् । तद्गृहाण महाराज पूजार्हो नौ मतो भवान् ॥
data.md: Let the boon, however, be such that it may not create enmity with the gods or bring on destruction to men. Accept then, O king, a boon, for you deserved one as we think.

data.v: प्रीतौ भवन्तौ यदि मे कृतमेतावता मम । एष एव परो लाभो निर्वृत्तो मे महाफलः ॥
data.md: Hearing these words, Srinjaya replied,-If you have been pleased with me my object then has been gained, for this itself is the highest gain and the fruition of all my desires.

data.v: तमेवंवादिनं भूयः पर्वतः प्रत्यभाषत । वृणीष्व राजन्संकल्पो यस्ते हृदि चिरं स्थितः ॥
data.md: To Srinjaya who said so, Parvata again said, —Pray, o king, for the fruition of that wish which you are cherishing in your heart for a long time.

data.v: अभीप्सामि सुतं वीरं वीर्यवन्तं दृढव्रतम् । आयुष्मन्तं महाभागं देवराजसमद्युतिम् ॥
data.md: Srinjaya answered, I wish to have a son who will be heroic and endued with great energy, firm in his vows and of long life, highly blessed and effulgent like the king of gods.

data.v: भविष्यत्येष ते कामो न त्वायुष्मान्भविष्यति । देवराजाभिभूत्यर्थं संकल्पो ह्येष ते हृदि ॥
data.md: At this, Parvata said,-This your desire will be satisfied. Your son, however shall not live long, since you wish to have such a son for prevailing over the king of the gods.

data.v: सुवर्णष्ठीवनाच्चैव स्वर्णष्ठीवी भविष्यति । रक्ष्यश्च देवराजात्स देवराजसमद्युतिः ॥
data.md: Your son shall be known by the name of Suvarnashthivin. He shall be effulgent like the king of gods, but take care to protect him always from that deity.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा सृञ्जयो वाक्यं पर्वतस्य महात्मनः । प्रसादयामास तदा नैतदेवं भवेदिति ॥
आयुष्मान्मे भवेत्पुत्रो भवतस्तपसा मुने । न च तं पर्वतः किंचिदुवाचेन्द्रव्यपेक्षया ॥
data.md: Hearing those words of the great Parvata, Srinjaya begged that saint for ordaining otherwise, saying,-May my son live long, O Muni, through your ascetic merit.-Parvata, however, said nothing, out of his partiality for Indra.

data.v: तमहं नृपतिं दीनमब्रुवं पुनरेव तु । स्मर्तव्योऽहं महाराज दर्शयिष्यामि ते स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Seeing the king very cheerless, I said to him,-Think of me, O king, (in your distress), and I shall promise to come when thought of by you.

data.v: अहं ते दयितं पुत्रं प्रेतराजवशं गतम् । पुनर्दास्यामि तद्रूपं मा शुचः पृथिवीपते ॥
data.md: Do not grieve, O king. I will give you back your beloved child alive, even if he be dead.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु नृपतिं प्रयातौ स्वो यथेप्सितम् । सृञ्जयश्च यथाकामं प्रविवेश स्वमन्दिरम् ॥
data.md: Having said so to that king both of us left him for coming to where we wished, and Srinjaya returned to his palace.

data.v: सृञ्जयस्याथ राजर्षेः कस्मिंश्चित्कालपर्यये । जज्ञे पुत्रो महावीर्यस्तेजसा प्रज्वलन्निव ॥
data.md: After some time had passed, the royal sage Srinjaya had born unto him a highly powerful and energetic son.

data.v: ववृधे स यथाकालं सरसीव महोत्पलम् । बभूव काञ्चनष्ठीवी यथार्थं नाम तस्य तत् ॥
data.md: The child grew up like a large lotus in a lake, and became Suvarnashthivin in reality as well as in name.

data.v: तदद्भुततमं लोके पप्रथे कुरुसत्तम । बुबुधे तच्च देवेन्द्रो वरदानं महात्मनोः ॥
data.md: This wonderful fact, O best of the Kurus, soon became widely known over the world. The king of the gods also learnt of it as the outcome of Paravata's boon.

data.v: ततस्त्वभिभवाद्भीतो बृहस्पतिमते स्थितः । कुमारस्यान्तरप्रेक्षी बभूव बलवृत्रहा ॥
data.md: Fearing humiliation the slayer of Vala and Vritra began to watch for the loopholes in that prince.

data.v: चोदयामास वज्रं स दिव्यास्त्रं मूर्तिसंस्थितम् । व्याघ्रो भूत्वा जहीमं त्वं राजपुत्रमिति प्रभो ॥
data.md: He commanded his celestial weapon Thunder, standing before him, in embodied from saying,-Go, O powerful one, and assuming the form of a tiger kill this prince.

data.v: विवृद्धः किल वीर्येण मामेषोऽभिभविष्यति । सृञ्जयस्य सुतो वज्र यथैनं पर्वतो ददौ ॥
एवमुक्तस्तु शक्रेण वज्रः परपुरंजयः । कुमारस्यान्तरप्रेक्षी नित्यमेवान्वपद्यत ॥
सृञ्जयोऽपि सुतं प्राप्य देवराजसमद्युतिम् । हृष्टः सान्तःपुरो राजा वननित्योऽभवत्तदा ॥
data.md: Srinjaya, meanwhile, having obtained that child who was effulgent like Indra himself, became filled with joy. The king, accompanied by his wives, and the other ladies of his household, took up his quarter in the midst of a forest.

data.v: ततो भागीरथीतीरे कदाचिद्वननिर्झरे । धात्रीद्वितीयो बालः स क्रीडार्थं पर्यधावत ॥
data.md: One day, on the bank of the Bhagirathi, the boy accompanied by his nurse, ran here and there in play.

data.v: पञ्चवर्षकदेशीयो बालो नागेन्द्रविक्रमः । सहसोत्पतितं व्याघ्रमाससाद महाबलः ॥
data.md: Though only five years' old, his prowess, even then, resembled that of a powerful elephant. While thus playing the child met a powerful tiger that attacked him suddenly.

data.v: तेन चैव विनिष्पिष्टो वेपमानो नृपात्मजः । व्यसुः पपात मेदिन्यां ततो धात्री विचुक्रुशे ॥
data.md: The infant prince trembled greatly as he was being mangled by the tiger and soon fell down dead on the Earth. Seeing in the nurse cried aloud in grief.

data.v: हत्वा तु राजपुत्रं स तत्रैवान्तरधीयत । शार्दूलो देवराजस्य माययान्तर्हितस्तदा ॥
data.md: Having killed the prince, the tiger through Indra's powers of delusion, vanished there and then.

data.v: धात्र्यास्तु निनदं श्रुत्वा रुदत्याः परमार्तवत् । अभ्यधावत तं देशं स्वयमेव महीपतिः ॥
data.md: Hearing the cries of the nurse, the king in great anxiety ran there.

data.v: स ददर्श गतासुं तं शयानं पीतशोणितम् । कुमारं विगतानन्दं निशाकरमिव च्युतम् ॥
data.md: He saw his son there, his blood quaffed off and lying dead on the ground like the moon dropped from the sky.

data.v: स तमुत्सङ्गमारोप्य परिपीडितवक्षसम् । पुत्रं रुधिरसंसिक्तं पर्यदेवयदातुरः ॥
data.md: Taking up on his lap the boy bathed in blood, and the king, with heart stricken with grief, began to lament piteously.

data.v: ततस्ता मातरस्तस्य रुदन्त्यः शोककर्शिताः । अभ्यधावन्त तं देशं यत्र राजा स सृञ्जयः ॥
data.md: The queen also smitten with sorrow, and crying, quickly ran where king Srinjaya was.

data.v: ततः स राजा सस्मार मामन्तर्गतमानसः । तच्चाहं चिन्तितं ज्ञात्वा गतवांस्तस्य दर्शनम् ॥
data.md: In that plight the king thought of me with rapt attention. Knowing that the king was thinking of me I appeared before him.

data.v: स मयैतानि वाक्यानि श्रावितः शोकलालसः । यानि ते यदुवीरेण कथितानि महीपते ॥
data.md: Assailed with grief as the king was, I recounted to him all those stories, O king, that this hero of Yadu's race has already recited to you.

data.v: संजीवितश्चापि मया वासवानुमते तदा । भवितव्यं तथा तच्च न तच्छक्यमतोऽन्यथा ॥
data.md: I restored Srinjaya's child to life with Indra's permission. That which is ordained must take place. It is impossible to make it otherwise.

data.v: अत ऊर्ध्वं कुमारः स स्वर्णष्ठीवी महायशाः । चित्तं प्रसादयामास पितुर्मातुश्च वीर्यवान् ॥
data.md: After this prince Suvarnashthivin of great renown and power began to gladden the hearts of his parents.

data.v: कारयामास राज्यं स पितरि स्वर्गते विभुः । वर्षाणामेकशतवत्सहस्रं भीमविक्रमः ॥
data.md: Of great prowess, he ascended the throne of his father after the latter had died, and reigned for one thousand and one hundred years.

data.v: तत इष्ट्वा महायज्ञैर्बहुभिर्भूरिदक्षिणैः । तर्पयामास देवांश्च पितॄंश्चैव महाद्युतिः ॥
data.md: He worshipped the gods in many great sacrifices accompanied with profuse presents. Highly effulgent he gratified the gods and the Pitris.

data.v: उत्पाद्य च बहून्पुत्रान्कुलसंतानकारिणः । कालेन महता राजन्कालधर्ममुपेयिवान् ॥
data.md: Having begotten many sons all of whom by their children multiplied the race, he breathed his last, o king, after many years.

data.v: स त्वं राजेन्द्र संजातं शोकमेतन्निवर्तय । यथा त्वां केशवः प्राह व्यासश्च सुमहातपाः ॥
data.md: Do you, O foremost of kings, remove this grief of your heart, as Keshava has advised you, as also Vyasa of austere penances.

data.v: पितृपैतामहं राज्यमास्थाय दुरमुद्वह । इष्ट्वा पुण्यैर्महायज्ञैरिष्टाँल्लोकानवाप्स्यसि ॥
data.md: Rise up, O king, and carry the burden of this your ancestral kingdom, and celebrate high and great sacrifices so, that you may obtain (hereafter) whatever regions you may wish to acquire. Rise up, O king, and carry the burden of this your ancestral kingdom, and celebrate high and great sacrifices so, that you may obtain (hereafter) whatever regions you may wish to acquire.

data.v: तूष्णींभूतं तु राजानं शोचमानं युधिष्ठिरम् । तपस्वी धर्मतत्त्वज्ञः कृष्णद्वैपायनोऽब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana saidDvaipayana-Vyasa, that great ascetic conversant with the truths of religion, spoke again to king Yudhishthira, who still remained silent and plunged in grief.

data.v: प्रजानां पालनं धर्मो राज्ञां राजीवलोचन । धर्मः प्रमाणं लोकस्य नित्यं धर्मानुवर्तनम् ॥
data.md: Vyasa said 'O you having eyes like lotus petals, the protection of subjects is the duty of kings. Those men who are always observant of duty regard duty to be all powerful.

data.v: अनुतिष्ठस्व वै राजन्पितृपैतामहं पदम् । ब्राह्मणेषु च यो धर्मः स नित्यो वेदनिश्चितः ॥
data.md: Do you, therefore, O king, follow your forefathers. The penances are the duty of the Brahmanas. This is the eternal prescription of the Vedas.

data.v: तत्प्रमाणं प्रमाणानां शाश्वतं भरतर्षभ । तस्य धर्मस्य कृत्स्नस्य क्षत्रियः परिरक्षिता ॥
data.md: Penances, therefore, O foremost of Bharata's race, are the eternal duty of the Brahmanas. A Kshatriya's duty is to protect all persons.

data.v: तथा यः प्रतिहन्त्यस्य शासनं विषये नरः । स बाहुभ्यां विनिग्राह्यो लोकयात्राविघातकः ॥
data.md: That man, who addicted to earthly objects, disregards wholesome restrictions, that man who transgresses at social harmony, should be punished with a strong hand.

data.v: प्रमाणमप्रमाणं यः कुर्यान्मोहवशं गतः । भृत्यो वा यदि वा पुत्रस्तपस्वी वापि कश्चन । पापान्सर्वैरुपायैस्तान्नियच्छेद्घातयेत वा ॥
data.md: The fool who ties to transgress authority, be he an attendant, a son or even a saint-indeed all such sinful men,-should by every means be punished or even killed. That king who behaves otherwise incurs sin.

data.v: अतोऽन्यथा वर्तमानो राजा प्राप्नोति किल्बिषम् । धर्मं विनश्यमानं हि यो न रक्षेत्स धर्महा ॥
ते त्वया धर्महन्तारो निहताः सपदानुगाः । स्वधर्मे वर्तमानस्त्वं किं नु शोचसि पाण्डव । राजा हि हन्याद्दद्याच्च प्रजा रक्षेच्च धर्मतः ॥
data.md: You have simply observed the duties of your own order. Why then, O son of Pandu, do you indulge in such grief? The king should kill those that deserve death, make gifts to persons deserving of charity, and protect his subjects according to the sacred laws.

data.v: न तेऽभिशङ्के वचनं यद्ब्रवीषि तपोधन । अपरोक्षो हि ते धर्मः सर्वधर्मभृतां वर ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said I do not doubt your words, O you of great ascetic merit? Everything regarding morality and duty is well known to you, O foremost of all persons, conversant with morality and duty.

data.v: मया ह्यवध्या बहवो घातिता राज्यकारणात् । तान्यकार्याणि मे ब्रह्मन्दहन्ति च तपन्ति च ॥
data.md: I have, however, for the sake of kingdom, caused many persons to be killed. Those deeds, O Brahmana, are burning and consuming me.

data.v: ईश्वरो वा भवेत्कर्ता पुरुषो वापि भारत । हठो वा वर्तते लोके कर्मजं वा फलं स्मृतम् ॥
data.md: Vyasa said O Bharata, is the Supreme Being the actor, or is men the doer? Is everything the outcome of Chance in the worlds, or are the fruits of our pristine deeds?

data.v: ईश्वरेण नियुक्ता हि साध्वसाधु च पार्थिव । कुर्वन्ति पुरुषाः कर्म फलमीश्वरगामि तत् ॥
data.md: If man, O Bharata, does all acts, good or evil, being urged by the Supreme Being, then the fruits thereof should attach to the Supreme Being himself.

data.v: यथा हि पुरुषश्छिन्द्याद्वृक्षं परशुना वने । छेत्तुरेव भवेत्पापं परशोर्न कथंचन ॥
data.md: If a person cuts down by an axe a tree in the forest, it is the person that commits the sin and not the axe.

data.v: अथ वा तदुपादानात्प्राप्नुयुः कर्मणः फलम् । दण्डशस्त्रकृतं पापं पुरुषे तन्न विद्यते ॥
data.md: Or, if it be said that, the axe being only the material cause, the consequence of the act should attach to the animate agent, then the sin visits to the person who has made the axe. This, however, can scarcely be true.

data.v: न चैतदिष्टं कौन्तेय यदन्येन फलं कृतम् । प्राप्नुयादिति तस्माच्च ईश्वरे तन्निवेशय ॥
data.md: If this be not reasonable, O son of Kunti, that one man should be visited by the sin of an act done by another, then guided by this, you should throw all responsibility upon the Supreme Being.

data.v: अथ वा पुरुषः कर्ता कर्मणोः शुभपापयोः । न परं विद्यते तस्मादेवमन्यच्छुभं कुरु ॥
data.md: If, on the other hand, man is himself the agent of all his acts, good and evil, then there is no Supreme Being and, therefore, whatever you have done cannot bring evil consequences on you.

data.v: न हि कश्चित्क्वचिद्राजन्दिष्टात्प्रतिनिवर्तते । दण्डशस्त्रकृतं पापं पुरुषे तन्न विद्यते ॥
data.md: Or, if it be said that, the axe being only the material cause, the consequence of the act should attach to the animate agent, then the sin visits to the person who has made the axe. This, however, can scarcely be true.

data.v: यदि वा मन्यसे राजन्हठे लोकं प्रतिष्ठितम् । एवमप्यशुभं कर्म न भूतं न भविष्यति ॥
data.md: If you say it is Chance only that acts in the world, then such an act of destruction could never take place nor will ever take place.

data.v: अथाभिपत्तिर्लोकस्य कर्तव्या शुभपापयोः । अभिपन्नतमं लोके राज्ञामुद्यतदण्डनम् ॥
data.md: If it is necessary to determine what is good and what bad in the world, attend to the scriptures. In those scriptures. In those scriptures it has been ordained that kings should stand with the rod of punishment uplifted in their hands.

data.v: अथापि लोके कर्माणि समावर्तन्त भारत । शुभाशुभफलं चेमे प्राप्नुवन्तीति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: I think, O Bharata, that acts, good and bad, are perpetually revolving here as on a wheel, and men reap the fruits of those acts, good or bad, that they do.

data.v: एवं सत्यं शुभादेशं कर्मणस्तत्फलं ध्रुवम् । त्यज तद्राजशार्दूल मैवं शोके मनः कृथाः ॥
data.md: One sinful act begets another. Therefore,O foremost of kings, avoid all evil acts and do not indulge in grief.

data.v: स्वधर्मे वर्तमानस्य सापवादेऽपि भारत । एवमात्मपरित्यागस्तव राजन्न शोभनः ॥
data.md: You should follow, O Bharata, the duties, even if reproachable, of your own order. This self-destruction, o king, does not appear in you.

data.v: विहितानीह कौन्तेय प्रायश्चित्तानि कर्मिणाम् । शरीरवांस्तानि कुर्यादशरीरः पराभवेत् ॥
data.md: Expiations, O king, have been laid down for (evil) acts. He that is alive can perform them, but he that dies cannot perform them.

data.v: तद्राजञ्जीवमानस्त्वं प्रायश्चित्तं चरिष्यसि । प्रायश्चित्तमकृत्वा तु प्रेत्य तप्तासि भारत ॥
data.md: Therefore, O king, without laying down your life, perform those expiatory acts. If you do not perform them you may have to repent in the next world.”

data.v: हताः पुत्राश्च पौत्राश्च भ्रातरः पितरस्तथा । श्वशुरा गुरवश्चैव मातुलाः सपितामहाः ॥
क्षत्रियाश्च महात्मानः संबन्धिसुहृदस्तथा । वयस्या ज्ञातयश्चैव भ्रातरश्च पितामह ॥
बहवश्च मनुष्येन्द्रा नानादेशसमागताः । घातिता राज्यलुब्धेन मयैकेन पितामह ॥
तांस्तादृशानहं हत्वा धर्मनित्यान्महीक्षितः । असकृत्सोमपान्वीरान्किं प्राप्स्यामि तपोधन ॥
data.md: Having brought about the death of so many heroic kings who were always righteous and all of whom had drunk Soma in sacrifices, what end shall I obtain, O great ascetic.

data.v: दह्याम्यनिशमद्याहं चिन्तयानः पुनः पुनः । हीनां पार्थिवसिंहैस्तैः श्रीमद्भिः पृथिवीमिमाम् ॥
data.md: Thinking that this Earth has been deprived of many foremost of kings, all of whom enjoyed great prosperity, I burn continually to this day.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा ज्ञातिवधं घोरं हतांश्च शतशः परान् । कोटिशश्च नरानन्यान्परितप्ये पितामह ॥
data.md: Having seen this destruction of kinsmen and of millions of other men, I burn with grief, Ograndfather.

data.v: का नु तासां वरस्त्रीणामवस्थाद्य भविष्यति । विहीनानां स्वतनयैः पतिभिर्भ्रातृभिस्तथा ॥
data.md: Oh, what will be the condition of those foremost of ladies who have been deprived of sons, of husbands, and of brothers.

data.v: अस्मानन्तकरान्घोरान्पाण्डवान्वृष्णिसंहितान् । आक्रोशन्त्यः कृशा दीना निपतन्त्यश्च भूतले ॥
data.md: Censuring the Pandavas and the Vrishnis as cruel murderers, those ladies, reduced greatly and sunk in grief, will throw themselves on the Earth.

data.v: अपश्यन्त्यः पितॄन्भ्रातॄन्पतीन्पुत्रांश्च योषितः । त्यक्त्वा प्राणान्प्रियान्सर्वा गमिष्यन्ति यमक्षयम् ॥
वत्सलत्वाद्द्विजश्रेष्ठ तत्र मे नास्ति संशयः । व्यक्तं सौक्ष्म्याच्च धर्मस्य प्राप्स्यामः स्त्रीवधं वयम् ॥
ते वयं सुहृदो हत्वा कृत्वा पापमनन्तकम् । नरके निपतिष्यामो ह्यधःशिरस एव च ॥
data.md: Having killed our kinsmen and friends and thereby committed a sin which cannot be expiated, we shall have tù fall into hell with heads downwards.

data.v: शरीराणि विमोक्ष्यामस्तपसोग्रेण सत्तम । आश्रमांश्च विशेषांस्त्वं ममाचक्ष्व पितामह ॥
data.md: O best of men, we shall, therefore, reduce our bodies with the austerest of penances! Tell me, O grand-father, what mode of life I should follow.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरस्य तद्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा द्वैपायनस्तदा । समीक्ष्य निपुणं बुद्ध्या ऋषिः प्रोवाच पाण्डवम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Hearing these words of Yudhishthira, the Dvaipayana-Rishi, having reflected keenly for sometime, said again to the son of Pandu.

data.v: मा विषादं कृथा राजन्क्षत्रधर्ममनुस्मर । स्वधर्मेण हता ह्येते क्षत्रियाः क्षत्रियर्षभ ॥
data.md: Vyasa said, Remembering the duties of a Kshatriya, O king, do not indulge in grief! All those Kshatriyas, O foremost of Kshatriyas, have been killed while following their legitimate duties.

data.v: काङ्क्षमाणाः श्रियं कृत्स्नां पृथिव्यां च महद्यशः । कृतान्तविधिसंयुक्ताः कालेन निधनं गताः ॥
data.md: Pursuing great prosperity and fame on Earth, those foremost of men, all of whom were liable to death, have died through the influence of Time.

data.v: न त्वं हन्ता न भीमोऽपि नार्जुनो न यमावपि । कालः पर्यायधर्मेण प्राणानादत्त देहिनाम् ॥
data.md: You have not been their slayer, nor this Bhima, nor Arjuna, nor the twins. It is Time that took away their lives according to the great law of change.

data.v: न यस्य मातापितरौ नानुग्राह्योऽस्ति कश्चन । कर्मसाक्षी प्रजानां यस्तेन कालेन संहृताः ॥
data.md: Time has neither mother, nor father, nor anybody to whom he shows any mercy. He is the witness of the acts of all creatures, By him have they been snatched away.

data.v: हेतुमात्रमिदं तस्य कालस्य पुरुषर्षभ । यद्धन्ति भूतैर्भूतानि तदस्मै रूपमैश्वरम् ॥
data.md: This battle, O foremost of Bharata's race, was only an occasion ordained by him. He brought out the destruction of creatures through the instrumentality of Time. In this manner it displays its irresistible power.

data.v: कर्ममूर्त्यात्मकं विद्धि साक्षिणं शुभपापयोः । सुखदुःखगुणोदर्कं कालं कालफलप्रदम् ॥
data.md: Know that Time depends upon the fetters of action and is the witness of all actions good and evil. It is Time that brings about the fruits, pleasurable or miserable, of our actions.

data.v: तेषामपि महाबाहो कर्माणि परिचिन्तय । विनाशहेतुकारित्वे यैस्ते कालवशं गताः ॥
data.md: Think, O mighty-armed one, of the acts of those Kshatriyas that have been killed. Those acts were the causes of their destruction and it is on account of them that they have died.

data.v: आत्मनश्च विजानीहि नियमव्रतशीलताम् । यदा त्वमीदृशं कर्म विधिनाक्रम्य कारितः ॥
data.md: Think also of your own acts of observances of vows with controlled mind, And think also how you have been compelled by the Supreme Ordainer to do such an act.

data.v: त्वष्ट्रेव विहितं यन्त्रं यथा स्थापयितुर्वशे । कर्मणा कालयुक्तेन तथेदं भ्राम्यते जगत् ॥
data.md: As a weapon made by a smith or carpenter is under the control of the person who uses it, and moves as moves it, likewise this universe, controlled by actions done in Time, moves as those actions move it.

data.v: पुरुषस्य हि दृष्ट्वेमामुत्पत्तिमनिमित्ततः । यदृच्छया विनाशं च शोकहर्षावनर्थकौ ॥
data.md: Beholding that the births and deaths of creatures take place without any perceptible cause and order, grief and joy are absolutely useless.

data.v: व्यलीकं चापि यत्त्वत्र चित्तवैतंसिकं तव । तदर्थमिष्यते राजन्प्रायश्चित्तं तदाचर ॥
data.md: Although this confusion of your heart is a mere delusion, still, if you like, O king, perform expiatory rites.

data.v: इदं च श्रूयते पार्थ युद्धे देवासुरे पुरा । असुरा भ्रातरो ज्येष्ठा देवाश्चापि यवीयसः ॥
data.md: It is heard, O Partha, that the gods and the Asuras fought against each other. The Asuras were the elder, and the gods the younger brothers.

data.v: तेषामपि श्रीनिमित्तं महानासीत्समुच्छ्रयः । युद्धं वर्षसहस्राणि द्वात्रिंशदभवत्किल ॥
data.md: Seeking prosperity, they fought a dreadful battle between them. The fight lasted for thirtytwo thousand years.

data.v: एकार्णवां महीं कृत्वा रुधिरेण परिप्लुताम् । जघ्नुर्दैत्यांस्तदा देवास्त्रिदिवं चैव लेभिरे ॥
data.md: Converting the Earth to one vast sea of blood, the gods killed the Daityas and occupied the celestial region.

data.v: तथैव पृथिवीं लब्ध्वा ब्राह्मणा वेदपारगाः । संश्रिता दानवानां वै साह्यार्थे दर्पमोहिताः ॥
data.md: Having occupied the Earth, a host of Brahmanas, conversant with the Vedas, armed themselves, stupefied with pride, with the Danavas for helping in the fight.

data.v: शालावृका इति ख्यातास्त्रिषु लोकेषु भारत । अष्टाशीतिसहस्राणि ते चापि विबुधैर्हताः ॥
data.md: They were known by the name of Shalavrika and were eighty-eight thousand in number. All of them, however, were killed by the gods.

data.v: धर्मव्युच्छित्तिमिच्छन्तो येऽधर्मस्य प्रवर्तकाः । हन्तव्यास्ते दुरात्मानो देवैर्दैत्या इवोल्बणाः ॥
data.md: Those wicked persons who desire to root out virtue and encourage sinfulness deserve io be killed even as the furious Daityas were killed by the gods.

data.v: एकं हत्वा यदि कुले शिष्टानां स्यादनामयम् । कुलं हत्वाथ राष्ट्रं वा न तद्वृत्तोपघातकम् ॥
data.md: If by killing a single individual a family may be saved, or, if by killing a single family the whole kingdom may be saved, such an act of slaughter is not sinful.

data.v: अधर्मरूपो धर्मो हि कश्चिदस्ति नराधिप । धर्मश्चाधर्मरूपोऽस्ति तच्च ज्ञेयं विपश्चिता ॥
data.md: Sin, O king, sometimes becomes virtue, and virtue sometimes becomes sin. The learned know which is which.

data.v: तस्मात्संस्तम्भयात्मानं श्रुतवानसि पाण्डव । देवैः पूर्वगतं मार्गमनुयातोऽसि भारत ॥
data.md: Therefore, console yourself, O son of Pandu, for you are well read in the scriptures. You have, O Bharata, only followed the path of the very gods.

data.v: न हीदृशा गमिष्यन्ति नरकं पाण्डवर्षभ । भ्रातॄनाश्वासयैतांस्त्वं सुहृदश्च परंतप ॥
data.md: Men like yourselves never go to hell, o foremost of Pandu's race! Comfort these your brothers and all your friends, O scorcher of foes.

data.v: यो हि पापसमारम्भे कार्ये तद्भावभावितः । कुर्वन्नपि तथैव स्यात्कृत्वा च निरपत्रपः ॥
data.md: He who deliberately commits sinful acts, and committing them feels no compunction but continues the same as before, is known as a great sinner. There is no expiation for him, and his sins never disappear.

data.v: तस्मिंस्तत्कलुषं सर्वं समाप्तमिति शब्दितम् । प्रायश्चित्तं न तस्यास्ति ह्रासो वा पापकर्मणः ॥
data.md: He who deliberately commits sinful acts, and committing them feels no compunction but continues the same as before, is known as a great sinner. There is no expiation for him, and his sins never disappear.

data.v: त्वं तु शुक्लाभिजातीयः परदोषेण कारितः । अनिच्छमानः कर्मेदं कृत्वा च परितप्यसे ॥
data.md: You are born in a noble family. Urged by the sons of others, you have most reluctantly done this, and having done this you repent for it.

data.v: अश्वमेधो महायज्ञः प्रायश्चित्तमुदाहृतम् । तमाहर महाराज विपाप्मैवं भविष्यसि ॥
data.md: The rite of Horse-sacrifice, has been indicated as an expiation for you. Make preparations for that sacrifice, O king, and you ! will be freed off of all your sins.

data.v: मरुद्भिः सह जित्वारीन्मघवान्पाकशासनः । एकैकं क्रतुमाहृत्य शतकृत्वः शतक्रतुः ॥
data.md: Having defeated his foes with the help of the Maruts, Indra gradually celebrated a hundred sacrifices and became Shatakratu.

data.v: पूतपाप्मा जितस्वर्गो लोकान्प्राप्य सुखोदयान् । मरुद्गणवृतः शक्रः शुशुभे भासयन्दिशः ॥
data.md: Freed from sin, occupying heaven, and having obtained many blissful regions and great happiness and prosperity, Shakra surrounded by the Maruts, is shining in beauty, and lighting up all the quarters with his effulgence.

data.v: स्वर्गलोके महीयन्तमप्सरोभिः शचीपतिम् । ऋषयः पर्युपासन्ते देवाश्च विबुधेश्वरम् ॥
data.md: The lord of Shachi is worshipped in the heaven by the Apsaras. The Rishis and the other gods all adore himn with respect.

data.v: सोऽयं त्वमिह संक्रान्तो विक्रमेण वसुंधराम् । निर्जिताश्च महीपाला विक्रमेण त्वयानघ ॥
data.md: You have obtained the Earth through your prowess. All the kings have been defeated by you, O sinless one, through your prowess.

data.v: तेषां पुराणि राष्ट्राणि गत्वा राजन्सुहृद्वृतः । भ्रातॄन्पुत्रांश्च पौत्रांश्च स्वे स्वे राज्येऽभिषेचय ॥
data.md: Proceeding with your friends to their kingdoms, O king, install their brothers, sons, or grandsons on their thrones.

data.v: बालानपि च गर्भस्थान्सान्त्वानि समुदाचरन् । रञ्जयन्प्रकृतीः सर्वाः परिपाहि वसुंधराम् ॥
data.md: Treating kindly even the children in the womb, make you subjects glad and happy, and govern the Earth,

data.v: कुमारो नास्ति येषां च कन्यास्तत्राभिषेचय । कामाशयो हि स्त्रीवर्गः शोकमेवं प्रहास्यति ॥
data.md: Install on their thrones the daughters of those that have no sons. Women are fond of pleasure and power. By this they will shake off their sorrows and become happy.

data.v: एवमाश्वासनं कृत्वा सर्वराष्ट्रेषु भारत । यजस्व वाजिमेधेन यथेन्द्रो विजयी पुरा ॥
data.md: Having comforted the entire empire in this way, O Bharata, worship the gods in a Horsesacrifice as did the victorious Indra in days of yore. It is not proper for us to grieve for those great Kshatriyas, O foremost of Kshatriyas. Stupefied by the power of the Destroyer, they have died while satisfying the duties of their own order.

data.v: अशोच्यास्ते महात्मानः क्षत्रियाः क्षत्रियर्षभ । स्वकर्मभिर्गता नाशं कृतान्तबलमोहिताः ॥
data.md: Having comforted the entire empire in this way, O Bharata, worship the gods in a Horsesacrifice as did the victorious Indra in days of yore. It is not proper for us to grieve for those great Kshatriyas, O foremost of Kshatriyas. Stupefied by the power of the Destroyer, they have died while satisfying the duties of their own order.

data.v: अवाप्तः क्षत्रधर्मस्ते राज्यं प्राप्तमकल्मषम् । चरस्व धर्मं कौन्तेय श्रेयान्यः प्रेत्य भाविकः ॥
data.md: You have performed the duties of a Kshatriya and obtained the Earth thornless. Follow your own duties, O son of Kunti, for then, O Bharata, you will enjoy happiness in the next world.

data.v: कानि कृत्वेह कर्माणि प्रायश्चित्तीयते नरः । किं कृत्वा चैव मुच्येत तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said 'What are the necessary rites of expiation? And what are those acts which one must do for being released from sin? Tell me this, O grandfather.

data.v: अकुर्वन्विहितं कर्म प्रतिषिद्धानि चाचरन् । प्रायश्चित्तीयते ह्येवं नरो मिथ्या च वर्तयन् ॥
data.md: Vyasa said “Having omitted to perform those acts that have been ordained, and done those that have been forbidden, and have behaved deceitfully, a man becomes liable to perform expiation.

data.v: सूर्येणाभ्युदितो यश्च ब्रह्मचारी भवत्युत । तथा सूर्याभिनिर्मुक्तः कुनखी श्यावदन्नपि ॥
परिवित्तिः परिवेत्ता ब्रह्मोज्झो यश्च कुत्सकः । दिधिषूपतिस्तथा यः स्यादग्रेदिधिषुरेव च ॥
अवकीर्णी भवेद्यश्च द्विजातिवधकस्तथा । अतीर्थे ब्रह्मणस्त्यागी तीर्थे चाप्रतिपादकः ॥
ग्रामयाजी च कौन्तेय राज्ञश्च परिविक्रयी । शूद्रस्त्रीवधको यश्च पूर्वः पूर्वस्तु गर्हितः ॥
वृथापशुसमालम्भी वनदाहस्य कारकः । अनृतेनोपचर्ता च प्रतिरोद्धा गुरोस्तथा ॥
यश्चाग्नीनपविध्येत तथैव ब्रह्मविक्रयी । एतान्येनांसि सर्वाणि व्युत्क्रान्तसमयश्च यः ॥
अकार्याण्यपि वक्ष्यामि यानि तानि निबोध मे । लोकवेदविरुद्धानि तान्येकाग्रमनाः शृणु ॥
data.md: I shall now mention other acts which men should not do, viz., acts that are forbidden by men and the Vedas. Listen to me with rapt attention.

data.v: स्वधर्मस्य परित्यागः परधर्मस्य च क्रिया । अयाज्ययाजनं चैव तथाभक्ष्यस्य भक्षणम् ॥
शरणागतसंत्यागो भृत्यस्याभरणं तथा । रसानां विक्रयश्चापि तिर्यग्योनिवधस्तथा ॥
आधानादीनि कर्माणि शक्तिमान्न करोति यः । अप्रयच्छंश्च सर्वाणि नित्यं देयानि भारत ॥
दक्षिणानामदानं च ब्राह्मणस्वाभिमर्शनम् । सर्वाण्येतान्यकार्याणि प्राहुर्धर्मविदो जनाः ॥
पित्रा विभजते पुत्रो यश्च स्याद्गुरुतल्पगः । अप्रजायन्नधर्मेण भवत्याधर्मिको जनः ॥
data.md: The son that quarrels with the father, the person who violates the bed of his preceptor, one who neglects to beget children on his wife, are all sinful, O foremost of men.

data.v: उक्तान्येतानि कर्माणि विस्तरेणेतरेण च । यानि कुर्वन्नकुर्वंश्च प्रायश्चित्तीयते जनः ॥
data.md: I have now described to you in brief as also in detail, those acts and omissions by which a man is compelled to perform expiation.

data.v: एतान्येव तु कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि मानवान् । येषु येषु निमित्तेषु न लिम्पन्त्यथ तच्छृणु ॥
data.md: Listen now to the circumstances under which men, by even committing these acts, are not sullied with sin.

data.v: प्रगृह्य शस्त्रमायान्तमपि वेदान्तगं रणे । जिघांसन्तं निहत्याजौ न तेन ब्रह्महा भवेत् ॥
data.md: If a Brahmana well acquainted with the Vedas takes up arins and tries to kill you in battle, you may proceed against him for taking his life. By such an act the slayer does not become guilty of Brahmanicide.

data.v: अपि चाप्यत्र कौन्तेय मन्त्रो वेदेषु पठ्यते । वेदप्रमाणविहितं तं धर्मं प्रब्रवीमि ते ॥
data.md: There is a Mantra in the Vedas, O son of Kunti, that sanctions it, I describe to you only those practices which are sanctioned by the authority of the Vedas.

data.v: अपेतं ब्राह्मणं वृत्ताद्यो हन्यादाततायिनम् । न तेन ब्रह्महा स स्यान्मन्युस्तं मन्युमृच्छति ॥
data.md: One who kills a Brahmana who deviates from his own duties and who goes armed for killing a man, does not truly become the killer of a Brahmania. In such a case it is the anger of the slayer that proceeds against the anger of the slain.

data.v: प्राणात्यये तथाज्ञानादाचरन्मदिरामपि । अचोदितो धर्मपरः पुनः संस्कारमर्हति ॥
data.md: A person by drinking alcohol unknowingly or upon the advice of a virtuous physician when his life is in a danger should have the expiatory rites performed once more in his case.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं कौन्तेयाभक्ष्यभक्षणम् । प्रायश्चित्तविधानेन सर्वमेतेन शुध्यति ॥
data.md: All that I have told you, O son of Kunti, about the eating of forbidden food, inay be purified by such expiatory rites.

data.v: गुरुतल्पं हि गुर्वर्थे न दूषयति मानवम् । उद्दालकः श्वेतकेतुं जनयामास शिष्यतः ॥
data.md: Knowing the preceptor's wife at the preceptor's behest, does not stain the pupil. The sage Uddalaka caused his son Shvetaketu to be begotten by a disciple.

data.v: स्तेयं कुर्वंस्तु गुर्वर्थमापत्सु न निबध्यते । बहुशः कामकारेण न चेद्यः संप्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: A person by committing theft for his preceptor in a time of distress, is not sullied by that sin. One, however, who commits theft for procuring enjoyments for himself, becomes stained.

data.v: अन्यत्र ब्राह्मणस्वेभ्य आददानो न दुष्यति । स्वयमप्राशिता यश्च न स पापेन लिप्यते ॥
data.md: One is not sullied by stealing from other than Brahmanas in times of distress and for the sake of his preceptor. Only one who steals under such circumstances without reserving for himself any portion thereof, is not sullied by sin.

data.v: प्राणत्राणेऽनृतं वाच्यमात्मनो वा परस्य वा । गुर्वर्थे स्त्रीषु चैव स्याद्विवाहकरणेषु च ॥
data.md: A falsehood may be uttered for saving one's own life or that of another, or for the sake of one's preceptor, or for gratifying a woman, or for bringing about a marriage.

data.v: नावर्तते व्रतं स्वप्ने शुक्रमोक्षे कथंचन । आज्यहोमः समिद्धेऽग्नौ प्रायश्चित्तं विधीयते ॥
data.md: One's vow of celibacy is not broken by having nocturnal pollutions. In such cases the expiation consists in the pouring of libations of clarified butter on the burning fire.

data.v: पारिवित्त्यं च पतिते नास्ति प्रव्रजिते तथा । भिक्षिते पारदार्यं च न तद्धर्मस्य दूषकम् ॥
data.md: If the elder brother is killed or has left the world, the younger brother does not commit sin by marrying. He who solicited by a woman, knows her commits no sin.

data.v: वृथापशुसमालम्भं नैव कुर्यान्न कारयेत् । अनुग्रहः पशूणां हि संस्कारो विधिचोदितः ॥
data.md: One should not kill or cause to be killed an animal except in a sacrifice. Animals have become sacred for the kindness shown towards them by the creator, himself in the ordinance laid down by him.

data.v: अनर्हे ब्राह्मणे दत्तमज्ञानात्तन्न दूषकम् । सकारणं तथा तीर्थेऽतीर्थे वा प्रतिपादनम् ॥
data.md: By making a gift unknowingly to an undeserving Brahmana one does not commit sin. The ignorant omission of behaving with liberality towards a deserving person does not lead to sin.

data.v: स्त्रियस्तथापचारिण्यो निष्कृतिः स्याददूषिका । अपि सा पूयते तेन न तु भर्ता प्रदुष्यते ॥
data.md: By forsaking an unchaste wife one does not incur sin. By such treatment the woman herself may be purified while the husband may avoid sin.

data.v: तत्त्वं ज्ञात्वा तु सोमस्य विक्रयः स्याददूषकः । असमर्थस्य भृत्यस्य विसर्गः स्याददोषवान् । वनदाहो गवामर्थे क्रियमाणो न दूषकः ॥
data.md: One who knows the true uses of the Soma juice, does not commit sin by selling it. By dismissing a servant who is incapable of doing service, one is not visited with sin.

data.v: उक्तान्येतानि कर्माणि यानि कुर्वन्न दुष्यति । प्रायश्चित्तानि वक्ष्यामि विस्तरेणैव भारत ॥
data.md: I have now described to you in brief as also in detail, those acts and omissions by which a man is compelled to perform expiation.

data.v: तपसा कर्मभिश्चैव प्रदानेन च भारत । पुनाति पापं पुरुषः पूतश्चेन्न प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: Vyasa said ‘By penances, religious rites, and gifts, O Bharata, a man purify his sins if he does not commit them again.

data.v: एककालं तु भुञ्जानश्चरन्भैक्षं स्वकर्मकृत् । कपालपाणिः खट्वाङ्गी ब्रह्मचारी सदोत्थितः ॥
data.md: By living upon only one meal a day, procured by begging, by doing all his acts himself, by going about begging with a human skull in one hand and a staff with a skull on it in another, by becoming a Brahmacharin and always ready for work, by renouncing all malice, by sleeping on the naked earth, by declaring his offence publicly, by doing all this for full twelve years, a person can cleanse himself from the sin of a Brahmanicide.

data.v: अनसूयुरधःशायी कर्म लोके प्रकाशयन् । पूर्णैर्द्वादशभिर्वर्षैर्ब्रह्महा विप्रमुच्यते ॥
षड्भिर्वर्षैः कृच्छ्रभोजी ब्रह्महा पूयते नरः । मासे मासे समश्नंस्तु त्रिभिर्वर्षैः प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: By living upon poor diet every day for six years. a person may be purged off that sin. By observing a more difficult vow about food one may be cleansed in three years.

data.v: संवत्सरेण मासाशी पूयते नात्र संशयः । तथैवोपरमन्राजन्स्वल्पेनापि प्रमुच्यते ॥
क्रतुना चाश्वमेधेन पूयते नात्र संशयः । ये चास्यावभृथे स्नान्ति केचिदेवंविधा नराः ॥
ते सर्वे पूतपाप्मानो भवन्तीति परा श्रुतिः । ब्राह्मणार्थे हतो युद्धे मुच्यते ब्रह्महत्यया ॥
गवां शतसहस्रं तु पात्रेभ्यः प्रतिपादयन् । ब्रह्महा विप्रमुच्येत सर्वपापेभ्य एव च ॥
data.md: By giving away a hundred thousand kine to deserving persons, one becomes cleansed of the sin of Brahmanicide as also of all other sins.

data.v: कपिलानां सहस्राणि यो दद्यात्पञ्चविंशतिम् । दोग्ध्रीणां स च पापेभ्यः सर्वेभ्यो विप्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: One that gives away twenty-five thousand kine of the Kapila breed all of them having calves becomes cleansed of all his sins.

data.v: गोसहस्रं सवत्सानां दोग्ध्रीणां प्राणसंशये । साधुभ्यो वै दरिद्रेभ्यो दत्त्वा मुच्येत किल्बिषात् ॥
data.md: One who, at the time of death, presents a thousand kine with calves to poor but deserving persons, becomes freed for sin.

data.v: शतं वै यस्तु काम्बोजान्ब्राह्मणेभ्यः प्रयच्छति । नियतेभ्यो महीपाल स च पापात्प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: That man, o king, who gives away a hundred horse of the Kamvoja breed to Brahmanas of regulated conduct, becomes freed from sin.

data.v: मनोरथं तु यो दद्यादेकस्मा अपि भारत । न कीर्तयेत दत्त्वा यः स च पापात्प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: That man, O Bharata, who gives to even one man all that he asks for, and who, having given it, does not advertise his act, becomes freed from sin,

data.v: सुरापानं सकृत्पीत्वा योऽग्निवर्णां पिबेद्द्विजः । स पावयत्यथात्मानमिह लोके परत्र च ॥
data.md: If a person who has once taken wine, drinks hot water, he purifies himself both here and hereafter.

data.v: मेरुप्रपातं प्रपतञ्ज्वलनं वा समाविशन् । महाप्रस्थानमातिष्ठन्मुच्यते सर्वकिल्बिषैः ॥
data.md: By falling from the summit of a mountain or entering a burning fire, or by going on journey for ever after renouncing the world, one is freed from all sins.

data.v: बृहस्पतिसवेनेष्ट्वा सुरापो ब्राह्मणः पुनः । समितिं ब्राह्मणैर्गच्छेदिति वै ब्राह्मणी श्रुतिः ॥
data.md: By celebrating the sacrifice laid down by Brihaspati, a Brahmana who drinks wine may obtain the region of Brahmana this has been said by Brahma himself.

data.v: भूमिप्रदानं कुर्याद्यः सुरां पीत्वा विमत्सरः । पुनर्न च पिबेद्राजन्संस्कृतः शुध्यते नरः ॥
data.md: If a person, after having drunk wine, becomes humble and makes a gift of land, and abstains himself from it ever afterwards he becomes purified and cleansed.

data.v: गुरुतल्पी शिलां तप्तामायसीमधिसंविशेत् । पाणावाधाय वा शेफं प्रव्रजेदूर्ध्वदर्शनः ॥
data.md: The person that has violated his preceptor's bed, should lie down on a sheet of heated iron, and having cut off the male organ, should leave the world and live in the woods, with eyes always turned upwards.

data.v: शरीरस्य विमोक्षेण मुच्यते कर्मणोऽशुभात् । कर्मभ्यो विप्रमुच्यन्ते यत्ताः संवत्सरं स्त्रियः ॥
data.md: By renouncing one's body, one become cleansed of all his sins. Women, by leading a regular life for one year, becomes freed off of all their sins.

data.v: महाव्रतं चरेद्यस्तु दद्यात्सर्वस्वमेव तु । गुर्वर्थे वा हतो युद्धे स मुच्येत्कर्मणोऽशुभात् ॥
data.md: The person who practises a very rigid vow, or gives away the whole of his wealth, or dies in a battle fought for the sake of his preceptor, becomes freed off of all his sins.

data.v: अनृतेनोपचर्ता च प्रतिरोद्धा गुरोस्तथा । उपहृत्य प्रियं तस्मै तस्मात्पापात्प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: One who utters untruth before one's preceptor or acts against his wishes, becomes freed of that sin by doing something agreeable to one's preceptor.

data.v: अवकीर्णिनिमित्तं तु ब्रह्महत्याव्रतं चरेत् । खरचर्मवासाः षण्मासं तथा मुच्येत किल्बिषात् ॥
data.md: One who has deviated from the vow of celibacy may become freed of that sin by being clad in a hide of a cow for six months and observing the penances laid down for Brahmanicide.

data.v: परदारापहारी च परस्यापहरन्वसु । संवत्सरं व्रती भूत्वा तथा मुच्येत किल्बिषात् ॥
data.md: One who has been guilty of adultery or of theft, is purified by practising rigid vows for a year.

data.v: स्तेयं तु यस्यापहरेत्तस्मै दद्यात्समं वसु । विविधेनाभ्युपायेन तेन मुच्येत किल्बिषात् ॥
data.md: When one steals another's property, one should, by all means in his power, return to the said party another property of the value of what has been stolen. One may then be freed of the sin.

data.v: कृच्छ्राद्द्वादशरात्रेण स्वभ्यस्तेन दशावरम् । परिवेत्ता भवेत्पूतः परिवित्तिश्च भारत ॥
data.md: The younger brother who has married before his elder brother is married, as also the elder brother whose younger brother has married before him, becomes freed by observing a rigid vow, with controlled mind for twelve nights.

data.v: निवेश्यं तु भवेत्तेन सदा तारयिता पितॄन् । न तु स्त्रिया भवेद्दोषो न तु सा तेन लिप्यते ॥
data.md: The younger brother, however, should marry again for rescuing his departed manes. Upon such second marriage the first wife becomes purified and her husband himself would not commit sin by taking her.

data.v: भजने ह्यृतुना शुद्धं चातुर्मास्यं विधीयते । स्त्रियस्तेन विशुध्यन्ति इति धर्मविदो विदुः ॥
data.md: Men well read in the scriptures say that women may be freed of even the greatest sins by practising the vow of Chaturmasya living all the while upon restricted and pure diet.

data.v: स्त्रियस्त्वाशङ्किताः पापैर्नोपगम्या हि जानता । रजसा ता विशुध्यन्ते भस्मना भाजनं यथा ॥
data.md: Persons well read in the scriptures take no notice of the sins that women may commit at heart. Whatever their sins may be they are cleaned by their menstrual course like a metallic plate that is cleansed with ashes.

data.v: चतुष्पात्सकलो धर्मो ब्राह्मणानां विधीयते । पादावकृष्टो राजन्ये तथा धर्मो विधीयते ॥
data.md: It has been ordained that a Brahmana should acquire and practise all the virtues. For a Kshatriya it has been ordained that he should acquire and practise one fourth of all virtues.

data.v: तथा वैश्ये च शूद्रे च पादः पादो विधीयते । विद्यादेवंविधेनैषां गुरुलाघवनिश्चयम् ॥
data.md: So, a Vaishya should practise less (than a Kshatriya's) by a fourth, and a Shudra less (than a Vaishya's) for a fourth. The gravity or lightness of sins of each of the four orders, should thus be ascertained.

data.v: तिर्यग्योनिवधं कृत्वा द्रुमांश्छित्त्वेतरान्बहून् । त्रिरात्रं वायुभक्षः स्यात्कर्म च प्रथयेन्नरः ॥
data.md: Having killed a bird or an animal, or cut down living trees, a person should declare his sin publicly and fast for three nights.

data.v: अगम्यागमने राजन्प्रायश्चित्तं विधीयते । आर्द्रवस्त्रेण षण्मासं विहार्यं भस्मशायिना ॥
data.md: By having intercourse with one whom intercourse is forbidden, the expiation consists in wandering in wet clothes and sleeping on a bed of ashes.

data.v: एष एव तु सर्वेषामकार्याणां विधिर्भवेत् । ब्राह्मणोक्तेन विधिना दृष्टान्तागमहेतुभिः ॥
data.md: These, O king, are the expiations for sins, as laid down in scriptures and by Brahmana himself.

data.v: सावित्रीमप्यधीयानः शुचौ देशे मिताशनः । अहिंस्रोऽमन्दकोऽजल्पन्मुच्यते सर्वकिल्बिषैः ॥
data.md: A Brahmana may be freed off all sins by reciting the Gayatri in a sacred place, living all the while upon restricted fare, casting off malice, abandoning anger and hate, unaffected by praise and blame, and observing the vow of silence.

data.v: अहःसु सततं तिष्ठेदभ्याकाशं निशि स्वपेत् । त्रिरह्नस्त्रिर्निशायाश्च सवासा जलमाविशेत् ॥
data.md: He should during the day be under shelter of the sky and should sleep in the same way at night, thrice during the day, and thrice during the night, he should also plunge with the clothes into a river or lake for performing his ablutions.

data.v: स्त्रीशूद्रपतितांश्चापि नाभिभाषेद्व्रतान्वितः । पापान्यज्ञानतः कृत्वा मुच्येदेवंव्रतो द्विजः ॥
data.md: Practising rigid vows, he should abstain from speaking with women, Shudras, and degraded persons. A Brahmana by observing such rules may be freed off of all sins unconsciously committed by him.

data.v: शुभाशुभफलं प्रेत्य लभते भूतसाक्षिकः । अतिरिच्येत्तयोर्यत्तु तत्कर्ता लभते फलम् ॥
data.md: A person reaps in the next world the fruits, good or bad, of his acts here which are all seen by the elements. Proportionate to virtue or vice, one enjoys or suffers the consequences.

data.v: तस्माद्दानेन तपसा कर्मणा च शुभं फलम् । वर्धयेदशुभं कृत्वा यथा स्यादतिरेकवान् ॥
data.md: By knowledge, by penances, and by pious acts, therefore, one multiplies his happiness. One, therefore, may likewise increase his misery by committing sinful acts.

data.v: कुर्याच्छुभानि कर्माणि निमित्ते पापकर्मणाम् । दद्यान्नित्यं च वित्तानि तथा मुच्येत किल्बिषात् ॥
data.md: One should, therefore, perform righteous deeds and avoid altogether sinful ones.

data.v: अनुरूपं हि पापस्य प्रायश्चित्तमुदाहृतम् । महापातकवर्जं तु प्रायश्चित्तं विधीयते ॥
data.md: I have now described what the expiations of the sins are. There is expiation for every sin except those that are (highly heinous.)

data.v: भक्ष्याभक्ष्येषु सर्वेषु वाच्यावाच्ये तथैव च । अज्ञानज्ञानयो राजन्विहितान्यनुजानते ॥
data.md: As regards sins regarding unclean food and the like, and improper speeches, etc., they are of two classes, viz., those committed knowingly and those that committed unconsciously.

data.v: जानता तु कृतं पापं गुरु सर्वं भवत्युत । अज्ञानात्स्खलिते दोषे प्रायश्चित्तं विधीयते ॥
data.md: All sins that are committed knowingly are serious, while those that are committed unwittingly are light. there is expiation for both.

data.v: शक्यते विधिना पापं यथोक्तेन व्यपोहितुम् । आस्तिके श्रद्दधाने तु विधिरेष विधीयते ॥
data.md: Forsooth, sin is capable of being washed away by following the ordinances. Those ordinances, however, have been laid down only for them who have faith in God.

data.v: नास्तिकाश्रद्दधानेषु पुरुषेषु कदाचन । दम्भदोषप्रधानेषु विधिरेष न दृश्यते ॥
data.md: They are not for atheists or those that have no faith, or those who are full of pride and malice.

data.v: शिष्टाचारश्च शिष्टश्च धर्मो धर्मभृतां वर । सेवितव्यो नरव्याघ्र प्रेत्य चेह सुखार्थिना ॥
data.md: A person, O foremost of men, who seeks well-being both here and hereafter should, O foremost of virtuous men, always follow virtue, hear the righteous, and satisfy the duties that have been ordained for him.

data.v: स राजन्मोक्ष्यसे पापात्तेन पूर्वेण हेतुना । त्राणार्थं वा वधेनैषामथ वा नृपकर्मणा ॥
data.md: Therefore, for the reasons already pointed out by me, you, O king, shall be freed off of all your sins, for you have slain your enemies in the discharge of your duties as a king and for the protection of your life and inheritance,

data.v: अथ वा ते घृणा काचित्प्रायश्चित्तं चरिष्यसि । मा त्वेवानार्यजुष्टेन कर्मणा निधनं गमः ॥
data.md: Or, if despite it, you still consider yourself sinful, perform expiation. Do not cast away your life for such grief that does not become a wise man.'

data.v: एवमुक्तो भगवता धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः । चिन्तयित्वा मुहूर्तं तु प्रत्युवाच तपोधनम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said This accosted by the holy Rishi, king Yudhishthira the just, having thought for a short time, said these words to the sage.

data.v: किं भक्ष्यं किमभक्ष्यं च किं च देयं प्रशस्यते । किं च पात्रमपात्रं वा तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Tell me, O grandfather, what food is clean and what, unclean, what gift is praiseworthy, and who is the deserving, and who, undeserving (recipients of gifts).

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । सिद्धानां चैव संवादं मनोश्चैव प्रजापतेः ॥
data.md: Vyasa said “Regarding it is cited a old discourse between the ascetics and that lord of creation, viz., Manu.

data.md: Refusal to take what is not given, gift, study of sacred books, penance, abstention from injury, truth, freedom from anger, and adoration of the gods in sacrifices,-these are the marks of virtue.

data.md: Virtue again, according to time and place, becomes sin. Thus misappropriation of another's property, untruth, and injury and killing, may under special circumstances, become virtue.

data.v: द्विविधौ चाप्युभावेतौ धर्माधर्मौ विजानताम् । अप्रवृत्तिः प्रवृत्तिश्च द्वैविध्यं लोकवेदयोः ॥
अप्रवृत्तेरमर्त्यत्वं मर्त्यत्वं कर्मणः फलम् । अशुभस्याशुभं विद्याच्छुभस्य शुभमेव च ॥

अप्रेक्षापूर्वकरणादशुभानां शुभं फलम् । ऊर्ध्वं भवति संदेहादिह दृष्टार्थमेव वा । अप्रेक्षापूर्वकरणात्प्रायश्चित्तं विधीयते ॥
data.md: Expiation has been laid down, for an act undertaken for the purpose of doing mischief (to some one) in the future, as well as for an act done whose consequence is apparently mischievous.

data.v: क्रोधमोहकृते चैव दृष्टान्तागमहेतुभिः । शरीराणामुपक्लेशो मनसश्च प्रियाप्रिये । तदौषधैश्च मन्त्रैश्च प्रायश्चित्तैश्च शाम्यति ॥
data.md: When an act is performed from wrath or misjudgment, then expiation should be performed by paining the body, guided by example by scriptures, and by reason. when any action, is performed for pleasing or displeasing the mind, the sin originating thereform may be cleansed by pure food and recitation of Mantras.

data.v: जातिश्रेण्यधिवासानां कुलधर्मांश्च सर्वतः । वर्जयेन्न हि तं धर्मं येषां धर्मो न विद्यते ॥
data.md: There is no expiation for them who do not observe duties and practices of their order and caste, country, and family, and who forsake their own creed.

data.md: When any doubt arises regarding what should be done, it should be settled by the injunction of the scriptures which ten persons versed in Vedic scriptures or three of those who frequently recite them may declare.

data.md: The bull, earth, little ants, worms born in dirt, and poison, should not be eaten by Brahmanas.

data.v: अभक्ष्या ब्राह्मणैर्मत्स्याः शकलैर्ये विवर्जिताः । चतुष्पात्कच्छपादन्यो मण्डूका जलजाश्च ये ॥
data.md: They should also abstain from eating fishes that have scales, and four-legged aquatic animals like frogs and others, except the tortoise.

data.md: Besides this the good that has been offered to the departed manes, that which has been usurer cooked by a woman who has recently given birth to a child, and food cooked by a unknown person, should not be taken. The milk also of a cow that has recently calved should not be drunk.

data.md: No gift should be made to a Brahmana who has no knowledge of the Vedas Gifts should be made to him only who is well read in the Vedas. An improper gift and an improper acceptance beget bad consequences to both the giver and the acceptor.

data.md: As a person who tries to cross the sea with the help of a rock or a mass of catechu sinks with the supports, so the improper giver and the acceptor both sink together.

data.md: As a fire that is covered with wet fuel does not burn, so the acceptor of a gift who has not practised penances, and piety to those who studied Vedas, but cannot confer any benefit (upon the giver).

data.md: As water in a skull and milk in a bag made of dog-skin become impure for the uncleanness of the vessels in which they are kept, so the Vedas become fruitless in a person who is not of good conduct.

data.md: One may give from pity to a low Brahmana who is without Mantras and vows, who is innocent of the scriptures and who is envious.

data.v: न वै देयमनुक्रोशाद्दीनायाप्यपकारिणे । आप्ताचरितमित्येव धर्म इत्येव वा पुनः ॥
data.md: One may, from pity, give to a person who is poor or afflicted or ill. But he should not make charities to such a person with the belief that he would drive any (spiritual) benefit from it or that he would acquire any religious merit by it.

data.md: Forsooth, gift made to a Brahmana ignorant of the Vedas, becomes perfectly fruitless for the shortcomings of the recipient.

data.v: यथा दारुमयो हस्ती यथा चर्ममयो मृगः । ब्राह्मणश्चानधीयानस्त्रयस्ते नामधारकाः ॥
data.md: As an elephant made of wood, or an antelope made of leather, so is a Brahmana who has not read the Vedas. All the three have nothing but names.

data.v: यथा षण्ढोऽफलः स्त्रीषु यथा गौर्गवि चाफला । शकुनिर्वाप्यपक्षः स्यान्निर्मन्त्रो ब्राह्मणस्तथा ॥
data.md: As a eunuch cannot beget children on women, as a cow does not procreats on another cow, as a bird lives in vain that is featherless, even so is a Brahmana that without Mantras.

data.v: ग्रामधान्यं यथा शून्यं यथा कूपश्च निर्जलः । यथा हुतमनग्नौ च तथैव स्यान्निराकृतौ ॥
data.md: As grain without kernel, as a well without water, as libations poured on ashes, even so is a gift to a Brahmana who is ignorant.

data.v: देवतानां पितॄणां च हव्यकव्यविनाशनः । शत्रुरर्थहरो मूर्खो न लोकान्प्राप्तुमर्हति ॥
data.md: An unlearned Brahmana is an enemy (to all) and is the destroyer of the food that is offered to the gods and the departed manes. A gift made to such a person become useless. He is, therefore, like a robber. He can never attain to blissful regions hereafter.

data.v: एतत्ते कथितं सर्वं यथा वृत्तं युधिष्ठिर । समासेन महद्ध्येतच्छ्रोतव्यं भरतर्षभ ॥

data.md: Yudhishthira said O holy and great ascetic, I wish to hear at length what the duties of kings are and what the duties, in full, of all the four orders.

data.md: I wish to hear, O foremost of Brahmanas, how persons should behave in times of distress, and how I may subjugate the world by following path of morality.

data.md: The practice of virtue and the performance of royal duties are always inconsistent with each other. I am always perplexed to think how one may reconcile the two.

data.md: Conversant with all duties and endued with universal knowledge that son of Bhagirathi will remove all your doubts regarding the difficult subjects of duties.

data.md: Having practised rigid vows, that mightyarined one obtained a knowledge of all the Vedas and their branches, from Vashishtha and from Chyavana of Bhrigu's race.

data.md: You should not thus continually indulge in grief. Do, O best of kings, what the holy Vyasa has said.

data.v: ब्राह्मणास्त्वां महाबाहो भ्रातरश्च महौजसः । पर्जन्यमिव घर्मार्ता आशंसाना उपासते ॥
data.md: The Brahmanas, O mighty-armed one, and these your highly energetic brothers stand before you beseechingly like persons soliciting Indra the gods of the clouds at the close of summer.

data.v: हतशिष्टाश्च राजानः कृत्स्नं चैव समागतम् । चातुर्वर्ण्यं महाराज राष्ट्रं ते कुरुजाङ्गलम् ॥
data.md: The surviving kings, and the people belonging to all the four orders of your kingdom of Kurujangala, O king, are here.

data.v: प्रियार्थमपि चैतेषां ब्राह्मणानां महात्मनाम् । नियोगादस्य च गुरोर्व्यासस्यामिततेजसः ॥
data.md: For the sake of doing what is agreeable to these great Brahmanas, for satisfying the behest of your reverend senior Vyasa of immeasurable energy, and at the request of ourselves who are well-wishers, and of Draupadi, O destroyer of foes, do what is agreeable to us, O slayer of foes, and what is beneficial to the world.

data.v: सुहृदां चास्मदादीनां द्रौपद्याश्च परंतप । कुरु प्रियममित्रघ्न लोकस्य च हितं कुरु ॥
data.md: For the sake of doing what is agreeable to these great Brahmanas, for satisfying the behest of your reverend senior Vyasa of immeasurable energy, and at the request of ourselves who are well-wishers, and of Draupadi, O destroyer of foes, do what is agreeable to us, O slayer of foes, and what is beneficial to the world.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु कृष्णेन राजा राजीवलोचनः । हितार्थं सर्वलोकस्य समुत्तस्थौ महातपाः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Thus addressed by Krishna, the great king (Yudhishthira) having eyes like lotus petals, rose from his seat for the well-being of the entire world.

data.v: सोऽनुनीतो नरव्याघ्रो विष्टरश्रवसा स्वयम् । द्वैपायनेन च तथा देवस्थानेन जिष्णुना ॥
data.md: That foremost of men, the illustrious Yudhishthira, solicited by Krishna himself, by the Dvaipayana (Vyasa), by Devasthana, by Jishnu, by these and many others, shook off his grief, and anxiety.

data.v: एतैश्चान्यैश्च बहुभिरनुनीतो युधिष्ठिरः । व्यजहान्मानसं दुःखं संतापं च महामनाः ॥
data.md: That foremost of men, the illustrious Yudhishthira, solicited by Krishna himself, by the Dvaipayana (Vyasa), by Devasthana, by Jishnu, by these and many others, shook off his grief, and anxiety.

data.v: श्रुतवाक्यः श्रुतनिधिः श्रुतश्रव्यविशारदः । व्यवस्य मनसः शान्तिमगच्छत्पाण्डुनन्दनः ॥
data.md: Full conversant with the teachings of the Srutis, with the science that explains them and with all that men usually hear and all that is worthy of being heard, the son of Pandu acquired peace of mind and resolved upon what he should next do.

data.v: स तैः परिवृतो राजा नक्षत्रैरिव चन्द्रमाः । धृतराष्ट्रं पुरस्कृत्य स्वपुरं प्रविवेश ह ॥
data.md: Surrounded by them all like the moon by the stars, the king, placing Dhritarashtra at the head started for the city.

data.v: प्रविविक्षुः स धर्मज्ञः कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः । अर्चयामास देवांश्च ब्राह्मणांश्च सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: Desirous of entering the city, Kunti's son Yudhishthira, conversant with everyday, worshipped the gods and thousands of Brahmanas.

data.v: ततो रथं नवं शुभ्रं कम्बलाजिनसंवृतम् । युक्तं षोडशभिर्गोभिः पाण्डुरैः शुभलक्षणैः ॥
मन्त्रैरभ्यर्चितः पुण्यैः स्तूयमानो महर्षिभिः । आरुरोह यथा देवः सोमोऽमृतमयं रथम् ॥
जग्राह रश्मीन्कौन्तेयो भीमो भीमपराक्रमः । अर्जुनः पाण्डुरं छत्रं धारयामास भानुमत् ॥
data.md: His powerful brother Bhima took the reins. Arjuna held over his head a highly lustrous umbrella.

data.v: ध्रियमाणं तु तच्छत्रं पाण्डुरं तस्य मूर्धनि । शुशुभे तारकाराजसितमभ्रमिवाम्बरे ॥
data.md: That white a umbrella held upon the car shone like a white cloud adorned with stars in the sky.

data.v: चामरव्यजने चास्य वीरौ जगृहतुस्तदा । चन्द्ररश्मिप्रभे शुभ्रे माद्रीपुत्रावलंकृते ॥
data.md: The two heroic sons of Madri, viz., Nakula and Sahadeva, took up two yak-tails white as the rays of the moon and let with gems, for fanning the king.

data.v: ते पञ्च रथमास्थाय भ्रातरः समलंकृताः । भूतानीव समस्तानि राजन्ददृशिरे तदा ॥
data.md: The five brothers, adorned with ornaments, having got upon the car, O king, shone like the five elements.

data.v: आस्थाय तु रथं शुभ्रं युक्तमश्वैर्महाजवैः । अन्वयात्पृष्ठतो राजन्युयुत्सुः पाण्डवाग्रजम् ॥
data.md: Riding upon another white car to which were yoked horses fleet as thought, Yuyutsu, O king, followed the eldest son of Pandu.

data.v: रथं हेममयं शुभ्रं सैन्यसुग्रीवयोजितम् । सह सात्यकिना कृष्णः समास्थायान्वयात्कुरून् ॥
data.md: Upon his own shining car of gold to which were yoked Shivya and Sugriva. Krishna, with Satyaki, followed the Kurus.

data.v: नरयानेन तु ज्येष्ठः पिता पार्थस्य भारत । अग्रतो धर्मराजस्य गान्धारीसहितो ययौ ॥
data.md: The eldest uncle of Pritha's son, O Bharata, accompanied by Gandhari, headed the train, upon a vehicle carried by men.

data.v: कुरुस्त्रियश्च ताः सर्वाः कुन्ती कृष्णा च द्रौपदी । यानैरुच्चावचैर्जग्मुर्विदुरेण पुरस्कृताः ॥
data.md: The other Kuru ladies, as also Kunti and Krishna, all proceeded on excellent cars, headed by Vidura.

data.v: ततो रथाश्च बहुला नागाश्च समलंकृताः । पादाताश्च हयाश्चैव पृष्ठतः समनुव्रजन् ॥
data.md: Then followed a large number of cars and elephants adorned with ornaments, and the infantry and horses.

data.v: ततो वैतालिकैः सूतैर्मागधैश्च सुभाषितैः । स्तूयमानो ययौ राजा नगरं नागसाह्वयम् ॥
data.md: His praises sung by sweet-voiced panegyrists and birds, the king went towards the city of Hastinapur.

data.v: तत्प्रयाणं महाबाहोर्बभूवाप्रतिमं भुवि । आकुलाकुलमुत्सृष्टं हृष्टपुष्टजनान्वितम् ॥
data.md: The march, O might-armed one, of king Yudhishthira, was so beautiful that its like had never been witnessed on Earth. Containing healthy and cheerful men, the busy hum of numberless voices was heard there.

data.v: अभियाने तु पार्थस्य नरैर्नगरवासिभिः । नगरं राजमार्गश्च यथावत्समलंकृतम् ॥
data.md: During the march of Pritha's son, the city and its streets were adorned with lively citizens.

data.v: पाण्डुरेण च माल्येन पताकाभिश्च वेदिभिः । संवृतो राजमार्गश्च धूपनैश्च सुधूपितः ॥
data.md: The part through which the king passed had been adorned with white festoons of flowers and numberless flags. The streets of the city were perfumed with incense.

data.v: अथ चूर्णैश्च गन्धानां नानापुष्पैः प्रियङ्गुभिः । माल्यदामभिरासक्तै राजवेश्माभिसंवृतम् ॥
data.md: The palace was covered with powdered perfumes and flowers and fragrant plants, and ornamented with garlands and wreaths.

data.v: कुम्भाश्च नगरद्वारि वारिपूर्णा दृढा नवाः । कन्याः सुमनसश्छागाः स्थापितास्तत्र तत्र ह ॥
data.md: New inetallic jars, brimful with water, were kept at the door of every house, and bevies of beautiful maidens stood at different parts.

data.v: तथा स्वलंकृतद्वारं नगरं पाण्डुनन्दनः । स्तूयमानः शुभैर्वाक्यैः प्रविवेश सुहृद्वृतः ॥
data.md: Accompanied by his friends, and welcomed with sweet words the son of Pandu, entered the city through its well-adorned gate.

data.v: प्रवेशने तु पार्थानां जनस्य पुरवासिनः । दिदृक्षूणां सहस्राणि समाजग्मुर्बहून्यथ ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Then the sons of Pritha entered the city, thousands of citizens came out to see the spectacle.

data.v: स राजमार्गः शुशुभे समलंकृतचत्वरः । यथा चन्द्रोदये राजन्वर्धमानो महोदधिः ॥
data.md: The well adorned squares and streets, with the crowd of men, shone like the ocean rising at the rise of the moon.

data.v: गृहाणि राजमार्गे तु रत्नवन्ति बृहन्ति च । प्राकम्पन्तेव भारेण स्त्रीणां पूर्णानि भारत ॥
data.md: The large palaces that stood on the streetsides, gaily decked and full of ladies seemed to shake, O Bharata, with their fair denizens.

data.v: ताः शनैरिव सव्रीडं प्रशशंसुर्युधिष्ठिरम् । भीमसेनार्जुनौ चैव माद्रीपुत्रौ च पाण्डवौ ॥
data.md: With soft and modest voices they described the praises of Yudhishthira, of Bhima and Arjuna, and of the two sons of Madri.

data.v: धन्या त्वमसि पाञ्चालि या त्वं पुरुषसत्तमान् । उपतिष्ठसि कल्याणि महर्षीनिव गौतमी ॥
data.md: And they said,-You deserve every praise, O blessed princess of Panchala, who wait by the side of these foremost of men like Gautaini by the side of the (seven) Rishis.

data.v: तव कर्माण्यमोघानि व्रतचर्या च भामिनि । इति कृष्णां महाराज प्रशशंसुस्तदा स्त्रियः ॥
data.md: 'Your acts and vows have fructified, O lady.' Thus, O king, the ladies praised the princess Krishna.

data.v: प्रशंसावचनैस्तासां मिथःशब्दैश्च भारत । प्रीतिजैश्च तदा शब्दैः पुरमासीत्समाकुलम् ॥
data.md: Praises being thus chanted, O Bharata, and they conversing with one another, and for the shouts of joy (uttered by the men), the city became filled with a loud noise.

data.v: तमतीत्य यथायुक्तं राजमार्गं युधिष्ठिरः । अलंकृतं शोभमानमुपायाद्राजवेश्म ह ॥
data.md: Having passed through the streets with becoming conduct, Yudhishthira then entered the beautiful palace (of the Kurus) adorned with all ornaments.

data.v: ततः प्रकृतयः सर्वाः पौरजानपदास्तथा । ऊचुः कथाः कर्णसुखाः समुपेत्य ततस्ततः ॥
data.md: Approaching the palace, citizens and villagers uttered speeches that were pleasing to his ears.

data.v: दिष्ट्या जयसि राजेन्द्र शत्रूञ्शत्रुनिसूदन । दिष्ट्या राज्यं पुनः प्राप्तं धर्मेण च बलेन च ॥
data.md: 'By good luck, O foremost of kings, you have defeated your enemies, O slayer of foes. By good luck, you have regained your kingdom through virtue and prowess.

data.v: भव नस्त्वं महाराज राजेह शरदां शतम् । प्रजाः पालय धर्मेण यथेन्द्रस्त्रिदिवं नृप ॥
data.md: Be, O foremost of king, our monarch for a century and protect your subjects virtuously like Indra protecting the celestials'.

data.v: एवं राजकुलद्वारि मङ्गलैरभिपूजितः । आशीर्वादान्द्विजैरुक्तान्प्रतिगृह्य समन्ततः ॥
data.md: Thus welcomed at the palace-gate with words of blessings and accepting the benedictions uttered by the Brahmanas from all sides, the king, graced with victory and the blessings of his people, entered the palace resembling the mansion of Indra himself, and then got down from his car.

data.v: प्रविश्य भवनं राजा देवराजगृहोपमम् । श्रुत्वा विजयसंयुक्तं रथात्पश्चादवातरत् ॥
data.md: Thus welcomed at the palace-gate with words of blessings and accepting the benedictions uttered by the Brahmanas from all sides, the king, graced with victory and the blessings of his people, entered the palace resembling the mansion of Indra himself, and then got down from his car.

data.v: प्रविश्याभ्यन्तरं श्रीमान्दैवतान्यभिगम्य च । पूजयामास रत्नैश्च गन्धैर्माल्यैश्च सर्वशः ॥
data.md: Entering the palace, Yudhishthira approached the tutelary deities and adored them with gems and scents and garlands.

data.v: निश्चक्राम ततः श्रीमान्पुनरेव महायशाः । ददर्श ब्राह्मणांश्चैव सोऽभिरूपानुपस्थितान् ॥
data.md: Endued with great fame and prosperity, the king came out once more and saw a number of Brahmanas waiting with sacred articles in their hands.

data.v: स संवृतस्तदा विप्रैराशीर्वादविवक्षुभिः । शुशुभे विमलश्चन्द्रस्तारागणवृतो यथा ॥
data.md: Surrounded by those Brahmanas desirous of uttering blessings on him, the king shone beautiful like the spotless moon in the midst of the stars.

data.v: तान्स संपूजयामास कौन्तेयो विधिवद्द्विजान् । धौम्यं गुरुं पुरस्कृत्य ज्येष्ठं पितरमेव च ॥
data.md: Accompanied by his priest Dhaumya and his eldest uncle, the son of Kunti gladly adored, with due rites, those Brahmanas with sweets, gems, and profuse gold, and kine and dresses, O king, and with various other articles that each desired.

data.v: सुमनोमोदकै रत्नैर्हिरण्येन च भूरिणा । गोभिर्वस्त्रैश्च राजेन्द्र विविधैश्च किमिच्छकैः ॥
data.md: Accompanied by his priest Dhaumya and his eldest uncle, the son of Kunti gladly adored, with due rites, those Brahmanas with sweets, gems, and profuse gold, and kine and dresses, O king, and with various other articles that each desired.

data.v: ततः पुण्याहघोषोऽभूद्दिवं स्तब्ध्वेव भारत । सुहृदां हर्षजननः पुण्यः श्रुतिसुखावहः ॥
data.md: Then loud acclamations of—This is a blessed day,-arose, filling the entire sky, O Bharata. That sacred sound which was sweet to the ear was highly gratifying to the friends and well-wishers of the Pandavas.

data.v: हंसवन्नेदुषां राजन्द्विजानां तत्र भारती । शुश्रुवे वेदविदुषां पुष्कलार्थपदाक्षरा ॥
data.md: The king heard that sound uttered by those learned Brahmanas loud and clear like the sound of swans. He listened also to the melodious and significant speeches, of those persons well read in the Vedas.

data.v: ततो दुन्दुभिनिर्घोषः शङ्खानां च मनोरमः । जयं प्रवदतां तत्र स्वनः प्रादुरभून्नृप ॥
data.md: Then arose, O king, the peal of drums and the pleasant blare of conchs, indicative of triumph.

data.v: निःशब्दे च स्थिते तत्र ततो विप्रजने पुनः । राजानं ब्राह्मणच्छद्मा चार्वाको राक्षसोऽब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Some time after, when the Brahmanas had become silent, a Rakshasa of the name of Charvaka, who had disguised himself as a Brahmana, addressed the king.

data.v: तत्र दुर्योधनसखा भिक्षुरूपेण संवृतः । सांख्यः शिखी त्रिदण्डी च धृष्टो विगतसाध्वसः ॥
data.md: He was a friend of Duryodhana and stood there under the disguise of a religious mendicant. With a rosary, with a tuft of hair on his head, and with a staff in his hand, he stood proudly and fearlessly in the midst of all those Brahmanas that had come there in thousands for uttering for blessings, (upon the king) O king, and all of whom had practised penances and vows.

data.v: वृतः सर्वैस्तदा विप्रैराशीर्वादविवक्षुभिः । परंसहस्रै राजेन्द्र तपोनियमसंस्थितैः ॥
स दुष्टः पापमाशंसन्पाण्डवानां महात्मनाम् । अनामन्त्र्यैव तान्विप्रांस्तमुवाच महीपतिम् ॥
data.md: That wicked Rakshasa, desirous of doing evil to the high-souled Pandavas, and without having consulted those Brahmanas, said these words to the king.

data.v: इमे प्राहुर्द्विजाः सर्वे समारोप्य वचो मयि । धिग्भवन्तं कुनृपतिं ज्ञातिघातिनमस्तु वै ॥
data.md: Charvaka said Making me their spokesman all these Brahmanas, are saying,-Fie on you. You are a wicked king. You are a destroyer of kinsmen.

data.v: किं ते राज्येन कौन्तेय कृत्वेमं ज्ञातिसंक्षयम् । घातयित्वा गुरूंश्चैव मृतं श्रेयो न जीवितम् ॥
data.md: What will you gain, O son of Kunti, by having thus exterminated your race? Having killed also your elders and preceptor, it is proper for you to cast away your life.

data.v: इति ते वै द्विजाः श्रुत्वा तस्य घोरस्य रक्षसः । विव्यथुश्चुक्रुशुश्चैव तस्य वाक्यप्रधर्षिताः ॥
data.md: 'Hearing these words of that wicked Rakshasa, the Brahmanas there were greatly moved. Cut to the quick by that speech, they set up a loud uproar.

data.v: ततस्ते ब्राह्मणाः सर्वे स च राजा युधिष्ठिरः । व्रीडिताः परमोद्विग्नास्तूष्णीमासन्विशां पते ॥
data.md: And all those Brahmanas, with king Yudhishthira, O king, became silent from anxiety and shame.
