data.md: He then pleased the servants who were dependent on him and the guests who came to him, including persons who were undeserving, by satisfying their wishes.

data.v: पुरोहिताय धौम्याय प्रादादयुतशः स गाः । धनं सुवर्णं रजतं वासांसि विविधानि च ॥
data.md: He gave to his priest Dhaumya kine in thousands, and immense wealth and gold and silver and dresses of various kinds.

data.v: कृपाय च महाराज गुरुवृत्तिमवर्तत । विदुराय च धर्मात्मा पूजां चक्रे यतव्रतः ॥
data.md: O monarch, the king treated Kripa like a preceptor. Ever observing vows the king continued to honour Vidura highly.

data.v: भक्षान्नपानैर्विविधैर्वासोभिः शयनासनैः । सर्वान्संतोषयामास संश्रितान्ददतां वरः ॥
data.md: That foremost of charitable men satisfied all persons with presents of food and drink and dresses of various kinds and beds and seats.

data.v: लब्धप्रशमनं कृत्वा स राजा राजसत्तम । युयुत्सोर्धार्तराष्ट्रस्य पूजां चक्रे महायशाः ॥
data.md: Having restored peace to his kingdom the highly illustrious king, O best of monarchs, paid due honours to Yuyutsu and Dhritarashtra.

data.v: धृतराष्ट्राय तद्राज्यं गान्धार्यै विदुराय च । निवेद्य स्वस्थवद्राजन्नास्ते राजा युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: Placing his kingdom at the disposal of Dhritarashtra, of Gandhari, and of Vidura, king Yudhishthira spent his days happily.

data.v: तथा सर्वं स नगरं प्रसाद्य जनमेजय । वासुदेवं महात्मानमभ्यगच्छत्कृताञ्जलिः ॥
data.md: Having pleased everybody, including the citizens, in this way, Yudhishthira, O foremost of Bharata's race, approached with joined hands the presence of the great Vasudeva.

data.v: ततो महति पर्यङ्के मणिकाञ्चनभूषिते । ददर्श कृष्णमासीनं नीलं मेराविवाम्बुदम् ॥
data.md: He saw Krishna, of the hue of a blue cloud, seated on a large sofa bedecked with gold and gems.

data.v: जाज्वल्यमानं वपुषा दिव्याभरणभूषितम् । पीतकौशेयसंवीतं हेम्नीवोपहितं मणिम् ॥
data.md: Clad in yellow silk robes and adorned with celestial ornaments, his person shone effulgent like a jewel set on gold.

data.v: कौस्तुभेन उरःस्थेन मणिनाभिविराजितम् । उद्यतेवोदयं शैलं सूर्येणाप्तकिरीटिनम् । नौपम्यं विद्यते यस्य त्रिषु लोकेषु किंचन ॥
data.md: His bosom adorned with the Kaustubha gem, he shone like the mountain with the rising Sun.

data.v: सोऽभिगम्य महात्मानं विष्णुं पुरुषविग्रहम् । उवाच मधुराभाषः स्मितपूर्वमिदं तदा ॥
सुखेन ते निशा कच्चिद्व्युष्टा बुद्धिमतां वर । कच्चिज्ज्ञानानि सर्वाणि प्रसन्नानि तवाच्युत ॥
तव ह्याश्रित्य तां देवीं बुद्धिं बुद्धिमतां वर । वयं राज्यमनुप्राप्ताः पृथिवी च वशे स्थिता ॥
भवत्प्रसादाद्भगवंस्त्रिलोकगतिविक्रम । जयः प्राप्तो यशश्चाग्र्यं न च धर्माच्च्युता वयम् ॥
data.md: We have regained our kingdom and the whole Earth has come under our sway, O divine lord, through your favour, O refuge of the three worlds and, O you of three steps. Through your favour we have gained victory and obtained great fame and have not transgressed the duties of our order.'

data.v: तं तथा भाषमाणं तु धर्मराजं युधिष्ठिरम् । नोवाच भगवान्किंचिद्ध्यानमेवान्वपद्यत ॥
data.md: The divine Krishna did not speak a single word to that chastiser of enemies, king Yudhishthira, for he was then rapt in meditation.

data.v: किमिदं परमाश्चर्यं ध्यायस्यमितविक्रम । कच्चिल्लोकत्रयस्यास्य स्वस्ति लोकपरायण ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said 'Wonderful it is, o you of immeasurable prowess, that you are rapt in meditation. O great refuge of the universe, is it all well with the three worlds?

data.v: चतुर्थं ध्यानमार्गं त्वमालम्ब्य पुरुषोत्तम । अपक्रान्तो यतो देव तेन मे विस्मितं मनः ॥
data.md: When you have, O god, withdrawn yourself from the world, having, O foremost of men, adopted the fourth state (of perfect unconsciousness of the world) my mind has been filled with wonder.

data.v: निगृहीतो हि वायुस्ते पञ्चकर्मा शरीरगः । इन्द्रियाणि च सर्वाणि मनसि स्थापितानि ते ॥
data.md: The five vital airs which act within the body have been controlled by you. You have controlled your senses within your mind.

data.v: इन्द्रियाणि मनश्चैव बुद्धौ संवेशितानि ते । सर्वश्चैव गणो देव क्षेत्रज्ञे ते निवेशितः ॥
data.md: Both words and mind, O Govinda, have been concentered within your understanding. All your senses, have been withdrawn into your self.

data.v: नेङ्गन्ति तव रोमाणि स्थिरा बुद्धिस्तथा मनः । स्थाणुकुड्यशिलाभूतो निरीहश्चासि माधव ॥
data.md: The hair on your body stands erect. Your mind and understanding are both calm. You are as immobile now, O Madhava, as an wooden post or a stone?

data.v: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो निरिङ्गो ज्वलतेऽच्युत । तथासि भगवन्देव निश्चलो दृढनिश्चयः ॥
data.md: O illustrious god, you are as calm as the flame of a lamp burning in a place where there is no wind. You are as immobile as a rock.

data.v: यदि श्रोतुमिहार्हामि न रहस्यं च ते यदि । छिन्धि मे संशयं देव प्रपन्नायाभियाचते ॥
data.md: If I am fit to hear the cause, and if it is no secret, remove, O god, my doubt, for I beg this। favour from you.

data.v: त्वं हि कर्ता विकर्ता च त्वं क्षरं चाक्षरं च हि । अनादिनिधनश्चाद्यस्त्वमेव पुरुषोत्तम ॥
data.md: You are the Creator and you are the Destroyer. You are destructible and you indestructible. You are without beginning and you are without end. You are the first and the foremost of beings.

data.v: त्वत्प्रपन्नाय भक्ताय शिरसा प्रणताय च । ध्यानस्यास्य यथातत्त्वं ब्रूहि धर्मभृतां वर ॥
data.md: O foremost of pious men, tell me the cause of this abstraction. I solicit your favour, and am your devoted worshipper, and am bending my head to you.

data.v: ततः स्वगोचरे न्यस्य मनो बुद्धीन्द्रियाणि च । स्मितपूर्वमुवाचेदं भगवान्वासवानुजः ॥
data.md: Thus accosted the illustrious younger brother of Vasava, reinstating his mind, understanding and the senses in their proper places, said these words similingly.

data.v: शरतल्पगतो भीष्मः शाम्यन्निव हुताशनः । मां ध्याति पुरुषव्याघ्रस्ततो मे तद्गतं मनः ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said 'That foremost men, viz., Bhishma, who is now lying on a bed of arrows, and who is now like a fire that is about to be extinguished, is thinking of me. It is therefore my mind also was concentrated on him.

data.v: यस्य ज्यातलनिर्घोषं विस्फूर्जितमिवाशनेः । न सहेद्देवराजोऽपि तमस्मि मनसा गतः ॥
data.md: My mind was fixed in him the twang of whose bow and the sound of whose palms Indra himself was unable to bear.

data.v: येनाभिद्रुत्य तरसा समस्तं राजमण्डलम् । ऊढास्तिस्रः पुरा कन्यास्तमस्मि मनसा गतः ॥
data.md: I was thinking of him who having defeated in a moment all the assembled kings, carried the three princesses of Kashi for the marriage of his brother Vichitravirya.

data.v: त्रयोविंशतिरात्रं यो योधयामास भार्गवम् । न च रामेण निस्तीर्णस्तमस्मि मनसा गतः ॥
data.md: I was thinking of him who fought continually for twenty-three days with Rama himself of Bhrigu's race and whom Rama could not defeat.

data.v: यं गङ्गा गर्भविधिना धारयामास पार्थिवम् । वसिष्ठशिष्यं तं तात मनसास्मि गतो नृप ॥
data.md: I was thinking of him whom Ganga conceived and gave birth to, according to ordinary human laws and whom Vasishtha took as a pupil.

data.v: दिव्यास्त्राणि महातेजा यो धारयति बुद्धिमान् । साङ्गांश्च चतुरो वेदांस्तमस्मि मनसा गतः ॥
data.md: I was thinking of that powerful hero of great intelligence who is a master of all the celestial weapons as also of the four Vedas with all their auxiliaries.

data.v: रामस्य दयितं शिष्यं जामदग्न्यस्य पाण्डव । आधारं सर्वविद्यानां तमस्मि मनसा गतः ॥
data.md: I was thinking of him, O son of Pandu, who is the favourite disciple of Rama the son of Jamadagni, and who is the master of all the sciences.

data.v: एकीकृत्येन्द्रियग्रामं मनः संयम्य मेधया । शरणं मामुपागच्छत्ततो मे तद्गतं मनः ॥
data.md: Controlling all his senses and concentrating his mind by the aid of his understanding, he sought my refuge. It was for this that I had fixed my mind upon him.

data.v: स हि भूतं च भव्यं च भवच्च पुरुषर्षभ । वेत्ति धर्मभृतां श्रेष्ठस्ततो मे तद्गतं मनः ॥
data.md: I was thinking of that best of all persons conversant with morality and duty, of him, O foremost of Bharatas, who knows the Past, the Future, and the Present.

data.v: तस्मिन्हि पुरुषव्याघ्रे कर्मभिः स्वैर्दिवं गते । भविष्यति मही पार्थ नष्टचन्द्रेव शर्वरी ॥
data.md: After the ascension to heaven of that foremost of kings for his own achievements the Earth, O son of Pritha, will took like a moonless night.

data.v: तद्युधिष्ठिर गाङ्गेयं भीष्मं भीमपराक्रमम् । अभिगम्योपसंगृह्य पृच्छ यत्ते मनोगतम् ॥
data.md: Therefore, O Yudhishthira, humbly approaching Ganga's son, viz., Bhishma, ask him about what you may wish to learn.

data.v: चातुर्वेद्यं चातुर्होत्रं चातुराश्रम्यमेव च । चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य धर्मं च पृच्छैनं पृथिवीपते ॥
data.md: O king enquire of him about the four branches of knowledge, about sacrifices and the rites sanctioned for the four castes, about the four modes of life, and about the duties of kings.

data.v: तस्मिन्नस्तमिते भीष्मे कौरवाणां धुरंधरे । ज्ञानान्यल्पीभविष्यन्ति तस्मात्त्वां चोदयाम्यहम् ॥
data.md: When Bhishma, that foremost one of Kuru's race, will disappear from the world every kind of knowledge will go away with him. It is, therefore, that I urge you to do it.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा वासुदेवस्य तथ्यं वचनमुत्तमम् । साश्रुकण्ठः स धर्मज्ञो जनार्दनमुवाच ह ॥
data.md: Hearing these wholesome and pregnant words of Vasudeva, the righteous Yudhishthira, with voice suppressed with tears, answered Janardana saying—'What you have said, O Madhava, about the greatness of Bhishma, is perfectly true. I have not the least doubt about it.

data.v: यद्भवानाह भीष्मस्य प्रभावं प्रति माधव । तथा तन्नात्र संदेहो विद्यते मम मानद ॥
data.md: Hearing these wholesome and pregnant words of Vasudeva, the righteous Yudhishthira, with voice suppressed with tears, answered Janardana saying—'What you have said, O Madhava, about the greatness of Bhishma, is perfectly true. I have not the least doubt about it.

data.v: महाभाग्यं हि भीष्मस्य प्रभावश्च महात्मनः । श्रुतं मया कथयतां ब्राह्मणानां महात्मनाम् ॥
data.md: I had heard of the piety and greatness, of the illustrious Bhishma from great Brahmanas talking about it.

data.v: भवांश्च कर्ता लोकानां यद्ब्रवीत्यरिसूदन । तथा तदनभिध्येयं वाक्यं यादवनन्दन ॥
data.md: You, O killer of foes, are the Creator of all the worlds, There, cannot, therefore, O delighter of the Yadavas, be the least doubt in what you say.

data.v: यतस्त्वनुग्रहकृता बुद्धिस्ते मयि माधव । त्वामग्रतः पुरस्कृत्य भीष्मं पश्यामहे वयम् ॥
data.md: If you are pleased to show us favour, O Madhava, then we shall go to Bhishma with yourself at our head.

data.v: आवृत्ते भगवत्यर्के स हि लोकान्गमिष्यति । त्वद्दर्शनं महाबाहो तस्मादर्हति कौरवः ॥
data.md: When the divine Sun shall have turned towards the north, Bhishma will leave (this world) for those blissful regions which he has acquired. That descendant of Kuru's race, therefore, O mighty-armed one, deserves to see you.

data.v: तव ह्याद्यस्य देवस्य क्षरस्यैवाक्षरस्य च । दर्शनं तस्य लाभः स्यात्त्वं हि ब्रह्ममयो निधिः ॥
data.md: Bhishina will then see you who are the first of gods, and who destructible and indestructible. Indeed, O lord, you are the vast receptacle of Brahma.

data.v: श्रुत्वैतद्धर्मराजस्य वचनं मधुसूदनः । पार्श्वस्थं सात्यकिं प्राह रथो मे युज्यतामिति ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Hearing these words of king Yudhishthira, the destroyer of Madhu addressed Satyaki who was sitting by him, saying,–'Let my car be yoked.

data.v: सात्यकिस्तूपनिष्क्रम्य केशवस्य समीपतः । दारुकं प्राह कृष्णस्य युज्यतां रथ इत्युत ॥
data.md: are At this Satyaki quickly left Keshava's company and going out, ordered Daruka, saying,-'Let Krishna's car be made ready.'

data.v: स सात्यकेराशु वचो निशम्य; रथोत्तमं काञ्चनभूषिताङ्गम् । मसारगल्वर्कमयैर्विभङ्गै;र्विभूषितं हेमपिनद्धचक्रम् ॥
दिवाकरांशुप्रभमाशुगामिनं; विचित्रनानामणिरत्नभूषितम् । नवोदितं सूर्यमिव प्रतापिनं; विचित्रतार्क्ष्यध्वजिनं पताकिनम् ॥
सुग्रीवसैन्यप्रमुखैर्वराश्वै;र्मनोजवैः काञ्चनभूषिताङ्गैः । सुयुक्तमावेदयदच्युताय; कृताञ्जलिर्दारुको राजसिंह ॥
शरतल्पे शयानस्तु भरतानां पितामहः । कथमुत्सृष्टवान्देहं कं च योगमधारयत् ॥
data.md: How did the grandfather of Bharatas, who lay on a bed of arrows, cast off his body and what sort of Yoga did he adopt?

data.v: शृणुष्वावहितो राजञ्शुचिर्भूत्वा समाहितः । भीष्मस्य कुरुशार्दूल देहोत्सर्गं महात्मनः ॥
data.md: Listen, O king, with pure heart and rapt attention, as to how, O foremost of the Kurus, the great Bhishma renounced his body.

data.v: निवृत्तमात्रे त्वयन उत्तरे वै दिवाकरे । समावेशयदात्मानमात्मन्येव समाहितः ॥
data.md: As soon as the Sun, passing the solstitial point entered in his northerly course, Bhishma with rapt attention, caused his soul (as connected with and independent of the body) to enter into the Universal Soul.

data.v: विकीर्णांशुरिवादित्यो भीष्मः शरशतैश्चितः । शिश्ये परमया लक्ष्म्या वृतो ब्राह्मणसत्तमैः ॥
data.md: Surrounded by many foremost of Brahmanas, that hero, his body cut with innumerable arrows, shone like the sun with his innumerable rays.

data.v: व्यासेन वेदश्रवसा नारदेन सुरर्षिणा । देवस्थानेन वात्स्येन तथाश्मकसुमन्तुना ॥
एतैश्चान्यैर्मुनिगणैर्महाभागैर्महात्मभिः । श्रद्धादमपुरस्कारैर्वृतश्चन्द्र इव ग्रहैः ॥
भीष्मस्तु पुरुषव्याघ्रः कर्मणा मनसा गिरा । शरतल्पगतः कृष्णं प्रदध्यौ प्राञ्जलिः स्थितः ॥
data.md: Lying on his bed of arrows, that foremost of men, Bhishma, with pure hearts and joined hands, thought of Krishna in mind, word, and deed.

data.v: स्वरेण पुष्टनादेन तुष्टाव मधुसूदनम् । योगेश्वरं पद्मनाभं विष्णुं जिष्णुं जगत्पतिम् ॥
data.md: With a cheerful and strong voice he sang the encomium of the destroyer of Madhu, that lord of Yoga, the lotus-navelled deity, that lord of the universe, called Vishnu and Jishnu.

data.v: कृताञ्जलिः शुचिर्भूत्वा वाग्विदां प्रवरः प्रभुम् । भीष्मः परमधर्मात्मा वासुदेवमथास्तुवत् ॥
data.md: With joined hands, that foremost of orators, that powerful Bhishma of highly virtuous soul, thus praised Vasudeva.

data.v: आरिराधयिषुः कृष्णं वाचं जिगमिषामि याम् । तया व्याससमासिन्या प्रीयतां पुरुषोत्तमः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said "O Krishna, O foremost of Beings, be pleased with words with I utter, in brief and in full, from desire of singing your praises.

data.v: शुचिः शुचिषदं हंसं तत्परः परमेष्ठिनम् । युक्त्वा सर्वात्मनात्मानं तं प्रपद्ये प्रजापतिम् ॥
data.md: You are pure and purity. You transcend all. You are what people say to be THAT. You are the Supreme Lord. With my entire heart I seek your refuge, O universal Soul and Lord of all creatures!

data.v: यस्मिन्विश्वानि भूतानि तिष्ठन्ति च विशन्ति च । गुणभूतानि भूतेशे सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ॥
data.md: All the worlds and all created things live in you and enter you at the time of dissolution. Like gems strung together in a thread, all things possessing attributes exist in you, the Supreme Lord.

data.v: यस्मिन्नित्ये तते तन्तौ दृढे स्रगिव तिष्ठति । सदसद्ग्रथितं विश्वं विश्वाङ्गे विश्वकर्मणि ॥
data.md: Having the universe for your work and the universe for your limbs, this universe consisting of mind and matter exists in your eternal and all-pervading soul like flowers strung together in a strong thread.

data.v: हरिं सहस्रशिरसं सहस्रचरणेक्षणम् । प्राहुर्नारायणं देवं यं विश्वस्य परायणम् ॥
अणीयसामणीयांसं स्थविष्ठं च स्थवीयसाम् । गरीयसां गरिष्ठं च श्रेष्ठं च श्रेयसामपि ॥
यं वाकेष्वनुवाकेषु निषत्सूपनिषत्सु च । गृणन्ति सत्यकर्माणं सत्यं सत्येषु सामसु ॥
चतुर्भिश्चतुरात्मानं सत्त्वस्थं सात्वतां पतिम् । यं दिव्यैर्देवमर्चन्ति गुह्यैः परमनामभिः ॥
यं देवं देवकी देवी वसुदेवादजीजनत् । भौमस्य ब्रह्मणो गुप्त्यै दीप्तमग्निमिवारणिः ॥
यमनन्यो व्यपेताशीरात्मानं वीतकल्मषम् । इष्ट्वानन्त्याय गोविन्दं पश्यत्यात्मन्यवस्थितम् ॥
पुराणे पुरुषः प्रोक्तो ब्रह्मा प्रोक्तो युगादिषु । क्षये संकर्षणः प्रोक्तस्तमुपास्यमुपास्महे ॥
data.md: In the Puranas, you have been described as Purusha. In the beginning of cycles, you are said to be Brahma, and at the time of universal dissolution you are spoken of as Sankarshana. You are worshipful therefore I worship you. are

data.v: अतिवाय्विन्द्रकर्माणमतिसूर्याग्नितेजसम् । अतिबुद्धीन्द्रियात्मानं तं प्रपद्ये प्रजापतिम् ॥
यं वै विश्वस्य कर्तारं जगतस्तस्थुषां पतिम् । वदन्ति जगतोऽध्यक्षमक्षरं परमं पदम् ॥
data.md: The Vedas describe you as the Creator of the universe and the Lord of everything existing in the universe. You are the Supreme Protector of the universe. You are Undecaying and that which is called the Highest.

data.v: हिरण्यवर्णं यं गर्भमदितिर्दैत्यनाशनम् । एकं द्वादशधा जज्ञे तस्मै सूर्यात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: You are gold-hued. You are the killer of Asuras. Though One, Aditi gave birth to you in twelve forms. Salutations to you who are the Soul of the Sun.

data.v: शुक्ले देवान्पितॄन्कृष्णे तर्पयत्यमृतेन यः । यश्च राजा द्विजातीनां तस्मै सोमात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: Salutations to you in your form of Soma who is the highest of Rishis and who gratified with nectar the gods in the light fortnight and the Pitris in the dark fortnight.

data.v: महतस्तमसः पारे पुरुषं ज्वलनद्युतिम् । यं ज्ञात्वा मृत्युमत्येति तस्मै ज्ञेयात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: You are the One Being of transcendent effulgence dwelling beyond darkness Knowing you one has no fear of death. Salutations of you in that form which is an object of knowledge.

data.v: यं बृहन्तं बृहत्युक्थे यमग्नौ यं महाध्वरे । यं विप्रसंघा गायन्ति तस्मै वेदात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: In the grand Ukthya sacrifice, the Brahmanas worship you as the great Rich. In the great fire-sacrifice, they describe you as the chief (priest). You are the soul of the Vedas. Salutations to you.

data.v: ऋग्यजुःसामधामानं दशार्धहविराकृतिम् । यं सप्ततन्तुं तन्वन्ति तस्मै यज्ञात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: The Rishis, the Yajus, and the Samans are your habitation. You are the five sorts of pure libations. You are the five sorts of pure libations. You are the seven words used in the Vedas. Salutations to you in your form of Sacrifice.

data.v: यः सुपर्णो यजुर्नाम छन्दोगात्रस्त्रिवृच्छिराः । रथंतरबृहत्यक्षस्तस्मै स्तोत्रात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: You are the Purusha described in the Vedas. Your name is Yajus. The Vedic metres are your limbs. The sacrifices laid down in the three Vedas forın your three heads. The great sacrifices called Rathantara is your voice expressing your gratification. Salutations to you in your form of sacred hymns.

data.v: यः सहस्रसवे सत्रे जज्ञे विश्वसृजामृषिः । हिरण्यवर्णः शकुनिस्तस्मै हंसात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: You are the Rishi who had appeared in the great sacrifice extending for a thousand years celebrated by the Patriarchs. You are the great swan with wings of gold. Salutations to you in your form of a swan.

data.v: पदाङ्गं संधिपर्वाणं स्वरव्यञ्जनलक्षणम् । यमाहुरक्षरं नित्यं तस्मै वागात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: Roots with all kinds of affixes and suffixes form your limbs. The Sandhis are your joints. The consonants and vowels are your ornaments. The Vedas have described you as the divine word. Salutations to you in your form as the Word.

data.v: यश्चिनोति सतां सेतुमृतेनामृतयोनिना । धर्मार्थव्यवहाराङ्गैस्तस्मै सत्यात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: You make the bridge for crossing the sea of life with Truth, with the means of emancipation, and with the means by which the senses may be controlled. Salutations to thee in your form of Truth.

data.v: यं पृथग्धर्मचरणाः पृथग्धर्मफलैषिणः । पृथग्धर्मैः समर्चन्ति तस्मै धर्मात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: Men following various religions moved by desire of various fruits, worship you with various rites. Salutations to you in your form of religion.

data.v: यं तं व्यक्तस्थमव्यक्तं विचिन्वन्ति महर्षयः । क्षेत्रे क्षेत्रज्ञमासीनं तस्मै क्षेत्रात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: The great Rishis seek your unmanifest self within the manifest. Called Kshetrajna, you sit in Kshetra. Salutations to you in your form of Kshetra.

data.v: यं दृगात्मानमात्मस्थं वृतं षोडशभिर्गुणैः । प्राहुः सप्तदशं सांख्यास्तस्मै सांख्यात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: Though always conscious and present in self, the Sankhyas still describe you as existing in the three states of wakefulness, dream and sleep. They further describe you as possessed of sixteen attributes and representing the number seventeen. Salutations to your form as described by the Sankhyas.

data.v: यं विनिद्रा जितश्वासाः सत्त्वस्थाः संयतेन्द्रियाः । ज्योतिः पश्यन्ति युञ्जानास्तस्मै योगात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: I bow to the Soul of Yoga who is seen in the form of an effulgent Light by persons that have their senses under restraint, who are endued with the quality of Goodness, who have regulated their breaths, and who who have conquered sleep.

data.v: अपुण्यपुण्योपरमे यं पुनर्भवनिर्भयाः । शान्ताः संन्यासिनो यान्ति तस्मै मोक्षात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: Peaceful Sannyasins, freed from fear of rebirth on account of the extinction of all their sins and merits, obtain you. Salutations to you in your form of emancipation.

data.v: योऽसौ युगसहस्रान्ते प्रदीप्तार्चिर्विभावसुः । संभक्षयति भूतानि तस्मै घोरात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: At the end of a thousand cycles, you assume the form of a fire with blazing flames and consume all creatures. Salutations to you in your form of fierceness.

data.v: संभक्ष्य सर्वभूतानि कृत्वा चैकार्णवं जगत् । बालः स्वपिति यश्चैकस्तस्मै मायात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: Having consumed all creatures and converted the universe into one sheet of water, you sleep on the waters in the form of a child. Salutations to you in your form as Maya (illusion).

data.v: सहस्रशिरसे तस्मै पुरुषायामितात्मने । चतुःसमुद्रपर्याययोगनिद्रात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: You have a thousand heads. You permeate everything. You are of immeasurable soul. You have conquered the four kinds of desire that are as vast as the four seas. Salutations to you in your form of Yoga sleep.

data.v: अजस्य नाभावध्येकं यस्मिन्विश्वं प्रतिष्ठितम् । पुष्करं पुष्कराक्षस्य तस्मै पद्मात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: From the navel of the Self-born having eyes like lotus leaves, sprung a lotus. On that lotus is situate this universe. Salutations to you in your form as lotus.

data.v: यस्य केशेषु जीमूता नद्यः सर्वाङ्गसंधिषु । कुक्षौ समुद्राश्चत्वारस्तस्मै तोयात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: I salute Him who is the soul of water, in whose hair are the clouds, in the joints of whose body are the rivers, and in whose stomach are the four oceans.

data.v: युगेष्वावर्तते योंऽशैर्दिनर्त्वयनहायनैः । सर्गप्रलययोः कर्ता तस्मै कालात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: You appear in very cycle in the forms called month and season and half-year and year, and are the cause of both creation and dissolution. Salutations to you in your form of Time.

data.v: ब्रह्म वक्त्रं भुजौ क्षत्रं कृत्स्नमूरूदरं विशः । पादौ यस्याश्रिताः शूद्रास्तस्मै वर्णात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: Brahmanas are your mouth, Kshatriyas are your two arms., Vaishyas are your stomach and thighs, and Shudras are your feet. Salutations to you in your form of caste.

data.v: यस्याग्निरास्यं द्यौर्मूर्धा खं नाभिश्चरणौ क्षितिः । सूर्यश्चक्षुर्दिशः श्रोत्रे तस्मै लोकात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: Fire is your mouth. The heavens are the crown of your head. The sky in your navel. The Earth is your feet. The Sun is your eye. The points of horizon are your ears. Salutations to you in your form as the three worlds.

data.v: विषये वर्तमानानां यं तं वैशेषिकैर्गुणैः । प्राहुर्विषयगोप्तारं तस्मै गोप्त्रात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: People according to the attributes assigned to you by the Vaisheshika theory, consider you as the Protector of the world. Salutations to you in your form of Protector.

data.v: अन्नपानेन्धनमयो रसप्राणविवर्धनः । यो धारयति भूतानि तस्मै प्राणात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: Assuming the forms of food, drink, and fuel, you multiply the humours and the vital airs of creatures and keep up their existence. Salutations to you in your form of life.

data.v: परः कालात्परो यज्ञात्परः सदसतोश्च यः । अनादिरादिर्विश्वस्य तस्मै विश्वात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: You are superior to Time. You are superior to Sacrifice. You are higher than the highest. Having yourself no origin, you are the origin of the Universe. Salutations to you in your form as Universe.

data.v: यो मोहयति भूतानि स्नेहरागानुबन्धनैः । सर्गस्य रक्षणार्थाय तस्मै मोहात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: You stupefy all creatures by the letters of affection and love for the continuance of the creation. Salutations to you in your form of stupefaction.

data.v: आत्मज्ञानमिदं ज्ञानं ज्ञात्वा पञ्चस्ववस्थितम् । यं ज्ञानिनोऽधिगच्छन्ति तस्मै ज्ञानात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: Knowing that knowledge which knows the five elements to be the true Self-knowledge people approach you by knowledge. Salutations to you in your form of Knowledge.

data.v: अप्रमेयशरीराय सर्वतोऽनन्तचक्षुषे । अपारपरिमेयाय तस्मै चिन्त्यात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: Your body cannot be measured. Your understanding and eyes see every thing. You are infinite and immeasurable. Salutations to you in your form of vastness.

data.v: जटिने दण्डिने नित्यं लम्बोदरशरीरिणे । कमण्डलुनिषङ्गाय तस्मै ब्रह्मात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: You had assumed the form of a hermit with matted locks on head, staff in hand, a long stomach, and having alms bowl for your quiver. Salutations to your form of Brahma.

data.v: शूलिने त्रिदशेशाय त्र्यम्बकाय महात्मने । भस्मदिग्धोर्ध्वलिङ्गाय तस्मै रुद्रात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: You carry the trident, you are the lord of the celestials, you have three eyes, and you are great. Your body is always besmeared with ashes. Salutations to you in your form of Rudra.

data.v: पञ्चभूतात्मभूताय भूतादिनिधनात्मने । अक्रोधद्रोहमोहाय तस्मै शान्तात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: You are the soul of all creatures. You are the Creator and the Destroyer of all creatures. You are without anger, without enmity, without affection. Salutations to you in your form of Peace.

data.v: यस्मिन्सर्वं यतः सर्वं यः सर्वं सर्वतश्च यः । यश्च सर्वमयो नित्यं तस्मै सर्वात्मने नमः ॥
data.md: Everything is in you. Everything originates from you. You are Everything. Everywhere are you. You are always the All. Salutations to you in your form as Everything.

data.v: विश्वकर्मन्नमस्तेऽस्तु विश्वात्मन्विश्वसंभव । अपवर्गोऽसि भूतानां पञ्चानां परतः स्थितः ॥
data.md: The universe is the work of your hand. You are the soul of the universe and the universe has originated from you. Salutations to you. You are the end of all created things. You are above the five elements.

data.v: नमस्ते त्रिषु लोकेषु नमस्ते परतस्त्रिषु । नमस्ते दिक्षु सर्वासु त्वं हि सर्वपरायणम् ॥
data.md: Salutations to you who are the three worlds to you who are above the three worlds! Salutations to you who are all the directions. You are all you are the one refuge of All.

data.v: नमस्ते भगवन्विष्णो लोकानां प्रभवाप्यय । त्वं हि कर्ता हृषीकेश संहर्ता चापराजितः ॥
data.md: Salutations to you. O divine Lord, O Vishnu, and, O eternal origin of all the worlds. You, O Hrishikesha, are the Creator, you are the Destroyer, and you are invincible.

data.v: तेन पश्यामि ते दिव्यान्भावान्हि त्रिषु वर्त्मसु । तच्च पश्यामि तत्त्वेन यत्ते रूपं सनातनम् ॥
data.md: I cannot see that divine form in which you are manifest in the Past, Present, and Future. I can, however, see truly your eternal form.

data.v: दिवं ते शिरसा व्याप्तं पद्भ्यां देवी वसुंधरा । विक्रमेण त्रयो लोकाः पुरुषोऽसि सनातनः ॥
data.md: You have filled heaven with your head, and Earth with your, and feet the three worlds with your energy. You are Eternal. and permeate everything in the universe.

data.v: अतसीपुष्पसंकाशं पीतवाससमच्युतम् । ये नमस्यन्ति गोविन्दं न तेषां विद्यते भयम् ॥
data.md: Those who worship you, are freed from all fears, O Govinda of undecaying prowess, you are clad in yellow robes of the colour of the Atasi flower.

data.v: यथा विष्णुमयं सत्यं यथा विष्णुमयं हविः । यथा विष्णुमयं सर्वं पाप्मा मे नश्यतां तथा ॥
data.md: As Truth is full of Vishnu, as the universe is full of Vishnu, as everything full of Vishnu, so let my soul be full of Vishnu, and my sins be dissipated.

data.v: त्वां प्रपन्नाय भक्ताय गतिमिष्टां जिगीषवे । यच्छ्रेयः पुण्डरीकाक्ष तद्ध्यायस्व सुरोत्तम ॥
data.md: I seek your refuge and am devoted to you, desirous of obtaining a happy end. O you having eyes like lotus petals, O best of gods, do you think of what will be for my well-being.

data.v: इति विद्यातपोयोनिरयोनिर्विष्णुरीडितः । वाग्यज्ञेनार्चितो देवः प्रीयतां मे जनार्दनः ॥
data.md: Having yourself no origin, O Vishnu, you are the origin of Knowledge and Penances. You are thus lauded, O Janardana, thus adored by me in the Sacrifice of words only, be O god, gratified with me.

data.v: एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं भीष्मस्तद्गतमानसः । नम इत्येव कृष्णाय प्रणाममकरोत्तदा ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Having said these words, Bhishma, with mind fixed upon Krishna, said,-'Salutations to Krishna.' And bowed to him.

data.v: अभिगम्य तु योगेन भक्तिं भीष्मस्य माधवः । त्रैकाल्यदर्शनं ज्ञानं दिव्यं दातुं ययौ हरिः ॥
data.md: Learning by his Yoga power of the devotion of Bhishma, Madhava, called also Hari, (entering his body) conferred upon him divine knowledge of the Past, the Present, and the Future, and went away.

data.v: तस्मिन्नुपरते शब्दे ततस्ते ब्रह्मवादिनः । भीष्मं वाग्भिर्बाष्पकण्ठास्तमानर्चुर्महामतिम् ॥
data.md: When Bhishma became silent, the Brahmavadins, with voices suppressed with tears, worshipped that great chief of the Kurus in excellent words.

data.v: ते स्तुवन्तश्च विप्राग्र्याः केशवं पुरुषोत्तमम् । भीष्मं च शनकैः सर्वे प्रशशंसुः पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: Those foremost of Brahmanas lauded Krishna also, that first of Beings and then continued silently to praise Bhishma repeatedly.

data.v: यद्धि भूतं भविष्यच्च भवच्च पुरुषर्षभ । सर्वं तज्ज्ञानवृद्धस्य तव पाणाविवाहितम् ॥
data.md: Possessed of great knowledge, you know everything belonging to the Past, the Future and the Present.

data.v: संसारश्चैव भूतानां धर्मस्य च फलोदयः । विदितस्ते महाप्राज्ञ त्वं हि ब्रह्ममयो निधिः ॥
data.md: The dissolution of created beings and the mode of righteousness, are well known to you, O you of great wisdom, for you are an ocean of virtue and duty.

data.v: त्वां हि राज्ये स्थितं स्फीते समग्राङ्गमरोगिणम् । स्त्रीसहस्रैः परिवृतं पश्यामीहोर्ध्वरेतसम् ॥
data.md: While living in the climax of prosperity. I saw you forego female intercourse though surrounded by female companions.

data.v: ऋते शांतनवाद्भीष्मात्त्रिषु लोकेषु पार्थिव । सत्यसंधान्महावीर्याच्छूराद्धर्मैकतत्परात् ॥
data.md: Except Shantanu's highly powerful son Bhishma firmly devoted to righteousness, possessed of heroism and having virtue for the only object of life, we have never heard of any other person in the three worlds who could, by his power of asceticism, though lying on a bed of arrows and on the point of death, prevent death (from attacking him).

data.v: मृत्युमावार्य तरसा शरप्रस्तरशायिनः । निसर्गप्रभवं किंचिन्न च तातानुशुश्रुम ॥
सत्ये तपसि दाने च यज्ञाधिकरणे तथा । धनुर्वेदे च वेदे च नित्यं चैवान्ववेक्षणे ॥
data.md: We have never heard of anyone else who was so devoted to truth, to penances, to gifts, to the celebration of sacrifices, to the sciences of arms, to the Vedas, and to the protection of persons begging for the same, and who abstained from injuring any creature, so pure in conduct, so self-controlled, and so bent upon doing good to all creatures, and who was also so great a car-warrior as you.

data.v: अनृशंसं शुचिं दान्तं सर्वभूतहिते रतम् । महारथं त्वत्सदृशं न कंचिदनुशुश्रुम ॥
data.md: We have never heard of anyone else who was so devoted to truth, to penances, to gifts, to the celebration of sacrifices, to the sciences of arms, to the Vedas, and to the protection of persons begging for the same, and who abstained from injuring any creature, so pure in conduct, so self-controlled, and so bent upon doing good to all creatures, and who was also so great a car-warrior as you.

data.v: त्वं हि देवान्सगन्धर्वान्ससुरासुरराक्षसान् । शक्त एकरथेनैव विजेतुं नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: Forsooth, you are competent to defeat, on a single car, the gods, Gandharvas, Asuras, Yakshas, and Rakshasas.

data.v: त्वं हि भीष्म महाबाहो वसूनां वासवोपमः । नित्यं विप्रैः समाख्यातो नवमोऽनवमो गुणैः ॥
data.md: O mighty-armed Bhishma, you are described by the Brahinanas as the ninth of the Vasus. By your virtues, however, you have excelled them all and are equal to Vasava himself.

data.v: अहं हि त्वाभिजानामि यस्त्वं पुरुषसत्तम । त्रिदशेष्वपि विख्यातः स्वशक्त्या सुमहाबलः ॥
data.md: I know, O best of persons, that you are celebrated for your prowess, O foremost of beings, among even the very abstracts.

data.v: मनुष्येषु मनुष्येन्द्र न दृष्टो न च मे श्रुतः । भवतो यो गुणैस्तुल्यः पृथिव्यां पुरुषः क्वचित् ॥
data.md: Among men on Earth, O foremost of men, we have never seen nor heard of any one endued with such accomplishments.

data.v: त्वं हि सर्वैर्गुणै राजन्देवानप्यतिरिच्यसे । तपसा हि भवाञ्शक्तः स्रष्टुं लोकांश्चराचरान् ॥
data.md: O Kshatriya chief, you excell the gods themselves in these accomplishments. By your ascetic power you can create a universe of mobile and immobile creatures. What is the use of saying that you have acquired many blessed regions by means of your foremost of virtues?

data.v: तदस्य तप्यमानस्य ज्ञातीनां संक्षयेण वै । ज्येष्ठस्य पाण्डुपुत्रस्य शोकं भीष्म व्यपानुद ॥
data.md: Remove now the sorrow of the eldest son of Pandu who is burning with sorrow on account of the destruction of his kinsinen.

data.v: ये हि धर्माः समाख्याताश्चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य भारत । चातुराश्रम्यसंसृष्टास्ते सर्वे विदितास्तव ॥
data.md: All the duties that have been laid down for the four orders about the four modes of life and well known to you.

data.v: चातुर्वेद्ये च ये प्रोक्ताश्चातुर्होत्रे च भारत । सांख्ये योगे च नियता ये च धर्माः सनातनाः ॥
data.md: Everything again that is in the four branches of learning, in the four Hotras, O Bharata, as also those eternal duties that are laid down in Yoga and Sankhya philosophy, the duties too of the four orders and those duties that are not inconsistent with their practices, all these, along with their interpretations,-O son of Ganga, are known to you.

data.v: चातुर्वर्ण्येन यश्चैको धर्मो न स्म विरुध्यते । सेव्यमानः स चैवाद्यो गाङ्गेय विदितस्तव ॥
इतिहासपुराणं च कार्त्स्न्येन विदितं तव । धर्मशास्त्रं च सकलं नित्यं मनसि ते स्थितम् ॥
data.md: You are the master-topics of histories and the Puranas. All the scriptures treating of duty and practice are centered in your memory.

data.v: ये च केचन लोकेऽस्मिन्नर्थाः संशयकारकाः । तेषां छेत्ता नास्ति लोके त्वदन्यः पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: Except you, O foremost of men, there is no other person that can dispell the doubts that may arise regarding the subjects of knowledge studied in the world.

data.v: स पाण्डवेयस्य मनःसमुत्थितं; नरेन्द्र शोकं व्यपकर्ष मेधया । भवद्विधा ह्युत्तमबुद्धिविस्तरा; विमुह्यमानस्य जनस्य शान्तये ॥
data.md: With the help of your intelligence, do you, O prince of men, drive the sorrow felt by the son of Pandu. Persons endued with so great and such varied knowledge live only for solacing those whose minds have been stupefied.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु वचनं भीष्मो वासुदेवस्य धीमतः । किंचिदुन्नाम्य वदनं प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Hearing those words of the highly intelligent Vasudeva, Bhishma, raising his head a little, said these words with joined hands.

data.v: नमस्ते भगवन्विष्णो लोकानां निधनोद्भव । त्वं हि कर्ता हृषीकेश संहर्ता चापराजितः ॥
data.md: Salutations to you. O divine Lord, O Vishnu, and, O eternal origin of all the worlds. You, O Hrishikesha, are the Creator, you are the Destroyer, and you are invincible.

data.v: विश्वकर्मन्नमस्तेऽस्तु विश्वात्मन्विश्वसंभव । अपवर्गोऽसि भूतानां पञ्चानां परतः स्थितः ॥
data.md: The universe is the work of your hand. You are the soul of the universe and the universe has originated from you. Salutations to you. You are the end of all created things. You are above the five elements.

data.v: नमस्ते त्रिषु लोकेषु नमस्ते परतस्त्रिषु । योगेश्वर नमस्तेऽस्तु त्वं हि सर्वपरायणम् ॥
data.md: Salutations to you who are the three worlds to you who are above the three worlds! Salutations to you who are all the directions. You are all you are the one refuge of All.

data.v: मत्संश्रितं यदात्थ त्वं वचः पुरुषसत्तम । तेन पश्यामि ते दिव्यान्भावान्हि त्रिषु वर्त्मसु ॥
data.md: O foremost of beings, those words which you have said regarding me have enabled me to see your divine attributes as manifest in the three worlds. O Govinda, I also behold your eternal image.

data.v: तच्च पश्यामि तत्त्वेन यत्ते रूपं सनातनम् । सप्त मार्गा निरुद्धास्ते वायोरमिततेजसः ॥
दिवं ते शिरसा व्याप्तं पद्भ्यां देवी वसुंधरा । दिशो भुजौ रविश्चक्षुर्वीर्ये शक्रः प्रतिष्ठितः ॥
अतसीपुष्पसंकाशं पीतवाससमच्युतम् । वपुर्ह्यनुमिमीमस्ते मेघस्येव सविद्युतः ॥
त्वत्प्रपन्नाय भक्ताय गतिमिष्टां जिगीषवे । यच्छ्रेयः पुण्डरीकाक्ष तद्ध्यायस्व सुरोत्तम ॥
data.md: I seek your refuge and am devoted to you, desirous of obtaining a happy end. O you having eyes like lotus petals, O best of gods, do you think of what will be for my well-being.

data.v: यतः खलु परा भक्तिर्मयि ते पुरुषर्षभ । ततो वपुर्मया दिव्यं तव राजन्प्रदर्शितम् ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said-'Since, O foremost of men, your devotion to me is very great, for this, O prince, I have shown my divine form to you.

data.v: न ह्यभक्ताय राजेन्द्र भक्तायानृजवे न च । दर्शयाम्यहमात्मानं न चादान्ताय भारत ॥
data.md: I do not, O foremost of kings, display myself to one which is not my votary, or to a devotee who is not sincere, or to one, O Bharata, who has not restrained his soul.

data.v: भवांस्तु मम भक्तश्च नित्यं चार्जवमास्थितः । दमे तपसि सत्ये च दाने च निरतः शुचिः ॥
data.md: You are devoted to me and always observe righteousiness, Of a pure heart, you are always self-restrained and ever practice penances and make gifts.

data.v: अर्हस्त्वं भीष्म मां द्रष्टुं तपसा स्वेन पार्थिव । तव ह्युपस्थिता लोका येभ्यो नावर्तते पुनः ॥
data.md: Through your own penances, O Bhishma, you are competent to see me. Those regions from which no one returns, O King, are ready for you.

data.v: पञ्चाशतं षट्च कुरुप्रवीर; शेषं दिनानां तव जीवितस्य । ततः शुभैः कर्मफलोदयैस्त्वं; समेष्यसे भीष्म विमुच्य देहम् ॥
data.md: Fifty-six days, O foremost of Kuru's race, still remain for you to live. Renouncing your body, you shall then, O Bhishma, obtain the blessed meed of your deeds.

data.v: एते हि देवा वसवो विमाना;न्यास्थाय सर्वे ज्वलिताग्निकल्पाः । अन्तर्हितास्त्वां प्रतिपालयन्ति; काष्ठां प्रपद्यन्तमुदक्पतंगम् ॥
data.md: See, those deities and the Vasus, all having fiery forms, riding on their cars, are waiting for you invisibly till the moment of the Sun's entering on his northerly course.

data.v: व्यावृत्तमात्रे भगवत्युदीचीं; सूर्ये दिशं कालवशात्प्रपन्ने । गन्तासि लोकान्पुरुषप्रवीर; नावर्तते यानुपलभ्य विद्वान् ॥
data.md: Subject to universal time, when the divine Sun turns to his northerly course, you, O foremost of men, shall go to those regions whence no man returns to this Earth.

data.v: अमुं च लोकं त्वयि भीष्म याते; ज्ञानानि नङ्क्ष्यन्त्यखिलेन वीर । अतः स्म सर्वे त्वयि संनिकर्षं; समागता धर्मविवेचनाय ॥
data.md: When you, O Bhishma, will leave this world all knowledge, O hero, will end with you. It is, therefore, that all these persons, assembled together, have approached you for listening to discourses on duty and morality.

data.v: तज्ज्ञातिशोकोपहतश्रुताय; सत्याभिसंधाय युधिष्ठिराय । प्रब्रूहि धर्मार्थसमाधियुक्त;मर्थ्यं वचोऽस्यापनुदास्य शोकम् ॥
data.md: Do you then speak words of truth, containing morality and profit and Yoga, to Yudhishthira who is firm in truth but whose learning has been clouded by consequent on the destruction of his kinsmen, and do you by this, speedily remove that grief of his. sorrow

data.v: ततः कृष्णस्य तद्वाक्यं धर्मार्थसहितं हितम् । श्रुत्वा शांतनवो भीष्मः प्रत्युवाच कृताञ्जलिः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, Hearing these words of Krishna pregnant with morality and worldly profit, Shantanu's son Bhishma answered him thus. Bhishma said

data.v: लोकनाथ महाबाहो शिव नारायणाच्युत । तव वाक्यमभिश्रुत्य हर्षेणास्मि परिप्लुतः ॥
data.md: O lord of all the worlds, O mighty-armed one, O Shiva, O Narayana, O you of undecaying glory, hearing your words I have been filled with joy.

data.v: किं चाहमभिधास्यामि वाक्पते तव संनिधौ । यदा वाचोगतं सर्वं तव वाचि समाहितम् ॥
data.md: But what words, O master of speech, can I communicate in your presence, when especially all the subjects of speech have been treated in your specch?

data.v: यद्धि किंचित्कृतं लोके कर्तव्यं क्रियते च यत् । त्वत्तस्तन्निःसृतं देव लोका बुद्धिमया हि ते ॥
data.md: Whatever in either world should be done or is done, emanates from your intelligent self, O god.

data.v: कथयेद्देवलोकं यो देवराजसमीपतः । धर्मकामार्थशास्त्राणां सोऽर्थान्ब्रूयात्तवाग्रतः ॥
data.md: That person, who can speak on the subject of heaven before the king of the celestials, himself is able to deal with morality and desire and profit and liberation in your presence.

data.v: शराभिघाताद्व्यथितं मनो मे मधुसूदन । गात्राणि चावसीदन्ति न च बुद्धिः प्रसीदति ॥
data.md: My mind, O destroyer of Madhu, is greatly agitated by the pain of wounds inflicted by arrows. My limbs are weak, My understanding is not clear.

data.v: न च मे प्रतिभा काचिदस्ति किंचित्प्रभाषितुम् । पीड्यमानस्य गोविन्द विषानलसमैः शरैः ॥
data.md: I am so afflicted, O Govinda, by these arrows resembling poison or fire that I have not the power to speak anything.

data.v: बलं मेधाः प्रजरति प्राणाः संत्वरयन्ति च । मर्माणि परितप्यन्ते भ्रान्तं चेतस्तथैव च ॥
data.md: My strength is leaving me. My vital airs are about to leave me. The very vitals of my body are being consumed. My understanding is clouded.

data.v: दौर्बल्यात्सज्जते वाङ्मे स कथं वक्तुमुत्सहे । साधु मे त्वं प्रसीदस्व दाशार्हकुलनन्दन ॥
data.md: From weakness my words are becoming indistinct. How then can I dare speak? O lord of Dasharha's race, be pleased with me.

data.v: तत्क्षमस्व महाबाहो न ब्रूयां किंचिदच्युत । त्वत्संनिधौ च सीदेत वाचस्पतिरपि ब्रुवन् ॥
data.md: O mighty-armed one, I will not say anything. Pardon me. Even the lord of speech (Brihaspati) will hesitate to speak before you.

data.v: न दिशः संप्रजानामि नाकाशं न च मेदिनीम् । केवलं तव वीर्येण तिष्ठामि मधुसूदन ॥
data.md: I cannot any longer decipher the points of the compass, nor distinguish the sky from the earth. Through your energy, O slayer of Madhu, I am only alive.

data.v: स्वयमेव प्रभो तस्माद्धर्मराजस्य यद्धितम् । तद्ब्रवीह्याशु सर्वेषामागमानां त्वमागमः ॥
data.md: Do you, therefore, yourself speak for the behoof of king Yudhishthira, for you are the ordainer of all the ordinances.

data.v: कथं त्वयि स्थिते लोके शाश्वते लोककर्तरि । प्रब्रूयान्मद्विधः कश्चिद्गुरौ शिष्य इव स्थिते ॥
data.md: How, O Krishna, when you, the eternal creator of the universe, are present, can one like me speak like a disciple before his preceptor?

data.v: उपपन्नमिदं वाक्यं कौरवाणां धुरंधरे । महावीर्ये महासत्त्वे स्थिते सर्वार्थदर्शिनि ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said Your words become you only who are the foremost of Kuru's race, who are endued with great energy, who are of great soul, and who are possessed of great patience and conversant with every subject.

data.v: यच्च मामात्थ गाङ्गेय बाणघातरुजं प्रति । गृहाणात्र वरं भीष्म मत्प्रसादकृतं विभो ॥
data.md: Regarding what you have said about the pain of wounds, receive, O Bhishma, this boon what I grant you, O powerful one, from favour.

data.v: न ते ग्लानिर्न ते मूर्छा न दाहो न च ते रुजा । प्रभविष्यन्ति गाङ्गेय क्षुत्पिपासे न चाप्युत ॥
data.md: Uneasiness, stupefaction, burning pain, hunger and thirst shall not, O son of Ganga, assail you, O you of undecaying glory.

data.v: ज्ञानानि च समग्राणि प्रतिभास्यन्ति तेऽनघ । न च ते क्वचिदासक्तिर्बुद्धेः प्रादुर्भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Your perception and memory, Osinless one, shall be unclouded. Your understanding shall not disappear.

data.v: सत्त्वस्थं च मनो नित्यं तव भीष्म भविष्यति । रजस्तमोभ्यां रहितं घनैर्मुक्त इवोडुराट् ॥
data.md: Your mind, O Bhishma, freed from the qualities of darkness and ignorance will always be subject to the quality of goodness, like the moon coming out of the clouds.

data.v: यद्यच्च धर्मसंयुक्तमर्थयुक्तमथापि वा । चिन्तयिष्यसि तत्राग्र्या बुद्धिस्तव भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Your understanding will penetrate every subject regarding duty, morality, or profit, you will think upon.

data.v: इमं च राजशार्दूल भूतग्रामं चतुर्विधम् । चक्षुर्दिव्यं समाश्रित्य द्रक्ष्यस्यमितविक्रम ॥
data.md: O foremost of kings, acquiring choice vision, you will, O you of incomparable prowess, succeed in seeing the four orders of created things.

data.v: चतुर्विधं प्रजाजालं संयुक्तो ज्ञानचक्षुषा । भीष्म द्रक्ष्यसि तत्त्वेन जले मीन इवामले ॥
data.md: Possessing the eye of knowledge, you will, O Bhishma, see, like fishes in a limpid stream, all created things that you will try to recollect.'

data.v: ततस्ते व्याससहिताः सर्व एव महर्षयः । ऋग्यजुःसामसंयुक्तैर्वचोभिः कृष्णमर्चयन् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, Then those great Rishis, with Vyasa amongst them, worshipped Krishna with hymns from the Richs, the Yajus, and the Samans.

data.v: ततः सर्वार्तवं दिव्यं पुष्पवर्षं नभस्तलात् । पपात यत्र वार्ष्णेयः सगाङ्गेयः सपाण्डवः ॥
data.md: A shower of celestial flowers of all seasons fell on that spot where the Vrishni hero with Ganga's son and the son of Pandu were.

data.v: वादित्राणि च दिव्यानि जगुश्चाप्सरसां गणाः । न चाहितमनिष्टं वा किंचित्तत्र व्यदृश्यत ॥
data.md: All kinds of celestial instruments played in the sky and the Apsaras began to sing. No evil portent appeared there.

data.v: ववौ शिवः सुखो वायुः सर्वगन्धवहः शुचिः । शान्तायां दिशि शान्ताश्च प्रावदन्मृगपक्षिणः ॥
data.md: An auspicious, pleasant and pure breeze, carrying every kind of fragrance, began to blow. All the points of the horizon became clear and quiet, and all the animals and birds began to move about peacefully.

data.v: ततो मुहूर्ताद्भगवान्सहस्रांशुर्दिवाकरः । दहन्वनमिवैकान्ते प्रतीच्यां प्रत्यदृश्यत ॥
data.md: Soon after, like a fire at the outskirt of a great forest, the divine Sun of a thousand rays was seen to descend westwards.

data.v: ततो महर्षयः सर्वे समुत्थाय जनार्दनम् । भीष्ममामन्त्रयां चक्रू राजानं च युधिष्ठिरम् ॥
data.md: Then, rising up, the great Rishis saluted Janardana and Bhishma and king Yudhishthira.

data.v: ततः प्रणाममकरोत्केशवः पाण्डवस्तथा । सात्यकिः संजयश्चैव स च शारद्वतः कृपः ॥
data.md: Upon this, Keshava, the sons of Pandu, Satyaki, Sanjaya, and Sharadwat's son Kripa, bowed reverentially to those sages.

data.v: ततस्ते धर्मनिरताः सम्यक्तैरभिपूजिताः । श्वः समेष्याम इत्युक्त्वा यथेष्टं त्वरिता ययुः ॥
data.md: Always righteous those sages, thus adored by Keshava and others, quickly went to their respective habitations saying-We will return tomorrow.'

data.v: तथैवामन्त्र्य गाङ्गेयं केशवस्ते च पाण्डवाः । प्रदक्षिणमुपावृत्य रथानारुरुहुः शुभान् ॥
data.md: After this, Keshava and the Pandavas, saluting Bhishma and going round him, got upon their beautiful cars.

data.v: ततो रथैः काञ्चनदन्तकूबरै;र्महीधराभैः समदैश्च दन्तिभिः । हयैः सुपर्णैरिव चाशुगामिभिः; पदातिभिश्चात्तशरासनादिभिः ॥
data.md: Those heroes then went out, accompanied by many other cars adorned with golden Kuvaras, and infuriate elephants resembling mountains, and horses quick-coursing as Garudas, and the infantry armed with bows and weapons.

data.v: ययौ रथानां पुरतो हि सा चमू;स्तथैव पश्चादतिमात्रसारिणी । पुरश्च पश्चाच्च यथा महानदी; पुरर्क्षवन्तं गिरिमेत्य नर्मदा ॥
data.md: That army, moving quickly, proceeded in two detachments, one in the van and the other in the rear of those princes. The spectacle shone like two currents of the great river Narmada at the point where it is divided by the Rikshavat mountains standing across it.

data.v: ततः पुरस्ताद्भगवान्निशाकरः; समुत्थितस्तामभिहर्षयंश्चमूम् । दिवाकरापीतरसास्तथौषधीः; पुनः स्वकेनैव गुणेन योजयन् ॥
data.md: Cheering up that great army the divine Moon rose before it in the sky, once more giving moisture, by his own force, to the terrestrial herbs and plants whose juice has been drunk up by the Sun.

data.v: ततः पुरं सुरपुरसंनिभद्युति; प्रविश्य ते यदुवृषपाण्डवास्तदा । यथोचितान्भवनवरान्समाविश;ञ्श्रमान्विता मृगपतयो गुहा इव ॥
data.md: Then that foremost of Yadu's race and the sons of Pandu, entering the (Kuru) city which was shining like that of the city of Indra itself, proceeded to their respective edifices like tired lions seeking their caves.

data.v: ततः प्रविश्य भवनं प्रसुप्तो मधुसूदनः । याममात्रावशेषायां यामिन्यां प्रत्यबुध्यत ॥
स ध्यानपथमाश्रित्य सर्वज्ञानानि माधवः । अवलोक्य ततः पश्चाद्दध्यौ ब्रह्म सनातनम् ॥
ततः श्रुतिपुराणज्ञाः शिक्षिता रक्तकण्ठिनः । अस्तुवन्विश्वकर्माणं वासुदेवं प्रजापतिम् ॥
data.md: Then a number of well-trained and sweet voiced persons conversant with hymns and the Puranas, began to sing the praises of Vasudeva, the master of all creatures and the creator of the universe.

data.v: पठन्ति पाणिस्वनिकास्तथा गायन्ति गायनाः । शङ्खानकमृदङ्गांश्च प्रवाद्यन्त सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: Others, keeping time by the clapping of hands, began to sing sweet hymns, and vocalists began to sing. Thousands of conchshells and drums were blown and beat.

data.v: वीणापणववेणूनां स्वनश्चातिमनोरमः । प्रहास इव विस्तीर्णः शुश्रुवे तस्य वेश्मनः ॥
data.md: The charming sound also of Vinas; Panavas, and bamboo flutes, was heard. The spacious edifice of Krishna, seemed, as if to laugh with music.

data.v: तथा युधिष्ठिरस्यापि राज्ञो मङ्गलसंहिताः । उच्चेरुर्मधुरा वाचो गीतवादित्रसंहिताः ॥
data.md: In the mansion of King Yudhishthira also melodious voices were heard, exclaiming auspicious wishes, and the sound of songs too and musical instruments.

data.v: तत उत्थाय दाशार्हः स्नातः प्राञ्जलिरच्युतः । जप्त्वा गुह्यं महाबाहुरग्नीनाश्रित्य तस्थिवान् ॥
data.md: Then the Dasharha here performed his ablutions. Joining his hands, the mighty armed hero, of undecaying glory, silently recited his sacred Mantras, and lighting up a fire poured libations of clarified butter upon it.

data.v: ततः सहस्रं विप्राणां चतुर्वेदविदां तथा । गवां सहस्रेणैकैकं वाचयामास माधवः ॥
data.md: Distributing a thousand kine amongst a thousand Brahmanas all of whom were masters of the four Vedas, he made them utter benedictions upon him.

data.v: मङ्गलालम्भनं कृत्वा आत्मानमवलोक्य च । आदर्शे विमले कृष्णस्ततः सात्यकिमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Touching next various sorts of sacred articles and beholding himself in a clear mirror, Krishna addressed Satyaki, saying,—'Go, O descendant of Shini, and repairing to Yudhishthira's palace, ascertain whether if the king is dressed for visiting Bhishma.'

data.v: गच्छ शैनेय जानीहि गत्वा राजनिवेशनम् । अपि सज्जो महातेजा भीष्मं द्रष्टुं युथिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: Touching next various sorts of sacred articles and beholding himself in a clear mirror, Krishna addressed Satyaki, saying,—'Go, O descendant of Shini, and repairing to Yudhishthira's palace, ascertain whether if the king is dressed for visiting Bhishma.'

data.v: ततः कृष्णस्य वचनात्सात्यकिस्त्वरितो ययौ । उपगम्य च राजानं युधिष्ठिरमुवाच ह ॥
data.md: Thus commanded by Krishna, Satyaki, proceeding quickly to the royal son of Pandu, said to him-'The foremost of cars, belonging to the highly intelligent Vasudeva, is ready, O king, for Janardana will go to see Ganga's son.

data.v: युक्तो रथवरो राजन्वासुदेवस्य धीमतः । समीपमापगेयस्य प्रयास्यति जनार्दनः ॥
data.md: Thus commanded by Krishna, Satyaki, proceeding quickly to the royal son of Pandu, said to him-'The foremost of cars, belonging to the highly intelligent Vasudeva, is ready, O king, for Janardana will go to see Ganga's son.

data.v: भवत्प्रतीक्षः कृष्णोऽसौ धर्मराज महाद्युते । यदत्रानन्तरं कृत्यं तद्भवान्कर्तुमर्हति ॥
data.md: O righteous, great, and powerful king! Krishna is waiting for you. You should now do what should be done next. Thus addressed, Dharma's son Yudhishthira answered as follows.

data.v: युज्यतां मे रथवरः फल्गुनाप्रतिमद्युते । न सैनिकैश्च यातव्यं यास्यामो वयमेव हि ॥
data.md: ‘O Phalguna of matchless splendour, let my best of cars be made ready. We should not be accompanied by the soldiers, but we shall proceed alone.

data.v: न च पीडयितव्यो मे भीष्मो धर्मभृतां वरः । अतः पुरःसराश्चापि निवर्तन्तु धनंजय ॥
data.md: That best or righteous person viz., Bhishma, should not be vexed. Let not the guards, therefore, O Dhananjaya accompany us today.

data.v: अद्यप्रभृति गाङ्गेयः परं गुह्यं प्रवक्ष्यति । ततो नेच्छामि कौन्तेय पृथग्जनसमागमम् ॥
data.md: From this day Ganga's son will discourse on things that are great mysteries, I do not, therefore, O son of Kunti, wish that there should be a miscellaneous assembly.'

data.v: तद्वाक्यमाकर्ण्य तथा कुन्तीपुत्रो धनंजयः । युक्तं रथवरं तस्मा आचचक्षे नरर्षभ ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of the king, Kunti's son Dhananjaya, that best of men went out and returning said to him that his best of cars stood ready for him.

data.v: ततो युधिष्ठिरो राजा यमौ भीमार्जुनावपि । भूतानीव समस्तानि ययुः कृष्णनिवेशनम् ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira, the twins Bhima and Arjuna, the five resembling the five elements, then proceeded towards Krishna's mansion.

data.v: आगच्छत्स्वथ कृष्णोऽपि पाण्डवेषु महात्मसु । शैनेयसहितो धीमान्रथमेवान्वपद्यत ॥
data.md: While the great Pandavas were coming, Krishna accompanied by the grandson of Shini, got upon his car.

data.v: रथस्थाः संविदं कृत्वा सुखां पृष्ट्वा च शर्वरीम् । मेघघोषै रथवरैः प्रययुस्ते महारथाः ॥
data.md: Saluting one another from their cars and each enquiring of the other whether he had passed the night happily, those foremost of men proceeded, without stopping, on those foremost of cars whose rattle resembled the roar of the clouds.

data.v: मेघपुष्पं बलाहं च सैन्यं सुग्रीवमेव च । दारुकश्चोदयामास वासुदेवस्य वाजिनः ॥
ते हया वासुदेवस्य दारुकेण प्रचोदिताः । गां खुराग्रैस्तथा राजँल्लिखन्तः प्रययुस्तदा ॥
data.md: Krishna's horses, viz., Balahaka, Meghapushpa, Shaivya and Sugriva were driven by Daruka. The animals, urged by him, O king, ran on marking the Earth with their hoofs.

data.v: ते ग्रसन्त इवाकाशं वेगवन्तो महाबलाः । क्षेत्रं धर्मस्य कृत्स्नस्य कुरुक्षेत्रमवातरन् ॥
data.md: Highly strong and quick-coursing, they flew onwards, devouring as if the very skies. Traversing the sacred field of Kuru, the princes went to that spot where the powerful Bhishma was lying on his bed of arrows, surrounded by those great Rishis, like Brahman himself in the midst of the celestials.

data.v: ततो ययुर्यत्र भीष्मः शरतल्पगतः प्रभुः । आस्ते ब्रह्मर्षिभिः सार्धं ब्रह्मा देवगणैर्यथा ॥
data.md: Highly strong and quick-coursing, they flew onwards, devouring as if the very skies. Traversing the sacred field of Kuru, the princes went to that spot where the powerful Bhishma was lying on his bed of arrows, surrounded by those great Rishis, like Brahman himself in the midst of the celestials.

data.v: ततोऽवतीर्य गोविन्दो रथात्स च युधिष्ठिरः । भीमो गाण्डीवधन्वा च यमौ सात्यकिरेव च । ऋषीनभ्यर्चयामासुः करानुद्यम्य दक्षिणान् ॥
data.md: Then Govinda, Yudhishthira. Bhima, and the wielder of Gandiva, the twins and Satyaki, getting down from their cars, saluted the Rishis by raising their right hands.

data.v: स तैः परिवृतो राजा नक्षत्रैरिव चन्द्रमाः । अभ्याजगाम गाङ्गेयं ब्रह्माणमिव वासवः ॥
data.md: Encircled by them, king Yudhishthira, like the moon in the midst of the stars, approached Ganga's son like Vasava proceeding towards Brahman.

data.v: शरतल्पे शयानं तमादित्यं पतितं यथा । ददर्श स महाबाहुर्भयादागतसाध्वसः ॥
data.md: Possessed by fear, the king timidly cast his eyes on the mighty-armed hero lying on his bed of arrows like the Sun himself dropped from the sky.

data.v: धर्मात्मनि महासत्त्वे सत्यसंधे जितात्मनि । देवव्रते महाभागे शरतल्पगतेऽच्युते ॥
शयाने वीरशयने भीष्मे शंतनुनन्दने । गाङ्गेये पुरुषव्याघ्रे पाण्डवैः पर्युपस्थिते ॥
काः कथाः समवर्तन्त तस्मिन्वीरसमागमे । हतेषु सर्वसैन्येषु तन्मे शंस महामुने ॥
शरतल्पगते भीष्मे कौरवाणां धुरंधरे । आजग्मुरृषयः सिद्धा नारदप्रमुखा नृप ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said When Bhishma, that chief of the Kurus, lay on his bed of arrows, many Rishis and Siddhas, O king, headed by Narada, came there.

data.v: हतशिष्टाश्च राजानो युधिष्ठिरपुरोगमाः । धृतराष्ट्रश्च कृष्णश्च भीमार्जुनयमास्तथा ॥
data.md: The residue of the king with Yudhishthira at their head, Dhritarashtra, Krishna, Bhima, Arjuna and the twins also came there.

data.v: तेऽभिगम्य महात्मानो भरतानां पितामहम् । अन्वशोचन्त गाङ्गेयमादित्यं पतितं यथा ॥
data.md: Approaching the grandfather of the Bharatas who shone like the Sun himself dropped from the sky, those great persons began to bewail for him.

data.v: मुहूर्तमिव च ध्यात्वा नारदो देवदर्शनः । उवाच पाण्डवान्सर्वान्हतशिष्टांश्च पार्थिवान् ॥
data.md: Then reflecting for a moment, Narada, of divine features, addressed all the Pandavas and the residue of the kings, saying, 'The time, I think, has come for you to question Bhishma for Ganga's son is about to die like the Sun that is on the point of setting.

data.v: प्राप्तकालं च आचक्षे भीष्मोऽयमनुयुज्यताम् । अस्तमेति हि गाङ्गेयो भानुमानिव भारत ॥
data.md: Then reflecting for a moment, Narada, of divine features, addressed all the Pandavas and the residue of the kings, saying, 'The time, I think, has come for you to question Bhishma for Ganga's son is about to die like the Sun that is on the point of setting.

data.v: अयं प्राणानुत्सिसृक्षुस्तं सर्वेऽभ्येत्य पृच्छत । कृत्स्नान्हि विविधान्धर्मांश्चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य वेत्त्ययम् ॥
data.md: He is about to give up his ghost. Do you all, therefore, request him to discourse to you. He is acquainted with the various duties of all the four orders.

data.v: एष वृद्धः पुरा लोकान्संप्राप्नोति तनुत्यजाम् । तं शीघ्रमनुयुञ्जध्वं संशयान्मनसि स्थितान् ॥
data.md: Aged as he is, after renouncing his corporeal frame he will attain to high regions of bliss. Request him, therefore, forthwith to clear the doubts that exist in your minds.

data.v: एवमुक्ता नारदेन भीष्ममीयुर्नराधिपाः । प्रष्टुं चाशक्नुवन्तस्ते वीक्षां चक्रुः परस्परम् ॥
data.md: Thus accosted by Narada, those princes approached Bhishina, but unable to ask him anything looked at one another.

data.v: अथोवाच हृषीकेशं पाण्डुपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः । नान्यस्त्वद्देवकीपुत्र शक्तः प्रष्टुं पितामहम् ॥
data.md: Then Yudhishthira the son of Pandu, addressing Hrishikesha, said,-"There is no one else then Devaki's son who can question the grandfather.

data.v: प्रव्याहारय दुर्धर्ष त्वमग्रे मधुसूदन । त्वं हि नस्तात सर्वेषां सर्वधर्मविदुत्तमः ॥
data.md: O foremost one of Yadu's race, do you, therefore, O destroyer of Madhu, speak first. You are the foremost of us all and are conversant with every duty and practice.'

data.v: एवमुक्तः पाण्डवेन भगवान्केशवस्तदा । अभिगम्य दुराधर्षं प्रव्याहारयदच्युतः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by the son of Pandu, the illustrious Keshava of undecaying glory, approaching the unconquerable Bhishma, spoke to him as follows.

data.v: कच्चित्सुखेन रजनी व्युष्टा ते राजसत्तम । विस्पष्टलक्षणा बुद्धिः कच्चिच्चोपस्थिता तव ॥
data.md: Have you, O best of kings passed the night happily? Has your understanding become unclouded?

data.v: कच्चिज्ज्ञानानि सर्वाणि प्रतिभान्ति च तेऽनघ । न ग्लायते च हृदयं न च ते व्याकुलं मनः ॥
data.md: Does your knowledge, O sinless one, shine in you by inward light? I hope your heart does not feel pain and your mind is no longer agitated?'

data.v: दाहो मोहः श्रमश्चैव क्लमो ग्लानिस्तथा रुजा । तव प्रसादाद्गोविन्द सद्यो व्यपगतानघ ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Burning, stupefaction, toil, exhaustion, and pain, through your Grace, O you of Vrishni's race, have all left me in a single day.

data.v: यच्च भूतं भविष्यच्च भवच्च परमद्युते । तत्सर्वमनुपश्यामि पाणौ फलमिवाहितम् ॥
data.md: O you of matchless splendour, I behold as distinctly as a fruit placed in my hands, all that is past, all that is future, and all that is present.

data.v: वेदोक्ताश्चैव ये धर्मा वेदान्तनिहिताश्च ये । तान्सर्वान्संप्रपश्यामि वरदानात्तवाच्युत ॥
data.md: I behold clearly, O you of unfading glory, by virtue of the boon granted by you to me, all the duties laid down in the Vedas, and in the Vedantas.

data.v: शिष्टैश्च धर्मो यः प्रोक्तः स च मे हृदि वर्तते । देशजातिकुलानां च धर्मज्ञोऽस्मि जनार्दन ॥
data.md: The duties that have been described by persons of learning and righteous conduct are still fresh in my memory. I am conversant also, O Janardana, with the duties and practices obtaining in particular countries and among particular tribes and families.

data.v: चतुर्ष्वाश्रमधर्मेषु योऽर्थः स च हृदि स्थितः । राजधर्मांश्च सकलानवगच्छामि केशव ॥
data.md: I remember again everything regarding the four modes of life. I am acquainted, O Keshava, with the royal duties.

data.v: यत्र यत्र च वक्तव्यं तद्वक्ष्यामि जनार्दन । तव प्रसादाद्धि शुभा मनो मे बुद्धिराविशत् ॥
data.md: I would say, O Janardana, everything in its proper hour. Through your favour, I have acquired an auspicious understanding.

data.v: युवेव चास्मि संवृत्तस्त्वदनुध्यानबृंहितः । वक्तुं श्रेयः समर्थोऽस्मि त्वत्प्रसादाज्जनार्दन ॥
data.md: Strengthened by contemplation of you, I feel as if I have become a young man again. Through your favour, O Janardana, I have become capable to talk on what is for the behoof of the world.

data.v: स्वयं किमर्थं तु भवाञ्श्रेयो न प्राह पाण्डवम् । किं ते विवक्षितं चात्र तदाशु वद माधव ॥
data.md: Why, however, O holy one, do you not yourself describe to Pandu's son all that is good? What explanation can you give about it? Tell me quickly, O Madhava.'

data.v: यशसः श्रेयसश्चैव मूलं मां विद्धि कौरव । मत्तः सर्वेऽभिनिर्वृत्ता भावाः सदसदात्मकाः ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said Know, O you of Kuru's race, that I am the root of fame and of everything that produces good. All things, good or bad, emanate from me.

data.v: शीतांशुश्चन्द्र इत्युक्ते को लोके विस्मयिष्यति । तथैव यशसा पूर्णे मयि को विस्मयिष्यति ॥
आधेयं तु मया भूयो यशस्तव महाद्युते । ततो मे विपुला बुद्धिस्त्वयि भीष्म समाहिता ॥
data.md: I have, however, resolved to enhance your fame, O you of great splendour. It is for this, O Bhishma, that I have just filled you with great intelligence.

data.v: यावद्धि पृथिवीपाल पृथिवी स्थास्यते ध्रुवा । तावत्तवाक्षया कीर्तिर्लोकाननु चरिष्यति ॥
data.md: As long, O king, as the Earth will last, so long will your fame travel with unmitigated lustre through all the worlds.

data.v: यच्च त्वं वक्ष्यसे भीष्म पाण्डवायानुपृच्छते । वेदप्रवादा इव ते स्थास्यन्ति वसुधातले ॥
data.md: Whatever, O Bhishma, you will say to the inquiring son of Pandu, will pass on Earth like the authoritative declarations of the Vedas.

data.v: यश्चैतेन प्रमाणेन योक्ष्यत्यात्मानमात्मना । स फलं सर्वपुण्यानां प्रेत्य चानुभविष्यति ॥
data.md: That person, who will follow the authority of your declarations, will obtain hereafter the meed of every meritorious act.

data.v: एतस्मात्कारणाद्भीष्म मतिर्दिव्या मया हि ते । दत्ता यशो विप्रथेत कथं भूयस्तवेति ह ॥
data.md: For this reason, O Bhishma, I have conferred on you celestial understanding so that your fame may be increased on Earth.

data.v: यावद्धि प्रथते लोके पुरुषस्य यशो भुवि । तावत्तस्याक्षयं स्थानं भवतीति विनिश्चितम् ॥
data.md: As long as a man's fame lasts in the world, so long are his good deeds alive.

data.v: राजानो हतशिष्टास्त्वां राजन्नभित आसते । धर्माननुयुयुक्षन्तस्तेभ्यः प्रब्रूहि भारत ॥
data.md: The unslain residue of the kings are sitting around you, desirous of hearing your discourses on morality and duty. Do you speak to them, O Bharata.

data.v: भवान्हि वयसा वृद्धः श्रुताचारसमन्वितः । कुशलो राजधर्माणां पूर्वेषामपराश्च ये ॥
data.md: You are aged and your conduct is consistent with the injunctions of the Shrutis. You are a master of the royal duties and of every other science of duty.

data.v: जन्मप्रभृति ते कश्चिद्वृजिनं न ददर्श ह । ज्ञातारमनुधर्माणां त्वां विदुः सर्वपार्थिवाः ॥
data.md: No one, has ever marked the slightest transgression in you since your very birth. All the kings know you to be master of the sciences of morality and duty.

data.v: तेभ्यः पितेव पुत्रेभ्यो राजन्ब्रूहि परं नयम् । ऋषयश्च हि देवाश्च त्वया नित्यमुपासिताः ॥
data.md: Like a father to his sons do you, therefore, O king, describe to them high morality. You have always adored the Rishis and the gods.

data.v: तस्माद्वक्तव्यमेवेह त्वया पश्याम्यशेषतः । धर्माञ्शुश्रूषमाणेभ्यः पृष्टेन च सता पुनः ॥
data.md: You should discourse on these subjects fully to persons desirous of listening to discourses on morality and duty. A learned person, especially when requested by the righteous, should talk of the same. The sages have declared this to be a duty.

data.v: वक्तव्यं विदुषा चेति धर्ममाहुर्मनीषिणः । अप्रतिब्रुवतः कष्टो दोषो हि भवति प्रभो ॥
तस्मात्पुत्रैश्च पौत्रैश्च धर्मान्पृष्टः सनातनान् । विद्वाञ्जिज्ञासमानैस्त्वं प्रब्रूहि भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: O powerful one if you do not speak on such subjects, you will incur sin. Therefore, questioned by your sons and grandsons, o learned one, about the eternal duties (of men), do you, O foremost of the Bharatas, describe this subject them.

data.v: अथाब्रवीन्महातेजा वाक्यं कौरवनन्दनः । हन्त धर्मान्प्रवक्ष्यामि दृढे वाङ्मनसी मम । तव प्रसादाद्गोविन्द भूतात्मा ह्यसि शाश्वतः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said The highly energetic delighter of Kurus, viz., Bhishma said,—'I shall describe the subject of duty. My speech and mind have become steady, through your favour, O Govinda, since you are the eternal soul of every being.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरस्तु मां राजा धर्मान्समनुपृच्छतु । एवं प्रीतो भविष्यामि धर्मान्वक्ष्यामि चानघ ॥
data.md: Let the righteous-souled Yudhishthira enquire of me about morality and duty. I shall then be much pleased to speak of all duties.

data.v: यस्मिन्राजर्षभे जाते धर्मात्मनि महात्मनि । अहृष्यन्नृषयः सर्वे स मां पृच्छतु पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: Let the son of Pandu, that virtuous and noble royal sage, upon whose birth all the Vrishnis were filled with joy, question me.

data.v: सर्वेषां दीप्तयशसां कुरूणां धर्मचारिणाम् । यस्य नास्ति समः कश्चित्स मां पृच्छतु पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: Let the son of Pandu, who has no peer among all the Kurus, among all righteous persons and among celebrated men question me.

data.v: धृतिर्दमो ब्रह्मचर्यं क्षमा धर्मश्च नित्यदा । यस्मिन्नोजश्च तेजश्च स मां पृच्छतु पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: let the son of Pandu, who is endued with intelligence, self-restraint, Brahmacharya, forgiveness righteousness, mental vigour and energy, question me.

data.v: सत्यं दानं तपः शौचं शान्तिर्दाक्ष्यमसंभ्रमः । यस्मिन्नेतानि सर्वाणि स मां पृच्छतु पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: Let the son of Pandu, who is settled in truth, charity, penances, heroism, peacefulness, cleverness, and fearlessness, question me.

data.v: यो न कामान्न संरम्भान्न भयान्नार्थकारणात् । कुर्यादधर्मं धर्मात्मा स मां पृच्छतु पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: Let the pious son of Pandu, who would never commit a sin actuated by desire of pleasure of profit or from fear, question me.

data.v: संबन्धिनोऽतिथीन्भृत्यान्संश्रितोपाश्रितांश्च यः । संमानयति सत्कृत्य स मां पृच्छतु पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: Let the son of Pandu, who always by his favour honours his relative and guests and servants and dependants, question me.

data.v: सत्यनित्यः क्षमानित्यो ज्ञाननित्योऽतिथिप्रियः । यो ददाति सतां नित्यं स मां पृच्छतु पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: Let the son of Pandu, who is ever truthful, forgiving, endued with knowledge, and attentive to guests and who always makes gifts to the pious, question me.

data.v: इज्याध्ययननित्यश्च धर्मे च निरतः सदा । शान्तः श्रुतरहस्यश्च स मां पृच्छतु पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: Let the son of Pandu, who always celebrates sacrifices and studies the Vedas and satisfies the morality and duty, who is ever peaceful and who has heard all mysteries, question me.

data.v: लज्जया परयोपेतो धर्मात्मा स युधिष्ठिरः । अभिशापभयाद्भीतो भवन्तं नोपसर्पति ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said 'King Yudhishthira, possessed by great shame and fearing your imprecations, does not venture to approach you.

data.v: लोकस्य कदनं कृत्वा लोकनाथो विशां पते । अभिशापभयाद्भीतो भवन्तं नोपसर्पति ॥
data.md: That king, O monarch, having caused a great carnage, ventures not to approach you from fear of your curse.

data.v: पूज्यान्मान्यांश्च भक्तांश्च गुरून्संबन्धिबान्धवान् । अर्घ्यार्हानिषुभिर्हत्वा भवन्तं नोपसर्पति ॥
data.md: Having wounded with arrows those who were worthy of his worship, those who were devoted to him, those who were his preceptors, those who were his relatives and kinsmen, and those who deserved his highest regard, he ventures not to approach you.

data.v: ब्राह्मणानां यथा धर्मो दानमध्ययनं तपः । क्षत्रियाणां तथा कृष्ण समरे देहपातनम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said As the duty of the Brahmanas is to practise charity, to study, and perform penances, so the duty of Kshatriyas is to renounce their bodies, OKrishna, in battle.

data.v: पितॄन्पितामहान्पुत्रान्गुरून्संबन्धिबान्धवान् । मिथ्याप्रवृत्तान्यः संख्ये निहन्याद्धर्म एव सः ॥
data.md: Kshatriyas should kill fathers and grandfathers and brothers and preceptors and relatives and kinsmen that may give them an unjust battle. This is their open duty.

data.v: समयत्यागिनो लुब्धान्गुरूनपि च केशव । निहन्ति समरे पापान्क्षत्रियो यः स धर्मवित् ॥
data.md: The Kshatriya, O Keshava, knows his own duty who kills in battle his very preceptors, if they happen to be sinful and covetous and negligent of restraints and vows.

data.v: आहूतेन रणे नित्यं योद्धव्यं क्षत्रबन्धुना । धर्म्यं स्वर्ग्यं च लोक्यं च युद्धं हि मनुरब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: A Kshatriya, when challenged, must always fight in battle, for Manu has said that a righteous battle acquire both heaven and fame on Earth for him.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु भीष्मेण धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः । विनीतवदुपागम्य तस्थौ संदर्शनेऽग्रतः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said After Bhishma had spoken thus, Dharma's son Yudhishthira humbly approached the Kuru hero and stood before him.

data.v: अथास्य पादौ जग्राह भीष्मश्चाभिननन्द तम् । मूर्ध्नि चैनमुपाघ्राय निषीदेत्यब्रवीत्तदा ॥
data.md: He seized the feet of Bhishma who in return cheered him with affectionate words. Smelling his head, Bhishma asked Yudhishthira to take his seat.

data.v: तमुवाचाथ गाङ्गेय ऋषभः सर्वधन्विनाम् । पृच्छ मां तात विस्रब्धं मा भैस्त्वं कुरुसत्तम ॥
data.md: Then Ganga's son, that best of bowmen, addressed Yudhishthira, saying,—'Do not fear, O best of the Kurus. Ask me, O child, without any hesitation.'

data.v: प्रणिपत्य हृषीकेशमभिवाद्य पितामहम् । अनुमान्य गुरून्सर्वान्पर्यपृच्छद्युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: Having saluted Hrishikesha, and Bhishma, and taken the permission of all the elders assembled there, Yudhishthira began to question Bhishma.

data.v: राज्यं वै परमो धर्म इति धर्मविदो विदुः । महान्तमेतं भारं च मन्ये तद्ब्रूहि पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said 'Persons conversant with duty and morality lecture that royal duties are the highest science of duty. I also regard the burden of those duties as being highly heavy. Do you, therefore, O king, describe those duties.

data.v: राजधर्मान्विशेषेण कथयस्व पितामह । सर्वस्य जीवलोकस्य राजधर्माः परायणम् ॥
data.md: O grandfather, do you speak fully on the duties of kings. The science of royal duties is the refuge of all creatures.

data.v: त्रिवर्गोऽत्र समासक्तो राजधर्मेषु कौरव । मोक्षधर्मश्च विस्पष्टः सकलोऽत्र समाहितः ॥
data.md: O you of Kuru's race, Religion, Profit, and Pleasure depend on royal duties. It is also clear that the practices that lead to liberation equally depend on them.

data.v: यथा हि रश्मयोऽश्वस्य द्विरदस्याङ्कुशो यथा । नरेन्द्रधर्मो लोकस्य तथा प्रग्रहणं स्मृतम् ॥
data.md: As the reins govern the horse or the iron goad the elephant, so the science of royal duties forms the reins for restraining the world.

data.v: अत्र वै संप्रमूढे तु धर्मे राजर्षिसेविते । लोकस्य संस्था न भवेत्सर्वं च व्याकुलं भवेत् ॥
data.md: If one becomes bewildered regarding the duties observed by kings, disorder would prevail on Earth and everything will be in confusion.

data.v: उदयन्हि यथा सूर्यो नाशयत्यासुरं तमः । राजधर्मास्तथालोक्यामाक्षिपन्त्यशुभां गतिम् ॥
data.md: As the Sun rising removes darkness, so this science destroys all the evil consequences of the world.

data.v: तदग्रे राजधर्माणामर्थतत्त्वं पितामह । प्रब्रूहि भरतश्रेष्ठ त्वं हि बुद्धिमतां वरः ॥
data.md: Therefore, O grandfather, do you, for my sake, discourse on royal duties first of all, for you, O chief of the Bharatas, are the foremost of all persons conversant with duties.

data.v: आगमश्च परस्त्वत्तः सर्वेषां नः परंतप । भवन्तं हि परं बुद्धौ वासुदेवोऽभिमन्यते ॥
data.md: O destroyer of foes, Vasudeva considers you as the foremost of all intelligent persons. Therefore, all of us expect the best knowledge from you.'

data.v: नमो धर्माय महते नमः कृष्णाय वेधसे । ब्राह्मणेभ्यो नमस्कृत्य धर्मान्वक्ष्यामि शाश्वतान् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said 'Saluting Dharma who is Supreme, Krishna who is Brahma in full, and the Brahmanas, I shall discourse on the eternal duties (of men).

data.v: शृणु कार्त्स्न्येन मत्तस्त्वं राजधर्मान्युधिष्ठिर । निरुच्यमानान्नियतो यच्चान्यदभिवाञ्छसि ॥
data.md: Hear from me, O Yudhishthira, with rapt attention, all the royal duties described accurately and fully and other duties that you may wish to know.

data.v: आदावेव कुरुश्रेष्ठ राज्ञा रञ्जनकाम्यया । देवतानां द्विजानां च वर्तितव्यं यथाविधि ॥
data.md: In the first place, O chief of Kuru's race, the king should, for pleasing (his subjects), wait humbly upon the gods and the Brahmanas, always following implicitly the ordinance.

data.v: दैवतान्यर्चयित्वा हि ब्राह्मणांश्च कुरूद्वह । आनृण्यं याति धर्मस्य लोकेन च स मान्यते ॥
data.md: By adoring the celestials and the Brahmanas, O increaser of Kuru's race, the king satisfies his debt to duty and morality, and acquires the respect of his subjects.

data.v: उत्थाने च सदा पुत्र प्रयतेथा युधिष्ठिर । न ह्युत्थानमृते दैवं राज्ञामर्थप्रसिद्धये ॥
data.md: O son, you should always exert promptly, O Yudhishthira, for without exertion and manliness mere destiny never accomplishes the objects the kings wish to achieve.

data.v: साधारणं द्वयं ह्येतद्दैवमुत्थानमेव च । पौरुषं हि परं मन्ये दैवं निश्चित्यमुच्यते ॥
data.md: These two, viz., exertion and destiny, are equal. Of them, I consider exertion to be superior for destiny is determined from the results of exertion.

data.v: विपन्ने च समारम्भे संतापं मा स्म वै कृथाः । घटते विनयस्तात राज्ञामेष नयः परः ॥
data.md: Do not be sorry if what is undertaken ends disastrously, for you should then exert yourself in the same work with redoubled attention. This is the highest of royal duties.

data.v: न हि सत्यादृते किंचिद्राज्ञां वै सिद्धिकारणम् । सत्ये हि राजा निरतः प्रेत्य चेह च नन्दति ॥
data.md: There is nothing which leads so much to the success of kings as Truth. The king who is devoted to Truth enjoys happiness both here and hereafter.

data.v: ऋषीणामपि राजेन्द्र सत्यमेव परं धनम् । तथा राज्ञः परं सत्यान्नान्यद्विश्वासकारणम् ॥
data.md: Even to the Rishis, O king, Truth, is the greatest wealth. Likewise for the kings, there is nothing that so much creates confidence in them as Truth.

data.v: गुणवाञ्शीलवान्दान्तो मृदुर्धर्म्यो जितेन्द्रियः । सुदर्शः स्थूललक्ष्यश्च न भ्रश्येत सदा श्रियः ॥
data.md: The king who is endued with all accomplishments and good conduct, who is self-controlled, Humble, and righteous, who has his passions under control, who is of a beautiful countenance and not too enquiring, never loses prosperity.

data.v: आर्जवं सर्वकार्येषु श्रयेथाः कुरुनन्दन । पुनर्नयविचारेण त्रयीसंवरणेन च ॥
data.md: By administering justice, by following these three expedients, viz., concealment of his own shortcomings, ascertainment of the loop-holes of foes, and keeping is own counsel close, as also by acting straight-forwardly, the king, O delighter of the Kurus, acquires prosperity.

data.v: मृदुर्हि राजा सततं लङ्घ्यो भवति सर्वशः । तीक्ष्णाच्चोद्विजते लोकस्तस्मादुभयमाचर ॥
data.md: If the king becomes mild, everybody disobey him. On the other hand, if he becomes fierce his subjects always fear him. Therefore, do you conduct yourself in both the ways.

data.v: अदण्ड्याश्चैव ते नित्यं विप्राः स्युर्ददतां वर । भूतमेतत्परं लोके ब्राह्मणा नाम भारत ॥
data.md: O foremost of liberal men, the Brahmanas should never be punished by you, for the Brahmana, O son of Pandu, is the foremost of human beings on the Earth.

data.v: मनुना चापि राजेन्द्र गीतौ श्लोकौ महात्मना । धर्मेषु स्वेषु कौरव्य हृदि तौ कर्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: The great Manu, O king of kings, has written two Slokas. As regards your duties, O you of Kuru's race, you should always remember them. Fire has originated from water, the Kshatriya from the Brahmana, and iron from stone. The three, viz., fire, Kshatriya, and iron, can act on every other thing, but coming into contact with their respective origins, their force becomes neutralised.

data.v: अद्भ्योऽग्निर्ब्रह्मतः क्षत्रमश्मनो लोहमुत्थितम् । तेषां सर्वत्रगं तेजः स्वासु योनिषु शाम्यति ॥
data.md: The great Manu, O king of kings, has written two Slokas. As regards your duties, O you of Kuru's race, you should always remember them. Fire has originated from water, the Kshatriya from the Brahmana, and iron from stone. The three, viz., fire, Kshatriya, and iron, can act on every other thing, but coming into contact with their respective origins, their force becomes neutralised.

data.v: अयो हन्ति यदाश्मानमग्निश्चापोऽभिपद्यते । ब्रह्म च क्षत्रियो द्वेष्टि तदा सीदन्ति ते त्रयः ॥
एतज्ज्ञात्वा महाराज नमस्या एव ते द्विजाः । भौमं ब्रह्म द्विजश्रेष्ठा धारयन्ति शमान्विताः ॥
एवं चैव नरव्याघ्र लोकतन्त्रविघातकाः । निग्राह्या एव सततं बाहुभ्यां ये स्युरीदृशाः ॥
data.md: But they, O foremost of kings, who wish to have such honour, though they may be obstacles to the three worlds, should always be repressed by the strength of your arms.

data.v: श्लोकौ चोशनसा गीतौ पुरा तात महर्षिणा । तौ निबोध महाप्राज्ञ त्वमेकाग्रमना नृप ॥
उद्यम्य शस्त्रमायान्तमपि वेदान्तगं रणे । निगृह्णीयात्स्वधर्मेण धर्मापेक्षी नरेश्वरः ॥
data.md: The great Rishi Ushanas, O son, recited two Slokas in days of yore. Listen to them, O king, with rapt attention. The true Kshatriya, ever observant of his duties, should punish a Brahmana, inspite of his being the master of the Vedas if he rushes to battle with an uplifted weapon.

data.v: विनश्यमानं धर्मं हि यो रक्षति स धर्मवित् । न तेन भ्रूणहा स स्यान्मन्युस्तं मनुमृच्छति ॥
एवं चैव नरश्रेष्ठ रक्ष्या एव द्विजातयः । स्वपराद्धानपि हि तान्विषयान्ते समुत्सृजेत् ॥
data.md: The Kshatriya, observant of his duties, who maintains righteousness when it is trespassed against, does not by that act, commit sin, for the anger of the assailant justifies the anger of the punisher. With these restrictions only, O foremost of kings, the Brahmanas should be protected. If they commit any offence they should be banished out of the country.

data.v: अभिशस्तमपि ह्येषां कृपायीत विशां पते । ब्रह्मघ्ने गुरुतल्पे च भ्रूणहत्ये तथैव च ॥
data.md: Even when they deserve punishment you should, O king, show them mercy. If a Brahmana becomes guilty of Brahmanicide, or of violating the bed of his preceptor or other elders, or of causing miscarriage, or of treason against the king, he should be punished with banishment from your territories. No corporal punishment is laid down for them.

data.v: राजद्विष्टे च विप्रस्य विषयान्ते विसर्जनम् । विधीयते न शारीरं भयमेषां कदाचन ॥
data.md: Even when they deserve punishment you should, O king, show them mercy. If a Brahmana becomes guilty of Brahmanicide, or of violating the bed of his preceptor or other elders, or of causing miscarriage, or of treason against the king, he should be punished with banishment from your territories. No corporal punishment is laid down for them.

data.v: दयिताश्च नरास्ते स्युर्नित्यं पुरुषसत्तम । न कोशः परमो ह्यन्यो राज्ञां पुरुषसंचयात् ॥
data.md: Those persons who revere the Brahmanas should be favoured by you. There is no wealth more valuable to kings than the proper selection of servants.

data.v: दुर्गेषु च महाराज षट्सु ये शास्त्रनिश्चिताः । सर्वेषु तेषु मन्यन्ते नरदुर्गं सुदुस्तरम् ॥
data.md: Among the six kinds of forts described in the scriptures, among every kind of other forts the service and the love of the subjects is of the most impregnable.

data.v: तस्मान्नित्यं दया कार्या चातुर्वर्ण्ये विपश्चिता । धर्मात्मा सत्यवाक्चैव राजा रञ्जयति प्रजाः ॥
data.md: Therefore, a wise king should always show mercy towards the four orders of his subjects. The righteous and truthful king succeeds in pleasing his subjects.

data.v: न च क्षान्तेन ते भाव्यं नित्यं पुरुषसत्तम । अधर्म्यो हि मृदू राजा क्षमावानिव कुञ्जरः ॥
data.md: You should not, however, O son, always forgive everybody, for a mild king is regarded as the worst like an elephant shorn of fierceness.

data.v: बार्हस्पत्ये च शास्त्रे वै श्लोका विनियताः पुरा । अस्मिन्नर्थे महाराज तन्मे निगदतः शृणु ॥
data.md: In the Samhita of Brihaspati, a Sloka was recited in days of yore applicable to the present subject. Hear, O king, I shall recite it.

data.v: क्षममाणं नृपं नित्यं नीचः परिभवेज्जनः । हस्तियन्ता गजस्येव शिर एवारुरुक्षति ॥
data.md: If the king becomes always forgiving, the lowest of persons influences him, as the driver who sits on the head of the elephant he guides.

data.v: तस्मान्नैव मृदुर्नित्यं तीक्ष्णो वापि भवेन्नृपः । वसन्तेऽर्क इव श्रीमान्न शीतो न च घर्मदः ॥
data.md: The king, therefore, should not always be mild. Nor should be always be terrific. He should be like the vernal sun, neither too cold nor too hot.

data.v: प्रत्यक्षेणानुमानेन तथौपम्योपदेशतः । परीक्ष्यास्ते महाराज स्वे परे चैव सर्वदा ॥
