data.md: By the direct evidence of the senses, by conjecture, by comparisons, and by the injunctions of the scriptures, O monarch, the king should study friends and enemies.

data.v: व्यसनानि च सर्वाणि त्यजेथा भूरिदक्षिण । न चैव न प्रयुञ्जीत सङ्गं तु परिवर्जयेत् ॥
data.md: O noble king, you should renounce all those evil practices which are called Vyasanas. It is not incumbent that you should never indulge in them. What, however, is necessary is that you should not be attached to them.

data.v: नित्यं हि व्यसनी लोके परिभूतो भवत्युत । उद्वेजयति लोकं चाप्यतिद्वेषी महीपतिः ॥
data.md: He that is attached to those practices is under the influence of every one. The king who does not love his subjects fills the latter with anxiety.

data.v: भवितव्यं सदा राज्ञा गर्भिणीसहधर्मिणा । कारणं च महाराज शृणु येनेदमिष्यते ॥
data.md: The king should always treat his subjects as a mother does the child of her womb. Hear, O king, why this is desirable.

data.v: यथा हि गर्भिणी हित्वा स्वं प्रियं मनसोऽनुगम् । गर्भस्य हितमाधत्ते तथा राज्ञाप्यसंशयम् ॥
data.md: As the mother, even not caring for those objects which she likes best, seeks the wellbeing of her child alone, so, forsooth, should kings treat their subjects.

data.v: वर्तितव्यं कुरुश्रेष्ठ नित्यं धर्मानुवर्तिना । स्वं प्रियं समभित्यज्य यद्यल्लोकहितं भवेत् ॥
data.md: A righteous king, O foremost one of Kuru's race, should always act in such a manner, as to sacrifice what he loves most for the sake of securing the well-being of his people.

data.v: न संत्याज्यं च ते धैर्यं कदाचिदपि पाण्डव । धीरस्य स्पष्टदण्डस्य न ह्याज्ञा प्रतिहन्यते ॥
data.md: You should never, O son of Pandu, abandon fortitude. The king who is crowned with fortitude and who punished wrong-doers, has no cause of fear.

data.v: परिहासश्च भृत्यैस्ते न नित्यं वदतां वर । कर्तव्यो राजशार्दूल दोषमत्र हि मे शृणु ॥
data.md: O foremost of speakers, you should never cut jokes with your servants. O foremost of kings, listen to the short-comings of such an act.

data.v: अवमन्यन्ति भर्तारं संहर्षादुपजीविनः । स्वे स्थाने न च तिष्ठन्ति लङ्घयन्ति हि तद्वचः ॥
data.md: If the master mixes too freely with them, servants begin to disregard him. They forget their own position and do not care their master.

data.v: प्रेष्यमाणा विकल्पन्ते गुह्यं चाप्यनुयुञ्जते । अयाच्यं चैव याचन्तेऽभोज्यान्याहारयन्ति च ॥
data.md: Ordered to do a thing, they hesitate, and give out the master's secrets. They ask for unbecoming things and take the food that is intended for the master.

data.v: क्रुध्यन्ति परिदीप्यन्ति भूमिमध्यासतेऽस्य च । उत्कोचैर्वञ्चनाभिश्च कार्याण्यनुविहन्ति च ॥
data.md: They even display their anger and try to excel their master. They even try to reign supreme over the king, and taking bribes and practising deceit, hinder the business of the state.

data.v: जर्जरं चास्य विषयं कुर्वन्ति प्रतिरूपकैः । स्त्रीरक्षिभिश्च सज्जन्ते तुल्यवेषा भवन्ति च ॥
data.md: They ruin the state with abuses by falsifications and forgeries. They make love with the female warders of the palace and dress in the same way as their master.

data.v: वातं च ष्ठीवनं चैव कुर्वते चास्य संनिधौ । निर्लज्जा नरशार्दूल व्याहरन्ति च तद्वचः ॥
data.md: They become so shameless as to pass wind and spit before the very eyes of their master, O foremost of kings, and they do not fear even to speak of him lightly before others.

data.v: हयं वा दन्तिनं वापि रथं नृपतिसंमतम् । अधिरोहन्त्यनादृत्य हर्षुले पार्थिवे मृदौ ॥
data.md: If the king becomes mild and cuts jokes, his servants, disobeying him, ride on horses and elephants and cars as good as the king's.

data.v: इदं ते दुष्करं राजन्निदं ते दुर्विचेष्टितम् । इत्येवं सुहृदो नाम ब्रुवन्ति परिषद्गताः ॥
data.md: His counsellors, in court, plainly say-This is beyond your power. This is a wicked attempt.

data.v: क्रुद्धे चास्मिन्हसन्त्येव न च हृष्यन्ति पूजिताः । संघर्षशीलाश्च सदा भवन्त्यन्योन्यकारणात् ॥
data.md: If the king becomes angry, they laugh; nor are they pleased if favours be conferred upon them, though they may express joy for other reasons.

data.v: विस्रंसयन्ति मन्त्रं च विवृण्वन्ति च दुष्कृतम् । लीलया चैव कुर्वन्ति सावज्ञास्तस्य शासनम् । अलंकरणभोज्यं च तथा स्नानानुलेपनम् ॥
data.md: They give out the secret counsels of their master and speak of his evil deeds. Without the least anxiety they disregard the king's commands.

data.v: हेलमाना नरव्याघ्र स्वस्थास्तस्योपशृण्वते । निन्दन्ति स्वानधीकारान्संत्यजन्ति च भारत ॥
न वृत्त्या परितुष्यन्ति राजदेयं हरन्ति च । क्रीडितुं तेन चेच्छन्ति ससूत्रेणेव पक्षिणा । अस्मत्प्रणेयो राजेति लोके चैव वदन्त्युत ॥
data.md: They wish to sport with the king as with a bird tied in a rope, and always make the people understand that the king is on very intimate terms with them and loves them dearly.

data.v: एते चैवापरे चैव दोषाः प्रादुर्भवन्त्युत । नृपतौ मार्दवोपेते हर्षुले च युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: If the king is mild and disposed to cut jokes. O Yudhishthira, these and many other evils originate from it.

data.v: नित्योद्युक्तेन वै राज्ञा भवितव्यं युधिष्ठिर । प्रशाम्यते च राजा हि नारीवोद्यमवर्जितः ॥
data.md: 'The king, O Yudhishthira, should always address himself for action. That king does not deserve praise who, like a woman, is destitute of exertion.

data.v: भगवानुशना चाह श्लोकमत्र विशां पते । तमिहैकमना राजन्गदतस्त्वं निबोध मे ॥
data.md: On this subject, the holy Ushanas has recited a Sloka, o king, Listen to it with attention, O king, as I recite it to you.

data.v: द्वावेतौ ग्रसते भूमिः सर्पो बिलशयानिव । राजानं चाविरोद्धारं ब्राह्मणं चाप्रवासिनम् ॥
data.md: Like a snake swallowing up mice, the Earth swallows up those two, viz., the king who does not like to fight and the Brahmana who is exceedingly found of his wives and children.

data.v: तदेतन्नरशार्दूल हृदि त्वं कर्तुमर्हसि । संधेयानपि संधत्स्व विरोध्यांश्च विरोधय ॥
data.md: You should, O foremost of kings, always remember it. Make peace with those enemies with whom peace should be made, and fight with them with whom war should be waged.

data.v: सप्ताङ्गे यश्च ते राज्ये वैपरीत्यं समाचरेत् । गुरुर्वा यदि वा मित्रं प्रतिहन्तव्य एव सः ॥
data.md: He, who acts inimically towards your kingdom consisting of seven limbs, should be killed, may he be your preceptor or friend.

data.v: मरुत्तेन हि राज्ञायं गीतः श्लोकः पुरातनः । राज्याधिकारे राजेन्द्र बृहस्पतिमतः पुरा ॥
data.md: There is an ancient Sloka recited by king Marutta, quite of a piece with Brihaspati's view, O king, about the duty of kings.

data.v: गुरोरप्यवलिप्तस्य कार्याकार्यमजानतः । उत्पथप्रतिपन्नस्य परित्यागो विधीयते ॥
बाहोः पुत्रेण राज्ञा च सगरेणेह धीमता । असमञ्जाः सुतो ज्येष्ठस्त्यक्तः पौरहितैषिणा ॥
data.md: According to the scriptural injunction, there is punishment for even the preceptor if he becomes haughty and disregardful of his duty, and if he transgresses all restrictions. Vahu's son, the highly intelligent king Sagara, from desire of doing good to the citizens, banished his own eldest son Asamanjas.

data.v: असमञ्जाः सरय्वां प्राक्पौराणां बालकान्नृप । न्यमज्जयदतः पित्रा निर्भर्त्स्य स विवासितः ॥
data.md: Asamanjas, O king, used to drown the children of the citizens in the Sarayu. His father, therefore, remonstrated with and exiled him.

data.v: ऋषिणोद्दालकेनापि श्वेतकेतुर्महातपाः । मिथ्या विप्रानुपचरन्संत्यक्तो दयितः सुतः ॥
data.md: The Rishi Uddalaka renounced his favourite son Svetaketu of rigid penances, because the latter used to invite Brahmanas with false promises of entertainment.

data.v: लोकरञ्जनमेवात्र राज्ञां धर्मः सनातनः । सत्यस्य रक्षणं चैव व्यवहारस्य चार्जवम् ॥
data.md: To make their subjects happy, to observe truth and to act sincerely are the eternal duties of kings.

data.v: न हिंस्यात्परवित्तानि देयं काले च दापयेत् । विक्रान्तः सत्यवाक्क्षान्तो नृपो न चलते पथः ॥
data.md: The king should not hanker after the wealth of others. He should in time give what should be given. If the king be comes endued with prowess, truthful in speech, and forgiving in temper, he would never be shorn of prosperity.

data.v: गुप्तमन्त्रो जितक्रोधो शास्त्रार्थगतनिश्चयः । धर्मे चार्थे च कामे च मोक्षे च सततं रतः ॥
data.md: With soul purged off sins the king should be able to govern his anger and all his conclusions should be according to the scriptures. He should also always follow morality, worldly profit, pleasure and emancipation.

data.v: त्रय्या संवृतरन्ध्रश्च राजा भवितुमर्हति । वृजिनस्य नरेन्द्राणां नान्यत्संवरणात्परम् ॥
data.md: The king should always keep his counsels close regarding these three. No greater misfortune can betake the king than the giving out of his counsels.

data.v: चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य धर्माश्च रक्षितव्या महीक्षिता । धर्मसंकररक्षा हि राज्ञां धर्मः सनातनः ॥
data.md: Kings should protect the four castes in the discharge of their duties. it is the eternal duty of kings not to allow the confusion of duties of the different orders.

data.v: न विश्वसेच्च नृपतिर्न चात्यर्थं न विश्वसेत् । षाड्गुण्यगुणदोषांश्च नित्यं बुद्ध्यावलोकयेत् ॥
data.md: The king should not confide (in others than his own servants), nor should he place too much confidence (in even his servants). He should, by own intelligence, find out the merits and short-comings of the six principal works of sovereignty.

data.v: द्विट्छिद्रदर्शी नृपतिर्नित्यमेव प्रशस्यते । त्रिवर्गविदितार्थश्च युक्तचारोपधिश्च यः ॥
data.md: The king who marks the short-comings of his enemies and cleverly follows morality, profit, and pleasure, who engages intelligent spies for determining secrets and tries to win over the officers of his enemies by presents of wealth is indeed praise-worthy.

data.v: कोशस्योपार्जनरतिर्यमवैश्रवणोपमः । वेत्ता च दशवर्गस्य स्थानवृद्धिक्षयात्मनः ॥
data.md: The king should administer justice like the Regent of Death and amass riches like the god of wealth. He should also mark the merits and short-comings of his on acquisitions and losses and of his own territories.

data.v: अभृतानां भवेद्भर्ता भृतानां चान्ववेक्षकः । नृपतिः सुमुखश्च स्यात्स्मितपूर्वाभिभाषिता ॥
data.md: He should feed those who have not been fed, and enquire of those who have been fed. Always sweet-speeched he should spcak with a smiling face.

data.v: उपासिता च वृद्धानां जिततन्द्रीरलोलुपः । सतां वृत्ते स्थितमतिः सन्तो ह्याचारदर्शिनः ॥
data.md: He should always wait upon his elders and put down procrastination. He should never covet others' properties.

data.v: न चाददीत वित्तानि सतां हस्तात्कदाचन । असद्भ्यस्तु समादद्यात्सद्भ्यः संप्रतिपादयेत् ॥
data.md: He should strictly follow the conduct of the righteous. He should never take money from the righteous. Taking the wealth of those who are not righteous he should give it to them who are righteous.

data.v: स्वयं प्रहर्तादाता च वश्यात्मा वश्यसाधनः । काले दाता च भोक्ता च शुद्धाचारस्तथैव च ॥
data.md: The king should himself be clever in smitting. He should be liberal. He should have his mind under control. He should dress himself gorgeously. He should make presents in proper time and be regular in his meals. He should also be of good conduct.

data.v: शूरान्भक्तानसंहार्यान्कुले जातानरोगिणः । शिष्टाञ्शिष्टाभिसंबन्धान्मानिनो नावमानिनः ॥
विद्याविदो लोकविदः परलोकान्ववेक्षकान् । धर्मेषु निरतान्साधूनचलानचलानिव ॥
सहायान्सततं कुर्याद्राजा भूतिपुरस्कृतः । तैस्तुल्यश्च भवेद्भोगैश्छत्रमात्राज्ञयाधिकः ॥
प्रत्यक्षा च परोक्षा च वृत्तिश्चास्य भवेत्सदा । एवं कृत्वा नरेन्द्रो हि न खेदमिह विन्दति ॥
data.md: He should always treat them equally before or behind. The king, who behaves in this way, is never overtaken by calamity.

data.v: सर्वातिशङ्की नृपतिर्यश्च सर्वहरो भवेत् । स क्षिप्रमनृजुर्लुब्धः स्वजनेनैव बाध्यते ॥
data.md: That crooked and covetous king, who suspect ever body and who imposes heavy taxes on his subjects, is soon killed by his own servants and relatives.

data.v: शुचिस्तु पृथिवीपालो लोकचित्तग्रहे रतः । न पतत्यरिभिर्ग्रस्तः पतितश्चावतिष्ठते ॥
data.md: That king, however, who is righteous and who is ever engaged in attracting the hearts of his people, is never ruined when attacked by foes. If defeated, he soon regains his position.

data.v: अक्रोधनोऽथाव्यसनी मृदुदण्डो जितेन्द्रियः । राजा भवति भूतानां विश्वास्यो हिमवानिव ॥
data.md: If the king is not angry by nature, if he is not addicted to evil habits and not severe in his punishment, if he succeeds in keeping his passions under restraint he becomes an object of confidence to all like the Himavat mountains.

data.v: प्राज्ञो न्यायगुणोपेतः पररन्ध्रेषु तत्परः । सुदर्शः सर्ववर्णानां नयापनयवित्तथा ॥
क्षिप्रकारी जितक्रोधः सुप्रसादो महामनाः । अरोगप्रकृतिर्युक्तः क्रियावानविकत्थनः ॥
आरब्धान्येव कार्याणि न पर्यवसितानि च । यस्य राज्ञः प्रदृश्यन्ते स राजा राजसत्तमः ॥
पुत्रा इव पितुर्गेहे विषये यस्य मानवाः । निर्भया विचरिष्यन्ति स राजा राजसत्तमः ॥
data.md: He is best of kings in whose kingdom men live fearlessly like sons in the house of their father.

data.v: अगूढविभवा यस्य पौरा राष्ट्रनिवासिनः । नयापनयवेत्तारः स राजा राजसत्तमः ॥
data.md: He is the best of kings whose subjects have not to hide their wealth and know what is good and what is bad for them.

data.v: स्वकर्मनिरता यस्य जना विषयवासिनः । असंघातरता दान्ताः पाल्यमाना यथाविधि ॥
वश्या नेया विनीताश्च न च संघर्षशीलिनः । विषये दानरुचयो नरा यस्य स पार्थिवः ॥
न यस्य कूटकपटं न माया न च मत्सरः । विषये भूमिपालस्य तस्य धर्मः सनातनः ॥
यः सत्करोति ज्ञानानि नेयः पौरहिते रतः । सतां धर्मानुगस्त्यागी स राजा राज्यमर्हति ॥
data.md: That king truly deserves to govern who honours knowledge, who is devoted to the no scriptures and the good of his people, who wends the path of the righteous, and who is liberal.

data.v: यस्य चारश्च मन्त्रश्च नित्यं चैव कृताकृते । न ज्ञायते हि रिपुभिः स राजा राज्यमर्हति ॥
data.md: That king deserves to rule whose counsels and acts done and undone remain close to his enemies.

data.v: श्लोकश्चायं पुरा गीतो भार्गवेण महात्मना । आख्याते रामचरिते नृपतिं प्रति भारत ॥
data.md: The following verse was recited in days of yore by Ushanas of Bhrigu's race, in the narrative called Ramacharita, on the subject, O Bharata, of royal duties.

data.v: राजानं प्रथमं विन्देत्ततो भार्यां ततो धनम् । राजन्यसति लोकस्य कुतो भार्या कुतो धनम् ॥
data.md: One should first select a king. Then should he select a wife, and then acquire wealth. If there be no king, what would become of his wife and properties?

data.v: तद्राजन्राजसिंहानां नान्यो धर्मः सनातनः । ऋते रक्षां सुविस्पष्टां रक्षा लोकस्य धारणम् ॥
data.md: About those who seek kingdom, there is no other eternal duty than the protection of subjects). The protection the king grants of his subjects maintains the world.

data.v: प्राचेतसेन मनुना श्लोकौ चेमावुदाहृतौ । राजधर्मेषु राजेन्द्र ताविहैकमनाः शृणु ॥
data.md: Manu, the son of Prachetas, recited these two verses regarding the duties of kings. Listen to them with attention.

data.v: षडेतान्पुरुषो जह्याद्भिन्नां नावमिवार्णवे । अप्रवक्तारमाचार्यमनधीयानमृत्विजम् ॥
data.md: These six persons should be shunned like a leaky boat on the sea, viz., a preceptor who does not speak, a priest who has not studied the scriptures, a king who does not give protection, herd who likes to rove within the village and a barber who wishes to go to the forest.

data.v: अरक्षितारं राजानं भार्यां चाप्रियवादिनीम् । ग्रामकामं च गोपालं वनकामं च नापितम् ॥
data.md: These six persons should be shunned like a leaky boat on the sea, viz., a preceptor who does not speak, a priest who has not studied the scriptures, a king who does not give protection, herd who likes to rove within the village and a barber who wishes to go to the forest.

data.v: एतत्ते राजधर्माणां नवनीतं युधिष्ठिर । बृहस्पतिर्हि भगवान्नान्यं धर्मं प्रशंसति ॥
data.md: 'Protection of the subjects, O Yudhishthira, is the quintessence of duties. the divine Brihaspati does not speak so highly of any other duty.

data.v: विशालाक्षश्च भगवान्काव्यश्चैव महातपाः । सहस्राक्षो महेन्द्रश्च तथा प्राचेतसो मनुः ॥
data.md: The divine Kavi (Ushanas) of large eyes and austere penances, the thousand-eyed Indra, and Manu, the son of Prachetas, the divine Bharadwaja, and the sage Gaurasiras all devoted to Brahma and utterers of Brahma, have composed works on the duties of kings.

data.v: भरद्वाजश्च भगवांस्तथा गौरशिरा मुनिः । राजशास्त्रप्रणेतारो ब्रह्मण्या ब्रह्मवादिनः ॥
data.md: The divine Kavi (Ushanas) of large eyes and austere penances, the thousand-eyed Indra, and Manu, the son of Prachetas, the divine Bharadwaja, and the sage Gaurasiras all devoted to Brahma and utterers of Brahma, have composed works on the duties of kings.

data.v: रक्षामेव प्रशंसन्ति धर्मं धर्मभृतां वर । राज्ञां राजीवताम्राक्ष साधनं चात्र वै शृणु ॥
data.md: All of them speak highly of the duty of protection, O foremost of virtuous persons regarding the kings. O you having eyes like lotus petals and copper-coloured, listen to the means by which protection may be obtained.

data.v: चारश्च प्रणिधिश्चैव काले दानममत्सरः । युक्त्यादानं न चादानमयोगेन युधिष्ठिर ॥
सतां संग्रहणं शौर्यं दाक्ष्यं सत्यं प्रजाहितम् । अनार्जवैरार्जवैश्च शत्रुपक्षस्य भेदनम् ॥
साधूनामपरित्यागः कुलीनानां च धारणम् । निचयश्च निचेयानां सेवा बुद्धिमतामपि ॥
बलानां हर्षणं नित्यं प्रजानामन्ववेक्षणम् । कार्येष्वखेदः कोशस्य तथैव च विवर्धनम् ॥
पुरगुप्तिरविश्वासः पौरसंघातभेदनम् । केतनानां च जीर्णानामवेक्षा चैव सीदताम् ॥
द्विविधस्य च दण्डस्य प्रयोगः कालचोदितः । अरिमध्यस्थमित्राणां यथावच्चान्ववेक्षणम् ॥
उपजापश्च भृत्यानामात्मनः परदर्शनात् । अविश्वासः स्वयं चैव परस्याश्वासनं तथा ॥
नीतिधर्मानुसरणं नित्यमुत्थानमेव च । रिपूणामनवज्ञानं नित्यं चानार्यवर्जनम् ॥
उत्थानं हि नरेन्द्राणां बृहस्पतिरभाषत । राजधर्मस्य यन्मूलं श्लोकांश्चात्र निबोध मे ॥
data.md: Readiness for action in kings is the root of royal duties. This has been said by Brihaspati. Listen to the verses recited by him.

data.v: उत्थानेनामृतं लब्धमुत्थानेनासुरा हताः । उत्थानेन महेन्द्रेण श्रैष्ठ्यं प्राप्तं दिवीह च ॥
data.md: By exertion the ambrosia was obtained; by exertion the Asuras were killed; by exertion Indra himself acquired sovereignty in heaven and on earth.

data.v: उत्थानधीरः पुरुषो वाग्धीरानधितिष्ठति । उत्थानधीरं वाग्धीरा रमयन्त उपासते ॥
data.md: The hero who works is superior to one who speaks. The heroes who speak, gratify and worship the heroes who work.

data.v: उत्थानहीनो राजा हि बुद्धिमानपि नित्यशः । धर्षणीयो रिपूणां स्याद्भुजंग इव निर्विषः ॥
data.md: The king, who is shorn of exertion, even if endued with intelligence, is always defeated by foes like a snake that is shorn of poison.

data.v: न च शत्रुरवज्ञेयो दुर्बलोऽपि बलीयसा । अल्पोऽपि हि दहत्यग्निर्विषमल्पं हिनस्ति च ॥
data.md: The king, even if very powerful, should not neglect a foe however weak. A scintillation of fire can produce a conflagration and a particle of Poison can kill.

data.v: एकाश्वेनापि संभूतः शत्रुर्दुर्गसमाश्रितः । तं तं तापयते देशमपि राज्ञः समृद्धिनः ॥
data.md: With only one kind of force, an enemy, from within a fort, can assail the whole country of even a powerful and prosperous king.

data.v: राज्ञो रहस्यं यद्वाक्यं जयार्थं लोकसंग्रहः । हृदि यच्चास्य जिह्मं स्यात्कारणार्थं च यद्भवेत् ॥
data.md: The secret speeches of a king, the collecting of troops for the purposes of victory, the wily purposes in his heart, desires for accomplishing particular objects, and the wrong acts he does or intends to do, should be concealed by assuming a bold appearance. He should act righteously for keeping his people under control.

data.v: यच्चास्य कार्यं वृजिनमार्जवेनैव धार्यते । दम्भनार्थाय लोकस्य धर्मिष्ठामाचरेत्क्रियाम् ॥
राज्यं हि सुमहत्तन्त्रं दुर्धार्यमकृतात्मभिः । न शक्यं मृदुना वोढुमाघातस्थानमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Wily persons can not govern an extensive empire, A king who is mild cannot acquire superior rank the acquisition of which depends upon exertion.

data.v: राज्यं सर्वामिषं नित्यमार्जवेनेह धार्यते । तस्मान्मिश्रेण सततं वर्तितव्यं युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: A kingdom, which is sought for by all like meat can never be protected by candour and simplicity. A king, O Yudhishthira, should, therefore, always resort to both candour and wiliness.

data.v: यद्यप्यस्य विपत्तिः स्याद्रक्षमाणस्य वै प्रजाः । सोऽप्यस्य विपुलो धर्म एवंवृत्ता हि भूमिपाः ॥
data.md: Even while protecting his subjects a king is beset with danger, he earns great merit. Such should be the conduct of kings.

data.v: एष ते राजधर्माणां लेशः समनुवर्णितः । भूयस्ते यत्र संदेहस्तद्ब्रूहि वदतां वर ॥
data.md: I have now told you a part only of the duties of kings. Tell me, O best of Kurus, what more you wish to know.

data.v: ततो व्यासश्च भगवान्देवस्थानोऽश्मना सह । वासुदेवः कृपश्चैव सात्यकिः संजयस्तथा ॥
साधु साध्विति संहृष्टाः पुष्यमाणैरिवाननैः । अस्तुवंस्ते नरव्याघ्रं भीष्मं धर्मभृतां वरम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said The illustrious Vyasa, Devasthana, Ashva, Vasudeva, Kripa, Satyaki and Sanjaya, filled with joy, and with faces resembling full-blown flowers, said,-Excellent! Excellent!' and sang the praises of that best of men, viz., Bhishma, that foremost of virtuous persons.

data.v: ततो दीनमना भीष्ममुवाच कुरुसत्तमः । नेत्राभ्यामश्रुपूर्णाभ्यां पादौ तस्य शनैः स्पृशन् ॥
data.md: Then Yudhishthira, that chief of Kuru's race, with a depressed heart and eyes bathed in tears, gently touched Bhishma's feet and said,—'O grandsire, I shall tomorrow enquire after those points about which I have my doubts, for today the sun, having sucked the moisture of the earth, is about to set.

data.v: श्व इदानीं स्वसंदेहं प्रक्ष्यामि त्वा पितामह । उपैति सविताप्यस्तं रसमापीय पार्थिवम् ॥
data.md: Then Yudhishthira, that chief of Kuru's race, with a depressed heart and eyes bathed in tears, gently touched Bhishma's feet and said,—'O grandsire, I shall tomorrow enquire after those points about which I have my doubts, for today the sun, having sucked the moisture of the earth, is about to set.

data.v: ततो द्विजातीनभिवाद्य केशवः; कृपश्च ते चैव युधिष्ठिरादयः । प्रदक्षिणीकृत्य महानदीसुतं; ततो रथानारुरुहुर्मुदा युताः ॥
data.md: Then Keshava, Kripa, Yudhishthira and others, saluting the Brahmanas and circumambulating Bhishma, gladly got on their cars.

data.v: दृषद्वतीं चाप्यवगाह्य सुव्रताः; कृतोदकार्याः कृतजप्यमङ्गलाः । उपास्य संध्यां विधिवत्परंतपा;स्ततः पुरं ते विविशुर्गजाह्वयम् ॥
data.md: All of them, observant of excellent vows, then bathed in the river Drishadvati-Having offered oblations of water to their departed manes and silently recited the sacred mantras and performed other auspicious rites, and having adored the evening twilight with due rites, those scorchers of enemies entered the city of Hastinapur.

data.v: ततः काल्यं समुत्थाय कृतपौर्वाह्णिकक्रियाः । ययुस्ते नगराकारै रथैः पाण्डवयादवाः ॥
data.md: Rising from their beds the next day and performing morning rites laid down in the scriptures, the Pandavas and the Yadavas started on their cars resembling fortified towns.

data.v: प्रपद्य च कुरुक्षेत्रं भीष्ममासाद्य चानघम् । सुखां च रजनीं पृष्ट्वा गाङ्गेयं रथिनां वरम् ॥
data.md: Proceeding to the field of Kuru and approaching the sinless Bhishma, they enquired of that best of car-warriors if he had spent the night happily.

data.v: व्यासादीनभिवाद्यर्षीन्सर्वैस्तैश्चाभिनन्दिताः । निषेदुरभितो भीष्मं परिवार्य समन्ततः ॥
data.md: Saluting all the Rishis, and having been blessed by them in return, the princes sat around Bhishma.

data.v: ततो राजा महातेजा धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः । अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्भीष्मं प्रतिपूज्याभिवाद्य च ॥
data.md: Then having adored Bhishma, king Yudhishthira, said these words with joined hands.

data.v: य एष राजा-राजेति शब्दश्चरति भारत । कथमेष समुत्पन्नस्तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Whence came the word Rajan, O king, that is used, O Bharata, on Earth? Tell me this, O scorcher of foes.

data.v: तुल्यपाणिशिरोग्रीवस्तुल्यबुद्धीन्द्रियात्मकः । तुल्यदुःखसुखात्मा च तुल्यपृष्ठभुजोदरः ॥
तुल्यशुक्रास्थिमज्जश्च तुल्यमांसासृगेव च । निःश्वासोच्छ्वासतुल्यश्च तुल्यप्राणशरीरवान् ॥
समानजन्ममरणः समः सर्वगुणैर्नृणाम् । विशिष्टबुद्धीञ्शूरांश्च कथमेकोऽधितिष्ठति ॥
कथमेको महीं कृत्स्नां वीरशूरार्यसंकुलाम् । रक्षत्यपि च लोकोऽस्य प्रसादमभिवाञ्छति ॥
data.md: Whence is it that one man governs the vast universe consisting of brave, energetic, wellborn and well-behaved men? Why do all men try to get his favour?

data.v: एकस्य च प्रसादेन कृत्स्नो लोकः प्रसीदति । व्याकुलेनाकुलः सर्वो भवतीति विनिश्चयः ॥
data.md: Why is it that one man becomes cheerful, the whole world is cheerful and if that one man is sorry the whole world is sorry?

data.v: एतदिच्छाम्यहं सर्वं तत्त्वेन भरतर्षभ । श्रोतुं तन्मे यथातत्त्वं प्रब्रूहि वदतां वर ॥
data.md: I wish to hear this in detail, O foremost of Bharata's race. O foremost of speakers, describe to me this fully.

data.v: नैतत्कारणमल्पं हि भविष्यति विशां पते । यदेकस्मिञ्जगत्सर्वं देववद्याति संनतिम् ॥
data.md: O king, there must be some mighty reason for all this because it is seen that the whole world bows down to one man as to a god.'

data.v: नियतस्त्वं नरश्रेष्ठ शृणु सर्वमशेषतः । यथा राज्यं समुत्पन्नमादौ कृतयुगेऽभवत् ॥
data.md: 'With rapt attentical, O foremost of kings, listen to it fully as to how in the golden cycle sovereignty was first instituted.

data.v: नैव राज्यं न राजासीन्न दण्डो न च दाण्डिकः । धर्मेणैव प्रजाः सर्वा रक्षन्ति च परस्परम् ॥
data.md: At first there was no sovereignty, no king, no punishment, and no punisher. All men used to protect one another piously.

data.v: पालयानास्तथान्योन्यं नरा धर्मेण भारत । खेदं परममाजग्मुस्ततस्तान्मोह आविशत् ॥
data.md: As they thus lived, O Bharata, righteously protecting one another, they found the task (in time), to be painful. Error then possessed their hearts.

data.v: ते मोहवशमापन्ना मानवा मनुजर्षभ । प्रतिपत्तिविमोहाच्च धर्मस्तेषामनीनशत् ॥
data.md: Having become subject to error, the perceptions of men, O prince, became clouded, and thence their virtue began to wane.

data.v: नष्टायां प्रतिपत्तौ तु मोहवश्या नरास्तदा । लोभस्य वशमापन्नाः सर्वे भारतसत्तम ॥
data.md: When their perceptions were clouded and when men became subject to error all of them became covetous, O chief of the Bharatas.

data.v: अप्राप्तस्याभिमर्शं तु कुर्वन्तो मनुजास्ततः । कामो नामापरस्तत्र समपद्यत वै प्रभो ॥
data.md: And because men tried to secure objects which were not their own, another passion called lust seized them.

data.v: तांस्तु कामवशं प्राप्तान्रागो नाम समस्पृशत् । रक्ताश्च नाभ्यजानन्त कार्याकार्यं युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: When they became subject to lust, another passion, named anger, soon attacked them. Once subject to anger, they lost all considerations of what should be done and what should not be.

data.v: अगम्यागमनं चैव वाच्यावाच्यं तथैव च । भक्ष्याभक्ष्यं च राजेन्द्र दोषादोषं च नात्यजन् ॥
data.md: Unrestrained sexual indulgence began. Men began to say what they liked. All distinctions between clean and unclean food and between virtue and vice disappeared.

data.v: विप्लुते नरलोकेऽस्मिंस्ततो ब्रह्म ननाश ह । नाशाच्च ब्रह्मणो राजन्धर्मो नाशमथागमत् ॥
data.md: When this confusion set in amongst men, the Vedas disappeared. Upon the disappearance of the Vedas, the righteousness also was gone.

data.v: नष्टे ब्रह्मणि धर्मे च देवास्त्रासमथागमन् । ते त्रस्ता नरशार्दूल ब्रह्माणं शरणं ययुः ॥
data.md: When both the Vedas and righteousness were lost, the gods, were overcome by fear. Overcome with fear. O foremost of men, they sought the help of Brahman.

data.v: प्रपद्य भगवन्तं ते देवा लोकपितामहम् । ऊचुः प्राञ्जलयः सर्वे दुःखशोकभयार्दिताः ॥
भगवन्नरलोकस्थं नष्टं ब्रह्म सनातनम् । लोभमोहादिभिर्भावैस्ततो नो भयमाविशत् ॥
ब्रह्मणश्च प्रणाशेन धर्मोऽप्यनशदीश्वर । ततः स्म समतां याता मर्त्यैस्त्रिभुवनेश्वर ॥
data.md: With the loss of the Vedas, o Supreme Lord, righteousness also has been lost. For this, O Supreme Lord of the three worlds, we are about to be reduced to the status of human beings.

data.v: अधो हि वर्षमस्माकं मर्त्यास्तूर्ध्वप्रवर्षिणः । क्रियाव्युपरमात्तेषां ततोऽगच्छाम संशयम् ॥
data.md: Men used to pour upwards while we used to pour downwards. For the stoppage of all religious rites among men we will suffer great distress.

data.v: अत्र निःश्रेयसं यन्नस्तद्ध्यायस्व पितामह । त्वत्प्रभावसमुत्थोऽसौ प्रभावो नो विनश्यति ॥
तानुवाच सुरान्सर्वान्स्वयंभूर्भगवांस्ततः । श्रेयोऽहं चिन्तयिष्यामि व्येतु वो भीः सुरर्षभाः ॥
ततोऽध्यायसहस्राणां शतं चक्रे स्वबुद्धिजम् । यत्र धर्मस्तथैवार्थः कामश्चैवानुवर्णितः ॥
त्रिवर्ग इति विख्यातो गण एष स्वयंभुवा । चतुर्थो मोक्ष इत्येव पृथगर्थः पृथग्गणः ॥
data.md: The self-create named the book as one of three subjects. He treated of a fourth subject called liberation whose meaning and attributes are different.

data.v: मोक्षस्यापि त्रिवर्गोऽन्यः प्रोक्तः सत्त्वं रजस्तमः । स्थानं वृद्धिः क्षयश्चैव त्रिवर्गश्चैव दण्डजः ॥
data.md: The three-fold characteristics of liberation according to the attributes of Goodness, Darkness and Ignorance and another namely the performance of duty without the desire for fruits were also described in it. Another threefold characteristics of Punishment viz., Conservation, Growth, and Destruction, were treated in it.

data.v: आत्मा देशश्च कालश्चाप्युपायाः कृत्यमेव च । सहायाः कारणं चैव षड्वर्गो नीतिजः स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Another six consisting of the hearts of men, place, time, means, tacts, and alliances, and causes, were described in it.

data.v: त्रयी चान्वीक्षिकी चैव वार्ता च भरतर्षभ । दण्डनीतिश्च विपुला विद्यास्तत्र निदर्शिताः ॥
data.md: The religious rites laid down in the three Vedas, knowledge, and the acts necessary for the support of life, (viz., agriculture, trade, etc.), O foremost of Bharata's race, and the very extensive branch of learning called legislation, were described in it.

data.v: अमात्यरक्षाप्रणिधी राजपुत्रस्य रक्षणम् । चारश्च विविधोपायः प्रणिधिश्च पृथग्विधः ॥
data.md: The subjects also of behaviour towards ministers, of spies, the indications of princes, of secret agents, of envoys and agents of other kinds, conciliation, sowing seeds of discord, gifts, and punishment, O king, with toleration as the fifth, were fully described there.

data.v: साम चोपप्रदानं च भेदो दण्डश्च पाण्डव । उपेक्षा पञ्चमी चात्र कार्त्स्न्येन समुदाहृता ॥
मन्त्रश्च वर्णितः कृत्स्नस्तथा भेदार्थ एव च । विभ्रंशश्चैव मन्त्रस्य सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योश्च यत्फलम् ॥
data.md: Deliberation of all sorts, counsels for creating disunion, the mistakes of deliberation, the results of the success or failure of counsels of three kinds viz., bad, middling, and good, made through fear, good conduct and gifts of wealth, were described there.

data.v: संधिश्च विविधाभिख्यो हीनो मध्यस्तथोत्तमः । भयसत्कारवित्ताख्यः कार्त्स्न्येन परिवर्णितः ॥
यात्राकालाश्च चत्वारस्त्रिवर्गस्य च विस्तरः । विजयो धर्मयुक्तश्च तथार्थविजयश्च ह ॥
data.md: The four sorts of time for making journeys, the details of the aggregate of three, the three sorts of victory, viz, that secured piously, that acquired by riches and that obtained by deceit were described, fully. The three kinds of attributes, viz., bad, middling and good, of the five expedients (viz., counsellors, kingdom, fort, army, and treasury) were also described in it.

data.v: आसुरश्चैव विजयस्तथा कार्त्स्न्येन वर्णितः । लक्षणं पञ्चवर्गस्य त्रिविधं चात्र वर्णितम् ॥
data.md: The four sorts of time for making journeys, the details of the aggregate of three, the three sorts of victory, viz, that secured piously, that acquired by riches and that obtained by deceit were described, fully. The three kinds of attributes, viz., bad, middling and good, of the five expedients (viz., counsellors, kingdom, fort, army, and treasury) were also described in it.

data.v: प्रकाशश्चाप्रकाशश्च दण्डोऽथ परिशब्दितः । प्रकाशोऽष्टविधस्तत्र गुह्यस्तु बहुविस्तरः ॥
data.md: Punishments of two kinds, viz, open and secret, were also described. The eight kinds of open punishments as also the eight kinds of secret punishment were described fully.

data.v: रथा नागा हयाश्चैव पादाताश्चैव पाण्डव । विष्टिर्नावश्चराश्चैव देशिकाः पथि चाष्टकम् ॥
अङ्गान्येतानि कौरव्य प्रकाशानि बलस्य तु । जङ्गमाजङ्गमाश्चोक्ताश्चूर्णयोगा विषादयः ॥
स्पर्शे चाभ्यवहार्ये चाप्युपांशुर्विविधः स्मृतः । अरिर्मित्रमुदासीन इत्येतेऽप्यनुवर्णिताः ॥
कृत्स्ना मार्गगुणाश्चैव तथा भूमिगुणाश्च ह । आत्मरक्षणमाश्वासः स्पशानां चान्ववेक्षणम् ॥
कल्पना विविधाश्चापि नृनागरथवाजिनाम् । व्यूहाश्च विविधाभिख्या विचित्रं युद्धकौशलम् ॥
उत्पाताश्च निपाताश्च सुयुद्धं सुपलायनम् । शस्त्राणां पायनज्ञानं तथैव भरतर्षभ ॥
बलव्यसनमुक्तं च तथैव बलहर्षणम् । पीडनास्कन्दकालश्च भयकालश्च पाण्डव ॥
तथा खातविधानं च योगसंचार एव च । चौराटव्यबलैश्चोग्रैः परराष्ट्रस्य पीडनम् ॥
अग्निदैर्गरदैश्चैव प्रतिरूपकचारकैः । श्रेणिमुख्योपजापेन वीरुधश्छेदनेन च ॥
दूषणेन च नागानामाशङ्काजननेन च । आरोधनेन भक्तस्य पथश्चोपार्जनेन च ॥
सप्ताङ्गस्य च राज्यस्य ह्रासवृद्धिसमञ्जसम् । दूतसामर्थ्ययोगश्च राष्ट्रस्य च विवर्धनम् ॥
अरिमध्यस्थमित्राणां सम्यक्चोक्तं प्रपञ्चनम् । अवमर्दः प्रतीघातस्तथैव च बलीयसाम् ॥
व्यवहारः सुसूक्ष्मश्च तथा कण्टकशोधनम् । शमो व्यायामयोगश्च योगो द्रव्यस्य संचयः ॥
अभृतानां च भरणं भृतानां चान्ववेक्षणम् । अर्थकाले प्रदानं च व्यसनेष्वप्रसङ्गिता ॥
तथा राजगुणाश्चैव सेनापतिगुणाश्च ये । कारणस्य च कर्तुश्च गुणदोषास्तथैव च ॥
दुष्टेङ्गितं च विविधं वृत्तिश्चैवानुजीविनाम् । शङ्कितत्वं च सर्वस्य प्रमादस्य च वर्जनम् ॥
अलब्धलिप्सा लब्धस्य तथैव च विवर्धनम् । प्रदानं च विवृद्धस्य पात्रेभ्यो विधिवत्तथा ॥
विसर्गोऽर्थस्य धर्मार्थमर्थार्थं कामहेतुना । चतुर्थो व्यसनाघाते तथैवात्रानुवर्णितः ॥
क्रोधजानि तथोग्राणि कामजानि तथैव च । दशोक्तानि कुरुश्रेष्ठ व्यसनान्यत्र चैव ह ॥
data.md: The ten dreadful vices, O chief of the Kurus, begotten by anger and lust, were described in that work.

data.v: मृगयाक्षास्तथा पानं स्त्रियश्च भरतर्षभ । कामजान्याहुराचार्याः प्रोक्तानीह स्वयंभुवा ॥
data.md: The four kinds of vices begotten of lust, viz., hunting, gambling, drinking and sexual intercourse were described by the Self-sprung in that work.

data.v: वाक्पारुष्यं तथोग्रत्वं दण्डपारुष्यमेव च । आत्मनो निग्रहस्त्यागोऽथार्थदूषणमेव च ॥
data.md: Roughness of speech, fierceness, severity of chastisement, infliction of pain on the body, suicide, and frustrating one's own objects, these six kinds of faults begotten of anger have also been described.

data.v: यन्त्राणि विविधान्येव क्रियास्तेषां च वर्णिताः । अवमर्दः प्रतीघातः केतनानां च भञ्जनम् ॥
data.md: Various kinds of machines and their actions have been described there. Devastation of the enemy's territories, attacks upon enemies, the destruction and removal of boundary lines and other indications, the cutting down of large trees, siege of forts, supervision of agriculture and other useful operations, and the hoarding of necessaries, dresses and the best means of manufacturing them, were all described.

data.v: चैत्यद्रुमाणामामर्दो रोधःकर्मान्तनाशनम् । अपस्करोऽथ गमनं तथोपास्या च वर्णिता ॥
पणवानकशङ्खानां भेरीणां च युधां वर । उपार्जनं च द्रव्याणां परमर्म च तानि षट् ॥
लब्धस्य च प्रशमनं सतां चैव हि पूजनम् । विद्वद्भिरेकीभावश्च प्रातर्होमविधिज्ञता ॥
मङ्गलालम्भनं चैव शरीरस्य प्रतिक्रिया । आहारयोजनं चैव नित्यमास्तिक्यमेव च ॥
एकेन च यथोत्थेयं सत्यत्वं मधुरा गिरः । उत्सवानां समाजानां क्रियाः केतनजास्तथा ॥
प्रत्यक्षा च परोक्षा च सर्वाधिकरणेषु च । वृत्तिर्भरतशार्दूल नित्यं चैवान्ववेक्षणम् ॥
अदण्ड्यत्वं च विप्राणां युक्त्या दण्डनिपातनम् । अनुजीविस्वजातिभ्यो गुणेषु परिरक्षणम् ॥
रक्षणं चैव पौराणां स्वराष्ट्रस्य विवर्धनम् । मण्डलस्था च या चिन्ता राजन्द्वादशराजिका ॥
द्वासप्ततिमतिश्चैव प्रोक्ता या च स्वयंभुवा । देशजातिकुलानां च धर्माः समनुवर्णिताः ॥
धर्मश्चार्थश्च कामश्च मोक्षश्चात्रानुवर्णितः । उपायश्चार्थलिप्सा च विविधा भूरिदक्षिणाः ॥
data.md: Religion, Profit, Pleasure, and liberation were also treated in it. The various means of acquisition, the desire for various sorts of wealth, O giver of profuse presents, the methods of agriculture and other works constituting the chief source of the revenue, and the various means for producing and applying illusions, the methods by which stagnant water is rendered foul, were described in it.

data.v: मूलकर्मक्रिया चात्र माया योगश्च वर्णितः । दूषणं स्रोतसामत्र वर्णितं च स्थिराम्भसाम् ॥
यैर्यैरुपायैर्लोकश्च न चलेदार्यवर्त्मनः । तत्सर्वं राजशार्दूल नीतिशास्त्रेऽनुवर्णितम् ॥
data.md: All those means, O foremost of kings, by which men might be prevented from falling off from the path of righteousness and honesty were all treated in it.

data.v: एतत्कृत्वा शुभं शास्त्रं ततः स भगवान्प्रभुः । देवानुवाच संहृष्टः सर्वाञ्शक्रपुरोगमान् ॥
data.md: Having composed that highly beneficial work, the divine Lord cheerfully said to the deities led by Indra, these words.

data.v: उपकाराय लोकस्य त्रिवर्गस्थापनाय च । नवनीतं सरस्वत्या बुद्धिरेषा प्रभाविता ॥
data.md: For the behoof of the world and for establishing the three-fold objects (viz., Religion, Profit, and Pleasure), I have composed this science representing the very essence of speech.

data.v: दण्डेन सहिता ह्येषा लोकरक्षणकारिका । निग्रहानुग्रहरता लोकाननु चरिष्यति ॥
data.md: Helped by punishment this science will protect the world. Meting out rewards and punishments, this science will work among men.

data.v: दण्डेन नीयते चेयं दण्डं नयति चाप्युत । दण्डनीतिरिति प्रोक्ता त्रीँल्लोकाननुवर्तते ॥
data.md: And because men will be governed by punishment, therefore will this science be known in the three worlds as Dandaniti (science of punishment).

data.v: षाड्गुण्यगुणसारैषा स्थास्यत्यग्रे महात्मसु । महत्त्वात्तस्य दण्डस्य नीतिर्विस्पष्टलक्षणा ॥
नयचारश्च विपुलो येन सर्वमिदं ततम् । आगमश्च पुराणानां महर्षीणां च संभवः ॥
तीर्थवंशश्च वंशश्च नक्षत्राणां युधिष्ठिर । सकलं चातुराश्रम्यं चातुर्होत्रं तथैव च ॥
data.md: Thus, O Yudhishthira, the histories of the past, the origin of the great Rishis, the holy rivers, the planets and stars and asterisms, the duties of the four modes of life, the four kinds of Homa, the characteristics of the four castes and the four branches of learning were all described in that work (of Brahma).

data.v: चातुर्वर्ण्यं तथैवात्र चातुर्वेद्यं च वर्णितम् । इतिहासोपवेदाश्च न्यायः कृत्स्नश्च वर्णितः ॥
तपो ज्ञानमहिंसा च सत्यासत्ये नयः परः । वृद्धोपसेवा दानं च शौचमुत्थानमेव च ॥
data.md: Whatever objects or things, O son of Pandu, there are on Earth, were all described in that work of the Grandfather. Histories, the Vedas and the Nyaya (logic) were all described in it, as also penances, knowledge, abstention from injury to all creatures, truth, falsehood, and high morality.

data.v: सर्वभूतानुकम्पा च सर्वमत्रोपवर्णितम् । भुवि वाचोगतं यच्च तच्च सर्वं समर्पितम् ॥
तस्मिन्पैतामहे शास्त्रे पाण्डवैतदसंशयम् । धर्मार्थकाममोक्षाश्च सकला ह्यत्र शब्दिताः ॥
data.md: Containing the cream of all the attributes of the six, this science will always be much respected by great persons. Religion, Profit, Pleasure, and Liberation have all been described in it.

data.v: ततस्तां भगवान्नीतिं पूर्वं जग्राह शंकरः । बहुरूपो विशालाक्षः शिवः स्थाणुरुमापतिः ॥
data.md: After this, the husband of Uma,—the divine and many-formed Shiva of large eyes, the source of all blessings, first read and mastered it.

data.v: युगानामायुषो ह्रासं विज्ञाय भगवाञ्शिवः । संचिक्षेप ततः शास्त्रं महार्थं ब्रह्मणा कृतम् ॥
data.md: In view, however, of the gradual decrease of the span of human existence, the divine Shiva abridged that highly important science compiled by Brahman.

data.v: वैशालाक्षमिति प्रोक्तं तदिन्द्रः प्रत्यपद्यत । दशाध्यायसहस्राणि सुब्रह्मण्यो महातपाः ॥
data.md: The abridgement, called Vaishalaksha, consisting of ten thousand chapters was then received by Indra, devoted to Brahman and possessed of great ascetic merit.

data.v: भगवानपि तच्छास्त्रं संचिक्षेप पुरंदरः । सहस्रैः पञ्चभिस्तात यदुक्तं बाहुदन्तकम् ॥
data.md: The divine Indra again abridged it into a work containing five thousand chapters and named it Vahudantaka.

data.v: अध्यायानां सहस्रैस्तु त्रिभिरेव बृहस्पतिः । संचिक्षेपेश्वरो बुद्ध्या बार्हस्पत्यं तदुच्यते ॥
data.md: Afterwards the powerful Brihaspati, by his intelligence, further abridged the work, into one containing three thousand chapters and named it Barhaspatya.

data.v: अध्यायानां सहस्रेण काव्यः संक्षेपमब्रवीत् । तच्छास्त्रममितप्रज्ञो योगाचार्यो महातपाः ॥
data.md: Next, the famous teacher of Yoga, Kavi of unlimited wisdom, abridged it further into a work of a thousand chapters.

data.v: एवं लोकानुरोधेन शास्त्रमेतन्महर्षिभिः । संक्षिप्तमायुर्विज्ञाय मर्त्यानां ह्रासि पाण्डव ॥
data.md: Considering the period of human existence and the general decrease (of every thing), great Rishis did thus, for the well-being of the world, abridge that science.

data.v: अथ देवाः समागम्य विष्णुमूचुः प्रजापतिम् । एको योऽर्हति मर्त्येभ्यः श्रैष्ठ्यं तं वै समादिश ॥
data.md: Then, approaching that lord of creatures, viz., Vishnu, the god said to him,-Point out, O god, that one among men who deserves to reign supreme over the rest.

data.v: ततः संचिन्त्य भगवान्देवो नारायणः प्रभुः । तैजसं वै विरजसं सोऽसृजन्मानसं सुतम् ॥
data.md: The divine and powerful Narayana, thinking a little, created by his will a son born of his energy, named Virajas.

data.v: विरजास्तु महाभाग विभुत्वं भुवि नैच्छत । न्यासायैवाभवद्बुद्धिः प्रणीता तस्य पाण्डव ॥
data.md: The highly blessed Virajas, however, did not desire to rule on Earth. His mind, O son of Pandu, was bent for a life of renunciation.

data.v: कीर्तिमांस्तस्य पुत्रोऽभूत्सोऽपि पञ्चातिगोऽभवत् । कर्दमस्तस्य च सुतः सोऽप्यतप्यन्महत्तपः ॥
data.md: Virajas had a son named Krittimat. He too cast off pleasure and enjoyment. Krittimat had a son named Kardama. Kardama also practised severe austerities.

data.v: प्रजापतेः कर्दमस्य अनङ्गो नाम वै सुतः । प्रजानां रक्षिता साधुर्दण्डनीतिविशारदः ॥
data.md: The lord of creatures, Kardama, begot a son named Ananga, who became a protector of creatures, pious and well-read in the science of punishment.

data.v: अनङ्गपुत्रोऽतिबलो नीतिमानधिगम्य वै । अभिपेदे महीराज्यमथेन्द्रियवशोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: Ananga beget a son named Atibala, wellread in politics. Obtaining extensive empire after the death of his father, he became a slave of his passions.

data.v: मृत्योस्तु दुहिता राजन्सुनीथा नाम मानसी । प्रख्याता त्रिषु लोकेषु या सा वेनमजीजनत् ॥
data.md: Mrityu, O king, had a mind-begotten daughter named Sunitha well-known over the three worlds. She was married to Atibala and gave birth to a son named Vena.

data.v: तं प्रजासु विधर्माणं रागद्वेषवशानुगम् । मन्त्रपूतैः कुशैर्जघ्नुरृषयो ब्रह्मवादिनः ॥
data.md: Vena, a slave of anger and malice, become impious and tyrannical towards all creatures. The Brahmavadin Rishis killed him with Kusha blades inspired with Mantras.

data.v: ममन्थुर्दक्षिणं चोरुमृषयस्तस्य मन्त्रतः । ततोऽस्य विकृतो जज्ञे ह्रस्वाङ्गः पुरुषो भुवि ॥
data.md: Uttering Mantras all the while, those Rishis pierced the right thigh of Vena. Thereupon, from that thigh, sprang a short-limbed person on earth, resembling a charred brand, having blood-red eyes and black hair. Those Brahmavadins said to him,-Nishida (sit) here.

data.v: दग्धस्थाणुप्रतीकाशो रक्ताक्षः कृष्णमूर्धजः । निषीदेत्येवमूचुस्तमृषयो ब्रह्मवादिनः ॥
data.md: Uttering Mantras all the while, those Rishis pierced the right thigh of Vena. Thereupon, from that thigh, sprang a short-limbed person on earth, resembling a charred brand, having blood-red eyes and black hair. Those Brahmavadins said to him,-Nishida (sit) here.

data.v: तस्मान्निषादाः संभूताः क्रूराः शैलवनाश्रयाः । ये चान्ये विन्ध्यनिलया म्लेच्छाः शतसहस्रशः ॥
data.md: From him have originated the Nishadas, viz., those wicked tribes who live in the hills and the forests, as also those hundreds and thousands of Mlechchhas, living on the Vindhya ranges.

data.v: भूयोऽस्य दक्षिणं पाणिं ममन्थुस्ते महर्षयः । ततः पुरुष उत्पन्नो रूपेणेन्द्र इवापरः ॥
data.md: The great Rishis then pierced right arm of Vena. Thence originated a person who was a second Indra in form.

data.v: कवची बद्धनिस्त्रिंशः सशरः सशरासनः । वेदवेदाङ्गविच्चैव धनुर्वेदे च पारगः ॥
data.md: Clad in mail, armed with swords, bows and arrows, and well-versed in the science of war, he was also a master of the Vedas and their auxiliaries.

data.v: तं दण्डनीतिः सकला श्रिता राजन्नरोत्तमम् । ततः स प्राञ्जलिर्वैन्यो महर्षींस्तानुवाच ह ॥
data.md: All the ordinances of the science of punishment, O king, came in their bodily forms to that best of men. The son of Vena then with joined-hands, said to those great Rishis.

data.v: सुसूक्ष्मा मे समुत्पन्ना बुद्धिर्धर्मार्थदर्शिनी । अनया किं मया कार्यं तन्मे तत्त्वेन शंसत ॥
data.md: I have got a very keen and fair understanding. Tell me fully what I shall do with it.

data.v: यन्मां भवन्तो वक्ष्यन्ति कार्यमर्थसमन्वितम् । तदहं वै करिष्यामि नात्र कार्या विचारणा ॥
data.md: I shall unhesitatingly accomplish any useful task which you will be pleased to indicate.

data.v: तमूचुरथ देवास्ते ते चैव परमर्षयः । नियतो यत्र धर्मो वै तमशङ्कः समाचर ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, the gods that were present there, also the Rishis said to him,-"Do you fearlessly perform all sorts of righteous works.”

data.v: प्रियाप्रिये परित्यज्य समः सर्वेषु जन्तुषु । कामक्रोधौ च लोभं च मानं चोत्सृज्य दूरतः ॥
data.md: Without caring for what is dear and what not so, regard all creatures with impartiality. Renounce lust, anger, covetousness and honour, and always following the dictates of righteousness, do you punish with your own hands the man, whoever he may be, who does not satisfy his duty.

data.v: यश्च धर्मात्प्रविचलेल्लोके कश्चन मानवः । निग्राह्यस्ते स बाहुभ्यां शश्वद्धर्ममवेक्षतः ॥
data.md: Without caring for what is dear and what not so, regard all creatures with impartiality. Renounce lust, anger, covetousness and honour, and always following the dictates of righteousness, do you punish with your own hands the man, whoever he may be, who does not satisfy his duty.

data.v: प्रतिज्ञां चाधिरोहस्व मनसा कर्मणा गिरा । पालयिष्याम्यहं भौमं ब्रह्म इत्येव चासकृत् ॥
data.md: Do you also swear that you would in thought, word, and deed, always maintain the religion laid on earth by the Vedas.

data.v: यश्चात्र धर्मनीत्युक्तो दण्डनीतिव्यपाश्रयः । तमशङ्कः करिष्यामि स्ववशो न कदाचन ॥
data.md: Do you also swear that you would fearlessly follow the duties laid down in the Vedas with the help of the science of punishment, and that you would never act capriciously.

data.v: अदण्ड्या मे द्विजाश्चेति प्रतिजानीष्व चाभिभो । लोकं च संकरात्कृत्स्नात्त्रातास्मीति परंतप ॥
data.md: O powerful one, know that Brahmanas are exempt from punishment, and promise further that you would protect the world from an intermixture of castes.

data.v: वैन्यस्ततस्तानुवाच देवानृषिपुरोगमान् । ब्राह्मणा मे सहायाश्चेदेवमस्तु सुरर्षभाः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, Vena's son replied to the deities headed by the Rishis, saying,-Those foremost of men, viz., the highly blessed Brahmanas shall ever be adored by me,

data.v: एवमस्त्विति वैन्यस्तु तैरुक्तो ब्रह्मवादिभिः । पुरोधाश्चाभवत्तस्य शुक्रो ब्रह्ममयो निधिः ॥
data.md: Those Brahmavadins then said to him, Let it be so,-Then Shukra, that great repository of Brahma became his priest.

data.v: मन्त्रिणो वालखिल्यास्तु सारस्वत्यो गणो ह्यभूत् । महर्षिर्भगवान्गर्गस्तस्य सांवत्सरोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: The Valakhilyas became his ministers, and the Saraswats his companions. The great and illustrious Rishis Garga became his astrologer.'

data.v: आत्मनाष्टम इत्येव श्रुतिरेषा परा नृषु । उत्पन्नौ बन्दिनौ चास्य तत्पूर्वौ सूतमागधौ ॥
data.md: This great declaration of Shrutis is known among men that Prithu is the eighth from Vishnu, A little before two persons named Suta and Magadha were born. They became his bards and panegyrists.

data.v: समतां वसुधायाश्च स सम्यगुपपादयत् । वैषम्यं हि परं भूमेरासीदिति ह नः श्रुतम् ॥
data.md: We have heard that the surface of the earth had before been very uneven. It was Prithu who levelled its surface.

data.v: स विष्णुना च देवेन शक्रेण विबुधैः सह । ऋषिभिश्च प्रजापाल्ये ब्रह्मणा चाभिषेचितः ॥
तं साक्षात्पृथिवी भेजे रत्नान्यादाय पाण्डव । सागरः सरितां भर्ता हिमवांश्चाचलोत्तमः ॥
शक्रश्च धनमक्षय्यं प्रादात्तस्य युधिष्ठिर । रुक्मं चापि महामेरुः स्वयं कनकपर्वतः ॥
यक्षराक्षसभर्ता च भगवान्नरवाहनः । धर्मे चार्थे च कामे च समर्थं प्रददौ धनम् ॥
data.md: The great Meru, that mountain of gold, gave him heaps of that precious metal. The divine Kubera carried on shoulders by men, that lord of Yakshas and Rakshasas, gave him wealth enough for perforining the necessary works of religion, profit, and pleasure. Horses, cars, elephants, and men, by millions.

data.v: हया रथाश्च नागाश्च कोटिशः पुरुषास्तथा । प्रादुर्बभूवुर्वैन्यस्य चिन्तनादेव पाण्डव । न जरा न च दुर्भिक्षं नाधयो व्याधयस्तथा ॥
data.md: O son of Pandu, were born as soon as Vena's son thought of them. At that time there prevailed neither decrepitude, nor famine, nor calamity, nor disease (on Earth).

data.v: सरीसृपेभ्यः स्तेनेभ्यो न चान्योन्यात्कदाचन । भयमुत्पद्यते तत्र तस्य राज्ञोऽभिरक्षणात् ॥
data.md: On account of the protection afforded by that king, nobody entertained any fear from reptiles and thieves of from any other source.

data.v: तेनेयं पृथिवी दुग्धा सस्यानि दश सप्त च । यक्षराक्षसनागैश्चापीप्सितं यस्य यस्य यत् ॥
data.md: He drew from the Earth, as a milcher from a COW, seventeen sorts of crops for the food of Yakshas, and Rakshasas, and Nagas, and other creatures.

data.v: तेन धर्मोत्तरश्चायं कृतो लोको महात्मना । रञ्जिताश्च प्रजाः सर्वास्तेन राजेति शब्द्यते ॥
data.md: That great king caused all creatures to consider righteousness as the foremost of all things; and because he pleased all the people, therefore, he was called Rajan (king.)

data.v: ब्राह्मणानां क्षतत्राणात्ततः क्षत्रिय उच्यते । प्रथिता धनतश्चेयं पृथिवी साधुभिः स्मृता ॥
data.md: And because he also healed the wounds of Brahmanas, therefore, he passed by the name of Kshatriya. And because the Earth (during his regime) became celebrated for the practice of virtue, therefore, she passed by the name of Prithivi.

data.v: स्थापनं चाकरोद्विष्णुः स्वयमेव सनातनः । नातिवर्तिष्यते कश्चिद्राजंस्त्वामिति पार्थिव ॥
data.md: The eternal Vishnu himself, O Bharata, confirmed his power, telling him,-No one, O king, shall excel you.

data.v: तपसा भगवान्विष्णुराविवेश च भूमिपम् । देववन्नरदेवानां नमते यज्जगन्नृप ॥
data.md: The divine Vishnu entered the body of that king for his penances. Therefore the entire universe adored Prithu who was the greatest of kings.

data.v: दण्डनीत्या च सततं रक्षितं तं नरेश्वर । नाधर्षयत्ततः कश्चिच्चारनित्याच्च दर्शनात् ॥
data.md: O king, your kingdom should always be protected by the help of the science of punishment. You should also, by careful observation made through the movements of your spies, protect it in such a manner that no one may injure it.

data.v: आत्मना करणैश्चैव समस्येह महीक्षितः । को हेतुर्यद्वशे तिष्ठेल्लोको दैवादृते गुणात् ॥
विष्णोर्ललाटात्कमलं सौवर्णमभवत्तदा । श्रीः संभूता यतो देवी पत्नी धर्मस्य धीमतः ॥
श्रियः सकाशादर्थश्च जातो धर्मेण पाण्डव । अथ धर्मस्तथैवार्थः श्रीश्च राज्ये प्रतिष्ठिता ॥
सुकृतस्य क्षयाच्चैव स्वर्लोकादेत्य मेदिनीम् । पार्थिवो जायते तात दण्डनीतिवशानुगः ॥
महत्त्वेन च संयुक्तो वैष्णवेन नरो भुवि । बुद्ध्या भवति संयुक्तो माहात्म्यं चाधिगच्छति ॥
स्थापनामथ देवानां न कश्चिदतिवर्तते । तिष्ठत्येकस्य च वशे तं चेदनुविधीयते ॥
data.md: Established by the gods, no one goes above him. It is therefore that everybody obeys one, and it is for this, that the world cannot command him.

data.v: शुभं हि कर्म राजेन्द्र शुभत्वायोपकल्पते । तुल्यस्यैकस्य यस्यायं लोको वचसि तिष्ठति ॥
data.md: Good acts, O king, lead to good. It is therefore that a great many obey his command, through he belongs to the same world and is possessed of similar limbs.

data.v: यो ह्यस्य मुखमद्राक्षीत्सोम्य सोऽस्य वशानुगः । सुभगं चार्थवन्तं च रूपवन्तं च पश्यति ॥
data.md: He who once beheld Prithu's sweet face, became obedient to him. Thenceforth he began to know him as handsome, wealthy and highly blessed.

data.v: ततो जगति राजेन्द्र सततं शब्दितं बुधैः । देवाश्च नरदेवाश्च तुल्या इति विशां पते ॥
data.md: There is no doubt in this. Since then, O king, the learned have begun to say there is no difference between a god and a king.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं महत्त्वं प्रति राजसु । कार्त्स्न्येन भरतश्रेष्ठ किमन्यदिह वर्तताम् ॥
data.md: I have now told everything about the greatness of kings. What other subject is there, O chief of the Bharatas, which I shall next describe.

data.v: ततः पुनः स गाङ्गेयमभिवाद्य पितामहम् । प्राञ्जलिर्नियतो भूत्वा पर्यपृच्छद्युधिष्ठिरः ॥
के धर्माः सर्ववर्णानां चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य के पृथक् । चतुर्णामाश्रमाणां च राजधर्माश्च के मताः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said After this Yudhishthira, saluted his grand father, the son of Ganga, and with joined hands and rapt attention, once more asked him, saying,-'What are the general duties of the four castes and what the especial duties of each. What mode of life should be adopted by which order and what duties are especially designated as the duties of kings.

data.v: केन स्विद्वर्धते राष्ट्रं राजा केन विवर्धते । केन पौराश्च भृत्याश्च वर्धन्ते भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: By what means does a kingdom prosper and what are the means by which the king himself prospers? How also, O foremost of Bharata's race, do the citizens and the servants of the king prosper?

data.v: कोशं दण्डं च दुर्गं च सहायान्मन्त्रिणस्तथा । ऋत्विक्पुरोहिताचार्यान्कीदृशान्वर्जयेन्नृपः ॥
data.md: What sorts of wealth, punishments, forts, allies, counsellors, priests and preceptors, should a king avoid?

data.v: केषु विश्वसितव्यं स्याद्राज्ञां कस्यांचिदापदि । कुतो वात्मा दृढो रक्ष्यस्तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Whom should the king trust in what sorts of distress and danger? What evils should the king avoid? Tell me all this, O grandfather.

data.v: नमो धर्माय महते नमः कृष्णाय वेधसे । ब्राह्मणेभ्यो नमस्कृत्वा धर्मान्वक्ष्यामि शाश्वतान् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said 'Saluting Dharma who is Supreme, Krishna who is Brahma in full, and the Brahmanas, I shall discourse on the eternal duties (of men).

data.v: अक्रोधः सत्यवचनं संविभागः क्षमा तथा । प्रजनः स्वेषु दारेषु शौचमद्रोह एव च ॥
data.md: The control of anger, truthfulness of speech, justice, forgiveness, begetting children upon one's own married wives, purity of conduct, avoidance of quarrel, simplicity, and maintenance of dependents,—these are the nine duties which all the four orders should follow.

data.v: आर्जवं भृत्यभरणं नवैते सार्ववर्णिकाः । ब्राह्मणस्य तु यो धर्मस्तं ते वक्ष्यामि केवलम् ॥
दममेव महाराज धर्ममाहुः पुरातनम् । स्वाध्यायोऽध्यापनं चैव तत्र कर्म समाप्यते ॥
data.md: I shall now describe the duties which the Brahmanas should exclusively follow. Selfcontrol, o king, has been declared to be the first duty of Brahmanas. Study of the Vedas, and patient practice of austerities, (are also their other duties). By practising these two, all their acts are done.

data.v: तं चेद्वित्तमुपागच्छेद्वर्तमानं स्वकर्मणि । अकुर्वाणं विकर्माणि शान्तं प्रज्ञानतर्पितम् ॥
data.md: If while engaged in the observance of his own duties, without doing any unfair act, riches comes to a peaceful Brahmana endued with knowledge, he should then marry and seek to beget children, and should also practise charity and celebrate sacrifices. It has been declared by the wise that wealth thus acquired should be enjoyed by distributing it among worthy persons and relatives.

data.v: कुर्वीतापत्यसंतानमथो दद्याद्यजेत च । संविभज्य हि भोक्तव्यं धनं सद्भिरितीष्यते ॥
परिनिष्ठितकार्यस्तु स्वाध्यायेनैव ब्राह्मणः । कुर्यादन्यन्न वा कुर्यान्मैत्रो ब्राह्मण उच्यते ॥
data.md: By his study of the Vedas all the pious acts are done. Whether he does or does not acquire anything else, if he only studies the Vedas, he becomes known as a Brahmana or the friend of all creatures.

data.v: क्षत्रियस्यापि यो धर्मस्तं ते वक्ष्यामि भारत । दद्याद्राजा न याचेत यजेत न तु याजयेत् ॥
data.md: I shall also tell you, O Bharata, what the duties of a Kshatriya are. A Kshatriya, O king, should give but not beg, should himself celebrate sacrifices but not officiate as a priest in the sacrifices of others.

data.v: नाध्यापयेदधीयीत प्रजाश्च परिपालयेत् । नित्योद्युक्तो दस्युवधे रणे कुर्यात्पराक्रमम् ॥
data.md: He should never teach the Veda but study the same with a Brahmana teacher. He should protect the people. Always trying his best for the destruction of robbers and wicked people, he should display his prowess in battle.

data.v: ये च क्रतुभिरीजानाः श्रुतवन्तश्च भूमिपाः । य एवाहवजेतारस्त एषां लोकजित्तमाः ॥
data.md: Those among Kshatriya kings who celebrate great sacrifices, who have a knowledge of the Vedas and who gain victories in battle, become foremost of those who acquire many blessed regions hereafter by their merit.

data.v: अविक्षतेन देहेन समराद्यो निवर्तते । क्षत्रियो नास्य तत्कर्म प्रशंसन्ति पुराविदः ॥
data.md: Persons well read in the scriptures do not speak highly of a Kshatriya who returns unscathed from battle.

data.v: वधं हि क्षत्रबन्धूनां धर्ममाहुः प्रधानतः । नास्य कृत्यतमं किंचिदन्यद्दस्युनिबर्हणात् ॥
data.md: This is the conduct of a wretched Kshatriya. There is no greater duty for him than the suppression of robbers.

data.v: दानमध्ययनं यज्ञो योगः क्षेमो विधीयते । तस्माद्राज्ञा विशेषेण योद्धव्यं धर्ममीप्सता ॥
data.md: Gifts, study, and sacrifices, yield prosperity to kings. Therefore, a king who desires to obtain religious merit should engage in battle.

data.v: स्वेषु धर्मेष्ववस्थाप्य प्रजाः सर्वा महीपतिः । धर्मेण सर्वकृत्यानि समनिष्ठानि कारयेत् ॥
data.md: Compelling all his subjects to follow their respective duties, a king should make all of them do everything according to the dictates of righteousness.

data.v: परिनिष्ठितकार्यः स्यान्नृपतिः परिपालनात् । कुर्यादन्यन्न वा कुर्यादैन्द्रो राजन्य उच्यते ॥
data.md: By his study of the Vedas all the pious acts are done. Whether he does or does not acquire anything else, if he only studies the Vedas, he becomes known as a Brahmana or the friend of all creatures.

data.v: वैश्यस्यापीह यो धर्मस्तं ते वक्ष्यामि भारत । दानमध्ययनं यज्ञः शौचेन धनसंचयः ॥
data.md: I shall now tell you, O Yudhishthira, what the eternal duties of the Vaishyas are.-A Vaishya should make gifts, study the Vedas, celebrate sacrifices, and acquire wealth by fair means.

data.v: पितृवत्पालयेद्वैश्यो युक्तः सर्वपशूनिह । विकर्म तद्भवेदन्यत्कर्म यद्यत्समाचरेत् । रक्षया स हि तेषां वै महत्सुखमवाप्नुयात् ॥
प्रजापतिर्हि वैश्याय सृष्ट्वा परिददे पशून् । ब्राह्मणाय च राज्ञे च सर्वाः परिददे प्रजाः ॥
तस्य वृत्तिं प्रवक्ष्यामि यच्च तस्योपजीवनम् । षण्णामेकां पिबेद्धेनुं शताच्च मिथुनं हरेत् ॥
data.md: I shall now describe the profession, he should pursue and the means by which he may earn his subsistence. It is said that the Shudras should be maintained by the three other castes.

data.v: लये च सप्तमो भागस्तथा शृङ्गे कला खुरे । सस्यस्य सर्वबीजानामेषा सांवत्सरी भृतिः ॥
data.md: If he keeps (for others) six kine, he may take the milk of one cow as his own remuneration; and if he keeps (for others) a hundred kine, he may take a pair as his remuneration. If he trades with other's money, he may take a seventh part of the profits, as his share. A seventh part of the profits arising from the trade in horns is also his, but he should take a sixteenth if the trade is in hoofs. If he makes cultivation with seeds given by others, he may take a seventh part of the produce. This should be his annual remuneration.

data.v: न च वैश्यस्य कामः स्यान्न रक्षेयं पशूनिति । वैश्ये चेच्छति नान्येन रक्षितव्याः कथंचन ॥
data.md: A Vaishya should never wish that he should not tend cattle. If a Vaishya desires to tend cattle no one else should undertake that task.

data.v: शूद्रस्यापि हि यो धर्मस्तं ते वक्ष्यामि भारत । प्रजापतिर्हि वर्णानां दासं शूद्रमकल्पयत् ॥
data.md: I should tell you, O Bharata, what the duties of a Shudra are. The Creator intended the Shudra as the servant of the other three castes.

data.v: तस्माच्छूद्रस्य वर्णानां परिचर्या विधीयते । तेषां शुश्रूषणाच्चैव महत्सुखमवाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: Therefore, the service of the three other classes is the duty of the Shudra. By thus serving the other three, a Shudra may acquire great happiness.

data.v: शूद्र एतान्परिचरेत्त्रीन्वर्णाननसूयकः । संचयांश्च न कुर्वीत जातु शूद्रः कथंचन ॥
पापीयान्हि धनं लब्ध्वा वशे कुर्याद्गरीयसः । राज्ञा वा समनुज्ञातः कामं कुर्वीत धार्मिकः ॥
data.md: He should serve the three other classes according to their order of seniority. A Shudra should never amass riches, lest by them, he makes the members of the three superior orders obedient to him. By this he would incur sin. With the king's permission, however, a Shudra, for religious observances, may acquire wealth.

data.v: तस्य वृत्तिं प्रवक्ष्यामि यच्च तस्योपजीवनम् । अवश्यभरणीयो हि वर्णानां शूद्र उच्यते ॥
data.md: I shall now describe the profession, he should pursue and the means by which he may earn his subsistence. It is said that the Shudras should be maintained by the three other castes.

data.v: छत्रं वेष्टनमौशीरमुपानद्व्यजनानि च । यातयामानि देयानि शूद्राय परिचारिणे ॥
data.md: Used umbrellas, hed-gears, beds, seats, shoes and fans, should be given to the Shudra servants.

data.v: अधार्याणि विशीर्णानि वसनानि द्विजातिभिः । शूद्रायैव विधेयानि तस्य धर्मधनं हि तत् ॥
data.md: Torn clothes, which are no longer fit for wear, should be given by the upper three castes to the Shudra. These are the latter's rightful acquisitions.

data.v: यश्च कश्चिद्द्विजातीनां शूद्रः शुश्रूषुराव्रजेत् । कल्प्यां तस्य तु तेनाहुर्वृत्तिं धर्मविदो जनाः । देयः पिण्डोऽनपेताय भर्तव्यौ वृद्धदुर्बलौ ॥
data.md: Men, well read in the science of duties, hold that if the Shudra approaches anyone belonging to the three twice-born orders for doing menial service, the latter should give him proper work.

data.v: शूद्रेण च न हातव्यो भर्ता कस्यांचिदापदि । अतिरेकेण भर्तव्यो भर्ता द्रव्यपरिक्षये । न हि स्वमस्ति शूद्रस्य भर्तृहार्यधनो ह्यसौ ॥
data.md: If the master loses his wealth, he should with greatest care be maintained by the Shudra servant. A Shudra cannot enjoy wealth even if it be his own. Whatever he possesses belongs lawfully to his master.

data.v: उक्तस्त्रयाणां वर्णानां यज्ञस्त्रय्यैव भारत । स्वाहाकारनमस्कारौ मन्त्रः शूद्रे विधीयते ॥
data.md: Sacrifice has been laid down as a duty of the three other castes, it has been laid down for the Shudra also, O Bharata, but he is not competent to utter svaha and svadha or any other Vedic mantra.

data.v: ताभ्यां शूद्रः पाकयज्ञैर्यजेत व्रतवान्स्वयम् । पूर्णपात्रमयीमाहुः पाकयज्ञस्य दक्षिणाम् ॥
data.md: Therefore the Shudra, without observing the vows laid down in the Vedas, should adore the gods in minor sacrifices, called Pakayajnas. The gift called Purnapatra is known as the Dakshina of such sacrifices,

data.v: शूद्रः पैजवनो नाम सहस्राणां शतं ददौ । ऐन्द्राग्नेन विधानेन दक्षिणामिति नः श्रुतम् ॥
data.md: We have heard that in days of yore a Shudra of the name of Paijavana gave Dakshina (in one of his sacrifices) consisting of a hundred thousand Purnapatras, according to the ordinance called Aindragni, (i.e., a hundred thousand animals).

data.v: अतो हि सर्ववर्णानां श्रद्धायज्ञो विधीयते । दैवतं हि महच्छ्रद्धा पवित्रं यजतां च यत् ॥
दैवतं परमं विप्राः स्वेन स्वेन परस्परम् । अयजन्निह सत्रैस्ते तैस्तैः कामैः सनातनैः ॥
संसृष्टा ब्राह्मणैरेव त्रिषु वर्णेषु सृष्टयः । देवानामपि ये देवा यद्ब्रूयुस्ते परं हि तत् । तस्माद्वर्णैः सर्वयज्ञाः संसृज्यन्ते न काम्यया ॥
data.md: The Brahmanas are the gods of the very gods. Whatever they would say would be for your great good. Therefore all kinds of sacrifices naturally belong to all the four orders. The celebration of these sacrifices is obligatory and not optional.

data.v: ऋग्यजुःसामवित्पूज्यो नित्यं स्याद्देववद्द्विजः । अनृग्यजुरसामा तु प्राजापत्य उपद्रवः ॥
data.md: The Brahmana, who is conversant with Richs, Yajus, and Samans, should always be adored as a god. The Shudra, who is without Richs and Yajus and Samans, has Prajapati for his god.

data.v: यज्ञो मनीषया तात सर्ववर्णेषु भारत । नास्य यज्ञहनो देवा ईहन्ते नेतरे जनाः । तस्मात्सर्वेषु वर्णेषु श्रद्धायज्ञो विधीयते ॥
data.md: Mental sacrifice, O sire, is sanctioned for all the orders, O Bharata. It is not true that the gods and other persons do not express a desire to share the offerings in such sacrifices ofs even the Shudra. For this reason, the sacrifice of devotion is laid down for all the castes.

data.v: स्वं दैवतं ब्राह्मणाः स्वेन नित्यं; परान्वर्णानयजन्नेवमासीत् । आरोचिता नः सुमहान्स धर्मः; सृष्टो ब्रह्मणा त्रिषु वर्णेषु दृष्टः ॥
data.md: The Brahmana is the foremost of gods. It is not true that they that belong to that order do not celebrate the sacrifices of the other orders. The fire called Vitana, though procured from Vaishyas and inspired with mantras, is stili inferior. The Brahmana can celebrate the sacrifices of the three other castes.

data.v: तस्माद्वर्णा ऋजवो जातिधर्माः; संसृज्यन्ते तस्य विपाक एषः । एकं साम यजुरेकमृगेका; विप्रश्चैकोऽनिश्चयस्तेषु दृष्टः ॥
data.md: Therefore, all the four castes are holy. All the castes are allied to one another by blood through the intermediate classes. They have all originated from Brahmanas. In ascertaining (the priority of origin) it will be seen that amongst all the cases the Brahmana was created first. Originally Saman was one; Yajus was one, and Rich was one.

data.v: अत्र गाथा यज्ञगीताः कीर्तयन्ति पुराविदः । वैखानसानां राजेन्द्र मुनीनां यष्टुमिच्छताम् ॥
data.md: Regarding it, persons, conversant with ancient histories, cite a verse, O king, sung in praise of sacrifice by the Vaikhanasa Munis on the occasion of performing a sacrifice of theirs.

data.v: उदितेऽनुदिते वापि श्रद्दधानो जितेन्द्रियः । वह्निं जुहोति धर्मेण श्रद्धा वै कारणं महत् ॥
data.md: Before or after sun rise, a person of controlled senses, with heart filled with devotion poured libations on the (sacrificial) fire according to the Vedic prescription. Devotion is a powerful agent.

data.v: यत्स्कन्नमस्य तत्पूर्वं यदस्कन्नं तदुत्तरम् । बहूनि यज्ञरूपाणि नानाकर्मफलानि च ॥
data.md: Respecting homas again, that variety which is called skanna is the first one, while that which is called askanna is the last though the most important. Sacrifices are many, their rites and fruits again are many.

data.v: तानि यः संविजानाति ज्ञाननिश्चयनिश्चितः । द्विजातिः श्रद्धयोपेतः स यष्टुं पुरुषोऽर्हति ॥
data.md: That Brahmana, possessed of devotion who, gifted with scriptural learning, knows all the rites, is competent to celebrate sacrifices.

data.v: स्तेनो वा यदि वा पापो यदि वा पापकृत्तमः । यष्टुमिच्छति यज्ञं यः साधुमेव वदन्ति तम् ॥
data.md: That person who desires to celebrate a sacrifice is regarded as righteous even if he happens to be a thief, a sinner or the worst of sinners.

data.v: ऋषयस्तं प्रशंसन्ति साधु चैतदसंशयम् । सर्वथा सर्ववर्णैर्हि यष्टव्यमिति निश्चयः । न हि यज्ञसमं किंचित्त्रिषु लोकेषु विद्यते ॥
data.md: The Rishis speak highly of such a man. Forsooth they are right. This then is the conclusion that all the castes should always and by every means in their power celebrate sacrifices.

data.v: तस्माद्यष्टव्यमित्याहुः पुरुषेणानसूयता । श्रद्धापवित्रमाश्रित्य यथाशक्ति प्रयच्छता ॥
data.md: There is nothing in the three worlds equal to sacrifice. Therefore, it has been said that every one,-with heart shorn of malice, should celebrate sacrifices, helped by devotion which is sacred to the best of his ability and as he pleases.

data.v: आश्रमाणां महाबाहो शृणु सत्यपराक्रम । चतुर्णामिह वर्णानां कर्माणि च युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Bhishma said O mighty-armed one, hear me, O you of prowess incapable of being baffled, as I name the four modes of life and describe their respective duties.

data.v: वानप्रस्थं भैक्षचर्यां गार्हस्थ्यं च महाश्रमम् । ब्रह्मचर्याश्रमं प्राहुश्चतुर्थं ब्राह्मणैर्वृतम् ॥
data.md: The four modes and Vanaprastha (hermit), Bhaikshya (mendicant), Garhasthya of great merit (house-holder), Brahmacharya (religious student) which is adopted by Brahmanas.

data.v: जटाकरणसंस्कारं द्विजातित्वमवाप्य च । आधानादीनि कर्माणि प्राप्य वेदमधीत्य च ॥
सदारो वाप्यदारो वा आत्मवान्संयतेन्द्रियः । वानप्रस्थाश्रमं गच्छेत्कृतकृत्यो गृहाश्रमात् ॥
data.md: Performing the purificatory rite consequent upon bearing matted locks, and of regeneration and having performed for sometime the rites of the sacred fire and studied the Vedas, one should, with purified soul and controlled senses having first carefully performed all the duties of the house-hold order, proceed, with or without his wife, to the forest for adoption of the mode called Vanaprastha.

data.v: तत्रारण्यकशास्त्राणि समधीत्य स धर्मवित् । ऊर्ध्वरेताः प्रजायित्वा गच्छत्यक्षरसात्मताम् ॥
data.md: Having studied the Scriptures called Aranyakas, having restrained his vital fluid and having retired from all worldly affairs the pious hermit may then find himself immersed in the eternal Soul knowing no deterioration.

data.v: एतान्येव निमित्तानि मुनीनामूर्ध्वरेतसाम् । कर्तव्यानीह विप्रेण राजन्नादौ विपश्चिता ॥
data.md: These are the signs of ascetics that have drawn up their vital fluid. A learned Brahmana, O king, should first practise and perform them.

data.v: चरितब्रह्मचर्यस्य ब्राह्मणस्य विशां पते । भैक्षचर्यास्वधीकारः प्रशस्त इह मोक्षिणः ॥
data.md: The Brahmana, O king, who is desirous of liberation, is is competent to adopt the mendicant's life after having gone through the mode called Brahmacharya.

data.v: यत्रास्तमितशायी स्यान्निरग्निरनिकेतनः । यथोपलब्धजीवी स्यान्मुनिर्दान्तो जितेन्द्रियः ॥
निराशीः स्यात्सर्वसमो निर्भोगो निर्विकारवान् । विप्रः क्षेमाश्रमं प्राप्तो गच्छत्यक्षरसात्मताम् ॥
data.md: Sleeping at the place where evening sets without caring to improve his situation, without a home, living on whatever fare is got (in charity), given to meditation, practising selfrestraint, with the senses under control, without desire, regarding all creatures impartially, without enjoyments, without dislike anything the Brahmana, possessed of learning, by adopting this mode of life, attains to unification with the eternal undecaying Soul.

data.v: अधीत्य वेदान्कृतसर्वकृत्यः; संतानमुत्पाद्य सुखानि भुक्त्वा । समाहितः प्रचरेद्दुश्चरं तं; गार्हस्थ्यधर्मं मुनिधर्मदृष्टम् ॥
data.md: The person, leading the life of a householder, should, after studying the Vedas, accomplish all the religious acts prescribed for to him. He should procreate children and enjoy pleasures and luxuries. With careful attention he should satisfy all the duties of this mode of life which is highly spoken of by ascetics and which is extremely difficult to follow (without sins.)

data.v: स्वदारतुष्ट ऋतुकालगामी; नियोगसेवी नशठो नजिह्मः । मिताशनो देवपरः कृतज्ञः; सत्यो मृदुश्चानृशंसः क्षमावान् ॥
data.md: He shouid be satisfied with his own married wife and should never approach her except in her season. He should follow prescription of the scriptures, should not be cunning and deceitful. He should be sparing in diet, devoted to the gods, grateful, mild, shorn of cruelty, and forgiving.

data.v: दान्तो विधेयो हव्यकव्येऽप्रमत्तो; अन्नस्य दाता सततं द्विजेभ्यः । अमत्सरी सर्वलिङ्गिप्रदाता; वैताननित्यश्च गृहाश्रमी स्यात् ॥
data.md: He should be of a tranquil heart, peaceful and careful in making offerings to the gods and the Pitris. He should always be hospitable to the Brahmanas. He should be shorn of pride and should not make charity to one sect. He should always carefully perforinthe Vedic rites.

data.v: अथात्र नारायणगीतमाहु;र्महर्षयस्तात महानुभावाः । महार्थमत्यर्थतपःप्रयुक्तं; तदुच्यमानं हि मया निबोध ॥
data.md: Regarding it, the illustrious and great Rishis cite a verse sung by Narayana himself, highly important and endued with high ascetic merit. Hear me as I repeat it.

data.v: सत्यार्जवं चातिथिपूजनं च; धर्मस्तथार्थश्च रतिश्च दारे । निषेवितव्यानि सुखानि लोके; ह्यस्मिन्परे चैव मतं ममैतत् ॥
data.md: By truth, simplicity, worship of guests, acquisition of religion and profit, and enjoyment of one's own married wife one should enjoy various kinds of happiness both here and hereafter.

data.v: भरणं पुत्रदाराणां वेदानां पारणं तथा । सतां तमाश्रमं श्रेष्ठं वदन्ति परमर्षयः ॥
data.md: The great Rishis have said that the maintenance of sons and wives, and the study of the Vedas, are the duties of those who follow this high mode of life.

data.v: एवं हि यो ब्राह्मणो यज्ञशीलो; गार्हस्थ्यमध्यावसते यथावत् । गृहस्थवृत्तिं प्रविशोध्य सम्य;क्स्वर्गे विशुद्धं फलमाप्नुते सः ॥
data.md: That Brahmana who, always engaged in the celebration of sacrifices, duly passes this mode of life and properly discharges all its duties, obtains blessed rewards in heaven.

data.v: तस्य देहपरित्यागादिष्टाः कामाक्षया मताः । आनन्त्यायोपतिष्ठन्ति सर्वतोक्षिशिरोमुखाः ॥
data.md: Upon his death, the rewards sought by him become eternal. Indeed these wait upon him for eternity like servants ever careful to execute the orders of their master.

data.v: खादन्नेको जपन्नेकः सर्पन्नेको युधिष्ठिर । एकस्मिन्नेव आचार्ये शुश्रूषुर्मलपङ्कवान् ॥
ब्रह्मचारी व्रती नित्यं नित्यं दीक्षापरो वशी । अविचार्य तथा वेदं कृत्यं कुर्वन्वसेत्सदा ॥
शुश्रूषां सततं कुर्वन्गुरोः संप्रणमेत च । षट्कर्मस्वनिवृत्तश्च नप्रवृत्तश्च सर्वशः ॥
न चरत्यधिकारेण सेवितं द्विषतो न च । एषोऽऽश्रमपदस्तात ब्रह्मचारिण इष्यते ॥
शिवान्सुखान्महोदर्कानहिंस्राँल्लोकसंमतान् । ब्रूहि धर्मान्सुखोपायान्मद्विधानां सुखावहान् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Tell us those duties which persons like ourselves should follow and which are auspicious, yield happiness in the future, benevolent, applauded by all, pleasant, and agreeable.

data.v: ब्राह्मणस्येह चत्वार आश्रमा विहिताः प्रभो । वर्णास्ताननुवर्तन्ते त्रयो भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: Bhishma said ‘The four modes of life, O powerful one, have been laid down for the Brahmana. The other three orders do not adopt them, O best of the Bharatas.

data.v: उक्तानि कर्माणि बहूनि राज;न्स्वर्ग्याणि राजन्यपरायणानि । नेमानि दृष्टान्तविधौ स्मृतानि; क्षात्रे हि सर्वं विहितं यथावत् ॥
data.md: Many acts, O king, leading to heaven and especially fit for the Kshatriyas, have already। been mentioned. Those, however, cannot be referred to in reply to your present question for all of them have been duly laid down for such Kshatriyas who are merciless.

data.v: क्षात्राणि वैश्यानि च सेवमानः; शौद्राणि कर्माणि च ब्राह्मणः सन् । अस्मिँल्लोके निन्दितो मन्दचेताः; परे च लोके निरयं प्रयाति ॥
data.md: That Brahmana, who follows the practices of Kshatriyas and Vaishyas and Shudras, is blamed in this world as a wicked person and goes to hell in the next world.

data.v: या संज्ञा विहिता लोके दासे शुनि वृके पशौ । विकर्मणि स्थिते विप्रे तां संज्ञां कुरु पाण्डव ॥
data.md: Those names, which are applied among men to slaves, dogs, wolves and (other) beasts, are given, O son of Pandu, to the Brahmana who does works which do not become him.

data.v: षट्कर्मसंप्रवृत्तस्य आश्रमेषु चतुर्ष्वपि । सर्वधर्मोपपन्नस्य संभूतस्य कृतात्मनः ॥
data.md: That Brahmana, who, in all the four modes of life, performs the sixfold acts (as regulating the breath, contemplation, etc.), who performs all his duties, who is patient, who has his passions under restraint, whose heart is pure and practises penances, who has no desire of bettering his situation and who is charitable, attains to regions of bliss in the next world.

data.v: ब्राह्मणस्य विशुद्धस्य तपस्यभिरतस्य च । निराशिषो वदान्यस्य लोका ह्यक्षरसंज्ञिताः ॥
data.md: That Brahmana, who, in all the four modes of life, performs the sixfold acts (as regulating the breath, contemplation, etc.), who performs all his duties, who is patient, who has his passions under restraint, whose heart is pure and practises penances, who has no desire of bettering his situation and who is charitable, attains to regions of bliss in the next world.

data.v: यो यस्मिन्कुरुते कर्म यादृशं येन यत्र च । तादृशं तादृशेनैव स गुणं प्रतिपद्यते ॥
data.md: Every one gets his own inclination from the nature of his acts regarding their circumstances, place, means and motives.

data.v: वृद्ध्या कृषिवणिक्त्वेन जीवसंजीवनेन च । वेत्तुमर्हसि राजेन्द्र स्वाध्यायगणितं महत् ॥
data.md: You should therefore, o king, consider the study of the Vedas, which is endued with such high merit, the manliness of kingly power, the pursuits of agriculture, trade, and hunting as all equal.

data.v: कालसंचोदितः कालः कालपर्यायनिश्चितः । उत्तमाधममध्यानि कर्माणि कुरुतेऽवशः ॥
data.md: The world is moved on by Time. Its works are settled by the course of Time. Man does all his acts, good, bad, and indifferent, entirely under the influence of Time.

data.v: अन्तवन्ति प्रदानानि पुरा श्रेयस्कराणि च । स्वकर्मनिरतो लोको ह्यक्षरः सर्वतोमुखः ॥
data.md: Those good acts of a man's past life which exert the greatest influence on the next, are liable to be exhausted. Men, however, perform always those acts to which their inclination leads. Those propensities again, lead a living being to various directions.

data.v: ज्याकर्षणं शत्रुनिबर्हणं च; कृषिर्वणिज्या पशुपालनं च । शुश्रूषणं चापि तथार्थहेतो;रकार्यमेतत्परमं द्विजस्य ॥
data.md: Bhishma said ‘Drawing the bowstring, destruction of enemies, agriculture, trade, tending cattle and serving others for money are not proper for a Brahmana.

data.v: सेव्यं तु ब्रह्मषट्कर्म गृहस्थेन मनीषिणा । कृतकृत्यस्य चारण्ये वासो विप्रस्य शस्यते ॥
data.md: An intelligent Brahmana, living as a householder, should duly perform the six Vedic acts. The retirement of a Brahmana into the woods, after having duly performed all the duties of the domestic mode of life, is highly spoken of.

data.v: राजप्रैष्यं कृषिधनं जीवनं च वणिज्यया । कौटिल्यं कौलटेयं च कुसीदं च विवर्जयेत् ॥
data.md: A Brahmana should avoid service of the king, money obtained by agriculture, sustenance derived from the trade, all kinds of wily conduct, knowing any but his married wives and usury.

data.v: शूद्रो राजन्भवति ब्रह्मबन्धु;र्दुश्चारित्र्यो यश्च धर्मादपेतः । वृषलीपतिः पिशुनो नर्तकश्च; ग्रामप्रैष्यो यश्च भवेद्विकर्मा ॥
data.md: That wretch of a Brahmana, who neglects to satisfy his duties and whose conduct becomes wicked becomes, O king, a Shudra. The Brahmana, who marries a Shudra woman, who becomes vile in conduct or a dancer or a village servant or performs other unbecoming acts, becomes a Shudra.

data.v: जपन्वेदानजपंश्चापि राज;न्समः शूद्रैर्दासवच्चापि भोज्यः । एते सर्वे शूद्रसमा भवन्ति; राजन्नेतान्वर्जयेद्देवकृत्ये ॥
data.md: Whether he recites the Vedas or not o king, if he does such improper acts, he is reduced to the position of a Shudra and on occasions of feeding he should be given a place amongst Shudras.

data.v: निर्मर्यादे चाशने क्रूरवृत्तौ; हिंसात्मके त्यक्तधर्मस्ववृत्ते । हव्यं कव्यं यानि चान्यानि राज;न्देयान्यदेयानि भवन्ति तस्मिन् ॥
data.md: Such Brahmanas become equal to Shudra, O king, and should be discarded at the time of worshipping the gods.

data.v: तस्माद्धर्मो विहितो ब्राह्मणस्य; दमः शौचं चार्जवं चापि राजन् । तथा विप्रस्याश्रमाः सर्व एव; पुरा राजन्ब्रह्मणा वै निसृष्टाः ॥
data.md: Whatever presents of food dedicated to the departed manes are made to Brahmanas, who have transgressed all restraints or become impure in conduct or addicted to wicked callings and cruel acts or who have neglected their legitimate duties, yield on merit (to the giver.) Therefore, O king, self-control, purity and simplicity have been laid down as the duties of a Brahmana. Besides these, O king, all the four modes of life were prescribed by Brahman for him.

data.v: यः स्याद्दान्तः सोमप आर्यशीलः; सानुक्रोशः सर्वसहो निराशीः । ऋजुर्मृदुरनृशंसः क्षमावा;न्स वै विप्रो नेतरः पापकर्मा ॥
data.md: He, who is self-controlled, has drunk the Soma in sacrifices, is of good conduct, has mercy for all creatures and patience to bear everything, has no desire of improving his position by acquisition of wealth, is frank and simple, mild, shorn of cruelty, and forgiving, is truly a Brahmana, and not he who is of sinful deeds.

data.v: शूद्रं वैश्यं राजपुत्रं च राजँ;ल्लोकाः सर्वे संश्रिता धर्मकामाः । तस्माद्वर्णाञ्जातिधर्मेषु सक्ता;न्मत्वा विष्णुर्नेच्छति पाण्डुपुत्र ॥
data.md: Men, desirous of acquiring virtue, seek the help, O king, of Sudras, Vaishyas, and Kshatriyas. If, therefore, the members of these (three) castes do not adopt peaceful duties, Vishnu, O son of Pandu, never extends his favour to them.

data.v: लोके चेदं सर्वलोकस्य न स्या;च्चातुर्वर्ण्यं वेदवादाश्च न स्युः । सर्वाश्चेज्याः सर्वलोकक्रियाश्च; सद्यः सर्वे चाश्रमस्था न वै स्युः ॥
data.md: If Vishnu be not pleased, the happiness of all men in heaven, the merit arising from the duties prescribed by the four orders, the injunctions of the Vedas, all kinds of sacrifices, and all other religions acts of men, and all the duties of the various modes of life, become lost.

data.v: यश्च त्रयाणां वर्णानामिच्छेदाश्रमसेवनम् । कर्तुमाश्रमदृष्टांश्च धर्मांस्ताञ्शृणु पाण्डव ॥
data.md: Listen now, O son of Pandu, to those duties which should be practised in the four modes of life. These should be known to the Kshatriya who wishes the members of the three (other) orders in his kingdom) to strictly follow the respective duties of those modes.

data.v: शुश्रूषाकृतकृत्यस्य कृतसंतानकर्मणः । अभ्यनुज्ञाप्य राजानं शूद्रस्य जगतीपते ॥
अल्पान्तरगतस्यापि दशधर्मगतस्य वा । आश्रमा विहिताः सर्वे वर्जयित्वा निराशिषम् ॥
