data.md: For a Shudra who wishes to hear (such scriptures as are not forbidden in his case), who has performed his duties, who has procreated a son, between whom and the superior orders there is not much difference for the purity of his conduct, all the modes of life have been laid down save the observance of universal peacefulness and self-control.

data.v: भैक्षचर्यां न तु प्राहुस्तस्य तद्धर्मचारिणः । तथा वैश्यस्य राजेन्द्र राजपुत्रस्य चैव हि ॥
data.md: For a Shudra practising all these duties, as also for a Vaishya, O king, and a Kshatriya, the Bhikshu mode of life has been sanctioned.

data.v: कृतकृत्यो वयोतीतो राज्ञः कृतपरिश्रमः । वैश्यो गच्छेदनुज्ञातो नृपेणाश्रममण्डलम् ॥
data.md: Having performed the duties of his order, and having also served the king, an aged Vaisya with the king's permission, may adopt another mode of life.

data.v: वेदानधीत्य धर्मेण राजशास्त्राणि चानघ । संतानादीनि कर्माणि कृत्वा सोमं निषेव्य च ॥
पालयित्वा प्रजाः सर्वा धर्मेण वदतां वर । राजसूयाश्वमेधादीन्मखानन्यांस्तथैव च ॥
समानीय यथापाठं विप्रेभ्यो दत्तदक्षिणः । संग्रामे विजयं प्राप्य तथाल्पं यदि वा बहु ॥
स्थापयित्वा प्रजापालं पुत्रं राज्ये च पाण्डव । अन्यगोत्रं प्रशस्तं वा क्षत्रियं क्षत्रियर्षभ ॥
अर्चयित्वा पितॄन्सम्यक्पितृयज्ञैर्यथाविधि । देवान्यज्ञैरृषीन्वेदैरर्चित्वा चैव यत्नतः ॥
अन्तकाले च संप्राप्ते य इच्छेदाश्रमान्तरम् । आनुपूर्व्याश्रमान्राजन्गत्वा सिद्धिमवाप्नुयात् ॥
राजर्षित्वेन राजेन्द्र भैक्षचर्याध्वसेवया । अपेतगृहधर्मोऽपि चरेज्जीवितकाम्यया ॥
data.md: A Kshatriya, for leading the life of a Rishi, O king, may take the Bhikshu mode of life; but he should never do so for enjoying the pleasure of the world. Having abandoned the life of a house-holder, he may adopt the life of mendicancy by begging what would barely maintain his life.

data.v: न चैतन्नैष्ठिकं कर्म त्रयाणां भरतर्षभ । चतुर्णां राजशार्दूल प्राहुराश्रमवासिनाम् ॥
data.md: A life of mendicancy is not compulsory for the three orders (viz., Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras), O giver of profuse presents. This mode of life, is open to all the four castes because they can adopt it if they choose.

data.v: बह्वायत्तं क्षत्रियैर्मानवानां; लोकश्रेष्ठं धर्ममासेवमानैः । सर्वे धर्माः सोपधर्मास्त्रयाणां; राज्ञो धर्मादिति वेदाच्छृणोमि ॥
data.md: Amongst men, the highest duties are those which are practised by Kshatriyas. The whole world is subject to the power of their arms. All the duties, principal and minor of the three other castes, depend upon the duties of the Kshatriya. The Vedas declare this.

data.v: यथा राजन्हस्तिपदे पदानि; संलीयन्ते सर्वसत्त्वोद्भवानि । एवं धर्मान्राजधर्मेषु सर्वा;न्सर्वावस्थं संप्रलीनान्निबोध ॥
data.md: As the foot-prints of all the other animals are covered by those of the elephant, so all the duties of the other castes, under every circumstances, are covered by those of the Kshatriya.

data.v: अल्पाश्रयानल्पफलान्वदन्ति; धर्मानन्यान्धर्मविदो मनुष्याः । महाश्रयं बहुकल्याणरूपं; क्षात्रं धर्मं नेतरं प्राहुरार्याः ॥
data.md: Men, well-read in the scriptures say that the duties of the other three castes give but limited relief or protection, yield petty rewards. The learned have said that the duties of the Kshatriya afford great relief and yield great rewards.

data.v: सर्वे धर्मा राजधर्मप्रधानाः; सर्वे धर्माः पाल्यमाना भवन्ति । सर्वत्यागो राजधर्मेषु राजं;स्त्यागे चाहुर्धर्ममग्र्यं पुराणम् ॥
data.md: The royal duties are the foremost of all duties. All the castes are protected by them. Every sort of Renunciation is included in kingly duties, o king, and Renunciation has been declared to be an eternal virtue and the foremost of all. on

data.v: मज्जेत्त्रयी दण्डनीतौ हतायां; सर्वे धर्मा न भवेयुर्विरुद्धाः । सर्वे धर्माश्चाश्रमाणां गताः स्युः; क्षात्रे त्यक्ते राजधर्मे पुराणे ॥
data.md: If the science of punishment disappears, the Vedas will be lost. All these scriptures also describing the duties of men become lost. Indeed, if these ancient duties the Kshatriyas be abandoned, all the duties of all the modes of life, become lost.

data.v: सर्वे त्यागा राजधर्मेषु दृष्टाः; सर्वा दीक्षा राजधर्मेषु चोक्ताः । सर्वे योगा राजधर्मेषु चोक्ताः; सर्वे लोका राजधर्मान्प्रविष्टाः ॥
data.md: All sorts of renunciation are in kingly duties; all kinds of initiation are in them; all sorts of learning are connected with them; and all sorts of worldly conduct are in them.

data.v: यथा जीवाः प्रकृतौ वध्यमाना; धर्माश्रितानामुपपीडनाय । एवं धर्मा राजधर्मैर्वियुक्ताः; सर्वावस्थं नाद्रियन्ते स्वधर्मम् ॥
data.md: As animals, killed by the vulgar, become the instrument of destroying the virtue and the religious acts of the destroyer so all other duties, if deprived of the protection offered by kingly duties, become subject to attack and destruction, and men, full of anxiety, neglect the practices laid down for them.

data.v: चातुराश्रम्यधर्माश्च जातिधर्माश्च पाण्डव । लोकपालोत्तराश्चैव क्षात्रे धर्मे व्यवस्थिताः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The duties of all the four modes of life, those of Yatis, O son of Pandu and the customs followed by men in general, are all comprised in kingly duties.

data.v: सर्वाण्येतानि धर्माणि क्षात्रे भरतसत्तम । निराशिषो जीवलोके क्षात्रे धर्मे व्यवस्थिताः ॥
data.md: All these acts, O chief of Bharatas are in Kshatriya duties. If the functions of royalty are disturbed, all creatures meet with evil.

data.v: अप्रत्यक्षं बहुद्वारं धर्ममाश्रमवासिनाम् । प्ररूपयन्ति तद्भावमागमैरेव शाश्वतम् ॥
data.md: The duties of men are not clear. They have, again, many exceptions. Guided by many (false) systems, their true nature is sometimes spoiled.

data.v: अपरे वचनैः पुण्यैर्वादिनो लोकनिश्चयम् । अनिश्चयज्ञा धर्माणामदृष्टान्ते परे रताः ॥
data.md: Others, who implicitly believe the decisions of men, without really knowing anything about the true nature of duties (as described in the scriptures), are at last constrained to believe in faiths whose ultimate ends are unknown.

data.v: प्रत्यक्षसुखभूयिष्ठमात्मसाक्षिकमच्छलम् । सर्वलोकहितं धर्मं क्षत्रियेषु प्रतिष्ठितम् ॥
data.md: The duties of the Kshatriyas are plain, conducive to great happiness, evident in their results, free from deceit, and beneficial to the whole world.

data.v: धर्माश्रमव्यवसिनां ब्राह्मणानां युधिष्ठिर । यथा त्रयाणां वर्णानां संख्यातोपश्रुतिः पुरा । राजधर्मेष्वनुपमा लोक्या सुचरितैरिह ॥
data.md: As the duties of the orders, as also of Brahmanas and of those that have retired from the world, O Yudhishthira, have before this been described as being included within those of that sacred mode of life viz., that of a householder so, the whole world, with all actions, is subject to kingly duties.

data.v: उदाहृतं ते राजेन्द्र यथा विष्णुं महौजसम् । सर्वभूतेश्वरं देवं प्रभुं नारायणं पुरा । जग्मुः सुबहवः शूरा राजानो दण्डनीतये ॥
एकैकमात्मनः कर्म तुलयित्वाश्रमे पुरा । राजानः पर्युपातिष्ठन्दृष्टान्तवचने स्थिताः ॥
data.md: Those kings, always observant of the injunctions of the scriptures enforced by examples, waited in days of yore, upon Narayana, after having compared their acts with the duties of each of the modes of life.

data.v: साध्या देवा वसवश्चाश्विनौ च; रुद्राश्च विश्वे मरुतां गणाश्च । सृष्टाः पुरा आदिदेवेन देवा; क्षात्रे धर्मे वर्तयन्ते च सिद्धाः ॥
data.md: Those deities, viz., the Saddhyas, the Vasus, the Ashvins, the Rudras, the Vishvas, the Maruts, and the Siddhas, created in days of yore by the first of gods, always practise Kshatriya duties.

data.v: अत्र ते वर्तयिष्यामि धर्ममर्थविनिश्चयम् । निर्मर्यादे वर्तमाने दानवैकायने कृते । बभूव राजा राजेन्द्र मान्धाता नाम वीर्यवान् ॥
पुरा वसुमतीपालो यज्ञं चक्रे दिदृक्षया । अनादिमध्यनिधनं देवं नारायणं प्रति ॥
स राजा राजशार्दूल मान्धाता परमेष्ठिनः । जग्राह शिरसा पादौ यज्ञे विष्णोर्महात्मनः ॥
दर्शयामास तं विष्णू रूपमास्थाय वासवम् । स पार्थिवैर्वृतः सद्भिरर्चयामास तं प्रभुम् ॥
तस्य पार्थिवसंघस्य तस्य चैव महात्मनः । संवादोऽयं महानासीद्विष्णुं प्रति महाद्युते ॥
data.md: Accompanied by Many good kings he offered his adorations to that powerful god. This high discourse took place between that foremost of kings and that illustrious god in the form of Indra, regarding the highly effulgent Vishnu.

data.v: किमिष्यते धर्मभृतां वरिष्ठ; यद्द्रष्टुकामोऽसि तमप्रमेयम् । अनन्तमायामितसत्त्ववीर्यं; नारायणं ह्यादिदेवं पुराणम् ॥
data.md: Indra said What is your object, О foremost of virtuous persons, in thus trying to see that Ancient and First of gods, viz., Narayana, of inconceivable power, and numberless illusions.

data.v: नासौ देवो विश्वरूपो मयापि; शक्यो द्रष्टुं ब्रह्मणा वापि साक्षात् । येऽन्ये कामास्तव राजन्हृदिस्था; दास्यामि तांस्त्वं हि मर्त्येषु राजा ॥
data.md: Neither myself, nor Brahman himself, can acquired a view of that god of universal from. I shall grant you what other objects you may desire to have for you are the foremost of mortals.

data.v: सत्ये स्थितो धर्मपरो जितेन्द्रियः; शूरो दृढं प्रीतिरतः सुराणाम् । बुद्ध्या भक्त्या चोत्तमश्रद्धया च; ततस्तेऽहं दद्मि वरं यथेष्टम् ॥
data.md: Your soul rests on peace; you are devoted to righteousness; you have your senses under control; and you are heroic. You always try your best to do what is agreeable to the gods. For the sake also of your intelligence, devotion, and great faith, I shall grant you whatsoever boons you may with to have.

data.v: असंशयं भगवन्नादिदेवं; द्रक्ष्याम्यहं शिरसाहं प्रसाद्य । त्यक्त्वा भोगान्धर्मकामो ह्यरण्य;मिच्छे गन्तुं सत्पथं लोकजुष्टम् ॥
data.md: Mandhatri said I bend my head for pleasing you; forsooth however, I wish to see the first of gods, O divine lord. Renouncing all (earthly) desires, I wish to acquire religious merit, and to lead the foremost mode of life, that path of the good held in highest esteem by all.

data.v: क्षात्राद्धर्माद्विपुलादप्रमेया;ल्लोकाः प्राप्ताः स्थापितं स्वं यशश्च । धर्मो योऽसावादिदेवात्प्रवृत्तो; लोकज्येष्ठस्तं न जानामि कर्तुम् ॥
data.md: By performing the great duties of a Kshatriya, I have acquired many regions of endless merit in the other world, and I have also, through those duties, spread my fame. I do not, however, know how to satisfy those duties the highest in the world emanating from the first of gods.

data.v: असैनिकोऽधर्मपरश्चरेथाः; परां गतिं लप्स्यसे चाप्रमत्तः । क्षात्रो धर्मो ह्यादिदेवात्प्रवृत्तः; पश्चादन्ये शेषभूताश्च धर्माः ॥
data.md: Indra said Those who are not kings, even if then satisfy their duties, cannot easily attain the highest meed of duty. Kingly duties first emanated from the original god. Other duties sprang afterwards from his body.

data.v: शेषाः सृष्टा ह्यन्तवन्तो ह्यनन्ताः; सुप्रस्थानाः क्षत्रधर्माविशिष्टाः । अस्मिन्धर्मे सर्वधर्माः प्रविष्टा;स्तस्माद्धर्मं श्रेष्ठमिमं वदन्ति ॥
data.md: Numberless other duties, with those of the Vanaprastha mode of life, were created afterwards. The fruits of all those are endless. Kingly duties however, are superior to them. They include all other duties. Therefore Kshatriya duties are described to be the foremost of all.

data.v: कर्मणा वै पुरा देवा ऋषयश्चामितौजसः । त्राताः सर्वे प्रमथ्यारीन्क्षत्रधर्मेण विष्णुना ॥
data.md: In days of yore Vishnu, by acting according to Kshatriya duties, forcibly suppressed and killed his enemies. Accordingly he have relief to the gods and the Rishis of immeasurable power.

data.v: यदि ह्यसौ भगवान्नाहनिष्य;द्रिपून्सर्वान्वसुमानप्रमेयः । न ब्राह्मणा न च लोकादिकर्ता; न सद्धर्मा नादिधर्मा भवेयुः ॥
data.md: If the divine Vishnu of inconceivable energy had not killed all his enemies among the Asuras, then the Brahmanas, and (Brahman) the Creator of the worlds and Kshatriya duties, and the duties that first originated from the Supreme deity, would all have been lost.

data.v: इमामुर्वीं न जयेद्विक्रमेण; देवश्रेष्ठोऽसौ पुरा चेदमेयः । चातुर्वर्ण्यं चातुराश्रम्यधर्माः; सर्वे न स्युर्ब्रह्मणो वै विनाशात् ॥
data.md: If that first and foremost of gods had not, by displaying his prowess, subjugated the Earth with all her Asuras, then all the duties of the four orders and all the duties of the four modes of life would all have been destroyed owing to the destruction of Brahmanas.

data.v: दृष्टा धर्माः शतधा शाश्वतेन; क्षात्रेण धर्मेण पुनः प्रवृत्ताः । युगे युगे ह्यादिधर्माः प्रवृत्ता; लोकज्येष्ठं क्षत्रधर्मं वदन्ति ॥
data.md: The eternal duties (of men) had all been destroyed but by the exercise of Kshatriya duties they were revived. In every cycle of duties of Brahmanas regarding the atainment to Brahma first set in. These however, are all protected by kingly duties. The later, on this account, are regarded as highest.

data.v: आत्मत्यागः सर्वभूतानुकम्पा; लोकज्ञानं मोक्षणं पालनं च । विषण्णानां मोक्षणं पीडितानां; क्षात्रे धर्मे विद्यते पार्थिवानाम् ॥
निर्मर्यादाः काममन्युप्रवृत्ता; भीता राज्ञो नाधिगच्छन्ति पापम् । शिष्टाश्चान्ये सर्वधर्मोपपन्नाः; साध्वाचाराः साधु धर्मं चरन्ति ॥
पुत्रवत्परिपाल्यानि लिङ्गधर्मेण पार्थिवैः । लोके भूतानि सर्वाणि विचरन्ति न संशयः ॥
data.md: Forsooth, all creatures live happily in the world, protected by kings exercising Kshatriya duties like children protected by their parents.

data.v: सर्वधर्मपरं क्षत्रं लोकज्येष्ठं सनातनम् । शश्वदक्षरपर्यन्तमक्षरं सर्वतोमुखम् ॥
data.md: Kshatriya duties are the highest of all duties. Those eternal duties, regarded as the first in the world, include the protection of every creature. Themselves eternal, they bring on liberation.

data.v: एवंवीर्यः सर्वधर्मोपपन्नः; क्षात्रः श्रेष्ठः सर्वधर्मेषु धर्मः । पाल्यो युष्माभिर्लोकसिंहैरुदारै;र्विपर्यये स्यादभावः प्रजानाम् ॥
data.md: Indra said Kshatriya duties, O king, which are so very potent, which embrace the exercise of all other duties, and which are the highest of all duties, should be observed by persons that are like you so high-souled and seek the well-being of the world. If those duties are not properly satisfied all creatures would be ruined.

data.v: भुवः संस्कारं राजसंस्कारयोग;मभैक्षचर्यां पालनं च प्रजानाम् । विद्याद्राजा सर्वभूतानुकम्पां; देहत्यागं चाहवे धर्ममग्र्यम् ॥
data.md: The king, cherishing mercy for all creatures, should consider these as the highest of his duties, viz., reclaiming the land for cultivation and fertilizing it, celebration of great sacrifices for purifying himself, aversion for begging, and protection of subjects.

data.v: त्यागं श्रेष्ठं मुनयो वै वदन्ति; सर्वश्रेष्ठो यः शरीरं त्यजेत । नित्यं त्यक्तं राजधर्मेषु सर्वं; प्रत्यक्षं ते भूमिपालाः सदैते ॥
बहुश्रुत्या गुरुशुश्रूषया वा; परस्य वा संहननाद्वदन्ति । नित्यं धर्मं क्षत्रियो ब्रह्मचारी; चरेदेको ह्याश्रमं धर्मकामः ॥
सामान्यार्थे व्यवहारे प्रवृत्ते; प्रियाप्रिये वर्जयन्नेव यत्नात् । चातुर्वर्ण्यस्थापनात्पालनाच्च; तैस्तैर्योगैर्नियमैरौरसैश्च ॥
सर्वोद्योगैराश्रमं धर्ममाहुः; क्षात्रं ज्येष्ठं सर्वधर्मोपपन्नम् । स्वं स्वं धर्मं ये न चरन्ति वर्णा;स्तांस्तान्धर्मानयथावद्वदन्ति ॥
निर्मर्यादे नित्यमर्थे विनष्टा;नाहुस्तान्वै पशुभूतान्मनुष्यान् । यथा नीतिं गमयत्यर्थलोभा;च्छ्रेयांस्तस्मादाश्रमः क्षत्रधर्मः ॥
data.md: Those men, who disobey all healthy checks and who are too much attached to the worldly objects, are regarded as brutes. They are constrained to act justly by the exercise of kingly duties. Those duties, therefore, are said to be the highest of all.

data.v: त्रैविद्यानां या गतिर्ब्राह्मणानां; यश्चैवोक्तोऽथाश्रमो ब्राह्मणानाम् । एतत्कर्म ब्राह्मणस्याहुरग्र्य;मन्यत्कुर्वञ्शूद्रवच्छस्त्रवध्यः ॥
data.md: That course of conduct which has been laid down for Brahmanas who follow the three Vedas, and those modes of life that have been laid down for Brahmanas, should, first, of all be observed by every Brahmana. If a Brahmana acts otherwise, he should be punished like a Shudra,

data.v: चातुराश्रम्यधर्माश्च वेदधर्माश्च पार्थिव । ब्राह्मणेनानुगन्तव्या नान्यो विद्यात्कथंचन ॥
data.md: The duties of the four modes of life and the rituals laid down in the Vedas, O king, should always be followed by a Brahmana; he has no other duties.

data.v: अन्यथा वर्तमानस्य न सा वृत्तिः प्रकल्प्यते । कर्मणा व्यज्यते धर्मो यथैव श्वा तथैव सः ॥
data.md: A Kshatriya should never maintain a Brahmana acting otherwise. His religious merit increases for his acts. A Brahmana, indeed, is like Dharma.

data.v: यो विकर्मस्थितो विप्रो न स सन्मानमर्हति । कर्मस्वनुपयुञ्जानमविश्वास्यं हि तं विदुः ॥
data.md: That Brahmana who does works that are not sanctioned for him, deserves no respect. If not engaged in his proper acts, he should not be trusted.

data.v: एते धर्माः सर्ववर्णाश्च वीरै;रुत्क्रष्टव्याः क्षत्रियैरेष धर्मः । तस्माज्ज्येष्ठा राजधर्मा न चान्ये; वीर्यज्येष्ठा वीरधर्मा मता मे ॥
data.md: These are the duties of the various orders. Kshatriyas should look after them so that their observance may be improved. These are the duties of Kshatriyas. For these reasons also, kingly duties and no others, are the highest of all. They are, as I believe, the duties of heroes, and the heroes are foremost in following them.

data.v: यवनाः किराता गान्धाराश्चीनाः शबरबर्बराः । शकास्तुषाराः कह्वाश्च पह्लवाश्चान्ध्रमद्रकाः ॥
ओड्राः पुलिन्दा रमठाः काचा म्लेच्छाश्च सर्वशः । ब्रह्मक्षत्रप्रसूताश्च वैश्याः शूद्राश्च मानवाः ॥
कथं धर्मं चरेयुस्ते सर्वे विषयवासिनः । मद्विधैश्च कथं स्थाप्याः सर्वे ते दस्युजीविनः ॥
एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं भगवंस्तद्ब्रवीहि मे । त्वं बन्धुभूतो ह्यस्माकं क्षत्रियाणां सुरेश्वर ॥
data.md: I wish to hear all this, O illustrious god, instruct me. O chief of all the gods, you are the friend of us Kshatriyas.

data.v: मातापित्रोर्हि कर्तव्या शुश्रूषा सर्वदस्युभिः । आचार्यगुरुशुश्रूषा तथैवाश्रमवासिनाम् ॥
data.md: Indra said All the robber tribes should serve their parents, their preceptors and other elders and hermits living in the forest.

data.v: भूमिपालानां च शुश्रूषा कर्तव्या सर्वदस्युभिः । वेदधर्मक्रियाश्चैव तेषां धर्मो विधीयते ॥
data.md: All the robber tribes should also serve their kings. The duties and rites laid down in the Vedas should also be followed by them.

data.v: पितृयज्ञास्तथा कूपाः प्रपाश्च शयनानि च । दानानि च यथाकालं द्विजेषु दद्युरेव ते ॥
data.md: They should celebrate sacrifices in honour of the departed manes, dig wells, for the public give water to thirsty travellers, distribute beds and other presents amongst Brahmanas.

data.v: अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधो वृत्तिदायानुपालनम् । भरणं पुत्रदाराणां शौचमद्रोह एव च ॥
data.md: Abstention from injury, truth, control of anger, supporting Brahmanas and relatives by giving them their dues, maintenance of wives and children, purity, peacefulness, making presents to Brahmanas at all sorts of sacrifices are duties to be followed by every person of this tribe who seeks his own prosperity. Such a person should also celebrate all kinds of Pakayajnas with rich presents of food and wealth.

data.v: दक्षिणा सर्वयज्ञानां दातव्या भूतिमिच्छता । पाकयज्ञा महार्हाश्च कर्तव्याः सर्वदस्युभिः ॥
data.md: Abstention from injury, truth, control of anger, supporting Brahmanas and relatives by giving them their dues, maintenance of wives and children, purity, peacefulness, making presents to Brahmanas at all sorts of sacrifices are duties to be followed by every person of this tribe who seeks his own prosperity. Such a person should also celebrate all kinds of Pakayajnas with rich presents of food and wealth.

data.v: एतान्येवंप्रकाराणि विहितानि पुरानघ । सर्वलोकस्य कर्माणि कर्तव्यानीह पार्थिव ॥
data.md: These and similar duties, O sinless one, were laid down in days of yore for person of this class. All these acts, which have been laid down for all others, should be done by the robbers also, O king.

data.v: दृश्यन्ते मानवा लोके सर्ववर्णेषु दस्यवः । लिङ्गान्तरे वर्तमाना आश्रमेषु चतुर्ष्वपि ॥
data.md: Mandhatri said In this world, such wicked men may be seen living in disguise among all the four castes and in all the four modes of life.

data.v: विनष्टायां दण्डनीतौ राजधर्मे निराकृते । संप्रमुह्यन्ति भूतानि राजदौरात्म्यतो नृप ॥
data.md: Indra said When the kingly duties are lost as well as the science of punishment, all creatures become exceedingly exercised, O sinless one, for the oppression of kings.

data.v: असंख्याता भविष्यन्ति भिक्षवो लिङ्गिनस्तथा । आश्रमाणां विकल्पाश्च निवृत्तेऽस्मिन्कृते युगे ॥
data.md: After the termination of the Krita age, a confusion will set in regarding the various modes of life, and numberless mendicants will appear with sectarial marks of various sorts.

data.v: अशृण्वानाः पुराणानां धर्माणां प्रवरा गतीः । उत्पथं प्रतिपत्स्यन्ते काममन्युसमीरिताः ॥
data.md: Disregarding the Puranas and the great truths of religion, men, urged by lust and anger, will wend wrong ways.

data.v: यदा निवर्त्यते पापो दण्डनीत्या महात्मभिः । तदा धर्मो न चलते सद्भूतः शाश्वतः परः ॥
data.md: When sinful men are restrained by highsouled persons with the help of the science of punishment, then religion, which reigns supreme over everything and is eternal and which is the source of all good, becomes firmly established.

data.v: परलोकगुरुं चैव राजानं योऽवमन्यते । न तस्य दत्तं न हुतं न श्राद्धं फलति क्वचित् ॥
data.md: The gifts, and libations, and offerings to the departed manes of the man who disregards the king who is superior to every one, become useless.

data.v: मानुषाणामधिपतिं देवभूतं सनातनम् । देवाश्च बहु मन्यन्ते धर्मकामं नरेश्वरम् ॥
data.md: The very gods do not disobey a virtuous king who is truly a personification of god.

data.v: प्रजापतिर्हि भगवान्यः सर्वमसृजज्जगत् । स प्रवृत्तिनिवृत्त्यर्थं धर्माणां क्षत्रमिच्छति ॥
data.md: Having created the universe, the divine Lord of all creatures meant the Kshatriya to rule men making them follow their duties.

data.v: प्रवृत्तस्य हि धर्मस्य बुद्ध्या यः स्मरते गतिम् । स मे मान्यश्च पूज्यश्च तत्र क्षत्रं प्रतिष्ठितम् ॥
data.md: I respect and worship that person who hclped by his understanding, watches the course of the duties performed by men. Upon such supervision depend Kshatriya duties.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा स भगवान्मरुद्गणवृतः प्रभुः । जगाम भवनं विष्णुरक्षरं परमं पदम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma continued 'Having said these words, the divine and powerful Narayana, in the forın of Indra, accompanied by the Maruts, repaired to his eternal abode of endless felicity.

data.v: एवं प्रवर्तिते धर्मे पुरा सुचरितेऽनघ । कः क्षत्रमवमन्येत चेतनावान्बहुश्रुतः ॥
data.md: When, O sinless one, duties were thus followed in days of yore what man of cleansed soul and learning is there that would disregard the Kshatriya?

data.v: अन्यायेन प्रवृत्तानि निवृत्तानि तथैव च । अन्तरा विलयं यान्ति यथा पथि विचक्षुषः ॥
data.md: Like blind men lost on the way creatures, acting unrighteously, meet with ruin.

data.v: आदौ प्रवर्तिते चक्रे तथैवादिपरायणे । वर्तस्व पुरुषव्याघ्र संविजानामि तेऽनघ ॥
data.md: O foremost of men, do you follow those duties which were first promulgated and which the ancients had followed. I know, O sinless one, that you are quite competent to do this.'

data.v: श्रुता मे कथिताः पूर्वैश्चत्वारो मानवाश्रमाः । व्याख्यानमेषामाचक्ष्व पृच्छतो मे पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You have described to me the four modes of life. I desire to know more of them. Do you describe them.'

data.v: विदिताः सर्व एवेह धर्मास्तव युधिष्ठिर । यथा मम महाबाहो विदिताः साधुसंमताः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said 'O Yudhishthira of mighty-arms, all th duties which are practised in this world by the righteous are known to you and me.

data.v: यत्तु लिङ्गान्तरगतं पृच्छसे मां युधिष्ठिर । धर्मं धर्मभृतां श्रेष्ठ तन्निबोध नराधिप ॥
data.md: O foremost of virtuous persons, hear now what you ask viz., the merit that a king acquires when the duties are practised by others leading other modes of life.

data.v: सर्वाण्येतानि कौन्तेय विद्यन्ते मनुजर्षभ । साध्वाचारप्रवृत्तानां चातुराश्रम्यकर्मणाम् ॥
data.md: All the merits, O son of Kunti, which accrue to persons practising the duties of the four modes of life, are partaken of, O foremost of men, by righteous kings.

data.v: अकामद्वेषयुक्तस्य दण्डनीत्या युधिष्ठिर । समेक्षिणश्च भूतेषु भैक्षाश्रमपदं भवेत् ॥
data.md: A king who is not under the influence of lust and hate, who rules with the help of the science of punishment, and who regards all creatures impartially, Yudhishthira, attains to the object of a mendicant's life.

data.v: वेत्त्यादानविसर्गं यो निग्रहानुग्रहौ तथा । यथोक्तवृत्तेर्वीरस्य क्षेमाश्रमपदं भवेत् ॥
data.md: That king, who is possessed of knowledge, who makes gifts to worthy persons on proper occasions, who knows how to favour and punish, who follows the injunctions of the scriptures in all his dealings, and who has tranquility of soul, attains to the object of the Garhasthya mode of life.

data.v: ज्ञातिसंबन्धिमित्राणि व्यापन्नानि युधिष्ठिर । समभ्युद्धरमाणस्य दीक्षाश्रमपदं भवेत् ॥
data.md: That king, O Yudhishthira, who saves from distress, to the best of his ability, the kinsmen and relatives and friends, attains to the object of the Vanaprastha mode of life.

data.v: आह्निकं भूतयज्ञांश्च पितृयज्ञांश्च मानुषान् । कुर्वतः पार्थ विपुलान्वन्याश्रमपदं भवेत् ॥
पालनात्सर्वभूतानां स्वराष्ट्रपरिपालनात् । दीक्षा बहुविधा राज्ञो वन्याश्रमपदं भवेत् ॥
data.md: For the protection of all the creatures as also of the proper protection of his own kingdom, a king acquires the merit of as many sacrifices as the number of creatures protected, and therefore attains to the object of Sannyasa mode of life.

data.v: वेदाध्ययननित्यत्वं क्षमाथाचार्यपूजनम् । तथोपाध्यायशुश्रूषा ब्रह्माश्रमपदं भवेत् ॥
data.md: Study of the Vedas every day, forgiveness, and worship of preceptors and services rendered to one's own teacher, secure the attainment of the object of Brahmacharya.

data.v: अजिह्ममशठं मार्गं सेवमानस्य भारत । सर्वदा सर्वभूतेषु ब्रह्माश्रमपदं भवेत् ॥
data.md: That king, O Bharata, who always treats all creatures with fairness and sincerity, attains to the object of Vanaprastha mode of life.

data.v: वानप्रस्थेषु विप्रेषु त्रैविद्येषु च भारत । प्रयच्छतोऽर्थान्विपुलान्वन्याश्रमपदं भवेत् ॥
data.md: That king, who gives to persons leading a Vanaprastha mode of life and to Brahmanas versed in the three Vedas, attains to the object of the Vanaprastha mode of life.

data.v: सर्वभूतेष्वनुक्रोशं कुर्वतस्तस्य भारत । आनृशंस्यप्रवृत्तस्य सर्वावस्थं पदं भवेत् ॥
data.md: That king, who shows mercy towards all creatures and abstains entirely from cruelty, O Bharata, attains to the object of all the modes of life.

data.v: बालवृद्धेषु कौरव्य सर्वावस्थं युधिष्ठिर । अनुक्रोशं विदधतः सर्वावस्थं पदं भवेत् ॥
data.md: That king, O Yudhishthira, who shows mercy to the young and the old, O son of Kunti, under every circumstance, attains to the objects of all modes of life.

data.v: बलात्कृतेषु भूतेषु परित्राणं कुरूद्वह । शरणागतेषु कौरव्य कुर्वन्गार्हस्थ्यमावसेत् ॥
data.md: That king, O perpetuator of Kuru's race, who relieves the oppressed who seek refuge with him, attains to the object of the Garhasthya mode of life.

data.v: चराचराणां भूतानां रक्षामपि च सर्वशः । यथार्हपूजां च सदा कुर्वन्गार्हस्थ्यमावसेत् ॥
data.md: That king, who protects all creatures mobile and immobile, and honours them duly, attains to the object of the Garhasthya mode of life.

data.v: ज्येष्ठानुज्येष्ठपत्नीनां भ्रातॄणां पुत्रनप्तृणाम् । निग्रहानुग्रहौ पार्थ गार्हस्थ्यमिति तत्तपः ॥
data.md: Granting favours and inflicting punishments upon the wives of brothers elder and younger and upon their sons and grandsons, constitute the domestic duties of a king and these are also his best penances.

data.v: साधूनामर्चनीयानां प्रजासु विदितात्मनाम् । पालनं पुरुषव्याघ्र गृहाश्रमपदं भवेत् ॥
data.md: By honouring those who are pious and worthy of adorations and protecting those who have (by their penances) acquired a knowledge of self, a king, O foremost of men, attains to the object of the Garhasthya mode of life.

data.v: आश्रमस्थानि सर्वाणि यस्तु वेश्मनि भारत । आददीतेह भोज्येन तद्गार्हस्थ्यं युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Inviting to his home, O Bharata, persons who have adopted the Vanaprastha and other modes of life, and feasting them form the domestic duties of a king.

data.v: यः स्थितः पुरुषो धर्मे धात्रा सृष्टे यथार्थवत् । आश्रमाणां स सर्वेषां फलं प्राप्नोत्यनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: That king who duly follows the duties laid down by the Creator, acquires the blessed merits of all the modes of life.

data.v: यस्मिन्न नश्यन्ति गुणाः कौन्तेय पुरुषे सदा । आश्रमस्थं तमप्याहुर्नरश्रेष्ठं युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: That king, O son of Kunti, who has all the virtues, that foremost of men, O Yudhishthira, is said by the learned to be a person who follows the Vanaprastha and all the other modes of life.

data.v: स्थानमानं वयोमानं कुलमानं तथैव च । कुर्वन्वसति सर्वेषु ह्याश्रमेषु युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: That king who duly honours the office or rank worthy of honour, the race or family worthy of honour, and those old men who deserve honour, is said, O Yudhishthira, to live in all the modes of life.

data.v: देशधर्मांश्च कौन्तेय कुलधर्मांस्तथैव च । पालयन्पुरुषव्याघ्र राजा सर्वाश्रमी भवेत् ॥
data.md: A king, O son of Kunti, by following the duties of his country and those of his family, acquires, O foremost of men the merits of all the modes of life.

data.v: काले विभूतिं भूतानामुपहारांस्तथैव च । अर्हयन्पुरुषव्याघ्र साधूनामाश्रमे वसेत् ॥
data.md: That king, who at proper seasons gives to pious men riches and precious gifts, earns the merits, O king, of all the modes of life.

data.v: दशधर्मगतश्चापि यो धर्मं प्रत्यवेक्षते । सर्वलोकस्य कौन्तेय राजा भवति सोऽऽश्रमी ॥
data.md: That king, O son of Kunti, who even when beset with danger and fear still keeps his eye on the duties of all men, earns the merits of all the modes of life.

data.v: ये धर्मकुशला लोके धर्मं कुर्वन्ति साधवः । पालिता यस्य विषये पादोंऽशस्तस्य भूपतेः ॥
data.md: The king partakes of the merits acquired under his protection by righteous people of his territories.

data.v: धर्मारामान्धर्मपरान्ये न रक्षन्ति मानवान् । पार्थिवाः पुरुषव्याघ्र तेषां पापं हरन्ति ते ॥
data.md: On the other hand, if kings, O foremost of men, do not protect the righteous people within their territories they then visited by the sins of the latter.

data.v: ये च रक्षासहायाः स्युः पार्थिवानां युधिष्ठिर । ते चैवांशहराः सर्वे धर्मे परकृतेऽनघ ॥
data.md: Those men also, O Yudhishthira, who assist kings (in protecting their subjects), are equally entitled, O sinless one, to a share of the merits acquired by others.

data.v: सर्वाश्रमपदे ह्याहुर्गार्हस्थ्यं दीप्तनिर्णयम् । पावनं पुरुषव्याघ्र यं वयं पर्युपास्महे ॥
data.md: The learned declare that the Garhasthya, which we follow, is superior to all the other modes of life. The conclusions regarding it are very clear. It is certainly sacred, O foremost of men.

data.v: आत्मोपमस्तु भूतेषु यो वै भवति मानवः । न्यस्तदण्डो जितक्रोधः स प्रेत्य लभते सुखम् ॥
data.md: That man, who regards all creatures as his own self, who never does any harm and has his anger under control, enjoys great happiness both here and here after.

data.v: धर्मोत्थिता सत्त्ववीर्या धर्मसेतुवटाकरा । त्यागवाताध्वगा शीघ्रा नौस्त्वा संतारयिष्यति ॥
data.md: A king can easily cross the ocean of the world having kingly duties as his fleet boat urged on by the breeze of gifts,, having the scriptures for its tackle and intelligence for the strength of its helmsman, and kept afloat by the power of virtue.

data.v: यदा निवृत्तः सर्वस्मात्कामो योऽस्य हृदि स्थितः । तदा भवति सत्त्वस्थस्ततो ब्रह्म समश्नुते ॥
data.md: When all attachment for every earthly object, is withdrawn from his heart he is then regarded as one leaving in his understanding alone. In this state he soon attains to Brahma.

data.v: सुप्रसन्नस्तु भावेन योगेन च नराधिप । धर्मं पुरुषशार्दूल प्राप्स्यसे पालने रतः ॥
data.md: Becoming cheerful by meditation and by controlling desire and other passions of the heart, O foremost of men, a king, engaged in discharging the duty of protection, succeeds in acquiring great merit.

data.v: वेदाध्ययनशीलानां विप्राणां साधुकर्मणाम् । पालने यत्नमातिष्ठ सर्वलोकस्य चानघ ॥
data.md: Do you, therefore, O Yudhishthira, try your best to protect Brahmanas of pious deeds and devoted to the study of the Vedas, as also all other men.

data.v: वने चरति यो धर्ममाश्रमेषु च भारत । रक्षया तच्छतगुणं धर्मं प्राप्नोति पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: By following the duty of protection only, o Bharata, the king acquires merit that is a hundred times greater than what is earned by hermits in their asylums in the forest.

data.v: एष ते विविधो धर्मः पाण्डवश्रेष्ठ कीर्तितः । अनुतिष्ठ त्वमेनं वै पूर्वैर्दृष्टं सनातनम् ॥
data.md: I have now described, O eldest son of Pandu, the various duties of men. Do you follow kingly duties which are eternal and that have been practised by great men since days of yore.

data.v: चातुराश्रम्यमेकाग्रः चातुर्वर्ण्यं च पाण्डव । धर्मं पुरुषशार्दूल प्राप्स्यसे पालने रतः ॥
data.md: If you devote yourself head and soul to the duty of protecting (your subjects), O foremost of men, you may then, O son of Pandu, acquire the merits of all the four modes of life and of all the four orders of men.

data.v: चातुराश्रम्य उक्तोऽत्र चातुर्वर्ण्यस्तथैव च । राष्ट्रस्य यत्कृत्यतमं तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You have described what the duties are of the four modes of life and of the four orders. Tell me now, O grandfather, what are the principal duties of a kingdom.'

data.v: राष्ट्रस्यैतत्कृत्यतमं राज्ञ एवाभिषेचनम् । अनिन्द्रमबलं राष्ट्रं दस्यवोऽभिभवन्ति च ॥
data.md: The (election and) coronation of a king is the first duty of kingdom. A kingdom in which anarchy reigns becomes weak and is soon attacked by robbers.

data.v: अराजकेषु राष्ट्रेषु धर्मो न व्यवतिष्ठते । परस्परं च खादन्ति सर्वथा धिगराजकम् ॥
data.md: In kingdoms torn by anarchy, righteousness cannot live. The denizens devour one another. An anarchy is the worst of all conditions.

data.v: इन्द्रमेनं प्रवृणुते यद्राजानमिति श्रुतिः । यथैवेन्द्रस्तथा राजा संपूज्यो भूतिमिच्छता ॥
data.md: The Shrutis say that in crowning a king, it is Indra that is crowned in the person of the king. A person, who seeks his own prosperity, should adore the king as he should adore Indra himself.

data.v: नाराजकेषु राष्ट्रेषु वस्तव्यमिति वैदिकम् । नाराजकेषु राष्ट्रेषु हव्यमग्निर्वहत्यपि ॥
data.md: No one should live in kingdoms torn by anarchy. Agni does not carry the libations that are poured upon him in kingdoms where anarchy reigns.

data.v: अथ चेदभिवर्तेत राज्यार्थी बलवत्तरः । अराजकानि राष्ट्राणि हतराजानि वा पुनः ॥
प्रत्युद्गम्याभिपूज्यः स्यादेतदत्र सुमन्त्रितम् । न हि पापात्पापतरमस्ति किंचिदराजकात् ॥
data.md: If a powerful king approaches kingdoms weakened by anarchy, with a view to annex them to his dominions, the people should go forward and receive the invader with honour. Such conduct would be quite of a piece with wise counsels. There is no evil greater than anarchy.

data.v: स चेत्समनुपश्येत समग्रं कुशलं भवेत् । बलवान्हि प्रकुपितः कुर्यान्निःशेषतामपि ॥
data.md: If the powerful invader be a little just, everything will be right. If however, he be exercised with may exterminate all.

data.v: भूयांसं लभते क्लेशं या गौर्भवति दुर्दुहा । सुदुहा या तु भवति नैव तां क्लेशयन्त्युत ॥
data.md: That cow which cannot be easily milked suffer much pain. On the other hand, that cow which is easily milked, has not to suffer any pain whatever.

data.v: यदतप्तं प्रणमति न तत्संतापयन्त्युत । यच्च स्वयं नतं दारु न तत्संनामयन्त्यपि ॥
data.md: The wood that bends easily need not be heated. The tree that bends easily, is not required to suffer any torture. anger he

data.v: एतयोपमया धीरः संनमेत बलीयसे । इन्द्राय स प्रणमते नमते यो बलीयसे ॥
data.md: Guided by these examples, O hero, men should bend before those that are powerful. The man who bends his head to a powerful person really bends his head to Indra.

data.v: तस्माद्राजैव कर्तव्यः सततं भूतिमिच्छता । न धनार्थो न दारार्थस्तेषां येषामराजकम् ॥
data.md: For these reasons, men, seeking prosperity, should (elect and) crown some person as their king. They who live in countries where anarchy reigns cannot enjoy there wealth and wives.

data.v: प्रीयते हि हरन्पापः परवित्तमराजके । यदास्य उद्धरन्त्यन्ये तदा राजानमिच्छति ॥
data.md: During times of anarchy, the sinful man enjoys by robbing the wealth of other people. When however, his ill acquired riches are taken away by others, he wishes for a king.

data.v: पापा अपि तदा क्षेमं न लभन्ते कदाचन । एकस्य हि द्वौ हरतो द्वयोश्च बहवोऽपरे ॥
data.md: It is clear therefore, that in times of anarchy the very wicked even cannot be happy. The wealth of one is taken away by two. That of those two is taken away by many acting in concert.

data.v: अदासः क्रियते दासो ह्रियन्ते च बलात्स्त्रियः । एतस्मात्कारणाद्देवाः प्रजापालान्प्रचक्रिरे ॥
data.md: He who is not a slave is made a slave. Women, again, are forcibly carried away. For these reasons the gods created kings for protecting the people.

data.v: राजा चेन्न भवेल्लोके पृथिव्यां दण्डधारकः । शूले मत्स्यानिवापक्ष्यन्दुर्बलान्बलवत्तराः ॥
data.md: If there were no king on Earth for holding the rod of punishment, the strong would then have oppressed the weak after the manner of fishes in the water.

data.v: अराजकाः प्रजाः पूर्वं विनेशुरिति नः श्रुतम् । परस्परं भक्षयन्तो मत्स्या इव जले कृशान् ॥
ताः समेत्य ततश्चक्रुः समयानिति नः श्रुतम् । वाक्क्रूरो दण्डपुरुषो यश्च स्यात्पारदारिकः । यश्च न स्वमथादद्यात्त्याज्या नस्तादृशा इति ॥
विश्वासनार्थं वर्णानां सर्वेषामविशेषतः । तास्तथा समयं कृत्वा समये नावतस्थिरे ॥
data.md: For inspiring confidence among all classes of the people, they made such an agreement and lived for some time.

data.v: सहितास्तास्तदा जग्मुरसुखार्ताः पितामहम् । अनीश्वरा विनश्यामो भगवन्नीश्वरं दिश ॥
data.md: Assembling after some time they proceeded in great miseries to the Grandfather, saying, Without a king, O divine lord, we are meeting with ruin. Appoint some one as our king.

data.v: यं पूजयेम संभूय यश्च नः परिपालयेत् । ताभ्यो मनुं व्यादिदेश मनुर्नाभिननन्द ताः ॥
data.md: All of us shall adore him and he shall protect us. Thus prayed for the Grandfather asked Manu. Manu, however, did not agree to the proposal.

data.v: बिभेमि कर्मणः क्रूराद्राज्यं हि भृशदुष्करम् । विशेषतो मनुष्येषु मिथ्यावृत्तिषु नित्यदा ॥
data.md: Manu said 'I fear all sinful deeds. To govern a kingdom is highly difficult, especially among men who are always false and deceitful in their conduct.'

data.v: तमब्रुवन्प्रजा मा भैः कर्मणैनो गमिष्यति । पशूनामधिपञ्चाशद्धिरण्यस्य तथैव च । धान्यस्य दशमं भागं दास्यामः कोशवर्धनम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The denizens of the Earth then said to him.-Do not fear. The sins that men commit will affect those only that commit them. For the increase of your wealth, we will give you a fiftieth part of our animals and precious metals and a tenth part of our gain. When our maidens also will become desirous of marrying we shall, when the question of marriage comes up, give you the most beautiful ones among them.

data.v: मुख्येन शस्त्रपत्रेण ये मनुष्याः प्रधानतः । भवन्तं तेऽनुयास्यन्ति महेन्द्रमिव देवताः ॥
data.md: Those amongst men who will become the foremost of all in the use of weapons and in riding animals, and other conveyances, shall go behind you like the deities behind Indra.

data.md: Strengthened by that merit so easily acquired by you do you protect us, o king, like Indra of a hundred sacrifices protecting the gods.

data.md: Like the Sun burning down everything with his rays, do you set out acquiring victories. Crush the pride of enemies and let righteousness always be victorious (in the world).

data.md: Brihaspati said The duties of all men, you of great wisdom, originate from the king. It is through fear of the king only that men do not devour one another.

data.md: The bulls would not know cows and milk jars would not be churned, and men living by rearing kine would be ruined, if the king did not exercise the duty of protection.

data.md: In the absence of king's protection, all things, filled with fear and anxiety and becoming senseless and uttering cries of misery would be ruined in no time.

data.md: If the king observes the duty of protection, women adorned with ornaments may fearlessly walk about everywhere without male relatives to guard them.

data.md: Men become righteous and without injuring serve one another because the king observes the duty of protection.

data.md: By virtue of royal protection the members of the three castes can celebrate high sacrifices and engage themselves in the acquisition of learning with attention.

data.md: The world depends upon agriculture and trade and is protected by the Vedas. All these again are duly protected by the king exercising his principal duty.

data.md: Since the king, taking a heavy burden upon himself, protects his subjects with the help of a mighty force, it is therefore that the people are able to live in happiness.

data.md: When he suppresses the the wicked by punishing them severely and favours the righteous by giving them rewards, he is then said to put on the form of Yama.

data.md: He should especially keep ready various drugs, roots and fruits, the four kinds of physicians, actors and dancers, athletes, and persons capable of assuming various disguises. He should adorn his capital and please all his subjects.

data.md: A king should take care of seven things. Listen to me as I name them. They are his own self, his ministers, his treasury, his servants for inflicting punishments, his friends, his provinces, and his capital. He should carefully protect his kingdom consisting of these seven limbs.

data.md: A king should take care of seven things. Listen to me as I name them. They are his own self, his ministers, his treasury, his servants for inflicting punishments, his friends, his provinces, and his capital. He should carefully protect his kingdom consisting of these seven limbs.

data.v: षाड्गुण्यं च त्रिवर्गं च त्रिवर्गमपरं तथा । यो वेत्ति पुरुषव्याघ्र स भुनक्ति महीमिमाम् ॥
data.md: That king, O foremost of man, who is conversant with the collection of six and three objects, and the high collection of three, gains the sovereignty of the whole Earth.

data.md: Hear, O Yudhishthira, what is called the aggregate of six. data.v: विगृह्यासनमित्येव यात्रां संपरिगृह्य च । द्वैधीभावस्तथान्येषां संश्रयोऽथ परस्य च ॥
data.md: Hear, O Yudhishthira, what is called the aggregate of six. data.md: Of what use are penances to that king, and what need has he of sacrifices who protects his people properly? Such a king should be known as one conversant with every virtue.

data.v: दण्डनीतिश्च राजा च समस्तौ तावुभावपि । कस्य किं कुर्वतः सिद्ध्यै तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥

data.md: Bhishma said Listen to me, O king, as I describe, O Bharata, the great virtues of the science of punishment in weighty and sacred words.

data.v: दण्डनीतिः स्वधर्मेभ्यश्चातुर्वर्ण्यं नियच्छति । प्रयुक्ता स्वामिना सम्यगधर्मेभ्यश्च यच्छति ॥
data.md: The science of punishment compels all men to satisfy the duties of their respective orders. Properly administered, it compels people to perform virtuous acts.

data.v: चातुर्वर्ण्ये स्वधर्मस्थे मर्यादानामसंकरे । दण्डनीतिकृते क्षेमे प्रजानामकुतोभये ॥
data.md: When the four orders perform their respective duties, when all healthy restrictions are kept up, when peace and happiness emanate from the science of punishment when the people are shorn of all fear, and the three higher orders try according to their respective duties, to preserve harmony people become truly happy at such times.

data.md: When the four orders perform their respective duties, when all healthy restrictions are kept up, when peace and happiness emanate from the science of punishment when the people are shorn of all fear, and the three higher orders try according to their respective duties, to preserve harmony people become truly happy at such times.

data.v: कालो वा कारणं राज्ञो राजा वा कालकारणम् । इति ते संशयो मा भूद्राजा कालस्य कारणम् ॥
data.md: You should not doubt whether it is the king that makes the age, or, it is the age that makes the king; the truth is that the king makes the age.

data.v: दण्डनीत्या यदा राजा सम्यक्कार्त्स्न्येन वर्तते । तदा कृतयुगं नाम कालः श्रेष्ठः प्रवर्तते ॥

data.md: All the seasons are delightful and free from evil. The voice pronunciation, and minds of all men became clear and delightful.

data.v: व्याधयो न भवन्त्यत्र नाल्पायुर्दृश्यते नरः । विधवा न भवन्त्यत्र नृशंसो नाभिजायते ॥
data.md: Ailments disappear and all men enjoy long lives. Wives do not become widows, and no person becomes a miser.

data.v: अकृष्टपच्या पृथिवी भवन्त्योषधयस्तथा । त्वक्पत्रफलमूलानि वीर्यवन्ति भवन्ति च ॥

data.v: नाधर्मो विद्यते तत्र धर्म एव तु केवलः । इति कार्तयुगानेतान्गुणान्विद्धि युधिष्ठिर ॥

data.v: दण्डनीत्या यदा राजा त्रीनंशाननुवर्तते । चतुर्थमंशमुत्सृज्य तदा त्रेता प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: When the king depends upon only three of the four parts of the science of punishment leaving out a fourth, the age called Treta sets in.

data.v: अशुभस्य चतुर्थांशस्त्रीनंशाननुवर्तते । कृष्टपच्यैव पृथिवी भवन्त्योषधयस्तथा ॥
data.md: A fourth part of unrighteousness sets in by the observance of the great science by threefourths. The Earth gives crops but waits for cultivation; the herbs and plants grow by cultivation.

data.v: अर्धं त्यक्त्वा यदा राजा नीत्यर्धमनुवर्तते । ततस्तु द्वापरं नाम स कालः संप्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: When the king follows the great science by only a half, leaving out the other half, then the age that sets in is called Dvapara.

data.v: अशुभस्य तदा अर्धं द्वावंशावनुवर्तते । कृष्टपच्यैव पृथिवी भवत्यल्पफला तथा ॥
data.md: A fourth part of unrighteousness sets in by the observance of the great science by threefourths. The Earth gives crops but waits for cultivation; the herbs and plants grow by cultivation.

data.md: Righteousness prevails in the Krita age. Nothing unrighteous exists then; the four orders are not inclined to take any pleasure in unrighteousness.

data.v: वैदिकानि च कर्माणि भवन्ति विगुणान्युत । ऋतवो नसुखाः सर्वे भवन्त्यामयिनस्तथा ॥

data.v: ह्रसन्ति च मनुष्याणां स्वरवर्णमनांस्युत । व्याधयश्च भवन्त्यत्र म्रियन्ते चागतायुषः ॥
data.md: The voice, pronunciation, and minds of men lose power. Diseases appear, and men die untimely.

data.v: विधवाश्च भवन्त्यत्र नृशंसा जायते प्रजा । क्वचिद्वर्षति पर्जन्यः क्वचित्सस्यं प्ररोहति ॥

data.v: रसाः सर्वे क्षयं यान्ति यदा नेच्छति भूमिपः । प्रजाः संरक्षितुं सम्यग्दण्डनीतिसमाहितः ॥
data.md: All kinds of moisture also fail, when the king does not, by duly following the great science, protect the subjects.

data.v: राजा कृतयुगस्रष्टा त्रेताया द्वापरस्य च । युगस्य च चतुर्थस्य राजा भवति कारणम् ॥
data.md: The king is the creator of the Krita age, of the Treta, and of the Dvapara. The king is the creator of the fourth age (called Kali).

data.v: कृतस्य करणाद्राजा स्वर्गमत्यन्तमश्नुते । त्रेतायाः करणाद्राजा स्वर्गं नात्यन्तमश्नुते ॥
data.md: If he creates the Krita age, he acquires eternal heaven. If he creates the Treta age, he acquires heaven for a limited period.

data.v: प्रवर्तनाद्द्वापरस्य यथाभागमुपाश्नुते । कलेः प्रवर्तनाद्राजा पापमत्यन्तमश्नुते ॥
data.md: If he creates the Dvapara, he attains to blessedness in heaven in proportion to his merits. By creating the Kali age, the king incurs a heavy sin.

data.v: ततो वसति दुष्कर्मा नरके शाश्वतीः समाः । प्रजानां कल्मषे मग्नोऽकीर्तिं पापं च विन्दति ॥
data.md: Sullied by wickedness, he suffers in hell for numberless years, for being drowned in the sins of his subjects, he incurs great sin and infamy himself.

data.v: दण्डनीतिं पुरस्कृत्य विजानन्क्षत्रियः सदा । अनवाप्तं च लिप्सेत लब्धं च परिपालयेत् ॥
data.md: Following the great science the learned Kshatriya should try to acquire those objects which he seeks and protect those which he has already acquired.

data.v: लोकस्य सीमन्तकरी मर्यादा लोकभावनी । सम्यङ्नीता दण्डनीतिर्यथा माता यथा पिता ॥
data.md: The science of punishment, which establishes all men in the observance of their respective duties, which is the basis of all healthy distinctions, and which truly keeps up the world and sets it agoing if properly administered, protects all men like parents protecting their children.

data.v: यस्यां भवन्ति भूतानि तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ । एष एव परो धर्मो यद्राजा दण्डनीतिमान् ॥
data.md: Know, O foremost of men, that the very lives of creatures depend upon it. The greatest merit of a king consists in his acquaintance with the science of punishment and administering it properly.

data.v: तस्मात्कौरव्य धर्मेण प्रजाः पालय नीतिमान् । एवंवृत्तः प्रजा रक्षन्स्वर्गं जेतासि दुर्जयम् ॥
data.md: Therefore, O you of Kuru's race, protect your subjects righteously, with the help of that great science. By protecting your subjects and adopting such a conduct, you will, forsooth, attain to such blessedness in heaven which cannot be easily acquired.

data.v: केन वृत्तेन वृत्तज्ञ वर्तमानो महीपतिः । सुखेनार्थान्सुखोदर्कानिह च प्रेत्य चाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said By following what conduct, O you who are a master of every kind of behaviour, can a king succeed in easily acquiring, both in this world and in the next, objects which yield happiness in the end?

data.v: इयं गुणानां षट्त्रिंशत्षट्त्रिंशद्गुणसंयुता । यान्गुणांस्तु गुणोपेतः कुर्वन्गुणमवाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said There are thirty-six virtues which a king should practise. There are another thirty-six related with these.. A virtuous person, by following these virtues, can certainly acquire great merit.

data.v: चरेद्धर्मानकटुको मुञ्चेत्स्नेहं न नास्तिकः । अनृशंसश्चरेदर्थं चरेत्काममनुद्धतः ॥
data.md: The king should follow his duties without any malice. He should not cast off mercy. He should have faith. He should earn wealth without persecution and cruelty. He should seek pleasure without attachment.

data.v: प्रियं ब्रूयादकृपणः शूरः स्यादविकत्थनः । दाता नापात्रवर्षी स्यात्प्रगल्भः स्यादनिष्ठुरः ॥
data.md: He should cheerfully speak out what is pleasant, and be brave without brag. He should be liberal, but should not make gifts to unworthy persons. He should exercise power without cruelty.

data.v: संदधीत न चानार्यैर्विगृह्णीयान्न बन्धुभिः । नानाप्तैः कारयेच्चारं कुर्यात्कार्यमपीडया ॥
data.md: He should make alliances, but not with the wicked. He should not act inimically towards his friends. He should never employ persons who are not devoted to him as his spies and secret emissaries. He should never accomplish his works by oppression.

data.v: अर्थान्ब्रूयान्न चासत्सु गुणान्ब्रूयान्न चात्मनः । आदद्यान्न च साधुभ्यो नासत्पुरुषमाश्रयेत् ॥
data.md: He should never give out his purposes before the wicked persons. He should speak of the merits of others but never his own. He should take money from his subjects but never from those who are good. He should never take the assistance of wicked persons.

data.v: नापरीक्ष्य नयेद्दण्डं न च मन्त्रं प्रकाशयेत् । विसृजेन्न च लुब्धेभ्यो विश्वसेन्नापकारिषु ॥
data.md: He should never inflict punishment without making careful enquiry. He should never give out his counsels. He should distribute money, but not amongst covetous persons. He should place confidence in others, but never in those who have injured him.

data.v: अनीर्षुर्गुप्तदारः स्याच्चोक्षः स्यादघृणी नृपः । स्त्रियं सेवेत नात्यर्थं मृष्टं भुञ्जीत नाहितम् ॥
data.md: He should not entertain malice. He should protect his married wives. He should be pure and should not always be exercised by compassion. He should not seek too much female companionship. He should take wholesome food and never that which is bad.

data.v: अस्तब्धः पूजयेन्मान्यान्गुरून्सेवेदमायया । अर्चेद्देवान्न दम्भेन श्रियमिच्छेदकुत्सिताम् ॥
data.md: He should without pride pay respect to worthy persons, and serve his preceptors and seniors with sincerity. He should seek prosperity, but never do anything that brings calumny.

data.v: सेवेत प्रणयं हित्वा दक्षः स्यान्न त्वकालवित् । सान्त्वयेन्न च भोगार्थमनुगृह्णन्न चाक्षिपेत् ॥
data.md: He should serve his elders with humility. He should be clever in business but should always wait for the opportune moment. He should solace men and never send them away with empty words. Having favoured a person, he should not case him off.

data.v: प्रहरेन्न त्वविज्ञाय हत्वा शत्रून्न शेषयेत् । क्रोधं कुर्यान्न चाकस्मान्मृदुः स्यान्नापकारिषु ॥
data.md: He should never strike in ignorance. Having killed his enemy he should never be sorry. He should display anger, but should never do so when there is no occasion. He should be mild, but never to the offenders.

data.v: एवं चरस्व राज्यस्थो यदि श्रेय इहेच्छसि । अतोऽन्यथा नरपतिर्भयमृच्छत्यनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Behave thus while ruling your kingdom if you wish to enjoy prosperity. The king that behaves otherwise is visited by great calamities.

data.v: इति सर्वान्गुणानेतान्यथोक्तान्योऽनुवर्तते । अनुभूयेह भद्राणि प्रेत्य स्वर्गे महीयते ॥
data.md: That king, who observes all these virtues that I have mentioned, enjoys many blessings of Earth and great rewards in heaven.'

data.v: इदं वचः शांतनवस्य शुश्रुवा;न्युधिष्ठिरः पाण्डवमुख्यसंवृतः । तदा ववन्दे च पितामहं नृपो; यथोक्तमेतच्च चकार बुद्धिमान् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Hearing these words of Shantanu's son, king Yudhishthira, always obedient in receiving instructions, endued with great intelligence, and protected by Bhima and others, then adored his grandfather and from that time began to rule according to his dictates.

data.v: कथं राजा प्रजा रक्षन्नाधिबन्धेन युज्यते । धर्मे च नापराध्नोति तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Tell me, O grandfather, how should the king protect his subjects so as to be able to avoid grief and so as not to militate against fairness?

data.v: समासेनैव ते तात धर्मान्वक्ष्यामि निश्चितान् । विस्तरेण हि धर्माणां न जात्वन्तमवाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said-'I shall recite in brief, O king, those eternal duties, for, if I were to mentioned them fully, I would never finish them.

data.v: धर्मनिष्ठाञ्श्रुतवतो वेदव्रतसमाहितान् । अर्चितान्वासयेथास्त्वं गृहे गुणवतो द्विजान् ॥
data.md: You should always worship those Brahmanas who are ardent in the performance of their duties, are learned, regular in adoring the gods, observant of high vows, and gifted with other accomplishments, when they come to your mansion, engage them in officiating in your sacrifices.

data.v: प्रत्युत्थायोपसंगृह्य चरणावभिवाद्य च । अथ सर्वाणि कुर्वीथाः कार्याणि सपुरोहितः ॥
data.md: With your priest accompanying you, you should rise up when they approach you, and touch and adore their feet, and do every other necessary act.

data.v: धर्मकार्याणि निर्वर्त्य मङ्गलानि प्रयुज्य च । ब्राह्मणान्वाचयेथास्त्वमर्थसिद्धिजयाशिषः ॥
data.md: Doing these acts of piety and performing other acts that are for your own well-being, you should (by presents) make those Brahmanas utter benedictions on you for the success of your object.

data.v: आर्जवेन च संपन्नो धृत्या बुद्ध्या च भारत । अर्थार्थं परिगृह्णीयात्कामक्रोधौ च वर्जयेत् ॥
data.md: Gifted with sincerity, wisdom and intelligence, O Bharata, you should follow truth and avoid lust and anger.

data.v: कामक्रोधौ पुरस्कृत्य योऽर्थं राजानुतिष्ठति । न स धर्मं न चाप्यर्थं परिगृह्णाति बालिशः ॥
data.md: That foolish king, who pursues Profit without being shorn of lust and anger, fails to win virtue and ultimately losses Profit as well.

data.v: मा स्म लुब्धांश्च मूर्खांश्च कामे चार्थेषु यूयुजः । अलुब्धान्बुद्धिसंपन्नान्सर्वकर्मसु योजयेत् ॥
data.md: Never appoint persons covetous and foolish in matters of Pleasure and profit. You should always appointmen who are free from covetousness and intelligent.

data.v: मूर्खो ह्यधिकृतोऽर्थेषु कार्याणामविशारदः । प्रजाः क्लिश्नात्ययोगेन कामद्वेषसमन्वितः ॥
data.md: Possessed of lust and anger and raw in the transaction of business, foolish persons, if vested with power in matters of Profit, always oppress the people by various mischievous means,

data.v: बलिषष्ठेन शुल्केन दण्डेनाथापराधिनाम् । शास्त्रनीतेन लिप्सेथा वेतनेन धनागमम् ॥
data.md: With a sixth part, making a fair calculation of the produce of the soil, as his tribute, with fines and forfeitures collected from offenders, with the other taxes, according to the scriptures, upon merchants and traders in exchange for the safety granted to them, a king should fill his treasury.

data.v: दापयित्वा करं धर्म्यं राष्ट्रं नित्यं यथाविधि । अशेषान्कल्पयेद्राजा योगक्षेमानतन्द्रितः ॥
data.md: Realising these just taxes and governing the kingdom properly, the king should carefully act in such a way that his subjects may not suffer from want.

data.v: गोपायितारं दातारं धर्मनित्यमतन्द्रितम् । अकामद्वेषसंयुक्तमनुरज्यन्ति मानवाः ॥
data.md: Men become deeply attached to that king who satisfies the duty of protection properly, who is liberal, who is steady in the observance of righteousness, who is vigilant, and who is shorn of lust and hate.

data.v: मा स्माधर्मेण लाभेन लिप्सेथास्त्वं धनागमम् । धर्मार्थावध्रुवौ तस्य योऽपशास्त्रपरो भवेत् ॥
data.md: Never desire to fill your treasury by acting unfairly or from covetousness. That king who does not follow the scriptures fails to acquire riches and religious merit.

data.v: अपशास्त्रपरो राजा संचयान्नाधिगच्छति । अस्थाने चास्य तद्वित्तं सर्वमेव विनश्यति ॥
data.md: That king, who is negligent about the means of acquiring riches, never succeeds in acquiring both religious merit and wealth. The wealth again that he acquires (by such means) is spent lavishly on unworthy objects.

data.v: अर्थमूलोऽपहिंसां च कुरुते स्वयमात्मनः । करैरशास्त्रदृष्टैर्हि मोहात्संपीडयन्प्रजाः ॥
data.md: That avaricious king, who foolishly oppresses his subjects by levying taxes not sanctioned by scriptures, is said to wrong his own self.

data.v: ऊधश्छिन्द्याद्धि यो धेन्वाः क्षीरार्थी न लभेत्पयः । एवं राष्ट्रमयोगेन पीडितं न विवर्धते ॥
data.md: As a person wanting milk never gets any by cutting off the udders of a cow, similarly a kingdom, assailed by improper taxes, never gives any profit to the king.

data.v: यो हि दोग्ध्रीमुपास्ते तु स नित्यं लभते पयः । एवं राष्ट्रमुपायेन भुञ्जानो लभते फलम् ॥
data.md: He, who treats a milch cow with kindness, always obtains milk from it. Likewise the king, who rules his kingdom by proper means, gets much fruits from it.

data.v: अथ राष्ट्रमुपायेन भुज्यमानं सुरक्षितम् । जनयत्यतुलां नित्यं कोशवृद्धिं युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: By protecting a kingdom properly and ruling it judiciously a king, O Yudhishthira, may succeed in always acquiring immense wealth.

data.v: दोग्धि धान्यं हिरण्यं च प्रजा राज्ञि सुरक्षिता । नित्यं स्वेभ्यः परेभ्यश्च तृप्ता माता यथा पयः ॥
data.md: The Earth, well protected by the king, yields crops and gold like a mother giving milk willingly to her child.

data.v: मालाकारोपमो राजन्भव माङ्गारिकोपमः । तथा युक्तश्चिरं राष्ट्रं भोक्तुं शक्यसि पालयन् ॥
data.md: Follow the example, O king, of the flower vendor and not of the charcoalmaker. Acting thus and satisfying the duty of protection you may be able to enjoy the Earth for ever.

data.v: परचक्राभियानेन यदि ते स्याद्धनक्षयः । अथ साम्नैव लिप्सेथा धनमब्राह्मणेषु यत् ॥
data.md: If in attacking an enemy's kingdom your treasury is exhausted, you may replenish it by taking wealth from all except Brahmanas.

data.v: मा स्म ते ब्राह्मणं दृष्ट्वा धनस्थं प्रचलेन्मनः । अन्त्यायामप्यवस्थायां किमु स्फीतस्य भारत ॥
data.md: Your heart should not be agitated even when you are in great distress, upon seeing Brahmanas having wealth. I need not mention then of what you should do when you are well off.

data.v: धनानि तेभ्यो दद्यास्त्वं यथाशक्ति यथार्हतः । सान्त्वयन्परिरक्षंश्च स्वर्गमाप्स्यसि दुर्जयम् ॥
data.md: You should give them wealth to the best of your power and according to their worthiness, and protect them, comforting them at all times. By acting thus you may acquire regions which are acquired with difficulty.

data.v: एवं धर्मेण वृत्तेन प्रजास्त्वं परिपालयन् । स्वन्तं पुण्यं यशोवन्तं प्राप्स्यसे कुरुनन्दन ॥
data.md: Behaving thus virtuously you should protect your subjects. You may then acquire, O delighter of the Kurus, fame that is eternal, high, and pure.

data.v: धर्मेण व्यवहारेण प्रजाः पालय पाण्डव । युधिष्ठिर तथा युक्तो नाधिबन्धेन योक्ष्यसे ॥
data.md: Protect your subjects piously, O son of Pandu, for you will then suffer no regret or pain.

data.v: एष एव परो धर्मो यद्राजा रक्षते प्रजाः । भूतानां हि यथा धर्मे रक्षणं च परा दया ॥
data.md: Protection of the subject is the greatest duty of the king, since mercy for all creatures and protecting them from injury has been said to be the highest merit.

data.v: तस्मादेवं परं धर्मं मन्यन्ते धर्मकोविदाः । यद्राजा रक्षणे युक्तो भूतेषु कुरुते दयाम् ॥
data.md: Persons, conversant with duties, consider that to be the greatest merit of the king, when, engaged in protecting all creatures, he shows mercy towards them.

data.v: यदह्ना कुरुते पापमरक्षन्भयतः प्रजाः । राजा वर्षसहस्रेण तस्यान्तमधिगच्छति ॥
data.md: The sin, a king incurs by neglecting for a single day to protect his subjects from fear, is such that his sufferings are not terminated in hell till after a thousand years.

data.v: यदह्ना कुरुते पुण्यं प्रजा धर्मेण पालयन् । दश वर्षसहस्राणि तस्य भुङ्क्ते फलं दिवि ॥
data.md: The merit, of a king by protecting his subjects righteously for a single day, is such that he enjoys its reward in heaven for ten thousand years.

data.v: स्विष्टिः स्वधीतिः सुतपा लोकाञ्जयति यावतः । क्षणेन तानवाप्नोति प्रजा धर्मेण पालयन् ॥
data.md: A king, by only protecting his subjects virtuously, soon gains those regions that are acquired by persons leading duly the Garhasthya, the Brahmacharya, and the Vanaprastha modes of life.

data.v: एवं धर्मं प्रयत्नेन कौन्तेय परिपालयन् । इह पुण्यफलं लब्ध्वा नाधिबन्धेन योक्ष्यसे ॥
data.md: Do you, O son of Kunti, follow with great care this duty (of protection). You will then obtain the reward of righteousness and suffer no grief and pain. You shall,, O son of Pandu, obtain great prosperity in heaven.

data.v: स्वर्गलोके च महतीं श्रियं प्राप्स्यसि पाण्डव । असंभवश्च धर्माणामीदृशानामराजसु । तस्माद्राजैव नान्योऽस्ति यो महत्फलमाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: Persons who are not kings do not gain merit like this. A person, therefore, who is a king, and no other can earn such rewards of virtue.

data.v: स राज्यमृद्धिमत्प्राप्य धर्मेण परिपालयन् । इन्द्रं तर्पय सोमेन कामैश्च सुहृदो जनान् ॥
data.md: Endued with intelligence, you have obtained a kingdom. Do you protect your subjects righteously. Please Indra with offerings of Soma and your friends and wellwishers with the objects they desire for.'

data.v: य एव तु सतो रक्षेदसतश्च निबर्हयेत् । स एव राज्ञा कर्तव्यो राजन्राजपुरोहितः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said A king should appoint that person as his priest who would protect the good and punish the wicked.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । पुरूरवस ऐलस्य संवादं मातरिश्वनः ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited the old story about the discourse between Pururavas the son of Aila and Matarishvan.

data.v: कुतः स्विद्ब्राह्मणो जातो वर्णाश्चापि कुतस्त्रयः । कस्माच्च भवति श्रेयानेतद्वायो विचक्ष्व मे ॥
data.md: Pururavas said Whence has the Brahmana originated and whence the three other orders? Why also has the Brahmana become the foremost? You should tell me all this.

data.v: ब्रह्मणो मुखतः सृष्टो ब्राह्मणो राजसत्तम । बाहुभ्यां क्षत्रियः सृष्ट ऊरुभ्यां वैश्य उच्यते ॥
data.md: Matarishvan answered The Brahmana. O best of kings, has originated from the mouth of Brahman. The Kshatriya has originated from his two arms, and the Vaishya from his two thighs.

data.v: वर्णानां परिचर्यार्थं त्रयाणां पुरुषर्षभ । वर्णश्चतुर्थः पश्चात्तु पद्भ्यां शूद्रो विनिर्मितः ॥
data.md: For serving these three orders, O king, a fourth order, viz., the Shudra, came into being created from the feet (of Brahman).

data.v: ब्राह्मणो जातमात्रस्तु पृथिवीमन्वजायत । ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां धर्मकोशस्य गुप्तये ॥
data.md: Thus created the Brahmana is born on Earth as the lord of all creatures, his duty being to preserve the Vedas and the other scriptures.

data.v: ततः पृथिव्या गोप्तारं क्षत्रियं दण्डधारिणम् । द्वितीयं वर्णमकरोत्प्रजानामनुगुप्तये ॥
data.md: Then, for ruling the Earth and holding the rod of punishment and protecting all creatures, the second order, viz., the Kshatriya was created.

data.v: वैश्यस्तु धनधान्येन त्रीन्वर्णान्बिभृयादिमान् । शूद्रो ह्येनान्परिचरेदिति ब्रह्मानुशासनम् ॥
data.md: The Vaishya was created for supporting the two other orders and himself by cultivation and trade, and finally it was ordained by Brahman that the Shudra should serve the three orders as a servant.

data.v: द्विजस्य क्षत्रबन्धोर्वा कस्येयं पृथिवी भवेत् । धर्मतः सह वित्तेन सम्यग्वायो प्रचक्ष्व मे ॥
data.md: Pururavas said Tell me, truly, O god of Wind, to whom does this Earth fairly belong, Does it belong to the Brahmana or to the Kshatriya.

data.v: विप्रस्य सर्वमेवैतद्यत्किंचिज्जगतीगतम् । ज्येष्ठेनाभिजनेनेह तद्धर्मकुशला विदुः ॥
data.md: The god of Wind said Everything that exists in the universe belongs to the Brahmana on account of his birth and precedence. Persons, conversant with morality, declare it.

data.v: स्वमेव ब्राह्मणो भुङ्क्ते स्वं वस्ते स्वं ददाति च । गुरुर्हि सर्ववर्णानां ज्येष्ठः श्रेष्ठश्च वै द्विजः ॥
data.md: What the Brahmana eats is his own. The place he dwells is his own. What he gives away is his own. He deserves the respect of all the (other) orders. He is the first-born and the foremost.

data.v: पत्यभावे यथा स्त्री हि देवरं कुरुते पतिम् । आनन्तर्यात्तथा क्षत्रं पृथिवी कुरुते पतिम् ॥
एष ते प्रथमः कल्प आपद्यन्यो भवेदतः । यदि स्वर्गे परं स्थानं धर्मतः परिमार्गसि ॥
यः कश्चिद्विजयेद्भूमिं ब्राह्मणाय निवेदयेत् । श्रुतवृत्तोपपन्नाय धर्मज्ञाय तपस्विने ॥
स्वधर्मपरितृप्ताय यो न वित्तपरो भवेत् । यो राजानं नयेद्बुद्ध्या सर्वतः परिपूर्णया ॥
ब्राह्मणो हि कुले जातः कृतप्रज्ञो विनीतवाक् । श्रेयो नयति राजानं ब्रुवंश्चित्रां सरस्वतीम् ॥
राजा चरति यं धर्मं ब्राह्मणेन निदर्शितम् । शुश्रूषुरनहंवादी क्षत्रधर्मव्रते स्थितः ॥
तावता स कृतप्रज्ञश्चिरं यशसि तिष्ठति । तस्य धर्मस्य सर्वस्य भागी राजपुरोहितः ॥
data.md: As long as a wish king, observant of the duties of his order, and shorn of pride, is desirous of listening to the advice of the Brahmana, so long is he respected and so long does he enjoy fame. The priest of the king, therefore, partakes, of the merit that the king acquires.

data.v: एवमेव प्रजाः सर्वा राजानमभिसंश्रिताः । सम्यग्वृत्ताः स्वधर्मस्था न कुतश्चिद्भयान्विताः ॥
data.md: When the king behaves himself thus, all his subjects, depending upon him, become virtuous in their behaviour, follow their duties, and are freed from every fear.

data.v: राष्ट्रे चरन्ति यं धर्मं राज्ञा साध्वभिरक्षिताः । चतुर्थं तस्य धर्मस्य राजा भागं स विन्दति ॥
data.md: The king shares a fourth part of those righteous acts which his subjects, wellprotected by him, perform in his kingdom.

data.v: देवा मनुष्याः पितरो गन्धर्वोरगराक्षसाः । यज्ञमेवोपजीवन्ति नास्ति चेष्टमराजके ॥
data.md: The gods, men, Pitris, Gandharvas, Uragas, and Rakshasas, all derive their support from sacrifices. In a country having no king, their can be no sacrifice.

data.v: इतो दत्तेन जीवन्ति देवताः पितरस्तथा । राजन्येवास्य धर्मस्य योगक्षेमः प्रतिष्ठितः ॥
data.md: The gods and the Pitris live upon the offerings made in sacrifices. Sacrifice, however, dependants upon the king.

data.v: छायायामप्सु वायौ च सुखमुष्णेऽधिगच्छति । अग्नौ वाससि सूर्ये च सुखं शीतेऽधिगच्छति ॥
data.md: In summer, men seek comfort from the shade of trees, cool water, and cool breezes. In winter, they derive comfort from fire, warm clothing and the sun.

data.v: शब्दे स्पर्शे रसे रूपे गन्धे च रमते मनः । तेषु भोगेषु सर्वेषु नभीतो लभते सुखम् ॥
data.md: The heart of man finds pleasure in sound, touch, taste, vision, and smell. The man, however, who is filled with fear, finds no pleasure in all these things.

data.v: अभयस्यैव यो दाता तस्यैव सुमहत्फलम् । न हि प्राणसमं दानं त्रिषु लोकेषु विद्यते ॥
data.md: That person, who removes the fears of men, acquires great merit. There is no present so valuable in three worlds as that of life.

data.v: इन्द्रो राजा यमो राजा धर्मो राजा तथैव च । राजा बिभर्ति रूपाणि राज्ञा सर्वमिदं धृतम् ॥
data.md: The king is Indra. The king is Yama. The king is Dharma. The king puts on different forms. The king preserves and supports every things.

data.v: राज्ञा पुरोहितः कार्यो भवेद्विद्वान्बहुश्रुतः । उभौ समीक्ष्य धर्मार्थावप्रमेयावनन्तरम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The king, observing both religious merit and profit which are very intricate, should, forthwith, appoint a priest learned and acquainted intimately with the Vedas and the (other) scriptures.

data.v: धर्मात्मा धर्मविद्येषां राज्ञां राजन्पुरोहितः । राजा चैवंगुणो येषां कुशलं तेषु सर्वशः ॥
data.md: Those kings, who have priests, who are pious and conversant with policy, and are possessed of good attributes, enjoy prosperity everywhere.

data.v: उभौ प्रजा वर्धयतो देवान्पूर्वान्परान्पितॄन् । यौ समेयास्थितौ धर्मे श्रद्धेयौ सुतपस्विनौ ॥
data.md: Both the priest and the king should have such qualities as arrest honour, and should observe the vows and penances. They would then succeed in supporting the subjects, the deities. the Pitris, and the children.

data.v: परस्परस्य सुहृदौ संमतौ समचेतसौ । ब्रह्मक्षत्रस्य संमानात्प्रजाः सुखमवाप्नुयुः ॥
data.md: It is laid down that they should have similar hearts and should be each other's friends. For such friendship between Brahmana and Kshatriya, the subjects become happy.

data.v: विमाननात्तयोरेव प्रजा नश्येयुरेव ह । ब्रह्मक्षत्रं हि सर्वेषां धर्माणां मूलमुच्यते ॥
data.md: If they do not respect each other, destruction would befall the people. The Brahmana and the Kshatriya are said to be the creators of all men.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । ऐलकश्यपसंवादं तं निबोध युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited the old story about the discourse between Pururavas the son of Aila and Matarishvan.

data.v: यदा हि ब्रह्म प्रजहाति क्षत्रं; क्षत्रं यदा वा प्रजहाति ब्रह्म । अन्वग्बलं कतमेऽस्मिन्भजन्ते; तथाबल्यं कतमेऽस्मिन्वियन्ति ॥
data.md: Aila's son said When the Brahmana forsakes the Kshatriya or the Kshatriya forsakes the Brahmana, who amongst them should be considered superior, and upon whom would the other orders depend and maintain themselves?

data.v: व्यृद्धं राष्ट्रं भवति क्षत्रियस्य; ब्रह्म क्षत्रं यत्र विरुध्यते ह । अन्वग्बलं दस्यवस्तद्भजन्ते;ऽबल्यं तथा तत्र वियन्ति सन्तः ॥
data.md: Kashyapa said Ruin befalls the kingdom of the Kshatriya when the Brahmana and Kshatriya fight with each other. Robbers attack that kingdom in which anarchy reigns and all good men regard the king as a Mlechchha.

data.v: नैषामुक्षा वर्धते नोत उस्रा; न गर्गरो मथ्यते नो यजन्ते । नैषां पुत्रा वेदमधीयते च; यदा ब्रह्म क्षत्रियाः संत्यजन्ति ॥
data.md: Their oxen do not thrive, nor do their children. Their pots (of milk) are not churned, and no sacrifices are celebrated there. The children do not study the Vedas in kingdoms where Brahmanas forsake Kshatriyas.

data.v: नैषामुक्षा वर्धते जातु गेहे; नाधीयते सप्रजा नो यजन्ते । अपध्वस्ता दस्युभूता भवन्ति; ये ब्राह्मणाः क्षत्रियान्संत्यजन्ति ॥
data.md: In their houses wealth does not multiply. There children do not become good and do not read the scriptures and celebrate sacrifices. Those Kshatriyas that forsake the Brahmanas become impure in blood.

data.v: एतौ हि नित्यसंयुक्तावितरेतरधारणे । क्षत्रं हि ब्रह्मणो योनिर्योनिः क्षत्रस्य च द्विजाः ॥
data.md: The Brahmana and the Kshatriya are connected with each other by nature, and each protects the other. The Kshatriya is the root of the Brahmana's advancement and the Brahmana is the root of the Kshatriya's advancement.

data.v: उभावेतौ नित्यमभिप्रपन्नौ; संप्रापतुर्महतीं श्रीप्रतिष्ठाम् । तयोः संधिर्भिद्यते चेत्पुराण;स्ततः सर्वं भवति हि संप्रमूढम् ॥
data.md: When each helps the other, both enjoy great prosperity. If their friendship, existing from days of yore, is snapped anarchy prevails everywhere.

data.v: नात्र प्लवं लभते पारगामी; महागाधे नौरिव संप्रणुन्ना । चातुर्वर्ण्यं भवति च संप्रमूढं; ततः प्रजाः क्षयसंस्था भवन्ति ॥
data.md: No person, desirous of crossing the ocean of life, succeeds in his attempts like a small boat floating on the bosom of the sea. The four orders of men become confounded and meet with destruction,

data.v: ब्रह्मवृक्षो रक्ष्यमाणो मधु हेम च वर्षति । अरक्ष्यमाणः सततमश्रु पापं च वर्षति ॥
data.md: If the tree of a Brahmana is protected, it showers gold and honey. If on the other hand, it is not protected, it then showers tears and sin.

data.v: अब्रह्मचारी चरणादपेतो; यदा ब्रह्मा ब्रह्मणि त्राणमिच्छेत् । आश्चर्यशो वर्षति तत्र देव;स्तत्राभीक्ष्णं दुःसहाश्चाविशन्ति ॥
data.md: When Brahmanas neglect the study of the Vedas and seek protection from the scriptures, then Indra does not pour rain in time and various sorts of calamities constantly assail the kingdom.

data.v: स्त्रियं हत्वा ब्राह्मणं वापि पापः; सभायां यत्र लभतेऽनुवादम् । राज्ञः सकाशे न बिभेति चापि; ततो भयं जायते क्षत्रियस्य ॥
data.md: When a sinful wretch, having killed a woman or a Brahmana, does not incur censure in assemblies of fellowmen and does not fear the king, then danger threatens the Kshatriya king.

data.v: पापैः पापे क्रियमाणेऽतिवेलं; ततो रुद्रो जायते देव एषः । पापैः पापाः संजनयन्ति रुद्रं; ततः सर्वान्साध्वसाधून्हिनस्ति ॥
data.md: For the sins perpetrated by sinful men, the god Rudra appears in the kingdom. Indeed, the sinful by their sins invite that god of vengeance. He then kills all, the honest and the wicked alike.

data.v: कुतो रुद्रः कीदृशो वापि रुद्रः; सत्त्वैः सत्त्वं दृश्यते वध्यमानम् । एतद्विद्वन्कश्यप मे प्रचक्ष्व; यतो रुद्रो जायते देव एषः ॥
data.md: Aila said Whence does Rudra originate? What also is his form? Creatures are seen to be destroyed by creatures. Tell me all this, O Kashyapa, Whence does the god Rudra originate.

data.v: आत्मा रुद्रो हृदये मानवानां; स्वं स्वं देहं परदेहं च हन्ति । वातोत्पातैः सदृशं रुद्रमाहु;र्दावैर्जीमूतैः सदृशं रूपमस्य ॥
data.md: Kashyapa said Rudra exists in the hearts of men. He destroys the bodies themselves in which he lives as also the bodies of others. Rudra is like visitations of the sky and his form is like that of the wind-god.

data.v: न वै वातं परिवृनोति कश्चि;न्न जीमूतो वर्षति नैव दावः । तथायुक्तो दृश्यते मानवेषु; कामद्वेषाद्बध्यते मुच्यते च ॥
data.md: The Wind does not, by blowing, visible destroy men at all times, nor does Indra do so by purring rain. On the other hand, it is seen among men that they lose their senses and are killed through lust and malice.

data.v: यथैकगेहे जातवेदाः प्रदीप्तः; कृत्स्नं ग्रामं प्रदहेत्स त्वरावान् । विमोहनं कुरुते देव एष; ततः सर्वं स्पृश्यते पुण्यपापैः ॥
data.md: Kashyapa said, Fire burning in one house, burns a whole quarter or an entire village. Likewise this deity stupefies the senses of some one and then that stupefaction affects all, the honest and the wicked alike, without any distinction.

data.v: यदि दण्डः स्पृशते पुण्यभाजं; पापैः पापे क्रियमाणेऽविशेषात् । कस्य हेतोः सुकृतं नाम कुर्या;द्दुष्कृतं वा कस्य हेतोर्न कुर्यात् ॥
data.md: Aila Said: If punishment affects all, viz., the honest and the wicked alike, on account of the sins committed by the sinful, why should men, in that case, perform acts that are meritorious? Indeed, why should they abstain from wicked acts.

data.v: असंत्यागात्पापकृतामपापां;स्तुल्यो दण्डः स्पृशते मिश्रभावात् । शुष्केणार्द्रं दह्यते मिश्रभावा;न्न मिश्रः स्यात्पापकृद्भिः कथंचित् ॥
data.md: By standing aloof from the sinful, one becomes pure and stainless. However, by being mixed with the sinful, the sinless are punished. Wet wood, if mixed with dry wood, is consumed by the fire for such mixture. The sinless, therefore, should never associate with the sinful.

data.v: साध्वसाधून्धारयतीह भूमिः; साध्वसाधूंस्तापयतीह सूर्यः । साध्वसाधून्वातयतीह वायु;रापस्तथा साध्वसाधून्वहन्ति ॥
data.md: Aila said The Earth contains the honest and the wicked. The sun warms the honest and the wicked. The wind blows equally for them. Water cleanses them equally.

data.v: एवमस्मिन्वर्तते लोक एव; नामुत्रैवं वर्तते राजपुत्र । प्रेत्यैतयोरन्तरवान्विशेषो; यो वै पुण्यं चरते यश्च पापम् ॥
data.md: Kashyapa said Such, indeed, is the course of this world, O prince. It is not so, however, in another world. In the other world, there is a great difference between the person that acts virtuously and him that acts sinfully.

data.v: पुण्यस्य लोको मधुमान्घृतार्चि;र्हिरण्यज्योतिरमृतस्य नाभिः । तत्र प्रेत्य मोदते ब्रह्मचारी; न तत्र मृत्युर्न जरा नोत दुःखम् ॥
data.md: The regions which virtuous men acquire are full of honey and the splendour of gold or of fire upon which clarified butter has been poured. They are compared to the navel of ambrosia. The meritorious person enjoys great happiness there. Death, decrepitude, and sorrow are not there.

data.v: पापस्य लोको निरयोऽप्रकाशो; नित्यं दुःखः शोकभूयिष्ठ एव । तत्रात्मानं शोचते पापकर्मा; बह्वीः समाः प्रपतन्नप्रतिष्ठः ॥
data.md: The region for the sinful is hell. Darkness and constant pain are there, and it is full of sorrow. Sinking in infamy, the sinful man grieves for many years.

data.v: मिथो भेदाद्ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियाणां; प्रजा दुःखं दुःसहं चाविशन्ति । एवं ज्ञात्वा कार्य एवेह विद्वा;न्पुरोहितो नैकविद्यो नृपेण ॥
data.md: For a division between Brahmanas and Kshatriyas, numberless griefs assail the people. Knowing this, a king should appoint a (Brahmana) priest having experience and wide knowledge. owner

data.v: तं चैवान्वभिषिच्येत तथा धर्मो विधीयते । अग्र्यो हि ब्राह्मणः प्रोक्तः सर्वस्यैवेह धर्मतः ॥
