data.md: There is no one more virtuous than he, upon whom high-born and learned persons depend from fear of losing their means of sustenance and depending upon upon whom they live contentedly.

data.v: किं न्वतः परमं स्वर्ग्यं का न्वतः प्रीतिरुत्तमा । किं न्वतः परमैश्वर्यं ब्रूहि मे यदि मन्यसे ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said What acts, O sir, lead to heaven? What is the nature of the great happiness that is derived from them? What also is the high prosperity that may be obtained from them? Tell me all this, if you know.

data.v: यस्मिन्प्रतिष्ठिताः सम्यक्क्षेमं विन्दन्ति तत्क्षणम् । स स्वर्गजित्तमोऽस्माकं सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ते ॥
data.md: Bhishma said That man, from whom a person assailed by fear obtains even a momentary relief, deserves heaven from amongst the best of us. What I tell you is very true.

data.v: त्वमेव प्रीतिमांस्तस्मात्कुरूणां कुरुसत्तम । भव राजा जय स्वर्गं सतो रक्षासतो जहि ॥
data.md: Be you gladly the king of the Kurus, O foremost one of Kuru's race, acquire heaven, protect the good, and kill the wicked.

data.v: अनु त्वा तात जीवन्तु सुहृदः साधुभिः सह । पर्जन्यमिव भूतानि स्वादुद्रुममिवाण्डजाः ॥
data.md: Let your friends, together with all honest man, derive their support from you, like all creatures from the god of the clouds and like birds from a large tree with sweet fruits.

data.v: धृष्टं शूरं प्रहर्तारमनृशंसं जितेन्द्रियम् । वत्सलं संविभक्तारमनु जीवन्तु त्वां जनाः ॥
data.md: Men seek refuge with that person who is dignified, courageous, capable of striking, merciful, has under control, is affectionate towards all, the impartial and just. senses

data.v: स्वकर्मण्यपरे युक्तास्तथैवान्ये विकर्मणि । तेषां विशेषमाचक्ष्व ब्राह्मणानां पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O grandfather, amongst Brahmanas some follow the duties proper to their order while others follow other duties. Tell me the difference between tow lasses.

data.v: विद्यालक्षणसंपन्नाः सर्वत्राम्नायदर्शिनः । एते ब्रह्मसमा राजन्ब्राह्मणाः परिकीर्तिताः ॥
data.md: Those Brahmanas, o king, who are learned and beneficent, and who look upon all creatures impartially, are said to be equal to। Brahma.

data.v: ऋत्विगाचार्यसंपन्नाः स्वेषु कर्मस्ववस्थिताः । एते देवसमा राजन्ब्राह्मणानां भवन्त्युत ॥
data.md: Those who are conversant with the Rishis, the Yajus, and the Samans and who follow the practices of their order, are, O king, equal to the very gods.

data.v: ऋत्विक्पुरोहितो मन्त्री दूतोऽथार्थानुशासकः । एते क्षत्रसमा राजन्ब्राह्मणानां भवन्त्युत ॥
data.md: Those who become Ritwijas, Purohitas, counsellors, envoys and messengers become, O king, equal to Kshatriyas.

data.v: अश्वारोहा गजारोहा रथिनोऽथ पदातयः । एते वैश्यसमा राजन्ब्राह्मणानां भवन्त्युत ॥
data.md: Those, who ride horses or elephants or cars or become foot-soldiers, become, O king, equal to Vaishyas.

data.v: जन्मकर्मविहीना ये कदर्या ब्रह्मबन्धवः । एते शूद्रसमा राजन्ब्राह्मणानां भवन्त्युत ॥
data.md: Those, however, who are not well-born and do not follow the duties of their order, and are, addicted to evil practices, are like Shudras.

data.v: अश्रोत्रियाः सर्व एव सर्वे चानाहिताग्नयः । तान्सर्वान्धार्मिको राजा बलिं विष्टिं च कारयेत् ॥
data.md: A virtuous king should realise tribute from and compel to enter the public service without any remuneration those Brahmanas who are not well read in the Vedas and who have not their own fires to worship.

data.v: आह्वायका देवलका नक्षत्रग्रामयाजकाः । एते ब्राह्मणचण्डाला महापथिकपञ्चमाः ॥
data.md: Those, who are employed in law courts for summoning people, those who perform worship for other for money, those who perform the sacrifices of Vaishyas and Shudras, those who officiate in sacrifices on behalf of a whole village, and those who make voyages on the ocean,—these five are regarded as Chandalas among Brahmanas.

data.v: एतेभ्यो बलिमादद्याद्धीनकोशो महीपतिः । ऋते ब्रह्मसमेभ्यश्च देवकल्पेभ्य एव च ॥
data.md: If the king's treasury is not well replenished, he may take tribute from these. In realising tribute, the king, however, should except those Brahmanas who are equal to the gods or Brahma.

data.v: अब्राह्मणानां वित्तस्य स्वामी राजेति वैदिकम् । ब्राह्मणानां च ये केचिद्विकर्मस्था भवन्त्युत ॥
data.md: The Vedas say that the king is the master of the wealth of all the orders except Brahmanas. He can take the wealth of those Brahmanas who have neglected to perform their legitimate duties.

data.v: विकर्मस्थास्तु नोपेक्ष्या जातु राज्ञा कथंचन । नियम्याः संविभज्याश्च धर्मानुग्रहकाम्यया ॥
data.md: The king should never treat in-differently those Brahmanas who do not observe their duties. For the sake of making his people virtuous, he should punish and take them away from their betters.

data.v: यस्य स्म विषये राज्ञः स्तेनो भवति वै द्विजः । राज्ञ एवापराधं तं मन्यन्ते तद्विदो जनाः ॥
data.md: That king, O monarch, in whose territories a Brahmana becomes a thief, is charged by the learned as the doer of that misdeed.

data.v: अवृत्त्या यो भवेत्स्तेनो वेदवित्स्नातकस्तथा । राजन्स राज्ञा भर्तव्य इति धर्मविदो विदुः ॥
data.md: Persons conversant with the Vedas declare that if a Brahmana versed in the Vedas and observant of vows becomes, through want of means, a thief, it is the duty of the king to support him.

data.v: स चेन्नो परिवर्तेत कृतवृत्तिः परंतप । ततो निर्वासनीयः स्यात्तस्माद्देशात्सबान्धवः ॥
data.md: If, after provision has been made for his maintenance, he does not abstain from thefts, he should then, O scorcher of foes, be exiled from the kingdom with all his relatives.

data.v: केषां राजा प्रभवति वित्तस्य भरतर्षभ । कया च वृत्त्या वर्तेत तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Of whose wealth, O foremost of Bharata's race, is the king considered to be the master? And what conduct also should the king follow? Describe to me this, O grandfather!

data.v: अब्राह्मणानां वित्तस्य स्वामी राजेति वैदिकम् । ब्राह्मणानां च ये केचिद्विकर्मस्था भवन्त्युत ॥
data.md: The Vedas say that the king is the master of the wealth of all the orders except Brahmanas. He can take the wealth of those Brahmanas who have neglected to perform their legitimate duties.

data.v: विकर्मस्थाश्च नोपेक्ष्या विप्रा राज्ञा कथंचन । इति राज्ञां पुरावृत्तमभिजल्पन्ति साधवः ॥
data.md: The king should never treat in-differently those Brahmanas who do not observe their duties. For the sake of making his people virtuous, he should punish and take them away from their betters.

data.v: यस्य स्म विषये राज्ञः स्तेनो भवति वै द्विजः । राज्ञ एवापराधं तं मन्यन्ते किल्बिषं नृप ॥
data.md: That king, O monarch, in whose territories a Brahmana becomes a thief, is charged by the learned as the doer of that misdeed.

data.v: अभिशस्तमिवात्मानं मन्यन्ते तेन कर्मणा । तस्माद्राजर्षयः सर्वे ब्राह्मणानन्वपालयन् ॥
data.md: For such an offence, kings consider themselves to be worthy of reproach. All righteous kings, therefore, provide Brahmanas with the means of sustenance,

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । गीतं केकयराजेन ह्रियमाणेन रक्षसा ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited the old narrative of the speech made by the king of the Kaikeyas to a Rakshasa while the latter was about to abduct him away.

data.v: केकयानामधिपतिं रक्षो जग्राह दारुणम् । स्वाध्यायेनान्वितं राजन्नरण्ये संशितव्रतम् ॥
data.md: Of rigid vows and well-read in the Vedas, the king of the Kaikeyas, O monarch, while living in the forest, was by force seized on a certain occasion by a Rakshasa.

data.v: न मे स्तेनो जनपदे न कदर्यो न मद्यपः । नानाहिताग्निर्नायज्वा मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: The king said, There is no thief in my kingdom, nor any wicked person nor any one who drinks alcohol. There is no one in my kingdomn who does not preserve his sacred fire or who does not celebrate sacrifices. How then have you been able to possess by heart?

data.v: न च मे ब्राह्मणोऽविद्वान्नाव्रती नाप्यसोमपः । नानाहिताग्निर्विषये मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: There is not Brahmana in my territories who is not learned or who does not observe Vows or who has not drunk Soma. There is no one who does not preserve his sacred fire or who does not celebrate sacrifices. How then have you been able to possess my soul?

data.v: नानाप्तदक्षिणैर्यज्ञैर्यजन्ते विषये मम । अधीते नाव्रती कश्चिन्मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: In my kingdom no sacrifice has been celebrated without completing it by Dakshina. No one in my kingdom studies the Vedas who does not observe vows. How then have you been able to possess my soul?

data.v: अधीयतेऽध्यापयन्ति यजन्ते याजयन्ति च । ददति प्रतिगृह्णन्ति षट्सु कर्मस्ववस्थिताः ॥
data.md: The Brahmanas in my kingdom teach, study, sacrifice, officiate at others' sacrifices, give, and receive presents. All of them perform those six acts.

data.v: पूजिताः संविभक्ताश्च मृदवः सत्यवादिनः । ब्राह्मणा मे स्वकर्मस्था मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: The Brahmanas in my kingdom devotedly follow the duties of their order. Adored and provided for, they are mild, and truthful in speech. How then have you been to possess my soul?

data.v: न याचन्ते प्रयच्छन्ति सत्यधर्मविशारदाः । नाध्यापयन्त्यधीयन्ते यजन्ते न च याजकाः ॥
ब्राह्मणान्परिरक्षन्ति संग्रामेष्वपलायिनः । क्षत्रिया मे स्वकर्मस्था मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: The Kshatriyas in my kingdom devotedly follow the duties of their order. They never beg but give, and are conversant with truth and virtue. They never teach but study, and celebrate sacrifices but never officiate at the sacrifices of others. They protect the Brahmanas and never fly from battlefield. How then have you been able to possess my soul,?

data.v: कृषिगोरक्षवाणिज्यमुपजीवन्त्यमायया । अप्रमत्ताः क्रियावन्तः सुव्रताः सत्यवादिनः ॥
data.md: The Vaishyas in my kingdom all follow the duties of their order. With simplicity and without deceit they gain their livelihood from agriculture, cattle-keeping, and trade. They are all careful, observant of religious rites and excellent vows, and truthful in speech.

data.v: संविभागं दमं शौचं सौहृदं च व्यपाश्रिताः । मम वैश्याः स्वकर्मस्था मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: They give to their guests what is their due, are self-controlled and pure, and devoted to their relatives and kinsmen. How then have you been to possess my heart?

data.v: त्रीन्वर्णाननुतिष्ठन्ति यथावदनसूयकाः । मम शूद्राः स्वकर्मस्था मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: The Shudras in my kingdom, always follow the duties of their order, humbly and duly serve and wait upon the other three orders without cherishing any inalice towards them. How then have you been able to possess my heart?

data.v: कृपणानाथवृद्धानां दुर्बलातुरयोषिताम् । संविभक्तास्मि सर्वेषां मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: I support the helpless and the old, the weak, the ill, and helpless women by giving them all their necessaries. How then have you been able to possess my heart?

data.v: कुलदेशादिधर्माणां प्रथितानां यथाविधि । अव्युच्छेत्तास्मि सर्वेषां मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: I have never done away with the special customs of families and of countries obtaining from days of yore. How then have you been able to possess my heart?

data.v: तपस्विनो मे विषये पूजिताः परिपालिताः । संविभक्ताश्च सत्कृत्य मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: The ascetics in my kingdom are protected and adored. They are always honoured and fed with food. How then have you been able to posses my heart?

data.v: नासंविभज्य भोक्तास्मि न विशामि परस्त्रियम् । स्वतन्त्रो जातु न क्रीडे मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: I never eat without feeding others from my food. I never know other people's wives. I never sport or recreate alone. How then have you been able to possess my heart?

data.v: नाब्रह्मचारी भिक्षावान्भिक्षुर्वाब्रह्मचारिकः । अनृत्विजं हुतं नास्ति मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: No one in my kingdom save a Brahmacharin begs his food, and no one who lives a mendicant's life desires to be a Brahmacharin. No one but a Ritwij pours libations (of clarified butter) upon the sacrificial fire. How then have you been able to possess my soul?

data.v: नावजानाम्यहं वृद्धान्न वैद्यान्न तपस्विनः । राष्ट्रे स्वपति जागर्मि मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: I never disrespect the learned or the old or those who practise penances. When all people are asleep, I keep up (for watching and protecting). How then have you been able to possess my heart?

data.v: वेदाध्ययनसंपन्नस्तपस्वी सर्वधर्मवित् । स्वामी सर्वस्य राज्यस्य श्रीमान्मम पुरोहितः ॥
data.md: My priest is endued with the knowledge of self. He practises penances, and is a master of duties. Highly intelligent he has the fullest power over my kingdom.

data.v: दानेन दिव्यानभिवाञ्छामि लोका;न्सत्येनाथो ब्राह्मणानां च गुप्त्या । शुश्रूषया चापि गुरूनुपैमि; न मे भयं विद्यते राक्षसेभ्यः ॥
data.md: By presents I desire to acquire knowledge, and by truth and the protection of Brahmanas. I wish to attain blissful regions of heaven. I always strive to serve my preceptors with my services. I do not fear the Rakshasas.

data.v: न मे राष्ट्रे विधवा ब्रह्मबन्धु;र्न ब्राह्मणः कृपणो नोत चोरः । न पारजायी न च पापकर्मा; न मे भयं विद्यते राक्षसेभ्यः ॥
data.md: In my kingdom there are no widows, no wicked Brahmanas, no Brahmana who had not satisfied his duties, no deceitful person, no thief, no Brahmana who officiates in the sacrifices of those for whom he should never officiate, and no perpetrator of sinful deeds. I do not fear the Rakshasas.

data.v: न मे शस्त्रैरनिर्भिन्नमङ्गे द्व्यङ्गुलमन्तरम् । धर्मार्थं युध्यमानस्य मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: There is no space in my body, of even two fingers breadth, which does not contain the mark of a weapon-wound. I always fight for the sake of fairness. How then have you been able to possess my heart?

data.v: गोब्राह्मणे च यज्ञे च नित्यं स्वस्त्ययनं मम । आशासते जना राष्ट्रे मामकान्तरमाविशः ॥
data.md: The people of my kingdom always bless me so that I may always be able to protect kine and Brahmanas and celebrate sacrifices. How then have you been able to possess me?

data.v: यस्मात्सर्वास्ववस्थासु धर्ममेवान्ववेक्षसे । तस्मात्प्राप्नुहि कैकेय गृहान्स्वस्ति व्रजाम्यहम् ॥
data.md: Since you satisfy your duties under all circumstances, therefore, O king of the Kaikeyas, go back to your palace. Blessed be you, I leave you.

data.v: येषां गोब्राह्मणा रक्ष्याः प्रजा रक्ष्याश्च केकय । न रक्षोभ्यो भयं तेषां कुत एव तु मानुषात् ॥
data.md: They, O king of the Kaikeyas, who protect kine and Brahmanas and all their subjects, have no fear of Rakshasas, what speak of sinful persons.

data.v: येषां पुरोगमा विप्रा येषां ब्रह्मबलं बलम् । प्रियातिथ्यास्तथा दारास्ते वै स्वर्गजितो नराः ॥
data.md: Those kings, who yield to Brahmanas and whose might depends upon that of the Brahmanas, and whose subjects are always hospitable, always succeed in gaining heaven.

data.v: तस्माद्द्विजातीन्रक्षेत ते हि रक्षन्ति रक्षिताः । आशीरेषां भवेद्राज्ञां राष्ट्रं सम्यक्प्रवर्धते ॥
data.md: Bhishma continued:-You should; therefore, protect the Brahmanas. Protected by you, they will protect you in return. Their blessings, O king, would, forsooth, come upon righteous kings.

data.v: तस्माद्राज्ञा विशेषेण विकर्मस्था द्विजातयः । नियम्याः संविभज्याश्च प्रजानुग्रहकारणात् ॥
data.md: The king should never treat in-differently those Brahmanas who do not observe their duties. For the sake of making his people virtuous, he should punish and take them away from their betters.

data.v: य एवं वर्तते राजा पौरजानपदेष्विह । अनुभूयेह भद्राणि प्राप्नोतीन्द्रसलोकताम् ॥
data.md: A king, who behaves thus towards the people of his city and the provinces, enjoys prosperity here and lives in heaven with Indra.'

data.v: व्याख्याता क्षत्रधर्मेण वृत्तिरापत्सु भारत । कथंचिद्वैश्यधर्मेण जीवेद्वा ब्राह्मणो न वा ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said "It is said that in seasons of distress a Brahmana may support himself by following Kshatriya duties. But can be, however, at any time, maintain himself by following the duties of the Vaishyas?”

data.v: अशक्तः क्षत्रधर्मेण वैश्यधर्मेण वर्तयेत् । कृषिगोरक्षमास्थाय व्यसने वृत्तिसंक्षये ॥
data.md: "When a Brahmana loses his means of livelihood and is visited by distress, he may certainly act like a Vaishya and derive his support by agriculture and tending cattle, if, of course, he is not capable to perform Kshatriya duties.'

data.v: कानि पण्यानि विक्रीणन्स्वर्गलोकान्न हीयते । ब्राह्मणो वैश्यधर्मेण वर्तयन्भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said "If a Brahmana, O foremost of Bharata's race, follows the duties of a Vaishya, what articles may he sell without losing his chance of attaining heaven?"

data.v: सुरा लवणमित्येव तिलान्केसरिणः पशून् । ऋषभान्मधु मांसं च कृतान्नं च युधिष्ठिर ॥
सर्वास्ववस्थास्वेतानि ब्राह्मणः परिवर्जयेत् । एतेषां विक्रयात्तात ब्राह्मणो नरकं व्रजेत् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said 'A Brahmana must not sell wines, salt, sesamum seeds, animals having manes, bulls, honey, meat and cooked food, O Yudhishthira, under any circumstances. A Brahmana, by selling these, would go to hell.

data.v: अजोऽग्निर्वरुणो मेषः सूर्योऽश्वः पृथिवी विराट् । धेनुर्यज्ञश्च सोमश्च न विक्रेयाः कथंचन ॥
data.md: A Brahmana, by selling a goat, commits the sin of selling the god of fire; by selling a sheep, the sin of selling the god of water; by selling a horse, the sin of selling the sun-god; by selling cooked food, the sin of selling land; and by selling a cow, the sin of selling Sacrifices and the Soma juice. A Brahmana, therefore, must not sell these.

data.v: पक्वेनामस्य निमयं न प्रशंसन्ति साधवः । निमयेत्पक्वमामेन भोजनार्थाय भारत ॥
data.md: The good do not speak highly of the purchase of uncooked food by giving cooked food in return. Uncooked food, however, may be given for procuring cooked food, O Bharata!

data.v: वयं सिद्धमशिष्यामो भवान्साधयतामिदम् । एवं समीक्ष्य निमयन्नाधर्मोऽस्ति कदाचन ॥
data.md: We will eat this cooked food of you. You may cook these raw things (that we give in return). In such an agreement there is no sin.

data.v: अत्र ते वर्तयिष्यामि यथा धर्मः पुरातनः । व्यवहारप्रवृत्तानां तन्निबोध युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Listen, O Yudhishthira, I shall describe to you the eternal practice, obtaining from days of yore, of persons conducting themselves according to approved usages.

data.v: भवतेऽहं ददानीदं भवानेतत्प्रयच्छतु । रुचिते वर्तते धर्मो न बलात्संप्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: I give you this. Give me this other thing in exchange. Such an exchange is righteous. To take things by force, is sinful.

data.v: इत्येवं संप्रवर्तन्त व्यवहाराः पुरातनाः । ऋषीणामितरेषां च साधु चेदमसंशयम् ॥
data.md: Such is the old practice followed by the Rishis and others. Forsooth, this is righteous.' Yudhishthira said

data.v: अथ तात यदा सर्वाः शस्त्रमाददते प्रजाः । व्युत्क्रामन्ति स्वधर्मेभ्यः क्षत्रस्य क्षीयते बलम् ॥
data.md: “When, O sire, giving up their respective duties, all the castes take up arms against the king, then, of course, the power of the king suffers decrease. How would the king then become the protector and refuge of the people? Remove this doubt of mine, O king, by speaking to me fully." Bhishma said

data.v: राजा त्राता न लोके स्यात्किं तदा स्यात्परायणम् । एतन्मे संशयं ब्रूहि विस्तरेण पितामह ॥
दानेन तपसा यज्ञैरद्रोहेण दमेन च । ब्राह्मणप्रमुखा वर्णाः क्षेममिच्छेयुरात्मनः ॥
data.md: “By gifts, by penances, by sacrifices, by peacefulness, and by self-control, all the castes led by the Brahmanas should, on such occasions, seek their own behoof.

data.v: तेषां ये वेदबलिनस्त उत्थाय समन्ततः । राज्ञो बलं वर्धयेयुर्महेन्द्रस्येव देवताः ॥
data.md: Those amongst them who are gifted with Vedic strength, should rise up on all sides and like the celestial empowering Indra contribute (by Vedic rites) to increase the strength of the king.

data.v: राज्ञो हि क्षीयमाणस्य ब्रह्मैवाहुः परायणम् । तस्माद्ब्रह्मबलेनैव समुत्थेयं विजानता ॥
data.md: Brahmanas are said to be the refuge of the king while his power is gone. A wise king seeks the increase of his power by means of the power of the Brahmanas.

data.v: यदा तु विजयी राजा क्षेमं राष्ट्रेऽभिसंदधेत् । तदा वर्णा यथाधर्ममाविशेयुः स्वकर्मसु ॥
data.md: When the king, after acquiring victory, tries to re-establish peace, all the castes then follow their respective duties.

data.v: उन्मर्यादे प्रवृत्ते तु दस्युभिः संकरे कृते । सर्वे वर्णा न दुष्येयुः शस्त्रवन्तो युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: When robbers overcoming all restraints, lay waste the country, all the orders may take up arms. By doing so, they commit no sin, O Yudhishthira!'

data.v: अथ चेत्सर्वतः क्षत्रं प्रदुष्येद्ब्राह्मणान्प्रति । कस्तस्य ब्राह्मणस्त्राता को धर्मः किं परायणम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said “If all the Kshatriyas stand against the Brahmanas, who then will protect the Brahmanas and their Vedas? What then should be the duty of the Brahmanas and who will be their shelter?"

data.v: तपसा ब्रह्मचर्येण शस्त्रेण च बलेन च । अमायया मायया च नियन्तव्यं तदा भवेत् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said By penances, by Brahmacharya, by weapons, and by (physical) power, applied with or without the help of deceit, the Kshatriyas should be vanquished.

data.v: क्षत्रस्याभिप्रवृद्धस्य ब्राह्मणेषु विशेषतः । ब्रह्मैव संनियन्तृ स्यात्क्षत्रं हि ब्रह्मसंभवम् ॥
data.md: If the Kshatriya misbehaves himself, especially towards Brahmanas, the Vedas themselves will put them down. The Kshatriyas have originated from the Brahmanas.

data.v: अद्भ्योऽग्निर्ब्रह्मतः क्षत्रमश्मनो लोहमुत्थितम् । तेषां सर्वत्रगं तेजः स्वासु योनिषु शाम्यति ॥
data.md: Fire has originated water; the Kshatriya, from the Brahmana; and iron, from stone. The power of fire, the Kshatriya, and iron, are irresistible. But when these conflict with their sources, their force becomes neutralised.

data.v: यदा छिनत्त्ययोऽश्मानमग्निश्चापोऽभिपद्यते । क्षत्रं च ब्राह्मणं द्वेष्टि तदा शाम्यन्ति ते त्रयः ॥
data.md: When iron strikes against stone, or fire fights with water, or the Kshatriya stands against the Brahmana, then the strength of each of those three is destroyed.

data.v: तस्माद्ब्रह्मणि शाम्यन्ति क्षत्रियाणां युधिष्ठिर । समुदीर्णान्यजेयानि तेजांसि च बलानि च ॥
ब्रह्मवीर्ये मृदूभूते क्षत्रवीर्ये च दुर्बले । दुष्टेषु सर्ववर्णेषु ब्राह्मणान्प्रति सर्वशः ॥
ये तत्र युद्धं कुर्वन्ति त्यक्त्वा जीवितमात्मनः । ब्राह्मणान्परिरक्षन्तो धर्ममात्मानमेव च ॥
मनस्विनो मन्युमन्तः पुण्यलोका भवन्ति ते । ब्राह्मणार्थं हि सर्वेषां शस्त्रग्रहणमिष्यते ॥
अति स्विष्टस्वधीतानां लोकानति तपस्विनाम् । अनाशकाग्न्योर्विशतां शूरा यान्ति परां गतिम् । एवमेवात्मनस्त्यागान्नान्यं धर्मं विदुर्जनाः ॥
data.md: Those brave, persons who fight for Brahmanas, acquire those happy regions in heaven which are reserved for persons who have always studied the Vedas with attention, who have practised the austerest of penances, and that have, after fasting, cast off their bodies into burning fires.

data.v: तेभ्यो नमश्च भद्रं च ये शरीराणि जुह्वति । ब्रह्मद्विषो नियच्छन्तस्तेषां नोऽस्तु सलोकता । ब्रह्मलोकजितः स्वर्ग्यान्वीरांस्तान्मनुरब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: I bow to them and blessed be they who thus renounce their lives while trying to punish the enemies of Brahmanas. Let us attain to that region which is reserved for them. Manu himself has said that those heroes go to the region of Brahman.

data.v: यथाश्वमेधावभृथे स्नाताः पूता भवन्त्युत । दुष्कृतः सुकृतश्चैव तथा शस्त्रहता रणे ॥
data.md: As persons become freed off of all their sins by taking the final bath in a horse-sacrifice, so those who die by weapons while fighting wicked people are freed off of all their sins.

data.v: भवत्यधर्मो धर्मो हि धर्माधर्मावुभावपि । कारणाद्देशकालस्य देशकालः स तादृशः ॥
data.md: Righteousness becomes unrighteousness, and unrighteousness becomes righteousness, according to place and time, Such is the power of place and time.

data.v: मैत्राः क्रूराणि कुर्वन्तो जयन्ति स्वर्गमुत्तमम् । धर्म्याः पापानि कुर्वन्तो गच्छन्ति परमां गतिम् ॥
data.md: The friends of humanity, by performing even acts of cruelty, have attained to exalted heaven. Pious Kshatriyas, by doing even sinful acts, to blessed ends.

data.v: ब्राह्मणस्त्रिषु कालेषु शस्त्रं गृह्णन्न दुष्यति । आत्मत्राणे वर्णदोषे दुर्गस्य नियमेषु च ॥
data.md: The Brahmana, by fighting for the three other castes, does not commit sin. People say that there is no higher duty then renouncing life under such circumstances.

data.v: अभ्युत्थिते दस्युबले क्षत्रार्थे वर्णसंकरे । संप्रमूढेषु वर्णेषु यद्यन्योऽभिभवेद्बली ॥
ब्राह्मणो यदि वा वैश्यः शूद्रो वा राजसत्तम । दस्युभ्योऽथ प्रजा रक्षेद्दण्डं धर्मेण धारयन् ॥
कार्यं कुर्यान्न वा कुर्यात्संवार्यो वा भवेन्न वा । न स्म शस्त्रं ग्रहीतव्यमन्यत्र क्षत्रबन्धुतः ॥
अपारे यो भवेत्पारमप्लवे यः प्लवो भवेत् । शूद्रो वा यदि वाप्यन्यः सर्वथा मानमर्हति ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Be he a Shudra or be he the member of any other caste, he that becomes a raft on a raftless current, or a means of crossing where no means exist, forsooth, deserves every respect.

data.v: यमाश्रित्य नरा राजन्वर्तयेयुर्यथासुखम् । अनाथाः पाल्यमाना वै दस्युभिः परिपीडिताः ॥
तमेव पूजयेरंस्ते प्रीत्या स्वमिव बान्धवम् । महद्ध्यभीक्ष्णं कौरव्य कर्ता सन्मानमर्हति ॥
किमुक्ष्णावहता कृत्यं किं धेन्वा चाप्यदुग्धया । वन्ध्यया भार्यया कोऽर्थः कोऽर्थो राज्ञाप्यरक्षता ॥
data.md: What use is there of bulls, that would not carry burdens, or of kine that would not give milk, or of a wife who is barren? Likewise, what need is there for a king who is not capable to grant protection?

data.v: यथा दारुमयो हस्ती यथा चर्ममयो मृगः । यथा ह्यनेत्रः शकटः पथि क्षेत्रं यथोषरम् ॥
एवं ब्रह्मानधीयानं राजा यश्च न रक्षिता । न वर्षति च यो मेघः सर्व एते निरर्थकाः ॥
नित्यं यस्तु सतो रक्षेदसतश्च निबर्हयेत् । स एव राजा कर्तव्यस्तेन सर्वमिदं धृतम् ॥
data.md: That person who always protects the good and checks the wicked, deserves to become a king and to govern the world.'

data.v: क्वसमुत्थाः कथंशीला ऋत्विजः स्युः पितामह । कथंविधाश्च राजेन्द्र तद्ब्रूहि वदतां वर ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said How O grandfather, should persons, employed as priests in our sacrifices, act? What sort of persons should they be, O king? Tell me all this, O foremost of orators.

data.v: प्रतिकर्म पुराचार ऋत्विजां स्म विधीयते । आदौ छन्दांसि विज्ञाय द्विजानां श्रुतमेव च ॥
data.md: Bhishma said It is laid down for those Brahmanas who are competent to officiate as priests that they should know the Chhandas including the Samans, and all the rites laid down in the Shrutis, and that they should be able to perform all such religious acts as secure the prosperity of the king.

data.v: ये त्वेकरतयो नित्यं धीरा नाप्रियवादिनः । परस्परस्य सुहृदः संमताः समदर्शिनः ॥
data.md: They should be devotedly loyal and utter sweet words in addressing kings. They should also be friendly towards one another, and regard all impartially.

data.v: येष्वानृशंस्यं सत्यं चाप्यहिंसा तप आर्जवम् । अद्रोहो नाभिमानश्च ह्रीस्तितिक्षा दमः शमः ॥
ह्रीमान्सत्यधृतिर्दान्तो भूतानामविहिंसकः । अकामद्वेषसंयुक्तस्त्रिभिः शुक्लैः समन्वितः ॥
अहिंसको ज्ञानतृप्तः स ब्रह्मासनमर्हति । एते महर्त्विजस्तात सर्वे मान्या यथातथम् ॥
यदिदं वेदवचनं दक्षिणासु विधीयते । इदं देयमिदं देयं न क्वचिद्व्यवतिष्ठते ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said There are Vedic texts relating to the gift of Dakshina in sacrifices. There is no ordinance, however, which says that so much should be given.

data.v: नेदं प्रति धनं शास्त्रमापद्धर्ममशास्त्रतः । आज्ञा शास्त्रस्य घोरेयं न शक्तिं समवेक्षते ॥
data.md: This ordinance (about the gift of Dakshina) is not the outcome of motives connected with the distribution of wealth. The command of the ordinance, when one cannot give according to the prescription, is terrible. That commandment has altogether neglected the capacity of the sacrificer.

data.v: श्रद्धामारभ्य यष्टव्यमित्येषा वैदिकी श्रुतिः । मिथ्योपेतस्य यज्ञस्य किमु श्रद्धा करिष्यति ॥
data.md: It occurs in the Vedas that a person should with devotion, celebrate a sacrifice. But what can devotion do when the sacrifice is sullied by false substitutes?

data.v: न वेदानां परिभवान्न शाठ्येन न मायया । कश्चिन्महदवाप्नोति मा ते भूद्बुद्धिरीदृशी ॥
data.md: Bhishma said No man gains blessedness or merit by disregarding the Vedas or by deceitor falsehood. Never think that it is otherwise.

data.v: यज्ञाङ्गं दक्षिणास्तात वेदानां परिबृंहणम् । न मन्त्रा दक्षिणाहीनास्तारयन्ति कथंचन ॥
data.md: Dakshina is one of the limbs of sacrifice and conduces to the nourishment of the Vedas. A sacrifice without Dakshina can never bring on salvation.

data.v: शक्तिस्तु पूर्णपात्रेण संमितानवमा भवेत् । अवश्यं तात यष्टव्यं त्रिभिर्वर्णैर्यथाविधि ॥
data.md: The efficacy, however, of a single Purnapatra is tantamount to that of any Dakshina however rich. Therefore, O sire, every one belonging to the three castes should celebrate sacrifices.

data.v: सोमो राजा ब्राह्मणानामित्येषा वैदिकी श्रुतिः । तं च विक्रेतुमिच्छन्ति न वृथा वृत्तिरिष्यते । तेन क्रीतेन धर्मेण ततो यज्ञः प्रतायते ॥
data.md: The Vedas have settled that Soma is the king of the Brahmanas. Yet they wish to sell it for the sake of celebrating sacrifices, though they never wish to sell it for acquiring a livelihood.

data.v: इत्येवं धर्मतः ख्यातमृषिभिर्धर्मवादिभिः । पुमान्यज्ञश्च सोमश्च न्यायवृत्तो यथा भवेत् । अन्यायवृत्तः पुरुषो न परस्य न चात्मनः ॥
data.md: These three, viz., a person, a sacrifice, and Soma, must have good character. A person of a bad character neither enjoy this nor the other world.

data.v: शरीरं यज्ञपात्राणि इत्येषा श्रूयते श्रुतिः । तानि सम्यक्प्रणीतानि ब्राह्मणानां महात्मनाम् ॥
data.md: We have heard this Shruti that the sacrifice which high-souled Brahmanas perform by wealth acquired by excessive physical labour, does not yield great merit.

data.v: तपो यज्ञादपि श्रेष्ठमित्येषा परमा श्रुतिः । तत्ते तपः प्रवक्ष्यामि विद्वंस्तदपि मे शृणु ॥
data.md: There is an injunction in the Vedas that penances are higher than sacrifices. I shall now describe penances to you. O learned prince listen to me.

data.v: अहिंसा सत्यवचनमानृशंस्यं दमो घृणा । एतत्तपो विदुर्धीरा न शरीरस्य शोषणम् ॥
data.md: Abstention from injury, truthfulness of speech, benevolence, are considered as penances by the wise and not the emaciation of the body.

data.v: अप्रामाण्यं च वेदानां शास्त्राणां चातिलङ्घनम् । अव्यवस्था च सर्वत्र तद्वै नाशनमात्मनः ॥
data.md: Disregard of the Vedas, disobedience to the scriptural injunctions and violation of all healthy restraints, bring on self-destruction.

data.v: निबोध दशहोतॄणां विधानं पार्थ यादृशम् । चित्तिः स्रुक्चित्तमाज्यं च पवित्रं ज्ञानमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Listen, O son of Pritha, to what has been laid down by those who pour ten libations upon mercy,-these the fire at ten times of the day.-For them who perform the sacrifice of penance, the Yoga they strive to bring about with Brahma is their ladle the heart is their clarified butter and high knowledge is their Pavitra (a couple of Kusha blades for pouring clarified butter).

data.v: सर्वं जिह्मं मृत्युपदमार्जवं ब्रह्मणः पदम् । एतावाञ्ज्ञानविषयः किं प्रलापः करिष्यति ॥
data.md: All sorts of crookedness mean death and all sorts of sincerity are called Brahma. This is the subject of knowledge. The verses of philosophers cannot affect this.

data.v: यदप्यल्पतरं कर्म तदप्येकेन दुष्करम् । पुरुषेणासहायेन किमु राज्यं पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Even the most insignificant act, O grandfather, cannot be accomplished by any man without co-operation. What then need be said of the king (who has to govern a kingdom)?

data.v: किंशीलः किंसमाचारो राज्ञोऽर्थसचिवो भवेत् । कीदृशे विश्वसेद्राजा कीदृशे नापि विश्वसेत् ॥
data.md: How should the king's minister act and behave? Upon whom should the king place confidence, and upon whom he should not?

data.v: चतुर्विधानि मित्राणि राज्ञां राजन्भवन्त्युत । सहार्थो भजमानश्च सहजः कृत्रिमस्तथा ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Kings, O monarch, have four sorts of friends. They are-one who has the same object, one who is devoted, one who is related by birth, and one who has been won over (by gifts and kindness).

data.v: धर्मात्मा पञ्चमं मित्रं स तु नैकस्य न द्वयोः । यतो धर्मस्ततो वा स्यान्मध्यस्थो वा ततो भवेत् ॥
data.md: A righteous person, who would serve one and not both sides, is the fifth of the king's friends. Such a person follow that side on which righteousness is, and accordingly acts righteously.

data.v: यस्तस्यार्थो न रोचेत न तं तस्य प्रकाशयेत् । धर्माधर्मेण राजानश्चरन्ति विजिगीषवः ॥
data.md: Regarding such a person, the king should never disclose such purpose of his as would not find his sympathy, Kings who wish to attain success are compelled to adopt both kinds of roads, fair and unfair.

data.v: चतुर्णां मध्यमौ श्रेष्ठौ नित्यं शङ्क्यौ तथापरौ । सर्वे नित्यं शङ्कितव्याः प्रत्यक्षं कार्यमात्मनः ॥
data.md: Of the four kinds of friends, the second and the third are superior, while the first and the fourth should always be looked upon with suspicion. Regarding those acts, however, which the king should do personally, he should always look with suspicion on all the four.

data.v: न हि राज्ञा प्रमादो वै कर्तव्यो मित्ररक्षणे । प्रमादिनं हि राजानं लोकाः परिभवन्त्युत ॥
data.md: The king should never act carelessly in watching his friends. A king who is careless is always overpowered by others.

data.v: असाधुः साधुतामेति साधुर्भवति दारुणः । अरिश्च मित्रं भवति मित्रं चापि प्रदुष्यति ॥
data.md: A wicked man puts on the appearance of honesty, and he who is honest becomes otherwise. An enemy may become a friend, and a friend may become an enemy.

data.v: अनित्यचित्तः पुरुषस्तस्मिन्को जातु विश्वसेत् । तस्मात्प्रधानं यत्कार्यं प्रत्यक्षं तत्समाचरेत् ॥
data.md: A man cannot always be of the same mind. Who is there that would trust him implicitly? All the principal works, therefore, a king should perform in his own presence.

data.v: एकान्तेन हि विश्वासः कृत्स्नो धर्मार्थनाशकः । अविश्वासश्च सर्वत्र मृत्युना न विशिष्यते ॥
data.md: An absolute confidence (in his ministers) destroys both morality and profit. A want of confidence again in all worse is than death.

data.v: अकालमृत्युर्विश्वासो विश्वसन्हि विपद्यते । यस्मिन्करोति विश्वासमिच्छतस्तस्य जीवति ॥
data.md: Over-confidence is premature death. One incurs danger by over-confidence, If one trusts another completely, he is said to live by the favour of the trusted person.

data.v: तस्माद्विश्वसितव्यं च शङ्कितव्यं च केषुचित् । एषा नीतिगतिस्तात लक्ष्मीश्चैव सनातनी ॥
data.md: Therefore every one should be trusted as also mistrusted. This rule of policy, O sire, should always be kept in view.

data.v: यं मन्येत ममाभावादिममर्थागमः स्पृशेत् । नित्यं तस्माच्छङ्कितव्यममित्रं तं विदुर्बुधाः ॥
data.md: One should always mistrust that person who would upon one's death, obtain one's wealth. The wise men describe such a person to be one's enemy.

data.v: यस्य क्षेत्रादप्युदकं क्षेत्रमन्यस्य गच्छति । न तत्रानिच्छतस्तस्य भिद्येरन्सर्वसेतवः ॥
data.md: From the field of any person the water enters into the other's field, the ridge should not be brocken without owner's wish.

data.v: तथैवात्युदकाद्भीतस्तस्य भेदनमिच्छति । यमेवंलक्षणं विद्यात्तममित्रं विनिर्दिशेत् ॥
data.md: Terrified with the fear of huge quantity of water that might fill up in the field, one who wants to break the ridge, he is said as enemy.

data.v: यः समृद्ध्या न तुष्येत क्षये दीनतरो भवेत् । एतदुत्तममित्रस्य निमित्तमभिचक्षते ॥
data.md: A person whose joy knows no limit upon seeing the advancement of the king and who feels pain upon seeing the king's decay, is one of the best friends of the king.

data.v: यं मन्येत ममाभावादस्याभावो भवेदिति । तस्मिन्कुर्वीत विश्वासं यथा पितरि वै तथा ॥
तं शक्त्या वर्धमानश्च सर्वतः परिबृंहयेत् । नित्यं क्षताद्वारयति यो धर्मेष्वपि कर्मसु ॥
क्षताद्भीतं विजानीयादुत्तमं मित्रलक्षणम् । ये तस्य क्षतमिच्छन्ति ते तस्य रिपवः स्मृताः ॥
व्यसनान्नित्यभीतोऽसौ समृद्ध्यामेव तृप्यते । यत्स्यादेवंविधं मित्रं तदात्मसममुच्यते ॥
data.md: That friend is like your own self who is filled with fear when calamity befalls you and with joy when prosperity smiles on you.

data.v: रूपवर्णस्वरोपेतस्तितिक्षुरनसूयकः । कुलीनः शीलसंपन्नः स ते स्यात्प्रत्यनन्तरः ॥
data.md: A person endued with beauty, fair complexion, sweet voice, liberality, highmindedness, and good birth, cannot be such a friend.

data.v: मेधावी स्मृतिमान्दक्षः प्रकृत्या चानृशंसवान् । यो मानितोऽमानितो वा न संदूष्येत्कदाचन ॥
data.md: That person who is endued with intelligence and memory, who is smart in transacting business, who is by nature shorn of cruelty, who is never wrathful, and who whether honoured or neglected is never dissatisfied, be he your priest or preceptor or trusted friend, should always receive your adoration if he accepts the office of your counsellor and lives in your palace.

data.v: ऋत्विग्वा यदि वाचार्यः सखा वात्यन्तसंस्तुतः । गृहे वसेदमात्यस्ते यः स्यात्परमपूजितः ॥
data.md: That person who is endued with intelligence and memory, who is smart in transacting business, who is by nature shorn of cruelty, who is never wrathful, and who whether honoured or neglected is never dissatisfied, be he your priest or preceptor or trusted friend, should always receive your adoration if he accepts the office of your counsellor and lives in your palace.

data.v: स ते विद्यात्परं मन्त्रं प्रकृतिं चार्थधर्मयोः । विश्वासस्ते भवेत्तत्र यथा पितरि वै तथा ॥
data.md: You may communicate to such a person your most secret counsels and the true state of never all your affairs, spiritual or temporal. You may trust him as you may your own father.

data.v: नैव द्वौ न त्रयः कार्या न मृष्येरन्परस्परम् । एकार्थादेव भूतानां भेदो भवति सर्वदा ॥
data.md: One person should be appointed to one work, and not two or three. These may not tolerate each other. It is always seen that several persons, if engaged in one and the same work, disagree with one another.

data.v: कीर्तिप्रधानो यश्च स्याद्यश्च स्यात्समये स्थितः । समर्थान्यश्च न द्वेष्टि समर्थान्कुरुते च यः ॥
यो न कामाद्भयाल्लोभात्क्रोधाद्वा धर्ममुत्सृजेत् । दक्षः पर्याप्तवचनः स ते स्यात्प्रत्यनन्तरः ॥
data.md: That person who acquires fame, who observes all restraints, who is never jealous of able and competent persons, who never does any evil act, who renounces righteousness from lust or fear or covetousness or wrath, who is smart in transaction business, and who always speaks wise and weighty words, should be your foremost of ministers.

data.v: शूरश्चार्यश्च विद्वांश्च प्रतिपत्तिविशारदः । कुलीनः शीलसंपन्नस्तितिक्षुरनसूयकः ॥
एते ह्यमात्याः कर्तव्याः सर्वकर्मस्ववस्थिताः । पूजिताः संविभक्ताश्च सुसहायाः स्वनुष्ठिताः ॥
data.md: Well-behaved persons and born in good families, who are liberal and never given to brag, who are brave and respectable, and learned and full of resources, should be appointed as ministers for supervising all your affairs. Respected by you and gratified with riches, they would act for your well-being and be of great help to you.

data.v: कृत्स्नमेते विनिक्षिप्ताः प्रतिरूपेषु कर्मसु । युक्ता महत्सु कार्येषु श्रेयांस्युत्पादयन्ति च ॥
data.md: Appointed of offices of emolument and of other important matters, they will always secure great prosperity.

data.v: एते कर्माणि कुर्वन्ति स्पर्धमाना मिथः सदा । अनुतिष्ठन्ति चैवार्थानाचक्षाणाः परस्परम् ॥
data.md: Actuated by a feeling of healthy rivalry, they satisfy all duties regarding profit, consulting with one another when necessary.

data.v: ज्ञातिभ्यश्चैव बिभ्येथा मृत्योरिव यतः सदा । उपराजेव राजर्धिं ज्ञातिर्न सहते सदा ॥
data.md: You should fear your kinsmen as you should death itself. A kinsman can never bear a kinsmen's prosperity even as a feudatory chief cannot bear to see the prosperity of his lord.

data.v: ऋजोर्मृदोर्वदान्यस्य ह्रीमतः सत्यवादिनः । नान्यो ज्ञातेर्महाबाहो विनाशमभिनन्दति ॥
data.md: None but a kinsman feels joy at the destruction of a kinsman endued with sincerity, mildness, liberality, modesty and truthfulness.

data.v: अज्ञातिता नातिसुखा नावज्ञेयास्त्वतः परम् । अज्ञातिमन्तं पुरुषं परे परिभवन्त्युत ॥
data.md: They, again, who have no kinsmen, can not be happy. No man is more contemptible than he who has no kinsman. A person who has no kinsman is easily overthrown by enemies.

data.v: निकृतस्य नरैरन्यैर्ज्ञातिरेव परायणम् । नान्यैर्निकारं सहते ज्ञातेर्ज्ञातिः कदाचन ॥
data.md: Kinsmen are the refuge of one who is attacked by others, for kinsmen can never bear to see a kinsman assailed by other people.

data.v: आत्मानमेव जानाति निकृतं बान्धवैरपि । तेषु सन्ति गुणाश्चैव नैर्गुण्यं तेषु लक्ष्यते ॥
data.md: When a kinsman is persecuted by even his friends, every kinsman of his considers the injury to be inflicted upon himself. In kinsmen, therefore, there both merits and shortcomings. A person having no kinsmen never shows favours to any one nor humbles himself to any one. In kinsmen, therefore, both mcrit and demerit are seen.

data.v: नाज्ञातिरनुगृह्णाति नाज्ञातिर्दिग्धमस्यति । उभयं ज्ञातिलोकेषु दृश्यते साध्वसाधु च ॥
तान्मानयेत्पूजयेच्च नित्यं वाचा च कर्मणा । कुर्याच्च प्रियमेतेभ्यो नाप्रियं किंचिदाचरेत् ॥
data.md: One should, for this reason, always honour and adore his kinsmen in words and deeds, and are do what pleases them without injuring them at any time.

data.v: विश्वस्तवदविश्वस्तस्तेषु वर्तेत सर्वदा । न हि दोषो गुणो वेति निस्पृक्तस्तेषु दृश्यते ॥
data.md: Though one may mistrust them at heart, he should behave towards them as if he trusted them completely. Thinking of their nature, it seems that they have neither demerits nor merits.

data.v: तस्यैवं वर्तमानस्य पुरुषस्याप्रमादिनः । अमित्राः संप्रसीदन्ति तथा मित्रीभवन्त्यपि ॥
data.md: A person who carefully conducts himself in this way finds his every enemies shorn of hostility and converted into friends.

data.v: य एवं वर्तते नित्यं ज्ञातिसंबन्धिमण्डले । मित्रेष्वमित्रेष्वैश्वर्ये चिरं यशसि तिष्ठति ॥
data.md: One who always conducts himself in this way with his kinsmen and relatives and treats thus his friends and enemies, succeeds in acquiring everlasting fame.'

data.v: एवमग्राह्यके तस्मिञ्ज्ञातिसंबन्धिमण्डले । मित्रेष्वमित्रेष्वपि च कथं भावो विभाव्यते ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said If one cannot thus win over one's kinsmen and relatives, the intending friends become foes. How should one, then, behave so that the hearts of both friends and enemies may be won?

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । वासुदेवस्य संवादं सुरर्षेर्नारदस्य च ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited the old story about the discourse between Pururavas the son of Aila and Matarishvan.

data.v: नासुहृत्परमं मन्त्रं नारदार्हति वेदितुम् । अपण्डितो वापि सुहृत्पण्डितो वापि नात्मवान् ॥
data.md: Once on a time Vasudeva said-Neither an illiterate and foolish friend, nor a learned friend of fickle mind, deserves, O Narada, to know one's secret counsels.

data.v: स ते सौहृदमास्थाय किंचिद्वक्ष्यामि नारद । कृत्स्नां च बुद्धिं संप्रेक्ष्य संपृच्छे त्रिदिवंगम ॥
data.md: Relying on your friendship for me, I shall say something to you, O sage! O you who can go to heaven at your pleasure, one should speak to another if he is convinced of the intelligence of that other.

data.v: दास्यमैश्वर्यवादेन ज्ञातीनां वै करोम्यहम् । अर्धभोक्तास्मि भोगानां वाग्दुरुक्तानि च क्षमे ॥
data.md: I never behave with slavish tendency towards my kinsmen by flattering speeches about their prosperity, I give them half of what I have, and forgive their evil words.

data.v: अरणीमग्निकामो वा मथ्नाति हृदयं मम । वाचा दुरुक्तं देवर्षे तन्मे दहति नित्यदा ॥
data.md: As a fire-stick is grinded by a person who seeks to get fire, so my heart is grinded by my kinsmen with their cruel words. Indeed, O celestial Rishi, those cruel words consume my heart every day.

data.v: बलं संकर्षणे नित्यं सौकुमार्यं पुनर्गदे । रूपेण मत्तः प्रद्युम्नः सोऽसहायोऽस्मि नारद ॥
data.md: Power lives in Sankarshana; mildness in Gada; and as regards Pradyumna, he excels even myself in beauty. Still I am helpless, O Narada!

data.v: अन्ये हि सुमहाभागा बलवन्तो दुरासदाः । नित्योत्थानेन संपन्ना नारदान्धकवृष्णयः ॥
data.md: Many others among the Andhakas and the Vrishnis are endued with great prosperity, might, daring courage and constant perseverance.

data.v: यस्य न स्युर्न वै स स्याद्यस्य स्युः कृच्छ्रमेव तत् । द्वाभ्यां निवारितो नित्यं वृणोम्येकतरं न च ॥
data.md: He, with whom they do not side, meets with destruction. He, on the other hand, with whom they side, acquires everything. Dissuaded by both Ahuka and Akrura, I do not side either of them.

data.v: स्यातां यस्याहुकाक्रूरौ किं नु दुःखतरं ततः । यस्य वापि न तौ स्यातां किं नु दुःखतरं ततः ॥
data.md: What can be more distressing for a person than to have both Ahuka and Akrura on his side? What, again, is more painful for one than not to have both of them on his side?

data.v: सोऽहं कितवमातेव द्वयोरपि महामुने । एकस्य जयमाशंसे द्वितीयस्यापराजयम् ॥
data.md: I am like the mother of two brothers gambling against each other, praying for victory to both.

data.v: ममैवं क्लिश्यमानस्य नारदोभयतः सदा । वक्तुमर्हसि यच्छ्रेयो ज्ञातीनामात्मनस्तथा ॥
data.md: I am thus, O Narada, afflicted by both. You should tell me that which is for the behoof of both myself and my kinsmen.

data.v: आपदो द्विविधाः कृष्ण बाह्याश्चाभ्यन्तराश्च ह । प्रादुर्भवन्ति वार्ष्णेय स्वकृता यदि वान्यतः ॥
data.md: Narada said Calamities, O Krishna, are of two sorts, viz., external and internal. They are begotten, O you of Vrishni's race, by one's own acts or by the acts of others.

data.v: सेयमाभ्यन्तरा तुभ्यमापत्कृच्छ्रा स्वकर्मजा । अक्रूरभोजप्रभवाः सर्वे ह्येते तदन्वयाः ॥
data.md: The calamity that has now overtaken you is an internal one and is begotten of your own acts. Valadeva and others, of the Bhoja race, are partisans of Akrura, and have sided him either for wealth, or for mere caprice, or actuated by words or by hatred. As for you, you have given away wealth obtained by you to another.

data.v: अर्थहेतोर्हि कामाद्वाद्वारा बीभत्सयापि वा । आत्मना प्राप्तमैश्वर्यमन्यत्र प्रतिपादितम् ॥
data.md: Though having many friends, you have, however, by your own act, invited calamity over your head. You cannot take back that wealth, even as one cannot swallow again the food that he has vomited himself.

data.v: कृतमूलमिदानीं तज्जातशब्दं सहायवत् । न शक्यं पुनरादातुं वान्तमन्नमिव त्वया ॥
बभ्रूग्रसेनयो राज्यं नाप्तुं शक्यं कथंचन । ज्ञातिभेदभयात्कृष्ण त्वया चापि विशेषतः ॥
data.md: The kingdom cannot be taken back from Babhru and Ugrasena. You, O Krishna, cannot, in particular, take it back from fear of creating intestine feuds.

data.v: तच्चेत्सिध्येत्प्रयत्नेन कृत्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम् । महाक्षयव्ययं वा स्याद्विनाशो वा पुनर्भवेत् ॥
data.md: Supposing the attempt succeeds, it will do so after move trouble and after the achievement of the most difficult works. A great slaughter and a great loss of wealth will take place, perhaps, even total destruction.

data.v: अनायसेन शस्त्रेण मृदुना हृदयच्छिदा । जिह्वामुद्धर सर्वेषां परिमृज्यानुमृज्य च ॥
data.md: Use then a weapon which is not made of steel, which is very mild and yet capable of piercing all hearts. Sharpening that weapon again and again rectify the tongues of your kinsmen!

data.v: अनायसं मुने शस्त्रं मृदु विद्यामहं कथम् । येनैषामुद्धरे जिह्वां परिमृज्यानुमृज्य च ॥
data.md: Use then a weapon which is not made of steel, which is very mild and yet capable of piercing all hearts. Sharpening that weapon again and again rectify the tongues of your kinsmen!

data.v: शक्त्यान्नदानं सततं तितिक्षा दम आर्जवम् । यथार्हप्रतिपूजा च शस्त्रमेतदनायसम् ॥
data.md: Narada said The giving of food to the best of your ability, forgiveness, sincerity, mildness, and honour to whom honour is due,-these make a weapon which is not made of steel.

data.v: ज्ञातीनां वक्तुकामानां कटूनि च लघूनि च । गिरा त्वं हृदयं वाचं शमयस्व मनांसि च ॥
data.md: With soft words alone turn away the anger of kinsmen about to utter cruel words, and please their hearts and minds and slanderous words.

data.v: नामहापुरुषः कश्चिन्नानात्मा नासहायवान् । महतीं धुरमादत्ते तामुद्यम्योरसा वह ॥
data.md: None who is not a great man with purified soul and endued with accomplishments and having friends can bear a heavy burden. Take up this great weight and bear it on your shoulders.

data.v: सर्व एव गुरुं भारमनड्वान्वहते समे । दुर्गे प्रतीकः सुगवो भारं वहति दुर्वहम् ॥
data.md: All oxen can carry heavy loads on a level road. The stronger ones only among them can carry such loads on a difficult road.

data.v: भेदाद्विनाशः संघानां संघमुख्योऽसि केशव । यथा त्वां प्राप्य नोत्सीदेदयं संघस्तथा कुरु ॥
data.md: Disunion will create destruction which will befall all the Bhojas and the Vrishnis! You, O Keshava, are the foremost of them. Do you act in such a way that the Bhojas and the Vrishnis may not meet with destruction.

data.v: नान्यत्र बुद्धिक्षान्तिभ्यां नान्यत्रेन्द्रियनिग्रहात् । नान्यत्र धनसंत्यागाद्गणः प्राज्ञेऽवतिष्ठते ॥
data.md: Nothing but intelligence and forgiveness, control of the senses, and liberality, reside in a person of wisdom.

data.v: धन्यं यशस्यमायुष्यं स्वपक्षोद्भावनं शुभम् । ज्ञातीनामविनाशः स्याद्यथा कृष्ण तथा कुरु ॥
data.md: The advancement of one's own race is always praiseworthy and glorious and conducive to long life. Do you, O Krishna, act in such a way that destruction may not overtake your kinsmen.

data.v: आयत्यां च तदात्वे च न तेऽस्त्यविदितं प्रभो । षाड्गुण्यस्य विधानेन यात्रायानविधौ तथा ॥
data.md: Use of the six qualities and riding on car (at the time of war), there is nothing about policy and art of war, O lord, which you do not know?

data.v: माधवाः कुकुरा भोजाः सर्वे चान्धकवृष्णयः । त्वय्यासक्ता महाबाहो लोका लोकेश्वराश्च ये ॥
data.md: The Yadavas, the Kukuras, the Bhojas, the Andhakas, and the Vrishni, all depend on you even as all the worlds and all the regents of their quarters, O mighty-armed one! The Rishis, O Madhava always pray for your advancement.

data.v: उपासते हि त्वद्बुद्धिमृषयश्चापि माधव । त्वं गुरुः सर्वभूतानां जानीषे त्वं गतागतम् । त्वामासाद्य यदुश्रेष्ठमेधन्ते ज्ञातिनः सुखम् ॥
data.md: You are the lord of all creatures. You know the past, the present, and the future. You are the foremost of all the Yadavas. Depending on you, they expect to live happily.

data.v: एषा प्रथमतो वृत्तिर्द्वितीयां शृणु भारत । यः कश्चिज्जनयेदर्थं राज्ञा रक्ष्यः स मानवः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said This that I have told you is the first means. Listen now, O Bharata, to the second one. That man who seeks the advancement of the king should always be protected by him.

data.v: ह्रियमाणममात्येन भृतो वा यदि वाभृतः । यो राजकोशं नश्यन्तमाचक्षीत युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: If a person O Yudhishthira, who is paid or not, comes to you for informing you of the damage done to your treasury when its contents are being embezzled by a minister, you should grant him an audience in private and protect him also from the minister. The minister guilty of embezzlement seek, O Bharata, to kill such informants.

data.v: श्रोतव्यं तस्य च रहो रक्ष्यश्चामात्यतो भवेत् । अमात्या ह्युपहन्तारं भूयिष्ठं घ्नन्ति भारत ॥
data.md: If a person O Yudhishthira, who is paid or not, comes to you for informing you of the damage done to your treasury when its contents are being embezzled by a minister, you should grant him an audience in private and protect him also from the minister. The minister guilty of embezzlement seek, O Bharata, to kill such informants.

data.v: राजकोशस्य गोप्तारं राजकोशविलोपकाः । समेत्य सर्वे बाधन्ते स विनश्यत्यरक्षितः ॥
data.md: They who plunder the royal treasury combine together for opposing the person who tries to protect it, and if the latter be left unprotected, he is sure to be destroyed.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । मुनिः कालकवृक्षीयः कौसल्यं यदुवाच ह ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited the old discourse between king Muchukunda and Vaishravana.

data.v: कोसलानामाधिपत्यं संप्राप्ते क्षेमदर्शिनि । मुनिः कालकवृक्षीय आजगामेति नः श्रुतम् ॥
data.md: We have heard that once on a time the sage Kalakavrikshiya came to Kshemadarshin, who had ascended the throne of Koshala.

data.v: स काकं पञ्जरे बद्ध्वा विषयं क्षेमदर्शिनः । पूर्वं पर्यचरद्युक्तः प्रवृत्त्यर्थी पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: Desirous of examining the conduct of all the officers of Kshemadarshin, the sage, with a crow kept with in cage in his hand, travelled again and again through every part of that king's dominions.

data.v: अधीये वायसीं विद्यां शंसन्ति मम वायसाः । अनागतमतीतं च यच्च संप्रति वर्तते ॥
data.md: men And he spoke to all the and said,-Study ye the practice of crows! The crows tell me the present, the past, and the future!

data.v: इति राष्ट्रे परिपतन्बहुशः पुरुषैः सह । सर्वेषां राजयुक्तानां दुष्कृतं परिपृष्टवान् ॥
data.md: Proclaiming this in the kingdom, the sage, accompanied by a large number of men, began to mark the misdeeds of all the state officers.

data.v: स बुद्ध्वा तस्य राष्ट्रस्य व्यवसायं हि सर्वशः । राजयुक्तापचारांश्च सर्वान्बुद्ध्वा ततस्ततः ॥
तमेव काकमादाय राजानं द्रष्टुमागमत् । सर्वज्ञोऽस्मीति वचनं ब्रुवाणः संशितव्रतः ॥
स स्म कौसल्यमागम्य राजामात्यमलंकृतम् । प्राह काकस्य वचनादमुत्रेदं त्वया कृतम् ॥
असौ चासौ च जानीते राजकोशस्त्वया हृतः । एवमाख्याति काकोऽयं तच्छीघ्रमनुगम्यताम् ॥
तथान्यानपि स प्राह राजकोशहरान्सदा । न चास्य वचनं किंचिदकृतं श्रूयते क्वचित् ॥
data.md: The sage then mentioned the names of other officers who had likewise been guilty of embezzlement, adding,-My crow never says anything false!

data.v: तेन विप्रकृताः सर्वे राजयुक्ताः कुरूद्वह । तमतिक्रम्य सुप्तस्य निशि काकमपोथयन् ॥
data.md: Thus accused and injured by the sage, all the officers of the king, O you of Kuru's race, in a body pierced his crow, while the sage slept at night.

data.v: वायसं तु विनिर्भिन्नं दृष्ट्वा बाणेन पञ्जरे । पूर्वाह्णे ब्राह्मणो वाक्यं क्षेमदर्शिनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Seeing his crow pierced with a shaft within the cage, the twice-born Rishi going to Kshemadarshin in the morning said to hiin,-O king, I seek your help. You are all powerful and you are the lord of the lives and riches of all! If you permit me I can then say what is for your well-bring. Sorry for you whom I regard as a friend, I have come to you, impelled by my devotion and ready to serve you with my whole heart.

data.v: राजंस्त्वामभयं याचे प्रभुं प्राणधनेश्वरम् । अनुज्ञातस्त्वया ब्रूयां वचनं त्वत्पुरो हितम् ॥
data.md: Seeing his crow pierced with a shaft within the cage, the twice-born Rishi going to Kshemadarshin in the morning said to hiin,-O king, I seek your help. You are all powerful and you are the lord of the lives and riches of all! If you permit me I can then say what is for your well-bring. Sorry for you whom I regard as a friend, I have come to you, impelled by my devotion and ready to serve you with my whole heart.

data.v: मित्रार्थमभिसंतप्तो भक्त्या सर्वात्मना गतः । अयं तवार्थं हरते यो ब्रूयादक्षमान्वितः ॥
data.md: You are being robbed of your wealth, I have come to you for disclosing it without showing any mercy for the robbers. Like a driver that urges a good horse, I have come here for awakening you whom I consider a friend.

data.v: संबुबोधयिषुर्मित्रं सदश्वमिव सारथिः । अतिमन्युप्रसक्तो हि प्रसज्य हितकारणम् ॥
data.md: A friend who knows his own interests and seeks his own prosperity and advancement, should forgive a friend that intruded himself forcibly, actuated by devotion at anger, for doing what is beneficial.

data.v: तथाविधस्य सुहृदः क्षन्तव्यं संविजानता । ऐश्वर्यमिच्छता नित्यं पुरुषेण बुभूषता ॥
data.md: The king replied to him, saying,—Why should I not hear anything which you will say, since I am not blind to what is for my good?

data.v: तं राजा प्रत्युवाचेदं यन्मा किंचिद्भवान्वदेत् । कस्मादहं न क्षमेयमाकाङ्क्षन्नात्मनो हितम् ॥
data.md: I grant you permission, O twice-born one! Tell me what you like. I shall certainly obey your instructions, O Brahmana!

data.v: ब्राह्मण प्रतिजानीहि प्रब्रूहि यदि चेच्छसि । करिष्यामि हि ते वाक्यं यद्यन्मां विप्र वक्ष्यसि ॥
data.md: The Sage said, Ascertaining the merits and demerits of your servants, as also the dangers which you may meet with at their hands, I have come to you, actuated by my devotion, for informing you of everything.

data.v: ज्ञात्वा नयानपायांश्च भृत्यतस्ते भयानि च । भक्त्या वृत्तिं समाख्यातुं भवतोऽन्तिकमागमम् ॥
data.md: His carelessness may create the king's anger, and such anger may bring about his destruction. Carefully learning how to behave himself, one should sit before the king as he should in the presence of a burning fire.

data.v: प्रागेवोक्तश्च दोषोऽयमाचार्यैर्नृपसेविनाम् । अगतीकगतिर्ह्येषा या राज्ञा सह जीविका ॥
data.md: The ancient preceptors have declared what the curses are, O king, of those that serve others. The lot of those that serve the king is very miserable and wretched.

data.v: आशीविषैश्च तस्याहुः संगतं यस्य राजभिः । बहुमित्राश्च राजानो बह्वमित्रास्तथैव च ॥
data.md: He who has any connection with kings is said to have connection with snakes of deadly venom. Kings have many friends as also many enemies.

data.v: तेभ्यः सर्वेभ्य एवाहुर्भयं राजोपसेविनाम् । अथैषामेकतो राजन्मुहूर्तादेव भीर्भवेत् ॥
data.md: Those who serve kings have to fear all of them. Every moment, again, they entertain fear from the king himself, O monarch.

data.v: नैकान्तेनाप्रमादो हि कर्तुं शक्यो महीपतौ । न तु प्रमादः कर्तव्यः कथंचिद्भूतिमिच्छता ॥
data.md: A person serving the king cannot escape the charge of carelessness in doing the king's work. Indeed, a servant who desires to acquire prosperity should never show carelessness in the discharge of his duties.

data.v: प्रमादाद्धि स्खलेद्राजा स्खलिते नास्ति जीवितम् । अग्निं दीप्तमिवासीदेद्राजानमुपशिक्षितः ॥
data.md: He should always fear to utter evil words before the king, or to sit cheerlessly or in disrespectful postures, or to walk disdainfully, or to show insolent gestures and disrespectful motions of the limbs.

data.v: आशीविषमिव क्रुद्धं प्रभुं प्राणधनेश्वरम् । यत्नेनोपचरेन्नित्यं नाहमस्मीति मानवः ॥
data.md: Prepared to give up his life itself at every moment, one should serve the king attentively, for the king is all powerful and lord of the lives and the riches of all, and, therefore, like to a snake of deadly venom.

data.v: दुर्व्याहृताच्छङ्कमानो दुष्कृताद्दुरधिष्ठितात् । दुरासिताद्दुर्व्रजितादिङ्गितादङ्गचेष्टितात् ॥
data.md: If the king becomes pleased he can shower prosperity like a god. If he becomes angry he can consume to the very roots like a burning fire.

data.v: देवतेव हि सर्वार्थान्कुर्याद्राजा प्रसादितः । वैश्वानर इव क्रुद्धः समूलमपि निर्दहेत् । इति राजन्मयः प्राह वर्तते च तथैव तत् ॥
data.md: This, O king, was said by Yama. Its truth is seen in the wordly affairs. I shall now do what would increase your prosperity.

data.v: अथ भूयांसमेवार्थं करिष्यामि पुनः पुनः । ददात्यस्मद्विधोऽमात्यो बुद्धिसाहाय्यमापदि ॥
वायसश्चैव मे राजन्नन्तकायाभिसंहितः । न च मेऽत्र भवान्गर्ह्यो न च येषां भवान्प्रियः । हिताहितांस्तु बुध्येथा मा परोक्षमतिर्भव ॥
ये त्वादानपरा एव वसन्ति भवतो गृहे । अभूतिकामा भूतानां तादृशैर्मेऽभिसंहितम् ॥
ये वा भवद्विनाशेन राज्यमिच्छन्त्यनन्तरम् । अन्तरैरभिसंधाय राजन्सिध्यन्ति नान्यथा ॥
तेषामहं भयाद्राजन्गमिष्याम्यन्यमाश्रमम् । तैर्हि मे संधितो बाणः काके निपतितः प्रभो ॥
data.md: Through fear of those men, O king, I shall leave this kingdom for some other hermitage. I have no worldly desire, yet those deceitful persons have shot this arrow at my crow, and have, O lord, sent the bird to Yama's abode. I have seen this, O king, with eyes whose vision has been improved by ascetic penances.

data.v: छद्मना मम काकश्च गमितो यमसादनम् । दृष्टं ह्येतन्मया राजंस्तपोदीर्घेण चक्षुषा ॥
data.md: With the help of this single crow I have crossed this kingdom of yours that is like a river consisting of alligators, shark, crocodiles and whales.

data.v: बहुनक्रझषग्राहां तिमिंगिलगणायुताम् । काकेन बडिशेनेमामतार्षं त्वामहं नदीम् ॥
data.md: Indeed, with the help of that bird, I have passed through your dominions like Himalayan valley, impenetrable and inaccessible for these trunks of (fallen) trees and scattered rocks and thorny shrubs and lions and tigers and other beasts of prey.

data.v: स्थाण्वश्मकण्टकवतीं व्याघ्रसिंहगजाकुलाम् । दुरासदां दुष्प्रवेशां गुहां हैमवतीमिव ॥
data.md: The learned hold that a region inaccessible for darkness can be passed through with the a help of a light, and an unfordable river can be crossed by means of a boat. No means, however, exist for penetrating through the labyrinth of royal affairs.

data.v: अग्निना तामसं दुर्गं नौभिराप्यं च गम्यते । राजदुर्गावतरणे नोपायं पण्डिता विदुः ॥
data.md: Your kingdom is like an inaccessible forest covered with darkness. You cannot trust it. How then can I.

data.v: गहनं भवतो राज्यमन्धकारतमोवृतम् । नेह विश्वसितुं शक्यं भवतापि कुतो मया ॥
data.md: Good and evil are seen here in the same light. To live here is not, therefore, safe. Here a righteous person meets with death, while an unrighteous man incurs no danger.

data.v: अतो नायं शुभो वासस्तुल्ये सदसती इह । वधो ह्येवात्र सुकृते दुष्कृते न च संशयः ॥
data.md: For the sake of justice, a person of unrighteous deeds should be killed but never one who is righteous in his deeds. It is not proper, therefore, for one to live in this kingdom long. A sensible man should leave this country soon.

data.v: न्यायतो दुष्कृते घातः सुकृते स्यात्कथं वधः । नेह युक्तं चिरं स्थातुं जवेनातो व्रजेद्बुधः ॥

data.md: There is a river, O king, of the name of Sita. Boats sink in it. This your kingdom is like that river. An all-destructive net appears to have been cast around it.

data.v: मधुप्रपातो हि भवान्भोजनं विषसंयुतम् । असतामिव ते भावो वर्तते न सतामिव । आशीविषैः परिवृतः कूपस्त्वमिव पार्थिव ॥
data.md: You are like the fall which awaits the collectors of honey, or like attractive food containing poison. Your nature now resembles that of dishonest men and not that of the good. You are like a pit, o king, abounding with snakes of deadly venom.

data.v: दुर्गतीर्था बृहत्कूला करीरीवेत्रसंयुता । नदी मधुरपानीया यथा राजंस्तथा भवान् । श्वगृध्रगोमायुयुतो राजहंससमो ह्यसि ॥
data.md: You resemble, O king, a river full of sweet water but difficult of access, with steep banks overgrown with Kariras and thorny canes. You are like a swan in the midst of dogs, vultures, and jackals.

data.v: यथाश्रित्य महावृक्षं कक्षः संवर्धते महान् । ततस्तं संवृणोत्येव तमतीत्य च वर्धते ॥
data.md: Parasites, supported by a huge tree, grow luxuriously, and at last covering the tree itself overshadow it entirely. A forest fire sets in, and catching those grasses first, consumes the tree with them. Thy ministers, O king, resemble those parasites of which I speak, Do you check and correct them.

data.v: तेनैवोपेन्धनो नूनं दावो दहति दारुणः । तथोपमा ह्यमात्यास्ते राजंस्तान्परिशोधय ॥

data.md: They have been nourished by you, But making conspiracy against you, they are destroying your prosperity.

data.md: Concealing the faults of your servants, I am living in your palace in constant dread of danger, even like a person living in a room with a snake within it or like the lover of a hero's wife. My object is to ascertain the behaviour of the king who lives with me.

data.v: कच्चिज्जितेन्द्रियो राजा कच्चिदभ्यन्तरा जिताः । कच्चिदेषां प्रियो राजा कच्चिद्राज्ञः प्रियाः प्रजाः ॥

data.md: They have found fault with me, because I seek your well-being. I have no doubt that there is no other cause for their hostility to me.

data.v: न हि तेषामहं द्रुग्धस्तत्तेषां दोषवद्गतम् । अरेर्हि दुर्हताद्भेयं भग्नपृष्ठादिवोरगात् ॥
data.md: I do not cherish any hostility towards them. I am engaged in only ascertaining their faults. As one should fear a wounded snake, cvery one should fear a wicked foe.

data.md: The king said Reside in my abode, O Brahmana. I shall always treat you with respect and honour, and always adore you.

data.v: ये त्वां ब्राह्मण नेच्छन्ति न ते वत्स्यन्ति मे गृहे । भवतैव हि तज्ज्ञेयं यदिदानीमनन्तरम् ॥
data.md: They that will dislike you shall not live with me. Do you then yourself award what should be their proper sentence.

data.md: Do you see, O holy one, then that the rod of punishment is wielded properly and that everything is done well in my kingdom. Reflecting upon everything, do you guide me in such a way that I may acquire prosperity!

data.md: The sage said Closing your eyes first of all to this offence of theirs, do you weaken them one by one. Prove their faults then and punish them one after another.

data.v: एकदोषा हि बहवो मृद्नीयुरपि कण्टकान् । मन्त्रभेदभयाद्राजंस्तस्मादेतद्ब्रवीमि ते ॥
data.md: When many person become guilty of the same offence, they can, by acting in concert, soften the very points of the thorns. Lest your ministers (being suspected, act against you and) disclose your secret counsels, I advise you to proceed cautiously.

data.v: वयं तु ब्राह्मणा नाम मृदुदण्डाः कृपालवः । स्वस्ति चेच्छामि भवतः परेषां च यथात्मनः ॥
data.md: As regards ourselves, we are Brahmanas, by nature merciful and reluctant to give pain to any one. We desire your, as well as of others, well-being, even as we wish the good of ourselves.

data.v: राजन्नात्मानमाचक्षे संबन्धी भवतो ह्यहम् । मुनिः कालकवृक्षीय इत्येवमभिसंज्ञितः ॥
data.md: I speak of myself, O king! I am your friend. I am known as the sage Kalakavrikshiya.

data.v: पितुः सखा च भवतः संमतः सत्यसंगरः । व्यापन्ने भवतो राज्ये राजन्पितरि संस्थिते ॥

data.md: Always follow truth. Your father knew me as his friend. When distress overtook this kingdom during the reign of your father, O king, I performed many penances (for driving it off). data.v: उभे दृष्ट्वा दुःखसुखे राज्यं प्राप्य यदृच्छया । राज्येनामात्यसंस्थेन कथं राजन्प्रमाद्यसि ॥
data.md: You have obtained a kingdom without any hitch. Think of everything connected with its happiness and misery. You have ministers in your kingdom. But why, O king, should you be guilty of carelessness?

data.v: ततो राजकुले नान्दी संजज्ञे भूयसी पुनः । पुरोहितकुले चैव संप्राप्ते ब्राह्मणर्षभे ॥
data.md: After this, the king of Koshala took a minister from the Kshatriya order, and appointed that foremost of Brahmana (viz., the sage Kalakavrikshiya), as his priest.

data.md: After these changes had been made, the king of Koshala brought the whole Earth under subjection and acquired great fame. The sage Kalakavrikshiya adored the gods in many grand sacrifices performed for the king.

data.md: Having listened to his wholesome advice, the king of Koshala conquered the whole Earth and acted in every way as the sage directed.

data.md: Bhishma said Such persons as are endued with modesty, self-control, truth, sincerity, and courage to say the proper thing, should be your law-makers.

data.md: They who are always devoted to you who are gifted with great courage, who are of the twice-bom caste, highly learned, well pleased with you, and persevering in acts, should, O son of Kunti, be sought by you for becoming your ministers of war at all seasons of distress, O Bharata!

data.md: Those who have been swon over with gifts of wealth, honour, respectful receptions, and means of giving happiness, and who on that account may be known by you as persons inclined to do you good in all your affairs, should always be made sharers of your happiness.

data.v: अभिन्नवृत्ता विद्वांसः सद्वृत्ताश्चरितव्रताः । न त्वां नित्यार्थिनो जह्युरक्षुद्राः सत्यवादिनः ॥
data.md: They who are unchangeable in conduct, endued with learning and good behaviour, observant of excellent vows, large-hearted, and truthful in speech, will always attend to your affairs and will never forsake you.

data.v: अनार्या ये न जानन्ति समयं मन्दचेतसः । तेभ्यः प्रतिजुगुप्सेथा जानीयाः समयच्युतान् ॥
data.md: They, on the other hand, who disrespectable, who do not follow healthy control, who are wicked, and who have fallen away from good practices, should always be compelled by you to observe all healthy restraints.

data.md: When the question arises as to which of two sides should be adopted, you should not abandon the many for adopting the side of one. When, however, that one person excels the many by virtue of his possessing many accomplishments, then you should for that one, forsake the many.

data.md: The marks of superiority, are prowess, devotion to works that bring fame, and observance of healthy restraints. are

data.md: He, again, who honours all able persons that never cherishes feelings of rivalry with meritorious persons, who never forsakes righteousness from lust or fear or anger or covetousness, who is humble, who is truthful and forgiving, who has his mind under control, who has a sense of dignity, and who has been tried in every situation, should be appointed by you as your counsellor.

data.md: High birth, purity of blood, forgiveness, cleverness, and purify of mind, bravery gratefulness, and truthfulness are, O son of Pritha, characteristic of superiority and goodness.

data.md: A person who carefully conducts himself in this way finds his every enemies shorn of hostility and converted into friends.

data.md: A king who has his mind under control, who is endued with wisdom, and who seeks prosperity, should carefully examine the merits and demerits of his ministers.

data.md: The king should appoint five such persons to superintend his affairs, who are intelligent, shorn of pride, possessed of a good disposition, energy, patience, forgiveness, purity, loyalty, firmness, and courage, whose merits and faults have been well proved, who are aged, who are capable of bearing burden and who are free from deceit.

data.v: पर्याप्तवचनान्वीरान्प्रतिपत्तिविशारदान् । कुलीनान्सत्यसंपन्नानिङ्गितज्ञाननिष्ठुरान् ॥
data.md: Men who are wise in speech, who are endued which heroism, who are full of resources under difficulties, who are of high descent, who are truthful, who can read signs, who are shorn of cruelty, who know the requirements of place and time, and who seek the well-being of their masters, should be appointed by the king as his ministers in all affairs of the kingdom.

data.v: देशकालविधानज्ञान्भर्तृकार्यहितैषिणः । नित्यमर्थेषु सर्वेषु राजा कुर्वीत मन्त्रिणः ॥
data.md: Those who are of good-birth and good behaviour, who can interpret all sings and gestures, who are shorn of cruelty, who know the requirements of place and time, who always seek the well-being of their master in all works, should be appointed as ministers by the king in all his affairs.

data.v: हीनतेजा ह्यसंहृष्टो नैव जातु व्यवस्यति । अवश्यं जनयत्येव सर्वकर्मसु संशयान् ॥
data.md: One who is shorn of energy and who has been forsaken by friends can never work with perseverance. Such a man if, appointed, fails in almost every work.

data.v: एवमल्पश्रुतो मन्त्री कल्याणाभिजनोऽप्युत । धर्मार्थकामयुक्तोऽपि नालं मन्त्रं परीक्षितुम् ॥
data.md: A minister possessing little learning, even if he be highly born and attentive to virtue, profit, and pleasure, cannot choose proper courses of action.

data.v: तथैवानभिजातोऽपि काममस्तु बहुश्रुतः । अनायक इवाचक्षुर्मुह्यत्यूह्येषु कर्मसु ॥
data.md: Likewise, a person of low birth, even if endued with great learning, always makes mistakes, like a blind man without a guide, in all acts requiring cleverness and foresight.
