data.md: A person, again, who is of unsettled purposes, even if endued with intelligence and learning, and even if conversant with means, cannot long act with success.

data.v: केवलात्पुनराचारात्कर्मणो नोपपद्यते । परिमर्शो विशेषाणामश्रुतस्येह दुर्मतेः ॥
data.md: A wicked man possessed of no learning may begin a work but he fails to determine what the results will be of his work.

data.v: मन्त्रिण्यननुरक्ते तु विश्वासो न हि विद्यते । तस्मादननुरक्ताय नैव मन्त्रं प्रकाशयेत् ॥
data.md: A king should never trust a minister who is not devoted to him. He should, therefore, never give out his counsels to a minister who is not devoted to him.

data.v: व्यथयेद्धि स राजानं मन्त्रिभिः सहितोऽनृजुः । मारुतोपहतच्छिद्रैः प्रविश्याग्निरिव द्रुमम् ॥
data.md: Such a wicked minister, in conjunction with the other minister of the king, may ruin his lord, like fire consuming a tree by entering into it through the holes in its body with the help of the wind.

data.v: संक्रुध्यत्येकदा स्वामी स्थानाच्चैवापकर्षति । वाचा क्षिपति संरब्धस्ततः पश्चात्प्रसीदति ॥
data.md: Being angry, a master may, deprive a servant of his office or reprove him, from rage, in harsh words, and restore him to power again.

data.v: तानि तान्यनुरक्तेन शक्यान्यनुतितिक्षितुम् । मन्त्रिणां च भवेत्क्रोधो विस्फूर्जितमिवाशनेः ॥
data.md: None save a servant devoted to the master stand and overlook such treatment. Ministers also become sometimes highly offended with their masters. can

data.v: यस्तु संहरते तानि भर्तुः प्रियचिकीर्षया । समानसुखदुःखं तं पृच्छेदर्थेषु मानवम् ॥
data.md: That one, amongst them, who subdues his anger from desire of doing good to his master,-that person who partakes in the king's happiness and misfortune, should be consulted by the king in all his affairs.

data.v: अनृजुस्त्वनुरक्तोऽपि संपन्नश्चेतरैर्गुणैः । राज्ञः प्रज्ञानयुक्तोऽपि न मन्त्रं श्रोतुमर्हति ॥
data.md: An wily person, even if he be devoted to his master and possessed of wisdom and adorned with numerous accomplishments, should never be consulted by the king.

data.v: योऽमित्रैः सह संबद्धो न पौरान्बहु मन्यते । स सुहृत्तादृशो राज्ञो न मन्त्रं श्रोतुमर्हति ॥
data.md: One who is allied with enemies and who does not care for the interests of the king's subjects, should be regarded as an enemy. The king should never consult him.

data.v: अविद्वानशुचिः स्तब्धः शत्रुसेवी विकत्थनः । स सुहृत्क्रोधनो लुब्धो न मन्त्रं श्रोतुमर्हति ॥
data.md: One who is not learned, who is not pure, who is proud, who seeks the king's enemies, who is given to brag, who is unfriendly, wrathful, and covetous, should should not be consulted by the king.

data.v: आगन्तुश्चानुरक्तोऽपि काममस्तु बहुश्रुतः । सत्कृतः संविभक्तो वा न मन्त्रं श्रोतुमर्हति ॥
data.md: One who is a stranger, even if he be devoted to the king and possessed of great learning, may be honoured by the king and pleased with maintenance, but the king should never consult him in his affairs.

data.v: यस्त्वल्पेनापि कार्येण सकृदाक्षारितो भवेत् । पुनरन्यैर्गुणैर्युक्तो न मन्त्रं श्रोतुमर्हति ॥
data.md: A well-wisher whose property was once confiscated for a slight offences, even if he be endued with all accomplishments, should not still be consulted by the king.

data.v: कृतप्रज्ञश्च मेधावी बुधो जानपदः शुचिः । सर्वकर्मसु यः शुद्धः स मन्त्रं श्रोतुमर्हति ॥
data.md: A person endued with wisdom, intelligence, and learning, who is born within the kingdom, who is pure and righteous in all his works, should be consulted by the king.

data.v: ज्ञानविज्ञानसंपन्नः प्रकृतिज्ञः परात्मनोः । सुहृदात्मसमो राज्ञः स मन्त्रं श्रोतुमर्हति ॥
data.md: One who is possessed of knowledge and wisdom, who knows the nature of friends and foes, who is a friend of the king like his second self, should be consulted.

data.v: सत्यवाक्शीलसंपन्नो गम्भीरः सत्रपो मृदुः । पितृपैतामहो यः स्यात्स मन्त्रं श्रोतुमर्हति ॥
data.md: One who is truthful in speech and modest and mild, and who is a hereditary servant of the king, should be consulted.

data.v: संतुष्टः संमतः सत्यः शौटीरो द्वेष्यपापकः । मन्त्रवित्कालविच्छूरः स मन्त्रं श्रोतुमर्हति ॥
data.md: One who is contented and honoured, who is truthful and dignified, who hates wickedness and wicked men, who is conversant with policy and the requirements of time, and who is courageous, should be consulted by the king.

data.v: सर्वलोकं समं शक्तः सान्त्वेन कुरुते वशे । तस्मै मन्त्रः प्रयोक्तव्यो दण्डमाधित्सता नृप ॥
data.md: One who is capable to win over all men by conciliation should be consulted, O monarch, by the king, who wishes to rule according to the dictates of the science of punishment.

data.v: पौरजानपदा यस्मिन्विश्वासं धर्मतो गताः । योद्धा नयविपश्चिच्च स मन्त्रं श्रोतुमर्हति ॥
data.md: One whom the inhabitants of both the capital and the provinces truth for his righteous ! conduct, who is competent to right and conversant with the rules of policy, should be consulted by the king.

data.v: तस्मात्सर्वैर्गुणैरेतैरुपपन्नाः सुपूजिताः । मन्त्रिणः प्रकृतिज्ञाः स्युस्त्र्यवरा महदीप्सवः ॥
data.md: Therefore, men endued with such accomplishments, men conversant with the nature of all and desirous of achieving high acts, should be honoured by the king and made his ministers. Their number also should not be less than three.

data.v: स्वासु प्रकृतिषु छिद्रं लक्षयेरन्परस्य च । मन्त्रिणो मन्त्रमूलं हि राज्ञो राष्ट्रं विवर्धते ॥
data.md: Ministers should be employed in noticing the shortcomings of their masters, of themselves, of the subject, and of the foes of their masters. The kingdom depends upon the counsels of policy which the ministers give, and its growth originates from the same source.

data.v: नास्य छिद्रं परः पश्येच्छिद्रेषु परमन्वियात् । गूहेत्कूर्म इवाङ्गानि रक्षेद्विवरमात्मनः ॥
data.md: Ministers should act in such a way that the enemies of their master may not be able to detect his loopholes. On the other hand, when their shortcomings are seen, they should then be assailed. Like the tortoise protecting its limbs by withdrawing them within its shell, ministers should keep close their own counsels. They should, even thus, conceal their own short-comings. Those ministers of a kingdom, who succeed in keeping their counsels close, are said to be wise. Counsels are the armour of a king, and the limbs are his subjects and officers.

data.v: मन्त्रग्राहा हि राज्यस्य मन्त्रिणो ये मनीषिणः । मन्त्रसंहननो राजा मन्त्राङ्गानीतरो जनः ॥
data.md: Ministers should act in such a way that the enemies of their master may not be able to detect his loopholes. On the other hand, when their shortcomings are seen, they should then be assailed. Like the tortoise protecting its limbs by withdrawing them within its shell, ministers should keep close their own counsels. They should, even thus, conceal their own short-comings. Those ministers of a kingdom, who succeed in keeping their counsels close, are said to be wise. Counsels are the armour of a king, and the limbs are his subjects and officers.

data.v: राज्यं प्रणिधिमूलं हि मन्त्रसारं प्रचक्षते । स्वामिनं त्वनुवर्तन्ति वृत्त्यर्थमिह मन्त्रिणः ॥
data.md: A kingdom depends upon spies and secret agents, and its strength lies in counsels of policy. If masters and ministers follow each other for getting support from each other, controlling pride and anger, and vanity and envy, they may then both become happy.

data.v: स विनीय मदक्रोधौ मानमीर्ष्यां च निर्वृतः । नित्यं पञ्चोपधातीतैर्मन्त्रयेत्सह मन्त्रिभिः ॥
data.md: A king should also consult such minister as are free from the five kinds of deceit.

data.v: तेषां त्रयाणां विविधं विमर्शं; बुध्येत चित्तं विनिवेश्य तत्र । स्वनिश्चयं तं परनिश्चयं च; निवेदयेदुत्तरमन्त्रकाले ॥
धर्मार्थकामज्ञमुपेत्य पृच्छे;द्युक्तो गुरुं ब्राह्मणमुत्तमार्थम् । निष्ठा कृता तेन यदा सह स्या;त्तं तत्र मार्गं प्रणयेदसक्तम् ॥
एवं सदा मन्त्रयितव्यमाहु;र्ये मन्त्रतत्त्वार्थविनिश्चयज्ञाः । तस्मात्त्वमेवं प्रणयेः सदैव; मन्त्रं प्रजासंग्रहणे समर्थम् ॥
data.md: Those who know the science of consultation hold that kings should always hold consultation in this way. Having settled plans in this way, they should then carry them into execution, for then they will be able to win over all the subjects.

data.v: न वामनाः कुब्जकृशा न खञ्जा; नान्धा जडाः स्त्री न नपुंसकं च । न चात्र तिर्यङ्न पुरो न पश्चा;न्नोर्ध्वं न चाधः प्रचरेत कश्चित् ॥
data.md: There should be no dwarfs, no humpbacked persons, no lean man, no lame or blind man, no idiot, no woman, and no eunuch, at the spot where the king holds his consultations. Nothing should move there, before or behind, above or below, or in opposite directions.

data.v: आरुह्य वातायनमेव शून्यं; स्थलं प्रकाशं कुशकाशहीनम् । वागङ्गदोषान्परिहृत्य मन्त्रं; संमन्त्रयेत्कार्यमहीनकालम् ॥
data.md: Getting up on a boat, or going to an open space shorn of grass and grassy bushes and whence the surrounding land may be distinctly seen, the king should hold consultations at the proper time, avoiding shortcomings of speech and gestures.'

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । बृहस्पतेश्च संवादं शक्रस्य च युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited the old story about the discourse between Pururavas the son of Aila and Matarishvan.

data.v: किं स्विदेकपदं ब्रह्मन्पुरुषः सम्यगाचरन् । प्रमाणं सर्वभूतानां यशश्चैवाप्नुयान्महत् ॥
data.md: What is that one act, O twice-born one, by finishing which with care, a person may be respected by all creatures and become famous.

data.v: सान्त्वमेकपदं शक्र पुरुषः सम्यगाचरन् । प्रमाणं सर्वभूतानां यशश्चैवाप्नुयान्महत् ॥
data.md: What is that one act, O twice-born one, by finishing which with care, a person may be respected by all creatures and become famous.

data.v: एतदेकपदं शक्र सर्वलोकसुखावहम् । आचरन्सर्वभूतेषु प्रियो भवति सर्वदा ॥
data.md: This is the one thing, O Shakra, which yields happiness to all. By practising it, one may always secure the love of all creatures.

data.v: यो हि नाभाषते किंचित्सततं भ्रुकुटीमुखः । द्वेष्यो भवति भूतानां स सान्त्वमिह नाचरन् ॥
data.md: The person who does not speak a word and whose face is always marked with frowns is hated of all. Want of sweet speeches makes him so.

data.v: यस्तु पूर्वमभिप्रेक्ष्य पूर्वमेवाभिभाषते । स्मितपूर्वाभिभाषी च तस्य लोकः प्रसीदति ॥
data.md: That person who, on seeing others, speaks to them first with smiles, succeeds in winning over every one.

data.v: दानमेव हि सर्वत्र सान्त्वेनानभिजल्पितम् । न प्रीणयति भूतानि निर्व्यञ्जनमिवाशनम् ॥
data.md: Even gifts, if not made with sweet speeches, do not please the recipients, like rice without curry.

data.v: अदाता ह्यपि भूतानां मधुरामीरयन्गिरम् । सर्वलोकमिमं शक्र सान्त्वेन कुरुते वशे ॥
data.md: If even the wealth of men, O Shakra, be snatched away with sweet speeches, such sweetness of conduct can even propitiate the robbed.

data.v: तस्मात्सान्त्वं प्रकर्तव्यं दण्डमाधित्सतामिह । फलं च जनयत्येवं न चास्योद्विजते जनः ॥
data.md: A king, therefore, who is desirous of even inflicting punishment, should use sweet words. Sweetness of speech never fails, while at the same time it never pains any heart.

data.v: सुकृतस्य हि सान्त्वस्य श्लक्ष्णस्य मधुरस्य च । सम्यगासेव्यमानस्य तुल्यं जातु न विद्यते ॥
data.md: A person of good deeds and good, pleasant and sweet speeches, has no peer.

data.v: इत्युक्तः कृतवान्सर्वं तथा शक्रः पुरोधसा । तथा त्वमपि कौन्तेय सम्यगेतत्समाचर ॥
data.md: Bhishma continued Thus addressed by his priest, Shakra began to follow those instructions. Do you also, O son of Kunti, practise this virtue.'

data.v: कथं स्विदिह राजेन्द्र पालयन्पार्थिवः प्रजाः । प्रति धर्मं विशेषेण कीर्तिमाप्नोति शाश्वतीम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O foremost of kings, what is that method by which a king governing his subjects may, thereby, acquire great blessedness and eternal fame?

data.v: व्यवहारेण शुद्धेन प्रजापालनतत्परः । प्राप्य धर्मं च कीर्तिं च लोकावाप्नोत्युभौ शुचिः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said A king of pure soul and devoted to the duty of protecting his subjects acquires merit and fame, both here and hereafter, by acting righteously.

data.v: कीदृशं व्यवहारं तु कैश्च व्यवहरेन्नृपः । एतत्पृष्टो महाप्राज्ञ यथावद्वक्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said What should attitude of the king with regard to the treatment of others. Asked by me, O you of great wisdom, you should tell me everything duly!

data.v: ये चैते पूर्वकथिता गुणास्ते पुरुषं प्रति । नैकस्मिन्पुरुषे ह्येते विद्यन्त इति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: The virtues of men, which you have described, cannot be found to exist in any single individual. Bhishma said-

data.v: एवमेतन्महाप्राज्ञ यथा वदसि बुद्धिमान् । दुर्लभः पुरुषः कश्चिदेभिर्गुणगुणैर्युतः ॥
data.md: You are highly intelligent, O Yudhishthira! It is what you say. The person is very rare who is endued with all those good qualities.

data.v: किं तु संक्षेपतः शीलं प्रयत्ने नेह दुर्लभम् । वक्ष्यामि तु यथामात्यान्यादृशांश्च करिष्यसि ॥
data.md: In short, such a one, [who is possessed of all those virtues) is very difficult to be seen even upon careful search. I shall, however, tell you what kinds of ministers should be appointed by you.

data.v: चतुरो ब्राह्मणान्वैद्यान्प्रगल्भान्सात्त्विकाञ्शुचीन् । त्रींश्च शूद्रान्विनीतांश्च शुचीन्कर्मणि पूर्वके ॥
अष्टाभिश्च गुणैर्युक्तं सूतं पौराणिकं चरेत् । पञ्चाशद्वर्षवयसं प्रगल्भमनसूयकम् ॥
मतिस्मृतिसमायुक्तं विनीतं समदर्शनम् । कार्ये विवदमानानां शक्तमर्थेष्वलोलुपम् ॥
विवर्जितानां व्यसनैः सुघोरैः सप्तभिर्भृशम् । अष्टानां मन्त्रिणां मध्ये मन्त्रं राजोपधारयेत् ॥
ततः संप्रेषयेद्राष्ट्रे राष्ट्रायाथ च दर्शयेत् । अनेन व्यवहारेण द्रष्टव्यास्ते प्रजाः सदा ॥
data.md: He should then announce in his kingdom, for the information of his subjects, the results of such consultations. You should always, following such a conduct, watch over your people.

data.v: न चापि गूढं कार्यं ते ग्राह्यं कार्योपघातकम् । कार्ये खलु विपन्ने त्वां सोऽधर्मस्तांश्च पीडयेत् ॥
data.md: You should never confiscate what is deposited with you or appropriate the thing whose ownership is disputed by two persons. Such a conduct would spoil the administration of justice. If the administration of justice be thus spoiled will assail you, and afflict your kingdom as well and strike your people with fear as little birds on seeing the hawk. Your kingdom will then vanish like a boat wrecked on the sea.

data.v: विद्रवेच्चैव राष्ट्रं ते श्येनात्पक्षिगणा इव । परिस्रवेच्च सततं नौर्विशीर्णेव सागरे ॥
data.md: You should never confiscate what is deposited with you or appropriate the thing whose ownership is disputed by two persons. Such a conduct would spoil the administration of justice. If the administration of justice be thus spoiled will assail you, and afflict your kingdom as well and strike your people with fear as little birds on seeing the hawk. Your kingdom will then vanish like a boat wrecked on the sea.

data.v: प्रजाः पालयतोऽसम्यगधर्मेणेह भूपतेः । हार्दं भयं संभवति स्वर्गश्चास्य विरुध्यते ॥
data.md: If a king governs his subjects unfairly, fear takes possession of his heart and the door of heaven is shut against him.

data.v: अथ योऽधर्मतः पाति राजामात्योऽथ वात्मजः । धर्मासने नियुक्तः सन्धर्ममूलं नरर्षभ ॥
कार्येष्वधिकृताः सम्यगकुर्वन्तो नृपानुगाः । आत्मानं पुरतः कृत्वा यान्त्यधः सहपार्थिवाः ॥
data.md: A kingdom, O foremost of men, depends upon righteousness. That minister, or king's son, who acts unfairly, holding the seat of justice, and those officers who, having accepted responsible offices, act unjustly, actuated by self-interest, all sink in hell along with the king himself.

data.v: बलात्कृतानां बलिभिः कृपणं बहु जल्पताम् । नाथो वै भूमिपो नित्यमनाथानां नृणां भवेत् ॥
data.md: Helpless inen, who are oppressed by the strong and who consequently bewail piteously, have the king for their protector.

data.v: ततः साक्षिबलं साधु द्वैधे वादकृतं भवेत् । असाक्षिकमनाथं वा परीक्ष्यं तद्विशेषतः ॥
data.md: In cases of dispute between two parties, the decision should depend upon the evidence of witness. If one of the parties has no witness and is helpless, the king should give the case his best consideration.

data.v: अपराधानुरूपं च दण्डं पापेषु पातयेत् । उद्वेजयेद्धनैरृद्धान्दरिद्रान्वधबन्धनैः ॥
data.md: The king should punish the offenders according to their offences. The wealthy should be punished with fines and confiscations; the poor, with loss of liberty.

data.v: विनयैरपि दुर्वृत्तान्प्रहारैरपि पार्थिवः । सान्त्वेनोपप्रदानेन शिष्टांश्च परिपालयेत् ॥
data.md: The wicked should be punished by the king with corporal punishments. The king should maintain all good men with sweet speeches and presents of riches.

data.v: राज्ञो वधं चिकीर्षेद्यस्तस्य चित्रो वधो भवेत् । आजीवकस्य स्तेनस्य वर्णसंकरकस्य च ॥
data.md: He who tries to bring about the death of the king should be punished with death to be effected by various means. One who becomes guilty of arson or theft or such co-habitation with women as may lead to an intermixture of castes, should be punished with death.

data.v: सम्यक्प्रणयतो दण्डं भूमिपस्य विशां पते । युक्तस्य वा नास्त्यधर्मो धर्म एवेह शाश्वतः ॥
data.md: A king, O monarch, who inflicts punishments duly and according to the dictates of the science of punishment, commits no sin by the act. On the other hand, he acquires eternal merit.

data.v: कामकारेण दण्डं तु यः कुर्यादविचक्षणः । स इहाकीर्तिसंयुक्तो मृतो नरकमाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: That foolish king who inflicts punishments whimsically, earns infamy here and sinks into hell hereafter.

data.v: न परस्य श्रवादेव परेषां दण्डमर्पयेत् । आगमानुगमं कृत्वा बध्नीयान्मोक्षयेत वा ॥
data.md: One should not be punished for the fault of another. Bestowing sufficient thought upon the code, a person should be convicted or acquitted.

data.v: न तु हन्यान्नृपो जातु दूतं कस्यांचिदापदि । दूतस्य हन्ता निरयमाविशेत्सचिवैः सह ॥
data.md: A king should never kill a messenger under any circumstances. That king who kills a messenger sinks into hell with all his ministers.

data.v: यथोक्तवादिनं दूतं क्षत्रधर्मरतो नृपः । यो हन्यात्पितरस्तस्य भ्रूणहत्यामवाप्नुयुः ॥
data.md: That king, mindful of Kshatriya practices, who kills a messenger faithfully speaking out his message, causes his departed manes to be stained with the sin of killing a foetus.

data.v: कुलीनः शीलसंपन्नो वाग्मी दक्षः प्रियंवदः । यथोक्तवादी स्मृतिमान्दूतः स्यात्सप्तभिर्गुणैः ॥
data.md: A messenger should have these seven accomplishments, viz., he should be of high descent, of a good family, eloquent, clever, sweet-speeched, faithful in delivering the message with which he is sent, and possessed of good memory.

data.v: एतैरेव गुणैर्युक्तः प्रतीहारोऽस्य रक्षिता । शिरोरक्षश्च भवति गुणैरेतैः समन्वितः ॥
data.md: The aid-de-camp of the king, who guards his persons, should also possess similar qualities. The officer also that guards his capital or citadel should possess the same qualities.

data.v: धर्मार्थशास्त्रतत्त्वज्ञः संधिविग्रहको भवेत् । मतिमान्धृतिमान्धीमान्रहस्यविनिगूहिता ॥
data.md: The king's minister should be well-read in the scriptures and capable in directing wars and making treaties. He should also be intelligent, courageous, modest, and capable of keeping secrets.

data.v: कुलीनः सत्यसंपन्नः शक्तोऽमात्यः प्रशंसितः । एतैरेव गुणैर्युक्तस्तथा सेनापतिर्भवेत् ॥
data.md: He should also be of high birth, have strength of mind, and be pure in conduct. If endued with these qualities, he should be regarded worthy. The commander of the king's forces should have also the same qualities.

data.v: व्यूहयन्त्रायुधीयानां तत्त्वज्ञो विक्रमान्वितः । वर्षशीतोष्णवातानां सहिष्णुः पररन्ध्रवित् ॥
data.md: He should also be master of the various sorts of battle array and with the uses of engines and weapons. He should be able to bear exposure to rain, cold, heat, and wind, and watchful of the shortcomings of foes.

data.v: विश्वासयेत्परांश्चैव विश्वसेन्न तु कस्यचित् । पुत्रेष्वपि हि राजेन्द्र विश्वासो न प्रशस्यते ॥
data.md: The king, O monarch, should, be able to make his enemies sleep under a sense of security. He should not, however, himself trust any one. The reposing of confidence on even his own son is not good.

data.v: एतच्छास्त्रार्थतत्त्वं तु तवाख्यातं मयानघ । अविश्वासो नरेन्द्राणां गुह्यं परममुच्यते ॥
data.md: I have now, O sinless one, described to you what are the injunctions of the scriptures. Not to trust any one has been regarded one of the greatest mysteries of king-craft?

data.v: कथंविधं पुरं राजा स्वयमावस्तुमर्हति । कृतं वा कारयित्वा वा तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said What should be the kind of city within which the king should himself live? Should he select one already made, or should he cause one to be especially made? Tell me this, O grand-father!

data.v: यत्र कौन्तेय वस्तव्यं सपुत्रभ्रातृबन्धुना । न्याय्यं तत्र परिप्रष्टुं गुप्तिं वृत्तिं च भारत ॥
data.md: Bhishma said “It is proper, O Bharata, to enquire about how should a king live on a city, and how should he defend it, O son of Kunti.

data.v: तस्मात्ते वर्तयिष्यामि दुर्गकर्म विशेषतः । श्रुत्वा तथा विधातव्यमनुष्ठेयं च यत्नतः ॥
data.md: I shall, therefore, describe to you this subject, referring especially to the defences of forts. Having heard me, you should make the arrangements required and conduct yourself attentively as directed.

data.v: षड्विधं दुर्गमास्थाय पुराण्यथ निवेशयेत् । सर्वसंपत्प्रधानं यद्बाहुल्यं वापि संभवेत् ॥
data.md: Keeping his eye on the six different sorts of forts the king should build his cities containing every kind of riches and every article of use in profusion.

data.v: धन्वदुर्गं महीदुर्गं गिरिदुर्गं तथैव च । मनुष्यदुर्गमब्दुर्गं वनदुर्गं च तानि षट् ॥
data.md: Those six kinds are water-citadels, earthcitadels, hill-citadels, human-citadels, mud citadels, and forest-citadels.

data.v: यत्पुरं दुर्गसंपन्नं धान्यायुधसमन्वितम् । दृढप्राकारपरिखं हस्त्यश्वरथसंकुलम् ॥
विद्वांसः शिल्पिनो यत्र निचयाश्च सुसंचिताः । धार्मिकश्च जनो यत्र दाक्ष्यमुत्तममास्थितः ॥
ऊर्जस्विनरनागाश्वं चत्वरापणशोभितम् । प्रसिद्धव्यवहारं च प्रशान्तमकुतोभयम् ॥
सुप्रभं सानुनादं च सुप्रशस्तनिवेशनम् । शूराढ्यजनसंपन्नं ब्रह्मघोषानुनादितम् ॥
समाजोत्सवसंपन्नं सदापूजितदैवतम् । वश्यामात्यबलो राजा तत्पुरं स्वयमावसेत् ॥
तत्र कोशं बलं मित्रं व्यवहारं च वर्धयेत् । पुरे जनपदे चैव सर्वदोषान्निवर्तयेत् ॥
data.md: Living there, the king should always try to fill his treasury, to increase his army, multiply the number of his friends, and establish courts of justice. He should suppress all abuses and evils in both his cities and provinces.

data.v: भाण्डागारायुधागारं प्रयत्नेनाभिवर्धयेत् । निचयान्वर्धयेत्सर्वांस्तथा यन्त्रगदागदान् ॥
data.md: He should collect provisions of all sorts and replenish his arsenals carefully. He should also increase his storage of rice and other grain, and strengthen his counsels.

data.v: काष्ठलोहतुषाङ्गारदारुशृङ्गास्थिवैणवान् । मज्जास्नेहवसाक्षौद्रमौषधग्राममेव च ॥
data.md: He should, increase his stores of fuel, iron, chaff, charcoal, timber, horns, bones, bamboos, marrow, oils, clarified butter, fat, honey, medicines, flax, resin, rice, weapons, arrows, leather, catgut, canes, and strings and cords made of Munja grass and other plants and creepers.

data.v: शणं सर्जरसं धान्यमायुधानि शरांस्तथा । चर्म स्नायु तथा वेत्रं मुञ्जबल्बजधन्वनान् ॥
data.md: He should, increase his stores of fuel, iron, chaff, charcoal, timber, horns, bones, bamboos, marrow, oils, clarified butter, fat, honey, medicines, flax, resin, rice, weapons, arrows, leather, catgut, canes, and strings and cords made of Munja grass and other plants and creepers.

data.v: आशयाश्चोदपानाश्च प्रभूतसलिला वराः । निरोद्धव्याः सदा राज्ञा क्षीरिणश्च महीरुहाः ॥
data.md: He should multiply the number of tanks and wells containing large quantities of water, and should protect all shady trees.

data.v: सत्कृताश्च प्रयत्नेन आचार्यर्त्विक्पुरोहिताः । महेष्वासाः स्थपतयः सांवत्सरचिकित्सकाः ॥
प्राज्ञा मेधाविनो दान्ता दक्षाः शूरा बहुश्रुताः । कुलीनाः सत्त्वसंपन्ना युक्ताः सर्वेषु कर्मसु ॥
data.md: He should entertain with honour the teachers of various sciences, Ritwijas, priests, powerful bowmen, persons skilled in architecture, astronomers, astrologers, physicians, as well as all men endued with wisdom, intelligence, self-control, cleverness, courage, learning, high-descent and energy, and competent to do all work.

data.v: पूजयेद्धार्मिकान्राजा निगृह्णीयादधार्मिकान् । नियुञ्ज्याच्च प्रयत्नेन सर्ववर्णान्स्वकर्मसु ॥
data.md: The king should honour the righteous and punish the unrighteous. He should, acting with resolution, compell the several castes follow their respective duties,

data.v: बाह्यमाभ्यन्तरं चैव पौरजानपदं जनम् । चारैः सुविदितं कृत्वा ततः कर्म प्रयोजयेत् ॥
data.md: Knowing properly, through spies, the external conduct and the state of mind of the inhabitants of his city and provinces, he should take the necessary steps.

data.v: चारान्मन्त्रं च कोशं च मन्त्रं चैव विशेषतः । अनुतिष्ठेत्स्वयं राजा सर्वं ह्यत्र प्रतिष्ठितम् ॥
data.md: The king should himself look after his spies and counsels, his treasury, and the instrument for inflicting punishments. Everything depends upon these.

data.v: उदासीनारिमित्राणां सर्वमेव चिकीर्षितम् । पुरे जनपदे चैव ज्ञातव्यं चारचक्षुषा ॥
data.md: Having spies for his eyes, the king should learn all the acts and intentions of his foes, friends, and neutrals.

data.v: ततस्तथा विधातव्यं सर्वमेवाप्रमादतः । भक्तान्पूजयता नित्यं द्विषतश्च निगृह्णता ॥
data.md: He should then, carefully, concert his own measures, honouring those that are loyal to him and chastising those that are hostile.

data.v: यष्टव्यं क्रतुभिर्नित्यं दातव्यं चाप्यपीडया । प्रजानां रक्षणं कार्यं न कार्यं कर्म गर्हितम् ॥
data.md: The king should always worship the gods in sacrifices and make gifts without giving pain to anybody. He should protect his subjects, never doing anything that may stand in the way of righteousness.

data.v: कृपणानाथवृद्धानां विधवानां च योषिताम् । योगक्षेमं च वृत्तिं च नित्यमेव प्रकल्पयेत् ॥
data.md: He should always support and protect the helpless, the lordless, the aged, and widows.

data.v: आश्रमेषु यथाकालं चेलभाजनभोजनम् । सदैवोपहरेद्राजा सत्कृत्यानवमन्य च ॥
data.md: The king should always honour the ascetics and present them, at proper times, with clothes, vessels and food.

data.v: आत्मानं सर्वकार्याणि तापसे राज्यमेव च । निवेदयेत्प्रयत्नेन तिष्ठेत्प्रह्वश्च सर्वदा ॥
data.md: The king should, with sufficient care, inform the ascetics of the state of his own self, of all his measures, and of the kingdom, and should always behave humbly in their presence.

data.v: सर्वार्थत्यागिनं राजा कुले जातं बहुश्रुतम् । पूजयेत्तादृशं दृष्ट्वा शयनासनभोजनैः ॥
data.md: When he beholds anchorites of high descent and great learning that have forsaken all earthly objects, he should honour them with presents of beds and seats and food.

data.v: तस्मिन्कुर्वीत विश्वासं राजा कस्यांचिदापदि । तापसेषु हि विश्वासमपि कुर्वन्ति दस्यवः ॥
data.md: Whatever the distress which he befalls him, he should confide in an anchorite. The very ribbers place confidence upon persons of that character.

data.v: तस्मिन्निधीनादधीत प्रज्ञां पर्याददीत च । न चाप्यभीक्ष्णं सेवेत भृशं वा प्रतिपूजयेत् ॥
data.md: The king should keep his wealth in charge of an ascetic and should take wise counsels from him. He should not, however, always wait upon them or adore them at all times.

data.v: अन्यः कार्यः स्वराष्ट्रेषु परराष्ट्रेषु चापरः । अटवीष्वपरः कार्यः सामन्तनगरेषु च ॥
data.md: From among those living in his own kingdom, he should select one for friendship. Likewise, he should select another from among those that live in the kingdom of his enemy. He should select a third from among recluses in the forests, and a fourth from among those living in his tributary kingdoms.

data.v: तेषु सत्कारसंस्कारान्संविभागांश्च कारयेत् । परराष्ट्राटवीस्थेषु यथा स्वविषये तथा ॥
data.md: He should treat them hospitably and honour them and assign them the means of maintenance. He should treat the ascetics living in the kingdoms of enemies in the forests in the same way as those that live in his own kingdom.

data.v: ते कस्यांचिदवस्थायां शरणं शरणार्थिने । राज्ञे दद्युर्यथाकामं तापसाः संशितव्रताः ॥
data.md: Engaged in penances and of rigid vows, they would, if calamity befalls the king and if he prays for protection, grant him what he wants.

data.v: एष ते लक्षणोद्देशः संक्षेपेण प्रकीर्तितः । यादृशं नगरं राजा स्वयमावस्तुमर्हति ॥
data.md: I have now told you briefly the characteristics of the city in which the king should live.

data.v: राष्ट्रगुप्तिं च मे राजन्राष्ट्रस्यैव च संग्रहम् । सम्यग्जिज्ञासमानाय प्रब्रूहि भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said How, O king, may a kingdom be firmly established, and how should it be protected? I wish to know this. Tell me all this, O foremost of Bharata's race.

data.v: राष्ट्रगुप्तिं च ते सम्यग्राष्ट्रस्यैव च संग्रहम् । हन्त सर्वं प्रवक्ष्यामि तत्त्वमेकमनाः शृणु ॥
data.md: Bhishma said 'Listen to me with close attention. I shall tell you how a kingdom may be consolidated, and how also it may be protected.

data.v: ग्रामस्याधिपतिः कार्यो दशग्राम्यस्तथापरः । द्विगुणायाः शतस्यैवं सहस्रस्य च कारयेत् ॥
data.md: A headman should be selected for each village. Over ten villages (or ten headmen) one superintendent should be appointed. Over two such superintendents there should be one officer. Above the latter should be appointed persons under each of whom should be a hundred villages; and above the last kind of officers, should be appointed men each of whom should given a thousand villages.

data.v: ग्रामे यान्ग्रामदोषांश्च ग्रामिकः परिपालयेत् । तान्ब्रूयाद्दशपायासौ स तु विंशतिपाय वै ॥
data.md: The headman should determine the characteristics of every person in the village and all the crimes also that demand punishment. He should report everything to the officer in charge of ten villages. The latter, again, should report the same to the officer in charge of twenty villages.

data.v: सोऽपि विंशत्यधिपतिर्वृत्तं जानपदे जने । ग्रामाणां शतपालाय सर्वमेव निवेदयेत् ॥
data.md: The latter, again, should report the conduct of all the persons with in his province to the officer in charge of a hundred villages.

data.v: यानि ग्रामीणभोज्यानि ग्रामिकस्तान्युपाश्नुयात् । दशपस्तेन भर्तव्यस्तेनापि द्विगुणाधिपः ॥
data.md: The village headman should control over all the produce and the properties of the village. Every headman should contribute his quota for maintaining the chief of ten villages, and the laiter should do the same for maintaining the chief of twenty villages.

data.v: ग्रामं ग्रामशताध्यक्षो भोक्तुमर्हति सत्कृतः । महान्तं भरतश्रेष्ठ सुस्फीतजनसंकुलम् । तत्र ह्यनेकमायत्तं राज्ञो भवति भारत ॥
data.md: The lord of a hundred villages should receive all honours from the king and should have for his support a large village, O chief of the Bharatas, populous and rich.

data.v: शाखानगरमर्हस्तु सहस्रपतिरुत्तमम् । धान्यहैरण्यभोगेन भोक्तुं राष्ट्रिय उद्यतः ॥
तथा यद्ग्रामकृत्यं स्याद्ग्रामिकृत्यं च ते स्वयम् । धर्मज्ञः सचिवः कश्चित्तत्प्रपश्येदतन्द्रितः ॥
नगरे नगरे च स्यादेकः सर्वार्थचिन्तकः । उच्चैःस्थाने घोररूपो नक्षत्राणामिव ग्रहः । भवेत्स तान्परिक्रामेत्सर्वानेव सदा स्वयम् ॥
data.md: Like some dreadful planet moving above all the asterisms below, the last mentioned officer should move and act above all the officers subordinate to him. Such an officer should learn the conduct of those under him through his spies.

data.v: विक्रयं क्रयमध्वानं भक्तं च सपरिव्ययम् । योगक्षेमं च संप्रेक्ष्य वणिजः कारयेत्करान् ॥
उत्पत्तिं दानवृत्तिं च शिल्पं संप्रेक्ष्य चासकृत् । शिल्पप्रतिकरानेव शिल्पिनः प्रति कारयेत् ॥
data.md: Knowing every time the quantity of the manufacturers, the receipts and expenses of the manufacturers, and the state of the arts, the king should levy taxes upon the artisans regarding the arts they follow.

data.v: उच्चावचकरा न्याय्याः पूर्वराज्ञां युधिष्ठिर । यथा यथा न हीयेरंस्तथा कुर्यान्महीपतिः ॥
data.md: The king, O Yudhishthira, may levy high taxes, but he should never levy such taxes as would oppress his people.

data.v: फलं कर्म च संप्रेक्ष्य ततः सर्वं प्रकल्पयेत् । फलं कर्म च निर्हेतु न कश्चित्संप्रवर्तयेत् ॥
data.md: No tax should be levied without determining the out-turn and the amount of labour necessary for its production. Nobody would work without sufficient causes.

data.v: यथा राजा च कर्ता च स्यातां कर्मणि भागिनौ । समवेक्ष्य तथा राज्ञा प्रणेयाः सततं कराः ॥
data.md: The king should, after proper thought, impose taxes in such a way that he and the person who labours to produce the article taxed may both partake of the out-turn.

data.v: नोच्छिन्द्यादात्मनो मूलं परेषां वापि तृष्णया । ईहाद्वाराणि संरुध्य राजा संप्रीतिदर्शनः ॥
data.md: The king should not, by his greediness, destroy his own foundations as well as those of others. He should always avoid those acts for which he may incur the hatred of his people. Indeed, by acting thus he may win popularity.

data.v: प्रद्विषन्ति परिख्यातं राजानमतिखादिनम् । प्रद्विष्टस्य कुतः श्रेयः संप्रियो लभते प्रियम् ॥
data.md: The subjects hate that king who becomes notorious for greediness. How can a king who is hated acquire prosperity? Such a king can never secure what is for his well-being.

data.v: वत्सौपम्येन दोग्धव्यं राष्ट्रमक्षीणबुद्धिना । भृतो वत्सो जातबलः पीडां सहति भारत ॥
data.md: An intelligent king should milk his kingdom like calves. If the calf be permitted to suck, it grows strong, O Bharata, and carries heavy loads.

data.v: न कर्म कुरुते वत्सो भृशं दुग्धो युधिष्ठिर । राष्ट्रमप्यतिदुग्धं हि न कर्म कुरुते महत् ॥
data.md: If, on the other hand, O Yudhishthira, the cow is milked too much, the calf becomes lean and incapable of making itself very useful to its owner. Similarly, if the kingdom be drained inordinately, the subjects become helpless and incapable of achieving any great act.

data.v: यो राष्ट्रमनुगृह्णाति परिगृह्य स्वयं नृपः । संजातमुपजीवन्स लभते सुमहत्फलम् ॥
data.md: That king who protects his kingdom himself and shows leniency to his subjects and supports himself upon what is easily got, succeeds in doing much.

data.v: आपदर्थं हि निचयान्राजान इह चिन्वते । राष्ट्रं च कोशभूतं स्यात्कोशो वेश्मगतस्तथा ॥
data.md: Does not the king then acquire wealth enough to meet his wants? The entire kingdom becomes then to him his treasury, and his treasury becomes his bed room.

data.v: पौरजानपदान्सर्वान्संश्रितोपाश्रितांस्तथा । यथाशक्त्यनुकम्पेत सर्वानभ्यन्तरानपि ॥
data.md: If the denizens of the cities and the provinces be poor, the king should, whether they depend upon him directly or indirectly, show them mercy to the best of his power.

data.v: बाह्यं जनं भेदयित्वा भोक्तव्यो मध्यमः सुखम् । एवं न संप्रकुप्यन्ते जनाः सुखितदुःखिताः ॥
data.md: Punishing all robbers who infest the boundaries, the king should protect the people of his villages and make them happy. Partaking of the king's happiness and misery, the subjects become greatly pleased with him.

data.v: प्रागेव तु करादानमनुभाष्य पुनः पुनः । संनिपत्य स्वविषये भयं राष्ट्रे प्रदर्शयेत् ॥
data.md: First of all, for making collection, the king should visit the principal centres of his kingdom one after another and try to fill his people with fear.

data.v: इयमापत्समुत्पन्ना परचक्रभयं महत् । अपि नान्ताय कल्पेत वेणोरिव फलागमः ॥
data.md: He should tell them, Here, a great danger threatens us. Our enemies have engendered a great calamity for us! I have every reason, however, to hope that the danger will pass away, for the enemy, like a flowering bamboo, will very soon be destroyed.

data.v: अरयो मे समुत्थाय बहुभिर्दस्युभिः सह । इदमात्मवधायैव राष्ट्रमिच्छन्ति बाधितुम् ॥
data.md: Many enemies of mine, having risen up and combined with a large body of robbers, wish to put our kingdom into difficulties, for themselves being destroyed.

data.v: अस्यामापदि घोरायां संप्राप्ते दारुणे भये । परित्राणाय भवतां प्रार्थयिष्ये धनानि वः ॥
data.md: To meet this calamity and dreadful danger, I seek your wealth for concerting measures for your protection

data.v: प्रतिदास्ये च भवतां सर्वं चाहं भयक्षये । नारयः प्रतिदास्यन्ति यद्धरेयुर्बलादितः ॥
data.md: When the danger passes away, I will repay you what I now take. Our foes, however, will not return what they (if unopposed) will take from you by force.

data.v: कलत्रमादितः कृत्वा नश्येत्स्वं स्वयमेव हि । अपि चेत्पुत्रदारार्थमर्थसंचय इष्यते ॥
data.md: On the other hand, they will even kill all your relatives with your very wives. Forsooth, you wish wealth for the sake of your children and wives.

data.v: नन्दामि वः प्रभावेन पुत्राणामिव चोदये । यथाशक्त्यनुगृह्णामि राष्ट्रस्यापीडया च वः ॥
data.md: I am happy to see your prosperity, and I solicit you as I would my own children. I shall take from you what you can easily spare for me. I do not wish to give pain to any one.

data.v: आपत्स्वेव च वोढव्यं भवद्भिः सद्गवैरिव । न वः प्रियतरं कार्यं धनं कस्यांचिदापदि ॥
data.md: In seasons of danger, you should, like strong bulls, bear such burdens. In seasons of distress, you should not value wealth too highly.

data.v: इति वाचा मधुरया श्लक्ष्णया सोपचारया । स्वरश्मीनभ्यवसृजेद्युगमादाय कालवित् ॥
data.md: A king knowing Time should, with such agreeable, sweet, and complimentary words, send his agents and make collections from his subjects.

data.v: प्रचारं भृत्यभरणं व्ययं गोग्रामतो भयम् । योगक्षेमं च संप्रेक्ष्य गोमिनः कारयेत्करान् ॥
data.md: Pointing out to them the necessity of repairing his forts and of meeting the expenses of his establishment and other heads, striking them with the fear of foreign invasion, and pointing to them the necessity that exists for protecting them and enabling them to ensure the means of living in peace, the king should impose taxes upon the Vaishyas of his kingdom.

data.v: उपेक्षिता हि नश्येयुर्गोमिनोऽरण्यवासिनः । तस्मात्तेषु विशेषेण मृदुपूर्वं समाचरेत् ॥
data.md: If the king does not care the Vaishyas, they become lost to him, and leaving his dominions retire into the woods. The king should, therefore, treat them leniently.

data.v: सान्त्वनं रक्षणं दानमवस्था चाप्यभीक्ष्णशः । गोमिनां पार्थ कर्तव्यं संविभागाः प्रियाणि च ॥
data.md: The king, O son of Pritha, should always conciliate and protect the Vaishyas, take measures for filling them with a sense of security and for ensuring them in the enjoyment of what they possess, and always do what they like.

data.v: अजस्रमुपयोक्तव्यं फलं गोमिषु सर्वतः । प्रभावयति राष्ट्रं च व्यवहारं कृषिं तथा ॥
data.md: The king, O Bharata, should always so treat the Vaishyas that their power to multiply money may be enhanced. The Vaishyas enhance the strength of a kingdom, improve its agriculture, and develop its trade.

data.v: तस्माद्गोमिषु यत्नेन प्रीतिं कुर्याद्विचक्षणः । दयावानप्रमत्तश्च करान्संप्रणयन्मृदून् ॥
data.md: A wise king, therefore, should always please them. Acting with carefulness and leniency, he should impose mild taxes upon them.

data.v: सर्वत्र क्षेमचरणं सुलभं तात गोमिभिः । न ह्यतः सदृशं किंचिद्धनमस्ति युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: It is always easy to treat the Vaishyas kindly. There is nothing which does greater good to a kingdom, O. Yudhishthira, than such treatment of the Vaishyas of the kingdom.'

data.v: यदा राजा समर्थोऽपि कोशार्थी स्यान्महामते । कथं प्रवर्तेत तदा तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Tell me, O grandfather, how should the king behave if, despite his great wealth, he seeks more!

data.v: यथादेशं यथाकालमपि चैव यथाबलम् । अनुशिष्यात्प्रजा राजा धर्मार्थी तद्धिते रतः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said A king desirous of acquiring religious merit, should seek the good of his subjects and protect them according to considerations of place and time and to the best of his intelligence and power.

data.v: यथा तासां च मन्येत श्रेय आत्मन एव च । तथा धर्म्याणि सर्वाणि राजा राष्ट्रे प्रवर्तयेत् ॥
data.md: He should, in his kingdom, adopt such measures as would in his view secure their good as also his own.

data.v: मधुदोहं दुहेद्राष्ट्रं भ्रमरान्न विपातयेत् । वत्सापेक्षी दुहेच्चैव स्तनांश्च न विकुट्टयेत् ॥
data.md: A king should milk his kingdom like a bee collecting honey from plants. He should act like the cow-herd who takes milk from her without boring her udders and without starving the calf.

data.v: जलौकावत्पिबेद्राष्ट्रं मृदुनैव नराधिप । व्याघ्रीव च हरेत्पुत्रमदष्ट्वा मा पतेदिति ॥
data.md: The king should act like the leech taking blood mildly. He should treat his subjects like a tigress carrying her cubs, touching them with her teeth but never cutting them therewith.

data.v: अल्पेनाल्पेन देयेन वर्धमानं प्रदापयेत् । ततो भूयस्ततो भूयः कामं वृद्धिं समाचरेत् ॥
data.md: Little by little should be drained from a prosperous subject. The demand should then be gradually increased till it reaches a fair amount.

data.v: दमयन्निव दम्यानां शश्वद्भारं प्रवर्धयेत् । मृदुपूर्वं प्रयत्नेन पाशानभ्यवहारयेत् ॥
data.md: The king should increase the burden of his subjects by and by like a person gradually increasing the load of a young bullock. Treating them with care and mildness, he should at last put the reins on them.

data.v: सकृत्पाशावकीर्णास्ते न भविष्यन्ति दुर्दमाः । उचितेनैव भोक्तव्यास्ते भविष्यन्ति यत्नतः ॥
data.md: If the reins are thus put, they would not refuse to to bear them. Indeed, sufficient measures should be taken for making them obedient. Mere entreaties to bring them to subjection would be of no avail.

data.v: तस्मात्सर्वसमारम्भो दुर्लभः पुरुषव्रजः । यथामुख्यान्सान्त्वयित्वा भोक्तव्य इतरो जनः ॥
data.md: It is impossible to treat all equally. Conciliating the leaders only, the ordinary people should be reduced to obedience.

data.v: ततस्तान्भेदयित्वाथ परस्परविवक्षितान् । भुञ्जीत सान्त्वयित्वैव यथासुखमयत्नतः ॥
data.md: Creating dissensions among the common people who are to carry the burdens, the king should himself come forward to conciliate them and then enjoy happily what he would draw from them.

data.v: न चास्थाने न चाकाले करानेभ्योऽनुपातयेत् । आनुपूर्व्येण सान्त्वेन यथाकालं यथाविधि ॥
data.md: The king should never impose taxes in a bad form and on persons who cannot pay them. He should impose them gradually and with mildness, in proper time and according to due forms.

data.v: उपायान्प्रब्रवीम्येतान्न मे माया विवक्षिता । अनुपायेन दमयन्प्रकोपयति वाजिनः ॥
data.md: The ways I suggest you are the legitimate means of king craft. They are not known as deceitful means. One who tries to control horses by unfair methods only makes them furious.

data.v: पानागाराणि वेशाश्च वेशप्रापणिकास्तथा । कुशीलवाः सकितवा ये चान्ये केचिदीदृशाः ॥
नियम्याः सर्व एवैते ये राष्ट्रस्योपघातकाः । एते राष्ट्रे हि तिष्ठन्तो बाधन्ते भद्रिकाः प्रजाः ॥
data.md: Drinking-shops, public women, pimps, actors, gamblers, and keepers of gambling houses, and other persons, of this sort, who always create disorders to the states, should all be checked. Living within the kingdom, these afflict and injure the better classes of the subjects.

data.v: न केनचिद्याचितव्यः कश्चित्किंचिदनापदि । इति व्यवस्था भूतानां पुरस्तान्मनुना कृता ॥
data.md: No one should ask anything of any one when on distress prevails. Manu himself in days of yore has laid down this injunction regarding all men.

data.v: सर्वे तथा न जीवेयुर्न कुर्युः कर्म चेदिह । सर्व एव त्रयो लोका न भवेयुरसंशयम् ॥
data.md: If all men were to live on alms and abstain from work, the world would, forsooth, come to an end.

data.v: प्रभुर्नियमने राजा य एतान्न नियच्छति । भुङ्क्ते स तस्य पापस्य चतुर्भागमिति श्रुतिः । तथा कृतस्य धर्मस्य चतुर्भागमुपाश्नुते ॥
data.md: The king alone is able to restrain and check. That king who does not prevent his subjects (from committing sins) is visited by a fourth part of the sins committed by them. This is the injunction of the Shrutis.

data.v: स्थानान्येतानि संगम्य प्रसङ्गे भूतिनाशनः । कामप्रसक्तः पुरुषः किमकार्यं विवर्जयेत् ॥
data.md: The following sins of which I speak should be checked. they are such as bring on penury on every one. What wicked act is there that a person under the influence of passion would not commit.

data.v: आपद्येव तु याचेरन्येषां नास्ति परिग्रहः । दातव्यं धर्मतस्तेभ्यस्त्वनुक्रोशाद्दयार्थिना ॥
data.md: They who do not live upon alms may beg at the time of distress. The righteous king should make gifts to them from mercy but not from fear.

data.v: मा ते राष्ट्रे याचनका मा ते भूयुश्च दस्यवः । इष्टादातार एवैते नैते भूतस्य भावकाः ॥
data.md: Let there be no beggars or robbers in your kingdom. It is only the robbers who give to the beggars. Such givers are not benefactors of men.

data.v: ये भूतान्यनुगृह्णन्ति वर्धयन्ति च ये प्रजाः । ते ते राष्ट्रे प्रवर्तन्तां मा भूतानामभावकाः ॥
data.md: Let such men live in your kingdom as advance the interests of others and do them good, but not such as root out others.

data.v: दण्ड्यास्ते च महाराज धनादानप्रयोजनाः । प्रयोगं कारयेयुस्तान्यथा बलिकरांस्तथा ॥
data.md: Those officers, O king, who realize from the subjects more than what is due should be punished. You should then appoint others who will take only what is due.

data.v: कृषिगोरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं यच्चान्यत्किंचिदीदृशम् । पुरुषैः कारयेत्कर्म बहुभिः सह कर्मिभिः ॥
data.md: Agriculture, tending of cattle trade and similar other acts, should be pursued by many persons in such a way that tey may not suffer injury.

data.v: नरश्चेत्कृषिगोरक्ष्यं वाणिज्यं चाप्यनुष्ठितः । संशयं लभते किंचित्तेन राजा विगर्ह्यते ॥
data.md: If a person engaged in agriculture, cattletending, or trade, feels a sense of insecurity, the king, incirs infamy thereby.

data.v: धनिनः पूजयेन्नित्यं यानाच्छादनभोजनैः । वक्तव्याश्चानुगृह्णीध्वं पूजाः सह मयेति ह ॥
data.md: The king should always honour his rich su.bjects and should say to them,-Do you, with me, advance the interests of the people!

data.v: अङ्गमेतन्महद्राज्ञां धनिनो नाम भारत । ककुदं सर्वभूतानां धनस्थो नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: In every kingdom, the wealthy form an estate in the realm. Forsooth, a wealthy person is the foremost of men.

data.v: प्राज्ञः शूरो धनस्थश्च स्वामी धार्मिक एव च । तपस्वी सत्यवादी च बुद्धिमांश्चाभिरक्षति ॥

data.md: For these reasons, O king, do you love all creatures, and show the qualities of truth, creatures, and show the qualities of truth, men. sincerity, absence of anger and abstention from injury.

data.v: एवं दण्डं च कोशं च मित्रं भूमिं च लप्स्यसे । सत्यार्जवपरो राजन्मित्रकोशसमन्वितः ॥
data.md: You should thus hold the rod of punishment, and multiply your treasury. and support your friends and consolidate your kingdom thus, practising the qualities of truthfulness and sincerity and supported by your friends, treasury, and army. sincerity, absence of anger and abstention from injury.

data.v: वनस्पतीन्भक्ष्यफलान्न छिन्द्युर्विषये तव । ब्राह्मणानां मूलफलं धर्म्यमाहुर्मनीषिणः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said “Let not fruit growing trees be cut down in your dominions. Fruits and roots are the property of the Brahmanas. The sages have declared this as an injunction of religion.

data.v: ब्राह्मणेभ्योऽतिरिक्तं च भुञ्जीरन्नितरे जनाः । न ब्राह्मणोपरोधेन हरेदन्यः कथंचन ॥
data.md: The residue, after supporting the Brahmanas, should be devoted to the support of other people, Nobody should take by inuring the Brahmanas.

data.v: विप्रश्चेत्त्यागमातिष्ठेदाख्यायावृत्तिकर्शितः । परिकल्प्यास्य वृत्तिः स्यात्सदारस्य नराधिप ॥
data.md: If a Brahmana, for want of support, wishes to leave a kingdom for securing maintenance elsewhere, the king, O monarch, should, with love and respect, give him the means of sustenance.

data.v: स चेन्नोपनिवर्तेत वाच्यो ब्राह्मणसंसदि । कस्मिन्निदानीं मर्यादामयं लोकः करिष्यति ॥
data.md: If he does not still abstain from leaving the kingdom, the king should repair to a concourse of Brahmanas and say-Such a Brahmana is leaving the kingdom. In whom shall my subjects then find an authority for guiding them?

data.v: असंशयं निवर्तेत न चेद्वक्ष्यत्यतः परम् । पूर्वं परोक्षं कर्तव्यमेतत्कौन्तेय शासनम् ॥
data.md: If alter this, he does not renounce his intention of leaving, and does not say anything, the king should say to him-Forget the past!—This, O son of Kunti, is the eternal way of the royal duty.

data.v: आहुरेतज्जना ब्रह्मन्न चैतच्छ्रद्दधाम्यहम् । निमन्त्र्यश्च भवेद्भोगैरवृत्त्या चेत्तदाचरेत् ॥
data.md: The king should further say to him,-Indeed, O Brahmana, people say that only that which is sufficient should be assigned to a Brahmana to maintain him. I, however, do not hold that opinion. On the other hand, I think that if a Brahmana seeks to abandon a kingdom for the king neglecting to provide him with means of support, such means should be assigned to him, and, further, if he wishes to take that step for procuring the means of luxury, he should still be requested to stay and supplied with those luxuries.

data.v: कृषिगोरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं लोकानामिह जीवनम् । ऊर्ध्वं चैव त्रयी विद्या सा भूतान्भावयत्युत ॥
data.md: Agriculture, cattle-tending, and trade, suppiy all men with the means of subsistence. A knowledge of the Vedas, however, supply them with the means of acquiring heaven.

data.v: तस्यां प्रयतमानायां ये स्युस्तत्परिपन्थिनः । दस्यवस्तद्वधायेह ब्रह्मा क्षत्रमथासृजत् ॥
data.md: They, therefore, that impede the study of the Vedas and the Vedic practices, are known as enemies of society. For exterminating these that Brahman created Kshatriyas.

data.v: शत्रूञ्जहि प्रजा रक्ष यजस्व क्रतुभिर्नृप । युध्यस्व समरे वीरो भूत्वा कौरवनन्दन ॥
data.md: Subdue your foes, protect your subjects, adore the gods in sacrifices, and fight battles bravely, O delighter of the Kurus!

data.v: संरक्ष्यान्पालयेद्राजा यः स राजार्यकृत्तमः । ये केचित्तान्न रक्षन्ति तैरर्थो नास्ति कश्चन ॥
data.md: A king should protect those who are worthy of protection. The king who does this is the best of rulers. Those kings who do not perform the duty of protection live uselessly.

data.v: सदैव राज्ञा बोद्धव्यं सर्वलोकाद्युधिष्ठिर । तस्माद्धेतोर्हि भुञ्जीत मनुष्यानेव मानवः ॥
data.md: For the behoof of all his subjects the king should always seek to learn the acts and thoughts of all, O Yudhishthira; and for the reason he should engage spies and secret agents.

data.v: अन्तरेभ्यः परान्रक्षन्परेभ्यः पुनरन्तरान् । परान्परेभ्यः स्वान्स्वेभ्यः सर्वान्पालय नित्यदा ॥
data.md: Protecting others from your own, and your own from others, as also others from others, and your own from your own, do you always maintain your subjects.

data.v: आत्मानं सर्वतो रक्षन्राजा रक्षेत मेदिनीम् । आत्ममूलमिदं सर्वमाहुर्हि विदुषो जनाः ॥
data.md: Guarding his own self first from every one, the king should protect the Earth. Men of knowledge have said that everything originate from self.

data.v: किं छिद्रं कोऽनुषङ्गो मे किं वास्त्यविनिपातितम् । कुतो मामास्रवेद्दोष इति नित्यं विचिन्तयेत् ॥
data.md: The king should always think of these, viz.,-What are his shortcomings to what evil habits he is addicted, what are the sources of his weakness, and what are the sources of his follies.

data.v: गुप्तैश्चारैरनुमतैः पृथिवीमनुचारयेत् । सुनीतं यदि मे वृत्तं प्रशंसन्ति न वा पुनः । कच्चिद्रोचेज्जनपदे कच्चिद्राष्ट्रे च मे यशः ॥
data.md: Indeed, he should know whether his conduct is or is not, generally applauded, or is, or is not, liked by the people of the provinces, and whether he has, or has not, succeeded in gaining a good name in his kingdom.

data.v: धर्मज्ञानां धृतिमतां संग्रामेष्वपलायिनाम् । राष्ट्रं च येऽनुजीवन्ति ये च राज्ञोऽनुजीविनः ॥
अमात्यानां च सर्वेषां मध्यस्थानां च सर्वशः । ये च त्वाभिप्रशंसेयुर्निन्देयुरथ वा पुनः । सर्वान्सुपरिणीतांस्तान्कारयेत युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Amongst the virtuous and wise, amongst those who never retreat from battle, and those who do not live in your kingdom, those who depend on you, and those who are your ministers, as well as those who do not follow party, they who praise or blame you should never be disregarded by you, O Yudhishthira!

data.v: एकान्तेन हि सर्वेषां न शक्यं तात रोचितुम् । मित्रामित्रमथो मध्यं सर्वभूतेषु भारत ॥
data.md: No man, O sire, can acquire the golden opinion of all persons in the world. All persons have friends, foes, and indifferent ones, O Bharata.

data.v: तुल्यबाहुबलानां च गुणैरपि निषेविनाम् । कथं स्यादधिकः कश्चित्स तु भुञ्जीत मानवान् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Of persons all of whom are equal in strength of arms and accomplishments' how does one reign supreme over all the others, and how does he succeed in lording over them all.

data.v: ये चरा ह्यचरानद्युरदंष्ट्रान्दंष्ट्रिणस्तथा । आशीविषा इव क्रुद्धा भुजगा भुजगानिव ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The mobile creatures devour things that are immobile; animals having teeth devour those that have none; angry snakes of dreadful venom devour smaller ones of their own species.

data.v: एतेभ्यश्चाप्रमत्तः स्यात्सदा यत्तो युधिष्ठिर । भारुण्डसदृशा ह्येते निपतन्ति प्रमाद्यतः ॥
data.md: The king, O Yudhishthira, should always be careful of his subjects as also of his eremies. If he becomes careless, they attack him like vultures.

data.v: कच्चित्ते वणिजो राष्ट्रे नोद्विजन्ते करार्दिताः । क्रीणन्तो बहु वाल्पेन कान्तारकृतनिश्रमाः ॥
data.md: Take care, O king, that the traders in your kingdom, who purchase articles for purposes of trade at prices high and low, and who while itenerating have to sleep or take rest in forests and inaccessible regions, may not suffer from the imposition of heavy taxes.

data.v: कच्चित्कृषिकरा राष्ट्रं न जहत्यतिपीडिताः । ये वहन्ति धुरं राज्ञां संभरन्तीतरानपि ॥
data.md: Let not the agriculturists in your kingdom leave it through oppression; they, who bear the burden of the king, support the other residents also of the kingdom.

data.v: इतो दत्तेन जीवन्ति देवाः पितृगणास्तथा । मनुष्योरगरक्षांसि वयांसि पशवस्तथा ॥
data.md: The gifts made by you in this world support the gods, Pitris, men, Nagas, Rakshasas, birds, and animals.

data.v: एषा ते राष्ट्रवृत्तिश्च राष्ट्रगुप्तिश्च भारत । एतमेवार्थमाश्रित्य भूयो वक्ष्यामि पाण्डव ॥
data.md: These, O Bharata, are the instruments of governing a kingdom and protecting its king. I shall again talk to you on the subject, son of Pandu."

data.v: यानङ्गिराः क्षत्रधर्मानुतथ्यो ब्रह्मवित्तमः । मान्धात्रे यौवनाश्वाय प्रीतिमानभ्यभाषत ॥
data.md: Bhishma said That best of all persons conversant with the Vedas, viz., Utatthya of Angirasa's family, discoursed gladly to Yuvanashva's son Mandhatri.

data.v: स यथानुशशासैनमुतथ्यो ब्रह्मवित्तमः । तत्ते सर्वं प्रवक्ष्यामि निखिलेन युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: I shall now, O Yudhishthira, relate to you every thing that Utatthya, that foremost of all perscns conversant with the Vedas, had said to that king.

data.v: धर्माय राजा भवति न कामकरणाय तु । मान्धातरेवं जानीहि राजा लोकस्य रक्षिता ॥
data.md: Utatthya said One becomes a king for advancing the cause of virtue and not for acting capriciously. Know this, O Mandhatri; the king is, indeed, the protector of the world.

data.v: राजा चरति वै धर्मं देवत्वायैव गच्छति । न चेद्धर्मं स चरति नरकायैव गच्छति ॥
data.md: If the king acts piously, he attains to the dignity of a god. If, however, he acts unrighteously, he sinks into hell.

data.v: धर्मे तिष्ठन्ति भूतानि धर्मो राजनि तिष्ठति । तं राजा साधु यः शास्ति स राजा पृथिवीपतिः ॥
data.md: All cri itures depends upon righteousness. If a king fails to punish iniquity, the god leave his palace and he incurs disreputation among men.

data.v: राजा परमधर्मात्मा लक्ष्मीवान्पाप उच्यते । देवाश्च गर्हां गच्छन्ति धर्मो नास्तीति चोच्यते ॥
data.md: All cri itures depends upon righteousness. If a king fails to punish iniquity, the god leave his palace and he incurs disreputation among men.

data.v: अधर्मे वर्तमानानामर्थसिद्धिः प्रदृश्यते । तदेव मङ्गलं सर्वं लोकः समनुवर्तते ॥
data.md: The endeavours of men who observe their own duties are always successful. Therefore all try to obey the injunctions of righteousness which yield prosperity.

data.v: उच्छिद्यते धर्मवृत्तमधर्मो वर्तते महान् । भयमाहुर्दिवारात्रं यदा पापो न वार्यते ॥
data.md: When sin is not restrained righteousness disappears and unrighteousness multiplies itself.

data.v: न वेदाननुवर्तन्ति व्रतवन्तो द्विजातयः । न यज्ञांस्तन्वते विप्रा यदा पापो न वार्यते ॥
data.md: When sinfulness is not restrained, the twice-born ones do not study the Vedas, or practise high vows, or perform sacrifices.

data.v: वध्यानामिव सर्वेषां मनो भवति विह्वलम् । मनुष्याणां महाराज यदा पापो न वार्यते ॥
data.md: When sin is not restrained, the minds of men, O king, become weak and bewildered like those of persons wounded with weapons.

data.v: उभौ लोकावभिप्रेक्ष्य राजानमृषयः स्वयम् । असृजन्सुमहद्भूतमयं धर्मो भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Looking on both the worlds, the Rishis made the king, that best of men, with a view that he should be righteousness incarnate on Earth.

data.v: यस्मिन्धर्मो विराजेत तं राजानं प्रचक्षते । यस्मिन्विलीयते धर्मस्तं देवा वृषलं विदुः ॥
data.md: He is called Rajan in whom righteousness predominates. That king, again, in whom there is no righteousness, is called a Vrishala.

data.v: वृषो हि भगवान्धर्मो यस्तस्य कुरुते ह्यलम् । वृषलं तं विदुर्देवास्तस्माद्धर्मं न लोपयेत् ॥
data.md: Righteousness has another name, viz., Vrisha. He who weakens Vrisha passes by the name of Vrishala. A king should, therefore, further the cause of Righteousness.

data.v: धर्मे वर्धति वर्धन्ति सर्वभूतानि सर्वदा । तस्मिन्ह्रसति हीयन्ते तस्माद्धर्मं प्रवर्धयेत् ॥
data.md: All creatures prosper by the growth of righteousness and deteriorate with its decay. Righteousness, therefore, should never be suffered to decay.

data.v: धनात्स्रवति धर्मो हि धारणाद्वेति निश्चयः । अकार्याणां मनुष्येन्द्र स सीमान्तकरः स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Righteousness is called Dharma, because it helps the acquisition and preservation of wealth. The sages, O king, have declared that the Dharma restrains and limits all evils acts of men.

data.v: प्रभवार्थं हि भूतानां धर्मः सृष्टः स्वयंभुवा । तस्मात्प्रवर्धयेद्धर्मं प्रजानुग्रहकारणात् ॥
data.md: The Self-create created Dharma for the aggrandisement and growth of creatures. Therefore, a king should follow the dictates of Dharma for benefiting his people.

data.v: तस्माद्धि राजशार्दूल धर्मः श्रेष्ठ इति स्मृतः । स राजा यः प्रजाः शास्ति साधुकृत्पुरुषर्षभः ॥
data.md: Therefore also, O foremost of kings' Dharma has been said to be the highest of all things. That best of men who governs his subjects righteously is called a king.

data.v: कामक्रोधावनादृत्य धर्ममेवानुपालयेत् । धर्मः श्रेयस्करतमो राज्ञां भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: Disregarding lust and anger follow the dictates of righteousness. Of all things, O chief of Bharata's race, which secure the prosperity of kings, righteousness is the foremost.

data.v: धर्मस्य ब्राह्मणा योनिस्तस्मात्तान्पूजयेत्सदा । ब्राह्मणानां च मान्धातः कामान्कुर्यादमत्सरी ॥
data.md: Dharma, again, has originated from the Brahmana. Therefore, the Brahmana should always be adored. You, should, O Mandhatri, satisfy humbly the wishes of Brahmanas.

data.v: तेषां ह्यकामकरणाद्राज्ञः संजायते भयम् । मित्राणि च न वर्धन्ते तथामित्रीभवन्त्यपि ॥
data.md: Neglecting to please Brahmanas the king brings danger on himself, for such neglect, he cannot acquire friends while his enemies multiply.

data.v: ब्राह्मणान्वै तदासूयाद्यदा वैरोचनो बलिः । अथास्माच्छ्रीरपाक्रामद्यास्मिन्नासीत्प्रतापिनी ॥
data.md: For entertaining malice out of folly towards the Brahmanas, the goddess of prosperity who had formerly lived with him became irate and deserted the Asura Vali the son of Virochana.

data.v: ततस्तस्मादपक्रम्य सागच्छत्पाकशासनम् । अथ सोऽन्वतपत्पश्चाच्छ्रियं दृष्ट्वा पुरंदरे ॥
data.md: Deserting the Asura she went to Indra the king of gods. Seeing the goddess living with Purandara, Vali regretted idly.

data.v: एतत्फलमसूयाया अभिमानस्य चाभिभो । तस्माद्बुध्यस्व मान्धातर्मा त्वा जह्यात्प्रतापिनी ॥
data.md: This, O powerful one, is the outcome of malice and pride. Be you awakened, O Mandhatri, so that the goddess of prosperity ! may not in anger desert you.

data.v: दर्पो नाम श्रियः पुत्रो जज्ञेऽधर्मादिति श्रुतिः । तेन देवासुरा राजन्नीताः सुबहुशो वशम् ॥
data.md: The Shrutis say that unrighteousness beget a son named Pride upon the goddess of prosperity. This Pride, O king, brought ruin upon many among the gods and the Asuras.

data.v: राजर्षयश्च बहवस्तस्माद्बुध्यस्व पार्थिव । राजा भवति तं जित्वा दासस्तेन पराजितः ॥
data.md: Many royal sages were ruined for him. Do you, therefore, awaken, O king, He who can conquer him becomes a king. He, however, who suffers himself to be conquered by him, becomes a slave.

data.v: स यथा दर्पसहितमधर्मं नानुसेवसे । तथा वर्तस्व मान्धातश्चिरं चेत्स्थातुमिच्छसि ॥
data.md: If, O Mandhatri, you wish to enjoy a life of perpetual happiness, live as a king should who does not indulge these two, viz., Pride and Unrighteousness.

data.v: मत्तात्प्रमत्तात्पोगण्डादुन्मत्ताच्च विशेषतः । तदभ्यासादुपावर्तादहितानां च सेवनात् ॥
data.md: Do not associate with him,—who is intoxicated with pride, who does not follow honesty, who scoffs at religion, who is insensate and negligent in paying homage to all of them even when united.

data.md: Keep yourself aloof from the company of ministers whom you have once punished and especially of women, as also from mountains and uneven lands and inaccessible forts and elephants and horses and reptiles. data.md: Keep yourself aloof from the company of ministers whom you have once punished and especially of women, as also from mountains and uneven lands and inaccessible forts and elephants and horses and reptiles. data.md: You should never know unknown women, or the eunuchs, or those who are lewd, or those who are the wives of other men, or those who are unmarried.

data.md: Therefore, the king should take particular care to act righteously for the behoof of his people.

data.md: Cold appears during the summer months, and disappears in its proper season. Drought and flood and pestilence attack the people.

data.md: Evil stars arise and dreadful comets appear on such occasions. Various other portents, presaging destruction of the kingdom, appear.

data.v: अरक्षितात्मा यो राजा प्रजाश्चापि न रक्षति । प्रजाश्च तस्य क्षीयन्ते ताश्च सोऽनु विनश्यति ॥
data.md: If the king does not take steps for his own safety and does not protect his subjects, the latter first meet with destruction which ultimately overtakes the king himself.

data.v: द्वावाददाते ह्येकस्य द्वयोश्च बहवोऽपरे । कुमार्यः संप्रलुप्यन्ते तदाहुर्नृपदूषणम् ॥
data.md: Two persons in unision take away the wealth of one, and many acting together rob the two. The virginity of maidens is destroyed. Such a state of things originate from the king's faults.

data.v: ममैतदिति नैकस्य मनुष्येष्ववतिष्ठते । त्यक्त्वा धर्मं यदा राजा प्रमादमनुतिष्ठति ॥
data.md: All rights of property are destroyed among men, when the king, forsaking righteousness, acts heedlessly.

data.v: कालवर्षी च पर्जन्यो धर्मचारी च पार्थिवः । संपद्यदैषा भवति सा बिभर्ति सुखं प्रजाः ॥
data.md: Utatthya said If the god of the clouds pours rain in season and the king acts virtuously, the prosperity that comes keeps the subjects in happiness.

data.v: यो न जानाति निर्हन्तुं वस्त्राणां रजको मलम् । रक्तानि वा शोधयितुं यथा नास्ति तथैव सः ॥
data.md: That washerman who does not know how to wash away the dirt of cloth without destroying its dye, is very unskilful in his profession.

data.v: एवमेव द्विजेन्द्राणां क्षत्रियाणां विशामपि । शूद्राश्चतुर्णां वर्णानां नानाकर्मस्ववस्थिताः ॥
data.md: That person among Brahmanas Kshatriyas or Vaishyas who, having deviated from the proper duties of his caste, has become a Shudra, is truly to be compared to such a washerman.

data.v: कर्म शूद्रे कृषिर्वैश्ये दण्डनीतिश्च राजनि । ब्रह्मचर्यं तपो मन्त्राः सत्यं चापि द्विजातिषु ॥
data.md: Menial service is the duty of the Shudra; agriculture is that of the Vaishya; the science of punishment of the Kshatriya and Brahmacharya, penances, Mantras, and truth, belong to the Brahmana. or

data.v: तेषां यः क्षत्रियो वेद वस्त्राणामिव शोधनम् । शीलदोषान्विनिर्हन्तुं स पिता स प्रजापतिः ॥
data.md: That Kshatriya who knows how to correct the wrong-doings of the other castes and to wash them clean like a washerman, is really their father and deserves to be their king.

data.v: कृतं त्रेता द्वापरश्च कलिश्च भरतर्षभ । राजवृत्तानि सर्वाणि राजैव युगमुच्यते ॥
data.md: The various cycles called Krita, Treta, Dvapara, and Kali, O foremost of Bharata's race, all depend on the conduct of the king. It is the king who makes the cycles.

data.v: चातुर्वर्ण्यं तथा वेदाश्चातुराश्रम्यमेव च । सर्वं प्रमुह्यते ह्येतद्यदा राजा प्रमाद्यति ॥
data.md: The four castes, the Vedas, and the duties of the four modes of life, all suffer from confusion and weakness when the king becomes heedless.

data.v: राजैव कर्ता भूतानां राजैव च विनाशकः । धर्मात्मा यः स कर्ता स्यादधर्मात्मा विनाशकः ॥
data.md: The king is the creator of all creatures, and is their destroyer. That righteous king is regarded as the creator, while the sinful one is regarded as the destroyer.

data.v: राज्ञो भार्याश्च पुत्राश्च बान्धवाः सुहृदस्तथा । समेत्य सर्वे शोचन्ति यदा राजा प्रमाद्यति ॥
data.md: The king's wives, sons, kinsmen, and friends, all become unhappy and grieve when the king becomes careless.

data.v: हस्तिनोऽश्वाश्च गावश्चाप्युष्ट्राश्वतरगर्दभाः । अधर्मवृत्ते नृपतौ सर्वे सीदन्ति पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Elephants, horses, kine, camels, mules, asses and other animals all lose their vigour when the king becomes sinful.

data.v: दुर्बलार्थं बलं सृष्टं धात्रा मान्धातरुच्यते । अबलं तन्महद्भूतं यस्मिन्सर्वं प्रतिष्ठितम् ॥
data.md: It is said, O Mandhatri, that the Creator created Power for for protecting Weakness. Weakness is, really, a great being, for every thing depends upon it.

data.v: यच्च भूतं स भजते भूता ये च तदन्वयाः । अधर्मस्थे हि नृपतौ सर्वे सीदन्ति पार्थिव ॥
data.md: All creatures adore the king. All creatures are the children of the king. If, therefore, O monarch, the king becomes unrighteous, all creatures meet with ruin.

data.v: दुर्बलस्य हि यच्चक्षुर्मुनेराशीविषस्य च । अविषह्यतमं मन्ये मा स्म दुर्बलमासदः ॥
data.md: The eyes of the Weak, of the Muni, and of the venomous snake, should be considered as unbearable. Do not, therefore, meet the Weak as you would do an enemy.

data.v: दुर्बलांस्तात बुध्येथा नित्यमेवाविमानितान् । मा त्वां दुर्बलचक्षूंषि प्रदहेयुः सबान्धवम् ॥
data.md: You should regard the Weak as being subject to humiliation. Take care that the eyes of the Weak do not burn you with your kinsmen.

data.v: न हि दुर्बलदग्धस्य कुले किंचित्प्ररोहति । आमूलं निर्दहत्येव मा स्म दुर्बलमासदः ॥
data.md: In a family scorched by the eyes of the Weak, no children are born. Such eyes burn the family to its very roots. Do not, therefore, treat the weak inimically.

data.v: अबलं वै बलाच्छ्रेयो यच्चातिबलवद्बलम् । बलस्याबलदग्धस्य न किंचिदवशिष्यते ॥
data.md: Weakness is more powerful than even the greatest Power, for that Power which is scorched by Weakness is absolutely rotted out.

data.v: विमानितो हतोत्क्रुष्टस्त्रातारं चेन्न विन्दति । अमानुषकृतस्तत्र दण्डो हन्ति नराधिपम् ॥
data.md: If a person, who has been humiliated or struck, fails, while crying for help, to get a protector, divine punishment over takes the king and brings about his fall.

data.v: मा स्म तात बले स्थेया बाधिष्ठा मापि दुर्बलम् । मा त्वा दुर्बलचक्षूंषि धक्ष्यन्त्यग्निरिवाश्रयम् ॥
data.md: Do not, 'O sire, while excersing Power, take wealth from the Weak, Take care that the eyes of the Weak do not burn you like a burning fire.

data.v: यानि मिथ्याभिशस्तानां पतन्त्यश्रूणि रोदताम् । तानि पुत्रान्पशून्घ्नन्ति तेषां मिथ्याभिशासताम् ॥
data.md: The tears shed by weeping men afflicted with falsehood kill the children and animals of those that have uttered those lies.

data.v: यदि नात्मनि पुत्रेषु न चेत्पौत्रेषु नप्तृषु । न हि पापं कृतं कर्म सद्यः फलति गौरिव ॥
data.md: Like a cow a sinful act does not yield immediate truits. If the fruit is not seen in the perpetrator himself, it is seen in his son or in his grand-son or daughter's son.
