data.md: When a Weak person fails to find a protector the great rod of divine punishment overtakes the king.

data.v: युक्ता यदा जानपदा भिक्षन्ते ब्राह्मणा इव । अभीक्ष्णं भिक्षुदोषेण राजानं घ्नन्ति तादृशाः ॥
data.md: When all the subjects of a king are compelled by distress to live like Brahmanas, by begging, such mendicancy brings destruction upon the king.

data.v: राज्ञो यदा जनपदे बहवो राजपूरुषाः । अनयेनोपवर्तन्ते तद्राज्ञः किल्बिषं महत् ॥
data.md: When all the officers of the king living in the provinces unite together and act unfairly, the king is then said to bring about a state of unredeeming evil upon his kingdom.

data.v: यदा युक्ता नयन्त्यर्थान्कामादर्थवशेन वा । कृपणं याचमानानां तद्राज्ञो वैशसं महत् ॥
data.md: When the officers of the king extort money, hy unfair mean, or acting from lust or avarice, from persons pitcously praying for mercy, a great destruct' on, jorsooth, be.ails the king.

data.v: महावृक्षो जायते वर्धते च; तं चैव भूतानि समाश्रयन्ति । यदा वृक्षश्छिद्यते दह्यते वा; तदाश्रया अनिकेता भवन्ति ॥
data.md: A huge tree, just growing, assumes large proportions, Numberless creatures then come and seek its shelter. When, however, it is cut down or burnt, those who had taken its shelter become all houseless.

data.v: यदा राष्ट्रे धर्ममग्र्यं चरन्ति; संस्कारं वा राजगुणं ब्रुवाणाः । तैरेवाधर्मश्चरितो धर्ममोहा;त्तूर्णं जह्यात्सुकृतं दुष्कृतं च ॥
data.md: When the denizens of a kingdom perform pious acts and all religious rites, and praise the good qualities, of the king, the latter acquires riches. When, however, the residents, out of ignorance forsake righteousness and act unrighteously, the king suffers from misery.

data.v: यत्र पापा ज्ञायमानाश्चरन्ति; सतां कलिर्विन्दति तत्र राज्ञः । यदा राजा शास्ति नरान्नशिष्या;न्न तद्राज्यं वर्धते भूमिपाल ॥
data.md: When sinful men of known acts are allowed to move among the righteous, Kali then overtakes the kings of those kingdoms. When the king punishes all wicked people, his kingdom prospers.

data.v: यश्चामात्यं मानयित्वा यथार्हं; मन्त्रे च युद्धे च नृपो नियुञ्ज्यात् । प्रवर्धते तस्य राष्ट्रं नृपस्य; भुङ्क्ते महीं चाप्यखिलां चिराय ॥
data.md: Forsooth, the kingdom of that king certainly prospers who honours his ministers and employs them in policy and in battles. Such a king enjoys the wide Earth or ever.

data.v: अत्रापि सुकृतं कर्म वाचं चैव सुभाषिताम् । समीक्ष्य पूजयन्राजा धर्मं प्राप्नोत्यनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: That king who duly honours at good acts and good speeches acquires great merit.

data.v: संविभज्य यदा भुङ्क्ते न चान्यानवमन्यते । निहन्ति बलिनं दृप्तं स राज्ञो धर्म उच्यते ॥
data.md: The enjoyment of good things with others, paying proper honours to the ministers, and subjugations of persons who are proud of their strength, are the great duty of a king.

data.v: त्रायते हि यदा सर्वं वाचा कायेन कर्मणा । पुत्रस्यापि न मृष्येच्च स राज्ञो धर्म उच्यते ॥
data.md: Protecting all men by words, body, and deeds, and never forgiving even his offending son himself, form the duty of the king.

data.v: यदा शारणिकान्राजा पुत्रवत्परिरक्षति । भिनत्ति न च मर्यादां स राज्ञो धर्म उच्यते ॥
data.md: Protecting those who seek refuge with him as he would protect his own children, and never depriving one of the honours to which he is entitled, form the duty of the king.

data.v: यदाप्तदक्षिणैर्यज्ञैर्यजते श्रद्धयान्वितः । कामद्वेषावनादृत्य स राज्ञो धर्म उच्यते ॥
data.md: Adoring the gods, with devotion in sacrifices completed by presents, and subduing lust and envy, from the duty of the king.

data.v: कृपणानाथवृद्धानां यदाश्रु व्यपमार्ष्टि वै । हर्षं संजनयन्नॄणां स राज्ञो धर्म उच्यते ॥
data.md: Wiping the tears of the distressed, the helpless, and the old, and filling them with joy, form the duty of the king.

data.v: विवर्धयति मित्राणि तथारींश्चापकर्षति । संपूजयति साधूंश्च स राज्ञो धर्म उच्यते ॥
data.md: Advancing friends, weakening enemies, and honouring the good, form the duty of the king.

data.v: सत्यं पालयति प्राप्त्या नित्यं भूमिं प्रयच्छति । पूजयत्यतिथीन्भृत्यान्स राज्ञो धर्म उच्यते ॥
data.md: Cheerfully adhering to truth, always making presents of land, entertaining guests, and maintaining dependents, form the duty of the king.

data.v: निग्रहानुग्रहौ चोभौ यत्र स्यातां प्रतिष्ठितौ । अस्मिँल्लोके परे चैव राजा तत्प्राप्नुते फलम् ॥
data.md: That king who favours those who deserve favours, and punishes those who deserve chastisement, acquires great merit both here and hereafter.

data.v: यमो राजा धार्मिकाणां मान्धातः परमेश्वरः । संयच्छन्भवति प्राणान्नसंयच्छंस्तु पापकः ॥
data.md: The king is Yama himself. He is, O Mandhatri, the god (incarnate) to all righteous persons. By controlling his senses he acquires great riches. By not subduing them he commits sin.

data.v: ऋत्विक्पुरोहिताचार्यान्सत्कृत्यानवमन्य च । यदा सम्यक्प्रगृह्णाति स राज्ञो धर्म उच्यते ॥
data.md: Paying proper honours to Ritwijas and priests and preceptors, and doing them good, form the duty of the king.

data.v: यमो यच्छति भूतानि सर्वाण्येवाविशेषतः । तस्य राज्ञानुकर्तव्यं यन्तव्या विधिवत्प्रजाः ॥
data.md: Yama governs all creatures without any distinction. The king should imitate him in his conduct by restraining all his subjects duly.

data.v: सहस्राक्षेण राजा हि सर्व एवोपमीयते । स पश्यति हि यं धर्मं स धर्मः पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: The king is said to resemble the Thousandeyed (Indra). O foremost of men, that which is regarded by the king as Righteousness is accepted as such by all.

data.v: अप्रमादेन शिक्षेथाः क्षमां बुद्धिं धृतिं मतिम् । भूतानां सत्त्वजिज्ञासां साध्वसाधु च सर्वदा ॥
data.md: You should diligently cultivate forgiveness, intelligence, patience and the love of all creatures. You should also determine the strength and weakness of all men and learn to distinguish between right and wrong.

data.v: संग्रहः सर्वभूतानां दानं च मधुरा च वाक् । पौरजानपदाश्चैव गोप्तव्याः स्वा यथा प्रजाः ॥
data.md: You should behave properly towards all creatures, make gifts, the utter agreeable and sweet words. You should maintain the residents of your city and the provinces in happiness.

data.v: न जात्वदक्षो नृपतिः प्रजाः शक्नोति रक्षितुम् । भारो हि सुमहांस्तात राज्यं नाम सुदुष्करम् ॥
data.md: A king, who is not clever, can never protect his subjects. Sovereignty, O sire, is a very heavy burden.

data.v: तद्दण्डविन्नृपः प्राज्ञः शूरः शक्नोति रक्षितुम् । न हि शक्यमदण्डेन क्लीबेनाबुद्धिनापि वा ॥
data.md: Only that king who is endued with wisdom and courage, and who is a master of the science of punishment, can protect a kingdom. He, on the other hand, who is devoid of energy and intelligence, and who is not versed in the great science, cannot bear the burden of sovereignty.

data.v: अभिरूपैः कुले जातैर्दक्षैर्भक्तैर्बहुश्रुतैः । सर्वा बुद्धीः परीक्षेथास्तापसाश्रमिणामपि ॥
data.md: Helped by ministers of beautiful features and good birth, clever in business, devoted to their masters, and highly learned, you should examine the hearts and acts of all men including the very hermits.

data.v: ततस्त्वं सर्वभूतानां धर्मं वेत्स्यसि वै परम् । स्वदेशे परदेशे वा न ते धर्मो विनश्यति ॥
data.md: Behaving thus, you will be able to learn the duties of all orders of men. This will help you in observing your own duties whether when you are in your country or when you go to other kingdoms.

data.v: धर्मश्चार्थश्च कामश्च धर्म एवोत्तरो भवेत् । अस्मिँल्लोके परे चैव धर्मवित्सुखमेधते ॥
data.md: Amongst these three objects, viz., Virtue, Profit, and Pleasure, Virtue is the foremost. He, who is of virtuous soul, acquires great happiness both here and hereafter.

data.v: त्यजन्ति दारान्प्राणांश्च मनुष्याः प्रतिपूजिताः । संग्रहश्चैव भूतानां दानं च मधुरा च वाक् ॥
data.md: If men are treated with honour, they can abandon their very wives and sons. By winning over good men, by gifts, sweet words, carefulness, and purity of conduct, a king may acquire for himself great prosperity. Do not, therefore, O Mandhatri, be negligent of these qualities and acts.

data.v: अप्रमादश्च शौचं च तात भूतिकरं महत् । एतेभ्यश्चैव मान्धातः सततं मा प्रमादिथाः ॥
अप्रमत्तो भवेद्राजा छिद्रदर्शी परात्मनोः । नास्य छिद्रं परः पश्येच्छिद्रेषु परमन्वियात् ॥
data.md: The king should never neglect to look after his own weak points as also after those of his foes. He should act in such a way that his enemies may not be able to discover his weak points, and he should himself assail them when theirs are seen.

data.v: एतद्वृत्तं वासवस्य यमस्य वरुणस्य च । राजर्षीणां च सर्वेषां तत्त्वमप्यनुपालय ॥
data.md: In this way Vasava, and Yama, and Varuna and all the great royal sages have acted. Do you follow the same conduct.

data.v: तत्कुरुष्व महाराज वृत्तं राजर्षिसेवितम् । आतिष्ठ दिव्यं पन्थानमह्नाय भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Do you, O great king, follow the conduct of those royal sages. Do you soon, O foremost of Bharata's race, follow this heavenly road.

data.v: धर्मवृत्तं हि राजानं प्रेत्य चेह च भारत । देवर्षिपितृगन्धर्वाः कीर्तयन्त्यमितौजसः ॥
data.md: The gods, the Rishis, the Pitris, and the Gandharvas, possessed of great energy, chant the praises, both here and hereafter, of that king who is righteous!

data.v: स एवमुक्तो मान्धाता तेनोतथ्येन भारत । कृतवानविशङ्कस्तदेकः प्राप च मेदिनीम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said nus spoken to by Utatthya, O Bharata, Mandhatri unhesitatingly did as he as he was directed, and became the soul king of the wide Earth.

data.v: भवानपि तथा सम्यङ्मान्धातेव महीपतिः । धर्मं कृत्वा महीं रक्षन्स्वर्गे स्थानमवाप्स्यसि ॥
data.md: Do you also, O king, act righteously like Mandhatri. You will then, after ruling the Earth, live in heaven!

data.v: कथं धर्मे स्थातुमिच्छन्राजा वर्तेत धार्मिकः । पृच्छामि त्वा कुरुश्रेष्ठ तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: How should a righteous king, who wishes to follow the ways of righteousness, behave? I ask you this, O foremost of men! Answer me, O grand-father!

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । गीतं दृष्टार्थतत्त्वेन वामदेवेन धीमता ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited the old story of what the highly intelligent Vamadeva acquainted with the true import of everything sang in days of yore.

data.v: राजा वसुमना नाम कौसल्यो बलवाञ्शुचिः । महर्षिं परिपप्रच्छ वामदेवं यशस्विनम् ॥
data.md: Once upon a time, king Vasumanas, endued with knowledge, fortitude, purity of conduct, asked the great Rishi Vamadeva of great ascetic merit, sayingधर्मार्थसहितैर्वाक्यैर्भगवन्ननुशाधि माम्।

data.v: धर्मार्थसहितं वाक्यं भगवन्ननुशाधि माम् । येन वृत्तेन वै तिष्ठन्न च्यवेयं स्वधर्मतः ॥
तमब्रवीद्वामदेवस्तपस्वी जपतां वरः । हेमवर्णमुपासीनं ययातिमिव नाहुषम् ॥
data.md: To him having a golden hue and seated at his ease like Yayati the son of Nahusha, that foremost of ascetics, viz., Vamadeva of great energy, said as follows.

data.v: धर्ममेवानुवर्तस्व न धर्माद्विद्यते परम् । धर्मे स्थिता हि राजानो जयन्ति पृथिवीमिमाम् ॥
data.md: Vamadeva said Do you act righteously. There is nothing superior to Righteousness. The righteous kings succeed in conquering the whole Earth.

data.v: अर्थसिद्धेः परं धर्मं मन्यते यो महीपतिः । ऋतां च कुरुते बुद्धिं स धर्मेण विरोचते ॥
data.md: That king who considers Righteousness as the most effectual instrument for accomplishing his objects, and who follows the advice of the righteous, shines with righteousness.

data.v: अधर्मदर्शी यो राजा बलादेव प्रवर्तते । क्षिप्रमेवापयातोऽस्मादुभौ प्रथममध्यमौ ॥
data.md: That king who neglects Righteousness and wishes to act with brute force, soon falls away from Righteousness and loses both Virtue and Profit.

data.v: असत्पापिष्ठसचिवो वध्यो लोकस्य धर्महा । सहैव परिवारेण क्षिप्रमेवावसीदति ॥
data.md: That king who follows the advice of a vicious and sinful minister becomes a destroyer of righteousness and deserves to be killed by his subjects with all his family. Indeed, he very soon meets with destruction,

data.v: अर्थानामननुष्ठाता कामचारी विकत्थनः । अपि सर्वां महीं लब्ध्वा क्षिप्रमेव विनश्यति ॥
data.md: That king who cannot satisfy his royal duties, who is governed by caprice in all his acts, and who vaunts, soon meets with destruction even if he happen to be the king of whole Earth.

data.v: अथाददानः कल्याणमनसूयुर्जितेन्द्रियः । वर्धते मतिमान्राजा स्रोतोभिरिव सागरः ॥
data.md: That king, however, who seeks prosperity, who is shorn of malice, who has his senses under restraint, and who is endued with intelligence, rolls in wealth like the ocean swelling with the waters put into it by a hundred rivers.

data.v: न पूर्णोऽस्मीति मन्येत धर्मतः कामतोऽर्थतः । बुद्धितो मित्रतश्चापि सततं वसुधाधिपः ॥
data.md: He should never consider himself as possessing enough of Virtue, enjoyment, wealth, intelligence, and friends.

data.v: एतेष्वेव हि सर्वेषु लोकयात्रा प्रतिष्ठिता । एतानि शृण्वँल्लभते यशः कीर्तिं श्रियः प्रजाः ॥
data.md: Upon these depends the word. By listening to this advice, a king acquires fame, great deeds, prosperity and subjects.

data.v: एवं यो धर्मसंरम्भी धर्मार्थपरिचिन्तकः । अर्थान्समीक्ष्यारभते स ध्रुवं महदश्नुते ॥
data.md: Being virtuous that king, who tries to acquire virtue and wealth by such means, and who undertakes all his measures after thinking upon their objects, succeeds in acquiring great prosperity.

data.v: अदाता ह्यनतिस्नेहो दण्डेनावर्तयन्प्रजाः । साहसप्रकृती राजा क्षिप्रमेव विनश्यति ॥
data.md: That king, who is illiberal, and shorn of affection, who oppresses his subjects by undue punishment, and who is rash in his acts, soon meets with destruction.

data.v: अथ पापं कृतं बुद्ध्या न च पश्यत्यबुद्धिमान् । अकीर्त्यापि समायुक्तो मृतो नरकमश्नुते ॥
data.md: That king, who is not intelligent, fails to see his own faults. Best with infamy here, he sinks into hell hereafter.

data.v: अथ मानयितुर्दातुः शुक्लस्य रसवेदिनः । व्यसनं स्वमिवोत्पन्नं विजिघांसन्ति मानवाः ॥
data.md: If the king honours them properly that deserve it, makes gifts, and recognises the value of sweet speeches by himself uttering them always, his subjects then remove the calamities that overtake him as if these had fallen upon themselves.

data.v: यस्य नास्ति गुरुर्धर्मे न चान्याननुपृच्छति । सुखतन्त्रोऽर्थलाभेषु न चिरं महदश्नुते ॥
data.md: The king, who has none to instruct him in the ways of righteousness and who never seeks advice from others, and who seeks to acquire wealth by means that caprice suggests, never enjoys happiness long.

data.v: गुरुप्रधानो धर्मेषु स्वयमर्थान्ववेक्षिता । धर्मप्रधानो लोकेषु सुचिरं महदश्नुते ॥
data.md: That king, on the other hand, who follows the advice of his preceptors in matters of virtue, who supervises the affairs of his kingdom himself, and who in all his acquisitions follows virtue, succeeds in enjoying happiness for a long time.

data.v: यत्राधर्मं प्रणयते दुर्बले बलवत्तरः । तां वृत्तिमुपजीवन्ति ये भवन्ति तदन्वयाः ॥
data.md: When the king, who is powerful acts unfairly towards the Weak, persons born in his family imitate the same conduct.

data.v: राजानमनुवर्तन्ते तं पापाभिप्रवर्तकम् । अविनीतमनुष्यं तत्क्षिप्रं राष्ट्रं विनश्यति ॥
data.md: Others, again, imitate that wretch who commits sins. Such imitation of the man who does not care for restraints soon brings destruction upon the kingdom.

data.v: यद्वृत्तिमुपजीवन्ति प्रकृतिस्थस्य मानवाः । तदेव विषमस्थस्य स्वजनोऽपि न मृष्यते ॥
data.md: The conduct of a king, who observes his proper duties, is accepted by men in general as a model for imitation. The conduct, however, of a king, who deviates from his duties, is not tolerated by his very kinsmen.

data.v: साहसप्रकृतिर्यत्र कुरुते किंचिदुल्बणम् । अशास्त्रलक्षणो राजा क्षिप्रमेव विनश्यति ॥
data.md: That rash king, who, neglecting the injunctions laid down in scriptures, acts with high-handedness in his kingdom, very soon meets with fall.

data.v: योऽत्यन्ताचरितां वृत्तिं क्षत्रियो नानुवर्तते । जितानामजितानां च क्षत्रधर्मादपैति सः ॥
data.md: That Kshatriya, who does not follow the conduct observed from days of yore by other Kshatriyas conquered or unconquered, deviates from Kshatriyas duties.

data.v: द्विषन्तं कृतकर्माणं गृहीत्वा नृपती रणे । यो न मानयते द्वेषात्क्षत्रधर्मादपैति सः ॥
data.md: Having captured in battle a royal enemy that did some good to the conqueror on a former occasion, that king, who, does not, out of malice, honour him, is said to deviate from Kshatriya duties.

data.v: शक्तः स्यात्सुमुखो राजा कुर्यात्कारुण्यमापदि । प्रियो भवति भूतानां न च विभ्रश्यते श्रियः ॥
data.md: The king should show his power, live merrily, and do what is necessary in times of danger. Such a king is loved of all creatures and never falls away from prosperity.

data.v: अप्रियं यस्य कुर्वीत भूयस्तस्य प्रियं चरेत् । नचिरेण प्रियः स स्याद्योऽप्रियः प्रियमाचरेत् ॥
data.md: If you do evil to any person, you should, when the times comes, do him good. One who is not loved becomes an object of love if he does what is good.

data.v: मृषावादं परिहरेत्कुर्यात्प्रियमयाचितः । न च कामान्न संरम्भान्न द्वेषाद्धर्ममुत्सृजेत् ॥
data.md: Falsehoods should be avoided. You should do good to others without being asked for the same. You should never abandon righteousness from lust or anger or malice.

data.v: नापत्रपेत प्रश्नेषु नाभिभव्यां गिरं सृजेत् । न त्वरेत न चासूयेत्तथा संगृह्यते परः ॥
data.md: Do not reply harshly when questioned by anybody. Do not utter mean words. Never be in a hurry to do anything. Never cherish malice. By such means an enemy is won over.

data.v: प्रिये नातिभृशं हृष्येदप्रिये न च संज्वरेत् । न मुह्येदर्थकृच्छ्रेषु प्रजाहितमनुस्मरन् ॥
data.md: Do not be overjoyed when anything pleasant occurs, nor give away to sorrow when anything disagreeable occurs. Never grieve when your wealth is exhausted, and always remember the duty of doing good to your subjects.

data.v: यः प्रियं कुरुते नित्यं गुणतो वसुधाधिपः । तस्य कर्माणि सिध्यन्ति न च संत्यज्यते श्रिया ॥
data.md: That king, who always does what is agreeable by natural inclination, acquires success in all his undertakings and is never shorn of prosperity.

data.v: निवृत्तं प्रतिकूलेभ्यो वर्तमानमनुप्रिये । भक्तं भजेत नृपतिस्तद्वै वृत्तं सतामिह ॥
data.md: The king should always, carefully, cherish that devoted servant who abstains from doing injury to his master and who always does what is for his good.

data.v: अप्रकीर्णेन्द्रियं प्राज्ञमत्यन्तानुगतं शुचिम् । शक्तं चैवानुरक्तं च युञ्ज्यान्महति कर्मणि ॥
data.md: He should employ in responsible offices persons who have controlled their senses, who are devotedly loyal and of pure conduct, and who are able.

data.v: एवमेव गुणैर्युक्तो यो न रज्यति भूमिपम् । भर्तुरर्थेष्वसूयन्तं न तं युञ्जीत कर्मणि ॥
data.md: That person, who by possessing such qualifications, pleases the king and who never neglects to take care of the interests of his master, should be appointed by the king in the affairs of his kingdom.

data.v: मूढमैन्द्रियकं लुब्धमनार्यचरितं शठम् । अनतीतोपधं हिंस्रं दुर्बुद्धिमबहुश्रुतम् ॥
data.md: On the other hand, the king becomes shorn of prosperity by appointing to important offices men who are fools and slaves of their senses, who are covetous and of disreputable conduct, who are deceitful and hypocritical, who are minded, and addicted to drink, gambling, women, and hunting.

data.v: त्यक्तोपात्तं मद्यरतं द्यूतस्त्रीमृगयापरम् । कार्ये महति यो युञ्ज्याद्धीयते स नृपः श्रियः ॥
रक्षितात्मा तु यो राजा रक्ष्यान्यश्चानुरक्षति । प्रजाश्च तस्य वर्धन्ते ध्रुवं च महदश्नुते ॥
data.md: That king, who, first protecting his own self, protects others worthy of protection, feels the satisfaction of seeing his subjects prosper. Such a king succeeds also in acquiring greatness.

data.v: ये केचिद्भूमिपतयस्तान्सर्वानन्ववेक्षयेत् । सुहृद्भिरनभिख्यातैस्तेन राजा न रिष्यते ॥
data.md: A king should, by devoted secret agents, watch the conduct and acts of other kings. By such means can he acquire superiority.

data.v: अपकृत्य बलस्थस्य दूरस्थोऽस्मीति नाश्वसेत् । श्येनानुचरितैर्ह्येते निपतन्ति प्रमाद्यतः ॥
data.md: Having injured a powerful king, one should not comfort himself with the idea that the injurer lives at a great distance from the injured. Such kings when injured attack the injurer like the hawk swooping down upon its : prey, in careless moments.

data.v: दृढमूलस्त्वदुष्टात्मा विदित्वा बलमात्मनः । अबलानभियुञ्जीत न तु ये बलवत्तराः ॥
data.md: A king, whose power has been consolidated and who is confident of his own strength, should attack a neighbour who is weaker than himself but never who is stronger.

data.v: विक्रमेण महीं लब्ध्वा प्रजा धर्मेण पालयन् । आहवे निधनं कुर्याद्राजा धर्मपरायणः ॥
data.md: Having acquired the sovereignty of the Earth by prowess, a virtuous king should protect his subjects fairly and kill enemies in battle

data.v: मरणान्तमिदं सर्वं नेह किंचिदनामयम् । तस्माद्धर्मे स्थितो राजा प्रजा धर्मेण पालयेत् ॥
data.md: Everything belonging to this world is liable to destruction. Nothing here is lasting. Therefore, the king, following righteousness, should protect his subjects righteously.

data.v: रक्षाधिकरणं युद्धं तथा धर्मानुशासनम् । मन्त्रचिन्त्यं सुखं काले पञ्चभिर्वर्धते मही ॥
data.md: The defence of forts, battle, administration of justice, consultations on questions of policy, and keeping the subjects of happiness, these five increase the dominions of a king.

data.v: एतानि यस्य गुप्तानि स राजा राजसत्तम । सततं वर्तमानोऽत्र राजा भुङ्क्ते महीमिमाम् ॥
data.md: That king who takes proper care of these is considered to be the best of kings. By always doing these, a king succeeds in protecting his kingdom.

data.v: नैतान्येकेन शक्यानि सातत्येनान्ववेक्षितुम् । एतेष्वाप्तान्प्रतिष्ठाप्य राजा भुङ्क्ते महीं चिरम् ॥
data.md: It is impossible, however, for one man to look after all these matters at all times. Transferring such supervision to his ministers, a king may govern the Earth for ever,

data.v: यत्किंचिन्मन्यसेऽस्तीति सर्वं नास्तीति विद्धि तत् । एवं न व्यथते प्राज्ञः कृच्छ्रामप्यापदं गतः ॥
data.md: Know, O prince, that those things which you consider as existing do not in reality exist. The wise know this very well, and are, therefore, never pained with the distress whatever that may be.

data.v: यद्धि भूतं भविष्यच्च ध्रुवं तन्न भविष्यति । एवं विदितवेद्यस्त्वमधर्मेभ्यः प्रमोक्ष्यसे ॥
data.md: What has taken place and what will bring to pass are all unreal, When you will know this which should be known by all, you will be shorn of unrighteousness.

data.v: यच्च पूर्वे समाहारे यच्च पूर्वतरे परे । सर्वं तन्नास्ति तच्चैव तज्ज्ञात्वा कोऽनुसंज्वरेत् ॥
data.md: Whatever things had been acquired by those that came before, and whatever acquired by their successors, have all perished. Thinking of all this, who is there that will give way to grief?

data.v: भूत्वा च न भवत्येतदभूत्वा च भवत्यपि । शोके न ह्यस्ति सामर्थ्यं शोकं कुर्यात्कथं नरः ॥
data.md: Things that were, are no more. Things that are, will again be no more. Grief cannot restore them. One should not, therefore, succumb to grief.

data.v: क्व नु तेऽद्य पिता राजन्क्व नु तेऽद्य पितामहः । न त्वं पश्यसि तानद्य न त्वा पश्यन्ति तेऽपि च ॥
data.md: Where, O king, is your father to-day and where your grandfather? To-day you see them not, nor do they now see you!

data.v: आत्मनोऽध्रुवतां पश्यंस्तांस्त्वं किमनुशोचसि । बुद्ध्या चैवानुबुध्यस्व ध्रुवं हि न भविष्यसि ॥
data.md: Meditating on your own instability, why do you grieve for them? Think with the help of your intelligence, and you will understand that you will cease to be!

data.v: अहं च त्वं च नृपते शत्रवः सुहृदश्च ते । अवश्यं न भविष्यामः सर्वं च न भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Myself, yourself, O king, your friends, and your foes, shall forsooth, cease to be. Indeed, everything will cease to be.

data.v: ये तु विंशतिवर्षा वै त्रिंशद्वर्षाश्च मानवाः । अर्वागेव हि ते सर्वे मरिष्यन्ति शरच्छतात् ॥
data.md: Those men who are now twenty or thirty years old, will, forsooth, all die within the next hundred years.

data.v: अपि चेन्महतो वित्ताद्विप्रमुच्येत पूरुषः । नैतन्ममेति तन्मत्वा कुर्वीत प्रियमात्मनः ॥
data.md: If a man cannot willingly relinquish his immense wealth, he should then try to think that his belongings, are not his own and by that means seek to do good to himself.

data.v: अनागतं यन्न ममेति विद्या;दतिक्रान्तं यन्न ममेति विद्यात् । दिष्टं बलीय इति मन्यमाना;स्ते पण्डितास्तत्सतां स्थानमाहुः ॥
data.md: Future acquisitions should be considered by one as not one's own. Lost properties, should also be regarded by one as not his own. Destiny should be deemed as all powerful. They who think in this wise are considered wise. This mood of regarding all things is an attribute of the good.

data.v: अनाढ्याश्चापि जीवन्ति राज्यं चाप्यनुशासते । बुद्धिपौरुषसंपन्नास्त्वया तुल्याधिका जनाः ॥
data.md: Many persons who are equal of superior to you in intelligence and inanliness, though bereft of wealth, are not kings but are still alive.

data.v: न च त्वमिव शोचन्ति तस्मात्त्वमपि मा शुचः । किं नु त्वं तैर्न वै श्रेयांस्तुल्यो वा बुद्धिपौरुषैः ॥
data.md: They are not, like you. They do not indulge in grief like you. Therefore, ceases to grieve in this wise! Are you not superior to those men, or at least equal to them in intelligence and inanliness?

data.v: यादृच्छिकं ममासीत्तद्राज्यमित्येव चिन्तये । ह्रियते सर्वमेवेदं कालेन महता द्विज ॥
data.md: The king said I consider the kingdom which I had with all its parapharnalia to have been acquired by me without any exertion. Omnipotent Time, however, twice-born one, has swept it away.

data.v: तस्यैवं ह्रियमाणस्य स्रोतसेव तपोधन । फलमेतत्प्रपश्यामि यथालब्धेन वर्तये ॥
data.md: The result, however, that I see, of my kingdom having been carried away by Time as by a stream, is that I am obliged to subsist upon whatever I get as alms.

data.v: अनागतमतीतं च यथा तथ्यविनिश्चयात् । नानुशोचसि कौसल्य सर्वार्थेषु तथा भव ॥
data.md: The sage said Actuated by the knowledge of what is true, one should never grieve for either the past or the future. Be you of such a mood of mind, o prince of Koshala, regarding every affair that may arrest your attention!

data.v: अवाप्यान्कामयस्वार्थान्नानवाप्यान्कदाचन । प्रत्युत्पन्नाननुभवन्मा शुचस्त्वमनागतान् ॥
data.md: Wishing to possess only that which is obtainable and not what is unobtainable, do you enjoy your present belongings and never grieve for what is absent.

data.v: यथा लब्धोपपन्नार्थस्तथा कौसल्य रंस्यसे । कच्चिच्छुद्धस्वभावेन श्रिया हीनो न शोचसि ॥
data.md: Be you satisfied, O prince of Koshala, with whatever you can easily get. Even if divested of prosperity, do not grieve for it but try to maintain a pure character.

data.v: पुरस्ताद्भूतपूर्वत्वाद्धीनभाग्यो हि दुर्मतिः । धातारं गर्हते नित्यं लब्धार्थांश्च न मृष्यते ॥
data.md: Only an unfortunate and foolish wight when divested of former prosperity, blames the supreme Ordainer, without being contented with his present position.

data.v: अनर्हानपि चैवान्यान्मन्यते श्रीमतो जनान् । एतस्मात्कारणादेतद्दुःखं भूयोऽनुवर्तते ॥
data.md: Such a person consider others however undeserving, as men blessed with prosperity. Therefore, those who are possessed of malice and vanity and puffed up with a sense of egoism, suffer more misery still. You however, O king, are not sullied by such vices.

data.v: ईर्ष्यातिच्छेदसंपन्ना राजन्पुरुषमानिनः । कच्चित्त्वं न तथा प्राज्ञ मत्सरी कोसलाधिप ॥
सहस्व श्रियमन्येषां यद्यपि त्वयि नास्ति सा । अन्यत्रापि सतीं लक्ष्मीं कुशला भुञ्जते जनाः । अभिविष्यन्दते श्रीर्हि सत्यपि द्विषतो जनात् ॥
data.md: Bear the prosperity of others, inspite of your being divested of the same. Clever and expert men succeed in enjoying the prosperity of their enemies.

data.v: श्रियं च पुत्रपौत्रं च मनुष्या धर्मचारिणः । त्यागधर्मविदो वीराः स्वयमेव त्यजन्त्युत ॥
data.md: Prosperity relinquishes the person that hates others. Pious and wise men conversant with the duties of Yoga renounce prosperity and sons and grandsons of their own accord.

data.v: बहु संकसुकं दृष्ट्वा विवित्सासाधनेन च । तथान्ये संत्यजन्त्येनं मत्वा परमदुर्लभम् ॥
data.md: Others, considering earthly possessions to be exceedingly unstable and unobtainable, and dependent upon continued exertion, are also scen to renounce it.

data.v: त्वं पुनः प्राज्ञरूपः सन्कृपणं परितप्यसे । अकाम्यान्कामयानोऽर्थान्पराचीनानुपद्रुतान् ॥
data.md: You seem to be endued with wisdom. Why, then, do you grieve so piteously, seeking for things which should not be sought for, since they are unstable and dependent on others?

data.v: तां बुद्धिमुपजिज्ञासुस्त्वमेवैनान्परित्यज । अनर्थांश्चार्थरूपेण अर्थांश्चानर्थरूपतः ॥
data.md: You wish to know the temperament of mind which would give you happiness. The advice I give you is to renounce all objects of desire! Objects which should be discarded appear to one as those which he should seek to secure, while those which should be secured appear to him as objects which should be avoided.

data.v: अर्थायैव हि केषांचिद्धननाशो भवत्युत । अनन्त्यं तं सुखं मत्वा श्रियमन्यः परीक्षते ॥
data.md: Some loss their wealth while seeking the same. Others consider wealth, as the source of endless happiness, and, therefore pursue it eagerly.

data.v: रममाणः श्रिया कश्चिन्नान्यच्छ्रेयोऽभिमन्यते । तथा तस्येहमानस्य समारम्भो विनश्यति ॥
data.md: Some again, overjoyed with wealth, think that there is nothing superior to it. While cagerly seeking for the acquisition of wealth, such a person loses all other objects of life. renounce

data.v: कृच्छ्राल्लब्धमभिप्रेतं यदा कौसल्य नश्यति । तदा निर्विद्यते सोऽर्थात्परिभग्नक्रमो नरः ॥
data.md: If, O prince of Koshala, a person loses that wealth which had been acquired with difficulty and after which he had hankered, he then, overcome by despair, gives up all desire of wealth.

data.v: धर्ममेकेऽभिपद्यन्ते कल्याणाभिजना नराः । परत्र सुखमिच्छन्तो निर्विद्येयुश्च लौकिकात् ॥
data.md: Some righteous and highly-born persons devote themselves to the acquisitions of virtue. These every king of worldly happiness from securing the same in the other world.

data.v: जीवितं संत्यजन्त्येके धनलोभपरा नराः । न जीवितार्थं मन्यन्ते पुरुषा हि धनादृते ॥
data.md: Some persons sacrifice life itself, actuated by the desire of acquiring wealth. These do not think that life without wealth has any use.

data.v: पश्य तेषां कृपणतां पश्य तेषामबुद्धिताम् । अध्रुवे जीविते मोहादर्थतृष्णामुपाश्रिताः ॥
data.md: Mark at their pitiable condition! Witness their foolishness! When life is so short and uncertain, these men, actuated by ignorance, seek wealth.

data.v: संचये च विनाशान्ते मरणान्ते च जीविते । संयोगे विप्रयोगान्ते को नु विप्रणयेन्मनः ॥
data.md: Who is there that would busy himself with boarding when destruction is its end, hanker after life when death is its end, and after union when separation is its end?

data.v: धनं वा पुरुषं राजन्पुरुषो वा पुनर्धनम् । अवश्यं प्रजहात्येतत्तद्विद्वान्कोऽनुसंज्वरेत् ॥
data.md: Sometimes man renounces wealth, and sometimes wealth renounces man. What man endued with knowledge is there who would grieve at the loss of wealth? There are many other persons in the world who lose wealth and friends.

data.v: अन्येषामपि नश्यन्ति सुहृदश्च धनानि च । पश्य बुद्ध्या मनुष्याणां राजन्नापदमात्मनः । नियच्छ यच्छ संयच्छ इन्द्रियाणि मनो गिरम् ॥
data.md: See, O king, with your intelligence, and you will come to learn that the calamities which befall men are all owing to their own conduct! Do you, therefore, control your senses, mind and speech.

data.v: प्रतिषिद्धानवाप्येषु दुर्लभेष्वहितेषु च । प्रतिकृष्टेषु भावेषु व्यतिकृष्टेष्वसंभवे । प्रज्ञानतृप्तो विक्रान्तस्त्वद्विधो नानुशोचति ॥
data.md: For, if these become weak and productive of evil there is no man who can stand aloof from temptation of external objects by which he is always surrounded. As no one can from a good idea of the past nor of the future, there being many intervals of time and place, a person like you who are endued with such wisdom and such prowess, never grieve for union and separation, for good or evil.

data.v: अल्पमिच्छन्नचपलो मृदुर्दान्तः सुसंशितः । ब्रह्मचर्योपपन्नश्च त्वद्विधो नैव मुह्यति ॥
data.md: A person so mild by nature, of controlled self, and settled conclusions, and observant of Brahmacharya vows, never grieve and never becomes restless from the desire of acquiring from the fear of losing anything insignificant.

data.v: न त्वेव जाल्मीं कापालीं वृत्तिमेषितुमर्हसि । नृशंसवृत्तिं पापिष्ठां दुःखां कापुरुषोचिताम् ॥
data.md: It is not proper that such a man should follow a deceitful life of mendicancy, a life that is sinful and wicked and cruel and which benefits only a human wretch.

data.v: अपि मूलफलाजीवो रमस्वैको महावने । वाग्यतः संगृहीतात्मा सर्वभूतदयान्वितः ॥
data.md: Do you go to the great forest and lead a life of happiness there, all alone and subsisting upon fruits and roots, restraining words and soul, and filled with mercy for all creatures.

data.v: सदृशं पण्डितस्यैतदीषादन्तेन दन्तिना । यदेको रमतेऽरण्ये यच्चाप्यल्पेन तुष्यति ॥
data.md: Or He, who cheerfully leads such a life in the forest, having elephants of large tusks for companions, with no human being by his side, and contented with the produce of the forest, is said to follow the footsteps of the wise.

data.v: महाह्रदः संक्षुभित आत्मनैव प्रसीदति । एतदेवंगतस्याहं सुखं पश्यामि केवलम् ॥
data.md: A large lake, when it becomes disturbed, becomes silent itself. Likewise, a wise men, when disturbed in such matters, becomes tranquil of himself. I see that a person, who has been reduced to such a plight as yours, may live happily even thus.

data.v: असंभवे श्रियो राजन्हीनस्य सचिवादिभिः । दैवे प्रतिनिविष्टे च किं श्रेयो मन्यते भवान् ॥
data.md: When it is impossible for you to recover your prosperity and when you are without ministers and counsellors, such a course is open to you. Do you expect to reap any benefit by depending upon destiny?

data.v: अथ चेत्पौरुषं किंचित्क्षत्रियात्मनि पश्यसि । ब्रवीमि हन्त ते नीतिं राज्यस्य प्रतिपत्तये ॥
data.md: If, on the other hand, O Kshatriya, you think that you still possess any prowess, I shall describe to you about that line of policy which you may follow for recovering your kingdom.

data.v: तां चेच्छक्ष्यस्यनुष्ठातुं कर्म चैव करिष्यसि । शृणु सर्वमशेषेण यत्त्वां वक्ष्यामि तत्त्वतः ॥
data.md: If you can adopt that policy and try to exert yourself, you can still regain your prosperity. Listen attentively to all that I say to you fully.

data.v: आचरिष्यसि चेत्कर्म महतोऽर्थानवाप्स्यसि । राज्यं राज्यस्य मन्त्रं वा महतीं वा पुनः श्रियम् । यद्येतद्रोचते राजन्पुनर्ब्रूहि ब्रवीमि ते ॥
data.md: If you act according to those counsels, you may acquire immense wealth, your kingdom and kingly power and great prosperity. If you like it, O king, tell me, for then I shall describe to you that policy.

data.v: ब्रवीतु भगवान्नीतिमुपपन्नोऽस्म्यहं प्रभो । अमोघमिदमद्यास्तु त्वया सह समागतम् ॥
data.md: The king said Tell me, O holy one, what you wish to say. I am willing to hear and act according to your advice. Let this my meeting with you to-day produce mighty results.

data.v: हित्वा स्तम्भं च मानं च क्रोधहर्षौ भयं तथा । प्रत्यमित्रं निषेवस्व प्रणिपत्य कृताञ्जलिः ॥
data.md: Casting off pride, desire, anger and joy and fear, wait upon your very foes, humbling yourself and joining your hands.

data.v: तमुत्तमेन शौचेन कर्मणा चाभिराधय । दातुमर्हति ते वृत्तिं वैदेहः सत्यसंगरः ॥
data.md: Do you wait upon Janaka the king of Mithila, always performing good and pure acts. The highly truthful king of Videha will, forsooth, give you great wealth.

data.v: प्रमाणं सर्वभूतेषु प्रग्रहं च गमिष्यसि । ततः सहायान्सोत्साहाँल्लप्स्यसेऽव्यसनाञ्शुचीन् ॥
data.md: You will then become the right arm of that king and secure the confidence of all persons. As an outcome of this, you will win over many courageous and persevering allies, pure in behaviour, and free from the seven cardinal faults.

data.v: वर्तमानः स्वशास्त्रे वै संयतात्मा जितेन्द्रियः । अभ्युद्धरति चात्मानं प्रसादयति च प्रजाः ॥
data.md: By following his duties, à person of subdued self and having his senses under control, succeeds in raising himself and cheering others.

data.v: तेनैव त्वं धृतिमता श्रीमता चाभिसत्कृतः । प्रमाणं सर्वभूतेषु गत्वा प्रग्रहणं महत् ॥
data.md: Honoured by Janaka enducd with intelligence and prosperity, you will certainly become the right hand of that king and enjoy the confidence of all.

data.v: ततः सुहृद्बलं लब्ध्वा मन्त्रयित्वा सुमन्त्रितम् । अन्तरैर्भेदयित्वारीन्बिल्वं बिल्वेन शातय । परैर्वा संविदं कृत्वा बलमप्यस्य घातय ॥
data.md: Having then mustered a large force and held consultations with good ministers, do you create dissensions among your enemies, and setting them against one another, break them all like a person breaking a Vilva with a Vilva. Or, making peace with the enemies of your foe, destroy the latter's power.

data.v: अलभ्या ये शुभा भावाः स्त्रियश्चाच्छादनानि च । शय्यासनानि यानानि महार्हाणि गृहाणि च ॥
data.md: You will then cause your enemies to be attached to such good things as are not easily · got at, to beautiful women and clothes, beds and seats and cars, all very costly, and houses, and birds and animals of various species, and juices and perfumes and fruits, so that your foe may be ruined of himself.

data.v: पक्षिणो मृगजातानि रसा गन्धाः फलानि च । तेष्वेव सज्जयेथास्त्वं यथा नश्येत्स्वयं परः ॥
data.md: You will then cause your enemies to be attached to such good things as are not easily · got at, to beautiful women and clothes, beds and seats and cars, all very costly, and houses, and birds and animals of various species, and juices and perfumes and fruits, so that your foe may be ruined of himself.

data.v: यद्येव प्रतिषेद्धव्यो यद्युपेक्षणमर्हति । न जातु विवृतः कार्यः शत्रुर्विनयमिच्छता ॥
data.md: If one's enemy be thus managed, or if he is treated in differently, one, who wishes to act according to good policy, should never allow that foe to know it at all.

data.v: वसस्व परमामित्रविषये प्राज्ञसंमते । भजस्व श्वेतकाकीयैर्मित्राधममनर्थकैः ॥
data.md: Following the conduct approved of the wise, do you enjoy every king of pleasure in the territories of your enemy, and imitating the conduct of the dog, the deer and the crow, be outwardly a friend to your enemies.

data.v: आरम्भांश्चास्य महतो दुष्करांस्त्वं प्रयोजय । नदीबन्धविरोधांश्च बलवद्भिर्विरुध्यताम् ॥
data.md: Make them undertake works which are difficult of accomplishment. See also that they enter into hostilities with powerful enemies.

data.v: उद्यानानि महार्हाणि शयनान्यासनानि च । प्रतिभोगसुखेनैव कोशमस्य विरेचय ॥
data.md: Making them attached to pleasure gardens and rich beds and seats, do you, by offering such objects of enjoyment, exhaust your eneiny's treasury.

data.v: यज्ञदानप्रशंसास्मै ब्राह्मणेष्वनुवर्ण्यताम् । ते त्वत्प्रियं करिष्यन्ति तं चेष्यन्ति वृका इव ॥
data.md: Advising your enemy to celebrate sacrifices and making gifts, do you please the Brahmanas. The latter will do good to you in return, and devour your enemy like wolves.

data.v: असंशयं पुण्यशीलः प्राप्नोति परमां गतिम् । त्रिविष्टपे पुण्यतमं स्थानं प्राप्नोति पार्थिवः । कोशक्षये त्वमित्राणां वशं कौसल्य गच्छति ॥
data.md: Forsooth, a person of righteous deeds acquires a high end. By such deeds men earn highly happy regions in heaven.

data.v: उभयत्र प्रसक्तस्य धर्मे चाधर्म एव च । बलार्थमूलं व्युच्छिद्येत्तेन नन्दन्ति शत्रवः ॥
data.md: If the treasury of your foes be exhausted, every one of them, O prince of Koshala, may be subdued. The treasury is the source of happiness in heaven and victory on Earth. It is in consequence of their wealth that enemies enjoy such happiness. The treasury, therefore, should by every means be drained. Do not speak highly of manliness in the presence of your foe, but speak highly of destiny.

data.v: निन्द्यास्य मानुषं कर्म दैवमस्योपवर्णय । असंशयं दैवपरः क्षिप्रमेव विनश्यति ॥
याजयैनं विश्वजिता सर्वस्वेन वियुज्यताम् । ततो गच्छत्वसिद्धार्थः पीड्यमानो महाजनम् ॥
त्यागधर्मविदं मुण्डं कंचिदस्योपवर्णय । अपि त्यागं बुभूषेत कच्चिद्गच्छेदनामयम् ॥
सिद्धेनौषधयोगेन सर्वशत्रुविनाशिना । नागानश्वान्मनुष्यांश्च कृतकैरुपघातय ॥
data.md: Your enemy will then desire to adopt renunciation and retire into the woods seeking liberation. You will then, with the help of drugs prepared by boiling highly efficacious herbs and plants, and of artificial salts, kill the elephants and horses and men.

data.v: एते चान्ये च बहवो दम्भयोगाः सुनिश्चिताः । शक्या विषहता कर्तुं नक्लीबेन नृपात्मज ॥
data.md: These and the many other well-laid plans exist, but they are all connected with fraud. An intelligent person can thus destroy the denizens of a hostile kingdom with poison,

data.v: न निकृत्या न दम्भेन ब्रह्मन्निच्छामि जीवितुम् । नाधर्मयुक्तानिच्छेयमर्थान्सुमहतोऽप्यहम् ॥
data.md: I do not wish, O Brahmana, to support life by deceit or fraud. I do not seek wealth, however profuse, which is to be acquired by unfair means.

data.v: पुरस्तादेव भगवन्मयैतदपवर्जितम् । येन मां नाभिशङ्केत यद्वा कृत्स्नं हितं भवेत् ॥
data.md: In the very beginning of our present discourse I excepted these means. By adopting only such means as would not incur censure, such means as would benefit me in every respect, by doing only such acts as are not harmful, I wish to live in this world! I cannot follow these ways which you point out to me! Indeed, these instructions do not become you!

data.v: आनृशंस्येन धर्मेण लोके ह्यस्मिञ्जिजीविषुः । नाहमेतदलं कर्तुं नैतन्मय्युपपद्यते ॥
data.md: In the very beginning of our present discourse I excepted these means. By adopting only such means as would not incur censure, such means as would benefit me in every respect, by doing only such acts as are not harmful, I wish to live in this world! I cannot follow these ways which you point out to me! Indeed, these instructions do not become you!

data.v: उपपन्नस्त्वमेतेन यथा क्षत्रिय भाषसे । प्रकृत्या ह्युपपन्नोऽसि बुद्ध्या चाद्भुतदर्शन ॥
data.md: The sage said-These words, O Kshatriya. which you give vent to, point you out as a pious men. Indeed, you are pious by nature and understanding, O you of great experience.

data.v: उभयोरेव वामर्थे यतिष्ये तव तस्य च । संश्लेषं वा करिष्यामि शाश्वतं ह्यनपायिनम् ॥
data.md: I shall try for the good of you both. I shall create a union, between you and that king, which should be eternal and cannot be broken.

data.v: त्वादृशं हि कुले जातमनृशंसं बहुश्रुतम् । अमात्यं को न कुर्वीत राज्यप्रणयकोविदम् ॥
data.md: Who is there that would not like to have a minister like you who are born of a noble family, who abstain from all unfair acts and cruelties, who are highly learned, and who are well versed in the art of government and of conciliation.

data.v: यस्त्वं प्रव्रजितो राज्याद्व्यसनं चोत्तमं गतः । आनृशंस्येन वृत्तेन क्षत्रियेच्छसि जीवितुम् ॥
data.md: I say this, O Kshatriya, because, though bereft of kingdom and plunged into great distress, still you wish to follow a pious course.

data.v: आगन्ता मद्गृहं तात वैदेहः सत्यसंगरः । यथाहं तं नियोक्ष्यामि तत्करिष्यत्यसंशयम् ॥
data.md: The king of the Videhas, ever devoted to truth, will come to my residence soon. For sooth, he will do what I will request him to do.

data.v: तत आहूय वैदेहं मुनिर्वचनमब्रवीत् । अयं राजकुले जातो विदिताभ्यन्तरो मम ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thereafter, inviting the king of the Videhas, the sage said these words to him,-This person is of royal birth. I know his very heart.

data.v: आदर्श इव शुद्धात्मा शारदश्चन्द्रमा इव । नास्मिन्पश्यामि वृजिनं सर्वतो मे परीक्षितः ॥
data.md: His soul is as pure as the surface of a mirror or the disc of the autumnal moon. He has been perfectly examined by me. I do not see any shortcoming in him.

data.v: तेन ते संधिरेवास्तु विश्वसास्मिन्यथा मयि । न राज्यमनमात्येन शक्यं शास्तुममित्रहन् ॥
data.md: Let there be friendship between him and you. Do you place confidence in him as in myself. A king who has no capable minister cannot govern his kingdom even for three days.

data.v: अमात्यः शूर एव स्याद्बुद्धिसंपन्न एव च । ताभ्यां चैव भयं राज्ञः पश्य राज्यस्य योजनम् । धर्मात्मनां क्वचिल्लोके नान्यास्ति गतिरीदृशी ॥
data.md: The minister should be brave and highly intelligent. By these two qualities one may conquer both the worlds. Mark, O king, these two qualities well, since they are necessary for governing a kingdom.

data.v: कृतात्मा राजपुत्रोऽयं सतां मार्गमनुष्ठितः । सुसंगृहीतस्त्वेवैष त्वया धर्मपुरोगमः । संसेव्यमानः शत्रूंस्ते गृह्णीयान्महतो गणान् ॥
data.md: This one, who always follows righteousness, has been a valuable acquisition. If treated by you with respect, he will subdue your enemies.

data.v: यद्ययं प्रतियुध्येत्त्वां स्वकर्म क्षत्रियस्य तत् । जिगीषमाणस्त्वां युद्धे पितृपैतामहे पदे ॥
data.md: If he engages in battle with you, he will do what as a Kshatriya he should do. Indeed, if, following the conduct of his ancestors, he fights for conquering you, it will be your duty to fight him, for as a Kshatriya it is your duty to conquer antagonists. Without engaging in battle, however, do you, at my behest, employ him under you from desire of benefiting yourself.

data.v: त्वं चापि प्रतियुध्येथा विजिगीषुव्रते स्थितः । अयुद्ध्वैव नियोगान्मे वशे वैदेह ते स्थितः ॥
स त्वं धर्ममवेक्षस्व त्यक्त्वाधर्ममसांप्रतम् । न हि कामान्न च द्रोहात्स्वधर्मं हातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Have your eyes on righteousness, casting off covetousness. You should not abandon the duties of your order from lust or from desire of battle.

data.v: नैव नित्यं जयस्तात नैव नित्यं पराजयः । तस्माद्भोजयितव्यश्च भोक्तव्यश्च परो जनः ॥
data.md: Victory, O sire, is not certain. Defeat also is not certain. Knowing this, peace should be made with an cnemy by giving him food and other things of enjoyment.

data.v: आत्मन्येव हि संदृश्यावुभौ जयपराजयौ । निःशेषकारिणां तात निःशेषकरणाद्भयम् ॥
data.md: One may witness victory and defeat his own case. They, who seek to root out an cnemy, are sometimes exterminated themselves in their endeavours!

data.v: इत्युक्तः प्रत्युवाचेदं वचनं ब्राह्मणर्षभम् । अभिपूज्याभिसत्कृत्य पूजार्हमनुमान्य च ॥
यथा ब्रूयान्महाप्राज्ञो यथा ब्रूयाद्बहुश्रुतः । श्रेयस्कामो यथा ब्रूयादुभयोर्यत्क्षमं भवेत् ॥
तथा वचनमुक्तोऽस्मि करिष्यामि च तत्तथा । एतद्धि परमं श्रेयो न मेऽत्रास्ति विचारणा ॥
ततः कौसल्यमाहूय वैदेहो वाक्यमब्रवीत् । धर्मतो नीतितश्चैव बलेन च जितो मया ॥
data.md: Then, addressing the prince of Koshala, the king of Videha said these words,-Following Kshatriya duties as also with the help of policy, I have conquered the world.

data.v: सोऽहं त्वया त्वात्मगुणैर्जितः पार्थिवसत्तम । आत्मानमनवज्ञाय जितवद्वर्ततां भवान् ॥
data.md: I have, however, O best of kings, been conquered by you with your good qualities. Without feeling any sense of humiliation, live you with me as a victor.

data.v: नावमन्ये च ते बुद्धिं नावमन्ये च पौरुषम् । नावमन्ये जयामीति जितवद्वर्ततां भवान् ॥
data.md: I honour you intelligence, and I honour your power. I do not disregard you, saying that I have conquered you. On the other hand, live you with me as a victor.

data.v: यथावत्पूजितो राजन्गृहं गन्तासि मे गृहात् । ततः संपूज्य तौ विप्रं विश्वस्तौ जग्मतुर्गृहान् ॥
data.md: Honoured duly by me, o king, you will go to my house-Both the kings then adored that Brahmana, and trusting each other, proceeded to the capital of Mithila.

data.v: वैदेहस्त्वथ कौसल्यं प्रवेश्य गृहमञ्जसा । पाद्यार्घ्यमधुपर्कैस्तं पूजार्हं प्रत्यपूजयत् ॥
data.md: Making the prince of Koshala enter his house, the king of the Videhas honoured hiin, who was worthy of every honour, with offerings of water to wash his feet, honey and curds and the usual articles.

data.v: ददौ दुहितरं चास्मै रत्नानि विविधानि च । एष राज्ञां परो धर्मः सह्यौ जयपराजयौ ॥
data.md: King Janaka also conferred upon his guest his own daughter and various kinds of gems and jewels. This is the greatest duty of king; victory and defeat are both uncertain."

data.v: ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परंतप । धर्मो वृत्तं च वृत्तिश्च वृत्त्युपायफलानि च ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You have, O scorcher of foes, described the duties, the general conduct, the means of sustenance, with their results, of Brahmanas, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas and Shudras.

data.v: राज्ञां वृत्तं च कोशश्च कोशसंजननं महत् । अमात्यगुणवृद्धिश्च प्रकृतीनां च वर्धनम् ॥
षाड्गुण्यगुणकल्पश्च सेनानीतिस्तथैव च । दुष्टस्य च परिज्ञानमदुष्टस्य च लक्षणम् ॥
समहीनाधिकानां च यथावल्लक्षणोच्चयः । मध्यमस्य च तुष्ट्यर्थं यथा स्थेयं विवर्धता ॥
क्षीणसंग्रहवृत्तिश्च यथावत्संप्रकीर्तिता । लघुनादेशरूपेण ग्रन्थयोगेन भारत ॥
विजिगीषोस्तथावृत्तमुक्तं चैव तथैव ते । गणानां वृत्तिमिच्छामि श्रोतुं मतिमतां वर ॥
data.md: You have also described the conduct that should be followed by kings desirous of conquering their enemies. I desire now, O foremost of intelligent men, to hear how should a person treat the number of brave men (vassals) that gather round a king.

data.v: यथा गणाः प्रवर्धन्ते न भिद्यन्ते च भारत । अरीन्हि विजिगीषन्ते सुहृदः प्राप्नुवन्ति च ॥
data.md: I wish to hear how they may advance, how they may be attached to the person of the king, and how, O Bharata, they may subduing foes gain friends.

data.v: भेदमूलो विनाशो हि गणानामुपलभ्यते । मन्त्रसंवरणं दुःखं बहूनामिति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: It appears to me that disunion alone can encompass their destruction. I think it is always difficult to keep counsels close when there are many in the assemblage.

data.v: एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं निखिलेन परंतप । यथा च ते न भिद्येरंस्तच्च मे ब्रूहि पार्थिव ॥
data.md: I desire to hear ail this fully, O scorcher of foes. Tell me also, O king, the means by which they may not happen to quarrel with the king."

data.v: गणानां च कुलानां च राज्ञां च भरतर्षभ । वैरसंदीपनावेतौ लोभामर्षौ जनाधिप ॥
data.md: Bhishma said "O king, avarice and anger between nobles and the kings create enmity.

data.v: लोभमेको हि वृणुते ततोऽमर्षमनन्तरम् । तौ क्षयव्ययसंयुक्तावन्योन्यजनिताश्रयौ ॥
data.md: The king yields to avarice. And, therefore, anger takes possession of the other. Each bent upon weakening and wasting the other, they both meet with destruction.

data.v: चारमन्त्रबलादानैः सामदानविभेदनैः । क्षयव्ययभयोपायैः कर्शयन्तीतरेतरम् ॥
data.md: By engaging spies, instruments of policy, and physical force, and adopting the means of conciliation, gifts, and dissension, and applying other methods for producing weakness, waste, and fear, the parties attack each other.

data.v: तत्र दानेन भिद्यन्ते गणाः संघातवृत्तयः । भिन्ना विमनसः सर्वे गच्छन्त्यरिवशं भयात् ॥
data.md: The aristocracy of a kingdom in a body becoine alienated from the king, if the latter seeks to exact too much from them. Alienated from the king, all of them become dissatisfied, and from fear join the enemies of the king.

data.v: भेदाद्गणा विनश्यन्ति भिन्नाः सूपजपाः परैः । तस्मात्संघातयोगेषु प्रयतेरन्गणाः सदा ॥
data.md: If again the aristocracy of a kingdom are divided, they meet with destruction. Disunited, they are easily ruined by their foes. The nobles, therefore, should always act unitedly.

data.v: अर्था ह्येवाधिगम्यन्ते संघातबलपौरुषात् । बाह्याश्च मैत्रीं कुर्वन्ति तेषु संघातवृत्तिषु ॥
data.md: If they be united together, they may acquire valuable properties by means of their strength and prowess. When they are thus united, many people from outside seek their alliance.

data.v: ज्ञानवृद्धान्प्रशंसन्तः शुश्रूषन्तः परस्परम् । विनिवृत्ताभिसंधानाः सुखमेधन्ति सर्वशः ॥
data.md: Wise people speak highly of those nobles who are united with one another in ties of love. If of one purpose, all of them can be happy.

data.v: धर्मिष्ठान्व्यवहारांश्च स्थापयन्तश्च शास्त्रतः । यथावत्संप्रवर्तन्तो विवर्धन्ते गणोत्तमाः ॥
data.md: They can establish fairness of conduct. By behaving properly, they grow prosperous.

data.v: पुत्रान्भ्रातॄन्निगृह्णन्तो विनये च सदा रताः । विनीतांश्च प्रगृह्णन्तो विवर्धन्ते गणोत्तमाः ॥
data.md: By restraining their sons and brothers and instructing them in their duties, and treating all persons kindly whose pridc has been subdued by knowledge, the aristocracy grow prosperous.

data.v: चारमन्त्रविधानेषु कोशसंनिचयेषु च । नित्ययुक्ता महाबाहो वर्धन्ते सर्वतो गणाः ॥
data.md: By always engaging spies and concerting measures of policy, and filling up their treasuries, the aristocracy, O you of mighty arms, grow prosperous.

data.v: प्राज्ञाञ्शूरान्महेष्वासान्कर्मसु स्थिरपौरुषान् । मानयन्तः सदा युक्ता विवर्धन्ते गणा नृप ॥
data.md: By receiving properly those who are endued with wisdom, courage and perseverance and who show steady prowess in all kinds of work, the aristocracy grow prosperous.

data.v: द्रव्यवन्तश्च शूराश्च शस्त्रज्ञाः शास्त्रपारगाः । कृच्छ्रास्वापत्सु संमूढान्गणानुत्तारयन्ति ते ॥
data.md: Having wealth and resources, and mastcred the scriptures and all the arts and sciences, the aristocracy rescue the ignorant masses from all sorts of distress and danger,

data.v: क्रोधो भेदो भयो दण्डः कर्शनं निग्रहो वधः । नयन्त्यरिवशं सद्यो गणान्भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: King's anger, disunion with him, terror, punishment, persecution, oppression, and executions, O chief of the Bharatas, quickly alienate the aristocracy from the king and make them side with kings' enemies.

data.v: तस्मान्मानयितव्यास्ते गणमुख्याः प्रधानतः । लोकयात्रा समायत्ता भूयसी तेषु पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Therefore, the leaders of the aristocracy should be honoured by the king. The affairs of the kingdom, o king, depend greatly upon them.

data.v: मन्त्रगुप्तिः प्रधानेषु चारश्चामित्रकर्शन । न गणाः कृत्स्नशो मन्त्रं श्रोतुमर्हन्ति भारत ॥
data.md: Consultations should be held with the leaders of the aristocracy, and secret agents should be engaged, O crusher of foes, to watch them. The king should not, O Bharata, consult with every member of the aristocracy.

data.v: गणमुख्यैस्तु संभूय कार्यं गणहितं मिथः । पृथग्गणस्य भिन्नस्य विमतस्य ततोऽन्यथा । अर्थाः प्रत्यवसीदन्ति तथानर्था भवन्ति च ॥
data.md: Acting jointly with the leaders, the king, should do what is for the behoof of the whole order. When, however, the aristocracy are divided and disunited and have no leaders, other courses of action should be followed,

data.v: तेषामन्योन्यभिन्नानां स्वशक्तिमनुतिष्ठताम् । निग्रहः पण्डितैः कार्यः क्षिप्रमेव प्रधानतः ॥
कुलेषु कलहा जाताः कुलवृद्धैरुपेक्षिताः । गोत्रस्य राजन्कुर्वन्ति गणसंभेदकारिकाम् ॥
data.md: The leaned and wise amongst them should put down a dispute as soon as it takes place. Indeed, if the elders of a family grow indifferent, quarrels break out amongst the members. Such quarrels bring about the ruin of a family and create disunion among the nobles.

data.v: आभ्यन्तरं भयं रक्ष्यं सुरक्ष्यं बाह्यतो भयम् । अभ्यन्तराद्भयं जातं सद्यो मूलं निकृन्तति ॥
data.md: Protect yourself, O king, from all internal fears. External fears, however, are not very important. The first kind of fear, O king, may cut your roots in a single day.

data.v: अकस्मात्क्रोधलोभाद्वा मोहाद्वापि स्वभावजात् । अन्योन्यं नाभिभाषन्ते तत्पराभवलक्षणम् ॥
जात्या च सदृशाः सर्वे कुलेन सदृशास्तथा । न तु शौर्येण बुद्ध्या वा रूपद्रव्येण वा पुनः ॥
भेदाच्चैव प्रमादाच्च नाम्यन्ते रिपुभिर्गणाः । तस्मात्संघातमेवाहुर्गणानां शरणं महत् ॥
महानयं धर्मपथो बहुशाखश्च भारत । किं स्विदेवेह धर्माणामनुष्ठेयतमं मतम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said The path of duty in long. It has also, O Bharata, many branches. What are those duties which you hold to be the best to practise.

data.v: किं कार्यं सर्वधर्माणां गरीयो भवतो मतम् । यथायं पुरुषो धर्ममिह च प्रेत्य चाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: What are the most important duties in your view by the practice of which I may acquire the highest merit both in this world and in the next.

data.v: मातापित्रोर्गुरूणां च पूजा बहुमता मम । अत्र युक्तो नरो लोकान्यशश्च महदश्नुते ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The adoration of mother, father, and preceptor is, I consider, the most important. The man, who satisfies that duty here, succeeds in winning great fame and many blessed regions.

data.v: यदेते ह्यभिजानीयुः कर्म तात सुपूजिताः । धर्म्यं धर्मविरुद्धं वा तत्कर्तव्यं युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Adored by you, whatever they will command you, be it consistent with righteousness, or be it inconsistent with it, you should carry it out unhesitatingly, O Yudhishthira.

data.v: न तैरनभ्यनुज्ञातो धर्ममन्यं प्रकल्पयेत् । यमेतेऽभ्यनुजानीयुः स धर्म इति निश्चयः ॥
data.md: One should never do what they forbid. Forsooth, there command should always be done.

data.v: एत एव त्रयो लोका एत एवाश्रमास्त्रयः । एत एव त्रयो वेदा एत एव त्रयोऽग्नयः ॥
data.md: They are the three worlds. They are the three modes of life. They are the three Vedas. They are the three sacred fires.

data.v: पिता ह्यग्निर्गार्हपत्यो माताग्निर्दक्षिणः स्मृतः । गुरुराहवनीयस्तु साग्नित्रेता गरीयसी ॥
data.md: The father is said to be the Garhapatya fire; the mother, the Dakshina fire; and the preceptor is the fire upon which libations are poured. These three fires are, of course, the greatest. If you adore carefully these three fires, you will conquer the three worlds.

data.v: त्रिष्वप्रमाद्यन्नेतेषु त्रीँल्लोकानवजेष्यसि । पितृवृत्त्या त्विमं लोकं मातृवृत्त्या तथापरम् । ब्रह्मलोकं गुरोर्वृत्त्या नित्यमेव चरिष्यसि ॥
data.md: By serving the father regularly one may cross this world. By serving the mother in the same way, one may enjoy blessed regions in the next. By serving the preceptor regularly, one may acquire the region of Brahma.

data.v: सम्यगेतेषु वर्तस्व त्रिषु लोकेषु भारत । यशः प्राप्स्यसि भद्रं ते धर्मं च सुमहाफलम् ॥
data.md: Properly treat these three, O Bharata, you will then acquire great fame in the three worlds, and be you blessed, great will be your merit and reward.

data.v: नैतानतिशयेज्जातु नात्यश्नीयान्न दूषयेत् । नित्यं परिचरेच्चैव तद्वै सुकृतमुत्तमम् । कीर्तिं पुण्यं यशो लोकान्प्राप्स्यसे च जनाधिप ॥
data.md: Never transgress them in your deeds. Never eat before they eat, nor eat any thing that is better than what they eat. Never attribute any fault to them. One should always serve them humbly. That is an act of great merit.

data.v: सर्वे तस्यादृता लोका यस्यैते त्रय आदृताः । अनादृतास्तु यस्यैते सर्वास्तस्याफलाः क्रियाः ॥
नैवायं न परो लोकस्तस्य चैव परंतप । अमानिता नित्यमेव यस्यैते गुरवस्त्रयः ॥
न चास्मिन्न परे लोके यशस्तस्य प्रकाशते । न चान्यदपि कल्याणं पारत्रं समुदाहृतम् ॥
data.md: He, who always disregards these three elders never enjoys fame either in this world or in the next. Such a man never reaps any good in the next world.

data.v: तेभ्य एव तु तत्सर्वं कृत्यया विसृजाम्यहम् । तदासीन्मे शतगुणं सहस्रगुणमेव च । तस्मान्मे संप्रकाशन्ते त्रयो लोका युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: All that I have dedicated to the honour of those three has multiplied a hundred-fold or a thousand-fold. On account of that merit that even now, Yudhishthira, the three worlds are clearly visible to me.

data.v: दशैव तु सदाचार्यः श्रोत्रियानतिरिच्यते । दशाचार्यानुपाध्याय उपाध्यायान्पिता दश ॥
data.md: One Acharya is superior to ten Brahmanas learned in the Vedas. One Upadhyaya is again superior to ten Acharyas. The father, again, is superior to ten Upadhyayas.

data.v: पितॄन्दश तु मातैका सर्वां वा पृथिवीमपि । गुरुत्वेनाभिभवति नास्ति मातृसमो गुरुः । गुरुर्गरीयान्पितृतो मातृतश्चेति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: The mother, again, is superior to ten fathers, or, perhaps, the whole world, there is no one so much worthy of reverence as the mother.

data.v: उभौ हि मातापितरौ जन्मनि व्युपयुज्यतः । शरीरमेतौ सृजतः पिता माता च भारत । आचार्यशिष्टा या जातिः सा दिव्या साजरामरा ॥
data.md: The father and the mother, O Bharata, only create the body. The life, on the other hand, which one acquires from his preceptor, is divine. That life suffers no decays and is imimortal.

data.v: अवध्या हि सदा माता पिता चाप्यपकारिणौ । न संदुष्यति तत्कृत्वा न च ते दूषयन्ति तम् । धर्माय यतमानानां विदुर्देवाः सहर्षिभिः ॥
data.md: The father and the inother, even if they offend you, should never be killed. By not punishing a father and a mother one does not commit sin. Indeed, such reverend persons, by escaping punishment do not stain the king. The gods and the Rishis do not withhold their favours from such persons who try to maintain even their sinful fathers reverently.

data.v: य आवृणोत्यवितथेन कर्णा;वृतं ब्रुवन्नमृतं संप्रयच्छन् । तं वै मन्ये पितरं मातरं च; तस्मै न द्रुह्येत्कृतमस्य जानन् ॥
data.md: He, who favours a person by giving him true instruction, by communicating the Vedas, and by giving immortal knowledge, should be honoured as parents. The disciple, out of gratitude for what the instructor has done, should never do what would injure the latter.

data.v: विद्यां श्रुत्वा ये गुरुं नाद्रियन्ते; प्रत्यासन्नं मनसा कर्मणा वा । यथैव ते गुरुभिर्भावनीया;स्तथा तेषां गुरवोऽप्यर्चनीयाः ॥
data.md: They, who do not honour their preceptors after receiving instruction from them by obeying them dutifully in thought and deed commit the sin of killing a foetus. There is no greater sinner in this world than this. Preceptors always treat their disciples with great affection. The latter should, therefore, reverse their preceptors duly.

data.v: तस्मात्पूजयितव्याश्च संविभज्याश्च यत्नतः । गुरवोऽर्चयितव्याश्च पुराणं धर्ममिच्छता ॥
data.md: He, therefore, who wishes to acquire that high merit which has existed from days of yore, should adore his preceptors and carefully share with them every object of enjoyment.

data.v: येन प्रीताश्च पितरस्तेन प्रीतः पितामहः । प्रीणाति मातरं येन पृथिवी तेन पूजिता ॥
येन प्रीणात्युपाध्यायं तेन स्याद्ब्रह्म पूजितम् । मातृतः पितृतश्चैव तस्मात्पूज्यतमो गुरुः । ऋषयश्च हि देवाश्च प्रीयन्ते पितृभिः सह ॥
data.md: He, who pleases his preceptor pleases Brahma. Therefore the preceptor deserves greater respect then enter the father or the mother.

data.v: न केनचन वृत्तेन ह्यवज्ञेयो गुरुर्भवेत् । न च माता न च पिता तादृशो यादृशो गुरुः ॥
data.md: The preceptor should never in any way be dishonoured by the disciple. Neither the mother nor the father deserves the honour which the preceptor does.

data.v: न तेऽवमानमर्हन्ति न च ते दूषयन्ति तम् । गुरूणामेव सत्कारं विदुर्देवाः सहर्षिभिः ॥
data.md: No insult should be offered to the father, the mother, and the preceptor. No act of theirs should be censured. The good and the great Rishis are pleased with him who treats his preceptors reverentially.

data.v: उपाध्यायं पितरं मातरं च; येऽभिद्रुह्यन्ति मनसा कर्मणा वा । तेषां पापं भ्रूणहत्याविशिष्टं; तस्मान्नान्यः पापकृदस्ति लोके ॥
data.md: They, who injure in thought and deed their preceptors, or fathers, or mothers, commit the sin of killing a foetus. There is no sinner in the world equal to them.

data.v: मित्रद्रुहः कृतघ्नस्य स्त्रीघ्नस्य पिशुनस्य च । चतुर्णां वयमेतेषां निष्कृतिं नानुशुश्रुमः ॥
data.md: We have never heard that these four, viz., he, who injures a friend, he, who is ungrateful, he, who kills a woman, and he, who kills preceptor, succeed in purifying themselves.

data.v: एतत्सर्वमतिदेशेन सृष्टं; यत्कर्तव्यं पुरुषेणेह लोके । एतच्छ्रेयो नान्यदस्माद्विशिष्टं; सर्वान्धर्माननुसृत्यैतदुक्तम् ॥
data.md: I have described to you in general all that a person should do in this world. Besides those duties that I have described, there is nothing which yields greater happiness. Thinking of all duties, I have described to you their essence. ever

data.v: कथं धर्मे स्थातुमिच्छन्नरो वर्तेत भारत । विद्वञ्जिज्ञासमानाय प्रब्रूहि भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said How, O Bharata, should a person act who wishes to follow virtue? O foremost of Bharata's race, learned as you are, enlighten me on the question put by me.

data.v: सत्यं चैवानृतं चोभे लोकानावृत्य तिष्ठतः । तयोः किमाचरेद्राजन्पुरुषो धर्मनिश्चितः ॥
data.md: Truth and falsehood exist, all over the world. Which of these two, O king, should a virtuous person follow.

data.v: किं स्वित्सत्यं किमनृतं किं स्विद्धर्म्यं सनातनम् । कस्मिन्काले वदेत्सत्यं कस्मिन्कालेऽनृतं वदेत् ॥
data.md: What again is truth? What is falsehood? What, again, is eternal virtue? When should a person tell the truth, and when should he tell an untruth?

data.v: सत्यस्य वचनं साधु न सत्याद्विद्यते परम् । यद्भूलोके सुदुर्ज्ञातं तत्ते वक्ष्यामि भारत ॥
data.md: Bhishma said s To tell the truth is righteous. There is nothing higher than truth. I shall now, O Bharata, tell you what men do not know generally.

data.v: भवेत्सत्यं न वक्तव्यं वक्तव्यमनृतं भवेत् । यत्रानृतं भवेत्सत्यं सत्यं वाप्यनृतं भवेत् ॥
data.md: There, where falsehood prevails as truth, truth should not be said. There, again, where truth passes for falsehood, even falsehood should be said.

data.v: तादृशे मुह्यते बालो यत्र सत्यमनिष्ठितम् । सत्यानृते विनिश्चित्य ततो भवति धर्मवित् ॥
data.md: That ignorant person commits sin, who says truth which is not righteous. That person is a master of duties who can distinguish truth from untruth.

data.v: अप्यनार्योऽकृतप्रज्ञः पुरुषोऽपि सुदारुणः । सुमहत्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यं बलाकोऽन्धवधादिव ॥
data.md: Even a person, who is disreputable, who is of impure soul, and who is very truthless, may succeed in acquiring great merit as the hunter Balaka by killing the blind beast.

data.v: किमाश्चर्यं च यन्मूढो धर्मकामोऽप्यधर्मवित् । सुमहत्प्राप्नुयात्पापं गङ्गायामिव कौशिकः ॥
data.md: How extraordinary it is that a foolish person though desirous of winning merit still perpetrated a sinful deed! An owl, again, living on the banks of the Ganges, acquired great merit.

data.v: तादृशोऽयमनुप्रश्नो यत्र धर्मः सुदुर्वचः । दुष्करः प्रतिसंख्यातुं तर्केणात्र व्यवस्यति ॥
data.md: The question you have put to me a difficult one, because it is difficult to say what is righteousness. It is not easy to describe it. No one describing righteousness, can describe it accurately.

data.v: प्रभावार्थाय भूतानां धर्मप्रवचनं कृतम् । यत्स्यादहिंसासंयुक्तं स धर्म इति निश्चयः ॥
data.md: Righteousness was declared for the aggrandisement and growth of all creatures. Therefore, what brings on advancement and growth is righteousness.

data.v: धारणाद्धर्म इत्याहुर्धर्मेण विधृताः प्रजाः । यत्स्याद्धारणसंयुक्तं स धर्म इति निश्चयः ॥
data.md: Righteousness was declared for preventing creatures from injuring one another. Therefore, Righteousness is that which prevents injury to creatures.

data.v: श्रुतिधर्म इति ह्येके नेत्याहुरपरे जनाः । न तु तत्प्रत्यसूयामो न हि सर्वं विधीयते ॥
data.md: Some say that Righteousness is the injunction of the Shrutis. Others do not agree to this. I would into blame them that say so. Everything, again, has not been described in the Shrutis.

data.v: येऽन्यायेन जिहीर्षन्तो धनमिच्छन्ति कर्हिचित् । तेभ्यस्तन्न तदाख्येयं स धर्म इति निश्चयः ॥
data.md: Sometimes men, desirous of getting hold of the wealth of some one, make enquiries. One should never answer such enquiries. That is settled duty.

data.v: अकूजनेन चेन्मोक्षो नात्र कूजेत्कथंचन । अवश्यं कूजितव्यं वा शङ्केरन्वाप्यकूजनात् ॥
श्रेयस्तत्रानृतं वक्तुं सत्यादिति विचारितम् । यः पापैः सह संबन्धान्मुच्यते शपथादिति ॥
data.md: If by becoming silent, one succeeds in escaping, one should remain silent, If, however, one's silence at a time when one must speak creates suspicion, it would be better then to say what is untrue than what is true. This is right conclusion. If one can escape from sinful men by an oath, one may take it without committing sin.
