data.md: Honoured by you first, I have afterwards been insulted by you. Your conduct towards me is calculated to make me an enemy of yours. It is not meet, therefore, that I should any longer live with you.

data.v: स्वसंतुष्टाश्च्युताः स्थानान्मानात्प्रत्यवरोपिताः । स्वयं चोपहृता भृत्या ये चाप्युपहृताः परैः ॥
परिक्षीणाश्च लुब्धाश्च क्रूराः काराभितापिताः । हृतस्वा मानिनो ये च त्यक्तोपात्ता महेप्सवः ॥
संतापिताश्च ये केचिद्व्यसनौघप्रतीक्षिणः । अन्तर्हिताः सोपहिताः सर्वे ते परसाधनाः ॥
अवमानेन युक्तस्य स्थापितस्य च मे पुनः । कथं यास्यसि विश्वासमहमेष्यामि वा पुनः ॥
data.md: I have been insulted by you and degraded from my place. How will you trust me again? How shall I continue to live with you?

data.v: समर्थ इति संगृह्य स्थापयित्वा परीक्ष्य च । कृतं च समयं भित्त्वा त्वयाहमवमानितः ॥
data.md: Knowing me to be competent you appointed me, and having examined me you had placed me in office. Violating the agreement then made (between us) you have insulted me.

data.v: प्रथमं यः समाख्यातः शीलवानिति संसदि । न वाच्यं तस्य वैगुण्यं प्रतिज्ञां परिरक्षता ॥
data.md: If one speaks of a particular person before others of righteous conduct, one should not, if desirous of keeping one's consistency, afterwards describe the same person as wicked.

data.v: एवं चावमतस्येह विश्वासं किं प्रयास्यसि । त्वयि चैव ह्यविश्वासे ममोद्वेगो भविष्यति ॥
data.md: I, who have thus been dishonoured by you, cannot any longer enjoy your confidence. On my part, when I shall find you withdraw your confidence from me, I shall be stricken with alarm and anxiety.

data.v: शङ्कितस्त्वमहं भीतः परे छिद्रानुदर्शिनः । अस्निग्धाश्चैव दुस्तोषाः कर्म चैतद्बहुच्छलम् ॥
data.md: You entertaining suspicion and myself entertaining fear, our enemies will always try to find out opportunities for injuring us. Your subjects will, as a matter of fact, become anxious and discontented. Such a state of things has many shortcomings.

data.v: दुःखेन श्लेष्यते भिन्नं श्लिष्टं दुःखेन भिद्यते । भिन्नश्लिष्टा तु या प्रीतिर्न सा स्नेहेन वर्तते ॥
data.md: It is difficult to unite again two who have been separated, as it is difficult to separate two that are united. If persons, reunited after separation, meet one another again, their conduct cannot be affectionate.

data.v: कश्चिदेव हि भीतस्तु दृश्यते न परात्मनोः । कार्यापेक्षा हि वर्तन्ते भावाः स्निग्धास्तु दुर्लभाः ॥
data.md: No servant is to be seen who always wishes to do good to his master. People work with the desire of doing good to his master as also to one's own self. All works are undertaken from selfish desires. Unselfish works or motives are very rare.

data.v: सुदुःखं पुरुषज्ञानं चित्तं ह्येषां चलाचलम् । समर्थो वाप्यशक्तो वा शतेष्वेकोऽधिगम्यते ॥
data.md: Those kings, whose hearts are restless and unquiet; cannot gain a true knowledge of men. Only one in a hundred can be found who is either capable or undaunted.

data.v: अकस्मात्प्रक्रिया नॄणामकस्माच्चापकर्षणम् । शुभाशुभे महत्त्वं च प्रकर्तुं बुद्धिलाघवात् ॥
data.md: The prosperity of men, as also their downfall, originates of itself. Prosperity and adversity, and greatness, all originate from weakness of understanding.

data.v: एवं बहुविधं सान्त्वमुक्त्वा धर्मार्थहेतुमत् । प्रसादयित्वा राजानं गोमायुर्वनमभ्यगात् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Having said these conciliatory words pregnant with virtue, pleasure and profit, and having pleased the king, the jackal retired to the forest.

data.v: अगृह्यानुनयं तस्य मृगेन्द्रस्य स बुद्धिमान् । गोमायुः प्रायमासीनस्त्यक्त्वा देहं दिवं ययौ ॥
data.md: Without heeding the entreaties of the king of beasts, the intelligent jackal renounced his body by sitting in Praya and went to heaven.

data.v: किं पार्थिवेन कर्तव्यं किं च कृत्वा सुखी भवेत् । तन्ममाचक्ष्व तत्त्वेन सर्वं धर्मभृतां वर ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said What works should be done by a king, and what are those works by doing which a king may become happy? Tell me this fully, O you who are the foremost of all persons acquainted with duties.

data.v: हन्त तेऽहं प्रवक्ष्यामि शृणु कार्यैकनिश्चयम् । यथा राज्ञेह कर्तव्यं यच्च कृत्वा सुखी भवेत् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said 'I shall tell you what you wish to know! Hear what should be done in this world by a king and what those works are by doing which a king may become happy.

data.v: न त्वेवं वर्तितव्यं स्म यथेदमनुशुश्रुमः । उष्ट्रस्य सुमहद्वृत्तं तन्निबोध युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: A king should not act like a camel of which we have heard. Listen to that history then, O Yudhishthira.

data.v: जातिस्मरो महानुष्ट्रः प्राजापत्ययुगोद्भवः । तपः सुमहदातिष्ठदरण्ये संशितव्रतः ॥
data.md: There was, in the golden cycle, a huge camel who had recollection of his pristine deeds. Practising the most rigid vows, that camel practised very severe austerities in the woods.

data.v: तपसस्तस्य चान्ते वै प्रीतिमानभवत्प्रभुः । वरेण छन्दयामास ततश्चैनं पितामहः ॥
data.md: When his penances were terminated the powerful Brahman became pleased with him. The Grandfather, therefore, desired to grant him boons.

data.v: भगवंस्त्वत्प्रसादान्मे दीर्घा ग्रीवा भवेदियम् । योजनानां शतं साग्रं या गच्छेच्चरितुं विभो ॥
data.md: The camel said Let my neck, O holy one, become long through your favour, so that, O powerful lord, I may be able to get any food that may be even at the end of even a hundred Yojanas.

data.v: एवमस्त्विति चोक्तः स वरदेन महात्मना । प्रतिलभ्य वरं श्रेष्ठं ययावुष्ट्रः स्वकं वनम् ॥
data.md: The great giver of boons said-Let it be so-Having got that boon, the camel then returned to his own forest.

data.v: स चकार तदालस्यं वरदानात्स दुर्मतिः । न चैच्छच्चरितुं गन्तुं दुरात्मा कालमोहितः ॥
data.md: Since the day of securing the boon, the foolish animal became idle. Indeed, stupefied by fate, the wretch did not from that day go out for grazing.

data.v: स कदाचित्प्रसार्यैवं तां ग्रीवां शतयोजनाम् । चचाराश्रान्तहृदयो वातश्चागात्ततो महान् ॥
data.md: One day, while extending his long neck of a hundred Yojanas, the animal was engaged in picking his food without any trouble, there uprose a great storm.

data.v: स गुहायां शिरोग्रीवं निधाय पशुरात्मनः । आस्ताथ वर्षमभ्यागात्सुमहत्प्लावयज्जगत् ॥
data.md: Keeping his head and a portion of the neck within the cave of a mountain, the camel resolved to wait till the storm would be over. Meanwhile rain came down in torrents, deluging the whole Earth.

data.v: अथ शीतपरीताङ्गो जम्बुकः क्षुच्छ्रमान्वितः । सदारस्तां गुहामाशु प्रविवेश जलार्दितः ॥
data.md: Wetted by the rain and shivering with cold, a jackal, with his wife, dragged himself with difficulty towards that very cave and entered it quickly for protection,

data.v: स दृष्ट्वा मांसजीवी तु सुभृशं क्षुच्छ्रमान्वितः । अभक्षयत्ततो ग्रीवामुष्ट्रस्य भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Living as he did upon meat, and greatly hungry and tried as he was, O foremnost of Bharata's race, the jackal, seeing the camel's neck, began to eat as much of it as he could. When he perceived that his neck was being eaten, the camel tried sorrowfully to shorten it.

data.v: यदा त्वबुध्यतात्मानं भक्ष्यमाणं स वै पशुः । तदा संकोचने यत्नमकरोद्भृशदुःखितः ॥
data.md: Living as he did upon meat, and greatly hungry and tried as he was, O foremnost of Bharata's race, the jackal, seeing the camel's neck, began to eat as much of it as he could. When he perceived that his neck was being eaten, the camel tried sorrowfully to shorten it.

data.v: यावदूर्ध्वमधश्चैव ग्रीवां संक्षिपते पशुः । तावत्तेन सदारेण जम्बुकेन स भक्षितः ॥
data.md: But as he moved it up and down, the jackal and his wife, catching it, continued to eat it away.

data.v: स हत्वा भक्षयित्वा च जम्बुकोष्ट्रं ततस्तदा । विगते वातवर्षे च निश्चक्राम गुहामुखात् ॥
data.md: Within a short time the camel was dead. Having thus killed and eaten the camel, the jackal then came out of the cave after the storm and shower had ceased.

data.v: एवं दुर्बुद्धिना प्राप्तमुष्ट्रेण निधनं तदा । आलस्यस्य क्रमात्पश्य महद्दोषमुपागतम् ॥
data.md: Thus did that foolish camel die. See what a great evil followed idleness.

data.v: त्वमप्येतं विधिं त्यक्त्वा योगेन नियतेन्द्रियः । वर्तस्व बुद्धिमूलं हि विजयं मनुरब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: As for yourself, avoiding idleness and controlling your senses, do everything in the world with proper means. Manu himself has declared that victory rests upon intelligence.

data.v: बुद्धिश्रेष्ठानि कर्माणि बाहुमध्यानि भारत । तानि जङ्घाजघन्यानि भारप्रत्यवराणि च ॥
data.md: All acts that are performed with the help of intelligence are regarded as the highest, those performed, with the help of feet are inferior, while those done by carrying loads are the worst.

data.v: राज्यं तिष्ठति दक्षस्य संगृहीतेन्द्रियस्य च । गुप्तमन्त्रश्रुतवतः सुसहायस्य चानघ ॥
परीक्ष्यकारिणोऽर्थाश्च तिष्ठन्तीह युधिष्ठिर । सहाययुक्तेन मही कृत्स्ना शक्या प्रशासितुम् ॥
data.md: In this world, O Yudhishthira, those, who listen to wise advice, those, O sinless one, who have allies, and act after proper scrutiny, succeeds in achieving all their objects. A person with such means succeeds in ruling the entire Earth.

data.v: इदं हि सद्भिः कथितं विधिज्ञैः; पुरा महेन्द्रप्रतिमप्रभाव । मयापि चोक्तं तव शास्त्रदृष्ट्या; त्वमत्र युक्तः प्रचरस्व राजन् ॥
data.md: O you powerful like Indra himself, this has been declared by ancient sages conversant with the scriptural injunctions! I, also, having my eyes on the scriptures, have said the same to you. Using your intelligence, do you act in this world, O king.'

data.v: राजा राज्यमनुप्राप्य दुर्बलो भरतर्षभ । अमित्रस्यातिवृद्धस्य कथं तिष्ठेदसाधनः ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Tell me, O foremost of Bharata's race, how a king, without the usual helps, having obtained a kingdom which is so valuable a possession, should treat a powerful enemy.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । सरितां चैव संवादं सागरस्य च भारत ॥
data.md: 'Regarding it is cited, O Yudhishthira the old discourse between Brihaspati and Indra.

data.v: सुरारिनिलयः शश्वत्सागरः सरितां पतिः । पप्रच्छ सरितः सर्वाः संशयं जातमात्मनः ॥
data.md: In days of yore, eternal Ocean that lord of Rivers, that refuge of the enemies of the gods, asked all the Rivers for solving this doubt that had arisen in his mind.

data.v: समूलशाखान्पश्यामि निहतांश्छायिनो द्रुमान् । युष्माभिरिह पूर्णाभिरन्यांस्तत्र न वेतसम् ॥
data.md: The Ocean said Ye Rivers, I see that all of you, with our strong currents, wash away trees of huge trunks, with their roots and branches. You do not, however, ever bring to me a cane.

data.v: अकायश्चाल्पसारश्च वेतसः कूलजश्च वः । अवज्ञाय नशक्यो वा किंचिद्वा तेन वः कृतम् ॥
data.md: The canes that grow on your banks have small stems and are not strong. Do you refuse to wash them down through contempt, or are they of any utility to you?

data.v: तदहं श्रोतुमिच्छामि सर्वासामेव वो मतम् । यथा कूलानि चेमानि भित्त्वा नानीयते वशम् ॥
ततः प्राह नदी गङ्गा वाक्यमुत्तरमर्थवत् । हेतुमद्ग्राहकं चैव सागरं सरितां पतिम् ॥
data.md: I desire, therefore, to hear what is your motive about it. Indeed, why is it that canes, are not washed down by any of you from the banks were they grow?-Thus addressed, the River Ganga replied, to Ocean, that Lord of all Rivers, in these words of great significance, fraught with reason, and, therefore, liked of all.

data.v: तिष्ठन्त्येते यथास्थानं नगा ह्येकनिकेतनाः । ततस्त्यजन्ति तत्स्थानं प्रातिलोम्यादचेतसः ॥
data.md: Ganga said Trees stand in one and the same place and are never displaced from where they stand. For this by their nature resisting our currents, they are obliged to leave the place of their growth. Canes, however, act otherwise.

data.v: वेतसो वेगमायान्तं दृष्ट्वा नमति नेतरः । स च वेगेऽभ्यतिक्रान्ते स्थानमासाद्य तिष्ठति ॥
data.md: The cane, seeing the advancing current, bends to it. The others do not act in this way. After the current has passed away, the cane resumes its pristine posture.

data.v: कालज्ञः समयज्ञश्च सदा वश्यश्च नोद्रुमः । अनुलोमस्तथास्तब्धस्तेन नाभ्येति वेतसः ॥
data.md: The cane is acquainted with the virtues of Time and opportunity. It is docile and obedient. It is yielding, but not stiff. Therefore, it stands where it grows, without being compelled to follow our current.

data.v: मारुतोदकवेगेन ये नमन्त्युन्नमन्ति च । ओषध्यः पादपा गुल्मा न ते यान्ति पराभवम् ॥
data.md: Those plants, trees, and creepers that bend and rise before the force of wind and water, are never rooted out.

data.v: यो हि शत्रोर्विवृद्धस्य प्रभोर्वधविनाशने । पूर्वं न सहते वेगं क्षिप्रमेव स नश्यति ॥
data.md: Bhishma said-That person, who does not yield to the power of a powerful foe who has grown and who is competent to imprison or kill, soon meets with ruin.

data.v: सारासारं बलं वीर्यमात्मनो द्विषतश्च यः । जानन्विचरति प्राज्ञो न स याति पराभवम् ॥
data.md: That wise man, who acts after determining fully the strength and weakness, the power and energy, of himself and his enemies is never discomfitted.

data.v: एवमेव यदा विद्वान्मन्येतातिबलं रिपुम् । संश्रयेद्वैतसीं वृत्तिमेवं प्रज्ञानलक्षणम् ॥
data.md: An intelligent man, therefore, when he sees liis enemy to be more powerful than himself imitate the conduct of the cane. That is a sign of wisdom.

data.v: विद्वान्मूर्खप्रगल्भेन मृदुस्तीक्ष्णेन भारत । आक्रुश्यमानः सदसि कथं कुर्यादरिंदम ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said How, O Bharata, should a learned and modest man behave, O chastiser of foes, when attacked with harsh speeches in the court by an ignorant person puffed up with conceit?

data.v: श्रूयतां पृथिवीपाल यथैषोऽर्थोऽनुगीयते । सदा सुचेताः सहते नरस्येहाल्पचेतसः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Listen, O king, how this subject has been treated of (in the scriptures), i.e. how a person of good soul should endure in this world the abusive words of foolish persons.

data.v: अरुष्यन्क्रुश्यमानस्य सुकृतं नाम विन्दति । दुष्कृतं चात्मनो मर्षी रुष्यत्येवापमार्ष्टि वै ॥
data.md: If a person, when abused my another, does not become irate, he is then sure to win the merit of all the good deeds that have been done by the abuser. The endurer, in such a case, transfers the demerit of all his own bad deeds to the person who being angry abuses him.

data.v: टिट्टिभं तमुपेक्षेत वाशमानमिवातुरम् । लोकविद्वेषमापन्नो निष्फलं प्रतिपद्यते ॥
data.md: An intelligent man should pay no attention to an utterer of abusive words who resembles, after all, only a Tittibha uttering dissonant notes. One, who is possessed by hate is said to live in vain. A fool is often heard to say,-I addressed such words to such a respectable man amid such an assembly of men!-and to cven boast of that wicked act.

data.v: इति स श्लाघते नित्यं तेन पापेन कर्मणा । इदमुक्तो मया कश्चित्संमतो जनसंसदि । स तत्र व्रीडितः शुष्को मृतकल्पोऽवतिष्ठति ॥
श्लाघन्नश्लाघनीयेन कर्मणा निरपत्रपः । उपेक्षितव्यो दान्तेन तादृशः पुरुषाधमः ॥
यद्यद्ब्रूयादल्पमतिस्तत्तदस्य सहेत्सदा । प्राकृतो हि प्रशंसन्वा निन्दन्वा किं करिष्यति । वने काक इवाबुद्धिर्वाशमानो निरर्थकम् ॥
data.md: What can a vulgar person do by either his praise or blame? He is like a crow that caws uselessly in the forest.

data.v: यदि वाग्भिः प्रयोगः स्यात्प्रयोगे पापकर्मणः । वागेवार्थो भवेत्तस्य न ह्येवार्थो जिघांसतः ॥
data.md: If those, who blame others by only their words, could establish those accusations by such means, then, perhaps, their words would have been considered to be of some value. However, their words are as effective as those uttered by fools invoking death upon them with whom they fall out.

data.v: निषेकं विपरीतं स आचष्टे वृत्तचेष्टया । मयूर इव कौपीनं नृत्यन्संदर्शयन्निव ॥
data.md: That man simply says that he is a bastard who indulges in such conduct and words. Indeed, he is like a peacock that dances while showing such a part of his body which should never be shown.

data.v: यस्यावाच्यं न लोकेऽस्ति नाकार्यं वापि किंचन । वाचं तेन न संदध्याच्छुचिः संक्लिष्टकर्मणा ॥
data.md: A person of pure conduct should never even speak with that sinful person, who does not scruple to utter anything or do anything.

data.v: प्रत्यक्षं गुणवादी यः परोक्षं तु विनिन्दकः । स मानवः श्ववल्लोके नष्टलोकपरायणः ॥
data.md: That man, who speaks of one's qualities when the latter marks him and who speaks ill of him when he does not see him, is really like a dog. Such a person does not acquire heaven and the fruits of any knowledge and virtue that he may have.

data.v: तादृग्जनशतस्यापि यद्ददाति जुहोति च । परोक्षेणापवादेन तन्नाशयति स क्षणात् ॥
data.md: The man, who speaks ill of one in his absence, loses the fruits of all his libations on fire and of the gifts he may make to even a hundred persons.

data.v: तस्मात्प्राज्ञो नरः सद्यस्तादृशं पापचेतसम् । वर्जयेत्साधुभिर्वर्ज्यं सारमेयामिषं यथा ॥
data.md: A wise man, therefore, should unhesitatingly avoid such a sinful person who should always be shunned by all honest men, as he would avoid the flesh of the dog.

data.v: परिवादं ब्रुवाणो हि दुरात्मा वै महात्मने । प्रकाशयति दोषान्स्वान्सर्पः फणमिवोच्छ्रितम् ॥
data.md: That wicked wretch, who mentions the faults of a high-souled person, really displays his own evil nature even as a snake shows his hood.

data.v: तं स्वकर्माणि कुर्वाणं प्रतिकर्तुं य इच्छति । भस्मकूट इवाबुद्धिः खरो रजसि मज्जति ॥
data.md: The sensible man, who tries to oppose such a back-biter always engaged in doing a work congenial to himself, finds himself in the painful situation of a stupid ass sunk in a heap of ashes.

data.v: मनुष्यशालावृकमप्रशान्तं; जनापवादे सततं निविष्टम् । मातङ्गमुन्मत्तमिवोन्नदन्तं; त्यजेत तं श्वानमिवातिरौद्रम् ॥
data.md: A man who always speaks ill of others, should be shunned like a furious wolf, or an infuriate elephant roaring madly, or a fierce dog.

data.v: अधीरजुष्टे पथि वर्तमानं; दमादपेतं विनयाच्च पापम् । अरिव्रतं नित्यमभूतिकामं; धिगस्तु तं पापमतिं मनुष्यम् ॥
data.md: Fie on that sinful wretch, who has followed the footsteps of the foolish who has transgressed all healthy restraints and modesty, who always injures others, and who does not care for his own prosperity.

data.v: प्रत्युच्यमानस्तु हि भूय एभि;र्निशाम्य मा भूस्त्वमथार्तरूपः । उच्चस्य नीचेन हि संप्रयोगं; विगर्हयन्ति स्थिरबुद्धयो ये ॥
data.md: If an honest man wishes to speak to such wretches when they try to humiliate him, he should thus be advised,-Do not allow yourself to be afflicted. A wordy torrents between a high and a low person is always disapproved by persons of sober intelligence.

data.v: क्रुद्धो दशार्धेन हि ताडयेद्वा; स पांसुभिर्वापकिरेत्तुषैर्वा । विवृत्य दन्तांश्च विभीषयेद्वा; सिद्धं हि मूर्खे कुपिते नृशंसे ॥
data.md: A slanderous wretch, when influenced by an anger, may strike another with his palms, or throw dust or chaff at another, or frighten another by showing or grinding his teeth. But all this is well-known.

data.v: विगर्हणां परमदुरात्मना कृतां; सहेत यः संसदि दुर्जनान्नरः । पठेदिदं चापि निदर्शनं सदा; न वाङ्मयं स लभति किंचिदप्रियम् ॥
data.md: That man, who bears the reproaches and slanders of wicked men uttered in assemblies, or who reads frequently these instructions, never suffers any pain from words.

data.v: पितामह महाप्राज्ञ संशयो मे महानयम् । स च्छेत्तव्यस्त्वया राजन्भवान्कुलकरो हि नः ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O grandfather, O you of great wisdom, I have one great doubt which perplexes me! You should, O king, remove it! You are a promoter of our family.

data.v: पुरुषाणामयं तात दुर्वृत्तानां दुरात्मनाम् । कथितो वाक्यसंचारस्ततो विज्ञापयामि ते ॥
data.md: You have described to us the slanderous speeches uttered by wicked men of bad conduct. I desire, however, to question you further.

data.v: यद्धितं राज्यतन्त्रस्य कुलस्य च सुखोदयम् । आयत्यां च तदात्वे च क्षेमवृद्धिकरं च यत् ॥
data.md: That which is beneficial to a kingdom, that which yields happiness to the family of kings, that which yields good and advancement in the future and the present, that which is good regarding food, drink and the body, are topics upon which I wish you to dwell.

data.v: पुत्रपौत्राभिरामं च राष्ट्रवृद्धिकरं च यत् । अन्नपाने शरीरे च हितं यत्तद्ब्रवीहि मे ॥
data.md: That which is beneficial to a kingdom, that which yields happiness to the family of kings, that which yields good and advancement in the future and the present, that which is good regarding food, drink and the body, are topics upon which I wish you to dwell.

data.v: अभिषिक्तो हि यो राजा राज्यस्थो मित्रसंवृतः । असुहृत्समुपेतो वा स कथं रञ्जयेत्प्रजाः ॥
data.md: How should a king, who has been put on the throne occupy it, surrounded by friends, ministers and servants, please his subjects?

data.v: यो ह्यसत्प्रग्रहरतिः स्नेहरागबलात्कृतः । इन्द्रियाणामनीशत्वादसज्जनबुभूषकः ॥
data.md: That king, who, taken away by his natural propensities and proclivities, become devoted to evil companions, and flatters wicked men for his being under the influence of his senses, find all servants of good birth and blood displeased with him. Such a king never gets those objects the accomplishment of which depends upon one's having a number of good servants about him.

data.v: तस्य भृत्या विगुणतां यान्ति सर्वे कुलोद्गताः । न च भृत्यफलैरर्थैः स राजा संप्रयुज्यते ॥
data.md: That king, who, taken away by his natural propensities and proclivities, become devoted to evil companions, and flatters wicked men for his being under the influence of his senses, find all servants of good birth and blood displeased with him. Such a king never gets those objects the accomplishment of which depends upon one's having a number of good servants about him.

data.v: एतान्मे संशयस्थस्य राजधर्मान्सुदुर्लभान् । बृहस्पतिसमो बुद्ध्या भवाञ्शंसितुमर्हति ॥
data.md: You, who are equal to Brihaspati himself in intelligence, should describe to me these duties of kings which are difficult to be ascertained and thereby resolve my doubt.

data.v: शंसिता पुरुषव्याघ्र त्वं नः कुलहिते रतः । क्षत्ता चैव पटुप्रज्ञो यो नः शंसति सर्वदा ॥
data.md: You, O foremost of men, are ever engaged in encompassing the good of our family. For this reason you always describe to us on the duties of the kings. Endued with great wisdom, Vidura also gives always valuable instruction.

data.v: त्वत्तः कुलहितं वाक्यं श्रुत्वा राज्यहितोदयम् । अमृतस्याव्ययस्येव तृप्तः स्वप्स्याम्यहं सुखम् ॥
data.md: Hearing instructions from you which are productive of good to our family and kingdom, I shall be able to live happily like a person pleased with having drunk the immortal nectar.

data.v: कीदृषाः संनिकर्षस्था भृत्याः स्युर्वा गुणान्विताः । कीदृशैः किंकुलीनैर्वा सह यात्रा विधीयते ॥
data.md: What classes of servants are to be considered as inferior and what as possessing all accomplishments? Helped by what class of servants or by servants of what kind of birth, should a king rule?

data.v: न ह्येको भृत्यरहितो राजा भवति रक्षिता । राज्यं चेदं जनः सर्वस्तत्कुलीनोऽभिशंसति ॥
data.md: If the king choose to act alone and without servants, he can never protect his people. All persons, however, of high birth wish for the acquisition of sovereignty? us

data.v: न हि प्रशास्तुं राज्यं हि शक्यमेकेन भारत । असहायवता तात नैवार्थाः केचिदप्युत । लब्धुं लब्ध्वा चापि सदा रक्षितुं भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The king, O Bharata, cannot along govern his kingdom. Without servants to help him, he cannot accomplish any object. Even if he gains any object, he cannot retain it.

data.v: यस्य भृत्यजनः सर्वो ज्ञानविज्ञानकोविदः । हितैषी कुलजः स्निग्धः स राज्यफलमश्नुते ॥
data.md: That king, whose servants are all gifted with knowledge and wisdom, who always seek the well being of their master, and who are of high birth and quiet disposition, enjoys the happiness of sovereignty.

data.v: मन्त्रिणो यस्य कुलजा असंहार्याः सहोषिताः । नृपतेर्मतिदाः सन्ति संबन्धज्ञानकोविदाः ॥
data.md: That king, whose ministers are all born in respectable families, incapable of being alienated from him, who always live with him, who always give advice to their master, who are endued with wisdom and goodness, who have a knowledge of all things, who can provide for future events and contingencies, who have a good knowledge of the virtues of time, and who never regret for the past, succeeds in enjoying the happiness of sovereignty.

data.v: अनागतविधातारः कालज्ञानविशारदाः । अतिक्रान्तमशोचन्तः स राज्यफलमश्नुते ॥
समदुःखसुखा यस्य सहायाः सत्यकारिणः । अर्थचिन्तापरा यस्य स राज्यफलमश्नुते ॥
data.md: That king, whose servants partake of his sorrows and joys, who always do what he likes, who always try to accomplish their maser's objects, and all of whom are faithful, enjoys the happiness of sovereignty.

data.v: यस्य नार्तो जनपदः संनिकर्षगतः सदा । अक्षुद्रः सत्पथालम्बी स राज्यफलभाग्भवेत् ॥
data.md: That king, whose subjects are always happy and magnanimous, and who always went to path of the righteous, enjoys the happiness of sovereignty.

data.v: कोशाक्षपटलं यस्य कोशवृद्धिकरैर्जनैः । आप्तैस्तुष्टैश्च सततं धार्यते स नृपोत्तमः ॥
data.md: He is the best of kings, the various sources of whose revenue are managed and supervised by contented and trustworthy men who know fully the means of multiplying the finances.

data.v: कोष्ठागारमसंहार्यैराप्तैः संचयतत्परैः । पात्रभूतैरलुब्धैश्च पाल्यमानं गुणीभवेत् ॥
data.md: That king acquires great riches and merit whose repositories and barns are looked after by trustworthy, devoted, and uncovetous and scrupulous servants always always bent upon gathering.

data.v: व्यवहारश्च नगरे यस्य कर्मफलोदयः । दृश्यते शङ्खलिखितः स धर्मफलभाग्भवेत् ॥
data.md: That king in whose city justice is administered properly which leads to the fining the plaintiff or the defendant, if his case is untrue, and in which criminal laws are administered after the manner of Shankha and Likhita, acquires the merit of sovereignty.

data.v: संगृहीतमनुष्यश्च यो राजा राजधर्मवित् । षड्वर्गं प्रतिगृह्णन्स धर्मात्फलमुपाश्नुते ॥
data.md: That king, who wins over subjects by kindness, who is master of the duties of kings, and who is mindful of six cardinal objects, acquires the merit of sovereignty.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । निदर्शनकरं लोके सज्जनाचरितं सदा ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Regarding it is cited the following ancient history. That history is considered as one of the greatest precedent amongst good and wisemen.

data.v: अस्यैवार्थस्य सदृशं यच्छ्रुतं मे तपोवने । जामदग्न्यस्य रामस्य यदुक्तमृषिसत्तमैः ॥
data.md: That history is connected with the present subject. I heard it in the asylum of Rama the son of Jamadagni, recited by many foremost of Rishis.

data.v: वने महति कस्मिंश्चिदमनुष्यनिषेविते । ऋषिर्मूलफलाहारो नियतो नियतेन्द्रियः ॥
data.md: In a certain large forest uninhabited by human beings, there lived an ascetic upon fruits and roots, practising rigid vows and with his senses under restraint.

data.v: दीक्षादमपरः शान्तः स्वाध्यायपरमः शुचिः । उपवासविशुद्धात्मा सततं सत्पथे स्थितः ॥
data.md: Observing strict regulations and selfrestraint, of great and pure soul, always making Vedic recitations, and of heart purified by facts, he treated all creatures with goodness.

data.v: तस्य संदृश्य सद्भावमुपविष्टस्य धीमतः । सर्वसत्त्वाः समीपस्था भवन्ति वनचारिणः ॥
data.md: Highly intelligent, as he was, as he sat on his seat, the goodness of his conduct having been known to all the creatures that dwelt in that forest, they used to approach him with affection.

data.v: सिंहव्याघ्राः सशरभा मत्ताश्चैव महागजाः । द्वीपिनः खड्गभल्लूका ये चान्ये भीमदर्शनाः ॥
ते सुखप्रश्नदाः सर्वे भवन्ति क्षतजाशनाः । तस्यर्षेः शिष्यवच्चैव न्यग्भूताः प्रियकारिणः ॥
data.md: Dreadful lions and tigers, infuriate elephants of huge body, leopards, rhinoceroses, bears, and other dreadful animals, living upon blood, used to come to the Rishi and question him politely. Indeed, all of them behaved towards him like disciples and slaves and always did what was agreeable to him.,

data.v: दत्त्वा च ते सुखप्रश्नं सर्वे यान्ति यथागतम् । ग्राम्यस्त्वेकः पशुस्तत्र नाजहाच्छ्वा महामुनिम् ॥
data.md: Coming to him they made enquiries, and then went away to their respective habitations. One domestic animal, however, resided there permanently, never, leaving the ascetic at any time.

data.v: भक्तोऽनुरक्तः सततमुपवासकृशोऽबलः । फलमूलोत्कराहारः शान्तः शिष्टाकृतिर्यथा ॥
data.md: He was greatly attached to the saint. Weak and emaciated with fasts, he lived upon fruits and roots and water, and was tranquil and of inoffensive character.

data.v: तस्यर्षेरुपविष्टस्य पादमूले महामुनेः । मनुष्यवद्गतो भावः स्नेहबद्धोऽभवद्भृशम् ॥
data.md: Lying at the feet of that great Rishi as the latter sat, the dog, with a humane heart, become greatly attached to him for the affection with which he was treated.

data.v: ततोऽभ्ययान्महावीर्यो द्वीपी क्षतजभोजनः । श्वार्थमत्यन्तसंदुष्टः क्रूरः काल इवान्तकः ॥
data.md: One day a very strong leopard came there, leaving upon blood. Of a cruel nature and always delighted at the prospect of prey, the dreadful animal looked like a second Yama.

data.v: लेलिह्यमानस्तृषितः पुच्छास्फोटनतत्परः । व्यादितास्यः क्षुधाभग्नः प्रार्थयानस्तदामिषम् ॥
data.md: Licking the corners of his mouth with the tongue, and lashing his tail furiously, the leopard came there, stricken with hunger and thirst, with wide open jaws, desirous of catching the dog as his prey.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा क्रूरमायान्तं जीवितार्थी नराधिप । प्रोवाच श्वा मुनिं तत्र यत्तच्छृणु महामते ॥
data.md: Seeing that dreadful animal coming, O king, the dog, in fear of his life, spoke to the ascetic as follows. Listen to them, O king!-

data.v: श्वशत्रुर्भगवन्नत्र द्वीपी मां हन्तुमिच्छति । त्वत्प्रसादाद्भयं न स्यात्तस्मान्मम महामुने ॥
data.md: O Rishi, this leopard is an enemy of the dogs, It wishes to kill me. O great sage, do you so act that all my fears from this animal may be removed through your favour. O you of mighty arms, forsooth, you are omniscient.

data.v: न भयं द्वीपिनः कार्यं मृत्युतस्ते कथंचन । एष श्वरूपरहितो द्वीपी भवसि पुत्रक ॥
data.md: The sage said You shall have no fear of death from leopards any longer! Let your natural from disappear and be you a leopard, O son!

data.v: ततः श्वा द्वीपितां नीतो जाम्बूनदनिभाकृतिः । चित्राङ्गो विस्फुरन्हृष्टो वने वसति निर्भयः ॥
data.md: Thereat, the dog was metamorphosed into a leopard with skin bright as gold. With stripes on his body and with huge teeth, thenceforth he began to live in that forest fearlessly.

data.v: ततोऽभ्ययान्महारौद्रो व्यादितास्यः क्षुधान्वितः । द्वीपिनं लेलिहद्वक्त्रो व्याघ्रो रुधिरलालसः ॥
data.md: Sometime after, there came into that asylum a dreadful and hungry tiger with mouth wide open. Licking the corners of his mouth with the tongue, and eagerly desirous of drinking blood, that tiger began to approach the animal that had been metamorphosed into a leopard.

data.md: Seeing the hungry tiger of dreadful teeth approach that forest, the leopard sought the Rishi's protection for saving his life.

data.v: शरभः शरभस्थाने सिंहः सिंह इवोर्जितः । व्याघ्रो व्याघ्र इव स्थाप्यो द्वीपी द्वीपी यथा तथा ॥
data.md: A Sharabha should occupy the position of Sharabha; a lion should be elated with the power of lion; a tiger; should be placed in the position of a tiger, and a leopard should be placed in that of a leopard.

data.v: कर्मस्विहानुरूपेषु न्यस्या भृत्या यथाविधि । प्रतिलोमं न भृत्यास्ते स्थाप्याः कर्मफलैषिणा ॥
data.md: Servants should according to the scriptural injunction, be appointed to offices for which each is competent. If you wish to achieve success, you should never appoint servants in offices higher than what they deserve.

data.v: यः प्रमाणमतिक्रम्य प्रतिलोमं नराधिपः । भृत्यान्स्थापयतेऽबुद्धिर्न स रञ्जयते प्रजाः ॥
data.md: That foolish king, who, disregarding precedent, appoints servants to offices for which they are not fit, fails to please his people.

data.v: न बालिशा न च क्षुद्रा न चाप्रतिमितेन्द्रियाः । नाकुलीना नराः पार्श्वे स्थाप्या राज्ञा हितैषिणा ॥
data.md: A king, who wishes to have accomplished servants should never appoint persons who are shorn of intelligence, who are low-minded, who are without wisdom, who are not masters of their senses, and who are not highly born.

data.v: साधवः कुशलाः शूरा ज्ञानवन्तोऽनसूयकाः । अक्षुद्राः शुचयो दक्षा नराः स्युः पारिपार्श्वकाः ॥
data.md: Men, who are honest, born in high family, brave, learned, shorn of malice and envy, noble, pure in conduct, and clever in business, deserve to be appointed as minister.

data.v: न्यग्भूतास्तत्पराः क्षान्ताश्चौक्षाः प्रकृतिजाः शुभाः । स्वे स्वे स्थानेऽपरिक्रुष्टास्ते स्यू राज्ञो बहिश्चराः ॥
data.md: Persons, who are humble, always ready to perform their duties, of a peaceful nature, pure in mind, adorned with various other gifts of nature, and are never spoken ill of for the offices they hold should be the intimate companions of the king.

data.v: सिंहस्य सततं पार्श्वे सिंह एव जनो भवेत् । असिंहः सिंहसहितः सिंहवल्लभते फलम् ॥
data.md: A lion should always associate with a lion, If one that is not a lion associates with a lion, it acquires all the advantages that belong to a lion.

data.v: यस्तु सिंहः श्वभिः कीर्णः सिंहकर्मफले रतः । न स सिंहफलं भोक्तुं शक्तः श्वभिरुपासितः ॥
data.md: That lion, however who while performing the duties of a lion, has a pack of dogs only for his companions, never succeeds for such companionship, in performing those duties.

data.v: एवमेतैर्मनुष्येन्द्र शूरैः प्राज्ञैर्बहुश्रुतैः । कुलीनैः सह शक्येत कृत्स्नां जेतुं वसुंधराम् ॥
data.md: Thus, O monarch, a king may succeed in subjugating the entire Earth if he has for his ministers men endued with courage, wisdom, great learning, and high-birth.

data.v: नावैद्यो नानृजुः पार्श्वे नाविद्यो नामहाधनः । संग्राह्यो वसुधापालैर्भृत्यो भृत्यवतां वर ॥
data.md: O foremost of kings, kings should never keep a servant who is shorn of learning, sincerity, wisdom and great wealth.

data.v: बाणवद्विसृता यान्ति स्वामिकार्यपरा जनाः । ये भृत्याः पार्थिवहितास्तेषां सान्त्वं प्रयोजयेत् ॥
data.md: Those men who are devoted to the master proceed unimpeded like arrows. Kings should always speak sweet words to those servants who are always busy with doing good to their masters.

data.v: कोशश्च सततं रक्ष्यो यत्नमास्थाय राजभिः । कोशमूला हि राजानः कोशमूलकरो भव ॥
data.md: Kings, should, always, diligently look after their treasuries. Indeed, kings depend on their treasuries A king should, always, try to swell his treasures.

data.v: कोष्ठागारं च ते नित्यं स्फीतं धान्यैः सुसंचितम् । सदास्तु सत्सु संन्यस्तं धनधान्यपरो भव ॥
data.md: Let your barns, O king, be filled with corn. And let them be entrusted to honest servants. Do your try to increase your wealth and corn.

data.v: नित्ययुक्ताश्च ते भृत्या भवन्तु रणकोविदाः । वाजिनां च प्रयोगेषु वैशारद्यमिहेष्यते ॥
data.md: Let your servants, skilled in battle, always attend to their duties. It is desirable that they should be skilful in the management of horses.

data.v: ज्ञातिबन्धुजनावेक्षी मित्रसंबन्धिसंवृतः । पौरकार्यहितान्वेषी भव कौरवनन्दन ॥
data.md: O delighter of the Kurus, Look to the wants of your kinsmen and friends. Be encircled by friends and relatives. Seek the good of your city.

data.v: एषा ते नैष्ठिकी बुद्धिः प्रज्ञा चाभिहिता मया । श्वा ते निदर्शनं तात किं भूयः श्रोतुमिच्छसि ॥
data.md: By mentioning the example of the dog I have instructed you about the duties you should adopt towards your subjects. What further do you wish to hear?'

data.v: राजवृत्तान्यनेकानि त्वया प्रोक्तानि भारत । पूर्वैः पूर्वनियुक्तानि राजधर्मार्थवेदिभिः ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You have, O Bharata, described the many duties of king-craft, which were observed and laid down in days of yore by persons of ancient times conversant with royal duties.

data.v: तदेव विस्तरेणोक्तं पूर्वैर्दृष्टं सतां मतम् । प्रणयं राजधर्माणां प्रब्रूहि भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: You have, indeed, described fully those duties as approved by the wise. Do you, however, O foremost of Bharata's race give us an abridgement of the same, so that we may keep it in memory.

data.v: रक्षणं सर्वभूतानामिति क्षत्रे परं मतम् । तद्यथा रक्षणं कुर्यात्तथा शृणु महीपते ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The protection of all creatures is considered the highest duty of the Kshatriya. Listen now to me, o king, as to how the duty of protection to be performed.

data.v: यथा बर्हाणि चित्राणि बिभर्ति भुजगाशनः । तथा बहुविधं राजा रूपं कुर्वीत धर्मवित् ॥
data.md: A king conversant with his duties should put on many forms and the peacock displays plumes of various hues.

data.v: तैक्ष्ण्यं जिह्मत्वमादान्त्यं सत्यमार्जवमेव च । मध्यस्थः सत्त्वमातिष्ठंस्तथा वै सुखमृच्छति ॥
data.md: Keenness, crookedness, truth, and sincerity, are the qualities which should be present in him. He should practise impartially the qualities of goodness if he is to acquire happiness.

data.v: यस्मिन्नर्थे हितं यत्स्यात्तद्वर्णं रूपमाविशेत् । बहुरूपस्य राज्ञो हि सूक्ष्मोऽप्यर्थो न सीदति ॥
data.md: He must assume that particular colour or form which is beneficial for the particular object which he tries to achieve. A king who can put on various forms succeeds in achieving even the most subtile objects.

data.v: नित्यं रक्षितमन्त्रः स्याद्यथा मूकः शरच्छिखी । श्लक्ष्णाक्षरतनुः श्रीमान्भवेच्छास्त्रविशारदः ॥
data.md: Dumb like the peacock in autumn, he should keep his counsels close. He should speak little and that little should be sweet. He should be of good features and well-read in the scriptures.

data.v: आपद्द्वारेषु यत्तः स्याज्जलप्रस्रवणेष्विव । शैलवर्षोदकानीव द्विजान्सिद्धान्समाश्रयेत् ॥
data.md: He should always be very careful about those gates through which dangers may come and befall him, like men guarding breaks in embankments through which the waters of large tanks may rush and flood their fields and houses. He should seek the protection of Brahmanas crowned with ascetic success as men seek the refuge of powerful rivers caused by the rain-water deposited within mountain lakes. That king, who wishes to amass riches should act like religious hypocrites who keep Sikha or tuft of hair.

data.v: अर्थकामः शिखां राजा कुर्याद्धर्मध्वजोपमाम् । नित्यमुद्यतदण्डः स्यादाचरेच्चाप्रमादतः । लोके चायव्ययौ दृष्ट्वा वृक्षाद्वृक्षमिवाप्लवन् ॥
data.md: The king should always have the rod of Punishment uplifted in his hands. He should always levy taxes carefully after examining the incomes and expenses of his subjects, like men going to a full-grown palmyra for drawing juice.

data.v: मृजावान्स्यात्स्वयूथ्येषु भावानि चरणैः क्षिपेत् । जातपक्षः परिस्पन्देद्रक्षेद्वैकल्यमात्मनः ॥
data.md: He should treat equitably his own subjects; cause the crops of his enemies to be crushed by the foot of his cavalry, march against enemies when his own wings have become strong; and mark all the sources of his own weakness.

data.v: दोषान्विवृणुयाच्छत्रोः परपक्षान्विधूनयेत् । काननेष्विव पुष्पाणि बर्हीवार्थान्समाचरेत् ॥
data.md: He should announce the faults of his enemies; crush those who are their partisans; and collect riches from outside like a person plucking flowers from the forest.

data.v: उच्छ्रितानाश्रयेत्स्फीतान्नरेन्द्रानचलोपमान् । श्रयेच्छायामविज्ञातां गुप्तं शरणमाश्रयेत् ॥
data.md: He should kill those foremost of kings who are puffed up with might and stand with upraised heads like mountains; by bribing the governors of the forests and by ambuscades and sudden attacks.

data.v: प्रावृषीवासितग्रीवो मज्जेत निशि निर्जने । मायूरेण गुणेनैव स्त्रीभिश्चालक्षितश्चरेत् । न जह्याच्च तनुत्राणं रक्षेदात्मानमात्मना ॥
data.md: Like the peacock in the rains, he should enter his nightly habitations alone and unseen. Indeed, he should enjoy, like the peacock, within his inner apartments, the company of his wives.

data.v: चारभूमिष्वभिगमान्पाशांश्च परिवर्जयेत् । पीडयेच्चापि तां भूमिं प्रणश्येद्गहने पुनः ॥
हन्यात्क्रुद्धानतिविषान्ये जिह्मगतयोऽहितान् । नाश्रयेद्बालबर्हाणि सन्निवासानि वासयेत् ॥
सदा बर्हिनिभः कामं प्रसक्तिकृतमाचरेत् । सर्वतश्चाददेत्प्रज्ञां पतंगान्गहनेष्विव । एवं मयूरवद्राजा स्वराष्ट्रं परिपालयेत् ॥
आत्मवृद्धिकरीं नीतिं विदधीत विचक्षणः । आत्मसंयमनं बुद्ध्या परबुद्ध्यावतारणम् । बुद्ध्या चात्मगुणप्राप्तिरेतच्छास्त्रनिदर्शनम् ॥
data.md: By dint of his own intelligence, he should determine what he is to do. By consulting with others he should either leave off or conform such resolution. Helped by that intelligence which is sharpened by the scriptures, one can fix his courses of action. Herein consists the utility of the scriptures.

data.v: परं चाश्वासयेत्साम्ना स्वशक्तिं चोपलक्षयेत् । आत्मनः परिमर्शेन बुद्धिं बुद्ध्या विचारयेत् । सान्त्वयोगमतिः प्राज्ञः कार्याकार्यविचारकः ॥
data.md: By following the means of conciliation, he should create confidence in the hearts of his enemies. He should show his own strength. By judging of various courses of action in his own mind he should by dint of his own intelligence, make his decision.

data.v: निगूढबुद्धिर्धीरः स्याद्वक्तव्ये वक्ष्यते तथा । संनिकृष्टां कथां प्राज्ञो यदि बुद्ध्या बृहस्पतिः । स्वभावमेष्यते तप्तं कृष्णायसमिवोदके ॥
अनुयुञ्जीत कृत्यानि सर्वाण्येव महीपतिः । आगमैरुपदिष्टानि स्वस्य चैव परस्य च ॥
क्षुद्रं क्रूरं तथा प्राज्ञं शूरं चार्थविशारदम् । स्वकर्मणि नियुञ्जीत ये चान्ये वचनाधिकाः ॥
data.md: A king, who knows well the means of acquiring riches, should always engage in his acts such men as are mild by nature and endued with wisdom, courage and great strength.

data.v: अप्यदृष्ट्वा नियुक्तानि अनुरूपेषु कर्मसु । सर्वांस्ताननुवर्तेत स्वरांस्तन्त्रीरिवायता ॥
data.md: Seeing his servants employed in acts for which each is fit, the king should act in unision with them like the strings of a musical instrument, set to proper tension, according with their notes.

data.v: धर्माणामविरोधेन सर्वेषां प्रियमाचरेत् । ममायमिति राजा यः स पर्वत इवाचलः ॥
data.md: The king should do good to all persons without violating the injunctions of Righteousness. That king stands firm as a rock whom everybody regards-He is mine.

data.v: व्यवसायं समाधाय सूर्यो रश्मिमिवायताम् । धर्ममेवाभिरक्षेत कृत्वा तुल्ये प्रियाप्रिये ॥
data.md: While settling the claims of litigants, the king, without making any difference between persons who are liked and those who are disliked by him, should preserve justice.

data.v: कुलप्रकृतिदेशानां धर्मज्ञान्मृदुभाषिणः । मध्ये वयसि निर्दोषान्हिते युक्ताञ्जितेन्द्रियान् ॥
अलुब्धाञ्शिक्षितान्दान्तान्धर्मेषु परिनिष्ठितान् । स्थापयेत्सर्वकार्येषु राजा धर्मार्थरक्षिणः ॥
data.md: The king should appoint in all his offices such men as know very well the characteristics of particular families of the people in general and of various countries; as are mild in words; as are of middle age; as have no shortcomings, as are devoted to good acts; as are never careless; as are free from rapacity; as are possessed of learning and self-control; and as are firm in virtue and always ready to preserve the interests of both virtue and profit.

data.v: एतेनैव प्रकारेण कृत्यानामागतिं गतिम् । युक्तः समनुतिष्ठेत तुष्टश्चारैरुपस्कृतः ॥
data.md: In this way, having determined the course of actions and their final ends, the king should accomplish them carefully; and instructed in all matters by his spies, he may live happily.

data.v: अमोघक्रोधहर्षस्य स्वयं कृत्यान्ववेक्षिणः । आत्मप्रत्ययकोशस्य वसुधैव वसुंधरा ॥
data.md: That king, who never yields to anger and joy without sufficient cause, who looks after all his acts himself, and who superintends his income and expenditure with his own eyes, succeeds in acquiring great wealth from the Earth.

data.v: व्यक्तश्चानुग्रहो यस्य यथार्थश्चापि निग्रहः । गुप्तात्मा गुप्तराष्ट्रश्च स राजा राजधर्मवित् ॥
data.md: That king is a master of his royal duties who rewards his officers and subjects publicly, who punishes those who deserve punishment, who protects his own self, and who protects his kingdom from very evil.

data.v: नित्यं राष्ट्रमवेक्षेत गोभिः सूर्य इवोत्पतन् । चारांश्च नचरान्विद्यात्तथा बुद्ध्या न संज्वरेत् ॥
data.md: Like the Sun shedding his rays upon everything underneath, the king should always look after his kingdom himself, and helped by his intelligence, be should supervise all his spies and officers.

data.v: कालप्राप्तमुपादद्यान्नार्थं राजा प्रसूचयेत् । अहन्यहनि संदुह्यान्महीं गामिव बुद्धिमान् ॥
data.md: The king should collect wealth from his subjects at the proper time. He should never announce what he does. Like an intelligent person milking his cow every day, the king should milk his kingdom everyday.

data.v: यथा क्रमेण पुष्पेभ्यश्चिनोति मधु षट्पदः । तथा द्रव्यमुपादाय राजा कुर्वीत संचयम् ॥
data.md: As the bee gathers honey from flowers gradually, the king should collect wealth gradually from his kingdom for keeping it in store.

data.v: यद्धि गुप्तावशिष्टं स्यात्तद्धितं धर्मकामयोः । संचयानुविसर्गी स्याद्राजा शास्त्रविदात्मवान् ॥
data.md: Having kept apart a sufficient portion, he should with the remaining portion, acquire religious merit and gratify his desires for pleasure. That king, who is acquainted with duties and who is gifted with intelligence, would never squander what has been stored.

data.v: नाल्पमर्थं परिभवेन्नावमन्येत शात्रवान् । बुद्ध्यावबुध्येदात्मानं न चाबुद्धिषु विश्वसेत् ॥
data.md: The king should never disregard any wealth, however little it may be; he should never belittle his foes for their powerlessness; he should by his own intelligence, examine his ownself; he should never place confidence in ignorant persons.

data.v: धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं संयमो बुद्धिरग्र्या; धैर्यं शौर्यं देशकालोऽप्रमादः । स्वल्पस्य वा महतो वापि वृद्धौ; धनस्यैतान्यष्ट समिन्धनानि ॥
अग्निस्तोको वर्धते ह्याज्यसिक्तो; बीजं चैकं बहुसाहस्रमेति । क्षयोदयौ विपुलौ संनिशाम्य; तस्मादल्पं नावमन्येत विद्वान् ॥
बालोऽबालः स्थविरो वा रिपुर्यः; सदा प्रमत्तं पुरुषं निहन्यात् । कालेनान्यस्तस्य मूलं हरेत; कालज्ञाता पार्थिवानां वरिष्ठः ॥
data.md: An enemy, whether he be a child, a young man, or an aged one, succeeds in killing a careless person. An insignificant enemy, when he becomes powerful, may root out a king. A king, therefore, who is conversant with the requirements of time is the greatest of all kings.

data.v: हरेत्कीर्तिं धर्ममस्योपरुन्ध्या;दर्थे दीर्घं वीर्यमस्योपहन्यात् । रिपुर्द्वेष्टा दुर्बलो वा बली वा; तस्माच्छत्रौ नैव हेडेद्यतात्मा ॥
data.md: An enemy, strong or weak, impelled by malice, may very soon destroy the fame of a king, impede the acquisition of religious merit by him; and deprive him of even his energy. Therefore, a king, who is of a controlled mind, should never be careless when he has an enemy.

data.v: क्षयं शत्रोः संचयं पालनं चा;प्युभौ चार्थौ सहितौ धर्मकामौ । अतश्चान्यन्मतिमान्संदधीत; तस्माद्राजा बुद्धिमन्तं श्रयेत ॥
data.md: If an intelligent king desires for riches and victory, he should after knowing his expenditure, income, savings, and administration, make either peace or war. For this reason the king should seek the help of an intelligent minister.

data.v: बुद्धिर्दीप्ता बलवन्तं हिनस्ति; बलं बुद्ध्या वर्धते पाल्यमानम् । शत्रुर्बुद्ध्या सीदते वर्धमानो; बुद्धेः पश्चात्कर्म यत्तत्प्रशस्तम् ॥
data.md: even a ever Brilliant intelligence weakens powerful person; by intelligence the growing power may be protected; a growing enemy is weakened by the help of intelligence; therefore, work which is undertaken with intelligence is deserving of praise.

data.v: सर्वान्कामान्कामयानो हि धीरः; सत्त्वेनाल्पेनाप्लुते हीनदेहः । यथात्मानं प्रार्थयतेऽर्थमानैः; श्रेयःपात्रं पूरयते ह्यनल्पम् ॥
data.md: A king, who is patient and without any fault, may, if he likes, obtain the fruition of all his wishes, with the help of even a small force. That king, however, who wishes to be encircled by a number of self-seeking flatterers, can never derive the smallest benefit.

data.v: तस्माद्राजा प्रगृहीतः परेषु; मूलं लक्ष्म्याः सर्वतोऽभ्याददीत । दीर्घं कालमपि संपीड्यमानो; विद्युत्संपातमिव मानोर्जितः स्यात् ॥
data.md: For these reasons, the king, should mildly colleci wealth from his subjects. If a king continually oppresses his people, he is destroyed like a flash of lighting that shines only for a second.

data.v: विद्या तपो वा विपुलं धनं वा; सर्वमेतद्व्यवसायेन शक्यम् । ब्रह्म यत्तं निवसति देहवत्सु; तस्माद्विद्याद्व्यवसायं प्रभूतम् ॥
data.md: Learning, penances, immense wealth, indeed, everything, can be acquired by exertion. Exertion of embodied creatures is governed by intelligence. Exertion, therefore, is the greatest of all things.

data.v: यत्रासते मतिमन्तो मनस्विनः; शक्रो विष्णुर्यत्र सरस्वती च । वसन्ति भूतानि च यत्र नित्यं; तस्माद्विद्वान्नावमन्येत देहम् ॥
data.md: The human body is the habitation of many intelligent, and energetic creatures, of Shakra, of Vishnu, of Sarasvati and of other brings. A learned men, therefore, should never disregard the body.

data.v: लुब्धं हन्यात्संप्रदानेन नित्यं; लुब्धस्तृप्तिं परवित्तस्य नैति । सर्वो लुब्धः कर्मगुणोपभोगे; योऽर्थैर्हीनो धर्मकामौ जहाति ॥
data.md: A covetous man should be brought under control by continued presents. He that covetous is never satiated with taking other people's riches, Every one, however, becomes covetous of happiness. If a person, therefore, becomes destitute of wealth, he becomes shorn of virtue and pleasure.

data.v: धनं भोज्यं पुत्रदारं समृद्धिं; सर्वो लुब्धः प्रार्थयते परेषाम् । लुब्धे दोषाः संभवन्तीह सर्वे; तस्माद्राजा न प्रगृह्णीत लुब्धान् ॥
data.md: A covetous man seeks to take to himself the riches, the enjoyments, the sons and daughters, and the affluence of others. Every kind of fault is seen in covetous men. The king, therefore, should never appoint a covetous man as his minister or officer.

data.v: संदर्शने सत्पुरुषं जघन्यमपि चोदयेत् । आरम्भान्द्विषतां प्राज्ञः सर्वानर्थांस्तु सूदयेत् ॥
data.md: A king should even sent a low person to ascertain the disposition and doings of his enemies. A wise king should frustrate all the attempts and objects of his enemies.

data.v: धर्मान्वितेषु विज्ञातो मन्त्री गुप्तश्च पाण्डव । आप्तो राजन्कुलीनश्च पर्याप्तो राज्यसंग्रहे ॥
data.md: That confident and high-born king who seeks instruction from learned and pious Brahmanas and who is protected by his ministers, can keep all his tributary chiefs under proper control.

data.v: विधिप्रवृत्तान्नरदेवधर्मा;नुक्तान्समासेन निबोध बुद्ध्या । इमान्विदध्याद्व्यनुसृत्य यो वै; राजा महीं पालयितुं स शक्तः ॥
data.md: O king, I have briefly described to you of all the duties laid down in the scriptures. Attend to them, helped by your intelligence. That king, who, in obeying his protector, attends to these, succeeds in ruling the whole Earth.

data.v: अनीतिजं यद्यविधानजं सुखं; हठप्रणीतं विविधं प्रदृश्यते । न विद्यते तस्य गतिर्महीपते;र्न विद्यते राष्ट्रजमुत्तमं सुखम् ॥
data.md: That king, who neglects the happiness which policy yields and seeks for that which chance may bring, never succeeds in enjoying the happiness of sovereignty or in acquiring blissful regions hereafter.

data.v: धनैर्विशिष्टान्मतिशीलपूजिता;न्गुणोपपन्नान्युधि दृष्टविक्रमान् । गुणेषु दृष्टानचिरादिहात्मवा;न्सतोऽभिसंधाय निहन्ति शात्रवान् ॥
data.md: By properly looking to the requirements of war and peace, a careful king, succeeds in killing even such foes as are highly rich, adored for intelligence and good conduct, endued with accomplishments, brave in battle, and ready for work.

data.v: पश्येदुपायान्विविधैः क्रियापथै;र्न चानुपायेन मतिं निवेशयेत् । श्रियं विशिष्टां विपुलं यशो धनं; न दोषदर्शी पुरुषः समश्नुते ॥
data.md: The king should find out those means which are supplied by different kinds of acts and measures. He should never depend upon destiny. One who sees faults in innocent persons, never succeeds in acquiring prosperity and fame.

data.v: प्रीतिप्रवृत्तौ विनिवर्तने तथा; सुहृत्सु विज्ञाय निवृत्य चोभयोः । यदेव मित्रं गुरुभारमावहे;त्तदेव सुस्निग्धमुदाहरेद्बुधः ॥
data.md: When two friends engage in doing one and the same act, a wise man always praises him among the two who undertakes the heavier share of work.

data.v: एतान्मयोक्तांस्तव राजधर्मा;न्नृणां च गुप्तौ मतिमादधत्स्व । अवाप्स्यसे पुण्यफलं सुखेन; सर्वो हि लोकोत्तमधर्ममूलः ॥
data.md: Do you practise these duties of kings that I have described to you. Be ready to perform the duty of protecting men. You may then easily acquire the need of virtue. All the regions of happiness hereafter depend upon merit.'

data.v: अयं पितामहेनोक्तो राजधर्मः सनातनः । ईश्वरश्च महादण्डो दण्डे सर्वं प्रतिष्ठितम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O grandfather, you have now finished your discourse upon the duties of kings. From what you have said it appears that punishment occupies a high position and is the master of everything, for everything depends upon punishment.

data.v: देवतानामृषीणां च पितॄणां च महात्मनाम् । यक्षरक्षःपिशाचानां मर्त्यानां च विशेषतः ॥
सर्वेषां प्राणिनां लोके तिर्यक्ष्वपि निवासिनाम् । सर्वव्यापी महातेजा दण्डः श्रेयानिति प्रभो ॥
data.md: It seems, O powerful one, that punishment, which is highly powerful and which is present everywhere, is the foremost of all beings among either gods and Rishis and great Pitris and Yakshas and Rakshasa and Pishachas and Sadhyas, or living beings in this world. consisting of beasts and birds.

data.v: इत्येतदुक्तं भवता सर्वं दण्ड्यं चराचरम् । दृश्यते लोकमासक्तं ससुरासुरमानुषम् ॥
data.md: You have said that the entire universe, mobile and immobile, including gods, Asuras, and men, depends upon punishment.

data.v: एतदिच्छाम्यहं ज्ञातुं तत्त्वेन भरतर्षभ । को दण्डः कीदृशो दण्डः किंरूपः किंपरायणः ॥
data.md: I now wish, O foremost of Bharata's race, to know truly who punishment is. Of what kind is he? What is his form? What is his nature?

data.v: किमात्मकः कथंभूतः कतिमूर्तिः कथंप्रभुः । जागर्ति स कथं दण्डः प्रजास्ववहितात्मकः ॥
कश्च पूर्वापरमिदं जागर्ति परिपालयन् । कश्च विज्ञायते पूर्वं कोऽपरो दण्डसंज्ञितः । किंसंस्थश्च भवेद्दण्डः का चास्य गतिरिष्यते ॥
data.md: Who is he that remains perpetually awake, protecting this universe? Who is he that is known to be the greatest of all things? Who, indeed, is that high person called punishment? What is that upon which Punishment depends? And what is his movement?

data.v: शृणु कौरव्य यो दण्डो व्यवहार्यो यथा च सः । यस्मिन्हि सर्वमायत्तं स दण्ड इह केवलः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Listen, O scion of the Kurus, who is punishment and why is he also called Vyavahara. That upon whom all things depend is called punishment.

data.v: धर्मस्याख्या महाराज व्यवहार इतीष्यते । तस्य लोपः कथं न स्याल्लोकेष्ववहितात्मनः । इत्यर्थं व्यवहारस्य व्यवहारत्वमिष्यते ॥
data.md: Punishment is that by which righteousness is maintained. He is sometimes called Vyavahara. Punishment is called as such so that the righteousness of a king who is wide awake may not suffer extinction.

data.v: अपि चैतत्पुरा राजन्मनुना प्रोक्तमादितः । सुप्रणीतेन दण्डेन प्रियाप्रियसमात्मना । प्रजा रक्षति यः सम्यग्धर्म एव स केवलः ॥
data.md: It is, therefore, that the name Vyavahara is applied to it. In days of yore, Manu, O king, declared first of all this truth, viz.,-He who protects all creatures, the loved and the hated equally, by impartially holding the rod of punishment, is said to be the righteousness incarnate.

data.v: अथोक्तमेतद्वचनं प्रागेव मनुना पुरा । जन्म चोक्तं वसिष्ठेन ब्रह्मणो वचनं महत् ॥
data.md: These words, that I have said, were, o king, first uttered in days of yore by Manu. They represent the great words of Brahmana.

data.v: प्रागिदं वचनं प्रोक्तमतः प्राग्वचनं विदुः । व्यवहारस्य चाख्यानाद्व्यवहार इहोच्यते ॥
data.md: And because these words were spoken first, therefore, they are known as the first. And since Punishment which stops the misappropriation of other people's wealth, therefore, Punishment has come to be called by the name of Vyavahara.

data.v: दण्डात्त्रिवर्गः सततं सुप्रणीतात्प्रवर्तते । दैवं हि परमो दण्डो रूपतोऽग्निरिवोच्छिखः ॥
data.md: The aggregate of three objects always depends well-applied Punishment. Punishment is a great god. In form he looks like a burning fire.

data.v: नीलोत्पलदलश्यामश्चतुर्दंष्ट्रश्चतुर्भुजः । अष्टपान्नैकनयनः शङ्कुकर्णोर्ध्वरोमवान् ॥
data.md: His complexion is dark like that of the petals of the blue lotus. He has four teeth, four arms and eight legs and many eyes. His ears are pointed like arrows and his hair stands upright. on
