data.md: There was friendship between us as long as there was necessity for the same. That reason, the outcome of time, is gone. Without it, that friendship also has passed away.

data.v: त्वं हि मेऽत्यन्ततः शत्रुः सामर्थ्यान्मित्रतां गतः । तत्कृत्यमभिनिर्वृत्तं प्रकृतिः शत्रुतां गता ॥
data.md: You are by nature my enemy. From circumsiances you became my friend. That state of things has gone away. The old but natural state of enmity has returned.

data.v: सोऽहमेवं प्रणीतानि ज्ञात्वा शास्त्राणि तत्त्वतः । प्रविशेयं कथं पाशं त्वत्कृतं तद्वदस्व मे ॥
data.md: I am well-read in the dictates of policy; tell me, why shall I enter to-day, for your sake, the net that is spread for me?

data.md: Through your power I was freed from a great danger. Through my power you have। been freed from a similar danger. Each of us has served the other. There is no need for us for becoming friends again.

data.md: O amiable one, your object has been accomplished. The object I had, has also been accomplished. You do not require me except to make me your food.

data.md: I am your food. You are the eater. I am weak. You are strong. There cannot be any friendship between us when we are so unevenly placed.

data.md: O highly wise one, his escape is very difficult, who, immediately after he is freed from danger, seeks the means of his enemy's happiness.

data.v: स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु गमिष्यामि दूरादपि तवोद्विजे । नाहं त्वया समेष्यामि निर्वृतो भव लोमश ॥
data.md: If you think that I have done you a service, do me a friend's work when I may happen to move trustfully or carelessly. Even that will be gratitude in you.

data.md: If you do not seek your own interests, tell me then what is there that I can do for you. I shall certainly give you everything save my life.

data.md: For protecting one's own self one should abandon his very children, kingdom, jewels, and wealth. One should sacrifice one's all for protecting one's own self.

data.md: The weak always regard the powerful as their enemies. Their understanding, based firmly on the truths of the scriptures, is never unhinged.

data.md: If I am ordered by you, I can, with all my kinsmen and relatives, sacrifice my very life. data.md: You are highly good. I have heard all that you have said and am glad to hear you. For all that, however, I cannot trust you. It is impossible for you, by such eulogiums or by present of great wealth, to induce me to unite with you again.

data.md: I tell you, O friend, that the wise never place themselves, without sufficient reason, under the power of an enemy. Regarding this, two stories have been recited by Sage Usanasa. Listen carefully.

data.v: शत्रुसाधारणे कृत्ये कृत्वा संधिं बलीयसा । समाहितश्चरेद्युक्त्या कृतार्थश्च न विश्वसेत् ॥
data.md: Having made an agreement with a stronger one, when both are threatened by enemies, a weak person should act carefully after considerations of policy. Having gained his object, the weaker of the two parties should not again trust the stronger.

data.v: सान्त्वे प्रयुक्ते नृपते कृतवैरे न विश्वसेत् । क्षिप्रं प्रबध्यते मूढो न हि वैरं प्रशाम्यति ॥
data.md: One should never trust the soothing assurances received from an injured party. The fool that trusts such assurances is soon ruined. Enmity is not quickly cooled.

data.v: अन्योन्यं कृतवैराणां पुत्रपौत्रं निगच्छति । पुत्रपौत्रे विनष्टे तु परलोकं निगच्छति ॥
data.md: The very sons and grandsons of persons, who have injured each other, meet with destruction. For such destruction of their children, they lose the next world also.

data.md: Amongst imn who have injured one another, distrust would yield happiness. One who has betrayed confidence should never be trusted in the least.

data.md: One should not trust a person undeserving of truth, nor should one trust too much a person worthy of trust. The anger from blind confidence is such that it cuts the very roots.

data.v: माता पिता बान्धवानां वरिष्ठौ; भार्या जरा बीजमात्रं तु पुत्रः । भ्राता शत्रुः क्लिन्नपाणिर्वयस्य; आत्मा ह्येकः सुखदुःखस्य वेत्ता ॥
data.md: The parents only are the best of friends. The wife is merely a soil for sowing seeds. The son is only one's seed. The brother is an enemy. The friend or companion wants to have his palms oiled if he is to continue so. One's own self enjoys or suffers one's happiness or misery.

data.md: Real peace cannot live amongst persons who have injured one another. No such necessity exists any longer for which I livea here.

data.md: The mind of a person who has once injured another, becomes naturally filled with want of confidence, if he sees the injured person adoring him with gifts and honours. Such conduct especially when shorn by the strong, always strikes the weak with fear.

data.md: An intelligent person should leave that place where he first meets with honour in order to meet next with dishonour and injury. Despite any subsequent honour that he might get from his enemy, he should act thus.

data.v: उषितास्मि तवागारे दीर्घकालमहिंसिता । तदिदं वैरमुत्पन्नं सुखमास्स्व व्रजाम्यहम् ॥
data.md: I have lived in your house for a long time, respected all along by you. a cause of eninity, however, has at last taken place. I should, therefore, quit this place without any hesitation.

data.v: यत्कृते प्रतिकुर्याद्वै न स तत्रापराध्नुयात् । अनृणस्तेन भवति वस पूजनि मा गमः ॥
data.md: Brahmadatta said One, who does return injury for an injury, is never considered as offending. Indeed, the avenger closes his account by such behaviour. Therefore, O Pujani, continue to live here without quitting this place!

data.md: Pujani said No friendship can again be formed between a person who has injured and him who has inflicted an injury in return. The hearts cannot forget what has taken place.

data.v: कृतस्य चैव कर्तुश्च सख्यं संधीयते पुनः । वैरस्योपशमो दृष्टः पापं नोपाश्नुते पुनः ॥
data.md: It is necessary that an injurer and the avenger of the injury should be united. Mutual enmity upon such a union has been seen to cool down. Usually, no fresh injury occurs.

data.md: Enmity originating from mutual injuries can never die. The person injured should never trust his enemies, drinking-O I have been comforted with assurances of good will!-In this world, men frequently suffer destruction for (misplaced) confidence. data.md: Those, who cannot be subdued by force and Sharp weapons, can be conquered by insincere professions of love like (wild) elephants through a (tame) she-elephant.

data.v: विभिन्नकलशाकीर्णं श्वचर्माच्छादनायुतम् । वराहखरभग्नास्थिकपालघटसंकुलम् ॥
data.md: The little hamlet was filled with broken jars, and pots made of earth. Dog-skins were seen here and there. Heaps of bones and skulls, of boars and asses, lay in various places.

data.v: मृतचेलपरिस्तीर्णं निर्माल्यकृतभूषणम् । सर्पनिर्मोकमालाभिः कृतचिह्नकुटीमठम् ॥
data.md: Clothes of the dead lay here and there, and the huts were adorned with garlands of used up flowers. Many of the denizens again were dressed with sloughs cast off by snakes.

data.v: उलूकपक्षध्वजिभिर्देवतायतनैर्वृतम् । लोहघण्टापरिष्कारं श्वयूथपरिवारितम् ॥
data.md: There were temples of gods on all sides bearing emblems of owls and other birds. Resounding with the sound of iron bells, the hamlet was filled with dogs standing or lying on every side.

data.v: तत्प्रविश्य क्षुधाविष्टो गाधेः पुत्रो महानृषिः । आहारान्वेषणे युक्तः परं यत्नं समास्थितः ॥
data.md: Stricken with hunger and engaged in search after food, the great Rishi Vishvamitra entered that hamlet and tried his level best to find something to eat.

data.v: न च क्वचिदविन्दत्स भिक्षमाणोऽपि कौशिकः । मांसमन्नं मूलफलमन्यद्वा तत्र किंचन ॥
data.md: Though the son of Kushila begged again and again, yet he could not get any meat or rice or fruit or root or any other kind of food.

data.v: अहो कृच्छ्रं मया प्राप्तमिति निश्चित्य कौशिकः । पपात भूमौ दौर्बल्यात्तस्मिंश्चण्डालपक्कणे ॥
data.md: The then, exclaiming-Alas, great is my suffering!-dropped down from weakness in that hamlet of the Chandalas.

data.v: चिन्तयामास स मुनिः किं नु मे सुकृतं भवेत् । कथं वृथा न मृत्युः स्यादिति पार्थिवसत्तम ॥
data.md: The sage began to reflect, aside,-What is best for me to do now?-Indeed, O best of kings, he then thought oniy of the means by which he could avoid immediate death.

data.v: स ददर्श श्वमांसस्य कुतन्तीं विततां मुनिः । चण्डालस्य गृहे राजन्सद्यः शस्त्रहतस्य च ॥
data.md: He saw, O king, a huge piece of flesh, of a dog that had recently been killed with a weapon, spread on the floor of a Chandala's hut.

data.v: स चिन्तयामास तदा स्तेयं कार्यमितो मया । न हीदानीमुपायोऽन्यो विद्यते प्राणधारणे ॥
data.md: The sage thought and decided that he should steal that meat. And he said to himself, I have no means now of keeping up my life.

data.v: आपत्सु विहितं स्तेयं विशिष्टसमहीनतः । परं परं भवेत्पूर्वमस्तेयमिति निश्चयः ॥
data.md: Theft is sanctioned in an hour of distress for even a great man. It will not divest him of his eminence. Even a Brahmana for saving his life may do it. This is certain.

data.v: हीनादादेयमादौ स्यात्समानात्तदनन्तरम् । असंभवादाददीत विशिष्टादपि धार्मिकात् ॥
data.md: First of all one should steal from a degraded person. Failing such a person one may steal from one's equal. Failing an equal, one may steal from even a great and virtuous man.

data.v: सोऽहमन्तावसानानां हरमाणः परिग्रहात् । न स्तेयदोषं पश्यामि हरिष्याम्येतदामिषम् ॥
data.md: I shall then, at this time when my life itself is almost gone, steal this meat. I do not see sin in such theft. I shall, therefore, steal this haunch of dog's meat.

data.v: एतां बुद्धिं समास्थाय विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । तस्मिन्देशे प्रसुष्वाप पतितो यत्र भारत ॥
data.md: Having thus resolved this resolution, the great sage Vishvamitra lay down for sleep where the Chandala was.

data.v: स विगाढां निशां दृष्ट्वा सुप्ते चण्डालपक्कणे । शनैरुत्थाय भगवान्प्रविवेश कुटीमठम् ॥
data.md: Seeing sometime after that the night had advanced and that the whole Chandala hamlet were in sleep, the holy Vishvamitra, quietly rising up, entered that hut.

data.v: स सुप्त एव चण्डालः श्लेष्मापिहितलोचनः । परिभिन्नस्वरो रूक्ष उवाचाप्रियदर्शनः ॥
data.md: The Chandala who was the owner of it, with eyes covered with pleghm, was lying like one asleep. Of disagreeable look, he said these harsh words in a broken and discordant voice.

data.v: कः कुतन्तीं घट्टयति सुप्ते चण्डालपक्कणे । जागर्मि नावसुप्तोऽस्मि हतोऽसीति च दारुणः ॥
data.md: The Chandala said Who is there, busy with opening up the latch? The whole Chandala hamlet is asleep. I, however, am awake and not asleep. Whoever you are, you are about to be killed!-These were the harsh words that met the sage's ears.

data.v: विश्वामित्रोऽहमित्येव सहसा तमुवाच सः । सहसाभ्यागतभयः सोद्वेगस्तेन कर्मणा ॥
चण्डालस्तद्वचः श्रुत्वा महर्षेर्भावितात्मनः । शयनादुपसंभ्रान्त इयेषोत्पतितुं ततः ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of that great Rishi of pure soul the Chandala rose up in fear from his bed and approached the sage.

data.v: स विसृज्याश्रु नेत्राभ्यां बहुमानात्कृताञ्जलिः । उवाच कौशिकं रात्रौ ब्रह्मन्किं ते चिकीर्षितम् ॥
data.md: Clasping his hands from respect and with eyes bathed in tears, he addressed Kushika's son, saying,-What do you seek here in the night, O Brahmana?

data.v: विश्वामित्रस्तु मातङ्गमुवाच परिसान्त्वयन् । क्षुधितोऽहं गतप्राणो हरिष्यामि श्वजाघनीम् ॥
data.md: Conciliating the Chandala, Vishvamitra said, I am greatly hungry and about to die of starvation. I wise to take away that haunch of dog's meat.

data.v: अवसीदन्ति मे प्राणाः स्मृतिर्मे नश्यति क्षुधा । स्वधर्मं बुध्यमानोऽपि हरिष्यामि श्वजाघनीम् ॥
data.md: My life is on the point of departure. Hunger has sullied my Vedic learning. I am weak and have lost my senses. I have no scruple about pure and impure food. Although I know it is sinful still I wish to take away that haunch of dog's meat.

data.v: अटन्भैक्षं न विन्दामि यदा युष्माकमालये । तदा बुद्धिः कृता पापे हरिष्यामि श्वजाघनीम् ॥
data.md: After I had failed to secure any alms, having wandered from house to house in this your hamlet, I determined to perpetrate this sinful act of taking away this haunch of dog's meat.

data.v: तृषितः कलुषं पाता नास्ति ह्रीरशनार्थिनः । क्षुद्धर्मं दूषयत्यत्र हरिष्यामि श्वजाघनीम् ॥
data.md: Being hungry I have become sinful. One who seeks food has no shame. It is hunger which is actuating me to commit this sin. It is for this that I wish to take away that haunch of dog's meat.

data.v: अग्निर्मुखं पुरोधाश्च देवानां शुचिपाद्विभुः । यथा स सर्वभुग्ब्रह्मा तथा मां विद्धि धर्मतः ॥
data.md: Fire is the mouth of the gods. He is also their priest. He should, therefore, take nothing save pure and clean things. At times, however, that great god becomes a consuiner of everythings. Know that I have now become like him.

data.v: तमुवाच स चण्डालो महर्षे शृणु मे वचः । श्रुत्वा तथा समातिष्ठ यथा धर्मान्न हीयसे ॥
मृगाणामधमं श्वानं प्रवदन्ति मनीषिणः । तस्याप्यधम उद्देशः शरीरस्योरुजाघनी ॥
data.md: Hear, O regenerate Rishi, What I say to you about your duty. The wise say that a dog is impurer than a jackal. The haunch, again, of a dog is impurer then any other part of his body.

data.v: नेदं सम्यग्व्यवसितं महर्षे कर्म वैकृतम् । चण्डालस्वस्य हरणमभक्ष्यस्य विशेषतः ॥
data.md: This is not wise resolution of yours, therefore, O great Rishi, this act, this theft of what belongs to a Chandala this theft, moreover of impure food, is not right.

data.v: साध्वन्यमनुपश्य त्वमुपायं प्राणधारणे । न मांसलोभात्तपसो नाशस्ते स्यान्महामुने ॥
data.md: Blessed to you, do you look out for some other means for keeping your life. O great sage, let not your penances suffer destruction for this your strong desire for dog's meat.

data.v: जानतोऽविहितो मार्गो न कार्यो धर्मसंकरः । मा स्म धर्मं परित्याक्षीस्त्वं हि धर्मविदुत्तमः ॥
data.md: Knowing as you do the duties sanctioned in the scriptures, you should not do a act which leads to a confusion of duties. Do not renounce righteousness, for you are the foremost of all pious persons.

data.v: विश्वामित्रस्ततो राजन्नित्युक्तो भरतर्षभ । क्षुधार्तः प्रत्युवाचेदं पुनरेव महामुनिः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, O king, the great Rishi Vishvamitra, stricken with hunger, O foremost of Bharata's race, once more said,-A long time has passed away without my having taken any food, I do not see any means again for keeping up my life.

data.v: निराहारस्य सुमहान्मम कालोऽभिधावतः । न विद्यतेऽभ्युपायश्च कश्चिन्मे प्राणधारणे ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, O king, the great Rishi Vishvamitra, stricken with hunger, O foremost of Bharata's race, once more said,-A long time has passed away without my having taken any food, I do not see any means again for keeping up my life.

data.v: येन तेन विशेषेण कर्मणा येन केनचित् । अभ्युज्जीवेत्सीदमानः समर्थो धर्ममाचरेत् ॥
data.md: One should, when he is about to die, keep up his life by any means in his power without judging of their charter. Afterwards, when able, he should seek the acquisition of merit.

data.v: ऐन्द्रो धर्मः क्षत्रियाणां ब्राह्मणानामथाग्निकः । ब्रह्मवह्निर्मम बलं भक्ष्यामि समयं क्षुधा ॥
data.md: The Kshatriyas should follow the conduct of Indra. It is the duty of the Brahmanas to behave like Agni. The Vedas are fire. They form my strength. I shall, therefore, eat even this impure food for satisfying my appetite.

data.v: यथा यथा वै जीवेद्धि तत्कर्तव्यमपीडया । जीवितं मरणाच्छ्रेयो जीवन्धर्ममवाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: That by which life may be preserved should, forsooth, be done unhesitatingly. Life is better than death. By living, one may acquire virtue.

data.v: सोऽहं जीवितमाकाङ्क्षन्नभक्षस्यापि भक्षणम् । व्यवस्ये बुद्धिपूर्वं वै तद्भवाननुमन्यताम् ॥
data.md: Seeking to preserve my life, I wish, with my perfect sense, to eat this impure food. You just order me.

data.v: जीवन्धर्मं चरिष्यामि प्रणोत्स्याम्यशुभानि च । तपोभिर्विद्यया चैव ज्योतींषीव महत्तमः ॥
data.md: Continuing to live I shall try to acquire virtue and shall dissipate by penances and by knowledge the calamities which have befallen me, like the luminaries of the sky destroying even the thickest darkness.

data.v: नैतत्खादन्प्राप्स्यसे प्राणमन्यं; नायुर्दीर्घं नामृतस्येव तृप्तिम् । भिक्षामन्यां भिक्ष मा ते मनोऽस्तु; श्वभक्षणे श्वा ह्यभक्षो द्विजानाम् ॥
data.md: The Chandala said By eating this food one like yourself cannot live long. Nor can one (like you) get strength (from such food), nor that gratification which ambrosia yields. Do you beg for some other kind of alms. Be not bent upon eating dog's imeat. The meat of dog is, forsooth, an impure food for the twice-born ones.

data.v: न दुर्भिक्षे सुलभं मांसमन्य;च्छ्वपाक नान्नं न च मेऽस्ति वित्तम् । क्षुधार्तश्चाहमगतिर्निराशः; श्वमांसे चास्मिन्षड्रसान्साधु मन्ये ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said Any other sort of meat cannot be easily had during a famine like this.Besides, OChandala, I have no money. I am very much hungry. I cannot move any longer. I am utterly hopeless. I think that all the six sorts of taste exist in that piece of dog's meat.

data.v: पञ्च पञ्चनखा भक्ष्या ब्रह्मक्षत्रस्य वै द्विज । यदि शास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते माभक्ष्ये मानसं कृथाः ॥
data.md: The Chandala said Only five sorts of meat are clean food for Brahmanas and Kshatriyas and Vaishyas, as sanctioned in the scriptures. Do not wish to have forbidden food.

data.v: अगस्त्येनासुरो जग्धो वातापिः क्षुधितेन वै । अहमापद्गतः क्षुब्धो भक्षयिष्ये श्वजाघनीम् ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said While hungry, the great Rishi Agastya ate up the Asura named Vatapi. I am in distress. I am hungry. I shall, therefore, eat that haunch of dog's meat.

data.v: भिक्षामन्यामाहरेति न चैतत्कर्तुमर्हसि । न नूनं कार्यमेतद्वै हर कामं श्वजाघनीम् ॥
data.md: The Chandala said Do you beg for something else. You should not do such a thing. Verily you should not do such an act. If, however, you like, you may take away this piece of dog's meat.

data.v: शिष्टा वै कारणं धर्मे तद्वृत्तमनुवर्तये । परां मेध्याशनादेतां भक्ष्यां मन्ये श्वजाघनीम् ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said The good are the authorities in matters of duty. I am following their example. I now consider this dog's haunch to be better food than any other pure food.

data.v: असता यत्समाचीर्णं न स धर्मः सनातनः । नावृत्तमनुकार्यं वै मा छलेनानृतं कृथाः ॥
data.md: The act of an impious man can never be regarded as an eternal practice. An improper act can never be a proper one. Do not commit a sin by deception.

data.v: न पातकं नावमतमृषिः सन्कर्तुमर्हसि । समौ च श्वमृगौ मन्ये तस्माद्भक्ष्या श्वजाघनी ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said A man who is a Rishi cannot commit a sin. In the present case, deer and dog, I think, are the same. I shall, therefore, eat this dog's haunch.

data.v: यद्ब्राह्मणार्थे कृतमर्थितेन; तेनर्षिणा तच्च भक्ष्याधिकारम् । स वै धर्मो यत्र न पापमस्ति; सर्वैरुपायैर्हि स रक्षितव्यः ॥
data.md: The Chandala said Begged by the Brahmans, the Rishi (Agastya) did that act. Under the circumstances it could not be a sin. Righteousness is that in which there is no sin. Besides, the Brahmanas, who are the preceptors of the three other orders, should be protected and maintained by all means.

data.v: मित्रं च मे ब्राह्मणश्चायमात्मा; प्रियश्च मे पूज्यतमश्च लोके । तं भर्तुकामोऽहमिमां हरिष्ये; नृशंसानामीदृशानां न बिभ्ये ॥
data.md: I am a Brahman. This my body is my friend. It is very dear to me and deserves the highest respect from me. In order to keep up the body I wish to take away that dog's haunch. I have become so eager that I do not fear you and your dreadful brother any longer.

data.v: कामं नरा जीवितं संत्यजन्ति; न चाभक्ष्यैः प्रतिकुर्वन्ति तत्र । सर्वान्कामान्प्राप्नुवन्तीह विद्व;न्प्रियस्व कामं सहितः क्षुधा वै ॥
data.md: Men give up their lives but still they do not seek impure food. All their wishes are fulfilled who can conquer appetite in this world. Do you also conquer your hunger and obtain those rewards.

data.v: स्थाने तावत्संशयः प्रेत्यभावे; निःसंशयं कर्मणां वा विनाशः । अहं पुनर्वर्त इत्याशयात्मा; मूलं रक्षन्भक्षयिष्याम्यभक्ष्यम् ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said About myself, I always observe rigid vows and my heart is set on peace. For preserving the root of all religious merit, I shall eat impure food.

data.v: बुद्ध्यात्मके व्यस्तमस्तीति तुष्टो; मोहादेकत्वं यथा चर्म चक्षुः । यद्यप्येनः संशयादाचरामि; नाहं भविष्यामि यथा त्वमेव ॥
data.md: It is clear that such an act would be considered moral for a person of pure soul. To a person, however, of impure soul the eating of dog's flesh would appear sinful. Even if my conclusion be wrong (and if I eat this dog's ineat) I shall not, for that act, become one like you.

data.v: पतनीयमिदं दुःखमिति मे वर्तते मतिः । दुष्कृती ब्राह्मणं सन्तं यस्त्वामहमुपालभे ॥
data.md: The Chandala said It is my settled conclusion that I should try my best to prevent you from this sin. By doing a wicked act a Brahmana goes down from his elevated station. It is for this that I am remonstrating with you.

data.v: पिबन्त्येवोदकं गावो मण्डूकेषु रुवत्स्वपि । न तेऽधिकारो धर्मेऽस्ति मा भूरात्मप्रशंसकः ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said Kine go on drinking without caring for the croaking of the frogs. You have no right to decide what is right (and what, not). Do not speak highly of yourself.

data.v: सुहृद्भूत्वानुशास्मि त्वा कृपा हि त्वयि मे द्विज । तदेवं श्रेय आधत्स्व मा लोभाच्छ्वानमादिथाः ॥
data.md: The Chandala said I have become your friend, therefore, I am speaking thus to you. Do what is good. Do not, from temptation, do what is sinful.

data.v: सुहृन्मे त्वं सुखेप्सुश्चेदापदो मां समुद्धर । जानेऽहं धर्मतोऽऽत्मानं श्वानीमुत्सृज जाघनीम् ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said If you be a friend who wishes me happiness, do you then extricate me from this distress. In that case, casting off this dog's haunch, I may think myself saved by the help of righteousness (and not by that of sinfulness).

data.v: नैवोत्सहे भवते दातुमेतां; नोपेक्षितुं ह्रियमाणं स्वमन्नम् । उभौ स्यावः स्वमलेनावलिप्तौ; दाताहं च त्वं च विप्र प्रतीच्छन् ॥
data.md: The Chandala said I dare not present this piece of meat to you, nor can I quietly allow you to rob me of my own food. If I give you this meat and if you take it, yourself being a Brahmana, both of us will go down to regions of misery in the next world.

data.v: अद्याहमेतद्वृजिनं कर्म कृत्वा; जीवंश्चरिष्यामि महापवित्रम् । प्रपूतात्मा धर्ममेवाभिपत्स्ये; यदेतयोर्गुरु तद्वै ब्रवीहि ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said By committing this sin to-day I shall certainly save my life which is very sacred. Having saved my life I shall afterwards practice virtue and purify my soul. Tell me which of these two is preferable.

data.v: आत्मैव साक्षी किल लोककृत्ये; त्वमेव जानासि यदत्र दुष्टम् । यो ह्याद्रियेद्भक्ष्यमिति श्वमांसं; मन्ये न तस्यास्ति विवर्जनीयम् ॥
data.md: The Chandala said One's own self is the best judge, while discharging the duties of his own caste or family. You yourself know which of those two acts is sinful. He who would consider dog's meat as pure food, I think, would not shrink from taking anything and everything.

data.v: उपादाने खादने वास्य दोषः; कार्यो न्यायैर्नित्यमत्रापवादः । यस्मिन्न हिंसा नानृते वाक्यलेशो; भक्ष्यक्रिया तत्र न तद्गरीयः ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said There is sin in accepting (an unclean present) or in eating (unclean food). When one's life is in peril, there is no sin in accepting such a present or eating such food. Besides, the eating of unclean food, when it does not involve destruction and deception and when the act will excite only mild rebuke, is not a very important matter.

data.v: यद्येष हेतुस्तव खादनस्य; न ते वेदः कारणं नान्यधर्मः । तस्मादभक्ष्ये भक्षणाद्वा द्विजेन्द्र; दोषं न पश्यामि यथेदमात्थ ॥
data.md: The Chandala said If this be your argument for taking impure food, it is then evident you do not respect the Veda and Aryan morality. Taught by what you are about to do, I see, O foremost of Brahmanas, there is no sin in neglecting the difference between pure and impure food.

data.v: न पातकं भक्षणमस्य दृष्टं; सुरां पीत्वा पततीतीह शब्दः । अन्योन्यकर्माणि तथा तथैव; न लेशमात्रेण कृत्यं हिनस्ति ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said It is not seen that a person commits a grave sin by taking interdicted food. It is only an oral precept which says that one becomes fallen by drinking wine. The other forbidden acts,-in fact, every sin,-cannot destroy one's merit.

data.v: अस्थानतो हीनतः कुत्सिताद्वा; तं विद्वांसं बाधते साधुवृत्तम् । स्थानं पुनर्यो लभते निषङ्गा;त्तेनापि दण्डः सहितव्य एव ॥
data.md: The Chandala Said That learned man who takes away dog's meat from an unworthy place like this), from an impure wretch (like me), from a wicked man (like me), commits an act which is never done by the good. On the other hand, for his connection with such act, he is sure to undergo the pangs of repentance.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा निववृते मातङ्गः कौशिकं तदा । विश्वामित्रो जहारैव कृतबुद्धिः श्वजाघनीम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Having said these words to Kushika's son, the Chandala became silent, Vishvamitra then, of refined understanding, took away that haunch of dog's meat.

data.v: ततो जग्राह पञ्चाङ्गीं जीवितार्थी महामुनिः । सदारस्तामुपाकृत्य वने यातो महामुनिः ॥
data.md: Having secured the piece of dog's meat for saving his life, the great ascetic took it away into the forest and wished with his wife to eat it.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु प्रववर्षाथ वासवः । संजीवयन्प्रजाः सर्वा जनयामास चौषधीः ॥
data.md: Meanwhile, the king of the gods began to pour profusely. Reviving all creatures by those showers, he made plants and herbs grow once more.

data.v: विश्वामित्रोऽपि भगवांस्तपसा दग्धकिल्बिषः । कालेन महता सिद्धिमवाप परमाद्भुताम् ॥
data.md: However, having completed the rites in honour of the gods and the Pitris and having pleased them duly, Vishvamitra, himself took that meat.

data.v: एवं विद्वानदीनात्मा व्यसनस्थो जिजीविषुः । सर्वोपायैरुपायज्ञो दीनमात्मानमुद्धरेत् ॥
data.md: Thus, having the preservation of life itself in view, a high-souled person, endued with learning and acquainted with means, should rescue his own cheerless self when fallen into distress, by all means in his power.

data.v: एतां बुद्धिं समास्थाय जीवितव्यं सदा भवेत् । जीवन्पुण्यमवाप्नोति नरो भद्राणि पश्यति ॥
data.md: With such a view one should always preserve his life. person, if alive, can acquire religious merit and enjoy happiness and prosperity.

data.v: तस्मात्कौन्तेय विदुषा धर्माधर्मविनिश्चये । बुद्धिमास्थाय लोकेऽस्मिन्वर्तितव्यं यतात्मना ॥
data.md: Therefore, O son of Kunti, a person of purified soul and endued with learning should live and act in this world, depending upon his own intelligence in ascertaining virtue and vice.

data.v: यदिदं घोरमुद्दिष्टमश्रद्धेयमिवानृतम् । अस्ति स्विद्दस्युमर्यादा यामहं परिवर्जये ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said If such a terrible act which should always be discarded like falsehood, be pointed (as duty), then what act is there from which I should forbear? Why also should not robbers then be honoured?

data.v: संमुह्यामि विषीदामि धर्मो मे शिथिलीकृतः । उद्यमं नाधिगच्छामि कुतश्चित्परिचिन्तयन् ॥
data.md: I am stupefied! My heart is pained. All the bonds that tie me to morality are loosened. I cannot compose my mind and dare act in the way pointed out by you.

data.v: नैतच्छुद्धागमादेव तव धर्मानुशासनम् । प्रज्ञासमवतारोऽयं कविभिः संभृतं मधु ॥
data.md: Bhishma said I do not instruct you regarding duty, taught by what I have heard from the Vedas alone. What I have told you is the result of wisdom and experience. This is the honey that the learned have gleaned.

data.v: बह्व्यः प्रतिविधातव्याः प्रज्ञा राज्ञा ततस्ततः । नैकशाखेन धर्मेण यात्रैषा संप्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: Kings should collect wisdom from various sources. One cannot go successfully through the worldly course with the help of a one-sided morality.

data.v: बुद्धिसंजननं राज्ञां धर्ममाचरतां सदा । जयो भवति कौरव्य तदा तद्विद्धि मे वचः ॥
data.md: Duty must originate from the understanding and the practices of the good should always be determined, O son of Kuru. Obey these words of mine.

data.v: बुद्धिश्रेष्ठा हि राजानो जयन्ति विजयैषिणः । धर्मः प्रतिविधातव्यो बुद्ध्या राज्ञा ततस्ततः ॥
data.md: Only kings of superior intelligence can rule, cxpccting victory. A king by the help of his understanding and guided by knowledge gathered from various sources, should so arrange that inoral laws may be observed.

data.v: नैकशाखेन धर्मेण राज्ञां धर्मो विधीयते । दुर्बलस्य कुतः प्रज्ञा पुरस्तादनुदाहृता ॥
data.md: The duties of a king can never be satisfied by rules drawn from a one-sided morality. A weak king can never show wisdom for his not having drawn it from the examples before him.

data.v: अद्वैधज्ञः पथि द्वैधे संशयं प्राप्तुमर्हति । बुद्धिद्वैधं वेदितव्यं पुरस्तादेव भारत ॥
data.md: Righteousness sometimes appears like unrighteousness. The latter also some-times appears like the former. He who does not know this, becomes confused when an actual instance presents itself before him. Before the time comes, one should, O Bharata, understand the circumstances, under which righteousness and its opposite become confused.

data.v: पार्श्वतःकरणं प्रज्ञा विषूची त्वापगा इव । जनस्तूच्चारितं धर्मं विजानात्यन्यथान्यथा ॥
data.md: Having gained this knowledge, a wise king should, when the time comes, act accordingly, helped by his judgement. His acts at such a time are misunderstood by ordinary people.

data.v: सम्यग्विज्ञानिनः केचिन्मिथ्याविज्ञानिनोऽपरे । तद्वै यथातथं बुद्ध्वा ज्ञानमाददते सताम् ॥
data.md: Some persons are endued with true knowledge. Some persons have false knowledge. Truly determining the nature of each kind of knowledge, a wise king derives knowledge from the good.

data.v: परिमुष्णन्ति शास्त्राणि धर्मस्य परिपन्थिनः । वैषम्यमर्थविद्यानां नैरर्थ्यात्ख्यापयन्ति ते ॥
data.md: The violators of moral laws find fault with the scriptures. They who have themselves no money, point out the inconsistencies of the works on the laws of wealth.

data.v: आजिजीविषवो विद्यां यशस्कामाः समन्ततः । ते सर्वे नरपापिष्ठा धर्मस्य परिपन्थिनः ॥
data.md: Those who wish to gain knowledge merely for carrying their sustenance, are, o king, sinful, besides being enemies of morality.

data.v: अपक्वमतयो मन्दा न जानन्ति यथातथम् । सदा ह्यशास्त्रकुशलाः सर्वत्रापरिनिष्ठिताः ॥
data.md: Wicked men of unripe understandings, can never know things truly, as persons ignorant of scriptures are unable in all their acts to be guided by reason.

data.v: परिमुष्णन्ति शास्त्राणि शास्त्रदोषानुदर्शिनः । विज्ञानमथ विद्यानां न सम्यगिति वर्तते ॥
data.md: The violators of moral laws find fault with the scriptures. They who have themselves no money, point out the inconsistencies of the works on the laws of wealth.

data.v: निन्दया परविद्यानां स्वां विद्यां ख्यापयन्ति ये । वागस्त्रा वाक्छुरीमत्त्वा दुग्धविद्याफला इव । तान्विद्यावणिजो विद्धि राक्षसानिव भारत ॥
data.md: By decrying the knowledge of others, such men announce the superiority of their own knowledge. They have words for their weapons and arrows and speak, as if they are well grounded in those sciences.

data.v: व्याजेन कृत्स्नो विदितो धर्मस्ते परिहास्यते । न धर्मवचनं वाचा न बुद्ध्या चेति नः श्रुतम् ॥
इति बार्हस्पतं ज्ञानं प्रोवाच मघवा स्वयम् । न त्वेव वचनं किंचिदनिमित्तादिहोच्यते ॥
स्वविनीतेन शास्त्रेण व्यवस्यन्ति तथापरे । लोकयात्रामिहैके तु धर्ममाहुर्मनीषिणः ॥
समुद्दिष्टं सतां धर्मं स्वयमूहेन्न पण्डितः । अमर्षाच्छास्त्रसंमोहादविज्ञानाच्च भारत ॥
शास्त्रं प्राज्ञस्य वदतः समूहे यात्यदर्शनम् । आगतागमया बुद्ध्या वचनेन प्रशस्यते ॥
अज्ञानाज्ज्ञानहेतुत्वाद्वचनं साधु मन्यते । अनपाहतमेवेदं नेदं शास्त्रमपार्थकम् ॥
दैतेयानुशनाः प्राह संशयच्छेदने पुरा । ज्ञानमव्यपदेश्यं हि यथा नास्ति तथैव तत् ॥
तेन त्वं छिन्नमूलेन कं तोषयितुमर्हसि । अतथ्यविहितं यो वा नेदं वाक्यमुपाश्नुयात् ॥
उग्रायैव हि सृष्टोऽसि कर्मणे न त्ववेक्षसे । अङ्गेमामन्ववेक्षस्व राजनीतिं बुभूषितुम् । यया प्रमुच्यते त्वन्यो यदर्थं च प्रमोदते ॥
data.md: See me, O dear child, how, by following the duties of my own order, I have sent innumerable Kshatriyas to heaven! There are some who are not pleased with me for this.

data.v: अजोऽश्वः क्षत्रमित्येतत्सदृशं ब्रह्मणा कृतम् । तस्मान्नतीक्ष्णभूतानां यात्रा काचित्प्रसिध्यति ॥
data.md: Goat, horse, and Kshatriya, were created by Brahman for the same purpose (of being useful to everybody). A Kshatriya, therefore, should always seek the happiness of all creatures.

data.v: यस्त्ववध्यवधे दोषः स वध्यस्यावधे स्मृतः । एषैव खलु मर्यादा यामयं परिवर्जयेत् ॥
data.md: The sin of killing a person unworthy of being killed is tantamount to that which is incurred by not killing one who deserves to be killed. Such is the established order of things which a weak-minded king never thinks of attending to.

data.v: तस्मात्तीक्ष्णः प्रजा राजा स्वधर्मे स्थापयेदुत । अन्योन्यं भक्षयन्तो हि प्रचरेयुर्वृका इव ॥
data.md: Therefore, a king should force all his subjects to observe their respective duties. If this is not done, they will prowl like wolves, devouring one another,

data.v: यस्य दस्युगणा राष्ट्रे ध्वाङ्क्षा मत्स्याञ्जलादिव । विहरन्ति परस्वानि स वै क्षत्रियपांसनः ॥
data.md: He is a wretch among Kshatriyas in whose kingdom robbers go about pillaging the property of other people like crows taking little fishes from water.

data.v: कुलीनान्सचिवान्कृत्वा वेदविद्यासमन्वितान् । प्रशाधि पृथिवीं राजन्प्रजा धर्मेण पालयन् ॥
data.md: Appointing high-born men with Vedic knowledge as your ministers, do you govern the Earth, protecting your subjects piously.

data.v: विहीनजमकर्माणं यः प्रगृह्णाति भूमिपः । उभयस्याविशेषज्ञस्तद्वै क्षत्रं नपुंसकम् ॥
data.md: That Kshatriya who, innocent of the established customs and contrivances, improperly taxes his people, is considered as a eunuch of his order.

data.v: नैवोग्रं नैव चानुग्रं धर्मेणेह प्रशस्यते । उभयं न व्यतिक्रामेदुग्रो भूत्वा मृदुर्भव ॥
data.md: A king should neither be severe nor mild. If he rules fairly he deserves praise. A king should not renounce both that qualities; on the other hand, becoming severe when (it is necessary), he should be mild when it is necessary to be so.

data.v: कष्टः क्षत्रियधर्मोऽयं सौहृदं त्वयि यत्स्थितम् । उग्रे कर्मणि सृष्टोऽसि तस्माद्राज्यं प्रशाधि वै ॥
data.md: The observance of Kshatriya duties is highly difficult. I love you greatly. You are created for the performance of severe acts. Therefore, do you rule kingdom.

data.v: अशिष्टनिग्रहो नित्यं शिष्टस्य परिपालनम् । इति शक्रोऽब्रवीद्धीमानापत्सु भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: The highly intelligent Shakra has said that in times of distress the great duty of a king is to punish the wicked and protect the good.

data.v: अस्ति स्विद्दस्युमर्यादा यामन्यो नातिलङ्घयेत् । पृच्छामि त्वां सतां श्रेष्ठ तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Is there any such rule (regarding royal duties) which should, under no circumstances) be violated? I ask you this, O foremost of virtuous persons! Tell me, O grandfather.

data.v: ब्राह्मणानेव सेवेत विद्यावृद्धांस्तपस्विनः । श्रुतचारित्रवृत्ताढ्यान्पवित्रं ह्येतदुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said One should always adore Brahmanas respected for learning, devoted to penances, and observant of Vedic injunctions. This, indeed, is a high and sacred duty.

data.v: या देवतासु वृत्तिस्ते सास्तु विप्रेषु सर्वदा । क्रुद्धैर्हि विप्रैः कर्माणि कृतानि बहुधा नृप ॥
data.md: You should always treat the Brahmanas like the gods. The Brahmanas, if enraged, can inflict pains in a variety of ways, O King.

data.v: तेषां प्रीत्या यशो मुख्यमप्रीत्या तु विपर्ययः । प्रीत्या ह्यमृतवद्विप्राः क्रुद्धाश्चैव यथा विषम् ॥
data.md: If they be pleased, you will win high fame. If otherwise, great will be your fear. If pleased, the Brahmanas become like ambrosia. If enraged, they become like poison.

data.v: पितामह महाप्राज्ञ सर्वशास्त्रविशारद । शरणं पालयानस्य यो धर्मस्तं वदस्व मे ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O grandfather, O you of great wisdom, O you who are a master of scriptures, tell me what the merit is of one who supports a person seeking his protection.

data.v: महान्धर्मो महाराज शरणागतपालने । अर्हः प्रष्टुं भवांश्चैव प्रश्नं भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Great is the merit, O king, in supporting a suppliant. It is worthy of you, O best of the Bharatas, to ask such a question.

data.v: नृगप्रभृतयो राजन्राजानः शरणागतान् । परिपाल्य महाराज संसिद्धिं परमां गताः ॥
data.md: Those great kings of yore, viz., Shivi and others, o king, acquired supreme heavenly bliss by having supported suppliants.

data.v: श्रूयते हि कपोतेन शत्रुः शरणमागतः । पूजितश्च यथान्यायं स्वैश्च मांसैर्निमन्त्रितः ॥

कुरुष्वानुग्रहं मेऽद्य सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ते । निश्चिता खलु मे बुद्धिरतिथिप्रतिपूजने ॥
data.md: O amiable one, be kind to me. To tell you the truth my heart is bent upon honouring you my guest.

data.v: ततः सत्यप्रतिज्ञो वै स पक्षी प्रहसन्निव । तमग्निं त्रिः परिक्रम्य प्रविवेश महीपते ॥
data.md: Having thus made up his mind, the great bird, with a smiling face, thrice went round that fire and then entered its flames.

data.v: अग्निमध्यं प्रविष्टं तं लुब्धो दृष्ट्वाथ पक्षिणम् । चिन्तयामास मनसा किमिदं नु कृतं मया ॥
data.md: Seeing the bird enter that fire, the fowler began to think! and asked himself,-What have I done.

data.v: अहो मम नृशंसस्य गर्हितस्य स्वकर्मणा । अधर्मः सुमहान्घोरो भविष्यति न संशयः ॥
data.md: Alas, dreadful will be the sin, the outcome of my own acts. I am highly ruthless and blameable.

data.v: एवं बहुविधं भूरि विललाप स लुब्धकः । गर्हयन्स्वानि कर्माणि द्विजं दृष्ट्वा तथागतम् ॥
data.md: Indeed, seeing the bird lay down his life, the fowler, considering his own acts, began to bewail thus piteously.

data.v: ततस्तं लुब्धकः पश्यन्कृपयाभिपरिप्लुतः । कपोतमग्नौ पतितं वाक्यं पुनरुवाच ह ॥
किमीदृशं नृशंसेन मया कृतमबुद्धिना । भविष्यति हि मे नित्यं पातकं हृदि जीवतः ॥
स विनिन्दन्नथात्मानं पुनः पुनरुवाच ह । धिङ्मामस्तु सुदुर्बुद्धिं सदा निकृतिनिश्चयम् । शुभं कर्म परित्यज्य योऽहं शकुनिलुब्धकः ॥
data.md: Thus censuring himself he began to say again and again,-I do not deserve any credit! My understanding is wicked! I am ever sinful!

data.v: नृशंसस्य ममाद्यायं प्रत्यादेशो न संशयः । दत्तः स्वमांसं ददता कपोतेन महात्मना ॥
data.md: Alas, renouncing all sorts of honourable occupation, I have become a fowler! A cruel wretch that I am, forsooth, this noble pigeon, by sacrificing his own life, has taught me a great lesson.

data.v: सोऽहं त्यक्ष्ये प्रियान्प्राणान्पुत्रदारं विसृज्य च । उपदिष्टो हि मे धर्मः कपोतेनातिधर्मिणा ॥
data.md: Renouncing wives and sons, I shall certainly cast off my very life which is so dear! The great pigeon has taught me that duty.

data.v: अद्य प्रभृति देहं स्वं सर्वभोगैर्विवर्जितम् । यथा स्वल्पं जलं ग्रीष्मे शोषयिष्याम्यहं तथा ॥
data.md: From this day, denying every comfort to my body, I shall exhaust it like a shallow tank in summer.

data.v: क्षुत्पिपासातपसहः कृशो धमनिसंततः । उपवासैर्बहुविधैश्चरिष्ये पारलौकिकम् ॥
data.md: Capable of bearing hunger, thirst, and penances, and being emaciated with veins visible all over, I shall by various sorts of fasts, practise such vows as will take me to the other world.

data.v: अहो देहप्रदानेन दर्शितातिथिपूजना । तस्माद्धर्मं चरिष्यामि धर्मो हि परमा गतिः । दृष्टो हि धर्मो धर्मिष्ठैर्यादृशो विहगोत्तमे ॥
data.md: Alas, by giving up his body the pigeon has shown how a guest should be adored! Taught by his example, I shall hereafter practise righteousness. Righteousness is the greatest refuge! Indeed, I shall practise the righteousness shown by the virtuous pigeon, that foremost of all winged creatures.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा विनिश्चित्य रौद्रकर्मा स लुब्धकः । महाप्रस्थानमाश्रित्य प्रययौ संशितव्रतः ॥
data.md: Having thus made up his mind and said these words, that fowler, once of dreadful deeds, started on a journey never to end, observing all the while the most rigid vows.

data.v: ततो यष्टिं शलाकाश्च क्षारकं पञ्जरं तथा । तांश्च बद्धा कपोतान्स संप्रमुच्योत्ससर्ज ह ॥
data.md: He threw away his strong staff, his sharp iron-stick, his nets and springes, and his iron cage, and liberated the she-pigeon that he had caught and imprisoned.'

data.v: ततो गते शाकुनिके कपोती प्राह दुःखिता । संस्मृत्य भर्तारमथो रुदती शोकमूर्छिता ॥
data.md: Bhishma said After the fowler had left there, the shepigeon, remembering her husband and stricken with grief for him, wept profusely and bewailed thus:नाहं ते विप्रियं कान्त कदाचिदपि संस्मरे।

data.v: नाहं ते विप्रियं कान्त कदाचिदपि संस्मरे । सर्वा वै विधवा नारी बहुपुत्रापि खेचर । शोच्या भवति बन्धूनां पतिहीना मनस्विनी ॥
data.md: I cannot, O dear husband, remember a single instance of your having done me an injury! Widows, even when they are mothers of many children, are still miserable! Bereft of husband, a woman becomes helpless and an object of pity to her friends.

data.v: लालिताहं त्वया नित्यं बहुमानाच्च सान्त्विता । वचनैर्मधुरैः स्निग्धैरसकृत्सुमनोहरैः ॥
data.md: I was always supported by you and for the great respect you had for me I was always honoured by you with sweet, agreeable, charming, and delightful words.

data.v: कन्दरेषु च शैलानां नदीनां निर्झरेषु च । द्रुमाग्रेषु च रम्येषु रमिताहं त्वया प्रिय ॥
data.md: I have sported with you in valleys of mountans, in springs of rivers and on charming trees.

data.v: आकाशगमने चैव सुखिताहं त्वया सुखम् । विहृतास्मि त्वया कान्त तन्मे नाद्यास्ति किंचन ॥
मितं ददाति हि पिता मितं माता मितं सुतः । अमितस्य तु दातारं भर्तारं का न पूजयेत् ॥
data.md: The gifts of the father, of the brother, and of the son to a woman are but limited. But unlimited are the gifts that her husband alone makes to her! What woman is there that would not, therefore, worship her husband.

data.v: नास्ति भर्तृसमो नाथो न च भर्तृसमं सुखम् । विसृज्य धनसर्वस्वं भर्ता वै शरणं स्त्रियाः ॥
data.md: A word has no protector like her husband, and no happiness like her husband. Casting off all her riches and possessions, a woman should follow her husband as her only refuge.

data.v: न कार्यमिह मे नाथ जीवितेन त्वया विना । पतिहीनापि का नारी सती जीवितुमुत्सहेत् ॥
data.md: Useless is life to me, O lord, now that I am separated from you! What chaste woman is there who would, when bereft of her husband, venture to bear the burden of life.

data.v: एवं विलप्य बहुधा करुणं सा सुदुःखिता । पतिव्रता संप्रदीप्तं प्रविवेश हुताशनम् ॥
data.md: Filled with sorrow and bewailing thus, the she-pigeon, devoted to her husband cast herself on the burning fire.

data.v: ततश्चित्राम्बरधरं भर्तारं सान्वपश्यत । विमानस्थं सुकृतिभिः पूज्यमानं महात्मभिः ॥
data.md: She then saw her husband bedecked with bracelets, seated on a (celestial) car, and worshipped of many great and meritorious beings standing around him.

data.v: चित्रमाल्याम्बरधरं सर्वाभरणभूषितम् । विमानशतकोटीभिरावृतं पुण्यकीर्तिभिः ॥
data.md: Indeed, there he was in the sky, decked with excellent garlands and clad in excellent robes, and adorned with every ornament. There were numberless celestial cars around him ridden by beings who had acted meritoriously while in this world.

data.v: ततः स्वर्गगतः पक्षी भार्यया सह संगतः । कर्मणा पूजितस्तेन रेमे तत्र स भार्यया ॥
data.md: Seated on his own celestial car, the bird went to heaven, and getting proper honours for his deeds in this world, continued to sport in joy, accompanied by his spouse. Seated on his own celestial car, the bird went to heaven, and getting proper honours for his deeds in this world, continued to sport in joy, accompanied by his spouse.

data.v: विमानस्थौ तु तौ राजँल्लुब्धको वै ददर्श ह । दृष्ट्वा तौ दंपती दुःखादचिन्तयत सद्गतिम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said lt so chanced that the fowler, O king, saw that pair while seated on their celestial car. Seeing the couple he became filled with sorrow and began to think of the means of acquiring the same end.

data.v: कीदृशेनेह तपसा गच्छेयं परमां गतिम् । इति बुद्ध्या विनिश्चित्य गमनायोपचक्रमे ॥
data.md: And he said to himself,-I must, by austerities like those of the pigeon, acquire such a high end!—Having made this resolution, the fowler, who had lived by the destruction of birds, started on an unreturning journey.

data.v: महाप्रस्थानमाश्रित्य लुब्धकः पक्षिजीवनः । निश्चेष्टो मारुताहारो निर्ममः स्वर्गकाङ्क्षया ॥
data.md: Without any attempt (for getting food) and living upon air alone, he renounced all other desires for acquiring heaven.

data.v: ततोऽपश्यत्सुविस्तीर्णं हृद्यं पद्मविभूषितम् । नानाद्विजगणाकीर्णं सरः शीतजलं शुभम् । पिपासार्तोऽपि तद्दृष्ट्वा तृप्तः स्यान्नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: After he had gone for some distance, he saw an extensive and charming lake full of cool and pure water, adorned with lotuses and abounding with various sorts of water-fowi.

data.v: उपवासकृशोऽत्यर्थं स तु पार्थिव लुब्धकः । उपसर्पत संहृष्टः श्वापदाध्युषितं वनम् ॥
महान्तं निश्चयं कृत्वा लुब्धकः प्रविवेश ह । प्रविशन्नेव च वनं निगृहीतः स कण्टकैः ॥
स कण्टकविभुग्नाङ्गो लोहितार्द्रीकृतच्छविः । बभ्राम तस्मिन्विजने नानामृगसमाकुले ॥
data.md: Cut and torn by prickles, and bathed in blood, he began to wander in that forest, shorn of men but abounding with animals of various species.

data.v: ततो द्रुमाणां महतां पवनेन वने तदा । उदतिष्ठत संघर्षात्सुमहान्हव्यवाहनः ॥
data.md: Sometime after, on account of the friction of some huge trees caused by a strong wind, a wide spread forest-fire arose.

data.v: तद्वनं वृक्षसंकीर्णं लताविटपसंकुलम् । ददाह पावकः क्रुद्धो युगान्ताग्निसमप्रभः ॥
data.md: The raging element, appearing like the fire at the end of the Cycle, the powerful fire began to consume that large forest abounding with tall trees and thick bushes and creepers.

data.v: सज्वालैः पवनोद्धूतैर्विस्फुलिङ्गैः समन्वितः । ददाह तद्वनं घोरं मृगपक्षिसमाकुलम् ॥
data.md: Indeed, with flames fanned by the wind and numberless sparks flying about in all directions, the all-consuming god began to consume that dense forest teeming with birds and beasts.

data.v: ततः स देहमोक्षार्थं संप्रहृष्टेन चेतसा । अभ्यधावत संवृद्धं पावकं लुब्धकस्तदा ॥
data.md: The fowler, desirous of renouncing his body, ran with a delighted heart towards that spreading fire.

data.v: ततस्तेनाग्निना दग्धो लुब्धको नष्टकिल्बिषः । जगाम परमां सिद्धिं तदा भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: Consumed by that fire the fowler became purged of all his sins and acquired, O best of the Bharatas, high success.

data.v: ततः स्वर्गस्थमात्मानं सोऽपश्यद्विगतज्वरः । यक्षगन्धर्वसिद्धानां मध्ये भ्राजन्तमिन्द्रवत् ॥
data.md: The anxiety of his mind gone, he at last saw himself in heaven, shining like Indra in midst of Yakshas and Gandharvas and persons endued with ascetic success.

data.v: एवं खलु कपोतश्च कपोती च पतिव्रता । लुब्धकेन सह स्वर्गं गताः पुण्येन कर्मणा ॥
data.md: Thus the pigeon and his devoted wife, with the fowler, went to heaven for their meritorious acts.

data.v: यापि चैवंविधा नारी भर्तारमनुवर्तते । विराजते हि सा क्षिप्रं कपोतीव दिवि स्थिता ॥
data.md: The woman who thus follows her husband speedily ascends to heaven and shines there like the she-pigeon of whom I have spoken.

data.v: एवमेतत्पुरा वृत्तं लुब्धकस्य महात्मनः । कपोतस्य च धर्मिष्ठा गतिः पुण्येन कर्मणा ॥
data.md: This is the ancient history of the great fowler and the pigeon. Thus did they acquire highly meritorious end by their righteous acts.

data.v: यश्चेदं शृणुयान्नित्यं यश्चेदं परिकीर्तयेत् । नाशुभं विद्यते तस्य मनसापि प्रमाद्यतः ॥
data.md: No evil overtakes the person who listens every day to this story or who recites it every day, even if error possesses his mind.

data.v: युधिष्ठिर महानेष धर्मो धर्मभृतां वर । गोघ्नेष्वपि भवेदस्मिन्निष्कृतिः पापकर्मणः । निष्कृतिर्न भवेत्तस्मिन्यो हन्याच्छरणागतम् ॥
data.md: O Yudhishthira, O foremost of all righteous persons, the protection of a suppliant is, indeed, a great act of merit. By following this duty, even the killer of a cow may be cleansed of sin.

data.v: अबुद्धिपूर्वं यः पापं कुर्याद्भरतसत्तम । मुच्यते स कथं तस्मादेनसस्तद्वदस्व मे ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O best of the Bharatas, when a person commits sin from want of discrimination, how may he be purified by it? Tell me all about it.

data.v: अत्र ते वर्णयिष्येऽहमितिहासं पुरातनम् । इन्द्रोतः शौनको विप्रो यदाह जनमेजयम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said In this connection I shall recite to you the old narrative, spoken highly of by the Rishis, of what the twice-born Indrota, the son of Shunaka, said to Janamejaya.

data.v: आसीद्राजा महावीर्यः पारिक्षिज्जनमेजयः । अबुद्धिपूर्वं ब्रह्महत्या तमागच्छन्महीपतिम् ॥
data.md: There was, in days of old, a highly energetic king, called Janamejaya, who was the son of Parikshit. On one occasion from want of discrimination, that king became guilty of Brahmanicide.

data.v: तं ब्राह्मणाः सर्व एव तत्यजुः सपुरोहिताः । जगाम स वनं राजा दह्यमानो दिवानिशम् ॥
data.md: Upon this, all the Brahmanas together with his priests cast him off. Burning day and night with grief, the king retired into the forest.

data.v: स प्रजाभिः परित्यक्तश्चकार कुशलं महत् । अतिवेलं तपस्तेपे दह्यमानः स मन्युना ॥
data.md: Deserted by his subjects too, he adopted this course for acquiring great merit. Reduced by repentance, the king practised the most rigid austerities.

data.v: तत्रेतिहासं वक्ष्यामि धर्मस्यास्योपबृंहणम् । दह्यमानः पापकृत्या जगाम जनमेजयः ॥
data.md: I shall now tell you the story of his expiation. Burning with the recollection of his sin, Janamejaya wandered about.

data.v: वरिष्यमाण इन्द्रोतं शौनकं संशितव्रतम् । समासाद्योपजग्राह पादयोः परिपीडयन् ॥
data.md: One day, in course of his peregrinations, he met Indrota, the son of Shunaka, of rigid vows, and approaching him touched his feet.

data.v: ततो भीतो महाप्राज्ञो जगर्हे सुभृशं तदा । कर्ता पापस्य महतो भ्रूणहा किमिहागतः ॥
data.md: Seeing the king before him, the sage reproved him, saying,-You have committed a great sin. You have been guilty of foeticide. Why have you come here.

data.v: किं तवास्मासु कर्तव्यं मा मा स्प्राक्षीः कथंचन । गच्छ गच्छ न ते स्थानं प्रीणात्यस्मानिह ध्रुवम् ॥
data.md: What have you to do with us? Do not touch me! Go, go away! Your presence does not give us pleasure!

data.v: रुधिरस्येव ते गन्धः शवस्येव च दर्शनम् । अशिवः शिवसंकाशो मृतो जीवन्निवाटसि ॥
data.md: Your body smells like blood. You look like a corpse. Though impure, you appear as pure, and though dead you move like a living being!

data.v: अन्तर्मृत्युरशुद्धात्मा पापमेवानुचिन्तयन् । प्रबुध्यसे प्रस्वपिषि वर्तसे चरसे सुखी ॥
data.md: Dead within, you are of impure soul for you always wish to commit sin. Though you sleep, and wake, your life, however, is spent in great misery.

data.v: मोघं ते जीवितं राजन्परिक्लिष्टं च जीवसि । पापायेव च सृष्टोऽसि कर्मणे ह यवीयसे ॥
data.md: Useless is your life, O king. You live most miserably. You have been created for ignoble and sinful acts.

data.v: बहु कल्याणमिच्छन्त ईहन्ते पितरः सुतान् । तपसा देवतेज्याभिर्वन्दनेन तितिक्षया ॥
data.md: Fathers wish for sons for obtaining various kinds of blessings, and hoping they would perform penances and sacrifices, adore the gods, and practise renunciation.

data.v: पितृवंशमिमं पश्य त्वत्कृते नरकं गतम् । निरर्थाः सर्व एवैषामाशाबन्धास्त्वदाश्रयाः ॥
data.md: See all your ancestors have fallen into hell for your acts. All the hopes your fathers had placed upon you have been frustrated,

data.v: यान्पूजयन्तो विन्दन्ति स्वर्गमायुर्यशः सुखम् । तेषु ते सततं द्वेषो ब्राह्मणेषु निरर्थकः ॥
data.md: You live in vain, for you, always entertain hatred and malice towards the Brahmanas,-by worshipping whom other men acquire long life, fame, and heaven.

data.v: इमं लोकं विमुच्य त्वमवाङ्मूर्धा पतिष्यसि । अशाश्वतीः शाश्वतीश्च समाः पापेन कर्मणा ॥
data.md: Leaving this world, you shall have to fall (into hell) with head downwards and remain in that posture for numberless years for your sinful deeds.

data.v: अद्यमानो जन्तुगृध्रैः शितिकण्ठैरयोमुखैः । ततोऽपि पुनरावृत्तः पापयोनिं गमिष्यसि ॥
data.md: There you will be tortured by vultures and peacocks having iron beaks. Returning thence into this world, you will be born again in a wretched order of creatures.

data.v: यदिदं मन्यसे राजन्नायमस्ति परः कुतः । प्रतिस्मारयितारस्त्वां यमदूता यमक्षये ॥
data.md: If you think, o king, that this world is nothing and that the next world is nothing and that the next world is but a shadow, the attendants of Yama in the infernal regions will convince you, removing your scepticism.

data.v: एवमुक्तः प्रत्युवाच तं मुनिं जनमेजयः । गर्ह्यं भवान्गर्हयति निन्द्यं निन्दति मा भवान् ॥
data.md: Thus accusted, Janamejaya replied to the sage, saying,-You chastise one who deserves to be chastised. You censure one who is worthy of being censured.

data.v: धिक्कार्यं मा धिक्कुरुते तस्मात्त्वाहं प्रसादये । सर्वं हीदं स्वकृतं मे ज्वलाम्यग्नाविवाहितः ॥
data.md: You blame me and my acts. I beg you to be kind to me! All my acts have been sinful. I burn, however, with repentance as if I am in the midst of burning fire.

data.v: स्वकर्माण्यभिसंधाय नाभिनन्दति मे मनः । प्राप्तं नूनं मया घोरं भयं वैवस्वतादपि ॥
data.md: Remembering my deeds, I am cheerless. Indeed, I am much afraid of Yama.

data.v: तत्तु शल्यमनिर्हृत्य कथं शक्ष्यामि जीवितुम् । सर्वमन्यून्विनीय त्वमभि मा वद शौनक ॥
data.md: How can I live without taking out that dart from my heart! O Shaunaka, suppressing all your anger, instruct me now!

data.v: महानसं ब्राह्मणानां भविष्याम्यर्थवान्पुनः । अस्तु शेषं कुलस्यास्य मा पराभूदिदं कुलम् ॥
data.md: Formerly I used to show a great reverence to Brahmanas. I solemnly say that I shall once more show.the same respect to them. Let not my family be extinct. Let not the family in which I am born be reduced to the dust.

data.v: न हि नो ब्रह्मशप्तानां शेषो भवितुमर्हति । श्रुतीरलभमानानां संविदं वेदनिश्चयात् ॥
data.md: It is not proper that they who have injured Brahmanas and have for that, on account of Védic injunctions, forfeited all claim to the I arn respect of the world and to social intercourse with their fellowmen, should have any one who will continue the name of their family.

data.v: निर्विद्यमानः सुभृशं भूयो वक्ष्यामि सांप्रतम् । भूयश्चैवाभिनङ्क्षन्ति निर्धर्मा निर्जपा इव ॥
data.md: I am overwhelmed with despair. I, therefore, repeat my promises. I pray you to protect me like sages who always protect the poor.

data.v: अर्वाक्च प्रतितिष्ठन्ति पुलिन्दशबरा इव । न ह्ययज्ञा अमुं लोकं प्राप्नुवन्ति कथंचन ॥
अविज्ञायैव मे प्रज्ञां बालस्येव सुपण्डितः । ब्रह्मन्पितेव पुत्रेभ्यः प्रति मां वाञ्छ शौनक ॥
data.md: Ignorant as I am, give me wisdom like a learned preceptor to his pupil or like a father to his son. Be pleased with ine, O Shaunaka!

data.v: किमाश्चर्यं यतः प्राज्ञो बहु कुर्याद्धि सांप्रतम् । इति वै पण्डितो भूत्वा भूतानां नोपतप्यति ॥
data.md: Shaunaka said What wonder is there that an ignorant wight should do many improper acts? Knowing this, a really wise person is never angry with foolish creatures.

data.v: प्रज्ञाप्रासादमारुह्य अशोच्यः शोचते जनान् । जगतीस्थानिवाद्रिस्थः प्रज्ञया प्रतिपश्यति ॥
data.md: By getting upon the top of wisdom's palace, one grieves for others, his own self being then too pure to be grieved by others. For his wisdom one surveys all creatures in the world like a person on a mountain-top seeing people below.

data.v: न चोपलभते तत्र न च कार्याणि पश्यति । निर्विण्णात्मा परोक्षो वा धिक्कृतः सर्वसाधुषु ॥
data.md: The person who is censured by good men, who hates good men and who hides himself from their view, never acquires any blessing and never understands the fitness of acts.

data.v: विदित्वोभयतो वीर्यं माहात्म्यं वेद आगमे । कुरुष्वेह महाशान्तिं ब्रह्मा शरणमस्तु ते ॥
data.md: You know the energy and the nobility of the Brahmana as laid down in the Veda and other scriptures. Act now in such a way that you may have tranquillity of heart and let Brahmanas be your refuge. If the Brahmanas do not be angry with you, you will, forsooth, enjoy happiness in heaven. If, again, you repent for sins, your sight will be clear and you will succeed in seeing righteousness.

data.v: तद्वै पारत्रिकं चारु ब्राह्मणानामकुप्यताम् । अथ चेत्तप्यसे पापैर्धर्मं चेदनुपश्यसि ॥
अनुतप्ये च पापेन न चाधर्मं चराम्यहम् । बुभूषुं भजमानं च प्रतिवाञ्छामि शौनक ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said, I am repenting for my sins. I will never again try to suppress virtue. I wish to obtain blessedness. Be you pleased with me.

data.v: छित्त्वा स्तम्भं च मानं च प्रीतिमिच्छामि ते नृप । सर्वभूतहिते तिष्ठ धर्मं चैव प्रतिस्मर ॥
data.md: Shaunaka said Removing arrogance and pride, O king, I wish you to respect me. Do good to all creatures, always remembering the dictates of virtue.

data.v: न भयान्न च कार्पण्यान्न लोभात्त्वामुपाह्वये । तां मे देवा गिरं सत्यां शृण्वन्तु ब्राह्मणैः सह ॥
data.md: I am not blaming you from fear or narrowness of mind or covetousness. Listen now, with these Brahmanas here, to the words of truth.

data.v: सोऽहं न केनचिच्चार्थी त्वां च धर्ममुपाह्वये । क्रोशतां सर्वभूतानामहो धिगिति कुर्वताम् ॥
data.md: I do not ask for anything. I shall, however, instruct you in the ways of virtue. All persons will croak and bray and cry fie on me.

data.v: वक्ष्यन्ति मामधर्मज्ञा वक्ष्यन्त्यसुहृदो जनाः । वाचस्ताः सुहृदः श्रुत्वा संज्वरिष्यन्ति मे भृशम् ॥
data.md: They will even call me sinful. My kinsmen and friends will renounce me. However, hearing the words I speak, my kinsmen and friends will surely succeed in vigorously crossing the difficulties of life.

data.v: केचिदेव महाप्राज्ञाः परिज्ञास्यन्ति कार्यताम् । जानीहि मे कृतं तात ब्राह्मणान्प्रति भारत ॥
यथा ते मत्कृते क्षेमं लभेरंस्तत्तथा कुरु । प्रतिजानीहि चाद्रोहं ब्राह्मणानां नराधिप ॥
नैव वाचा न मनसा न पुनर्जातु कर्मणा । द्रोग्धास्मि ब्राह्मणान्विप्र चरणावेव ते स्पृशे ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said I swear, touching even your feet, that I shall never again, in thought, word, or deed, harm the Brahmanas.

data.v: तस्मात्तेऽहं प्रवक्ष्यामि धर्ममावृत्तचेतसे । श्रीमान्महाबलस्तुष्टो यस्त्वं धर्ममवेक्षसे । पुरस्ताद्दारुणो भूत्वा सुचित्रतरमेव तत् ॥
data.md: Shaunaka said I shall for these reasons describe to you virtue, you whose heart has been exceedingly agitated. Endued with knowledge, great strength, and a contented heart, you seek virtue of your own accord.

data.v: अनुगृह्णन्ति भूतानि स्वेन वृत्तेन पार्थिव । कृत्स्ने नूनं सदसती इति लोको व्यवस्यति । यत्र त्वं तादृशो भूत्वा धर्ममद्यानुपश्यसि ॥
data.md: People say that that king who begins with sternness consumes the entire world. You were stern before. But you now seck righteousness.

data.v: हित्वा सुरुचिरं भक्ष्यं भोगांश्च तप आस्थितः । इत्येतदपि भूतानामद्भुतं जनमेजय ॥
data.md: Forsaking luxurious food and all articles of enjoyment, you are now practising rigid penances for a long time. All this, O Janamejaya, is sure to appear wonderful to those kings who are sunk in sin.

data.v: यो दुर्बलो भवेद्दाता कृपणो वा तपोधनः । अनाश्चर्यं तदित्याहुर्नातिदूरे हि वर्तते ॥
data.md: It is not at all wonderful that he who has wealth should become liberal, or that he who has wealth of asceticism should become unwilling to spend it. It has been said that the one does not live far off from the other.

data.v: एतदेव हि कार्पण्यं समग्रमसमीक्षितम् । तस्मात्समीक्षयैव स्याद्भवेत्तस्मिंस्ततो गुणः ॥
data.md: An ill-judged thing produces enough of miserics. That, on the other hand, which is done with the help of sound judgement yields excellent results.

data.v: यज्ञो दानं दया वेदाः सत्यं च पृथिवीपते । पञ्चैतानि पवित्राणि षष्ठं सुचरितं तपः ॥
data.md: Sacrifice, gift, mercy, the Vedas, and truth, O king,-these five,-are purifying. The sixth is penance well-practised. This last, O Janamejaya, is highly purifying for kings.

data.v: तदेव राज्ञां परमं पवित्रं जनमेजय । तेन सम्यग्गृहीतेन श्रेयांसं धर्ममाप्स्यसि ॥
पुण्यदेशाभिगमनं पवित्रं परमं स्मृतम् । अपि ह्युदाहरन्तीमा गाथा गीता ययातिना ॥
यो मर्त्यः प्रतिपद्येत आयुर्जीवेत वा पुनः । यज्ञमेकान्ततः कृत्वा तत्संन्यस्य तपश्चरेत् ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited the following verse sung by Yayati-That mortal who would acquire life and longevity should, after having celebrated sacrifices with devotion, renounce them and practise penances.

data.v: पुण्यमाहुः कुरुक्षेत्रं सरस्वत्यां पृथूदकम् । यत्रावगाह्य पीत्वा वा नैवं श्वोमरणं तपेत् ॥
data.md: The field of Kuru has been described to be sacred. The river Sarasvati is considered more so. The Tirthas of the Sarasvati are inore sacred than the Sarasvati herself; and the Tirtha called Prithudaka is more sacred than all the Tirthas of the Sarasvati. One that has bathed in Prithudaka and drunk its waters will not have to be sorry for a premature death.

data.v: महासरः पुष्कराणि प्रभासोत्तरमानसे । कालोदं त्वेव गन्तासि लब्धायुर्जीविते पुनः ॥
सरस्वतीदृषद्वत्यौ सेवमानोऽनुसंचरेः । स्वाध्यायशीलः स्थानेषु सर्वेषु समुपस्पृशेः ॥
त्यागधर्मं पवित्राणां संन्यासं परमब्रवीत् । अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीमा गाथाः सत्यवता कृताः ॥
यथा कुमारः सत्यो वै न पुण्यो न च पापकृत् । न ह्यस्ति सर्वभूतेषु दुःखमस्मिन्कुतः सुखम् ॥
एवं प्रकृतिभूतानां सर्वसंसर्गयायिनाम् । त्यजतां जीवितं प्रायो विवृते पुण्यपातके ॥
यत्त्वेव राज्ञो ज्यायो वै कार्याणां तद्वदामि ते । बलेन संविभागैश्च जय स्वर्गं पुनीष्व च ॥
यस्यैवं बलमोजश्च स धर्मस्य प्रभुर्नरः । ब्राह्मणानां सुखार्थं त्वं पर्येहि पृथिवीमिमाम् ॥
यथैवैनान्पुराक्षैप्सीस्तथैवैनान्प्रसादय । अपि धिक्क्रियमाणोऽपि त्यज्यमानोऽप्यनेकधा ॥
आत्मनो दर्शनं विद्वन्नाहन्तास्मीति मा क्रुधः । घटमानः स्वकार्येषु कुरु नैःश्रेयसं परम् ॥
data.md: Though they have censured you and though they have deserted you, do you still, guided by knowledge of self, solemnly promise never to injure them, Engaged in becoming acts, try to do what is for your highest good.

data.v: हिमाग्निघोरसदृशो राजा भवति कश्चन । लाङ्गलाशनिकल्पो वा भवत्यन्यः परंतप ॥
data.md: Amongst kings some one becomes as cool as snow; some one, as fierce as fire; some one becomes like a plough; and some one, again, becomes like a thunder-bolt.

data.v: न निःशेषेण मन्तव्यमचिकित्स्येन वा पुनः । न जातु नाहमस्मीति प्रसक्तव्यमसाधुषु ॥
data.md: He who wishes to prevent self-destruction, should never mix with wicked persons for general or particular purposes.

data.v: विकर्मणा तप्यमानः पादात्पापस्य मुच्यते । नैतत्कार्यं पुनरिति द्वितीयात्परिमुच्यते । चरिष्ये धर्ममेवेति तृतीयात्परिमुच्यते ॥
data.md: From a sinful act committed only once, one may clear himself by repenting for it. From an act committed twice, one may purify himself by vowing never to repeat the act.

data.v: कल्याणमनुमन्तव्यं पुरुषेण बुभूषता । ये सुगन्धीनि सेवन्ते तथागन्धा भवन्ति ते । ये दुर्गन्धीनि सेवन्ते तथागन्धा भवन्ति ते ॥
data.md: One who wishes to acquire prosperity should do all that yields blessedness. They who live amidst fragrance themselves become fragrant by virtue thereof. They, on the other hand, who live in the midst of foul smell themselves become foui.

data.v: तपश्चर्यापरः सद्यः पापाद्धि परिमुच्यते । संवत्सरमुपास्याग्निमभिशस्तः प्रमुच्यते । त्रीणि वर्षाण्युपास्याग्निं भ्रूणहा विप्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: One who practises ascetic austerities is soon purged of all one's sins. By adoring the sacrificial fire for a year, one sullied by various sins becomes purified.

data.v: यावतः प्राणिनो हन्यात्तज्जातीयान्स्वभावतः । प्रमीयमाणानुन्मोच्य भ्रूणहा विप्रमुच्यते ॥
अपि वाप्सु निमज्जेत त्रिर्जपन्नघमर्षणम् । यथाश्वमेधावभृथस्तथा तन्मनुरब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Manu has said that by diving in water after reciting thrice the sin-destroying Mantras, one rcaps the fruits of the final bath in a Horsesacrifice.

data.v: क्षिप्रं प्रणुदते पापं सत्कारं लभते तथा । अपि चैनं प्रसीदन्ति भूतानि जडमूकवत् ॥
data.md: Such an act very soon purifies one of all his sins, and he becomes, once again, the esteemed of the world. All creatures obey such a person, like helpless idiots.

data.v: बृहस्पतिं देवगुरुं सुरासुराः; समेत्य सर्वे नृपतेऽन्वयुञ्जन् । धर्मे फलं वेत्थ कृते महर्षे; तथेतरस्मिन्नरके पापलोके ॥
data.md: Approaching, in days of yore, the celestial preceptor Brihaspati, the gods and Asuras, O king, humbly enquired of him, saying,-You are cognisant, O great Rishi, of the fruits of virtue, as also the fruits of those other acts which lead to hell in the next world.

data.v: उभे तु यस्य सुकृते भवेतां; किं स्वित्तयोस्तत्र जयोत्तरं स्यात् । आचक्ष्व नः कर्मफलं महर्षे; कथं पापं नुदते पुण्यशीलः ॥
data.md: Can not that person free himself from both virtue and sin who regards the two (happiness and inisery) equally? Tell us, O great Rishi, what are the fruits of righteousness, and how does a virtuous person remove his sins!

data.v: कृत्वा पापं पूर्वमबुद्धिपूर्वं; पुण्यानि यः कुरुते बुद्धिपूर्वम् । स तत्पापं नुदते पुण्यशीलो; वासो यथा मलिनं क्षारयुक्त्या ॥
data.md: Brihaspati answered If, having committed sin through foolishness, one performs meritorious acts understanding their nature, he succeeds, by such righteousness, in cleansing himself from sin even as a piece of dirty cloth is washed clean by some saline substance.

data.v: पापं कृत्वा न मन्येत नाहमस्मीति पूरुषः । चिकीर्षेदेव कल्याणं श्रद्दधानोऽनसूयकः ॥
data.md: One should not brag after having committed sin. By having faith and by freeing one's self from malice, one acquires blessedness.
